name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Berry fruit and olive aromas along with a slightly reduced note of rubber and/or latex open this full, chewy and tannic Cabernet from a wet and cool vintage. Given its birth year, this is a big success; it tastes of pure blackberry and cassis, with smoky oak helping things along. On the finish, this is full and ripe but not overly complex. Drink through 2025.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the elusive appellation, this impresses in its layering of rich toffee, chocolate and blackberry plum. Sumptuous, soft and voluptuously built, it combines fruit and spice around toasted oak and firm tannin.

name: Larkmead 2016 LMV Salon Red (Napa Valley)
description: Graphite, flint and toasted oak accent a core of brawny, concentrated black fruit in this estate red. Clove, black currant, cigar box and firm, structured tannins contribute to the classic nature of this well-made wine. Enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Spicy in blackberry and chocolate, this is a smooth, soft and moderately complex red, made in small quantities from the well-known appellation. A hint of expected dustiness wavers amidst the fruit and oak.

name: Timark 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Currant, cassis and crushed rock accent a soft, richly layered and concentrated body of firm intensity and tannin in this block-designate from the warm site. Tasting of cocoa powder, blueberry jam and toasted oak, the wine finishes quietly and with a touch of pepper.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This vintage of Two Passions is evocative but a little young and raw. It's incredibly minty with a fair lick of green bell pepper, graphite and mineral notes at the fore. Pipe-smoke, wood-spice and currant aromas take up the rear. Tannins are fine, tight and powdery and the acidity is a little sharp. This feels like it needs more time to knit together, despite already having several years of bottle age. Try in 2020 and then drink until 2029.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Jammy blueberry, cherry and chocolate flavors make for a densely packed bullet of richness and rounded tannins in this valley-floor wine. Well made and complex in structure, it delivers a lasting punch of clove, tobacco and dried herb.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Very ripe aromas of blackberry jam and sweet cedar show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is candied with black-cherry juice and maple-syrup flavors.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Very full aromas of black cherry, smoke and crushed stone make for a pleasing nose on this bottling. The flavors are approachable if simplistic, with more black cherry and oak, backed by forgiving tannins and substantive acidity.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, aged two years in new French oak. Leather, cigar and black currant highlight a smoothly structured, richly full-bodied wine that shows warmth and depth.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Oodles of oak meet gobs of fruit in this ripe, mature and ready-to-drink wine. Toast, nutmeg, vanilla and cedar wrap around rich plum and a touch of raspberry, while full body adds to a generous mouthfeel.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Baking chocolate, cherry cordial, green herb and anise aromas are at the fore. Plump, upfront flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a bit of grit. Give it time to settle in.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This big but balanced wine carries aromas of black cherry and mint. The palate offers a firm texture, with fresh flavors of ripe black cherry, cranberry and black plum.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This is the winery's first reserve-level offering, coming from a multi-clonal block of Cabernet at this vineyard. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, toast and herb are at the fore. Reserved, chocolatey flavors follow. The barrel influence shows more strongly than the norm for this winery, but it has good stuffing. Best after 2023.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine offers a bright nose of sweet oak, which leads to succulent waves of cherry, plum and currant on the palate. Flourishes of cedar and dried herb meld with a wealth of soft, silky tannins.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Extracted aromas of red berry, purple flowers and peppery spice are very tangy on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very tangy with red currant and pomegranate balsamic flavors, framed by buoyant acidity and background tannins.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Bell pepper, hard spice and green tobacco aromas blend with milder notes of cherry and plum. This feels lean, crisp and punchy, while the flavor profile is tart and gritty, with green notes infused into basic plum flavors. Heat and scratchy tannins roughen up the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of black plum, black olive and violet lead into a texturally dynamic palate loaded with ripe but not overdone black currant, baking spice and vanilla flavors. Strong acidity drives the finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: There's no question that this wine brings the funk. Cassis bud, freshly tilled soil, chimney and ember aromas are followed by flavorful cherry notes on a deft palate. It shows a surprising amount of structure for the Rocks District. There's also a mouthwatering sense to it that ups the interest along with a long finish. Cabernet from this area is unique and hasn't gotten as much attention as other varieties.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This wine may be a Bordeaux blend—with a small amount of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot in the mix—but it's unmistakably Margaret River in style. It's spicy and concentrated, with black-cherry and cassis fruit, tobacco leaf, mint, mocha and graphite and more earthy herbal notes. There's a fair lick of oak influence here too. The palate is powerful but poised, framed by ultrafine herb-and-graphite tannins and lifted by crisp acidity. Still a baby, this fine wine should gain heaps of complexity with time. Drink 2021–2034 and likely beyond.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This is a spicy, herbal and thickly concentrated wine, grippy in tannin and brawny black fruit. The big flavor is complemented by complex elements of cedar, clove and cigar box—lasting notions on the finish that would benefit from more time in bottle. Enjoy best from 2025–2030.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Like Leeuwin Estate, Stella Bella lies in the southern part of Margaret River where climes are a little cooler and wines a tad fresher. This approachable red berry and floral example shows a fair lick of toasted, coconut oak but it's tucked in with savory graphite and warm earth tones. The freshness element is especially felt on the palate, where acidity lifts the fruit into crunchiness, cinched by spicy sinewy tannins. The oak does get a bit blocky here but all is forgiven thanks to those interestingly textured tannins and bright fruit. Drink now through 2027.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling shows intense blackberry-jam aromas alongside a hint of cedar. The flavors and texture fill the mouth, delivering dense blackberry, dried violets and roasted coffee against chalky yet polished tannins. Drink now through 2031.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: From estate-grown fruit, 100% varietal, this is a bold, concentrated and well-structured wine, big in grippy tannin and robust oak. The dark brooding berry fruit is contrasted in tobacco and tar, with a lasting flinty quality.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Warm aromas of black cherry, caramel and cola promise a comforting sip on this rich and ripe wine from one of the region's more beautiful estates. Rich cassis and blackberry flavors meet with spicy touches of sarsaparilla and mocha on the sip, which is framed by chalky yet slender tannins.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This winery celebrates its 20th anniversary of this wine, and what a two decades it has been. With a healthy 20% Petit Verdot and a dash of Merlot (5%), aromas of char, cherry, citrus, generous barrel spice, bay leaf, plum, thyme and anise lead to elegant, classically styled fruit flavors with lip-smacking acidity and tannins that give a gentle but notable squeeze. It's a throwback wine. Leave it until at least 2025.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The more affordable little sister of Mount Eden, this wine, which is bolstered by 15% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 1% Malbec, offers black plum, wet river stones, dusty herbs and wood spice on the nose. The palate focuses on minerality, structure and savory flavors, including subtle lavender and black plum. The structure will last for ages. Drink 2020–2036.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a restrained and polished wine that neatly demonstrate's Margaret River's ability to produce world class Cabernet. It opens fairly delicately, with aromas of cherries, red currents, licorice, tobacco leaf and graphite, with a touch of olive and peppery wood spice. The palate then comes at you full throttle—acid, oak, tannins, fruit and alcohol—there's nothing shy or demure here. But there's also bags of complexity, regionality and age-worthiness. Drink now, with time in decanter and protein or better yet, wait a decade.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This Cab is classic Margaret River from a long-standing estate, offering a plethora of aromas from ripe plums, blackberries and licorice to cedar, pencil lead, olive brine and mint. It's fairly full figured but there's focus and restraint amidst Cabernet's inherent power. Silky fruit, herbal tannins and plenty of savory spice set this wine up for a long life. Drink now through 2034.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: It's hard to believe that this is Vasse Felix's middle-tier red, such is its pedigree. With a little Malbec and Petit Verdot in the mix, this Cabernet is classic Margaret River, balancing power and structure with complexity and poise. Evoking the springtime scents of this coastal region, it billows ripe red currents, eucalyptus, sage, beach scrub and sea spray. Set up for aging, tannins are fine and vice-like and the oak is fairly prominent, but all should settle into place with a few more years in bottle. Drink now until 2029.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Pleasing aromas of cocoa, thyme, dark coffee, graphite and cherry lead to elegant, lip-smacking flavors that still carry a sense of richness. Refined, subtle tannins back it up. Coffee notes linger on the finish. The balance is spot on, and it brings an unabashed sense of deliciousness.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine is a full-bore full-bodied effort that shows intensely concentrated black-fruit, black-pepper and wood-smoke aromas, followed by a wave of superripe flavors. An attractive charcoal and iron-like quality comes out with time in the glass. Firm tannins keep it well wrapped up, but this is not necessarily an ager; enjoy through 2021.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is signature Margaret River. A nose of ripe cherries and raspberries is backed by savory spices, eucalyptus, pencil lead, black olives and some floral nuances. The mouthfeel has lovely tension and lift to it, the acidity counteracting the dryness of the powdery tannins that slink around the tongue rather than gripping it. Power and poise are what Margaret River Cabs are all about and this has both in spades, and for an incredible bargain to boot.

name: Hess Collection 2016 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This includes 12% Mount Veeder Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. Juicy blackberry and brown-sugar richness evolves in the glass to find balance in high-toned cherry and currant. It has good tension and texture within a full-bodied concentrated framework.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Pencil shavings and plum give this sumptuous full-bodied wine a well-earned structure, with high-toned, fresh undertones of acidity and complexity. The oak and tannin weight are in balance and in support of the savory fruit.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This elegant, classically styled wine is earthy in tobacco, mushroom and fig, a lovely wine from the mountain appellation. A soft understated richness of plum and black cherry wrap around a texture of grippy dust and dark chocolate, finishing as gracefully as it starts.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: The price tag associated with fine wines doesn't always align with quality, but in the case of Stella Bella's Luminosa range, it's worth every penny. The Cab is fragrant combo of blueberries, cherries, florals, soft peppery spice and a streak of something savory and mineral, like sea spray on warm beach pebbles. The tannins are fine, herbal and highly textured, beautifully balancing the juicy silky fruit and returning to its savory side on the finish. Drink now through 2029 and likely beyond.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: For the first time this wine contains some fruit from the winery's Holy Roller Vineyard. The aromas pop, with notes of blackberry bramble, coffee, barrel spice and herb. Rich, ripe fruit flavors follow. There's a pleasing sense of plumpness to the flavors but also enough acidity and tannin structure to win the race. Best after 2026, with a long life beyond that.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: The aromas in this 100% Cabernet Sauvignon are brooding, with notes of char, leafy herbs, freshly brewed coffee and spice. A full-flavored palate follows, laden with dark coffee flavors. The tannins give a firm squeeze. A warm finish caps it off. Give it time for the tannins to stretch their legs. Best after 2024.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Luxurious aromas of barrel spice, char, roasted coffee bean, black cherry, earth, cocoa, graphite, coffee and herb lead to elegant but textured, layered, tart, lip-smacking fruit flavors. The palate is all pleasantly dialed back considering the warmth of the vintage and region, with an exquisite acidity and tannin balance. In cooler days, Washington Cabernets sat squarely between California and Bordeaux. This throwback wine does just that. Best after 2025.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: There's no question this is a warm-vintage wine, with its aromas of black cherry, game, licorice, scorched earth, barrel spice and blackberry. The palate brings rich, intense, rollicking dark-fruit flavors that have enough firm, tightly wound tannic structure to stitch them all together. It has the stuffing to run the race and then run it again. Best after 2027.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is savory style of Cab from a mountainside site, starting with aromas of roast beef, crushed asphalt and dark seared elderberry fruits. Black plum and more elderberry show on the sip, but the focus of the smoothed out tannic profile is showcasing rocky soil-driven flavors, with hints of olive and charred meat toward the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a huge, muscular but agile wine made from organically grown grapes. Fragrant aromas of French oak spices are followed by concentrated layers of black cherry, cinnamon, black currant and clove. Supported by a big, velvety frame of soft tannins, it is seductive now and will improve through 2026.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine has a supple succulence of black fruit on the midpalate that's accented by earthy, savory spice. Dark cherry and plum take on bolder, concentrated richness as the wine opens, with expansive, grippy tannins lending support. Enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This wine is from the producer's high-elevation Cooley Ranch Vineyard and blended with 20% Petit Verdot. It offers aromas of sage, cedar and oak on the nose. Full in weight and intensely powerful, it has thick, rich layers of cherry, cola and cassis that await further integration. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Crisp blackberry, light licorice, lilac and a hint of charred meat show on the nose of this luxury-level bottling from Brian Terrizzi. There are elderberry and elderflower touches on the elegantly woven sip, where dark fruit and flowers compete for attention amidst the dry tannic framing.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This wine continues to overdeliver on its price point, offering elegant yet powerful aromas of fig, forest floor and earth. Firm tannins offer grip around flavors of black currant, sage, cedar and flint, with spicy clove lingering on the finish.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Quilceda Creek has been a benchmark in Washington since its first vintage in 1979. Aromas of pitch-black cherry, graphite and spice lead to ripe, intense, layered dark-fruit flavors supported by velvety but firm tannins that lead to a warm finish. As always, time in the cellar will serve this wine well. Best after 2026, with a long life beyond that.

name: Fortress 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Raw, grassy aromas include candied fruit and mint notes. The palate is high in acidity and low in charm. Herbal raspberry and plum flavors are sugary on the finish.

name: Finca Flichman 2018 Roble Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: This smells sweet, confected and oaky, with a generous overlay of rich vanilla-soaked cherry and raspberry sauce. The palate is similarly sweet and oaky, with oodles of vanilla-soaked wood and surprisingly austere tannins that grip the finish.

name: Fortress 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Fiery red fruit aromas are green, while this rubs the cheeks with astringency. Herbal red fruit flavors suggest currant and thyme, while this undistinguished Cabernet tastes green and spicy on the finish.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Aromas of tree bark, spice and fiery red fruits lead to a raw, cheeky palate with tomatoey acidity. Oddly, cherry and plum flavors carry a burnt overtone, while this reverts to tomatoey and smacking on the finish.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Berry and black-currant aromas are candied and smell of latex and rubber. A sappy palate is fairly raw and thin, while this tastes vaguely of soap, raspberry and dried leaves. A short finish is fitting.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: From head to toe there's nothing special about this so-called Reserva Especial. The nose smells of clove and not of fruit, while the palate is edgy, raw and gravelly. Flavors of mint gumdrop and clove are, like the nose, devoid of fruit. A raw, gritty finish is no savior.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Berry and plum aromas are roasted and suggest Band-Aid rubber. A tight, pulling palate is rubbery and braced by tomatoey acidity, while herbal berry and plum flavors are slightly green prior to a scratchy finish.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Plum and raspberry aromas are clouded by creamy, candied oak notes in front of a grapy palate with gritty tannins. Black-cherry and cassis flavors come with a brown-sugar accent, while this basic Cabernet loses steam on a finish that tastes unnaturally sweet.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Basic cherry, plum and berry aromas qualify as standard. This boxed Cab feels creamy and sticky. Sugary flavors of maple syrup, milk chocolate and berry jam finish without much grip or structure. Subtract a point or two if you can't handle residual sugar in your Cabernet.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: There's not a strong set of aromas here, with subtle notes of black cherry, bramble and mentholated herb stems. The palate is medium in feel, with soft tannins and a pronounced minty character riding atop red-plum and brambly red-berry fruits that carry through to the close.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine is garnet-ruby in color and has aromas of black cherry, red plum and violet. On the palate there are flavors of plum, cinnamon and cherry, and there is a touch of tart acidity on the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An obvious and dramatic oak aroma and flavor make this full-bodied wine a kind of one-note song. It is moderately tannic and has some ripe black cherry under the char, cedar and menthol notes.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Gritty, grainy berry aromas are spicy but lack complexity and nuance. On the palate, this pulls inward due to clampy tannins. Spicy plum flavors finish with rawness, racy acidity and scratchiness.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Jammy berry aromas are slightly roasted and rubbery. A flush palate is anchored by mild but gritty tannins, while this Cab tastes of herbal plum and berry fruits along with mint. Tolerable heat on the finish isn't a major detractor.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Round, mostly ripe black-fruit aromas do a fair job of drawing you into this flush Cabernet that's chunky and slightly awkward in feel but not unbalanced. Black-fruit flavors show a green note, while this is soft on a finish, with almost no tannic grip.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Generic black plum and berry aromas are not well defined or elevated. A flush, sappy palate is saucy in feel, while this tastes of herbal black fruits, oak spice and pepper. A dry finish is low on fruit.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The aromas pop with notes of jalapeño pepper, green pepper, flower, plum and black currant. Lighter-styled fruit flavors follow, painting around the edges. The concentration seems light and it all comes off as quite green.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Raspberry leaf, just-ripe strawberry and soft herbal tones grace the subtle nose of this wine. It's soft and satiny in feel, with light tannins and a mentholated lift that unfurls on the close, with shots of red-cherry juice and a fleck of pomegranate.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Bright black cherry and blueberry aromas meld with cinnamon and bubblegum in this accessible Cabernet Sauvignon. It is juicy and crunchy on the palate in dark berry flavors that are shaded by graphite and warm spice.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This Romanian Cabernet Sauvignon is ink colored with aromas of red plum, red currant and eucalyptus. It has flavors of cherry vanilla, black raspberry and plum before the smooth finish.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This Romanian Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of cassis, tart red cherry and black plum. On the palate there are flavors of black plum and black raspberry before the smooth finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Off-dry dark-fruit and herb flavors are at the heart of this lightly aromatic wine. It's a straightforward, red wine quaffer.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: A red-cherry-candy aroma shows upfront on the nose of this wine, with additional hints of tea and tree bark. The palate is smooth and slightly light in feel, with soft spiciness that unfolds on the finish and lifts sthe just-ripe red-berry flavors.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Inky purple in the glass, this Romanian Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of black cherry, red plum, red currant and a touch of eucalyptus. On the palate there are flavors of plum, black raspberry and cherry vanilla. It has a smooth and easygoing finish.

name: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Graphite, pencil and oak accent a concentrated, tannic core of big texture and flavor in this reserve-tier wine, which is blended with 10% Merlot. Tart acidity gives it a powerful counterweight to the dried herb and overall grip.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Purple in the glass, this Cabernet Sauvignon from Romania has aromas of red plum and cherry and a whiff of mint in the bouquet. There are flavors of cherry, black raspberry and vanilla leading to a smooth finish.

name: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this wine offers smoky oak and dried herb in abundance, with a powerful density of heat and tannin. The producer's estate vineyard is on Ehlers Lane in a warm area of the appellation.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: While quite spicy on the nose in pepper and orange spice, there's still plenty of ripe cherry and currant underneath. Juicy red berry flavors reign on the palate, honed by graphite and a bit of tannic grip.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Big in structure, this full-bodied wine shows moderate cherry and blackberry flavors and a surprisingly light midpalate before tightening up a bit with tannins on the finish.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Green peppercorns and pasilla chile aromas make for a very herbal backdrop to this bottling, which also shows a line of blackberry on the nose. The acid is bright on the palate, holding up the bell pepper and strawberry flavors.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Medium bodied and easy to enjoy, this wine offers light maple and baking-spice aromas, fresh red-cherry and blackberry flavors and light tannins for a bit of grip.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Aromas of char and cherry jam are prominent. Somewhat lighter-styled fruit and barrel flavors follow. Coffee notes linger on the finish. The variety seems hard to discern.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The aromas are unusual, with notes of scorched earth and soil, showing reduction that distracts. Over time, bittersweet chocolate, cherry and herb notes emerge. The palate shows a reserved sense of styling, exhibiting polish and balance. A light grip of tannins pulls it all together. It's in an awkward spot at present.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Minty herbs, cherry and spiced-plum aromas form the bouquet of this wine. The palate is soft, smooth and slightly plush in feel, but not fat, with velvety tannins and ample acidity. Nicely balanced, it offers pleasant flavors, with ripe red-fruit characteristics that carry through to the close.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas offer notes of green herb, tobacco, earth and olive. The tannins come off as dry and astringent, needing some time in the cellar or food alongside them to be tamed.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Green notes of tobacco, eucalyptus and plum are edgy but typical of many Chilean Cabernets. On the palate, this feels full but cut by tomatoey acidity. Mild green flavors drive a competent finish.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is blended with 9% Petite Sirah and smaller amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot, packing a punch of concentrated red fruit that's plenty rich and ripe. Woody tannins surround sweet oak that finishes in a taste of vanilla.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cherry-candy and dark-fruit aromas are followed by medium-bodied coffee and cherry flavors. The tannins seem a bit bunched up.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of tobacco, herbs, olive, dried cheese, spicy blackberry and coffee are generous and announce a full and grabby Cabernet with dry scraping tannins. Saturated blackberry, coffee and chocolate flavors are not sparing or restrained, while this finishes in chocolaty darkness.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This balanced wine is packed with fruit and spice flavors. A full body and moderate tannins give it a big mouthfeel, while ripe black-cherry and red-cherry notes provide satisfaction.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Juicy, spicy red berries, raspberries and plums all abound on the nose of this fresh, vibrant red. The palate is light and fruity, with abundant and snappy red-berry flavors and a touch of crushed violets. It's an easygoing and superbly drinkable red.

name: Beringer 2016 Chabot Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a stewy, thick and concentrated wine with broad woody tannins. Expansive on the palate, it has an intensity of earth and herb met by blackberry jam, cocoa powder and sweet tobacco.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Cocoa, coffee and dark-cherry aromas are followed by slightly medicinal-seeming fruit flavors. It could use more tannic structure to stand it all up.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Café au lait, orange-rind, red-fruit, cherry and maple bar doughnut aromas are followed by sweet, plentiful raspberry flavors that persist through the finish. It drinks more like Merlot than Cabernet but brings plenty of enjoyment.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Easygoing and pleasant red-fruit aromas meet with a touch of damp herbs and bell pepper on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with ripe plums and strawberries yet it's the pyrazine-laden cherry-pepper notes that set it apart.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: An appealing nose offers cassis, cherry and plum aromas along with some spice. This is a bit raw and scratchy on the palate, with high acidity. Conversely, the flavor profile is lean and shallow, with a focus on raspberry and plum fruit. Overall, this Cabernet meets or exceeds established norms for Chilean Cabernet.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of whole tangerine, soil, raspberry, wild cherry Luden's cough drops and barrel spice are followed by plentiful red- and black-fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of balance throughout. Firm tannins provide the structure.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of dark roasted coffee beans, char, vanilla and cherry are followed by fruit and barrel flavors that show more of the same. There are good things happening, but the barrel influence seems primary at present. Perhaps they will settle in with time.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: There is a strong sense of earth to the nose of this twist-top bottling, with soil and rock aromas alongside black cherry and singed tobacco. The palate is lightly bodied yet stiff with tannins, offering flavors of blackberry juice along with peppery spices and pinches of oregano and marjoram.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Sliced and whole green-pepper aromas are out front, followed by notes of red cherry and orange. These aromas carry through to soft, textured the palate.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of vanilla, herb, cherry and baking spice are followed by a full-bodied palate. The tightly wound tannins need some time to unspool. The oak plays prominently, but it's quite tasty with coffee lingering on the finish. Give it a short decant if drinking in the near term.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Subdued berry aromas are mild and a touch green and spicy. The palate feels tight as a drum, with rubbery tannins. Classic Chilean flavors of spiced berry fruits and plum are lemony and then savory in front of a fresh finish with tannic bite and notable acidity.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Very smooth and subtly spicy, this full-bodied wine drips with fruit so ripe it would drop from the tree or vine. Plums, black cherries and blackberries come to mind. The wine has soft tannins, a broad texture and a lingering ripe finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Aromas of coffee, oak grain, cassis and leafy berry fruits make for a classic Chilean Cabernet nose. A tight palate is only moderately fleshy, while minty plum and raspberry flavors are typical of Maipo Cabernet. On the back side, this clamps down on a gravelly finish.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of black licorice, spice, graphite, sawdust, herb, coffee and dark cherry and followed by tart, puckering cranberry and cherry flavors and a tight squeeze of tannins. A lightly smoky finish caps it off. Give it some time in a decanter if drinking in the near term.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is definitely oaky, but in a good way, with baking spice aromas leading to mulled raspberry and cherry flavors that meld with a cocoa accent on the palate. A medium body and smooth tannins give just enough grip to the mouthfeel.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a big, juicy and expansive wine, blended with 12% Merlot. Concentrated flavors of dark cherry and black currant fill the glass in weighty structure and integrated tannin, leading to a cohesive, lengthy finish.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of cocoa, char, licorice and black cherry are out front. Tightly wound, full-bodied palate-coating coffee, cherry meat and chocolate flavors follow. Firm tannins back it up. There's a lot packed into the bottle.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Earthy, slightly damp aromas of black fruits, tobacco and herbs are common to Maipo Cabernet. A flush and full palate is framed by proper acidity and hard tannins, while blackberry and cassis flavors are spicy and lightly herbal prior to a finish with some chocolaty oak. Drink through 2025.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of green herb, tar, plum, dark chocolate and pencil lead to full-bodied black-cherry and jam flavors. Coffee and chocolate notes linger on the finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This delicious bottle starts off with robust aromas of cherry, sweet oak and mint. Polished but firm tannins uphold dark fruit, baking spice and a pinch of peppery herbs on the well-rounded, satisfying palate.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: Densely packed in tobacco and leather, this powerfully ripe, full-bodied wine is integrated in sturdy tannins with a lengthy palate. Black fruit dominates within this context, as the wine builds up steam and heat.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of spice, rubber and berry fruits lead to a full palate with punchy acidity and firm bones. Flavors of mint and green herbs meld with dense dark berries and lead to an olive tone that lingers on the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Heavy oak character, a distinctive tobacco and olive flavor and plenty of tannin set this full-bodied, unapologetic wine apart from the crowd. It has a thick, almost stiff mouthfeel, bold herb and fruit flavors and a lingering, oak-spice finish.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: A waft of grainy oak is up front and with that are notes of vanilla, lemon peel and resin. This is heavy and full in body, with hammering tannins that require resolution. Woody, toasty, chocolaty black-fruit flavors finish with chocolaty richness and resiny smoke from the wine's oak treatment. Drink through 2028.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine has a bright nose of cherry and currant, its tannins silky and seamless across the palate. It blends in smaller percentages of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec, with a chalky, herbal character that lingers in moderate structure and tannin weight.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas are brooding, with notes of cigar box, black licorice, baking spice and cherry, with the fruit seeming ever so slightly dried out. Full-bodied Fruit Roll-Ups flavors follow. It shows a sense of poise and balance that ups the interest.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This Bulgarian Cabernet Sauvignon is garnet-ruby in the glass and has aromas of sweet baking spice, black plum and violet and a touch of graphite. On the palate it has flavors of black plum and black raspberry, and there are balanced tannins and pleasant acidity on the finish.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Overdelivering on its price point, this is a well-made, impressively structured red wine, blended with 9% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Soft in texture and moderate in acidity, it has high-toned red fruit that presents as tart and tangy beneath firm, integrated tannin and vanilla oak.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Warm berry aromas are vaguely furry and obtuse, not exact or precise. On the palate, this Old World-style Cabernet is direct and juicy, with zesty acidity creating tension. Red-currant and raspberry flavors are dry and racy on the finish, indicating that this will age well for at least another 10 years; drink through 2032.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Green herb, dried herb, coffee and cherry aromas lead to full-bodied well-balanced cherry flavors backed by sneaky firm tannins.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This is the flagship wine from Duckhorn's Washington label. Aromas of black raspberry, black currant, pencil eraser and spice lead to full-bodied red- and black-fruit flavors, with a dense midpalate. It's high on the hedonism scale, with the tannins well tamed from this sometimes burly appellation.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: From the former site of Hidden Ridge Vineyard, Slope is indeed from a 55-degree slope, the site near the Spring Mountain border. A sweetness of vanilla and cinnamon give it a richness met by viscous, smoothly jammy red and black cherry, finishing with a touch of texture.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Bright, compelling aromas of raspberry, red currant and spice lead to ripe red-fruit flavors that taper toward the finish. Plump, surprisingly tamed tannins provide support.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fragrant aromas of dried herb, milk chocolate, tobacco, black cherry, graphite and spice box are followed by full-bodied action-packed cherry flavors. The tannins give a firm squeeze. It's a Cabernet prototype. Best after 2024.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Dense aromas of black currant are leveled by slate and graphite tones on the nose of this bottling. The palate is all about texture that is firm but friendly, carrying flavors of black olive, violet and blackberry. This one still needs even more time to develop fully.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: Earthy aromas of clay and loam lead into black currant, espresso and roasted meats on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard. It lands on the palate with a soft presence, delivering flavors of roasted strawberry, cocoa and an earthy, soil-like streak.

name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2016 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky cherry and mocha flavors are accented by dark chocolate and sweet oak in this lush, creamy red that is made in a rich, layered style. Lasting notes of tobacco, dusty sage and brawny tannin round out the impressive experience.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine comes from one of the state's premier vineyards in the far western end of the valley. Starting out a bit reduced, the subsequent aromas are bright and fresh, with notes dark raspberry, dried herb, jam and tar. Reserved, superbly balanced fruit flavors follow, lingering on the finish. It possesses a lovely sense of structure.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Good structure and plenty of black-fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine a good choice. It shows judicious balancing of blackberry and black cherry with seductive oak accents and supported by a moderate layer of fine-grained tannins for a mouthwatering texture.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Olive, tobacco, eucalyptus and grainy oak aromas are front and center on a classic Chilean Cabernet nose. On the palate, this is piped full of resiny oak and cutting acidity. Flavors of spiced plum, vanilla, chocolate and wood grain give way to clearer black-fruit notes on a juicy, intense finish. Drink through 2025.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Blended with a sizable percentage of Merlot, this soft, beguiling and likable red is flinty and dusty, with brooding, earthy sanguine notes. Amidst the flint and dust is a bright undercurrent of acidity that keeps if fresh and lively.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Appealing aromas of dark coffee grounds, cherry and spice are out front. Rich, full-bodied, power-packed fruit flavors follow, with dense firmly wound tannins backing them up. It shows the best of this often challenging vintage. Best after 2023. Decant if drinking in the near term.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Fruit for this wine comes from vines planted in 1985—old vines. All aged in neutral oak—a rarity for the variety—aromas of raspberry compote, herb and mineral lead to achingly pure, intense but exceptionally balanced red-fruit flavors that bring a frank sense of deliciousness. If you want to taste old vine Washington Cabernet unencumbered by oak and pretense, look no further.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Smoky chocolate aromas blend with herbal black-fruit notes, a hint of lemon peel and a smear of black shoe polish. Freshness on the palate is at a premium, and along with that there's lemony acid and smacking tannins. Blackberry, coffee and toast flavors finish with controlled heat. Drink through 2028.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal, estate wine given nearly two years in French oak, much of it new, this wine is powerful, sultry and smooth, with succulent red fruit and fig at its fore. Tobacco, forest and cedar give it a savory, complementary complexity that works well to make it a cohesive wine. This will benefit from time in the bottle; enjoy best 2021–2026.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine has plenty of dark berry and cherry notes, a touch of black olive and a big structure of firm, fine-grained tannins. Deft oak accents spice up the palate and linger on the finish. Best through 2025.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Blended with smaller amounts of Merlot, Petit Verdot, Zinfandel and other varieties, this wine is lightly spiced and in balance, despite its powerful approach to ripeness. Tobacco, clove and black pepper enliven the darker, denser aspects of blackberry jam and dark chocolate, finishing unabashedly rich.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rich but subtle aromas of red fruit are lifted by ample baking spice and a rocky minerality on the nose of this bottling. There is solid grip to the sip, where more lush purple and red-fruit flavors meet with touches of crushed graphite, roasted coffee bean and fine oak. Chalky tannins carry into the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Delicious, fruit-soaked flavors and a smooth texture make this full-bodied wine almost irresistible. It is drenched in ripe blackberry, blueberry and cocoa flavors, and feels shaped by new oak without becoming overtly oaky in flavor. Best through 2023.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: Cocoa, char, cherry, chocolate and coffee aromas are at the fore. Coffee, chocolate and cherry flavors follow, with fruit and barrel playing well off each other. There's enough structure to lay down a few years in the cellar.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This wine shines in bright red fruit, dusty herb and sage. Grippy and full bodied, it evolves to reveal layers of sweet tobacco and cinnamon founded along a sizable structure of tannin and oak. Enjoy best from 2026–2031.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This well-made and well-polished wine is bold in flavor and full bodied, but achieves good balance via fruit acidity and moderate tannins that buoy the ripe blackberry, plum and black-cherry flavors. Light oak spices add welcome complexity.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine shows a beautiful blend of oak spices with pure Cabernet fruit flavors for a minty, cinnamony, spiced cherry effect that's delicious. It's medium to full bodied, has an elegant, lightly tannic mouthfeel and lingering finish.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Spicy, savory berry aromas meld with forest floor, earth and tobacco notes. On the palate, this feels quite fresh and vibrant, but still full in body and layered. Raspberry, currant and bramble flavors are savory and spicy, with a backing of toast, pepper and cocoa on the finish. Drink through 2025.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a substantially dense, hearty wine, rich and round in style, with structured tannins. Sweet oak envelopes packed layers of blueberry, mocha and vanilla, showing a hint of the mountain in cocoa powder and dust.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Earthy in saddle and tobacco, this wine is thickly concentrated and richly full bodied. From the exotic mountain appellation, it shares flavors of clove, black pepper and black currant in a sea of sage and blackberry, the fruitiness balanced in spice and dried herb.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This includes 5% Sangiovese, a worthy, more feral companion to the structured Cabernet. Toasted oak, tobacco and crayon wax play out along a brooding core of tart black fruit and serious tannin, finishing with a taste of graphite.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine represents the first time the winery has aged its red in entirely French oak, switching slowly over from American. Notions of clove and vanilla accent sanguine red fruit and savory elements.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a tight-grained, grippy and complex red wine, savory in leather, tobacco and current. The midpalate softens into a rich, luxurious explosion of black cherry, cocoa powder and currant. It stands to develop more substantially over time; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This luxury level bottling, which includes 14% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, begins with earthy aromas of loam and cigar wrapper as well as elegant touches of purple flowers, boysenberry fruit and beef. The palate combines dried berries with pine, wrapped in a polished tannic structure.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This affordably priced bottling delivers all that's desired in a Paso Robles red: rich aromas of black cherry foam, oak spice, vanilla cream and pie crust. That's followed by a lush and rounded palate of pillowy, chalky tannins that offer flavors of cherry, baking spice and dried herbs.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This seductive wine entices from the first whiff to the lingering finish. A potpourri of baking spices, cedar and mint infuses the aroma, while layered and delicious black cherry, raspberry and cassis flavors coat the palate. A posh and creamy texture is subtly reinforced by fine grained tannins. Best through 2025.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: Intense aromas of red currant and black plum meet with an elegant floral display on the fresh nose of this bottling. There's great energy to the palate, where exotic red-cherry and elderberry flavors meet with cola, more flowers and tannins that will quickly smooth out.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: One of Chile's most consistently impressive Cabernets strikes again. Concentrated aromas of plum and berry fruits come with a note of charred oak. On the palate, this is grippy but pulsing with bold fruit. Blackberry, cassis, toast and chocolate flavors finish with intensity. Drink through 2040.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Complex and high toned, this wine is made from the producer's estate Sacrashe Vineyard in the hills of Rutherford. Bold, full bodied and savory, it shines in toasted oak, sage and currant, with a lasting richness of blackberry and cherry.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Well-concentrated berry aromas include rich notes of chocolate, tobacco and earth on this plush yet restrained Cabernet. Spicy berry and cocoa flavors finish dry, long and with a hint of clove. Given the documented difficulties of 2016 in Chile, this can hold its head up. Drink through 2026.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Blended with 9% Merlot and 1% Malbec, this is a lush, richly styled red wine that is well made and integrated, with dense concentration and structure. It lingers in dark cherry, dried herb and oak, offering an Old World character amidst the hearty fruit.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This impressive red overdelivers on its price point, combining the main variety with Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Merlot, aging the whole in French oak for 18 months (40% of it new). Truffled earth, compost, bark and gunpowder give it a savory edge that leads to a juicy, balanced midpalate of black fruit, cocoa powder and dust.

name: Hess Collection 2016 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Earthy, thick and densely packed in tannin, baked plum and nutmeg, this is an enormously fleshy, full-bodied wine with pronounced oak and heat. Forest floor, clove and tobacco figure into the flavor profile in savory, complex ways, accenting the bold power. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best 2020–2025.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a great amount of energy on the nose of this bottling, showing fresh berries alongside damp wood and chunky soil aromas. The palate is cohesive in offering all the elements of Cab, from dark berries at the core to touches of marjoram, oregano and cracked pepper. Tannins are apparent, but not obtrusive.

name: Diamond Creek 2016 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Red Rock is a 7-acre block of the famous vineyard and this vintage is blended with 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc. Tobacco, leather and cigar box season a thick, viscous structure of sweet cherry and cassis that is rich and succulently rewarding. Cellar awhile to tame the tannins and enjoy best 2026–2031.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a grippy, powerful and densely built wine, robustly oaky and substantial in dark, brooding black fruit. The blackberry and cherry have a succulence that gives the wine a juicy core and soft midpalate, as a build up of black pepper, graphite and smoke surround.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: This is a beautiful, classically made solo-project wine from the veteran winemaker Chris Phelps, now at Inglenook. Dusty sage, plum and cocoa dust highlight a layered, balanced and complex midpalate that's structured and velvety lush, with a lasting taste of sweet tobacco.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From a high-elevation site, this impressively structured wine is cofermented with 8% Malbec and explodes in tones of black pepper, nutmeg and sweet tobacco. It is smooth and tingling in acidity, yet also shows length and breadth. Enjoy 2021–2026.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This new wine is from the highest-elevation point on Cooley Ranch, a wild site north of Rockpile that reaches 2,040 feet. Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec, it shows rocky minerality and deft tannic structure, with toasty oak and a lushness of vanilla, tobacco and dark plum.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Weighty, substantive and grippy in tannin, this is a bold, powerful wine that is unflinchingly ripe and richly layered. Black cherry and smoky oak compete for affection on the lengthy palate, asking for more time to develop in bottle. Enjoy best from 2026–2031.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: Tawny in taut leather with layers of coffee bean, dried herb, plum and cherry, this wine is structured and 100% varietal, from older vines. Lengthy in power and grip, it has dusty tannin weight and breadth alongside fistfuls of Asian spice and clove and lasting acidity. Enjoy now or wait and enjoy 2026–2036.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: Dust and sage color this bold, powerful wine, which is layered and complex in its ripeness and structure. Weighty in oak and tannin, it shows an expanse of rich red fruit, from cassis to current, with seasonings of cocoa dust, espresso and cigar. Enjoy best after cellaring 2026–2031.

name: Chappellet 2015 Pritchard Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Entirely varietal and made from a tiny yielding section of the estate vineyard, a force of nature and mineral. A substantial nose of baked black fruit, coffee bean and chewy, grippy tannin give it a tenacity and weight that finds length enough to smoothen out the sharp edges, dried herb and clove. This is one to let settle; enjoy best from 2026–2036.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: A tiny production from winemaker Chris Phelps of Inglenook, this wine is softly round and richly structured, with a backbone of silky tannin and integrated oak. Black cherry and toffee mocha stand out most prominently around savory characteristics of sage, graphite and pencil. This is a lovely, elegant and 100% varietal wine.

name: Diamond Creek 2016 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This is an intensely powerful Cabernet Sauvignon, with 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc blended in. It is robust in firm tannins that prop up flavors of leather, dark chocolate, sage and crushed rock, accented by toasted oak and cedar. It will benefit from aging; enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon wine is rare for Bordeaux. Here it gives a firmly structured wine with layers of tannins and therefore aging potential. Along with the tannins, black-currant fruits are ready to give a bright character as well as acidity. Drink from 2021.

name: Larkmead 2015 The Lark Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made entierly from Cabernet Sauvignon, this top tier wine offers dark, brooding flavors of coffee, toffee, sage and earth. It is robust in feel, showing up-front power and structure that's balanced by nuanced oak. This deserves more time in the cellar; enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: This is a thick, weighty wine made 100% from one variety, with bombastic, brawny black fruit. Tar, leather, garrigue and earthy herb give it contrast and complexity, its fleshy ripeness never distracting from its well-made core. This could do with some cellaring; enjoy best 2026–2031.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Full, smooth and ripe black-fruit aromas hit the bull's eye for value-priced Cabernet regardless of origin. A lush palate is pumped with extracted berry fruit, while integrated flavors of blackberry and wild herbs finish smooth and easy. Drink up and enjoy.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This vintage is a strong offering. The fruit is from two top South Aussie Cabernet regions: Clare Valley and Coonawarra, and both regions shine through. The nose leads with plums, currants, pencil lead, black olives and oak spice. The palate follows, with lifted tangy and juicy fruit that acts as a counterweight to the fine chalky tannins and oak spice. This is a relatively straightforward but varietally expressive drop with a long, brambly finish.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Dusty oak, sage and leather give this mountain-appellation wine a savory, herbal and earthy personality that is appealing and well integrated with the dense, concentrated black fruit. The oak and tannin are beginning to meld well together into a seamless whole.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Fruity, nervy and tautly balanced, this full-bodied wine is laser-focused on black-cherry flavors that are pure, concentrated and deep. It has a sense of natural, unmanipulated fruitiness that is well shaped by fine-grained tannins. Best through 2026.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Tones of clove, bay leaf and sage ride over a core of big black fruit in this youthfully tannic wine. An accent of tobacco arises on the midpalate and leads to a robust, lasting peppery finish.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Sanguine and floral on the nose, this wine offers rustic flavors of red and black fruit around a weighty, dense palate. It shows lots of concentration and power, finishing on savory swirls of gunpowder and cigar.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Spicy black fruit dipped in nutmeg and cocoa powder rules the palate of this structured, silky wine, with integrated oak and measured tannin providing a foundation of intensity and concentration on the palate.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine shows quite a bit of attractive oak influence that reveals as cedar, cinnamon and clove in the aromas, while good, concentrated black-cherry and blackberry flavors fill the middle. The wine is big and broad, mouthfilling and moderately tannic.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of bittersweet chocolate, cherry, herbs and baking spice are followed by palate-coating flavors and a firm structure. A chocolate note lingers on the finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Dense aromas of black currant, earthy herbs, tobacco and pencil shavings show on the nose of this bottling. Brighter touches of plum and mulberry power the palate, where chopped herbs and graphite flavors add complexity.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This has a sizable addition of 13% Cabernet Franc, which works nicely to provide an herbal earthiness that appeals. Juicy and broad on the palate in generous black fruit that doesn't hold back in ripeness of density, it shows complexity and structure, with chalky tannin and oak.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Richness and ripeness give this very full-bodied wine a mouthfilling presence as black-cherry and blackberry flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. Subtle oak spices add complexity too.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Winemaker Pete Dillon and his team make a dizzying array of wines from around Australia and the world. This Yarra Valley Cab displays all the hallmarks of the variety and region: sun-kissed brambly red currants and strawberries, mocha, ground pepper, wild thyme and mint. The palate shows both power and restraint. Chalky herbaceous tannins kick things off until a rush of juicy berry fruit fills the midpalate. The tannins pounce again on the finish, cinching the tongue.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: The 2017 vintage of this wine succeeds even better than the last, offering excellent value for money. Bright, drinkable and varietal, this very Aussie Cab leads with red and black currants and cherries, pencil lead and spice. Tannins are fine grained and tightly wound, with a touch of spicy oak amidst the tangy fruit and graphite characters. This is a poised and balanced weeknight red.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Berry and plum aromas are herbal and include cheesy oak notes. On the palate, this Cabernet Sauvignon from Navarra is high in acidity and choppy in feel. Modest flavors of berry fruits are lessened by dry tannins and fiery heat on the finish.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made from a majority of the variety with additions of Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this is a thick, richly concentrated wine simple in dark cherry, vanilla and oak.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Juicy, broadly defined and generous in black fruit, this full-bodied wine has dustings of dried herb and cigar. It delivers approachable smoothness and lasting ripeness.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal with chalky tannins, this is blended with 8% Malbec from the elusive appellation. Red currant, baked plum and jammy blackberry highlight a powerful core of ripeness and grip.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This is a ripe flashy Cab oozing black-cherry and cassis fruit, menthol, dried green herbs, damp earth and it also hasa green vegetal streak. The palate is dense with fruit that gets a little lost under a blanket of oak and muscular spicy tannins.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This wine is light for a Cabernet, and shows lots of fresh, almost-sweet fruit flavors from strawberry to marascino cherry. Medium body and a lack of noticeable tannins keep the texture soft and easy.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas of this wine, aged 30 months in French and American oak, are locked up out of the gate. Cherry fruit leather, black licorice, dill and anise aromas emerge over time. Ripe red and black fruit flavors follow, looking for a bit more structure to pull them together. The warmth of the vintage shows.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a small inland region on the eastern edge of South Australia, this cherry-hued Cab starts out on the funky, slightly sweaty side—a mealy character overlaying the red-berry, rhubarb, sweet spice and green-pepper notes (perhaps from the 5% of Cab Franc in the blend). The funkier tones blow off with time in glass but the other the aromas never really come to the fore. The palate is silky, almost creamy, with soft edges, red fruit and a gentle grip of savory, herb-flecked tannins.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Light and bright aromas of red fruit, tobacco and dank herbs show on the nose of this bottling. Tangy herbs and zippy acidity carry tart berry flavors through the sip.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Herbal and briary, this wine shows strong flavors of clove, cigar and leather saddle, with a soft, easygoing midpalate of full-bodied weight and flavor. Black currant and dark chocolate mark the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Gamy aromas meet with dark berry on the slightly sour nose of this bottling. Tangy black fruits and dark strawberry show on the sip, where the gamy, dried meat flavors also show.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: From the producer's oldest block of Cabernet Sauvignon, this delivers soft, layered herbaceousness and grip, the tannins firm and tenacious. Baked plum, nutmeg and oaky concentration complement each other well.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a dark and intensely brooding wine, 100% varietal, from fruit grown near Howell Mountain. Smoke, char, bark and densely packed tannin wrap around baked plum, graphite and earthy dried herb.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A smoky, peppery tone dominates this full-bodied and flavorful wine, but it has enough black-cherry and sour cherry fruitiness on the palate to balance it out. Moderate tannins add some grip and the smoky-fruity blend lingers on the finish.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Hearty, reduced and big in oak and tannin, this wine offers jammy black fruit, with light hints of leather and sage. Robustly ripe, soft and rich, it overdelivers on its price points to fans of a robust concentrated style.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Tight, tannic and leathery in texture, this full-bodied wine is thick and broadly defined, with powerfully dense, dark berry fruit. Hints of sage give it an nice earthiness that lingers.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers dried black-plum and baked soil aromas on the tightly wound nose. More plum flavors meet with rosemary flowers on the palate, which is clean yet simple.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Blackberry and black-cherry jam meet with rocky soils and savory aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is more primary, with raspberry syrup and light herb flavors most prominent.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine leads with spicy smoky oak in the aromas and pours more oak over the ripe cherry and black-plum flavors. It's not a bad choice for those with a taste for wood, and has a smooth, lightly tannic texture.

name: Larkmead 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This stellar, powerhouse wine is perfumed in aromas of pencil, leather and sage that season a core of mineral and crushed rock. The fruit is equally savory in currant and plum, with a dusting of dark chocolate. Enjoy now–2029.

name: Masia de la Vinya 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: With a soft entry into rounded flavors of bay leaf and oak, this is a simple wine, with mild red fruit on offer.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Rubbery earthy reduced aromas set this on its course. In the mouth, this Cabernet is tight, edgy and raw. Herbaceous plum and berry flavors run out on a choppy finish.

name: Kunde 2015 Drummond Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Dusty oak and rock form around a harshness of tannin in this savory wine that has just a touch of rich red fruit.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Blended with 11% Merlot and 4% Malbec, this is a hearty red wine that's brimming in chalky tannin and oak. Powerfully dense, with a touch of heat, it features peppercorn and dried herb as well as a touch of cigar.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A heavy, sweet-oak component obscures most of the fruit flavor in this medium-bodied wine. It tastes like wood smoke, cedar and mint all the way through.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Grapy blueberry aromas are sunbaked, with a note of cardamom. A jammy palate is massive, while this tastes of very ripe plum and berry fruits prior to a fat palate—better than stripped but a bit overweight.

name: Buehler 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of Band-Aid, cherry and herbs are followed by light, raisiny-seeming flavors with a tacky feel.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Stalky berry aromas include an oaky note of vanilla. On the palate, this Cabernet feels tannic and sticky. Peppery plum and raisiny flavors are herbal, candied and mildly oxidized on the finish.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Herbal, intensely tannic and brimming in peppercorn, this is a full-bodied, concentrated and richly rounded wine that finishes tart.

name: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Thick in black, leathery fruit, dried herb and toasted oak, this is an intensely ripe, concentrated wine that has a sour quality to the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This Cab, from the southeast corner of South Australia, seems to be aging rapidly. Slightly volatile, with fading red-currant and plum fruit, there's still plenty of typical Cab characters: pencil lead, tobacco leaf, savory spices and a charred oak note. The palate is structured and tannic, with warm but fading fruit, oak spice and a bitter note on the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This Cab starts out green, led by tomato leaf, green olive and eucalyptus notes, with some tangy red-berry fruit and dusty spices far in the background. On the palate, the acidity is a little puckering and the fruit more forward and ripe than the nose lets on, hugged by grainy chunky tannins. This is straightforward, if a bit disjointed.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Spicy aromas of tight-grained oak and vanilla touch up green-leaning berry scents. A reasonably flush and sound palate feels a bit resiny, while this tastes of dry plums and berry fruits along with oak and spice.

name: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Spicy aromas of berry fruits and green herbs are typical of just-ripe to not-so-ripe Cabernet. A tight and tannic palate is not expansive, while much like the nose, this tastes of herbal black fruits and bell pepper. Very dry tannins make for a scratchy finish.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Extracted on the nose, this bottling shows dried sour cherry aromas and a hint of herbs. Sticky tannins frame the palate, where blackberry and garden herb flavors meet with a hint of bitter earth.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Smoky in charred oak with thick walls of tannin, this is blended with 10% Merlot, 7% Malbec and 6% Cabernet Franc. Together they offer dense flavors of dried herb, baked blackberry and tar.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This winter warmer wine opens with notes of plums, blueberry, dark chocolate flakes, cola and slightly soapy, earthy oak spice. Tannins take a few seconds to arrive on the palate but are powerful and mouthfilling when they do come, feeling wooly on the tongue like a blanket. The oak is there too, a little bitter on the finish, and the fruit gets a little lost with these two powerful components at the fore.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh herbs, cherry liqueur and pencil eraser aromas lead to sweet, bunched up, center focused fruit flavors. The tannins show some grit.

name: Samuel Charles 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Extremely extracted aromas of black plum, milk chocolate and fudge are very rich on on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dense with black plums, roasted berries and strong licorice spice.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dried blackberry, incense, turned earth and mushroom aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling. Similarly dried fruits show on the palate, including plums and berries, and the forest-floor kick of mushroom and damp herbs also persists.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Dusty clove, sage and vanilla ride along a soft, simple palate of medium-bodied ripeness and concentration in this wine, which finishes thick in oak and tannin.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a pleasantly juicy and easy-to-enjoy bottling that is widely available. Aromas of blackberry jam, cedar and loamy earth lead into a zippy, fresh palate of dark red fruit and wood spice.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Merlot and sourced from both the producer's estate and other sites, this is an approachable, appealing wine, etched in smoked meat, oak and black pepper. With a fleshiness to the mouthfeel, it has lasting flavors of blackberry and clove.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a big-boned Cab with flavors of mint, blackberry and pencil laced with spicy tannins and savory oak. The mouthfeel is lush but the fruit is juicy, making this a wine for big red lovers.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Offering up plenty of varietal character, this Cab dishes aromas of ripe, almost raisiny black-currant and raspberry fruit, tobacco leaf, menthol and a soft line of savory spice. There's a slightly charred, polished wood note in the background. On the palate, the fruit is both supple and tangy, wound tightly by powerful, spicy tannins that call out for rich cuisine.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Red-fruit-dominant, with light touches of baking spice, dust and tannin, this wine is ripe and robustly built. Dark and brooding in nature, it packs a lasting punch of power and concentration.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This vintage of Clairault Cab is currently showing quite a bit of reduction so be sure to give it time in decanter for those funky barnyard notes to blow off. When they do, however, the regional and varietal character starts to shine through in the form of red-berry fruit, dried herbs, peppery spice and mint. The reduction is affecting the palate too, suppressing some of wine's brightness and personality, emphasizing the chewy tannins and creating some bitterness on the finish. Hopefully this finds its way again in the coming years.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: The black-currant and black-cherry flavors in this full-bodied wine are just-ripe and generous, filling out the good structure of fine-grained tannins and showing a touch of tartness and restraint on the finish. Best through 2024.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This vintage of Ironstone Cab has lots of varietal character but isn't offering as much promise as some other vintages. The nose is ripe, spicy and chocolatey, with plum and berry aromas, eucalyptus and tobacco leaf. The mouthfeel is plush and silky, with granular tannins and a fair lick of oak.
