Texturally it's lovely but the fruit is fading a bit and it's missing some of the finesse and elegance this premium Cab region is so renowned for.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This rich broody Barossa cab exudes flavors of blackberry, red currant, beet, eucalyptus and graphite. The palate feels a little hot and oaky but the tannins are fine grained and muscular, with lovely texture, and the acidity is lifted, buoying all that ripe fruit. This still feels pretty young and inaccessible, though. Best to give it some time in bottle. Drink 2020–2027.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: The dark red fruits are initially subdued on the nose of this bottling, giving way to the crushed slate and rocky soil aspects of the nose. It's very dry and earthy on the palate as well, where dried herbs, baked loam and crushed stone meet with hints of dark cherry.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Smashed plums, drying lilacs and a hint of soy show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is layered with flavors of sour blackberry, dried violets and lavender, marjoram and other roasting herbs and a more savory soy touches.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Focused aromas of black cherry, crushed rocks, dried herbs and coffee show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard east of San Diego. Roasted cherry flavors converge with anise, fennel and leather on the palate.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Black-cherry and oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the town of Jamul east of San Diego. Stony flavors of gravel and chalk meet with tart cherry and cocoa on the palate.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From fifth and sixth generation winemakers in the foothills of the Barossa Ranges, this five-year-old bottling seem to be aging quickly. The color is heading into brick shades and the strawberry and raspberry fruit on the floral, aromatic nose is a little raisiny. But Cab's typical tobacco-leaf and spice notes are there too, beneath the fruit, and there's a lovely ease and drinkability to the palate. The tannins are drying but the fruit is plump and bright. Drink up.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: This wine offers a basket of brambly berry fruit but is really all about the spice and savory umami elements, along with characteristic pencil lead and toasty oak. There's a lovely burst of acidity on the palate that lifts the berry fruit. It's cinched by tight dusty tannins and spicy toasty oak. It is a good value bottle, just as was intended.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Thick and rich in cherry, raspberry and oak, this is a full-bodied, entirely enjoyable wine. The layers of flavor are soft and well integrated, with touches of leather and baking spice.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: There's a sunny, Mediterranean vibe about this full-bodied Cab that aligns with McLaren Vale's warm, maritime climate. Scrubby green seaside herbs and spices swirl with ripe raspberry, red currant, plum and graphite on the nose. The palate is balanced, with more green herbal notes and fruit that feels juicy even in the grasp of firm, nicely textured tannins. The oak is showing here but it's fairly well integrated. Drink now through 2026.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine delivers a robustly rich experience of lengthy appeal. Blended with 12% Petite Sirah, among other varieties, and aged in American oak, the palate shows a wealth of black cherry, cassis and blackberry around toasted oak and a hint of clove.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This buoyant, fresh and substantial wine bursts with concentrated flavors of black currant and black cherry. While full in weight, the texture has light tannins that give a slight, welcome grip on the palate.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a clonal selection on the producer's estate vineyard, this pure expression of the grape exudes black licorice, lavender and oak. Sturdy, grippy tannins wrap around an expansive midpalate that's accented by dried herb, cedar and cigar.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Blended with smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot, this mountainous wine is rounded in weight and texture, with a soft fruity approach that is balanced and rewarding. Firm tannins surround a core of brooding black fruit, earth and anise that lingers long on the finish.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Robust in dried herb and graphite, this is a weighty, structured and tannic red blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec. Classic elements of currant and clove add to the overall mix of vintage-appropriate density and power.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This juicy, smooth wine includes 3% Petit Verdot in the blend. Firm in tannin and oak, it shows dense layers of red and black cherry alongside dustings of cocoa powder and sweet tobacco.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: With 11% Petite Sirah and 8% Malbec in the blend, this is no shy undertaking. Robust, fleshy dark fruit flavors are enveloped by a voluptuous texture. Currant and toasted oak form the core of the midpalate as a hint of cigar comes into play on the finish.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Ripe berry and black cherry aromas are spicy and include a note of black olive. On the palate, this reflects the heat of 2015 and thus it feels heavy and sappy, almost raisiny. To that end, flavors of prune and raisin are chocolaty, while this Cabernet feels rich and almost overripe on the finish. Drink through 2022.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A polished texture and a complex, complete flavor profile give this full-bodied wine a wonderful presence. It offers a bit of restraint to the opulent black-cherry and blueberry flavors while subtle oak accents frame rather than coat the fruit.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This big, rich wine offers an array of plump fruit flavors that are woven through subtle oak spices. It has plenty of tannins, but they're so well integrated that the texture still feels creamy, carrying flavors of blueberry, black cherry and dark chocolate. Best through 2025.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Thick in tannin and spicy in nutmeg, this is a savory, structured and rambunctious red, bold in full-bodied ripeness and concentration. Clove, cigar and cedar give it seasoning and complexity around a length of black currant and brambly blackberry dusted in cocoa powder.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine with impressive concentration and full-bodied weight, this wine is soft and richly layered in blue and black fruit, with memorable elements of mocha and vanilla. Classically structured, it offers insight into a great vintage in the right hands.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Artful Red Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick and savory red wine from a picture-perfect vintage, moderate in ripeness and power. Graphite, lavender and dried herb combine around dense layers of cassis and red currant, finishing with length and grace.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Crayon wax, plum and dark cherry mingle against a medium-bodied, moderately oaked and well-made mountain wine from the famous site in this new appellation. Sinewy texture is boosted by high-toned acidity and earthy freshness that allows room for white and black pepper to linger.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: Smoky oak, meat and garrigue accent a juicy, integrated core of blueberry, blackberry and currant in this approachable wine that is both lush and fruity. The tannins are well integrated and softly wrapped around the richness.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: The wood-aged wine has dry tannins and a firm character. Beginning to mature, the wine is full, showing secondary flavors as well as ripe black plum and black currant fruits. The wine is now balanced and ready to drink.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From eroded riverbed soils that present as gravelly, layered in quartz and chert, this single-soil, single-varietal wine is thick, viscous and brawny in wood, earth and herbal elements. A soft texture takes root on the midpalate allowing for black and blue fruit to enter the picture and show verve on the high-toned finish.

name: Diamond Creek 2016 Volcanic Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From a five-acre section of the vineyard, this classic red is blended with 8% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc. Crushed rock, red fruit and warm baking spices combine around a grippy midpalate of leather, clove and tobacco—the power gracefully persistent. The finish is brambly and bright. Allow this youthful wine to age; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Saturated with opulent black-fruit flavors and moderately tannic, this wine is big but polished and complex. It shows little obvious oakiness, but rather feels shaped by oak aging until it was velvety and firm. Enjoyable now with something roasted or braised, this wine will drink best after 2022.

name: Four Lanterns 2017 Kharis Red (Paso Robles)
description: There's a compelling density of aromas in the way of blackberry, dark cocoa and savory charred meat on the nose of this bottling. The palate is deep and ripe yet balanced by a dry structure, offering flavors of black cherry, black currant, cocoa and espresso bean.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Sourced predominantly from the Coombsville appellation, this is a stunning, beautifully aromatic wine made with 3% Petit Verdot. Winemaker Andy Erickson coaxes clove, red currant and a bite of acidity from soft, seamlessly rounded layers of classic structure and grace. Earthy tones of gravel and dried herb provide contrast to the powerful fruit. Enjoy best from 2026–2030.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This layered, complex and polished wine is compelling from the first scent of clove, black plum and black cherry to the rich, saturated flavors and the lingering spiced-plum finish. A warm layer of soft tannins envelops the palate as subtle blackberry and dark-chocolate notes emerge with repeated sipping and linger on the finish. Aged for 18 months in all new Hungarian Kadar barrels, it will mature through 2030.

name: Larkmead 2016 Solari Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a powerfully concentrated and constructed wine, with 14% Petit Verdot and 8% Malbec. Dark, inky and reductive, it offers waves of tar, leather and toasted oak within sinewy tannins. Chewy black fruit is structured around wild elements of cedar, dried herb and sage, with lingering notes of clove. This is one to let settle; enjoy best from 2025–2030.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2015 Cask 23 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This gorgeous wine combines the best of two historic vineyards—Fay and S.L.V.—into one cohesive, refined whole. A soft entry of woody spice and toasted oak leads the way to an expansive midpalate of currant, crushed rock, dried herb and elegant tannins begging for further time in the bottle. Enjoy 2026–2036.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Aromas of coffee bean, charred meat, blackberry and toast show on the nose of this blend of 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot. There is compelling density to the palate, which offers flavors of espresso, cocoa, charred toast and blackberry.

name: Casca Wines 2018 Cabo da Roca Baga Castelão-Aragonex-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Península de Setúbal)
description: Jammy and gushy, this inexpensive, generous and fruity wine tastes grapey like Welch's and has a soft full texture. It's simple and tasty.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Nice and rich in blackberry and black-cherry flavors, this full-bodied and jammy wine is velvety and mouthcoating in texture.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This flavorful, approachable and full-bodied wine is drenched in plum and black-cherry aromas, rich and soft fruit flavors and laced with very mild tannins.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: A deep color and concentrated black-cherry flavor gives this full-bodied wine some classic Cabernet character. Dense fruit and lightly spiced oak tones meld with a light snap of tannin to firm up the texture.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine has everything in good proportions, from ripe fruit aromas to equally bold, ripe and almost-sweet flavors that are judiciously spiced with oak and braced by moderate tannins.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: This bottling remains as impressive and delicious as it did upon debut two vintages ago. Aromas of black cherry, hickory smoke and vanilla cookie lead into a palate of brown sugar, sea salt, caramel and black-cherry foam, all framed by polished tannins and just enough acidity.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a medium-bodied wine from the Mondavi family of Charles Krug Winery. It balances red and black fruit flavors with supportive acidity and solid tannins. A bit of oak rises up but doesn't detract from the fruity core.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Bold fruit flavors vie with attention-getting oak notes like vanilla and waffle in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It is packed with bright cherry and raspberry flavors and feels slightly sweet on the finish.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This solid and well-made wine is one of the best deals in California Cab. It does not go for overt oak or over-ripeness, but offers honest black-cherry and black-currant flavors, subtle vanilla and spice notes, a good structure of moderate tannins and a nice heft on the palate. It can fill in at almost any meal.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: From a high-elevation site in the Mayacamas Mountains, this is an affordable, small-production, 100% varietal wine, with bright notes of raspberry and cherry. The tannins are soft and well integrated, with a light layering of earth, clove and baking spice playing around the midpalate.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: This firm-textured and full-bodied wine layers spicy, earthy, meaty oak tones over concentrated, effusive berry and plum flavors. Grippy tannins thicken the mouthfeel while layers of oak spice and jammy fruit roll over the palate.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: The dense texture of the Cabernet Sauvignon gives this wine both richness and a fine sense of structure. The succulent acidity brings freshness to the ripe black currant fruit. The wine is now ready to drink.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Chewy tannin and oak with a smoky toasty component lead the way to a robust and softly rich wine that includes 21% Syrah, the whole aged in French, Eastern European and American oak. Straightforward and savory, it finishes in earthy black currant.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A bit shy on the nose at first, this bottling eventually offers aromas of pencil shavings, tart red plums and slightly richer black cherry. The palate shows dark berry and plum flavors, wrapped in soft yet somewhat chunky tannins.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: A balanced and not overreaching nose offers berry, spice and mild oak notes. This Cabernet, named after the winery's founding “Silver Lady,” is full on the palate, with chewy tannins. Ripe cassis, berry, tobacco and vanilla flavors are true to Maipo, while this maintains its quality on a structured finish.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Toasty aromas of strawberry, dried red plum and incense show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong cedar and pine kick to the nose, where dark red-currant and tart plum-skin flavors are framed by angular tannins.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This Cab shows both varietal character and the warmth of this warm inland region. It charges out of the gate with ripe fruit and spice: plump red and black berries, menthol, eucalyptus and pencil lead. The oak is present too, vanillin and a little soapy. The palate gets a bit weighed down with clunky, muscular tannins, as the fruit struggles to keep up. But considering the heat of the Riverina, there's a fair amount of freshness amidst the power. Drink now with protein until 2027.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Ripe black fruit aromas are clouded by oak-based scents of graphite, milk chocolate and resiny spice. On the palate, this warm-vintage Cabernet Sauvignon is flush and pulpy, but inexact. Plum, cassis and spice flavors are slightly raisiny prior to a short finish with heat and overt oak character.

name: Serafino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: The 2017 vintage of Cab really shows off the variety. It's minty and spicy with ripe plummy fruit, pencil lead, black olives and a slightly soapy, synthetic oak character at the back. The palate is equally spicy, with crunchy acidity, sandy, grippy tannins, plenty of oak influence and an astringency on the finish. It is a full-bodied straightforward Barossa red.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: The nose on this bottling, which includes 8% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot and 2% Merlot, is extremely potpourri-like, with dried purple-flower aromas mixing with purple fruit. The strong violet kick plays into the palate as well, with is also extremely purple in flavor.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: From a historic estate in the Riverina, a massive inland region in the southwest corner of New South Wales, this is a dense powerful Cab flush with ripe plums and blackberries, peppery spice, charred root vegetables, dusty dried green herbs and a lick of cola oak. The plump fruit on the palate is cinched by powerful sinewy tannins.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Aromas of green pepper, baking spice, struck match and plum lead to broad-feeling but still elegant green pepper and cherry flavors. A light squeeze of tannin finishes it off. It's a straight-down-the-fairway interpretation of Cabernet, showing the variety's more elegant side.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a likable, well-made wine, blended with 12% Merlot and appropriately soft, succulent and moderately rich. Tangy red fruit is lifted by good acidity and nuanced oak, the tannins are well behaved.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is blended with 10% Cabernet Franc, 10% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot. A sweetness of cherry and vanilla dominant along a smooth corridor of smoky oak and grippy tannin. It lingers in heat and density as black-pepper spiciness takes hold.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: A straightforward wine that overdelivers on its price point, this is blended with 7% Merlot and made by longtime Napa Valley winemaker Joel Aiken. Tight in oak and tannin, it offers a generous expanse of black cherry, currant and sage, finishing in a thicket of dark chocolate and vanilla.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Cedar, spice and dried herb hit the nose of this robust, densely concentrated red wine that is full bodied and unabashedly ripe in style. Black currant and blackberry take on a jammy quality that will appeal to fans of rich roundedness.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blackberry jam, loamy earth, cocoa and a hint of lilac show on the nose of this bottling. The palate lands with density, carrying flavors of dried berry, dried herbs and mint.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of plum, fresh herb and green pepper are out front on the nose. The palate is light and elegant in structure, making it a solid choice for the dinner table.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This red is a solid example of the kind of powerful yet finessed Cabs Margaret River is so famed for. Peeking between the brambly fruit are dried mint, Christmas spice and chocolate characters, held together by taut fine tannins. The finish is long and minty and the structure sets this up for some time in the cellar. Drink now with protein or hold up until 2027.

name: Fiftyrow 2016 Alice Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Tightly tannic and robustly concentrated, this is a powerhouse red wine, dotted in black cherry, vanilla and toasted oak. Accents of dried herb and sage provide complementary spice and earth to the richness.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: A heady combo of ripe fruit and soapy oak lead the way on the nose of this powerful Cab. Amidst plush blackberry and cassis are notes of mint, olives and slightly charred, mocha barrel characters. Grippy leathery tannins prop up the velvety fruit, balancing this youthful, dense wine. Drink with a decanter and plenty of protein at hand.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Chapel Hill consistently produces solid, throw-back wines of restraint and balance. This vintage of Cab leads with muted brambly fruit, dusty oak spice, cocoa powder and soft vanilla and baking-spice notes. There's plenty of toasty savory oaky spice on the palate, along with discreet fruit and slightly coarse tannins. Drink now until around 2025.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: At five years of age, this Cab is aging rapidly, so drink up. There is, however, plenty of fruit and varietal character still left in the tank. A fading cherry color, it smells like blueberries, cherry cordial and cockail bitters, with some savory spices and furniture-polish notes. There's tart red fruit on the palate and a lovely spicy tannin structure, but an oaky bitterness flares up on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of black cherry, caramel sauce, dried herbs and crushed rocks lead into a palate shaped by strong yet relenting tannins. Flavors of oak and more dark cherry ride a silky mouthfeel.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Brooding aromas of plum, jam, coffee, tire rubber and spice lead to a ripe, fruit-forward palate. Abundant coffee notes linger on the finish. The warmth of the vintage shows, but there's still enjoyment to be had.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Ripe, polished and well balanced, this wine checks all the boxes. Opulent black-cherry, black-currant and oak-spice aromas lead to rich but not overripe fruit flavors, while a soft layer of fine-grained tannins forms a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: In Cape Mentelle's typically polished and tightly wound style, this classy Margaret River Cab opens with notes of cherry chocolate, baking spice, pipe tobacco, fennel seeds and fresh eucalyptus. Fruit on the palate is clean and tart, cinched by ultrafine and incredibly taut tannins. You can see where this wine is going, but right now it's virtually closed its doors. Give this the time it needs and reap the rewards. Drink 2021–2039 and likely beyond.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Dense blackberry and black-plum aromas are lifted by earthy wood and leather on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard. There is a strong black-plum tang at the front of the palate, then the chalky tannins take hold, delivering touches of cocoa and coffee into the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This appealing and full-bodied wine is filled to the brim with plump, generous black-fruit and baking-spice flavors that are well-concentrated and wrapped in a blanket of fine-grained tannins. A new offering from E. & J. Gallo, it has very good depth and length without being heavy.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Produced from selected parcels, this is a 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, rare in a region where blends predominate. It works well, with solid tannins and powerful black-currant fruits, The texture along with the wine's acidity will ensure its aging. Drink from 2022.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: All varietal, fruit for this wine comes from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Dark roasted coffee bean, cherry and dried herb aromas are out front. Creamy, rich fruit and barrel flavors follow. It's a Cabernet lover's Cabernet and has the stuffing to go the distance.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A vibrant cherry color, this wine delivers bright raspberry and cherry fruit alongside mint, tobacco leaf, pencil lead and fistfuls of wild green herbs. It plays between power and finesse on the palate, displaying a satiny texture that is fastened by a firm clasp of finely structured tannins. Drink now through 2029.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: A deep color and ripe aromas of black fruits and prune convey the friendly conditions of 2018. This Cab is saturated and full in volume. Blackberry, raisin, cassis and chocolate flavors finish warm and chocolaty. If you like your Cabernets ripe and rich, this is in that mold.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: There are immensely dense fruit aromas on the nose of this bottling, where cassis and lilac prove elegant and deep once they emerge from the structured backdrop. A crunchy blackberry flavor meets with violet on the palate, which is firm with tannins that start to relent by the finish. Drink 2021–2031.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: The black fruit aroma is reserved on the nose of this bottling, allowing violet, stone, loam and a hint of herbs to come to the forefront. The dry palate is cohesive in flavors of black cherry, purple flowers and soil, with a hint of black olive. The subtleties will benefit from cellaring. Drink 2021–2032.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling by John and Helen Falcone offers aromas of black cherry, roasted wood and savory cracked pepper. The palate combines black-cherry sauce with hickory-smoke flavors, wrapped in smooth polished tannins and a silky mouthfeel.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: The name for this wine refers to a gravelly loam soil formed in alluvial beds and often found on bench lands and side slopes. It shows tangy currant and black cherry, with herbal sage and anise around the edges. The tannins are still young and gripping. Enjoy 2021–2026.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is a textured and leathery red that offers spice, earth and robustly ripe fruit. Brick, tar, raspberry and currant flavors are seasoned in dried herb and tobacco, with firm tannins lending support.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft in texture and accented in smoky, toasted oak, this estate wine blends in 13% Merlot and 3% each of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. It offers lush layers of tangy black fruit, clove, sage and a touch of warmth.

name: Marietta Cellars 2016 Armé Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Full of dark fruit flavor and a dry core on the palate, this classically structured Cabernet has a taut mouthfeel, lifted acidity and moderate tannins. It will pair beautifully with big proteins now, but there's no great hurry to drink it. Best through 2025.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From the producer's own Mount George Vineyard this 100% varietal wine is sumptuous in blackberry, cherry and a forthright nose of clove. Dark and brooding, it offers depth and rounded texture, a richness on the midpalate that leads to earthy notes of dried herb, cedar and crushed rock.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Burly black fruit is complemented by bouquets of dried herb, spicy clove and a touch of heat in this classically styled wine, blended with 7% Petit Verdot and 4% Peite Sirah. With length and structure it finds a way to be fruity and elegant with just enough time in the bottle.

name: Hall 2015 Kathryn Hall Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's Mount Veeder vineyards, this wine is blended with 14% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. Thick and concentrated in red fruit and oak, it has a strong presence of oak and sage on the palate. The finish is lengthy in black pepper and integrated tannins.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Thick, herbal and earthy, this is a fantastic expression of the appellation. Firm tannins show structure and measured richness around thickets of black cherry, dark chocolate and earthy sage, finishing on a hint of black pepper.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Adorned with an impressive metal label, this end-of-night, break-out-the-cigars dessert bottling is pungent on the nose, with rich black-currant and the slightest prune aroma. It lands on the palate with a waxy mouthfeel, combining weighty richness and power. Sweeter flavors of caramelized black cherry are cut by mouthcleansing acidity.

name: Arietta 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft, rounded red fruit marks the juicy midpalate of this beautifully made wine that is appealing in its robust weight and power. With tamed tannins, it offers a mix of black cherry, dried herb, graphite and crushed rock around a length of supportive oak.

name: Four Lanterns 2017 Kharis Red (Paso Robles)
description: This big wine has a velvety texture and generous flavors of black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate. Wisps of baking spices coat the palate while ample fine-grained tannins firm up the mouthfeel. It spent 18 months in all-new French oak barrels.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a tremendous deal for the quality: a highly aromatic, structured wine, with a juicy backbone of black currant and dusty texture. Crushed rock and firm tannin provide a mineral-suggestive midpalate of tone and tension, with balanced acidity and brightness throughout.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Thick, concentrated and hugely structured, this wine from the famous site is robust in tannin and oak, with a core of tangy red fruit, both currant and cassis. It builds succulence on the palate as it opens, allowing for a generosity of spirit and fruit. Still, cellaring will benefit the wine; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: A complex combo of brambly blueberries, cassis, pencil lead, tobacco, game and eucalyptus carry the nose. These flavors flow through to the palate where the oak plays a fairly dominant role at the moment, along with a grip of dusty tannins and drying tannins. There's restraint, focus and structure—all elements to suggest a long and lovely life for this well made wine. Drink 2020–2029.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: With a spicy, vibrant entry of clove and cinnamon, this wine expands into a melded texture and bold flavors of cassis, currant and a bite of watermelon hard candy. Well made, integrated and firm in tannin and oak, it impresses from start to lengthy, spicy finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This wine is sourced from gravelly loam, a soil type the producer believes to be capable of achieving greatness in Cabernet Sauvignon. It is powerfully built in concentrated layers of sage, crushed rock, cedar and black fruit. The oak is integrated, leaving a trace of vanilla.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From the producer's estate Silverado Vineyard (the fourth to be planted in the appellation to Cabernet Sauvignon), this 100% varietal wine impresses in dusty, gravelly rock and earthy clove and sage. Focused and fresh in underlying acidity, it has classic structure and graceful red fruit within moderated, balanced power and grace.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Made in smaller amounts, this vintage—what's been made—is worth seeking. It's a lengthy, expansive expression of dusty rock, clove, cedar and herb. With tension and verve, it offers just a touch of mocha richness amid firm tannin structure and measured oak. Enjoy best 2022–2027.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A new offering from the producer, from the famous high-elevation site above the Sonoma Valley, this wine is robust in red fruit, cassis and earthy on the nose. Seamless in youthful tannin and dusty crushed rock-like minerality, it is an outstanding debut from a tough but tremendously rewarding vintage when in the right hands. This will do well with more time in the bottle; enjoy best from 2022–2027.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This small-production offering from the producer is intended to shed light on specific soil types. Suther is a gravelly loam typically found on ridgetops and side slopes of mountains. The wine exhibits spice, earth and rock, with a seamless texture and powerful weight. Grippy tannins and bold black fruit contribute to the brooding nature.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From a fantastic vintage, vineyard and winemaker, this small-production offering sings in cedar, pencil shavings and dried herb de Provence. Dusty mineral components ride beneath a core of black currant and olive, the tannin and oak profile measured and well-integrated, leaving ample room for classic elegance and structure to speak.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Bright in acidity and offering firm tannic structure, this lush wine is gracefully lengthy and powerful in weight. Red fruit, anise, fennel and sage provide a richness of flavor across the palate, with a depth of chocolate and blackberry jam that lingers on the finish.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: A deep, dark color and generous black-fruit aromas lead to well-extracted flavors of blackberry, blueberry and black currant on the palate, while a thick blanket of fine-grained tannins wraps it all in. It is huge in structure but matched by luxurious, layered fruit and spice flavors. Best 2023–2033.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: Boldly concentrated and intense on the palate, this reserve-level wine is powerfully built and reduced, its midpalate opening up to express a juicy core of blackberry and blueberry. From there it builds weight and richness, finishing in a flurry of dark chocolate and vanilla.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine shows a mix of power and austerity in its mélange of red and black fruits, sweet pipe tobacco, flowers, herbs and spices. Fine-grained tannins offer grip to the plush palate, lending focus and balance.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Lush on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of ripe red cherry, with cinnamon, pencil shavings and roasted herb touches. The palate is flavorful and full of body, showing roasted blackberries, ripe cherries, sweet herbs and a vanilla finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Expressive aromas of gun smoke, plum, black currant and green pepper lead to a full-flavored but still well-balanced palate, redolent with luscious black currant flavors, with the oak seeming pulled way back. It brings a sense of purity that delights, hitting well above its weight class.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas provide notes of flower, soil, herb and cassis. Firm tannins backed by bright acidity follow. It should shine at the dinner table. It's drinking young at present but has great stuffing. Enjoy after 2021, or decant.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Light aromas of spice box, nori, green herbs, licorice and black fruit are followed by plump, savory black fruit flavors. Pillowy soft tannins stand it up. It's a unique expression of the variety.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is robust in tannin and ripe fruit, with a savory core steeped in earth, tobacco and cedar. Rich notions of cherry and vanilla arise on the palate, with a lurking creaminess to the texture. This structured powerhouse should do well in the cellar; enjoy 2022–2026.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a high-toned, well-integrated and likable wine that's broadly expressive and expansive on the palate. It offers layered flavors of sweet tobacco, black raspberry and cherry, with supple tannins that add length and breadth.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: In spite of a lightness to the palate weight, this is no doubt a serious wine. It's complex and integrated, with intriguing aspects of leather, earth and truffle. Soft and supple, it shows flavors of clove, tart red raspberry and cassis, and is deliciously memorable in every way. Enjoy 2026–2036.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Thick in dark chocolate and leather, this is a lengthy, dry and grippy red wine, sourced from two sites in the appellation. Herbal in clove and cedar, it is 100% varietal, its oak supportive but not distracting.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: From the famous Merlot vineyard this is indeed inclusive of 6% Merlot (and 2% Petit Verdot), which adds a layer of softness and approachability. Thick robust black fruit and smoky oak highlight a lush supple texture and significant bite of concentration and power.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Violet red to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of fruits of the wood and mocha. It is palate pleasing from first sip through the bright and spicy finish, with substantial tannins and flavors of blackberry, black cherry, crème brûlée and anise.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Spicy and earthy in plum, black currant and blackberry, this is a soft, supple and rounded wine, in balance despite a hearty ripeness and bold texture of underlying tannic grip. It sources across the appellation to showcase an approachable, robust memorable experience of powerful concentration.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Concentrated black-cherry and black-currant flavors get great support from firm tannins and good acidity in this medium-bodied wine. It has good focus and concentration at relatively low ripeness, revealing layers of fruit and light oak nuances as it opens up.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Fruit from McClellan, Seven Hills, Dugger Creek and Anna Marie vineyards comprise this wine. Earth, anise, cedar, baking spice, fresh tobacco and cherry aromas lead to pulled-back, even-keeled fruit and barrel flavors. Vanilla notes linger on the finish. It shows a sense of subtlety.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This big but balanced wine has a wonderful black currant aroma, opulent spice and fruit flavors and a firm, moderately tannic texture. Focused on currant and black cherry on the palate, it shows mild oak accents of nutmeg and vanilla. It tastes pure and elegant, and should improve through at least 2025.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Made entirely in a varietal manner, this is a soft, structured and well-integrated wine, bursting in red and blue fruit, its power and weight in balance. Full bodied, it holds its concentration in soft pockets of rich complexity that impress.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This vintage of Chapel Hill's Parson Cab is another solid and varietally expressive drop that delivers bang for the buck. Medium in weight, it offers up a mélange of aromas and flavors: cherries, plums, black olives, thyme, dried leaves and warm earth, all balanced by soft-edged chalky tannins, sandy texture and a lift of acidity. Drink beside a char-grilled steak or a bowl of spaghetti Bolognese.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A fine companion to the winery's regular release, this opens with a burst of cherry fruit, highlighted with well-balanced herbs, olive and a touch of iron ore. It's substantial without being overdone in any way, and whatever new oak may have been used (if any) was done with a light hand. This belongs right up with the best southern Oregon Cabernets.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Plummy red fruit is softly layered around rich toasted notes of cinnamon and cedar in this 100% varietal wine. Well put together, it has a dense heartiness to it that shines in complexity and overdelivers on its price point.

name: Parallel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Present oak makes itself known in this darkly fruited, savory and earthy red, which is undeniably bold, brawny and lushly round. Full bodied, its complexity is quiet and supportive in the background, providing a backbone of acidity that helps to balance out the wine's inherent power.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Ripe berry fruit aromas with touches of raisin and chocolate hold up to scrutiny. Despite some tartaric sizzle, this feels lush and tastes quite delicious, especially given how tough 2016 was due to much rain. Plum, berry and lemony oak flavors finish with cocoa and vanilla along with a reprise of shrill acidity. Drink through 2025.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Made by Dave Phinney of Prisoner and Orin Swift fame, this is a well-made, full-bodied and deeply concentrated wine from the gracefully powerful appellation. Reduced oak gives in to spicy Mexican chocolate and a velvety texture of undeniable lushness piqued in bright acidity.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Plantings from the early 1970s and '80s make up this 100% varietal wine. Char, wet coffee grounds, dark chocolate, mushroom, cherry and herb aromas lead to full-bodied, sensuous fruit and barrel flavors, with the mouthfeel bringing much of the appeal. The barrel influence is primary at present. Best after 2024.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This wine is blended with 5% Malbec and aged in 50% new French oak for 22 months. It offers juicy black fruit and pillowy, expansive tannins that provide firm structure and weight. The acidity provides tension against the wine's fruit-forward nature, with an accent of clove in the background.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This impressive wine opens in a bouquet of violet and dried herb, with an intensity of tannin power at its back. Red and black currant, cranberry and clove combine in a seam of textured complexity and nuanced flavor. Enjoy 2026–2036.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This wine is 100% varietal. Aromas of dark roasted coffee, dried herb, exotic spice and plum lead to ripe, velvety fruit and barrel flavors with firm tannins backing it up. Dark chocolate notes linger on the finish. Yum. Best after 2025 with a long life beyond that.

name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2016 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal from the wild appellation—a study in brawny big oak and tannin with meaty aspects of gunpowder and toasted oak. The site reaches 1,500-feet elevation, with the grapes planted in volcanic soils. The result is lasting in currant, bay leaf and mineral stone.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Given time to age in bottle, this impresses in soft supple waves of sweet red fruit and vanilla, a rich and rounded expression that succeeds in its broad appeal. A touch of baking spice emanates from the toasted oak, making for a complete package of decadent lushness.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Herbal and expansive in soft red fruit, tannin and oak, this wine has a weighty middle strengthened by the addition of 6% Petit Verdot, which adds a floral lavender note. Succulent and rich, it offers a length of clove and tobacco on the finish.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Soft and silky with a backbone of lush velvety texture, this is an impressively delicious wine, tasting of blueberry mocha. With firm integrated tannins and restrained oak, it offers quiet power that persists in layers of flavor and complexity.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Cinnamon, plum and blueberry flavors mingle around a core of full-bodied layered richness in this mountain wine. Mildly structured, it has a roundness that appeals and persists.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This wine is a blend of Klipsun and Red Willow Cabernet with a kiss of Olsen Petit Verdot. There's no mistaking it was aged in expensive oak (21 months, 100% new French), with its aromas of spice, char and baking chocolate providing accent to cherry, herb and flower. The palate brings wound up tannins supporting plentiful fruit flavors. It will have a long, long life in the cellar. Best after 2025.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Smooth red fruit is girded by powerful tension in this mountain wine, integrated in tannin despite its mountain heritage. Black raspberry and black currant are complemented by dustings of mocha and lavender. The wine is complex and hearty, with 5% Petit Verdot.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Fruit for this wine comes from Seven Hills, Pepper Bridge and Figgins Estate vineyard. Dried and fresh herb, gun smoke, plum and barrel spice aromas lead to full, textured, drawn out fruit flavors that show great length. Slightly chalky, very tightly wound tannins back it up. Best after 2024.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine is 100% varietal, with all of the fruit coming from Obelisco and Klipsun vineyards. The aromas aren't ready to reveal themselves at present. Dark cherry, black raspberry, spice, dark coffee and licorice notes lead to dark, dense fruit flavors, with a lively sense of acidity framing it all. It's a fascinating wine, more about subtlety than strength. It should have a long life in front of it. Best after 2025.

name: Inglenook 2015 Rubicon Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is an intriguingly feral, herbal and classically styled wine, dripping in sage, toasted oak and wrap-around tannin. Cranberry, clove and cassis form a tangle of nuanced, graceful flavor nestled within a core of impressive structure. This is one to put away for awhile; enjoy best 2026 through 2036.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Complexity, spiciness and luxurious chocolaty flavors give this full-bodied and well-oaked wine a lot to savor. It has a broad mouthfeel, moderate tannins and good balance, too.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Black raspberry succulence meets pretty aromatics in this soft, velvety and approachable 100% varietal wine. Toasted wood and a density of tense structure give it complexity underneath the core of fruit.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is the winery's most broadly available wine, capturing the diversity of the valley across its many appellations. Sanguine in exotic red fruit and a fleshy meaty current of stony mineral, it's fleshy and full bodied, with a lushness that lingers.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is 100% varietal and impressive in its balance of smooth, well-integrated texture and biting acidity. Chalky crayon, plum and cherry flavors make for a robust, succulent midpalate that's nuanced in toasted oak and vanilla.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of ripe black cherry and cigar box are followed by well-balanced fruit and barrel flavors. It displays a sneaky sense of acid and tannins structure that keeps the interest high.

name: Kenzo Estate 2016 Rindo Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a special bottling for the producer, but it is still within its elegant style of balanced ripeness, opening in bright bursts of cassis and currant. From grapes grown at 1,300-feet in elevation, it begs for more time to resolve its intensity of unresolved tannins, the accents awash in cedar and dried herb. Enjoy 2024–2029.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Complex, fruity but also herbaceous, this full-bodied wine is well structured, nicely ripe in flavor and has a good grippy texture. Bay leaf, black cherry and mint in the aromas are followed by concentrated black-currant flavors that have very good depth and length.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine in currant, cassis and soft spicy herbal notes, this is a majority varietal wine, with a touch of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Hearty in full-bodied ripeness, it holds its power well, showing a thick tannin structure that supports the balance of fruit.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Soft, smooth and fully expressive in red cherry and currant, this is a nicely made wine that's integrated in oak and tannin and ready to enjoy now. It has an undercurrent of dusty texture that gives it a mineral-like edge.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a soft, lush and creamy wine from the beloved appellation, richly textured and brimming in red cherry and cassis. Mocha and vanilla arise from the well-integrated oak, with teases of cedar and tobacco gliding along the lengthy finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a dense, austere wine, but it's one that seems reflective of varietal and place, namely the terra rossa soils of Coonawarra. The nose packs in raisiny red fruit, chocolate, milky coffee and earthy herbs, while the palate comes with muscular, drying tannins, tangy fruit, stony minerality and herbal nuances. There's a structure and balance here that suggests this wine could age for another decade, but for the price, it'll likely be drunk now, so have high protein dishes at the ready.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Bright red fruit is dominant and juicy in this broadly appealing wine, blended with 9% Petit Verdot. Structured and strong in oak, it has a leathery, savory quality to both the fruit and the texture, finishing in dried herb.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Fresh herb, dark coffee, plum, graphite, green herb and vanilla aromas lead to ripe, hedonistic, but nicely balanced fruit flavors. A grip of tannins backs it up.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-weight wine expresses lots of varietal character. Cab lovers will dig the savory, herbal, pencil lead and vanilla tones that weave into red fruit and florals. Sandy textured tannins hold the fruit, warm stone and earthy flavors together, and things finish on an herbal touch. The oak rears its head a little on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A little dusty and austere at the start, it takes some swirling in the glass to eke out other aromas like black currants, raspberries, dried herbs, cola and briny black olives. The palate is more giving, though, with silky, tangy fruit and spice padded in savory tannins. There's a fair lick of oak here, but in the end the fruit wins out. Drink now–2027.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine smells like a bowl of fruit, with notes of raspberry and cherry with accents of yogurt and herb. Soft, elegant fruit flavors follow. Those looking for a big, bold Cabernet should look elsewhere. This one is all about elegance and grace.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tremendously impressive wine from the producer's high-elevation estate situated at 2,400 feet. Rich tones of vanilla bean, cassis and raspberry liqueur open the door to a soft, integrated midpalate that is complex and lengthy.

name: Realm Cellars 2016 The Bard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine from the Oak Knoll District is inviting in blackberry and huckleberry fruit, while the dark oak is supportive and complementary. There's a layering of baking spice that lingers on the full-bodied texture and density of the wine, which has intriguing side notes of gunpowder and violet.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a bold, plummy and rounded wine from a well-farmed site in the heart of the appellation. Full bodied and robustly built, it shows a brightness of acidity that balances out its more powerful tendencies.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Earthy berry aromas are deep and solid enough to be convincing. A plump palate with drying tannins features quality spiced berry and plum flavors that should seem familiar to most Cabernet drinkers. This is fleshy in feel and spicy on the finish. Drink through 2025.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Bright in fresh layers of cherry and cassis, this wine is smooth, fragrant in violet, dark in color and with powerful concentration. Touches of baking spice, vanilla and oak give it additional flavor and richness. There's 10% Petit Verdot in the mix.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is an elegantly understated red from the region, flavorful in candied plum, raspberry and a welcoming dusty note. Clove, cedar and dried herb contribute savory components that make for a complex balance of personality on the light-bodied palate, lifted by lilted red fruit.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This robust wine was given 27 months in 100% new French oak and is built for aging. Structured and dense in tannin, and blended with 3% Malbec, it shows a wealth of big juicy black fruit, coconut, toasted oak and elongated tannins. Enjoy best from 2025 through 2030.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Klipsun (52%) and Red Mountain Vineyard (26%) fruit make up the backbone of this wine. Fresh and dried savory herb aromas are at the fore, followed by notes of pencil lead, spice, bay leaf, chocolate and black fruit. Rich, ripe, layered fruit flavors follow, backed by brawny tannins and a long finish. A highly structured wine, it needs some time to stretch its legs, but it has the stuffing to go the distance. Best after 2025, with a very long life beyond that.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: The aromas are locked up at first, displaying notes of earth, dark cherry and spice. Dense, focused, structured fruit flavors follow. One of the wines of the vintage. Don't go near this one until at least 2024. It will have a long life in the cellar beyond that.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a reserve wine worthy of its designation, blended with small amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Soft layers of red currant and cassis highlight a full-bodied palate of integrated tannin and oak, offering plenty of length and expanse as dots of clove and cedar form.

name: Quilceda Creek 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: From this historic Coombsville site comes this earthy, graphite-ridden red, which is herbal within a core of baked red fruit dripping in grippy structure. It has a breadth of expansive full-bodied richness that holds its fruit in check within an herbal, Old World embrace of tight-grained tannin and expansive power. Enjoy this concentrated wine best from 2026 through 2036.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Aromas of pencil shavings, cedar and violet show brightly in this vineyard-designate wine. The palate is robustly concentrated and fleshy, its tannins firm and well integrated. Mocha, plum and blueberry define the fruit components that shine alongside plenty of underlying acidity.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine offers juicy red fruit on the nose, with background layers of mocha and vanilla. The palate offers a velvety concentration of berry fruits that are supported by a rich, strucutred profile.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 3% Petit Verdot, this dark-garnet wine bursts with aromas of herb, clove, tobacco and cedar. Aged entirely in new French oak for two years, it shows a decadent, sumptuous texture built by soft, integrated tannins around a core of dark chocolate and cassis.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Light aromas of assorted fresh herbs, sugared plum and leaf lead to slightly sweet, lightly smoky flavors, with a mesquite-filled finish.

name: Inglenook 2016 Rubicon Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: From the esteemed producer's gorgeous estate, including 3% Merlot, this is impressive and structured—a leathery, viscous and concentrated expression of a great site in an intense vintage. Gunpowder, oak and black-cherry compote form around brightly captured acidity and a lasting fistful of baking spice that lingers and softens the finish.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Predominantly sourced from the Discovery and Champoux Vineyards, this wine offers aromas of scorched earth, cassis, cherry, bay leaf and whiffs of green pepper. There's an exquisite sense of balance, intensity, density and granularity to the palate, with chocolaty flavors on the finish. It has a long life in front of it. Best from 2025–2030.

name: Larkmead 2016 Dr. Olmo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made by consulting winemaker Martha McClellan, this is a dark, brooding mountain wine, brawny in leather, baked cherry and raspberry. Secondary components of meat and oak are embraced in soft expansive tannins that contribute lush creamy texture and cohesion. It has an enduring element of spicy savory pepper, baking spice and tobacco that endure on the palate. Enjoy 2025–2035.

name: Finca Flichman 2018 Roble Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Soupy aromas of tomato leaf and compost are not fresh or inviting. This feels tomatoey, with sharp acidity. Green, weedy flavors of currant and red plum hold no sway.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Stalky, herbaceous aromas of eucalyptus and juniper are a loud and clear warning of what's coming, and that would be a tightly wound palate with green tannins. Herbaceous, strangely oaky flavors are not persuasive.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Aromas of smoke, mesquite, herbs and blue fruit lead to moderately smoky flavors. Chocolate and coffee notes linger on the finish.

name: Otazu 2009 Altar Cabernet Sauvignon (Pago de Otazu)
description: Concentrated and thick aromas of black currant are very tangy and cut by damp woody cedar tones. The palate is very tangy and thick with grape seed, blackberry and oaky vanilla flavors.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Black cherry to the eye, this wine offers a nose of fruits of the wood. There is a nice balance of bright fruit and silky tannins, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, white chocolate and baking spice that wind down to a vanilla-laced finish.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas are reticent, with notes of plum, almond skin, coffee, dried cherry, vanilla and dark chocolate. Plum and flavors, focused in the middle follow, tapering toward the edges follow. The concentration seems quite light initially, fleshing out a bit over time. Lightly grainy tannins wrap it all together. Best after 2023.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 13% Syrah, this is substantial red wine, perfumed in violet, with deep, dark flavors of dark cherry, vanilla and toasted oak. Supple and soft, it finishes in a savory tease of cedar and turned earth.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a gamy, brooding and darkly colored wine, offered at a nice price. Juicy, rounded and rich, it shows balance and complementary flavors of toasted oak, sage and blackberry.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This provides good value and a velvety smooth expression of the variety that should satisfy fans of a bigger style. Big-boned in tannin and oak, it settles into itself to show dense jammy flavors of black cherry, currant and chocolate.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Coming from Block 11 of this vineyard that was originally planted in 1988, aromas of vanilla extract, chocolate, dark cherry, cassis and medicine lead to silky fruit and barrel flavors with chalky tannins. The oak seems out front at present.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of plum, dried herbs, moist earth and cocoa are followed by smooth, soft, palate-coating blue and black fruit flavors. Fine grained tannins back it up. There's a lot to like.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas offer a medley of raspberry, vanilla, black cherry cordial, green herb and barrel spice notes. Quite ripe fruit flavors follow, dipping in the middle. It doesn't seem to have the structure to support all of the ripe fruit.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This dark violet-red wine features aromas of cassis and juniper berry. It has flavors of black currant, cherry, fennel and a hint of smoke, with vivid acidity that stands up to burly tannins. Although the long finish is marked with notes of citrus zest, tannins linger on the palate.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Beguiling aromas of dried herbs, graphite, scorched earth, plum and spice are followed by plump, well-balanced, ripe fruit flavors. It brings a lot of appeal.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Fresh aromas of blackberry meet with toasty oak, peppercorn and a hint of green herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate's core of black currant and black-plum fruit are lifted by woody spice and framed by medium acidity and tannins.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Bright fruit flavors of cassis and cherry dominate in this full-bodied wine. Its tannins are on the silky, velvety end of the spectrum, with underlying grip and structure for balance.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Thick, textured and richly dense, this well-priced red is broad in its appeal, with a length of cassis, red currant and toasted oak. The approach is moderate and in balance, with light teases of baking spice.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Ripe in flavor and big but soothing in mouthfeel, this full-bodied wine coats the palate with jammy blackberry, wood smoke and cocoa flavors. A rich texture, mild tannins and concentrated fruit components come together nicely.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: With 5% Merlot, this hearty ripe wine spent two years in French oak and another year aging in bottle. Soft, rich and round, it has a dense core of blueberry pie and chocolate flavor that's supremely decadent.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Impenetrable in color, this Cabernet, from the renowned Gimblett Gravels soils of Hawke's Bay in the North Island, shows an iodine quality amidst stewed raspberries, currants, tangy sumac and earthy cumin spice. As it opens with swirling in glass, the sweet oak aromas makes their way to the fore. The palate shows quite a lot of extraction and oak, with grainy, grippy tannins and a long herbaceous finish. For a 2013, it shows little sign of mellowing any time soon.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This bottling shows accessible aromas of black cherry, toasty oak, grilled teriyaki meat and a hint of purple flowers. The palate brings blackberry and smoked meat flavors framed by tannins that rise up toward the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A big structure and powerful oak and black-fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine a lot of presence. Aromas of cedar, tobacco and black cherry are followed by punchy berry and cassis flavors wrapped in firm tannins. Best after 2022.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of black olive, foresty dampness and herbaceous black fruits tell you that this isn't overly ripe. That take is confirmed on the palate, which is hard and sappy. Flavors of herbal blackberry, juniper berry and coffee finish minty and with a note of eucalyptus.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of wood spice, tire rubber and cherry lead to ripe fruit flavors that paint around the edges. The tannins give a firm squeeze. A coffee-filled finish follows.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Damp wood, leather, mushrooms and slightly sour blackberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The fruit flavors of blackberry and plum are quite ripe on the palate, and lifted by cedar touches.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: The aromas offer notes of green herbs, smoke, dark chocolate, cherry and orange rind. Medium-bodied flavors follow, with the concentration light initially before broadening. There's plenty to hang the hat on.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Blended with Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this is oaky and robust in broad black fruit and a powerful midpalate of dried herb. It finishes thin.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Berry fruit and hand soap aromas are standard fare. This feels choppy and high in acid, while forced oak is a big part of a flavor profile that includes berry and plum fruits. A tight and rubbery finish is smacking and tastes oaky.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of vanilla extract and anise along with cherry and plum. Somewhat dried out seeming dark fruit and cranberry flavors follow, with abundant barrel accents throughout.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Boysenberry and red-fruit aromas mix with anise on the fruity nose of this bottling. The palate is very fruity, with flavors of blueberry gum and fennel frond.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is planky in oak and thick in substance, the tannins adding weight and grip. The flavors commingle plum with clove and black pepper.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: On the lighter side for Cabernet, this wine shows lively fruit and herb aromas and fresh flavors that are well matched by medium body and very little tannin.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Light aromas of matchstick, plum and burnt caramel lead to soft, elegant, lightly sweet plump fruit flavors. The concentration is light, but it shows pleasing balance for a wine at this price.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This medium-bodied wine offers straightforward fruitiness and accents of dried herbs on a rather light texture with soft tannins.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This is a showy wine that exudes strong buttery oaky aromas, medium-intensity cassis and light herb flavors. It is medium to full bodied, smooth and almost soft in texture.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This deep blackberry-colored wine has a nose of cassis and espresso. Rugged tannins support flavors of black currant, raspberry, dark chocolate and eucalyptus. The lingering finish is marked with strong minty notes. Mevushal.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Subdued aromas of cassis, vanilla, herbs and dark chocolate lead to fruit and barrel flavors that paint around the edges, seeming to be missing in the middle. Grainy tannins back it up. The concentration appears light, and the barrel influence overweighted.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Faint black currant, green herb and vanilla aromas lead to lighter-styled black fruit flavors. A sweet finish follows.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Soft, plush tannins surround a creamy texture of baked plum, cinnamon and cedar, the wine Old World in dried herb and sage components. Full bodied, it showcases the variety from the producer's long-owned estate.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: In this 100% varietal, aromas of raspberry and blackberry jam are at the fore, followed by notes of baking spices and anise. Plum, quite ripe, sweet black fruit flavors follow. Chocolate notes linger on the finish. It pushes the extreme edges of ripeness. Drink now.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Deeply concentrated aromas of blackberry sauce are hit with a minty streak and strong cedar tones on the nose of this wine from a Malibu-based producer. The palate is very ripe and extracted with tangy black-currant flavors and strong acidity.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Subdued aromas of green pepper, herbs, cherry and a touch of mesquite lead to sweet, elegant fruit flavors. The concentration is light but what is there goes straight down the fairway.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Rubbery blackberry aromas come with milk chocolate and dusty earth notes. In the mouth, this is tight, raw and tough. Black fruit flavors are lightly herbal and touched up by oaky char and chocolate.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: With aromas of raspberry, clove and vanilla, this wine offers flavors of strawberry, cranberry and chocolate. It is soft in the mouth, with smooth tannins and a note of lemon zest on the finish.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Tire rubber, coffee and sliced red apple aromas lead to quite ripe, sweet fruit flavors, with plentiful barrel accents. Vanilla notes linger on the finish. It doesn't all come together at present, with the extraction dialed up. Boozy flavors follow. The tannins bring some grit.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Perfumed and thick in tannin, this is an intensely aromatic and layered wine, showing highlights of clove, tobacco and clove. The fruit is nuanced and quiet, a mix of currant and cranberry.

name: Fleury Estate 2014 Lauren Bryce Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Meaty and brimming in smoky oak, this is a boldly ripe and richly crafted red wine, with just 1% Cabernet Franc in the mix. The tannin grip is significant and substantial.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This red-violet-colored wine has a nose of black cherry, raspberry and lavender. Powerful tannins support flavors of blackberry, dark plum, espresso and smoked meat. It may be a touch too tart for some palates, especially toward the cranberry-laced finish.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Sanguine in spirit, this is a thick rich wine blended with 10% Petit Verdot and a half percent of Malbec. Blueberry and currant highlight a palate of chalky tannin and toasted oak.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Part savory in soy, cedar and crayon wax and part robust in black plum and berry, this wine is substantial in tannins most of all, which taste burly and beyond generous in the glass.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Quiet green pepper, sugared plum, red apple and cherry notes lead to soft, sweet, dark fruit flavors that display a light styling. It's a pleasant, easy-drinking example of the variety.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine offers aromas of dark plum and flint. Vigorous tannins offer a framework for flavors of raspberry, cherry, vanilla and mint. The mint can come on a little too strong for some palates, but it recedes nicely into a cool herbal finish. Mevushal.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Perfumed and thick in structure, this is a widely appealing wine bursting in jammy blueberry and dark cherry that finishes robust in oak.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Raspberry and blackberry jam and plum seed aromas lead to full-bodied black fruit flavors. Firm tannins back it up. The fruit seems overripe, with the warmth of the vintage showing.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Soft rich red fruit expresses itself along an integrated throughway of tannin and oak. This being a 100% varietal wine, it was given less time in new French oak than some of the producer's vineyard designates. Leather and dried herb combine to accent the finish.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Unusual aromas of raspberry jam, green pepper, leafy green herbs and creamsicle lead to soft, light fruit flavors that trail toward the finish. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It doesn't quite seem to have fully ripened and could use more structure to stand it up.

name: Grassini 2016 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Substantial tannins and a powerful presence of toasted oak give this wine a heady full-bodied personality, complemented in red fruit, crayon and rich dark chocolate.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Aromas of cassis, baking spice and star anise lead the nose on this light-hearted Cabernet Sauvignon. The easygoing palate offers black currant, vanilla and white pepper alongside round tannins.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This wine is nicely priced, offering baking-spice and smoky oak around a simple core of structure and firm tannin. The flavors are in balance and the wine ultimately easy to enjoy, with an understated elegance that should appeal.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine features a bouquet of just-picked cherries and nutmeg. Flavors of cherry cola, raspberry and fennel bulb are set into sturdy tannins that drop off into a zippy pomegranate finish.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows crisp aromas of cranberry, fresh herbs and crushed graphite on the nose. The palate is a tad ripe, with candied cherry and pomegranate-syrup flavors, all lifted by mint and rising tannins on the finish.
