name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Smoky oak and meat contrast against jammy black fruit and chocolate in this reserve-tier wine, aged 19 months in French oak, the majority new. A small percentage of Syrah adds to the meaty backbone of overt flavor.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: There is an earthy core of turned loam on the nose of this bottling alongside fresh red cherries. The tannins are a bit hard on the palate, where roasted berry and damp herb flavors ride a lingering acidity.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This wine offers major bang for the buck, a soft nuanced layering of smooth juicy cassis and plum wrapped in leather and oak. Expansive and structured, it has freshness without fuss.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine has aromas of blackberry and anisette. It is spicy at first, with flavors of clove, anise, vanilla and coffee bean, but strong cherry and violet also fill the mouth. Tenacious tannins and rich spice make for a long-lasting finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Deep garnet in the glass, this wine has a nose of black cherry and flint. It is bright on entry, with flavors of cherry, cherry cola, roasted meat and a touch of mint. Vigorous tannins take hold of the palate and hang on into a lively, high-acid finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: With a nose of mixed berry pie and a tiny hint of green pepper, this wine offers flavors of black cherry, strawberry, dark chocolate and clove. Rugged tannins are equally matched by bracing acidity, and the finish is noted for a splash of cranberry.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a soft, supple and spicy wine, brimming in black pepper and smoked meat. Expansive and broadly textured, it has underlying grip and youthful tannin, with lasting flavors of black cherry and lavender.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is blended with 14% Cabernet Franc, 7% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot, the whole given 20 months in a combination of French and Hungarian oak. It shows bright floral aromatics and bold flavors of blueberry, cinnamon and clove. The texture is soft and well integrated, with a light finish.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: With 5% Cabernet Franc, this red is dotted in dried herb and sage, the tannins pillowy on the palate. A dusty rocky mineral component leads the way along a robust core of integrated concentration and dark flavors of blackberry and black currant.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Candied red fruit defines the core of this 100% varietal wine, with accents of cedar, sage and dried herb. Buzzy acidity keeps it fresh against a wall of robust ripeness and chalky tannins.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This substantial wine of considerable weight and tension has a thick entry from a grippy savory personality. Earthy dried herb, sage and currant define it, a nod to its mountain provenance. There is 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot in the wine.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Aromas of cassis and dark chocolate are the opening act for flavors of raspberry, black currant, cocoa and orange zest. This well-balanced wine offers muscular tannins and vibrant acidity with touches of brightness on the coffee bean finish.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is the first release of this premium red from the 2013 vintage, considered one of the best in Hawke's Bay. Even with some bottle age, this inky-hued wine is still massive. The nose is a rich combo of ripe blackberry and cassis, coffee, a mélange of herbs like thyme and bay leaf, cracked pepper and plenty of vanillin oak. The palate is tightly gripped by drying hulking tannins and the fruit is plush and extracted. Nevertheless, there is poise amidst all the power, just don't expect to touch it for awhile. Drink 2024–2039.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This is an Old World wine in style—classic and muted in cedar and herb. Dry tannins form a foundation for deft flavors of currant, tomato leaf and a bright streak of acidity. The finish has a lasting strength of grippy tannin.

name: Parallel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dust and gravel components provide a mineral aspect to this mountain-grown wine, a study in classic elements of cedar and dried herb. The midpalate is richer and denser in chocolate-covered red cherry and strawberry, with an underlying lushness. It's undoubtedly decadent in style.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This 100% single-vineyard varietal wine is powerfully concentrated, with a huge mouthfeel from the beginning. It evolves to show elements of leather, dry tannin and dark currant, with a tenacity to its structure. Enjoy best from 2022–2025.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Appealing aromas of dark roasted coffee, café au lait, plum and barrel spice lead to elegant fruit flavors that display a charming sense of freshness. It's a pretty expression of the variety, with a lovely sense of balance.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: Expansive and weighty, this powerful wine has a soft and supple tannin structure and full-bodied ripeness, with highlights of blueberry, currant and dark cherry. Secondary notes of vanilla and dark chocolate emphasize its enduring richness.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: An elegant nose of thick black cherry, blueberry, smashed violets and grape seed show on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are very polished on the palate at first but grow denser as the flavors of cocoa, caramel and black cherry arise. Drink 2020–2032.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Down-the-middle aromas of blackberry pie, sweet cedar and fresh rose buds show on the nose of this bottling from a newer brand. The palate combines those same fruit and wood flavors with more complex hints of green herbs and tobacco, finishing with a wash of acidity.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Thick in oak and tannin, this wine has grip and tension that underlie a foundation of savory cedar, currant, clove and tobacco. This will do well over time; enjoy 2022–2026.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Smoky oak and firm, grippy tannins rise to the front of the palate in this reserve-tier wine. It is 100% varietal and sourced from multiple vineyards. Thick black fruit is complemented by cedar and dried herb atop a velvety smooth texture.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Thick and concentrated, this wine is burly in black fruit and a lingering ripeness that takes on a generous lushness and mouthfeel.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: The aromas bring notes of dried black currant, baking spices, mushroom and dried herbs. Ripe, full, slightly dried out seeming fruit flavors follow, finishing warm. The tannins seem a bit aggressive at present and the fruit somewhat desiccated.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rustic aromas of red fruit, smoke and dusty earth show on the nose. There are fresher fruit flavors of strawberry and even cranberry on the palate, where wood spices take over and lead into a graham cracker finish.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of leafy herbs, kirsch, black cherry jam and spice lead to quite ripe fruit flavors. It's a strange mixture of overripe and underripe elements, wanting a bit more structure to support the ripe fruit.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This attention-getting wine boasts very ripe, grapey, dried-fruit flavors and a broad full mouthfeel with very fine-grained tannins that are not at all harsh. The flavors are ample and the texture soft.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: High-register aromas of vanilla, baking spices, herbs, cedar and coffee lead to full-bodied, extracted dark fruit flavors. Grainy tannins back it up. It finishes warm.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Soft, round and jammy in raspberry, this wine also offers sage and compost—an underlying earthiness that complements its more decadent tones marked additionally in chocolate mocha.

name: Beringer 2016 Chabot Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Blended with 6% Cabernet Franc, this is a soft seamless wine that is creamy in texture and tannin. Pencil shavings and dried herb complement a richness of black cherry and dark chocolate.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: The new releases from Newman's Own have stepped up in quality. Flavors of black cherry, maple and chocolate come with a hint of sweetness in this very polished, fruity, and approachable wine.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: A bouquet of red fruit leads the way to a juicy midpalate of structured richness and oak, the latter well integrated and supportive. Balanced ripeness allows the cherry, cassis and cocoa powder to impress in brightness.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: This is a flavorful, enjoyable and drinkable wine. Abundant black-cherry and blackberry-jam aromas lead to ripe black-fruit flavors and a fairly broad texture that has just a touch of tannin.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an attractively priced wine, well made and richly woven in strawberry and cassis. Smooth rounded edges of integrated tannin and oak punctuate a touch of grip on the powerful, full-bodied finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine offers a good value, opening in bay leaf and eucalyptus that is brightly interwoven with burly oak and textured tannin. Cherry and cassis flavors give it a fruity lift before the finish's powerful heat.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Baking spice, dark chocolate, red apple and dried cherry and cranberry aromas are out front. The palate brings full-bodied fruit flavors, with the tannins bringing a lightly astringent feel.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Tart elderberry and red- and black-plum aromas show strongly on the juicy nose of this bottling, along with hints of lilac and lavender. The palate is very fruity, with smashed raspberry and red-currant flavors, while bright acid and light tannins prove pleasant if simple.

name: Walnut Crest 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)
description: Opaque in color, this dense, herbaceous wine starts with a nose of plush currants, graphite, dried tarragon and an assortment of other dried herbs along with a good lick of slightly synthetic-feeling oak. While the alcohol doesn't appear overly high, there's a warm bitter feeling to the palate, where a thick coat of drying tannins nearly overwhelms the ripe fruit. Give this time to settle and then give it a lengthy decant. Drink 2022–2039.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Pleasing aromas of dried herbs, barrel spice and cherry lead to ripe but somewhat subdued fruit flavors where the concentration seems pulled back. The tannins give a firm squeeze. It's a pretty expression of the variety. Best after 2022.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Meant to be enjoyable earlier than the winery's signature mountain Cabernet, this is blended with 10% Merlot and 10% Malbec. It also includes fruit from off of the estate. Black-fruit forward, it has a balanced approach to oak and power, with a roundness to the palate.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Sanguine in style, this is earthy and tart in red currant, blueberry and a richness of graham cracker, the minerality a mix of iron and earth. The tannins are substantial yet pillowy, making the palate soft and rich.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of freshly brewed black coffee and caramel are out front. Plum, anise, green herb and cherry jam notes are behind them. A full-throttled palate follows, with burly tannins backing it all up. It needs significant time in the cellar for the tannins to (hopefully?) unwind.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Peppercorns, roasted pasilla chile and asphalt aromas meet with bright red fruit on the nose of this bottling, which is a great Cab for a summer day. The pyrazine-laden palate is fresh with more chile flavors that give depth to the underlying strawberry character.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Initially locked up aromas of dried thyme and other assorted herbs open to reveal notes of pitch black cherry, coffee and barrel spice. The palate is quite ripe but manages to maintain balance through the sweet pit fruit flavors.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is 100% varietal, sourced from a mix of hillside and valley-floor sites. Chocolate mocha, sweet cherry and dusty rock accent a lush decadent expression of robust full-bodied ripeness and concentration.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is ripe and powerfully concentrated, with grippy intensity. Perfumed notes of clove, nutmeg and tobacco follow through on the thick palate to highlight leather and smoked meat.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This single-vineyard wine is 100% varietal and hails from a 141-acre hillside site. It's lush and smooth with a velvety texture defined in blueberry toast, baked plum and dark chocolate. It offers plenty of robust body weight and powerful tannin.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Plummy and brimming in dark cherry, this wine from the famous mountain site also broods in dark chocolate, a richness that persists and pleases the palate. Rounded, soft and rich, it has a spicy, earthy undercurrent that complements.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Bright red fruit finds tension in a bold layering of tannin and full-bodied concentration within this dark, brooding wine. Blackberry, cocoa dust and flint wrap around herbal components of turned earth, flint and sage, finishing in a punch of toasted oak.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is earthy in truffle and turned earth aromas, with an expansive layering on the palate of rich red fruit. Bright acidity and integrated tannins meld with the robust ripeness and rounded edges.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Barrel spice, baking spice, vanilla, herb, coffee and cherry aromas lead to ripe, rich, full-bodied fruit flavors. This one is all about hedonism and the warmth of the vintage, delivering both.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas offer notes of dried and fresh herbs, vanilla, tobacco, coffee and cherry. Plump, rich, ripe black fruit flavors follow, with enough structure to stand them up. Warm vintage yumminess.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of mixed berry preserves and geranium leaf prepare the palate for flavors of fruits of the wood, dark chocolate, tobacco leaf and orange zest. Strong fruit flavors and acidity compensate for strong tannins. The long, satisfying finish is marked by a final touch of brightness.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hugely concentrated and powerfully built wine, chewy in tannin and oak. The fruit is overtaken by dark-chocolate and tobacco notes, richly voluptuous in texture and lasting ripeness.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of bell pepper, underbrush and dark-skinned berry. The savory palate evokes black currant, star anise and vanilla alongside velvety tannins.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This full-bodied wine is polished and well balanced, but quite concentrated too. It delivers black cherry and black-currant flavors on an almost creamy texture. Plenty of fine-grained tannins add good structure and the finish is lingering.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This young vineyard is quickly making a name for itself. Wines like this show why. Coffee ground, black raspberry, cedar, herb and spice aromas lead to full-bodied, rich, layered black fruit flavors that persist on the finish. It's a warm vintage wine that pulls no punches but still keeps its power in check.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Made from the oldest vines in the producer's vineyard estate, where concentrated berries result, this is an herbal, grippy and indeed intensely taut tension-filled wine. Chocolate, fig and cherry liqueur mingle on the complex palate of nuanced richness and lingering earthiness.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Lively aromas of boysenberry juice, mint, pine wood and a hint of chocolate make for a very inviting nose on this bottling. There are plenty of minty herbal flavors on the palate, where blackberry jam and pepper spice are backed up by sticky tannins.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine is well made and satisfying, opening in a bright sanguine nose of iron and leather. The midpalate is lengthy and graceful, offering a succulence of cassis and black cherry.

name: Parallel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is tremendously structured and youthful in tannin and oak. The grapes come from the producer's 26-acre estate, which was first planted by Andre Tchelistcheff, a friend of the original founder. (Sullivan is currently owned by Juan Pablo Torres Padilla's private investment group VITE USA.) The wine is made by Jeff Cole and shows smoky black fruit and elements of crushed rock. Age and enjoy best 2025–2030.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Enchanting aromas of huckleberry, parsley, dried herbs, black currant and dried flower lead to full-feeling plum, orange peel and herb flavors. Lightly grainy tannins provide support, and coffee flavors finish it off. It shows a lovely sense of balance, with its best days in front of it—a big time winner for the price.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Robust in dark cherry-cordial flavor and a taste of sage, this is a powerfully concentrated and boldly ripe wine, 100% varietal and from the famous site. Tannins are dusty and substantial, providing structure within the thick concentration.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This 100% varietal wine is made from grapes grown on two sites of the appellation, including the Silenus Estate. Opening in baked bread, brioche and cedar, it continues to develop expressions of dried herb, fig and cocoa powder in the glass between a good tension of acidity and integration.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This comes from one of the state's top vineyards. Plum, vanilla and coffee aromas are out front, and soft, sumptuous, palate-coating fruit flavors follow. A lingering finish caps it off. Beautiful stuff.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Dried herbs, cherry jam, graphite and spice lead to ripe, full, fleshy fruit flavors that linger. It comes off as quite ripe but has a pleasing yum factor and a fine sense of acidity. Best after 2026.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a unique fennel-like spice that pervades many Temecula Valley wines, and veteran Phil Baily uses it to his advantage in this bottling. Aromas of roasted strawberry, anise, bay leaf, roasted plum and soy lead into a palate full of blackberry paste, marjoram and peppercorns. There are hints of the Indian spice ajwain as well.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This is Old World in style, subdued and elegantly layered in dark cherry and plum. Structured and soft in its youth, it contains 5% Petit Verdot and finishes in a nuanced reminder of toasted oak and vanilla.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is the first vintage of this wine to be designated as a Cabernet Sauvignon, it is blended with the 18% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Dried leaf, cherry cordial, herb, raspberry jam and spice aromas are at the fore. The palate brings a sense of elegance, restraint and structure. Coffee notes linger on the finish. Those looking for a big and bold Cabernet should look elsewhere. This one is all about subtlety. Some time in the cellar will serve it well. Best after 2024, with a long life beyond that.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This wine has an inviting floral nose that leads to an expressive generosity of blueberry and cinnamon spice. Lengthy and robustly built, it has mineral earthiness along the lines of the region's famous dust, a stony quality that remains memorable on the palate.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Deep black cherry in color, this wine has a nose of black plum, roasted red pepper and violet. It is sophisticated on the palate, with robust tannins and flavors of dark berries, coffee, mocha and anise. Fruit takes a back seat on the finish, which highlights notes of spice and chocolate.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Softly layered and richly round, this is an appealing wine blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Concentrated and complex, it winds together the sweetness of vanilla and cherry with spicy elements of clove, tobacco and sage.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Aromas of smoked black plums, dried earth and purple flowers make for a roasted nose on this reserve bottling. There is a pleasing snap of blackberry fruit on the palate, where toasty oak and caramel tones drive through the delicately bodied wine.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine, which spent 16 months in 57% new oak, shows deep aromas of black plum, cassis and prominent oak seasoning. The mouthfeel is fairly thick and full of black cherry, black currant and coffee foam, with acid that washes through on the finish.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of sandalwood, anise, vanilla, barrel spice, cocoa, herbs and black cherry. Deft, balanced dark fruit, herb and coffee flavors follow, with fruit and barrel intertwining and playing well off each other. It shows a pleasing sense of density yet lightness, with enough tannic heft to go the distance. The barrel influence plays a prominent role but plays it well.

name: Daou 2016 Soul of a Lion Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: The grapes for this wine are sourced from the steep slopes of the producer's own Pritchard Hill spot at 1,425 feet. Juicy black cherry and wild berry yield to rich vanilla and oak, with ample grip and tension that lend structure. It's simply delicious, voluptuous and lush yet complex.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Grippy and earthy in savory black fruit, this appellation wine is strong and powerful in tannin and structure, with a smooth, underlying velvety texture that rounds out its full-bodied edges.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Winemaker: David Finlayson. There's a warmth on the nose of this slightly liquorous wine, with warm brambly berry sauce and vanilla-soaked baked berries aligned to warm cherries and earthy spice. The palate is bold and firm, with seriously gripping tannins that yield a tight, firm texture and hang on long through the close. The fruit is skin-driven and reminiscent of black plum and cassis, with a lingering astringency and some black tea bitterness through the close. Young, big and brawny, this needs time to mellow, so enjoy after 2025.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Winemaker: Morné Vrey. There's a richness right upfront on the nose of this ripe red wine. It leads with aromas of sweet red berries, raspberry, caramel sauce and warm, buttered strawberries. Touches of earthy character, like blackcurrant leaf and green herbs, keep it from going over the edge in lush richness. The palate is light and smooth, with velvety tannins and more plush red-berry and -fruit flavors that carry through to the round close.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Winemaker: Miles Mossop. This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon starts off closed and shy, but slowly, with time, reveals itself to be more like a butterfly that is beginning to emerge from its cocoon. With another decade to two of life ahead of it, it currently offers tight, spicy blackberry, plum and mulberry on the nose, with tons of earthy herbs and cedary spice acting as framework. It's medium-plus in weight, yet boldly structured and fruited, with more intensity and fruit concentration on the palate than the nose suggests. Gripping tannins lend a firm mouthfeel, with lingering notes of toasted oak, pepper and blackberry bramble on the close. Hold until 2025 and enjoy through 2033.

name: Seven Hills 2016 Klipsun Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is quite tannic and somewhat astringent, the blend consisting of 25% Merlot. Aged 18 months in French oak, half of it new, the oak accentuates and underlines the strong tannin.

name: Rodney Strong 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Mild in spice and quiet black fruit, this wine includes 7% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot. Priced at a good value, it is made in a simple, approachable style.

name: Tamber Bey 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Chocolate and brown sugar make for a thick and overtly rich and oaky experience in this small-production wine. Its tannins are overtly pronounced.

name: Merriam 2014 Gloeckner Turner Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: Tangy and somewhat astringent in tannin, this wine is thick in black fruit, brown sugar and toasted oak.

name: Fox in the Hen House 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: Heavy oak-based aromas of clove and vanilla don't allow for much natural fruit to make an impression. A thick creamy resiny palate is full of oak grain and tannins, while this tastes of raw wood, clove, toast, mocha and chai tea. Overall, this is about 90% forced oak and 10% natural: take it or leave it.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A faint nose of red currant, tilled earth and peppercorn carries to the light-bodied palate. This is soft in feel and framed by delicate tannins and easygoing acidity.

name: Maryhill 2016 Clifton Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)
description: Black cherry, tar and funky game aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate recalls damp campfire wood, sour oregano and roasted cherries.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Wet campfire, dried mints and black raspberry show on the nose of this earthy bottling. The palate is very ripe and fairly sweet with red fruits and cut with pinches of tarragon.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Very fruity and grapey in aroma, this medium-bodied wine adds strong vanilla, marshmallow and toast in the flavors. It comes off as a pop wine due to those obvious oak elements and a hint of sweetness.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Straightforward black-fruit aromas are slightly minty and grassy. On the palate, this is tight and high in acidity. Salty berry and black-plum flavors finish short and pointy, and never does this NV Cabernet fully draw you in.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Crumbled rose petals, grilled beef, oak smoke and pinched herbs show on the nose of this bottling, which also offers a graphite minerality. The palate is concentrated with tangy black-cherry, smoked meat and oregano flavors.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Plummy in up-front fruit, this wine has a thickness of tannin and oak that gives it an expansive, weighty quality on the medium-bodied palate.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Light red-cherry, baked pastry and oregano aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's lively on the palate with nearly effervescent acidity, offering blackberry, mint and forest-floor flavors, framed by clingy tannins.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This well-sourced red is sweetly rounded and rich in tobacco, cedar and sage, with secondary notes of dark cherry and dried herb. Robust and powerfully built, it has rounded tannins and nicely integrated oak.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine is big but complex, showing earthy tobacco-like aromas, ripe but dense blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a velvety blanket of fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, not overripe and displays some of the classic black olive and pepper aspects of Cabernet that are compelling. Best from 2023.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This lovely wine shows exceptional quality and complexity within a bold, expansive package of thick, grippy tannin and layered flavors of blackberry, tobacco and smoked meat. It is blended with 7% Merlot, 3% Petit Verdot and 2% each of Malbec and Petit Verdot.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This new producer has the proper bona fides, employing sought-after consulting winemaker Thomas Rivers Brown to make the wine from a site on the eastern edge of the appellation. Juicy in dark cherry it offers a soft structure dotted in cocoa dust, baked plum, cedar and pencil—a rich, full-bodied style complemented by classic savory notes.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Dusty sage and tobacco highlight a rich, balanced and complex expression of the variety, in this case 100% and from one property. Thick, rich and tightly wound, it has underlying brightness and minerality that complement its sizable posture.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Herbal and grippy in tannin, this is a complex, thickly concentrated wine, not shy in oak or power. The full-bodied intensity opens into an expanse of cherry cordial and spicy vanilla. This should do well in the cellar, so enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Serious and full bodied, this complex wine is made from organic grapes. It wafts aromas of mint, toasted oak and baking spices and delivers layers of black and red fruits, cedar and vanilla on the palate. It has moderate tannins and a mouthfiling texture. Best after 2023.

name: Four Lanterns 2017 Kharis Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark in the glass, this bottling offers deep black-cherry aromas along with chipped graphite, wet slate and espresso bean. The palate combines violet, coffee-bean and black-fruit flavors into a cohesive, elegant and deliciously lush experience.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a savory and mineral-driven style of Cab, starting with aromas of crushed graphite, roasted pasilla chile, black olive, damp soil and cassis. The palate is layered with oregano and marjoram flavors that give depth to the black-currant and roasted beef flavors.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is a firmly textured, concentrated and muscular wine from Beckstoffer's Lake County property that will need time to open. Currently, tightly wound black cherry, cranberry and blueberry notes are reined in by integrated but chewy tannins, while rich, luxurious chocolate and cherry flavors emerge on the palate and grow on the finish. Best from 2023.

name: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: From the Ulysses Vineyard in Oakville, and blended with small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this wine impresses in earthy sage, clove, cedar and tobacco. Old World in style, it has appealing aspects of crushed rock and structured tannin, with just a hint of dark chocolate and currant. Best 2025–2030.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Juicy black fruit presents as robustly full bodied and layered in this powerful wine, which is both supple and strong, with length and good integration of tannins and oak. A lingering note of smoked meat adds complexity and savory intrigue.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This high-powered wine is saturated with aromatic, spicy and complex oak shadings that integrate nicely with the very ripe berry and dried fruit flavors. It has almost the same mouthcoating density of a Port along with a hint of sweetness on the lingering finish. It's bold, entertaining and satisfying.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This classically styled wine has pretty opening aromas of black currant, cherry and berry, with a slight tease of vanilla and dark chocolate. High toned and supple on the palate, the tannins are well integrated and structured, with a good tension of acidity. Best 2020–2025.

name: Yao Family Wines 2015 Yao Ming Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the great Oakville estate is this spicy jammy red brimming in robust tannin and oak. A sweetness of cherry cordial, raspberry cream and vanilla make it richly rewarding on the textured, concentrated palate, with a lasting note of earthy gunpowder at the finish.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This wine is soft and supple, with strong flavors of blueberry and mocha. Lush, rich and creamy on the palate, it has broad appeal and understated complexity.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Made entirely from estate-grown organically farmed grapes, including 14% Cabernet Franc and 10% Petit Verdot, this is a dense expression of brambly blackberry, strawberry and darker notions of tobacco and toasted oak. It has a beautiful bouquet of earthy tobacco and iron, powerful yet structured and dazzling in spice and dried herb. Enjoy 2026–2030.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine shows its mountain provenance in meaty, grippy and gritty tannins and a broad expansive weight on the palate. But beneath its brawn is beauty and a rounded lushness of delicious drinkability, a mix of brambly blackberry, cherry, cassis and crushed rock. Let it sit in the glass over time or consider cellaring. Enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2016 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of crushed plum, cedar, cigar box, spice and fresh herbs lead to ripe, jammy, tightly wound fruit and herb flavors supported by tannins that need significant time to settle in. It's an intriguing offering of the variety, equal parts promise and delivery. Give it until at least 2025.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Entirely varietal, this is a boldly flavored, structured and complex mountain-grown wine, tense and brimming in tannin. The juicy core of cherry, cassis and currant complements the darker, more brooding elements of tobacco, clove and herb. This should do well over time; enjoy best from 2026–2031.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Thick tannins wrap around juicy jammy flavors of blueberry and black cherry in this concentrated and savory, earthy wine. Additional aspects of dried herb, tobacco and a touch of vanilla round out the full-bodied experience.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Cherry, blackberry, crushed rocks and oak decorate the nose of this bottling. The flavors begin brightly, with blackberry and a rocky minerality, then grow more toward sour black plum and dank herbs. The tannins are sticky by the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec. Spicy leather and sweet tobacco combine around bright red fruit and supple tannin. It offers a balanced approach to richness and concentration.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This young release Cabernet from an up-and-coming region of the valley offers appealing aromas of blue plum, baking spices and dried herbs. It's loaded with full-feeling blueberry and cherry flavors that hit the gong hard. A firm sense of tannin and acid structure backs it up. It delivers a lot of quality and value.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lovely mint and cedar aromas draw attention, while rich oaky, chocolaty flavors flood the palate with ripeness. Full body, moderate tannins and a sense of completeness and generosity make the wine especially attractive.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is made entirely from mountain fruit along the eastern hills of the Napa Valley, including the producer's estate. It is blended with 12% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec. Smoky oak, clove and tobacco accent red fruit and a savory bottom line of cedar and sage. It's rich but well behaved.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: One of the things so fascinating about the Rocks District is how soil trumps variety. This wine could come from no other place. The aromas intrigue, with notes of ember, black olive brine, dried tobacco and herbs. The palate brings fresh, abundant, pillowy savory flavors, with plenty of green pepper accents. A mouthwatering finish caps it off.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Blended with 3% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot, this opens on a perfumed nose of sage, lavender and rose petal. Persistent tones of clove and baking spice complement the brooding blackberry and sanguine notes.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dark violet to the eyes, this wine proffers a bouquet of dark plums, cassis and vanilla. It has flavors of blackberry, cherry pie, fennel and white chocolate, with vivid acidity that holds its own against substantial tannins. There is a touch of smoke on the finish that disappears in a burst of cranberry brightness.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: While it was aged in 60% new oak barrels, it's the pure and concentrated black-cherry flavors that give this full-bodied wine a practically irresistible allure from the first aromatic whiff to the fruit-soaked palate impression. Firmly tannic, it's not too stiff and will make a great pairing with any number of meaty, cheesy dishes.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Robust in spice and oak, this 100% varietal wine is well structured and full of earthy intensity. Black cherry, cassis and an earthy undercurrent of gravel and rock give it complexity. Enjoy 2021–2026.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from the producer's Chiles Valley estate, organically farmed, and blended with 25% Merlot. A bright, perfumed nose of rose and sage leads to a soft, cohesive and well-integrated midpalate of dark cherry, raspberry and hints of vanilla and herb. It shows great length and breadth.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Dark ruby in the glass, this wine has a nose of black plum and earth. There is a pleasing mélange of fruit and savory flavors, with cassis, blackberry, anise and smoked meat backed by rigid tannins. The bright finish is laced with notes of Seville orange.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This enticing wine has a spicy sexy swirl of oak in the aroma and broad saturated fruit and dark-chocolate flavors that flood the palate with ripeness and linger on the finish. It's very full bodied but stays smooth in texture.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a reserve-level wine, aged in 80% new French oak for 27 months. Intense on the nose in coconut and nutmeg, it offers robust chalky tannins and a strong powerful core of concentrated cassis, sage and cocoa powder. It should do well in the cellar for a time; enjoy best 2025–2030.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine is made with organically farmed grapes from the property's steepest terrain, a tribute to the winery's founder, Volker. Powerfully built, it's thick, herbal and oaky, layered in juicy red fruit, sage, cocoa dust and crushed rock. The mineral aspects are profound. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is a powerful, richly woven wine, substantially earthy and savory in spirit. Elements of cedar, pencil shavings, sage and tobacco characterize an expansive and weighty mouthfeel of explosive tannin and robust oak.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows prominent fruit-forward aromas of blackberry jam and oak, proving quite familiar and rich. Once sipped, the wine fills the mouth with texture and flavor, combining the dark fruit tones with baking-spice and woody notes, and finishing on vanilla.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Intensely flavored in blackberry and cherry, this is a grippy full-bodied wine, with underlying acidity that freshens its bolder tendencies impressively. Lavender, black licorice and dried herb add to the complexity and layering of character.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This wine is sourced from the producer's Hillside Estate and Borderline Vineyards two miles south of the winery. It offers toasted oak, leather, clove and cinnamon—a savory profile that's deceptively fresh in underlying acidity. Dark plum and black cherry flavors are lushly textured and spicy on the palate.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: High-toned in tart waves of red currant and cassis, this 100% varietal wine is concentrated and herbal, with strong tannin structure and approachable complexity.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blackberry jam, oaky wood and a hint of balsamic vinegar show on the nose of this bottling. Similar flavors arise on the palate, namely blackberry balsamic sauce and a touch of oak.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Soft violet and boysenberry aromas consume the nose of this affordably priced bottling. There is decent tension to the palate, where blackberry-pie and vanilla flavors lean toward sweetness.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: An unapologetic oakiness shapes the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. Grilled bread, sweet pickles and cedar in the aroma lead to juicy cherry flavors that are held firmly in check by oak notes and a touch of astringency.

name: Grassini 2016 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Black cherry, cassis and a thread of sanguine earthiness mark this full-bodied wine, leathery in tannin and texture. It has a rounded approachability and simplicity to the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: There's a mix of bright red cherry, smoke, herbs and gravel on the nose of this bottling from organic grapes. The palate is pleasant if simple, with baked cherry, vanilla and plenty of baking spice.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Smoky oaky aromas and flavors take center stage in this full-bodied, moderately tannic and fairly concentrated wine. Good but subdued blackberry and black-cherry notes come out with time.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of raspberry jam, medicine and herby bramble are followed by red fruit flavors that are lighter in the middle, fuller around the edges. Coffee and black tea notes linger on the finish. The fruit seems desiccated.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Dionysus fruit makes up the heart of this wine. The aromas don't sit quite squarely, which is a shame, as the dark fruit flavors on the palate are lovely.

name: Grassini 2016 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Brooding aromas of herbs, black licorice, vanilla and dark fruit are at the fore. It is full in weight, with somewhat tacky-feeling dark fruit flavors on the palate. The tannins give a dry grip. Decant if drinking in the near term.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Cherries, cedar and damp forest wood show on the nose of this bottling. It's both fruity and tangy on the sip with more cherry and wood spice, proving quite fruity and oaky.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Unusual aromas of black olive brine, nori and cherry lead to cranberry flavors that paint around the edges. It's interesting but needs more structure and midpalate density to stand it up.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of macerated cherry, anise and herb. Slightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors follow.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Modest plum and prune aromas are the most identifiable parts of a closed nose. In the mouth, rocky tannins spread from side to side and take no prisoners. Dark but generic plum and berry flavors finish with heat and grab. Drink this rough customer through 2025.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Heavy char and smoke in the aromas and flavors almost take over this full-bodied wine in spite of some pretty concentrated blackberry and black-plum notes underneath. It's moderately tannic and feels very firm in texture.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of coffee bean and chocolate are followed by notes of herb, orange peel and citrus on the nose. On the lighter side of medium-bodied, berry fruit flavors follow on the palate, finishing with a firm handshake of tannins that soften with time open. Citrus notes linger on the finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a very fruit-led Cabernet, by Margaret Rivers standards. It oozes ripe plums and red berries, trailed by whispers of violet, pepper and dried herbs. A fiercely clenched fist of chewy tannins are made more prominent by slightly clunky oak.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Juicy up front, this is a seriously structured and robust wine, brimming in bold flavors of tar, tobacco and cedar. With 7% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot, it offers concentrated intensity and lush texture.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Distracting aromas of mesquite smoke and char are followed by notes of cherry and herb. Sleek but plentiful plum and smoke flavors follow. The tannins give a light grip.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Barrel notes of vanilla extract, nougat and freshly hewn wood are at the fore, with the fruit struggling to get to the surface. The palate mixes fruit and barrel, with a soft, supple feel. There are good things going on, but the wood gets in the way.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Aromas of dried black cherry, mortared herbs, blackberry and spice lead to slightly smoky, extremely tightly wound fruit and barrel flavors with a medicinal finish. The dots don't all seem to connect.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a well-made, fairly priced red, dusty in herbal sage and earthy tobacco. Broad tannins give it wide appeal and balanced concentration, finishing in clove and dark-chocolate notes.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of metal, whole green pepper, flower and cassis lead to plump, ripe plum and berry flavors. It's a straightforward, very varietal Cabernet quaffer, with the oak dialed way back.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Candied red-currant aromas are given a strongly minty touch on the nose of this bottling. The minty character works better on the palate, where it combines with strawberry and red plum, leading into a pine-needle finish.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is a full 13 years old on release. Aromas of dried cherry, spice and leather lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors. It seems to be fading, but there is still a lot to like.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Standard Cabernet aromas of dark plum and berry fruits set up a clamping palate, with grating tannins. Smoky dark-plum and blackberry flavors finish rough and tough, with mild heat and unresolved tannins that grate and grind. Time in the bottle will only help this along; drink through 2028.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Baked red-cherry-pie aromas meet with a touch of soil and wet rocks on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent grip to the palate, where blackberry and oak flavors lead into a palate of vanilla pastry.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: There's a wild, rustic and hardscrabble quality to this bottling, like many from this hot, hilly region, starting with aromas of blackberries, tar and forest floor. The palate is reductive with hints of tar and turned earth, but there are also more accessible flavors of blackberry paste and sour cherry. Sticky tannins frame the sip.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of apple, wet hay, dried cherry, Band-Aid and medicine cabinet lead to plump but dried-out-seeming fruit flavors. It all doesn't work. Medicinal notes linger on the finish.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Aromas of licorice, bittersweet chocolate, black cherry and herb lead to full-bodied, sweet, jammy fruit flavors surrounded by dense, tightly wound, dry tannins. A warm finish follows.

name: Timark 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a broad, brawny red wine with 4% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. Full bodied, ripe and rich in baked plum, cinnamon and vanilla, it finishes in leathery black pepper.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are full and fruity but common. A grabby palate with hard tannins is jagged more than smooth flowing, while earthy plum and prune flavors culminate on a drawing finish anchored by hard rubbery tannins. Drink through 2028.

name: J. Bookwalter 2016 Chapter 9 Conner-Lee Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Soft, rich and round in dark cherry, brown sugar and vanilla-tinged oak, this is a wine made by Joe Wagner in a popular, likable style, full bodied and deeply concentrated.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Thick and tannic in full-bodied concentration, this wine overdelivers on its price point, offering well-defined and richly rewarding flavors of dark cherry and cassis. Oak, clove and pencil shavings provide complex counterparts to the fruit.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Burnt oak and dry barrel aromas dominate a nose with baked berry-fruit scents. A stout palate is dense and full, while this offers a burnt-oak lead flavor balanced by peppery spice notes, dark berry accents and toast. A spicy, peppery character lingers across a lively finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Equally massive fruit and oak-barrel flavors compete for supremacy in this bold and firmly tannic wine. It shows ripe black-cherry and blackberry flavors that mingle with smoke, toast, cedar and vanilla notes.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This small-batch minimal-intervention wine comes from a single vineyard in eastern Margaret River. It starts reductively. Those barnyard aromas do blow off with time in glass, although an earthy funk is part of what defines this Cab, along with an intriguing combo of tangy plums, cherries, mint, fennel, wild herbs and spice. The palate is more focused, walking a line between juicy fruit and powerful, chalky tannins.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied, trim and fully organic wine shows the classic black-cherry aromas of the varietal, followed by rather lean fruit flavors and a firm, lightly tannic texture. It's not a huge wine, but it is nicely balanced and appetizing.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Aromas of dark strawberry and red plum meet with mint and turned loam on the nose. Savory herbs provide a counterpoint to the rich flavors of pomegranate syrup and mulberry on the palate, with chalky tannins framing it all.

name: Ad Vivum 2015 Sleeping Lady Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Earthy and robust, this wine has intensity in spades. Full bodied, it is concentrated in Christmas spice and baked plum, with a sweetness to the oak. The tannins are big and structured, adding a chalky quality to the texture.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Blackberry and cola aromas meet with gravel and turned soil on the minerally driven nose of this bottling. The palate is also full of intriguing earth, with stiffer tannins framing the soil and blackberry flavors.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are big but unfocused on their way to a fleshy, plump and fruity palate. Blackberry, dark-plum and spice flavors settle on a full chocolaty finish. This Cab is bold and full; drink through 2026.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This vintage of Margaret River Cab begins a touch reductive, amplifying the vegetal and stalky characters and making the fruit feel a little dense. The fruit is there, though, in the form of red currants backed by ground white pepper, pencil lead and plenty of oak spice. The palate is rich and concentrated, lacking a little freshness, relatively speaking. Oak flares up a little too. Nevertheless, this shows varietal character and the region's spice and graphite nuances right to the end.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: The nose of this single-vineyard expression combines wet stone and dusty oregano with fresh hints of red fruit and boysenberry on the nose. There is an herbal array on the palate of oregano and marjoram, which lift the red-currant fruit and ride light, easy tannins.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas are pretty, with notes of raspberry jam, herb, plum, black tea and cherry candy. Scrumptious, light, acid-driven fruit flavors follow, with firm tannins backing it up. Coffee notes linger on the finish. Give it time to come together.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Spicy berry and plum aromas come with notes of green herbs, mint, bell pepper and sauciness. Firm acidity on the palate is poking and prodding, while this Calchaquí Cabernet tastes of herbal blackberry, coffee and chocolate. On the finish, this is fresh and lively, with manageable tannins.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This vintage is still very young and tightly wound. It starts a little reductive, with some rubbery oniony notes. But underneath lie aromas of ripe red currant, peppery spice, anise and dried herbal notes. Fruit on the palate feels ripe and concentrated and the oak is a little flashy here, but tannins are savory and sandy textured. Overall, this is a solid, medium- to full-bodied Cab that needs another few years in bottle. Drink 2021 through 2027.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Ripe berry and raisiny aromas smell a lot like spice cake. In the mouth, this Cabernet is blocky and heavy, with gummy tannins. Blackberry and chocolaty spice flavors are appealing, while this settles on blackened spice and prune on a stout finish.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Roasted berry aromas are rubbery and suggest fresh asphalt. On the palate, this is hard, choppy and bumpy but fresh and forward. Spicy plum and berry flavors finish short due to edgy tannins. Drink this hard-nosed Cabernet through 2027.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas of prune and blackberry lead to a padded palate that's thick and slightly soupy. Blackberry, prune, bacon and graphite flavors remain ripe and full on a chewy, dense finish that's long and chocolaty.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Generous, jammy aromas and fully ripe berry flavors give this full-bodied wine an easy-peasy charm. It's soft and mouthfilling in texture, light on tannins and not weighed down by too much oakiness.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a Port-style fortified wine. Though labeled simply “dessert,” it's based on Cabernet Sauvignon. Strong and tannic, it nonetheless captures the flavor and style of young Port, and keeps its 60 g/L residual sugar in check with a big burst of tart pie cherries and a dash of chocolate.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Scratchy intensity sets the tone for a nose with prune, plum and berry aromas. On the palate, this Cabernet feels compact and driven by tomatoey acidity. Saucy, savory tomato, plum, black-pepper and green-herb flavors hold onto a savory identity across a steady finish.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This winery is known for its boldly tannic wines, and this offering is no different. Dark cherry, cedar, blackberry, dried herb and spice aromas lead to rich, ripe, sweet, black fruit flavors. The tannins give a firm squeeze. Best after 2023.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: The aromas offer notes of orange peel, smoke and fresh herbs. Lightly styled, well-balanced blue fruit and citrus flavors follow.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Savory saucy black-fruit aromas are a touch briny, but overall the nose on this young Cabernet is solid. A full lively palate passes the balance test, while this tastes of blackberry, cassis and chocolate. A packed finish confirms that this has plenty going for it.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of herb, cherry and blackberry lead to supremely tannic, highly structured fruit flavors. Almost unapproachable now, this wine needs significant time to stretch its legs, but it has the stuffing to go the distance. Best after 2025. Give it at least a 24-hour decant if drinking in the near term.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dense with a thread of underlying acidity, this reserve-tier wine offers bold flavors of blackberry, black cherry, dust and cocoa powder. Lush and concentrated in full-bodied intensity, it has aromatic complexity and a lasting hint of savory cedar and clove.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made, well-priced wine, classic in elements of pencil shaving, dried herb, clove and cedar. Generous oak and tannin provide structure and weight within a balanced approach to ripeness, with lasting impressions of coffee and black currant on the finish.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Coming from vines with at least 30 years of age, the aromas are perfumed with notes of macerated cherry, fresh flowers, black licorice, thyme, green herbs and black fruit. Full-bodied, action-packed fruit and herb flavors follow, with enough acidity and tannin structure to go the distance and a sense of freshness that ups the interest.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Dense and concentrated aromas of blackberry, purple flowers and cola spice show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted black plum, rose petals, wild thyme and dark chocolate combine on the complex palate.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: How times flies. In the 25th iteration of this wine, aromas of sweet barrel spice, vanilla, the blackest of cherries, herb and scorched earth lead to creamy, well-balanced fruit and barrel flavors, with vanilla extract and cocoa notes on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Plummy aromas meet with sunbaked soil and lots of earthy herbs on the nose of this bottling. Grippy tannins and buoyant acidity frame the palate, where strawberry, red plum and baking spice flavors lead into an oaky finish.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From a low-yield year, this is a spicy, herbal and tension-filled wine has good build and breadth, with brooding elements of black cherry, blackberry and dark chocolate. The tannin and oak are well integrated, with youthful grip and concentration.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Dark jammy black-fruit aromas suggest raisin and prune. In the mouth, this is choppy and full of life. Ripe berry and chocolate flavors are generous and finish chewy, dense and chocolaty, with drawing but ripe tannins.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Fresh herb, green pepper and roasted coffee bean aromas are out front. Ripe black fruit and herb flavors follow. Coffee notes linger on the finish. It's a rich, hedonistic, high octane example of the variety.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A fruity nose is complemented in clove spice and tobacco in this full-bodied wine, which has a soft rounded richness that's complex and in balance.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Despite already having some bottle age, this is a young powerful Margaret River Cabernet swimming in seas of currant and blackberry fruit, graphite, dried spice and vanillin oak, with a little meatiness in the background. The mouthfeel is rich and filling but there's enough acidity to buoy it and it's tightly wound by muscular sinewy tannins. Drink from 2022 at the earliest but it will cellar for at least a decade beyond that.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: From the team at Clairault, this is a spicy and slightly austere but unmistakably Margaret River Cab. It charges out of the gate with red currants, cherries, cracked pepper, tobacco leaves, stalks, graphite and tar, with some toasty oak influence. The palate is even spicier. It's tight and focused, with fine chalky herb-flecked tannins and mineral streaks. Lean and focused, it's still young and would best be drunk from 2020–2029.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: The ripe and rich fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine are shaded by light oak spices and shaped by soft tannins. It is mouthfilling in texture, coating the palate with opulent black-cherry and dried cherry flavors.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: With a sizable tannin structure and powerful concentration, this is a mountain wine, no doubt, with dusty sage and dried herb secondary to dense dark chocolate, blackberry and currant. The palate grips and demands more time to mellow. Enjoy best from 2025–2030.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: High-register aromas of fresh and dried herbs, green pepper, plum, pencil lead and black cherry lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. (Very) far from a big bruiser, it shows a pleasing sense of elegance and a mouthwatering quality seldom seen on this variety. It will sing at the dinner table.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A black color and saturated aromas of blackberry, raisin, green herbs and hot pavement set up a full palate that's choppy and tightly built. Baked, lightly woody berry flavors finish with jammy weight on a ripe rough finish. Drink through 2022.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: One sniff of this little beauty and you'll be transported to Margaret River's pristine shores, the Indian Ocean lapping at your feet and towering eucalyptus trees swaying above your head. Your nostrils will sense wild blueberry, strawberry, white-pepper spice, crushed violets, scrubby seaside bushes and dusty warm earth. The mouthfeel is medium in weight, tightly gripped by herbal tannins and a juicy fruity lift on the finish. This producer's more premium Cabs may be more polished, but Filius is just plain joyful to drink.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This exuberant wine is packed with expressive fruit aromas and irresistible flavors that range from cherry to black plum and blackberry. No noticeable oak gets in the way of the wine's fruit flavors. Medium body, good balance and gentle tannins make it easy to sip.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: A dense black color and power-packed aromas of blackberry, earthy plum, mint and herbs open this wide-bodied Cabernet. Herbal plum and berry flavors are stocky, while this is solid as a boulder on the finish, with an overriding sense of ripeness and heft.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This 100% varietal has aromas of tomato leaf, heaping amounts of black licorice, pencil shavings and celery stalk that lead to full-bodied, supple black fruit flavors. It comes off as riper in style than the norm for the winery but still brings appeal, with a soft, silky feel.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: The aromas bring notes of macerated cherry, exotic spice, dusty earth, dried herb, vanilla, mushroom and dried black currant. Dense blue and black fruit flavors follow, with a firm lick of tannins backing it up.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is the inaugural release of this winery's LTL—Larger Than Life—wine. The aromas are closed up out of the gate, with brooding notes of black cherry, blackberry, cranberry and spice. Sweet, ripe flavors follow that paint around the edges, with firm, slightly dry tannins providing support. Some additional time in the bottle should serve it well.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of green herb, coffee ground, black fruit and clove lead to dark fruit flavors backed by slightly gritty-seeming tannins. Chocolate notes linger on the finish. There are good things here, but they don't all seem in harmony at present, with the barrel influence showing prominently.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Burly tannins meet big oak and powerful lengths of dust, clove and tobacco in this intensely structured and flavorful red, 100% varietal and grown on the producer's estate vineyard. Aged 18 months in entirely French oak, 60% of it new, it imparts a toasted woody flavor.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Rooty, saucy berry aromas are earthy and gamy, with a pleasing natural quality. Punchy and rubbing tannins and acidity roughen the palate, while flavors of red plum, red bell pepper and chocolate end with pace and depth.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of cherry, cedar, dried herb, vanilla, scorched earth and flower lead to somewhat compact seeming fruit flavors that bring a sense of delicacy, fleshing out with time open. Leafy notes linger on the finish. It has pleasing, mouthwatering acidity and bunchy tannins that augur well for its longevity. It's not ready to reveal its charms right now.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Reedy, rooty aromas of currant are dry and spicy. This Cabernet is narrow and linear, but also fresh in style. Cherry, tea and chocolate flavors are reedy like the nose, while a sense of heat rises on a wiry one-dimensional finish.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Tart and reductive aromas of dried berries show on the nose of this bottling, which needs time to open up. There are elegant purple fruits that pop on the palate, but the tarry aspect carries into the finish.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Brawny toasted oak and smoke ride along a thick rich frame of black fruit and leather in this tannic full-bodied wine.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Bright aromas of fresh herb, orange rind and orange twist lead to flavors that show more of the same, with the palate bringing a lovely sense of texture. There's enjoyment to be had, though it's impossible to identify as Cabernet.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Damp, earthy berry aromas come with a note of orange peel. On the palate, this is aggressive at first, then it goes heavy and syrupy. Black cherry and berry flavors are not distinguished, while this is drilling on a finish with cherry Lifesaver notes. Tasted twice; this note is based on the better of two samples.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Char and oak introduce the nose and palate to this broad, likable and approachable red, brimming in black cherry and blackberry. There's a touch of dried herb and sage on the finish.

name: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Cherry jam, fig and vanilla oak rise to the top of this full-bodied wine's palate, which presents as overtly sweet and syrupy.

name: Seven Hills 2016 Klipsun Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: This is a green, herbaceous and distractingly earthy wine that doesn't taste good.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers remarkable value for the quality—a stellar commingling of cranberry, cassis and black cherry. With a robust mouthfeel of plump juicy fruit, gun smoke and firm tannin, it shows integrated oak flavors and plenty of underlying acidity to remain fresh in the glass.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Woody cedar, tobacco and peppercorn line the road to a brawny and substantial experience of full-bodied concentration in this reserve-worthy red that offers value for the price. Firm, expansive tannins wrap around black currant and black cherry as a thick finish awaits. Enjoy from 2026–2031.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: The aromas bring immediate appeal, with notes of dried herb, barrel spice and black fruit. Rich but well-balanced fruit flavors follow along with a lengthy finish. It has a nice yum factor. Some time in the cellar will be rewarded. Best after 2023, with a long life in front of it.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This opens with classic Cab aromas of cassis, wild raspberry and plum, though the bouquet veers more juicy, vibrant and overall red in character than black. The medium-weight palate is plush and velvety in texture, with fine yet structuring tannins and bolder black fruit sensations of plum and currant that carry through to the long, cigar-spice-fueled finish.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Flavors of tart cherry, red currant and clove combine to highlight a palate of measured ripeness and grace in this firmly tannic wine from a great site. It shows breadth to the body and is succulent in nature, finishing on lingering spice notes.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling, which includes 16% Malbec and 6% Petit Verdot, is a complete and cohesive wine that will satisfy many palates. Aromas of black cherry, dark plum and spice cake lead into a palate that's rich in a blackberry flavor. Polished tannins and fresh acidity frame it all.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a quietly powerful wine that wraps deep black-cherry and cranberry flavors in a firm but smooth texture of fine-grained tannins and full body. It has a satisfying sense of depth to the ripe fruit and subtle oak-spice accents, and a polished mouthfeel that seals the deal. Best through 2025.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Cask 23 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made to honor baseball player Cal Ripken Jr.'s 2131st consecutive game played, this 100% varietal red is grippy in flavors of coconut and black cherry, with a structured, complex and robust palate. It has richness within balanced tannin and oak, finishing with a wealth of black licorice and earth.

name: Four Lanterns 2017 Kharis Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blended with 5% each of Merlot and Malbec, this is an impressive, full-bodied red that displays a clove and cinnamon entry. Blackberry and black currant flavors are seamless on the palate, while a high-toned acidity comes to life on the red-fruit-driven finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Youthful, this wine is blended with small amounts of Malbec, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Together, they form a core of earthy cedar, clove and pencil shavings, with a bite of thick tannin taking on a leathery texture. Dark cherry, black currant and dark chocolate melt on the palate into a velvety whole.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This wine is impressively blended with 10% Cabernet Franc, showing a wealth of dusty plum, clove and cinnamon character up front and throughout. The fruit is predominantly from mountain vineyards. Soft, integrated texture shows its integration with the French oak, which supports instead of distracts.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Juicy red fruit is lightly spiced in cinnamon, clove and a tangle of toasted oak in this well-made, 100% varietal wine. Red and black cherry show a succulence on the midpalate as complex, integrated structure supports a memorable experience on the spicy earthy finish.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Fruity in blueberry and black cherry, with a citrus-tinged undertow, this blockbuster beauty is a mix of sleek tannins and complex structure, offering undeniable deliciousness as well as something to think about. Gunpowder and tobacco give it a savory edginess and lingering finish of black pepper. Enjoy from 2025–2035.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This wine is plush, lush and fruity, interwoven with tones of cardamom and clove. The palate is rich in feel, bolstered by layers of orange peel, cassis and toasted oak flavors.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tar, leather and coffee flavors ride along a velvety body of integrated and richly woven texture in this beautiful wine, blended to great floral and herbal effect, with 12% Cabernet Franc. Black licorice, black cherry and firm tannins make for a stellar and seamless experience dripping in lasting richness.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a chewy, substantially weighted and full-bodied red from the always impressive and nuanced appellation, a study in meat, garrigue and leather. Dark and brooding in savory fruit and herbal earthiness, it has a density that unfurls on the palate in slow waves of subtle blackberry and blueberry pie.
