name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dr. Crane delivers rewarding complexity and contour within a framework of firm, substantial tannins and stark structure. Leather, grilled meat and gunpowder complement tangy layers of acid-driven cassis and red currant, combining effortlessly in a seamless array of evolving flavors and aromas. The minerality takes form in a sensation of crushed rock. Enjoy from 2025–2035.

name: Château Calon Ségur 2016  Saint-Estèphe
description: This is a head-turning wine, especially at the price—an impressive study in cohesive elements of black currant, lavender and licorice melded with meaty, lengthy tannin. The black currant gives way to more sumptuous flavors of blueberry and cocoa powder, offering balanced body weight and complexity.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Cask 23 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The famous wine lives up to its mighty reputation in this vintage. Densely packed in tones of red currant, cassis and cocoa powder, the palate offers a sublime texture that lingers despite an overall powerful punch of structure and tannin. Elements of crushed rock and black licorice unfold on the finish. Enjoy from 2024–2034.

name: Mill Creek 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Aromas of fruit leather, wet hay and medicine cabinet lead to lightly sweet fruit flavors. It doesn't work.

name: Masia de la Vinya 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of potpourri, jalapeño and cranberry lead to tart, lighter-styled cherry and flower flavors.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: This is a bit like sucking on sweet wood chips, the fruit hidden underneath the overly assertive sweet-wood tones. The palate is similarly loaded with sweet wood spice, though glimmers of berry preserves, blackberry paste and fig jam whisper underneath.

name: Fox in the Hen House 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: An odd mix of tomato, green herb and oaky aromas are unusual and not fully convincing. A hard-bodied palate is lean, while tomato and green herb flavors turn greener on the finish. This tastes like a Cabernet that didn't get fully ripe.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has a rather light-garnet color, mature herbal aromas and unusual spicy, floral, almost-sweet flavors.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Blended with 11% Malbec and 3% Merlot this medium-bodied wine is bland in structure and slightly herbal in approach, with a baked element to the dark fruit.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: There's a medicinal cherry note upfront on the nose of this wine, with waves of black-currant liqueur, plum paste and tobacco earthiness underneath. The medium-weight palate shows astringent tannins that finish somewhat aggressively, while the fruit hides in the back of the palate, not offering enough support to the tough structure.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This vintage is blanketed in an oak character that feels synthetic, like dusting polish. This tone sits beside mint, dried herbs and raisiny dark and purple fruit. The palate is dense and full bodied, and the oak makes things dry and a little clunky.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is an ultraripe, oaky wine that charges out of the gate with blackberry jam aromas overlaid with chocolaty, soapy oak notes. There's a nice line of acidity on the palate, but it's not quite enough to lift the fruit out of jam territory, and it fights with the clunky, woody tannins.

name: Akash 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: This is a soft, simple and somewhat heated block-designate, tasting robustly ripe on the tongue. Plum and cinnamon flavors help to offset the ripeness and intensity, but the fruit is beginning to fade.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A stalky wine light in fruit and tannins, this is softly textured and has juicy acidity. Its appellation covers the whole of the Bordeaux region and further south. This warm wine is ready to drink.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a green, leafy style of Cabernet, leading with green bell pepper and tomato leaf aromas, and backed by blackberry, mint and tobacco leaf aromas. On the full-figured palate, the fruit feels a touch sour, blanketed in drying, grainy tannins.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a medium-bodied, oaky Cab laced with ripe red berry fruit, mint, dried cedar and oak spice. The red-fruited palate feels tangy from a good lick of acidity and the tannins are soft and silky, but the oak influence is prominent and drying.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky oak takes on a char flavor in this simply constructed and structured red. A juiciness of cherry comes to life on the midpalate, that's soft, ripe and without fanfare.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This red leads with vibrant aromas of ripe black cherry, plum, blackberry and a touch of sweet wood spice. It's smooth and easy on the palate, with a plush texture, soft acidity and velvety tannins that finish with a whisper.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Reduced, with a strong element of char to the oak, this 100% varietal wine is inky and dark, with a thick, tannic character that holds tenaciously on to the palate. A sweetness of cherry, vanilla and cocoa powder clings to the dense, concentrated palate.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A broad nose of cherry and currant melds with a bit of pepper on the nose. The palate is light in concentration, with tart red-fruit flavors meeting hints of green herbs.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The rich flavors of this ripe and jammy-tasting wine are rounded by a touch of sweetness as in many California red blends. It starts out in the aroma and first sip as big and full bodied and finishes as soft and candied.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of damp campfire, hickory smoke and red-cherry pie show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is slightly thin with angular tannins, showing dried black fruit and dried fennel flavors.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Cassis, raspberry sauce, blackberry jam, popcorn and baking spice unfold on the nose of this ripe wine. The medium-weight palate offers a smooth entry and nice weight on the midpalate, and then shows tannic length through the close.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Burnt, roasted, smoky aromas announce a ton of oak but not much fruit. In the mouth, this is big and edgy, with rocky tannins. Charred flavors dominate this Cabernet, which ends with charcoal and clove notes along with drying tannins.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Earthy aromas of oregano mix with black-cherry juice on the nose of this bottling. Tangy black plum, violet and oak show on the slightly sweet-seeming palate.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Meaty, savory plum and berry aromas set up a hefty palate with chewy tannins. Berry flavors come with chocolaty oak, while this everyday Cabernet is short on the finish, with a hint of toasty spice.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Aromas of bacon and mint sit on top of herbaceous berry fruit scents, while next up is a choppy palate with scouring acidity. Gamy berry flavors come with a generous side helping of bacon grease, while this Cabernet tastes about the same on the finish.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Charry notes are out front, with green herb, vanilla and cedar box behind them. The palate paints around the edges, with the wood influence dominating. Char and vanilla notes linger on the finish. It's a pretty green interpretation of the variety.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with 8% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc, this wine opens in a tartness of acidity as layers of dried herb, leather and black cherry develop. The texture is soft and simple, making the full-bodied concentration approachable.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of golden raisin, red apple, hay and medicine cabinet are followed by dried out seeming cherry and Band-Aid flavors. It doesn't all work.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This affordable red is thick in tannin and oak, with a touch of reduction adding to its concentration and power. Fruity black cherry and blackberry flavors give it a lift on the midpalate.

name: Samuel Charles 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: A 100% varietal wine from one block of the property, this is thick and ripe with an abundance of oak. The fruit is masked somewhat by the astringency of the tannins.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Leather and leafy notes are attached to standard berry fruit scents, while on the palate this is tight, drawing and fresh. Spicy herbal flavors are equal to the wine's generic berry fruit, while this tastes lightly green on the finish.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Bright and herbal, this is made in an elegant, food-friendly style, the oak smoky and in moderation. Black and red currant and cedar dot an intensity on the midpalate that mellows into a well-made finish of soft leather and tobacco.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: With 4% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, this fairly priced wine is dusty in oak and soft and supple on the palate, highlighted in cherry, cassis and vanilla.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: High-toned aromas of plum and orange peel are a bit unsettled. In the mouth, this is in solid physical shape, with hammering tannins. Herbal black fruit flavors are spicy and peppery on the back end.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Gamy aromas of olive, brine and mulchy earth accent berry fruit on a nose that screams “old school Chile.” A tight, firm palate with rubbing tannins holds lightly herbal and spicy flavors of berry fruit and mint, while olive and green notes are draped all over the finish of this hot-year Cabernet.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a thick concentrated wine with a depth of dark chocolate and toasted oak, in addition to earthy tobacco. The tannins are sharp and sour, still finding their way.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: With the addition of Petit Verdot, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this is a soft, supple red wine, dusty in leather, clove and tobacco. It has full-bodied power and a substantial tannin presence.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Herbal and brawny, this wine is made in a big, bold and highly ripe style, richly wrapped in black cherry and currant. The tannins are supportive and mountainous, as the oak makes itself known.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Beef and smoke aromas and brown sugar and spice flavors give this full-bodied wine more of an oaky than a fruity personality. It has a good firm structure of light tannins and firm acidity, so it's appetizing and fresh on the palate.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is the Pinot Noir and Chardonnay producer's second inaugural release of Cabernet Sauvignon, having made the variety from 1979 to 1992 before grafting over the Cab vines to Pinot Noir. In 2012 Hanzell replanted two acres of Pinot back to Cabernet and here's the welcome result. Blended with 12% Cabernet Franc, 11% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot, it offers a sweet cassis bouquet and substantial structure lined in flavors of red fruit, pencil shavings and tobacco.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Notes of violet and lavender mark the nose of this 100% varietal wine. Blueberry, blackberry and dark chocolate swirl around weighty tannins and oak, striking a balance on the long finish of black pepper and tobacco. Still youthful, this will do well in the cellar. Enjoy 2021–2026.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Woody pencil shavings and dried herb combine on the nose and palate in this Cabernet that's blended with 8% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec. Succulent red currant and cassis come to life on the midpalate, with a tannic backbone that emphasizes final touches of black pepper and clove.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Blended with 3% Merlot, this mountain-grown wine offers tight-grained tannins and substantial power and weight. Flavors of blackberry, plum and cocoa powder dance around a core of toasted oak and graphite, unfurling to yield a pleasing wine.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A robustly styled wine with a depth of jammy plum and cherry, this is also bursting in earthy mushroom and forest tones, along with a distinct hit of cigar box. Refined tannins surround the soft rich midpalate followed by prominent oak.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Cedar aromas meet with dark red fruit and anise on the nose of this bottling from the eastern edge of the Santa Ynez Valley. Chalky tannins make for a compelling structure on the sip, where mouthfilling flavors of dark berries prove full but not fruity, finishing on a hint of vanilla.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Concentrated and thick aromas of chocolate fudge and candied Concord grape make for a very rich expression on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also rich and powerful with thick flavors of black cherry, cassis, roasted fennel and a hint of cocoa.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Black and inky, this wine blends in 13% Merlot and a smidgen of Cabernet Franc. Sandalwood, oak and cigar orbit around a soft, rich and round midpalate that is deftly structured and well integrated in oak and tannin.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This is a classically elegant, structured wine, subdued in tannin and oak. It sings a song of savory intrigue, from tobacco, cedar and clove to currant and cassis. It offers flavor and texture within quiet interludes of integrated ripeness.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Representing one of the finest values in Napa Cabernet, this 100% varietal wine is bright and plush, layered in anise and cassis liqueur. A fresh high-toned midpalate evolves to show a softly round ending as a classic style of structure and elegance play out.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a broad, rich and relaxed wine made from organic grapes. It shows generous black-plum and blackberry flavors, full body and grippy, moderate tannins. It does a great job of filling a big frame with opulent, delicious and ripe fruit, while adding subtle spice and wood-smoke nuances that enhance each sip.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: Reductive with burly bold flavors of diesel and tar, this vineyard-designate from the southern end of the appellation is oaky, broad and grippy. Black fruit takes on a juicy undertone midway on the palate as tobacco, pencil and turned earth challenge in savory power. Enjoy 2025–2035.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This Cabernet is blended with 6% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc. Fresh tones of brioche and currant meld with crushed rock, pencil and sweet tobacco. Youthful tannins offer a structured frame to this undeniably elegant wine.

name: Kenzo Estate 2016 Rindo Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec, this is a brawny, substantial wine from grapes grown at 1,900-feet in elevation. It has richness to spare, a combination of dark cherry and cassis that is hugely structured and seasoned in cigar box, cocoa and sage.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick and herbaceous, with a trail of bright red currant, cherry and cassis, this is a broadly expansive and well-made wine, elegantly balanced and restrained in style. It delivers plenty of fruit within a context of structure and seamless texture.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Cask 23 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal, estate-grown wine is earthy and brimming in vanilla, anise and cedar. Classic in style and approach, it offers a complex concentration of balanced fruit and savory components that accent substantial tannins.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Aromatically and flavorfully evocative of blackberry pie and coffee, this is a thick, decadent and firmly structured wine, with integrated tannins and oak. Powerful, it retains a forceful elegance around balanced ripeness and restraint.

name: Four Lanterns 2017 Kharis Red (Paso Robles)
description: This wine is broad and expansive in plush dark fruit and spice that is supported by soft, billowy tannins. Blended with 9% Malbec, 8% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, is dazzles in tones of violet, blueberry, clove, pencil and pepper.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: High-toned acidity lifts a thick body of viscosity and power in this vineyard-designated estate wine. Leather, tobacco and baked plum adorn a middle of firm structure and peppery spice, finding powerful elegance and complexity as it goes.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: This historic producer excels at Cabernet. It's broody and savory in notes of graphite, dried herbs and flowers amid the red currant and spicy oak notes. It's lifted by a focused line of acidity, which slices neatly through the savory tannins and grainy texture, making the fruit feel crunchy and tangy. There's something rustic yet classy about this wine. Drink now–2026.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is an estate-grown red that's thick, rich and concentrated in bold flavors of dark chocolate and blueberry cake. The midpalate is soft and seductive with full-bodied power as a finishing touch of dust and crushed rock builds and emboldens.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: A lean high-toned red wine, this shows deft layers of balanced ripeness and savory character, a mix of cigar box, black cherry and spicy leather. The mountain appellation contributes elements of the forest and graphite, with mineral-laden gems hidden within.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the great site in the heart of St. Helena, this is a thick, rich red, brimming in delicious layers of cherry liqueur, graham cracker and black licorice. Complex, it is lushly crafted with robust body and structure, built to last and the tannins soften over time. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Blended with small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Merlot, this wine succeeds in its rich coming-together of plum, lavender and black-currant flavors, the palate densely packed in fruit and tight-grained tannin. Effusively perfumed in oak and cedar, it is nicely integrated and shows great complexity.

name: Kenzo Estate 2016 Rindo Red (Napa Valley)
description: Cherry, berry and spice tones orbit around well-integrated oak and firm tannins, showing breadth and weight as this builds in the glass. Everything is in proportion—fruit, oak and tannin—offering a seamless experience that is defined by structure and complexity. It will cellar well; enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Juicy in cherry and cassis, this provides moderate ripeness and resplendent acidity, with an exuberant expression of style and grace that makes it enjoyable in the glass. Firm tannin structure gives it complexity for days and a lightness of being that is hard to resist.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Winemaker Jean Hoefliger crafts a beautiful statement of refined structure and grace in this wine, highlighting pencil shavings, clove and firm, substantial tannin weight. Supportive acidity provides a contrasting brightness that refreshes the palate against tart red currant and cassis. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: An impressive showcase of the famous Oakville vineyard, this delivers weighty, complex notions of tobacco, cedar and pencil shavings, savory and robust elements that find companionship in complementary red cherry, currant and cassis. With lasting breadth and weight, it will do well with more time in the cellar. Enjoy 2025–2035.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is an impressively memorable wine, perfumed in violet and sage tones, with a persistence of blackberry and cocoa powder that feels seamless and perfectly integrated on the palate. Accents of bright acidity and graphite complement the richer, concentrated aspects, finding rhythm in the glass.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is a complex, beautiful red wine, blended with a handful of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Aged two years in all new French oak, it shows a full embrace of dark cherry, currant and cedar flavors. Classic, boldly textured and well integrated, it is structured and ready for the cellar. Best 2024–2031.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From a certified-organic site in Rutherford and 100% varietal, this wine has benefitted from time in the bottle, dazzling in soft silky red fruit and jolts of nutmeg and dust. Beautifully layered, structured and brightly vibrant, it has impressive coaxings of cigar, cedar and a rich hint of wild vanilla.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy baked plum, raisin cake and anise mark the extended entry of this bold big-boned red from the great Oakville site. Softly integrated in tannin and oak, it shows deft layers of cassis, cedar and cigar box, a persistence of woody herbaceousness intriguing and contributing ongoing complexity. Best 2025–2035.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: With a mineral-laden opening of iron, earth and crushed rock, this expands on the palate to showcase thick, rich layers of cassis, nutmeg and clove, in addition to classic touches of pencil shaving and cigar box. With a firm tannin structure that's youthful and still evolving, this should be cellared for best enjoyment. Drink 2021–2026.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine made by Thomas Rivers Brown, this is abundant in baked plum, cassis and dark currant. Firm tannins wrap around the integrated oak and secondary seasonings of black pepper, licorice and pepper, leaving a fresh, floral finish to ponder. Enjoy 2021–2026.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From a 1,110-foot-high elevation site, this is chalky and waxy in plum, cinnamon, leather and tobacco. It has an underlying richness of chocolate-covered espresso beans and dark cherry that are sustained in balanced complexity and structure. Dusty rock and mineral linger.

name: The Atom 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Heavy oak aromas are artificial while this smells much like shoe polish, vanilla and cheap chocolate. A heavy, grabby palate comes with flavors that match the nose: char, milk chocolate and wood.

name: Santa Rita 2017 120 Reserva Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Thin strawberry aromas are green, while there's almost no depth to the palate. But what pushes this to the fringes of acceptability are hollow and grassy red fruit flavors.

name: Fox in the Hen House 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: This affordable wine is smoky in oak with oddly flavored elements of dried herb and cedar that become green on the palate.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Aromas of crushed dried herb, tire rubber and purple fruit carry the nose. The palate follows suit, with light fruit flavors melding to create an easygoing package.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Appealing aromas of leafy green herb and cherry lead to plump fruit flavors that paint around the edges. The concentration is light, particularly through the middle, but what's there is pleasant.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Aromas of cough syrup, game, barrel spice and herbs are followed by ripe cherry flavors and abundant baking spice accents. Firm, wound-up tannins back it all up.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Straightforward black-cherry and black-olive flavors give this medium-bodied wine a solid footing, while a smooth, low-tannin texture makes it easy on the palate. It's fruity enough without overdoing it, and has good balance.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Aromas of mocha and lightly herbal red berry fruits and plum lead to a full palate with moderate acidic cut. Baked plum and prune flavors are friendly and stocky, but not complex. On the finish, this is warm almost to the point of being hot.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: A nose of condensed plum and blueberry sauce starts off this hands-off approach to the variety. The palate is taut in feel, with flavors of thick cranberry and dark-plum skins enveloped in a sheen of velvety tannins and juicy acidity.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Heavily spiced and oaky, this wine gives an almost sweet impression of baking spices in the aroma, and berry jam in the flavor. Medium body and light tannins add good structure beneath all the oaky perfume.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: This is a medium-bodied, nicely balanced wine that has everything in the proper proportions. Fresh cherry and light herb aromas are followed by ripe black cherry, black olive and a touch of oak spice on the palate. Light tannins and good acidity complete the experience.

name: J. Bookwalter 2016 Chapter 9 Conner-Lee Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Brawny, concentrated and tannic, this is an expansive, firmly structured red wine that imparts big flavors of black currant, clove and earth.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A perfumed nose of slightly soapy, vanillin oak overlays ripe plum, red berry and baking spice aromas. Tannins are tightly wound, but the acidity lifts the fruit into juicy rather than jam territory. A full-bodied and fairly muscular Cab.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The perfumed, slightly soapy vanillin oak on this wine overlays ripe plum and blackberry fruit, licorice and fennel seed aromas. The tannins feel a little clunky beside the plush, plummy fruit. This is a big-boned Cab meant for early drinking.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in clove and tobacco, this is a soft, smoothly crafted wine with some age on it that's rich in clove, toasted oak and black cherry.

name: Priest Ranch 2016 Snake Oil Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and tannic, this is a boldly flavored and structured wine, dense in plum, dark cherry, clove and black pepper. It has soft approachable tannins and a hearty use of oak.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Black currant, red apple, green pepper, cherry cordial and bittersweet chocolate aromas lead to plump, pleasing plum flavors. There's a lot to like.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Soft, rich and likable, this is made at an attractive price point and delivers seamless approachability that's both varietal and well made. Black fruit and black pepper highlight the experience most, with firm tannins and toasted oak never getting in the way.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A high-toned nose of vanilla-dusted red fruit and earth leads to the light-bodied zesty palate. Tart currant and cranberry lead the flavors, with a delicate veil of tannins holding the palate together.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Bright and snappy aromas of boysenberry jam on toast and dark red cherry show on the lively nose of this bottling, whose label features an amazing display of augmented reality viewable through a smart phone. The flavors are fresh in ripe plum and berry, lifted by hints of fennel and mint, and wrapped in enough structure to keep it serious.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The cherry, herb and flower aromas enchant. Full-bodied, black as night flavors follow, wrapped up in firm, tightly wound tannins that come off as a bit dry. Give it some additional time in the bottle or an extended decant if drinking in the near term.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: The aromas bring notes of black fruit, fresh herb and barrel spice. Full-bodied dark fruit flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a dry, scratchy feel that softens a bit with some time open. There's a lot of value to be had. Decant if drinking in the near term.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: With 5% Petite Sirah, this shows as dark, inky and concentrated in style, with an opening of soft rich black fruit and plenty of heat. Cedar, clove and sage offer a contrast to the toasted oak and fruit-forward character of the wine.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine made by sought-after winemaking consultant Thomas Rivers Brown. It delivers a powerful package of plum and dark chocolate. Earthy tobacco and sage meld with grippy, youthful tannins to showcase a well-structured offering. Enjoy 2024–2029.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: There's currently a slight volatility to this wine that serves to lift the drying red raspberry and plum fruit. Alongside it sits chocolate and dried herbal notes and a dusty earth quality that evokes the dry, sunbaked South Aussie soils. The palate is a little less cohesive. While the fruit is tangy and the warm, dusty earth character evocative, the oak is a little overpowering, weighing things down somewhat. Nevertheless, this is a solid wine from a historic winery.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Medium in weight, this McLaren Vale Cab offers notes of fresh plum and rhubarb fruit, cola, vanillin oak, pencil lead and a medicinal herbal quality. The oak is particularly present on the palate, especially the finish, but it's not hulking, allowing the soft tannins to support the fruit. Bottle aging has likely softened this wine into a gentler creature than it once was.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Full bodied, moderately spicy and full of ripe, almost jammy fruit flavors, this bold and mouthfilling wine tastes rich and generous. Blackberry and sweet black-plum notes seem to coat the tongue, and add to an almost thick texture that extends the finish nicely.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick, oaky sheens of cocoa and baking spice ride over aromas of sauced cherry and cranberry. There's solid fruit concentration on the palate, framed by a decent helping of oak and bolstered by a firm mesh of tannins. Give this some time to integrate. Drink from 2020.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a straight-up, well-structured and moderately tannic wine with medium to full body, firm acidity and an almost tangy texture. It dusts black-cherry and cranberry flavors with hints of spicy oak and dark chocolate that continue to develop on the palate and finish.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: An herbal imprint permeates across this wine—a bright expression of the grape that's earthy and lingering in tobacco, cigar box and pencil shavings. Clove, currant and sage play prominent roles across a landscape of full-bodied balance and complexity.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This lavishly oaked wine blends ripe black-fruit flavors with abundant baking spice, wood smoke and maple tones. It is big but fairly soft in structure, with moderate tannins that give it a seductive, extravagant edge.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 86% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Malbec, 5% Petit Verdot, 3% Cabernet Franc and 1% Merlot, this is an herbal and smoky wine, earthy in sage and flint. Thick leathery tannins grip the palate with force as a touch of cherry and vanilla wind around a deep lasting finish.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine is sourced from an estate vineyard along Lytton Springs that also grows Petit Verdot, of which there is 10% in this wine. A soft, juicy entry upholds flavors of dried herb, strawberry and red currant, with firm, sinewy tannins giving support. A thread of fresh acidity helps balance the fruit.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a ripe, plush wine, but it avoids being syrupy or heavy. It starts with aromas of red berry fruit, mint, ground pepper, graphite and baking spices. The palate is wound with tight, chalky-textured tannins and a bite of acidity. The oak creeps in, particularly on the finish, but overall this is a restrained expression of the region that should hold up in bottle until 2024 or so.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Big in structure and chocolaty in flavor, this rich, full-bodied wine is impressive and smooth. While firm in tannins, it balances that grip with flavors of ripe black cherry, mint and dark chocolate in a seamless, delicious way.

name: Alpha Omega 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This is a thick, concentrated wine from the producer's estate site on the eastern benches of the appellation. Leather, earth and blue and red fruit meld together within firm sizable tannins and prominent oak. The wine is made in a big full-bodied style.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This was a solid and relatively cool vintage for Cabernet in Langhorne Creek and this wine expresses the year beautifully. The upfront plum and currant fruit are there, but the oh-so-Aussie aromas of fresh eucalyptus and bay leaf are just as prominent, backed by mocha and vanilla-tinged oak and dusty, savory tannins that support rather an overpower. A full-bodied yet restrained wine.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: There's no mistaking the variety, with its aromas of dried and fresh herb, along with notes of cherry and plum. Full-bodied black currant flavors follow, with plentiful cocoa accents throughout. A grip of tannins pulls it together. It's a lot of wine for the money. Give it some time to open.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Lush in tannin and oak, this is a well-made, softly approachable and likable vineyard-designate from the heart of the appellation. Cherry and chocolate provide contrast and undeniable richness, with a lasting thread of vanilla.

name: Hess Collection 2016 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is the producer's 100% estate bottling meant to reflect the best of the best. Brawny and substantial oak accentuates the wine's savory, earthy intensity in forest, cedar and tar. Full bodied and richly concentrated, it finishes in a fistful of black pepper.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine that is soft and sinewy in style. Full bodied, it has pronounced oak, cedar and dried herb with fruity components of blueberry, cassis and red currant, the finish awash in clove and coffee.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Presumably 100% Cabernet, this shows a lot of barrel influence at the moment, with aggressive scents of vanilla when first opened. Let it breathe and a solid core of blueberry fruit comes up, with a wrapping of stem, earth and tannin flavors. It's a bit rough and tumble, but compelling, with big bones and plenty of fruit to carry it. Drink after 2022.

name: Fox in the Hen House 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: Leafy berry aromas blend with chocolaty oak on a nose that doesn't exactly cause fireworks. A sticky palate shows resiny flavors of buttered popcorn and chocolaty berry fruit.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Extra bold flavors of dried fruit and a lush velvety texture give this full-bodied wine an opulent character. Black fig and dried plum in the aroma lead to spicy, mulled-wine flavors lightly accented by sandalwood and turned-earth notes.

name: En Garde 2015 Touché Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an estate-grown, 100% varietal wine that showcases a soft, broad experience that's approachably rich and well-balanced. Perfumed in cherry, cassis and vanilla, it has a subtle, savory character on the midpalate of dense smoky oak and firm structure.

name: Marietta Cellars 2016 Armé Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine is a fruit bowl of raspberries, blackberries and blueberries backed by cedar spice, black pepper and a savory streak. The savoriness continues on the palate in the form of fine-grained tannins that hold all that plump fruit in place. A plush but balanced expression of the Eden Valley. Drink now–2025.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Candied berry, marshmallow and milk chocolate aromas help to cover core herbaceous scents. This feels both creamy and green, and that's how it tastes, too. Flavors of plum, cherry, chocolate and vanilla just never seem quite natural or honest.

name: Crosby Roamann 2015 Crosby's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal in clove and thick in tannin, this is a simply structured and medium-bodied wine that is beginning to show its age.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Saucy berry, tomato and rubbery aromas at first smell like soup, but later suggest Band-Aid rubber and latex. A snappy, tomatoey palate is decent at best, while this tastes of green herbs and generic plum.

name: Axios 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This rich full-bodied wine has a jammy syrupy nature to its fruit that presents as sweet and cloying.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Mild volatility on the nose makes this Cab smell a bit like salad dressing. A scrubbing palate with rough tannins is backed by saucy plum and berry fruit flavors. A screechy palate with rubbery tannic grab makes for a grinding finish.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Plum and berry aromas suggest animal. This Cabernet feels fleshy but short on depth. Herbal plum and berry flavors qualify as lightly green, while this is harmless and mostly tasteless on a quiet finish.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a long-aged wine in both barrel and bottle: two years each. Mushroom, tobacco and black-olive flavors work well against a burnt, green background that provokes the palate.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Powdery aromas of floral bath soap mix with lightly green plum and currant scents. A simple, crisp, acidic palate is fresh and lean, with little depth or substance. Tart, salty plum and currant flavors carry over to a quick finish.

name: Hugh Hamilton 2016 The Villain Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This wine is soft and simple in approach, fairly priced and tasting of tobacco, cedar and stewed plum. The ripeness is moderate.

name: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal—thick and peppery, with a huge presence of oak that makes it hard for the fruit to speak.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Charcoal aromas and smoky toasted-oak flavors dominate this full-bodied and almost aggressively oaky wine, relegating its fruit flavors to the rear and bringing rocky chalky notes to the fore. The mouthfeel is dry and lean.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft, simple and approachable wine priced fairly. It has firm herbal tannins and a strong presence of oak.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Challenging aromas of red cabbage, herbal fruit and horse hide raise questions about this Cabernet, some of which get answered in a good way. A strong palate lacks subtlety, while meaty plum and blueberry flavors are lightly green before showing black coffee on a hard finish.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is big in flavors of tar and oak, with a perfumed hit of cassis and cedar on the nose. Huge tannins wrap around generously ripe layers of baked black cherry.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Tomato, green herb and chemical oak aromas need time to resolve, and they do. A fair but basic palate is slightly gummy in feel, with tomato-like acidity cutting a path for chocolaty berry flavors. On the finish, this is slightly candied, with a smear of lasting oak.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Oaky vanilla dominates on the nose of this thick, rounded and rich wine, that is jammy in strawberry and cherry.

name: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine that shows currant and cassis flavors atop a thick, reduced and tangy middle of bold intensity.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Perfumed in mint and cedar, this light-hearted wine takes on a thick midpalate of earthy graphite and tobacco. The tannins dull, the wine finishes without fanfare.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine is fresh, fruity, grapey and relatively light bodied, offering strawberry and cherry-candy flavors, soft tannins and low acidity.

name: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas bring notes of dried cherry, apple, anise and golden raisin, with the palate showing more of the same. The fruit seems quite desiccated.

name: Fiftyrow 2016 Alice Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: The aromas offer notes of char, vanilla, Band-Aid, anise and dried raspberry and cherry. Fruit and game flavors follow, dipping in the middle, with the tannins giving a firm, slightly dry squeeze.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of olive, graphite, herbs, tomato leaf and stewed berry fruit are earthy, while a jammy, syrupy palate with sappy berry flavors is short on freshness and balance. Although this Cabernet has its virtues, it tastes of desiccated blueberry with green infusions.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Gritty berry aromas are oaked up and smell of butter, wood spice and burnt bread. A medium-bodied palate is a touch grinding and bumpy, while this Cabernet from a warm year is woody tasting, with mild green notes. As Chilean Cabs go, this should seem familiar.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas suggest notes of leafy green herbs, green pepper, a whiff of tire rubber, anise, scorched earth and black cherry. Focused, pitch black, lively fruit flavors follow. The acidity and tannin structures are enchanting. If the aromas and palate sync, it could move up.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a nicely made wine offered at a fair price—a light-bodied expression of cassis, currant and plum wrapped in tight firm tannins. Buoyant acidity keeps the fruit fresh and vibrant on the finish.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Dark cherry and berry aromas meet with cedar and leather on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers pleasant berry flavors alongside milk chocolate and tangy black-plum skins, framed by squeaky tannins.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Bittersweet chocolate, spicy dried herb, barrel spice and cherry aromas lead to elegant, juicy, well-balanced fruit flavors that carry on the finish. Grippy tannins back it up. Pair it with food to see it at its best.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky blackberry, toasted oak and peppercorn aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is cohesive with hickory smoke and boysenberry, wrapped in sturdy tannins.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Eucalyptus and bay leaf aromas come through strongly in this full-bodied approachable red from the famous site named for the author. Plum, black licorice and rounded oak complete the picture, finishing smoothly.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Aromas of Band-Aid, latex, grilled beef, green herbs and savory spices make up the nose on this dry, lean Cabernet that is suggestive of nonclassified Bordeaux. Tomato, spiced plum and nutmeg flavors finish with herbal overtones.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Ripe, smoky aromas of tree bark and meaty berry fruits set up a fat, blocky palate. Earthy berry flavors are matched by burnt coffee notes. On the finish, this is savory and hinting at green, with thickness.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Prominent scents of mentholated herbs and black currant leaf form the nose of this wine, overriding the secondary black plum and berry aromas. The palate is full and structured, with fine yet supporting tannins and ripe black-fruit flavors that carry more intensity than the nose suggests. The finish is fruity and enduring, with lingering flavors of black plum and cherry.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Entirely varietal from a specific block on the appellation, this is a burly, thick and robustly ripe wine, salty in oak as fresh layers of dark cherry are seasoned in cedar, dried herb and drying tannin.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Warm, earthy aromas of leathery berry, olive and tobacco set up an overripe palate with raisiny dryness. Raisin and caramel flavors lead this one-dimensional Cabernet toward a predestined baked-out finish.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a good, well-made and well-balanced wine at a great price that delivers ripe fruit notes and attractive spicy, smoky accents on a moderately tannic frame. It will make a great pairing with grilled chicken or roast beef.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Lemony oak, floral soap and mulchy berry aromas amount to a muddled whole that gets better with airing. A round, medium-bodied palate is solid in feel and structure, while this tastes oaky, with flavors of dried spices, cherry and plum. A spicy, steady finish is healthy and braced by juicy acidity.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This young release wine is all Cabernet, and it's rare to see a red wine from this appellation at this price. The aromas offer notes of herb, plum and black currant that haven't fully settled in. Tasty, slightly tacky feeling blue and black fruit flavors follow, with dry tannins backing them up. It has a pleasing yum factor and will only improve with some additional time in bottle. Best after 2020.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a heck of a value given the quality—a soft, approachable varietal wine that's pillowy on the palate in thick waves of cherry, vanilla and leather. Blended with 10% Merlot and smaller amounts of Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot, it overdelivers with a finishing touch of dried herb.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: With 5% Petite Sirah, this red is thick, spicy and leathery, with an earthy underbelly. Black and red cherry give it a lush fruit-forward nature set against a tease of dried herb and cedar.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: In this 100% varietal, licorice aromas are in the lead, followed by spice, herb and black fruit. Soft, quite ripe fruit flavors follow. The flavors seem a bit Port-like but it still brings appeal. It could use more structure to hold it together.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Saucy aromas of tomato, herbs and forest floor set up a tough palate with raw, choppy tannins. Spiced plum and cocoa flavors conclude on a warm, sappy finish with wood and spice notes. As Chilean Cabernet goes, this is fitting and appropriate.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This bottling, which includes some Merlot and Cabernet Franc, offers straightforward aromas of blackberry, cedar and caramel. The palate is more complex, layered with more blackberry as well as leather, roasted beef, and purple flowers, all framed by chalky tannins.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from the Wahluke Slope. Slightly reductive aromas of gun smoke are followed by notes of graphite, black currant and green pepper. The palate is full of black fruit flavors with a firm but not unyielding sense of structure. The balance is impressive at this price.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This wine, a 100% varietal from juice master Ryan Crane at Kerloo Cellars, brings aromas of gun smoke, dried and fresh herbs and jammy black fruit. Well-balanced black cherry and blackberry flavors follow, carrying on the lightly smoky finish.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Small Block Series Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Clean and ripe aromas of blackberry and black currant meet with caramel and dark spice on the nose of this bottling, which must be one of the most coastally influenced Cabernets available. The palate is framed in a thicker grippy tension, offering flavors of blackberry and black plum.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Smoky, rubbery aromas of berry fruits and black currant lead to a fleshy, grabby, pulpy palate. Herbal berry and saucy plum flavors finish with herbal notes. Overall, this is plump, dark and honest for Chilean Cabernet, especially in a difficult year like 2016.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Forward aromas of dried black currant and blackberry lead the bouquet of this red, with additional accents of green pepper, tobacco leaf and licorice root. The palate is medium in weight and firmly structured, with robust tannins and medium acidity to balance the ripe black fruit flavors. Hints of leather and wood spice unfold on the medium-length close.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Foresty, roasted berry aromas are spicy and rooty, while rubbery, hard tannins make for a rocky road. This tastes blackened and baked, with prune and black plum flavors turning slightly raisiny on a broad finish that remains rough in texture.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Spicy aromas of licorice root, tobacco, green herbs and berry fruits foresee a flush palate. Plum and cherry flavors are peppery, while a coffee note marks the finish.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine has spent three years in 100% new French oak and is the producer's current release. Dark chocolate, graham cracker and blackberry-pie flavors highlight a thick viscous palate of rich intensity that finds peace within a spicy dark-cherry finish.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of blackberry, crushed pepper, toasted tarragon and licorice show on the nose of this bottling. There is compelling richness to the palate and a firm tannic frame, allowing flavors of blackberry jam, toast, black plum and oak to carry the whole experience.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Earthy tobacco highlights this easily enjoyable, approachable red offered at a fair price. Robust red fruit is seasoned by further elements of savory pencil shavings and graphite as the oak integrates into a finish that is soft and smooth.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: For fans of a rich, robust style in full grasp of jammy red and blue fruit, this wine succeeds, offering a juicy palate of big thick flavor. Firm tannins add to the robust nature of the wine, as it finishes in a swath of vanilla oak. There is 11% Merlot and 2% Syrah in the mix.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This robust wine offers ripe plum on the nose, with highlights of dried herb and vanilla. Elongated tannins contribute to a plush feel on the palate that works well with the approachability of the overall package.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This mellow and apparently well-aged wine has an attractive bottle bouquet, smooth texture and plummy deep fruit flavors. While full bodied, the wine's tannins are soft and melted for a soothing mouthfeel.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From a single site on the appellation, this 100% varietal wine is fruity and juicy, with a nice approachability that shows a tameness to the tannins. Cedar, graphite and cassis complement each other well, as the finish marches to a fruit-forward lingering of ample red fruit.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Given that 2016 was a tough vintage for red wines in Chile, this is quite the success. Smoky aromas of berry fruits and herbs are solid, while this feels plump and whole. Plum, cassis and spice flavors carry the palate with a sense of energy.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Effusive in blackberry, plum and dark chocolate, this is a soft and well-integrated wine, fruity and savory in equal measure. The oak adds a component of vanilla and baking spice, which add welcome complexity.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy in plum and cocoa powder, this is a thick rich red wine blended with small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Red currant, wild raspberry and leather are buoyed by big oak and tannin weight. The wine is ready to enjoy now.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: From a site in St. Helena at the base of Spring Mountain, this is a leathery, richly layered wine, jammy in black fruit, black olive and sweet tobacco. It has a hit of heat to offer on the lengthy full-bodied finish.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Beyond the cool concept label, there's a serious Cabernet Sauvignon in the bottle—one with steady aromas of cola and root beer along with berries and light oak. A flush palate deals a full fan of berry flavors, while rubbing tannins give grip to an otherwise easy finish. Drink through 2024.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This moderately ripe and lush wine is brawny in tones of leather, dried herb and tobacco. Cedar, dried herb and currant round out its savory nature on the palate.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Ripe black cherry and strawberry provide a brightness beneath this wine's thick tannic structure and full-bodied richness. Spicy oak and clove season the fruit and present toasted oak.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Tones of black currant and oak highlight the light-bodied, elegant palate. Interwoven tannins offer a velvety texture, while the tart black fruit is adorned by accents of cedar, graphite and a hint of dark chocolate.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This smells bold and dark right off the bat, with scents of cassis and blackberry. Complementary aromas of dried herbs, tobacco and cigar box add depth to the bouquet. The palate is medium in weight and full in feel, with a mouthfilling structure that's well balanced between the ripe dark-fruit tones, pronounced tannins, ample acidity and enduring finish.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Black plum jam, peppercorn, milk chocolate and herbs show on the nose of this bottling from the legendary grower Louis Lucas and former judge Royce Lewellen. Black-cherry and roasted plum flavors are enhanced with Chinese five spice and a chalky tension on the palate.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a value-driven proposition of well-made wine, with tiny amounts of Petit Verdot, Merlot and Petite Sirah. Earthy in clove and dark backing spices, it has a wealth of soft blue and black fruit backed by firm easygoing tannin and integrated oak. This is one to hoard.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Boysenberry and lilac aromas make for a very intensely floral and fruity nose on this bottling. The palate is also loaded with purple, from açaí and boysenberry to violet, all framed by chalky tannins.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: From a vineyard in the East Bay near Castro Valley by second generation vintner Shauna Rosenblum, this is a lively style of Cab, starting with aromas of dark strawberry, cracked pepper and a cornucopia of dried herbs. It's playful on the palate, combining red cherries with green peppercorns, freshly plucked marjoram and a forest-like flavor.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Grainy oak is a big part of an otherwise berry-driven nose that also shows a hint of earth and horse. A big, grapy palate is loaded with pulpy blackberry and dark plum flavors, while the finish on this staunch Cabernet feels rubbery and bold. This is for fans of big reds.

name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2016 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 11% Cabernet Franc, this wine is nicely perfumed and full of clove, cigar and black-currant flavor. Thick tenacious tannins support burly toasted oak as the midpalate gets a lift from lurking acidity.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Saucy aromas of wild herbs, grilled meat and black fruit are boisterous on the nose. This feels mostly pure, but at the same time it's thick and full in body. Creamy blackberry, cassis and raisin flavors finish with good depth. This is a true-to-form ripe Chilean Cab to drink through 2023.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Wines by Scott Sampler are hard to judge against their peers, as his extended macerations produce results that don't compare to similar bottlings. In this case, the Cab is light in the glass and tangy on the nose with strawberry, damp wood and menthol touches. The palate is bright with hibiscus and complex with umami-laced red fruit, green peppercorns and spicy peppers.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Juicy black cherry is the star of this complex, lengthy and fleshy vineyard-designate wine, which holds its power in check while presenting a wealth of toasted oak and firm tannins. The bold structure suggests it needs more time in bottle. Enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Renowned winemaker Christian Tietje is lending his hand to this historic and revived brand, now owned by the Argentine wine family Budeguer. This bottling is dark and concentrated with thick aromas of blackberry, caramel and violet. The oaky palate is framed by firm tannins, offering rich and dark fruit flavors as well as woody tones of cedar and caramel, with a pinch of herbs.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Barrel fermented and aged, this well-made wine is elegant and classic in structure, 100% varietal in its offerings of tobacco, dark cherry, dried herb and pencil shavings. Grippy tannins provide a backbone of power and body, with a soft lingering finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dried berry, cocoa dust, roasted wood and cracked pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong espresso bean and cocoa combination to the palate, where charred blackberry, plum and fig elements make for a comfortingly roasted flavor profile.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Silky and supple despite the great concentration and full body, this opulent wine has focus and fruitiness. The color is extra dark, the aromas are brimming with black currants and black cherries, while the flavors capture wonderful baked fruits and dark chocolate. The wine's tannins are soft and well integrated, providing a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Dense in color and aromas, this nonvintage Cab smells warm and malty, with notes of maple, raisin, tobacco and toast. The palate is ample and lush, with potency and chewy tannins. Deep berry flavors finish smoky and oaky. Drink through 2024.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a fantastic and affordable red wine with small additions of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Rich red tangy fruit is fleshy and full on the palate. Simultaneously, the wine is well integrated and structured, with a touch of sweet oak.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of elderberry and blackberry are dusted with dried herbs on the nose of this bottling by the Hearst family and Jim Saunders. It's built to last on the palate, with strong blackberry, elderberry and boysenberry flavors wrapped around vanilla and herbs. The firm tannins will mellow with time. Drink 2020–2036.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: Quite thick in the glass, this reserve bottling by longtime grower David Parrish starts with inviting, delicious aromas of black cherry, pencil shavings and loamy soils. That density is confirmed on the palate, where black-currant flavors meet with hefty oak, milk chocolate, peppercorns and oregano, finishing on vanilla.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Intense blackberry and black-currant aromas meet with violet on the nose of this bottling by Bill Wathen and Dick Doré. There is a pure expression of blackberry on the palate, alongside roasted espresso, peppercorn-spice and tangy black-plum flavors.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of roasted cocoa, blackberry, loamy earth and dried herb show on the nose of this small-batch bottling, of which only 43 cases were made. There is a great vitality on the palate, where flavors of dark strawberry and black cherry meet with mocha, caramel and hoisin. The structure is firm with solid acidity.

name: Diamond Creek 2016 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This 100% varietal wine is exquisitely made, aged nearly two years in French oak, 80% of it new. It imparts gorgeous layers of raspberry and strawberry around an inviting nose of rose and violet. A bold pillowy middle offers clove, pencil shavings and turned earth, the tannins thick and structured.

name: Larkmead 2016 Dr. Olmo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sourced from the Martin Stelling Vineyard behind the winery, this is classic Napa and a gorgeous celebration of the variety. Blended with 3% Petit Verdot, it offers notes of red fruit, turned earth, graphite and anise, with a light toasting of oak to balance. It finishes lush and succulent in feel.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, concentrated estate-grown wine, blended with 3% Petit Verdot. Rich red fruit plays around interlaced acidity as accents of dried herb, red currant and structured tannins define a juicy midpalate of delicious intrigue and weight. This is a memorable, small-production wine from the wilds of Howell Mountain.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This bottling is dark in the glass and extremely lavish, with silky aromas of cassis, black cherry and caramel. The palate combines blackberry mousse, mocha and more caramel with a firm tannic structure and buoyant acidity.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This Cabernet shows very little varietal character. It feels generic and thin, with synthetic, hotel soap aromas, plummy fruit and peppery, slightly sweaty oak spice. Fruit on the medium-weight palate turns a little sour and lean, although the texture is silky.

name: The Atom 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has strong mint and menthol aromas, very oaky flavors and an astringent drying mouthfeel. Some low-key black-cherry notes are virtually overwhelmed by the strong, greenish oak flavors and stiff tannins.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Aromas of medicine cabinet, dried cherry, dill and raisin are followed by fruit and game flavors that paint around the edges. Vanilla notes linger on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Rich aromas of black cherry and vanilla are seasoned with oregano and thyme on the pleasantly complex nose of this bottling. That complexity extends to the sip, where red-cherry and boysenberry flavors mesh with herbs, caramel and vanilla-spice flavors.

name: Fox in the Hen House 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: The oaky, smoky aromas and charred but sweet flavors make this medium-bodied wine hard to identify as a Cabernet. Think of it as a mass-market red blend and it makes more sense.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a hearty red with small accents of other grapes (like Merlot, Cab Franc and Malbec) that is soft, supple and mellow in fruit. The tannins take on an astringent note that dulls the fruit.

name: Millésimé 2012 Bleu Saphir Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dusty sage and cedar highlight a palate of full-bodied, mouthcoating blue fruit and tobacco. The tannins are drying on the finish.

name: Hugh Hamilton 2016 The Villain Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: From the 2016 vintage, a year with a lot of rain and widespread ripeness issues, this is a difficult wine to get behind. The nose is saucy and green, while the palate feels soupy. Herbal, green flavors of tea and plum struggle to hold sway.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Rubbery berry aromas are packaged with savory oak in front of a grabby, tannic palate. This tastes of stalky berry fruits, roasted meat and oak, while you will find little to no change on a tannic finish.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine has an odd soapy aroma akin to bubble bath that distracts from its otherwise floral personality. Blended with 4% Petit Verdot, it continues on with faint notions of blackberry buried within a context of light-bodied bay leaf and mint.

name: Hugh Hamilton 2016 The Villain Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Smoky char and Italian deli meat rise on the nose of this affordable red, which is made to broadly appeal. Blackberry, black cherry and toasted oak round out the rich full-bodied flavor.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Underripe aromas of green pepper, garden herb and orange peel are at the fore, with abundant smoky accents. Mesquite flavors fill out the palate.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Red currant and raspberry fruit are in this wine, combined with spicy, slightly green oak notes as well as menthol and a hint of smoke. It's medium bodied with juicy fruit and a soft streak of tannins. The oak is a little angular and sitting in its own corner, and the fruit feels sour on the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Unfortunately this wine doesn't seem to be holding up well. The color is fading and so is the nose. There are currants, raspberries, dried leaves and some floral notes, but the fruit feels a little tired and some volatility is setting in. The palate offers an appealing tang of fruit, but texturally it's lean and angular with some bitterness creeping in on the finish and heat from the alcohol.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced, jammy black fruit aromas come with not-so-welcome notes of curry and celery. A soupy palate is jammy and not in the best state of balance, while this tastes of berry fruits with red cabbage and celery notes. The 2016 harvest was marred by a lot of rain; this good but flawed Cabernet echoes that.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Ripe red and black berry fruit, licorice, dried spices and florals and mint make up the nose, along with some toasty oak. On the full-figured palate, that plush fruit turns a little sour and the alcohol feels a touch warm. There's an apparent woodiness, too.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An oak-topped nose smells more artificial than natural due to plastic and rubbery notes. In the mouth, this is hard as rocks. Blueberry, tomato, green herb and oaky flavors culminate on a grabby, rubbery finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Sleeping Lady Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This wine offers dull compressed tannins and uneventful fruit, serving up a density of lasting oak and tobacco.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Big tannins take on a dry, green note of cedar and tobacco, with powerful oak contributing additional weight. Black currant fruit is equally savory.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: While many Cabernet drinkers will want to pass on this, there's probably a market for a thick, soft heavyweight wrapped in the char and chocolate that Bourbon barrels provide. This is opaque in color, charred and chocolaty on the nose, then sticky and sweet through the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This enjoyable wine is flavorful and well made. It offers black cherry and hints of dark chocolate on the palate, light tannins for structure and a good sense of freshness.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is blended with 14% Malbec and aged in French oak for more than a year. Reductive and thick on the palate, it has strong tannins and a density of black fruit, cedar and dried herb.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: A dark color and reduced, gaseous aromas include notes of prune and plum. A heavy, grabby palate holds flavors of plum, prune and boysenberry, while this feels clipped and dry on a rubbing finish.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Robust in oak and ripe red fruit, this wine brims along in full-flavored layers of dark cherry and strawberry, delivering good quality for the price.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of cocoa, plum, green pepper and matchstick lead to somewhat smoky flavors. Gruff tannins back it up.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of plum, blueberry, vanilla, orange rind and spice lead to light creamsicle flavors. It's pleasant, though the variety seems impossible to place.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a medium-weight Cab from the warm climes of Langhorne Creek, a region southeast of Barossa. It offers a noseful of plummy fruit, baking and green herb spices, tobacco leaf and toasted oak notes that feel just a tad soapy. The palate is silky and soft yet more restrained than some of its jammier compatriots, but the fruit does feel a little sour at times and the tannins a touch bitter at the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Cabernet's recognizable green characters are on show here—tobacco leaf and green pepper—followed by red currant and plum fruit and some charred oak notes. Medium bodied, the palate feels somewhat thin and the tannins a touch astringent, a sensation that's aided by sharp-edged acidity, but the fruit is tangy and the varietal character shows right to the finish.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: With 15% Cabernet Franc, 8% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, this opens in smoky char, cedar and pencil, the underbelly flirting into green. Simple and straightforward, it delivers varietal flavor without much fuss.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This is a good, solid, drinkable wine that offers pleasant plum and cherry flavors, a smooth texture and decent balance. It's medium bodied and will be a versatile wine for everyday occasions.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: In this 100% Cabernet wine, vanilla bean, coconut flakes, game, cherry, sawdust and licorice aromas lead to subdued, somewhat dried out seeming fruit flavors. It doesn't all work.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Earthy blackberry aromas feed into a palate with grinding tartaric acidity. Pointy berry flavors are lemony and oaky, while this finishes quickly, like a snap of the fingers. Everything on the surface of this Cab is good, but there's not much depth to it.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is full of savory feral components, a mix of pencil shavings, black currant, tobacco and oak. Compressed tannins give it a sturdy, dry quality that leans into dried herb and a short finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Fresh, grapy aromas and straightforward blackberry flavors add up to a simple, uncomplicated and satisfying wine that is medium bodied and has a welcome touch of tannin. It is made from organic grapes.

name: ZD 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Brimming in sage and dried herb, this is a somewhat dull, leathery and overtly earthy wine, with full-bodied ripeness that holds back in fruit.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a transition vintage with a new consulting winemaker coming on board. There's a slightly bitter anise note ringing through the core of tart cranberry and raspberry, but it's a clean and precise wine with some mid-term aging potential. It spent 18 months in one-third new French oak.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Earthy black fruit aromas are a bit desiccated, a like prune. This feels beefy and tannic more than elegant. Dried berry flavors include a green note, while this organic-grape Cabernet flattens out on a full but rubbery finish.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Overripe cherry, dried herb and spice aromas are followed by full-bodied black fruit flavors backed by a firm grip of tannins. It runs hot, with the volatiles seeming a bit amped.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are unusual, with notes of berry, gummy bear, Twizzler and spice. Quite ripe, extracted black fruit flavors follow, with the tannins a bit gruff. The warmth of the vintage shows.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a simple if balanced, full-bodied wine with a flavor profile that includes rhubarb, red currant, tobacco leaf, menthol and black olive, gripped by savory tannins and closing on a spicy note.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
