description: Bay leaf and cedar dot a soft, moderately structured wine that's well-priced and lightly ripe. A taste of bouillon and leather wrap around chalky tannin and toasted oak.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: The aromas bring heaping amounts of dried green pepper, along with raspberry, herb and pencil eraser. Plush, full-bodied cherry flavors follow. The tannins bring a dry grip. Give it time in the cellar to see if it comes around.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is sanguine in red currant and cranberry, made in an elegant, nuanced style highlighting thick tannins and oak over fruit. Accents of tobacco, cedar and pencil are nice companions.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A midnight black color is backed by herbal aromas of dark berry fruits and cassis that burn. On the palate, this feels a bit sappy and heavy, with a thick base. Dark, roasted plum and cassis flavors finish steady but with heft and weight.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Made in large quantities at a fair price, this wine delivers plenty of body and flavors, including 8% Petit Verdot and 2% Merlot. Smoky oak supports a soft supple texture of midpalate intensity and rich red fruit.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This includes 5% Merlot, 3% Petite Sirah and 2% Petit Verdot, a nicely made blend offered at a fair price that delivers juicy black-cherry flavor around soft simple texture and tannin, with a lasting note of mocha.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Spice, high-toned herb and plum aromas lead to restrained fruit flavors. It's pleasant but seems a bit innocuous, with the concentration at times not all there.

name: Serafino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Aromas of raspberry jam, black cherry and licorice lead to front-loaded, ripe fruit flavors that trail toward the finish. It seems to have a hole in the middle, threaded with medicinal notes.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of black fruits and blacktop are tarry, while this Cab feels gritty and powerful on the palate. Dark, spicy black fruit flavors come with a note of chocolate, while this is dense and meaty and doesn't fall apart on a finish that tastes mildly green.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 100% varietal, with all of the fruit coming from Quintessence Vineyard. Aromas of gardenia, ripe cherry, barrel spice and herb are followed by soft raspberry and cherry flavors. It needs more structure to stand it all up.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Herbal and thick in tannin, this wine possesses a wealth of full-bodied ripeness and oak, with a savory earthy backbone of tree bark, sage and tobacco. The fruit is elusive, more dark and brooding than expressive, with plenty of heat on offer.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of black licorice, vanilla extract, cherry and spice lead to full-bodied cranberry and vanilla flavors. The oak influence (24 months in French) seems quite intense.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This wine is thick, rich and decadently soft with a cherry-vanilla sweetness on the nose that follows through on the full-bodied palate.

name: Fiftyrow 2016 Alice Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: With the assistance of winemaker Margo Van Staaveren, the golfer offers a 100% varietal wine that's soft and supple in appeal. Red fruit and light spice, chocolate and cedar notes accent a rich full-bodied character that's dense, dark and brooding.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Moderate in structure this embraces a heady cradling of oak, which emphasizes firm chalky tannins around the 100% varietal wine's brooding richness of black-cherry jam and dark chocolate. Black tea and traces of black licorice figure into the mix.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: In this Cabernet Sauvignon blended with 18% Sangiovese, vanilla, baking spice, leather, cranberry and earth aromas lead to full-feeling dark fruit flavors with a warm finish. The tannins have a slightly scratchy feel.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Herbal in clove and peppercorn, this is a dusty tannic red wine from the mountain vineyard, hearty and yet soft in underlying texture. The richness of the black fruit is additionally emphasized by a notion of mocha and marshmallow voluptuousness.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: A dark and dense color along with ripe, mossy aromas of herbal black fruits and grilled meat create interest and confidence prior to a full but sappy and drying palate that's more jammy than fit. Spicy oak and herbal black fruit flavors hold their own on a weighty finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: The aromas pop, with notes of overripe raspberry, black cherry, macerated cranberry, vanilla and green pepper. Ripe dark fruit flavors follow, with the tannins giving a firm handshake. Drink now.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This starts off fairly ripe and rich, oozing plums, berries, dark chocolate, ground white pepper and dried leafy, herbal notes. The palate is more restrained than the nose suggests, although there's still some warmth here from the alcohol. The tangy, plummy fruit is framed in sandy tannins, and although this doesn't show a ton of varietal character, it's a solid wine nonetheless.

name: Timark 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Dusty leather and pillowy tannins surround a core of full-bodied black currant, cedar and dried herb. The structure is moderate and softly rich.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 7% Syrah added to the whole, this wine is tart in red fruit and citrus tones with bright acidity. It has a strong foundation of tannin and oak upon which additional highlights include white pepper and spicy nutmeg.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This Margaret River Cab is quite closed and reductive at first. It takes some time in the glass to open but eventually reveals aromas of red currant, raspberry, pencil lead and dried leaves. The palate is lean and chalky in texture. The oak feels somewhat clunky, but a tight line of tannins holds everything together.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of dark chocolate, spice, red apple and raspberry lead to ripe but well-constructed flavors. A warm finish caps it off. It carries a lot of heat, but there are good things behind it.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: A 100% varietal, this comes from the oldest commercial Cabernet Sauvignon plantings in the valley. High-toned aromas of dried herb, barrel spice, vanilla and cherry lead to soft, chocolaty fruit flavors with a Port-like quality.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This wine offers a lot of quality at an affordable price. Lovers of classic big reds will dig the ripe plum, berry, cola, vanilla and earthy, herbal aromas. The tannins are tightly wound and drying but are balanced by silky red fruit with herbal nuances. There's power here, but also balance and restraint. Drink now with protein and until 2029.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: From the heart of the appellation this wine is dark and juicy in blackberry with plenty of power and heat. Rich dusty notes of clove, tobacco and chocolate give it a roundness that complements and tames the more tannic edges, finishing in toasted oak.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From a beloved site on the Rutherford Bench, this wine is soft in red cherry and plum, with a dusty framework of integrated oak and rounded richness. The structure is supple and simple in approach, allowing the fruit to speak.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a nicely made wine that was given extra time in bottle and now delivers outstanding quality for the price. Lean and muscular in approach, it comes from vineyards on Howell Mountain and Glass Mountain, sharing a darkness of oak and blackberry, the tannins pillowy and seasoned in clove and cola.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of char, dried herb, matchstick and cherry lead to chocolaty plum and cherry flavors that show a sense of polish. It's surprisingly restrained considering the warmth of the vintage and appellation. Best after 2024, with a very long life beyond that.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Examples of the variety from this appellation are somewhat rare. The aromas show notes of bittersweet chocolate, peat, mortared dried herbs, smoke, brown spices, raspberry and cherry. The flavors dance lightly but show pleasing balance throughout. Char notes linger on the finish.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This aromatic Cab opens with a plummy, red currant tang, flanked by white pepper, dried green herbs, graphite and a hint of dried flowers. Medium to full in body, the fruit is plush but bright, backed by herbal, graphite characters right through to the close. Soft-edged but grippy, grainy tannins and a streak of oak support without overwhelming.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Juicy with clove and cedar seasoning, this is a well-made wine that's fairly priced, thick with walls of concentrated black cherry and boysenberry. Full bodied and unapologetically ripe, it finishes in a swirl of smoky oak.

name: Blackbird Vineyards 2016 Contrarian Red (Napa Valley)
description: Chunky red fruit and herb combine effortlessly in this appellation wine, blended with 2% Petit Verdot. Pencil shavings and oak contribute savory complexity against a wall of thick tannins that evolve and soften in the glass.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is the producer's first vintage and it impresses in soft tannins that wrap effortlessly around a core of full-bodied cherry and vanilla. It offers touches of dried herb and cedar that last on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This restrained expression of Cabernet Sauvignon offers savory herb, olive and tart plum flavors, with pinpoint balance and firm tannins. It drinks quite well and has the stuffing to age another half decade. Drink through 2024.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Made by Martha McClellan and Wesley Steffens of Vineyard 7 & 8, this is a tremendous wine for the price, blended with 7% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot, the fruit from two estate vineyards on Spring Mountain as well as a Beckstoffer property on the valley floor. Fruity and floral, it has a densely concentrated palate of cinnamon-toast and vanilla-bean flavor that evolves and delights on the palate.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's estate and combined with small amounts of Malbec, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this is an Old World-style, graceful expression of relatively cool-climate Cab, leathery and tight in tannin structure. Plum, cherry and fresh acidity give it a lift of fruitiness around dots of dried herb.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: An immediately appealing nose is deep and cedary and offers plentiful blackberry, tobacco, vanilla and mocha aromas. While this is a touch choppy and tannic in feel, it's also far from dull. Chocolaty oak forms the top and bottom layers of the flavor profile, with blackberry and spiced plum in the middle. A toasty finish with smoky oak and tannic ribbing closes this out; drink through 2025.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's estate vineyard on Mount Veeder, this is a thick, concentrated wine of tremendous flavor. Rich black fruit dominates around an orbit of sweet tobacco, dark chocolate and crayon wax, with just a touch of reduction nipping at the finish. This is a full and robustly powerful wine.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas offer notes of herb, black fruit, graphite, cocoa, plum and spice. Compact, somewhat bunched up-seeming fruit flavors follow. It needs time to come together.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This bottling exhibits the richness that's made Paso Robles famous, yet at a price point that's great for frequent indulgence. Inky in the glass, the bottling's lush nose offers concentrated black cherry, caramel, cocoa and coffee. It's soft and smooth on the palate, where the black-cherry compote flavors are lifted by star anise and clove.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is ripe to the point of sweetness, blending vanilla and milk-chocolate notes from oak with dried plum and raisin flavors.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: This Rutherford vineyard provides brightness and depth to the proceedings here—a mix of shy floral tones and fresh currant. High-toned flavors have a backbone of soft rounded caramel and velvety texture, finishing in cinnamon toast and bittersweet chocolate. Enjoy 2021–2030.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Layered, rich and nicely tannic, this full-bodied wine surrounds ripe black cherry and blackberry tones with a firm, velvety texture and achieves good balance, too. Intricate nuances of nutmeg, cinnamon and tobacco keep it interesting. The wine is rather tight to drink now but should have a good future. Best after 2022.

name: Tussock Jumper 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (San Juan)
description: Extremely obvious oak aromas and flavors knock this wine off balance and don't allow much flavor from the grapes to show through. It smells and tastes like pungent cedar, cloves and charred wood.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This blends in a healthy 17% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec, the grapes from several of the valley's appellations, including Oakville and Mount Veeder. In total, the wine is intense in power and tightly wound grip, with textured layers of tar, cocoa powder and black currant. It has years to go in bottle. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Ruby to the eye, this wine has a nose of blackberry and lavender. It is smooth in the mouth, with velvety tannins and flavors of black cherry, cassis, anisette and rose petal. The spicy finish winds down with an orange zest note.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: In typical Penfolds style, this is a multi-regional, multi-vineyard blend from across the warmest regions of South Australia. The sunshine shows in the form of ripe raspberries and currants along with dark chocolate and dried mint. The palate is silky-textured and oozes with ripe, almost jammy, fruit and savory, grainy tannins. This is approachable now with time decanter and alongside protein, but best after a few years in cellar and then for the next decade. Drink 2022–2032.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Grippy black cherry and blackberry burst out of the entry of this full-bodied, richly concentrated wine, its palate lush, smooth and big-boned. Dried herb and a floral tease of rose round out the fruit-forward experience.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softly textured and full bodied in richness and ripe concentration, this wine is woody and earthy, with a backbone of black currant, clove, black pepper and sizable grip.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dark aromas of blackberry, baked earth, licorice and chaparral scrub show on the nose of this rich and extracted bottling. The palate is also lush and juicy with black-currant and caramel flavors, yet held in check by chalky tannins.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine has a classic herbal element of sage, sous-bois and mint, tucked within soft layers of integrated tannin and oak. Medium bodied, it shines in rich blue fruit and a lasting note of clove.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Packaged in one of the more impressive labels on the market, this very young wine is quite ready now, starting with fresh aromas of blackberry sauce, crushed slate and dried herbs. Chalky tannins frame the sip, where ripe red-fruit flavors lead into herbs, smoked meat and cocoa.

name: Parallel 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big bold wine, layered in concentrated flavors of cassis and red currant that present as sanguine and woody. Gritty, sizable tannins add intensity and boldness to the hugely ripe style of the wine.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Ripe cranberry sorbet, orange peel and a pinch of tarragon show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit tangy with strawberry-balsamic flavors and a pinch of herbs.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 Fay Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This wine has significant tannin power that presents as grippy and powerful on the palate. Soft underlying aspects of violet, dark cherry and plum are complemented by graphite and toasted oak, all within a full-bodied ripe rich persona. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Ad Vivum 2015 Sleeping Lady Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This is a thick, richly layered red from the producer's site—one of the cooler sides of the vineyard. Lush on the palate, it has tender elements of black currant, smoked meat, black pepper, licorice and lavender, a complex array of elements that shows room for further evolution. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Ripeness is paramount in this full-bodied, dark-fruit-forward wine crafted by Winemaker Kirk Venge. It smells and tastes soaked in late-picked grape and berry flavors, has a broad, almost thick texture and full mouthfeel. The oak influence is not obvious, but adds complexity and grip to the midpalate and finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Classic Coonawarra, this wine is inky-hued, rich and powerful. The nose is a melody of eucalyptus, dried herbs, mint chocolate, black currants and raspberries, with an iron-like quality. The palate is where the power comes into play, with savory tannins wrapping around the tongue, saved by a spine of acidity and plump fruit. Give this time in the cellar for the palate to settle some. Drink 2020–2030 at least.

name: Hess Collection 2016 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From the wilds of the appellation and blended with 16% Merlot and 9% Cabernet Franc, this wine is dense, layered and soft—a robust expression of chocolate, caramel and juicy blackberry. The oak is well integrated and supportive of polished powerful tannins.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From the exciting appellation that is Coombsville, this wine starts with beautiful aromas of violet and clove before opening up on the palate to a generous array of blackberry, plum and black pepper. Full bodied, it shows elegance and a sense of balance that holds up through a lengthy finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine is made from some of the smallest, densest berries on the property's northern end, a warm, intense place for grapes. Floral on the nose, it presents chalky tannin, ash and crushed rock-like minerality around a core of red and black cherry as well as plum. It offers substantial concentration and robust richness.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Floral in a heady mix of cherry blossom and lavender, this light-styled red is sanguine in red currant and cassis. Firm tannins provide support without distraction, the oak equally integrated and subtle. Robust and ripe on the midpalate, the wine has a graceful finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Gorgeous floral aromas and a rich, dense palate of saturated black fruits give power and breadth to this full-bodied and firmly textured wine. Aromas of violet, cinnamon and sandalwood make way for very ripe black-cherry and blueberry flavors underlain with firm but very fine-grained tannins.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: For a Coonwarra Cab, this is downright light, but by more global standards it's in the medium-full bodied range. Blood red in hue and a little sanguine in aroma and flavor as well, this wine shows lifted aromas of red and black currants and iodine. The palate shows more plush berries, a lick of woody oak influence and tannins which are fine-grained and brawny but silky, too. The finish is long, juicy and savory.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: Winemaker Jeff Ames marks his first vintage with this producer, crafting an exceptional, age-worthy wine. The tightly structured palate is youthful, coiling in flavors of black raspberry, cherry pie and supportive oak. Let this one settle a bit; enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Both concentrated and luxurious, this wine is a classic that offers a broad range of enticing aromas, plenty of delicious fruit in the middle and a lingering finish. Clove, cedar and cassis fill the aromas, while ripe blueberry and black cherry flood the palate. A great balance of a velvety texture and soft tannins holds it all together.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This wine has a bright entry of dark and red cherry and a nice grip of structure. Powerful, it provides a silky-smooth texture that's integrated with the tannins and oak, with complex accents of clove, leather and black pepper along the way.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a powerfully built, age-worthy wine, robustly concentrated and dense in elements of tobacco, gunpowder, turned earth and leather. Sizable tannins give it additional weight and breadth, as well as structure: a sign of the vintage as well as site. Best 2025–2030.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty rock and mineral characterize this wine throughout its full-bodied concentration of ripe plum and black cherry. Cedar, graphite and oak provide context and additional complexity, rounding out on a finish of dried herb, clove and black pepper.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Brawny in supple baked black fruit, this wine is largely concentrated and robust in dense, secondary waves of mocha, black licorice and vanilla. Complex elements of dried herb and sage nip at the palate with ease, complementing the undeniable richness.

name: Diamond Creek 2016 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This is a “wow” wine: brawny, broad and juicy in black fruit. Blended with 5% Merlot and 4% Malbec, the grapes from the coolish appellation, it offers robust oak and tannin within savory notes of cedar, tobacco and toast. This is one worth cellaring; enjoy 2024–2029.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: From another great site farmed by the famous Beckstoffer, this is grainy, textured and robustly ripe. Powerfully built to age and impress, it offers a wealth of lush, layered blue fruit and black licorice, as well as impressive structure. Enjoy 2026–2031.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is a well-integrated wine from the warmer appellation, the oak and tannin relatively tamed within a rich framework of baked plum, cherry and exuberant acidity. The flavors are robustly concentrated and widely appealing.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Leafy, earthy red-fruit aromas show a hint of animal. Tightness drawn from tomatoey acidity and rubbing tannins make food a requirement, while currant and berry flavors are tight and reedy. This is a dry red-fruit Cabernet that emphasizes freshness and tension.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Penley's top wine has a lot going on. Aromas include mint, dark chocolate, violet, currant, dried herbs and a prominent streak of graphite. The palate is knit together with fine-grained, tightly wound tannins and seamlessly balanced by silky-textured fruit and acidity. This should age beautifully for many years. Drink 2020–2033.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: There's a touch of fizz to the glass of this twist-top bottling, which indicates a freshness that shows in the snappy berry aromas on the nose. The palate offers herbal touches of tobacco against tangy dark-red fruits. The body is somewhat thin but the overall experience is pleasurable.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A big oaky nose smells of animal and Brett as well as blueberry and blackberry. This Cabernet is chunky and full but not all that structured. Savory gamy berry flavors finish with touches of mint, earth and leather.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This ripe and expressive wine exudes an earthy, black-fig aroma, then rich and concentrated black-cherry and dried date flavors are accented by spicy, wet earth and oak notes and a mouthfeel shaped by velvety tannins.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of plum, green herb, licorice, cigar box and baking spice lead to somewhat disjointed-seeming fruit flavors, with a firm lick of dry tannins on the outer edges. It doesn't all come together at present.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas of licorice, herb, tire rubber, raspberry and cherry bring a sense of delineation. The palate is plump in the middle, less so around the edges. There are a lot of interesting parts, but they don't fit together at present.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Candied black cherry makes for a very expressive, almost sweet nose on this bottling. The palate blossoms with purple flowers of lilac and jasmine, yet it is somewhat thin in body.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Thickly tannic right from the start, this wine feels overloaded with astringent, charred flavors of coffee grounds, earth and stem. The black cherry fruit is concentrated but overwhelmed. It will require aggressive aeration to bring it back into relative balance.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This bottling, aged in 100% American oak, offers earthy aromas of forest floor, concentrated cassis and a balsamic berry sauce on the nose. Chunky sticky tannins deliver flavors of dark chocolate and dried berries, which turn tangy toward the finish.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of raspberry and cherry along with cola, herb and spice accents, pushing the boundaries of ripeness. The palate can't quite live up to that promise, coming off as lighter in style with slightly grippy tannins out of the gate. Coffee notes linger on the finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Meaty plum and berry aromas are gamy at first, then more full and round with the benefit of airing. A full and grabby palate displays muscle and tannins more than finesse, while savory berry and plum flavors finish with residual dryness. Drink this authentic Cabernet through 2022.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Mature berry, dusty barn and slight volatility tamp down the nose on this flush muscular Cabernet. Spiced plum flavors are savory and fruity at the same time. A steady finish with honest but hard tannins are a plus and suggest this as a good dinner wine, especially for meat dishes.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Spicy black-fruit aromas are in the lead, backed by mild notes of tomato leaf and green herbs. A tight and juicy palate features bold acidity, while flavors of blackberry, black currant and black pepper wrap up on a fresh finish that's slightly raw and tart.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine seems to teeter on the edge of ripeness, with aromas of green pepper, mint and fresh chopped herb out in front of cherry. The compact, somewhat lighter-styled, blackberry flavors need some time to spread out.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is 100% varietal, with a dash of fruit coming from Stone Tree Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. The aromas are high toned, with notes of baking spice, anise and cherry. Compact, lighter styled fruit flavors follow. It needs time to stretch its legs to show its best.

name: Walnut Crest 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)
description: Almost all of this wine comes from the Old Block at this vineyard. The aromas are light and seem hard to tease out initially, later revealing notes of cherry, tobacco and dried and fresh herb. On the palate, it's elegant, with the flavors focused around the edges and lighter in the middle.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Funky aromas of olive, rubber and sea shell announce a wine from Argentina's northlands. This Cafayate Cabernet is tight and hard-edged, while flavors run towards blackened plum, blackberry and pepper. Toasty spice and hard tannins control a rugged finish.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This bottling, which also includes 9% Carmenère, 4% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc, hews toward an older California style of Cab, with dried oregano and cedar overriding black-plum and blackberry aromas on the nose. The palate is also very herbal and rather light, with tight tannins framing flavors of oregano, peppercorn and blackberry.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Dense berry aromas come with notes of clove and nutmeg on a baked nose. Pulling tannins make for a rubbing mouthfeel, while this Cabernet tastes largely of oak and clove, with berry undertones. Spicy oak and minty green notes are both notable on the finish.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is the first clonally labeled Cabernet I am aware of in the state. Herb and flower aromas are out front and make an impression. Over time, notes of dark cherry, anise and earth emerge. There's a lovely sense of delicacy to the palate, though the tannins seem dry, unresolved and gruff, with a touch of bitterness. Best after 2022.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Earthy, somewhat rustic aromas of dried herbs and black cherry make for nicely layered nose. The palate offers gravelly, earthy, loamy flavors that complement the roasted strawberry core.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Roasted berry aromas are initially leathery and earthy, then slightly animal influenced as this Cabernet breathes. Rubbing tannins and a compact mouthfeel eschew elegance, while flavors of plum and berry fruits are dry, peppery and slightly medicinal all the way through the finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Straightforward berry aromas can handle a slight note of volatility. This is a medium-bodied Cabernet with soft tannins translating to easy consumption. Savory spicy berry flavors come with herbal tomato notes, while this feels good and tastes saucy on the finish.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas enchant, with notes of fresh herb, flower, blackberry and cherry, showing a lovely sense of purity and delineation. Far from a big bruiser, the palate brings a compelling sense of elegance and restraint, with cranberry flavors and firm tannins backing it up.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Fairly powerful aromas of black cherry and raisin meet with fudge and caramel on the nose of this ripe bottling. It's thick and lavish with chalky tannins on the palate, with rich blackberry jam and black-pepper flavors.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Cherry and blackberry aromas are intense and chocolaty, while the palate pounds with tannins, acidity and angular berry and plum fruit. As Cabernets go, this one is massive, but with a short finish where the fruit fades and is replaced by maple-like oak and heat. Drink through 2024.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Tobacco and mocha aromas help soften lemony high-toned notes on the nose. A grabby palate shows acidic pinch, while berry flavors are peppery, chocolaty and display caramel and coffee from oak. A drawing but tasty finish says this will last through at least 2022.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Bold berry aromas include a shot of mint. In the mouth, this is sappy and full, with good weight and balance. Plum, berry and cassis flavors are ripe but not jammy or without tension, while modest complexity is displayed on the finish through fresh lightly herbal notes of tomato and pepper. Drink through 2023.

name: Grimm's Bluff 2015 Contango Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This wine is effusively aromatic in violet and wild raspberry, following through on the palate with similar flavors. Compact in medium-bodied ripeness and tannin, it finishes with secondary characteristics of black pepper and leather.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Jammy berry aromas are clean and cheerful. This cool-vintage Cab Sauvignon feels tight, fresh and bursting with energy. Black-plum, wild-berry and peppery flavors finish crisp, dry and lightly toasted.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Plum and dark-berry aromas are slightly minty and mildly green. A dry edgy palate qualifies as fresh, while this tastes largely of fresh plum and black currant along with a hint of toasty oak. A high-energy finish is snappy and fresh, much like the rest of this cool-vintage Cabernet.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Deep fruity aromas of blackberry and black-plum jam meet with wood spice, roasted meat and sarsaparilla on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, which is still young and may grow more interesting with patience. The tannins rise up right away on the palate, offered roasted wood and berry flavors with a coffee, tea and tobacco finish.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Berry aromas include a cool minty note as well as a touch of animal. Like most Mendoza and Uco Valley 2016 Cabernets, this is tight and snappy in feel due to a cool and rainy year. Lightly herbal berry flavors are slightly woody, while this is clipped and dry on the finish.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Softened with the addition of 25% Merlot, this wine offers a combination of power with grace. Touches of tar, petrol and rocky mineral start this off on the nose. It's shows robust and tightly grained tannins on the palate, with a bold shock of blue fruit and cinnamon.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Stalky berry and plum aromas come with a rugged scent of burning brush prior to a palate that's sinewy and acidic more than filled out and fruity. Leafy herbal flavors of red plum and red currant are fresh, racy and taut on a reserved finish. At only 13.5% ABV, this is a much lighter version of Alta than in the past.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Candied black-raspberry aromas meet with elegant mace and star anise spice on the nose of this bottling. There's a backbone of black-plum jelly and purple flowers to the sip, which is layered throughout in Christmas spices.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Floral aromas of violet and cherry blossom drop into rich black-cherry and cocoa tones on the nose of this widely available bottling. The palate is juicy in black cherry and blackberry flavors, with accents of oak and cracked pepper, all framed by a chalky texture.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: A closed nose bubbles to life with tones of coconut and ripe berries, while the hefty palate is built by gripping tannins. Black-fruit flavors reign, with notes of hoisin sauce and licorice on the side. Drink through 2022.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the mountain appellation, this offers aromas of violet and cedar before delving into powerful flavors of cherry, blueberry and graham cracker. Well-developed tannins support the frame, retaining plenty of acidity and underlying succulence. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this bottling, which is cofermented with 10% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, shows dried dill and roasted fennel bulb on the nose, with a strawberry tone slowly emerging. Oregano and black pepper meet with red fruit, star anise and cinnamon on the palate, which is still young and needs more time to come into its own.

name: Vasse Felix 2015 Tom Cullity Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Margaret River)
description: From the great site in Rutherford, this wine is dusty and weighty in blue fruit, leather and polished grippy tannin. With a touch of that grip on the texture, it shows as complex and robustly ripe and full bodied, offering an explosive concentration of up-front succulence and savory underbelly.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Plush, lengthy and well integrated, this is a complex exotic mix of black licorice, leather, meat and plum. Made from one of the warmest parts of the vineyard, it has robust tannin structure and tension, finishing in a burst of clove and pepper.

name: Kenzo Estate 2016 Murasaki Estate Bottled Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Dried herb, cedar and pencil shavings mark this rich, full-bodied wine that offers earth and plum flavors. Robust and concentrated, it holds its density well, allowing room for the fruit to breathe, all while seasoned in clove and black pepper.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Oak Knoll wine is bright, integrated, tamed in tannin and juicy. Gorgeous inviting aromatics make an immediate statement, opening the door for a stage of animated blueberry, blackberry and cassis. The texture is complex but supple and smooth.

name: Shafer 2004 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Named for the late matriarch of the property, this is a blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot, all of it grown on hillside estate vineyards. It dances around cherry, cassis and rose petal, the core of the wine soft in integrated tannins and oak. Balanced in weight, it is undeniably lovely, complex and beautiful. It will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2024–2034.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth and grippy, this wine offers a beautiful undercurrent of balanced bright acidity, which lifts the richness of the fruit to new levels. Blueberry, black cherry and graphite combine with ease around powerful dusty tannin and toasted oak.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick and richly built with bright red fruit, this has integrated tannin and oak. A touch of grip rides around the edges of the fruit and clove spice, which are nuanced in layers of black licorice, blueberry and cassis. Full bodied, the wine has a wealth of minerality at its core.

name: Hall 2014 Rainin Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Brightly woven in cassis and black raspberry, this is a blockbuster wine, sumptuous and seductive in enviable structure and complexity. Polished tannins wrap around a rich, balanced core of rounded fruit, with a bite of cedar and oak vying for attention.

name: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a gorgeous, memorable and classically styled wine, grippy in tannin and a leathery texture that's complex and complicated. Black pepper, black cherry and toasted oak give it definition that evolves stunningly in the glass.

name: Fox in the Hen House 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)
description: Cedar box and mesquite aromas are at the fore, with the cherry notes seeming subdued and dried out. Ripe, jammy, sweet fruit flavors follow. It doesn't all work.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a fruity, soft-textured and rounded wine that has raspberry and cherry-extract flavors, very low tannin content and a syrupy, almost-sweet character.

name: Hugh Hamilton 2016 The Villain Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Soapy grapey aromas fail to round into anything more specific or elevated. On the palate, this is clampy and rubbery, without much give. Flavors of grapey-berry fruits and rhubarb veer towards green, while rough tannins on the finish are grabby.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Black currant, tire rubber, green herb and mesquite aromas are followed by fruit flavors that paint around the edges, missing in the middle. The variety seems hard to find.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This lightly sweet and syrupy wine smells like waffles and tastes like blueberries. It is medium bodied, soft in texture and very low in tannin.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A cloudy tint and gritty pulling aromas of underripe berry fruits make for a challenging start. Raw and scrubbing tannins frame slightly green berry flavors, while this is dry and scratchy on the finish.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Lighter in color than the norm for this variety. The aromas offer notes of raspberry gummy and herb. The flavors are quite dilute, with the concentration lacking and the tannins gritty.

name: Castoro Cellars 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Lighter aromas of dried herb, licorice, vanilla and cherry are out front. Light, tangy fruit flavors follow, with the tannins showing a bit of grit.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is very fruity in flavor and soft and easy in texture. It has low acidity, very little noticeable tannin and a rather thick, syrupy mouthfeel.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Pure berry aromas lean toward black fruits. On the palate, this cool-vintage Cabernet is fresh and firm, with a tight grip. Cherry and berry flavors are quick and punchy, with a touch of supporting oak, while a dry finish with crisp acidity includes plum and cherry notes.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of overripe cherry, herb and fruit leather lead to dried-out-seeming fruit flavors backed by gritty tannins. It all seems quite desiccated, with the heat of the vintage showing.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed oak is smoky and a tad rough around the edges, the wine offering a fruity and lush midpalate that takes on a harsh green component as it finishes soft and simple.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas offer varietal notes of dried and fresh herb, along with whiffs of spice and cherry. The flavors are somewhat lighter in style, with the tannins having a grainy feel.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cassis, cherry, animal fur, sugar beet and raisiny aromas are telling in that they struggle to come together, much like the rest of this hard-pounding Cabernet from a difficult vintage for late-harvest reds. Clipped plum and olive flavors are uncomfortable on a chippy palate with acidity and astringency issues.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Comes from this esteemed vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. The aromas rise up, with notes of apple, dried cherry and baking spice, seeming a bit desiccated. Plentiful fruit flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a firm grip, needing some time to loosen.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Dry and full-bodied, this wine has extra-ripe fruit aromas that verge on balsamic, concentrated cherry and cranberry flavors and firm tannins that tighten the texture.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a relatively light, smooth and honest version of a typically tannic varietal. It offers vivid black-cherry and blackberry flavors, no assertive oakiness, a slightly gripping mouthfeel and medium body.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a rare Columbia Valley appellated wine that comes from a vineyard on the Oregon side. Baking-spice, mocha, cherry and tire-rubber aromas are at the fore. Somewhat lighter-seeming fruit flavors follow and paint around the edges. It provides interest but doesn't all work.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Jumbled aromas of roasted fruits and road tar come around with airing but are never fully convincing. This Cabernet feels sappy and mildly abrasive, while foresty berry flavors are modest, as is a fleshy finish.

name: Derange 2016 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Dried out aromas of cherry, anise, vanilla, baking spice and cola lead to a palate that shows more of the same. The fruit seems quite desiccated, with the tannins a bit jagged. It seems quite evolved for its age.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Well structured and filled with straightforward fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine is nicely dry, concentrated and appealing without overt oak influence. Ripe cherry and blackberry notes fill the aroma while equally vivid fruit flavors coat the palate.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Sourced from 1985 plantings on the Oregon side of the Columbia river, this is a light version of Cabernet, with gentle flavors of berry, underbrush and dried herbs. It's balanced and shows some interesting complexity, but should be consumed over the next four or five years.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: A rusty color and aromas of root beer, maple and scented soap indicate that this mature Cabernet is not about fruit. Fig, chocolate and overripe base flavors end with strong suggestions of Port and Sherry. This is interesting more than anything else at this point. Drink now.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fruit for this wine comes from the Rocks District. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of black olive, raspberry, smoke, licorice, high-toned savory herb, cherry, crushed chalk and spice. Soft, light, savory fruit flavors follow with a cranberry-filled finish.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: The aromas offer notes of fresh herb, cigar box, barrel spice and dark cherry, seeming subdued out of the gate. Plentiful, somewhat lighter-styled cherry flavors follow. Grainy, slightly dry tannins provide support. It's in an awkward place right now.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Concentrated black-currant aromas lead into charred oak and wood-ash aromas on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 12% Petite Sirah, 4% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot and 3% Malbec. The palate is a bit tart and sour with black-plum skin flavors at first, but then a black-cherry richness shines through alongside singed tobacco.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Jammy raisin and fig aromas are less than resolute, while a hard-driving, intense palate is less than refined. Forward plum and berry flavors come with toasty oak as a backup, while on the finish this darkens up and takes on a peppery flavor profile.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: The aromas seem hyper ripe, especially for this producer and site, with notes of cassis, blackberry and spice. Ripe fruit flavors follow, with dry-seeming tannins providing support. It's an odd mix.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Cherry and blackberry aromas are accented by tire rubber. A tight linear palate is a bit scratchy, while herbal plum and currant flavors fade quickly on a finish that shows an oaky note of clove.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Foxy berry and plum aromas rattle around before settling on scented hand soap. A tight palate owes its feel to grape skins, while staunch acidity sticks out. Said acidity makes for narrow plum flavors and a drawing finish with controlled tartness.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This comes from a site in Pope Valley on the eastern edge of the appellation, where the grapes are grown at 1,200-feet in elevation. Red currant, clove and turned earth top a layer of grippy reduction and sizable oak, with secondary elements of tar and leather.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: This shows moderate scents of ripe black plum, blueberry and raspberry that ride over subtle hints of blackcurrant leaf, bramble and pressed purple flowers. Medium weight and smooth on the palate, it boasts crushed-velvet tannins. The medium-length finish offers a solid fruit presence that veers toward berry compote and crumble, with lingering sweet spice.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Meaty, big-boned and steeped in both woody oak and tannin, this is a brawny full-bodied wine with ample concentration. The midpalate takes on a succulence of juicy black currant and black cherry, finishing with a leathery accent.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A juicy midpalate of raspberry and black cherry is met by polished tannin and integrated oak in this well-made wine from a soft, approachable vintage.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Woodward Canyon Estate, Champoux, Sagemoor and Spring Creek vineyards. Despite seeing just 50% new oak, aromas of baking spice and vanilla are at the fore at present, in front of notes of herb and cherry. The palate brings a suave feel, with a lovely sense of texture, dipping in the middle before coming back together. The oak influence is intense right now. Give it time to settle in. Best after 2023.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Cinnamon and clove season sanguine elements of smoked meat and blue fruit in this broadly structured, well-made wine. Big in flavor, it finishes in a length of toasty oak.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a throwback to a more savory style of Cabernet Sauvignon that was once the norm in California. Aromas of crushed oregano, peppercorn and pencil shavings lead into a palate that is full in rocky minerality and dried herbs, but there's also dark cranberry fruit to round it out.

name: Beaulieu Vineyard 2016 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a three-acre block on the producer's estate, this is an herbal, woody and earthy red wine. Generous helpings of oak and concentration grasp bold flavors of black cherry, currant as well as richer hits of dark chocolate and coffee.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Charred meat, smoked boysenberries, crushed gravel and charcoal make for a savory nose on this bottling by Greg Martellotto, whose Italian family has made wine for generations. Dried herbs, tangy cranberries and roasted meats show on the palate, which offers a hefty weight and should age well.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This is a small-production offering from a small producer. It opens in a beautifully floral display of rose and sage, following through with a substantial weight and breadth of cassis and black cherry. The oak is rich and rewarding while allowing the wine to remain balanced and elegant.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Brambly berry, black plum and cherry abound on the nose of this attractive wine. Touches of cinnamon stick, violet and milk chocolate add interest. The medium-weight palate is fresh and vibrant in ripe fruit tones, with velvety tannins and ample acidity. It's well balanced and harmonious, while the lasting finish evolves from fruit flesh to soil then tree bark and finally soft sweet spice.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is juicy, structured and high toned, with elegant flavors of red cherry and cassis. High powered, it has contrasting notions of dried herb, clove and black pepper that play well against the fruit and a gritty oaky texture.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: This wine is currently quite big and bold. The bouquet opens with robust, abundant dark plum, cherry, boysenberry and blackberry fruit scents that are hit by notes of fresh soil, roasted cocoa nib and cigar box spice. It opens up to reveal more nuance—graphite, sweet tobacco—with time. The dark fruits and medium-plus tannins create a bold, gripping structure that fills the mouth and finishes long. It has the stuffing to age well, so drink 2022–2026.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: A fresh cherry aroma is wrapped in loads of intriguing spice on the nose of this bottling, including clove, mint and cocoa. A chalky texture of grainy tannins frames the palate, where plum, blackberry, dried ginger and more baking-spice flavors ride a persistent acidity.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: From a hillside site between Oak Knoll and Coombsville, this is a sanguine, elegant red densely layered and plush in soft oak. Red currant, clove, cedar and cherry make appearances within savory complements of leather and tobacco.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in rose and violet, this reserve-worthy red displays deft notes of currant, dark cherry and plum along an exotic mineral-laden lineup of crushed rock and cocoa powder. Plush and broadly expansive in tannin, it persists in a classic, old-world finish of dried herb, sage and clove. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: A mix of forest and floral aromas frames berry notes on the attractive nose. Full extraction and heavy tannins make for a weighty palate that needs more time, while this Cabernet tastes like a bowl of plums and blackberries. On the finish, licorice and burnt toast notes rise up. Drink through 2025.

name: Larkmead 2016 Dr. Olmo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is among winemaker Cathy Corison's finest offerings, made from decades-old vines planted on St. George rootstock. Cassis, red currant and floral elements make for an inviting entry of aromatics that is followed by substantial structure and classic herbal undertones. A pillowy body of balanced elegance is met by an earthy, leathery finish of complex beauty.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This bottling by industry veterans John and Helen Falcone always packs in Paso Robles' lushness without breaking the bank. Creamy aromas of black-cherry chiffon, lush roses and violets and vanilla-speckled French toast lead into a ripe palate of black cherry, cassis, mocha and caramel. Soft but structural tannins and a proper acidity hold it together.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Inky in the glass, this rich and structured bottling offers a plump black-currant aroma, along with pinches of pepper and tightly woven oak. The palate lands softly and then the tannins rise up, offering savory flavors of charred beef, dark chocolate and black cherry. Drink 2020–2036.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This suave, seductive wine opens with forward aromas of black currant, blackberry and mentholated plum that are hit by green, earthy tones of tobacco leaf, licorice root and flower stem. The palate is full and lush, with rich and opulent dark-fruit flavors that are framed by bold, structuring tannins and lifted by ample acidity, as well as pronounced oak and licorice spice tones. It's harmonious and balanced, with all the components strong and upfront. A complete and delicious wine now, enjoy through 2026.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Ultraripe aromas of raisin, oud wood and musky men's cologne are attractive and complex for a young Cabernet that's putting out at max level in terms of lushness and extraction. Deep oaky blackberry and chocolate flavors hold onto a café-mocha note on a full finish. Drink through 2024.

name: Leonetti Cellar 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is pretty, floral and compact in red fruit, the texture soft and billowy on the palate. Rich and full bodied, it has additional complexity from small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Integrated beautifully, it shows balance and power in equal measure.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: The producer's new Nomad collection includes bottlings from every marquee Beckstoffer Cabernet Sauvignon vineyard in the Napa Valley. This is an herbal, dusty, old-world offering, deep in grippy tannins and the youthful vigor of firm acidity. Pencil shavings, red currant and a streak of cocoa play on the palate with bright abandon. Enjoy best from 2026–2030.

name: Yao Family Wines 2015 Yao Ming Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh on the palate and floral on the nose in a bouquet of rose, lavender and crushed herb, this perennially beautiful, delicate wine benefits from the addition of 7% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot, also from the organically farmed estate. Pencil shavings, coffee and a touch of tobacco add to its savory, earthy nature, contributing to its overall structure and elegance. Enjoy best from 2025 through 2030 if you're able to wait.

name: Joseph Phelps 2015 Insignia Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)
description: The Daou brothers are intent on making this brand the most expensive and luxurious in Paso Robles. This vintage begins with intense aromas of roasted blackberry, tangy black-plum skin and crushed peppercorn. The palate is expertly layered in flavors of cassis, caramel, gravel, loam, cocoa and a hint of licorice. The tannins are firm but already approachable.

name: Fortress 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Gritty aromas of road tar, black olive and rubber don't smell much like Cabernet or any particular variety for that matter. A clampy, pulling palate is high in acidity and low in charm. Flavors of plum, tomato sauce and green herb run out on a choppy, high-acid finish.

name: Turnbull 2016 Black Label Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This winery is focused on setting a new benchmark for what Cabernet Sauvignon from Santa Barbara can be, and this bottling is its best yet. Beautifully layered aromas of black cherry, baking spice, star anise and crushed slate lead into a roasted palate of black plum and chai spices, with acid that carries into the finish.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Light aromas of raspberry and cherry turn more herbal and sassy the longer this sits. A bouncy palate is lean and linear, with no texture or depth. Green-leaning berry and cherry flavors fail to stir interest on an insipid finish.

name: Masia de la Vinya 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Dried cherry, fruit roll-up, hay and jam aromas lead to fruit flavors that show more of the same. It seems extremely evolved for its age.

name: Schug 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas seem quite dried out and evolved for a newly released wine. The flavors come off as light in concentration, missing in the middle.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: This is a stunningly beautiful wine that is ageworthy, complex and will stay with you long after it's gone. Tones of cedar, clove and cinnamon start it off, followed by a dusting of cocoa powder and toasted oak. Lingering threads of crushed rock, violet and currant carry the finish. It finishes soft and silky.

name: RedHeads 2016 Nobs and Snobs Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Clare Valley)
description: The Bourbon-barrel-aged red wine trend is not good. This wine starts with overcooked blackberries, strong clove and burnt caramel on the nose. That caramel and butterscotch kick, thanks to the Bourbon, dominates the palate.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The aromas seem candied, with high-toned notes of raspberry, dried red cherry, hay and game. Slightly sweet seeming cherry and orange peel flavors follow, missing in the middle.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has strong wood and baking-spice aspects in the aromas and flavors that give it a smoky-sweet effect. Candied cherries and vanilla notes stand out from the soft texture.

name: Kunde 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is simple in approach, with a tart, tannic texture that is a little rough on the palate.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Very ripe and extracted aromas of cassis and blackberry syrup meet with a pinch of dried oregano. It's both ripe and tangy on the palate, with balsamic notes.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of overripe red apple and apple skin are out front. The cherry flavors are straight down the fairway, with quite gritty tannins providing support.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Coming from a hot region in a hot vintage, the aromas offer notes of ripe cherry and raisin along with mocha and spice. Full fruit flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a lot of astringency, which causes distraction.

name: Vermeil 2015 Frediani Vineyard Rosedale Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot and Malbec, this red is dull on the nose with a touch of astringency. The red fruit is a mix of currant and black cherry, with a full-bodied ripeness front and center.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas bring high-toned notes of overripe red apple and apple skin along with cherry and spice. The palate has a sense of lushness, not making up for what the aromas lack. Gritty, slight bitter tannins back it up.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Grapy and straightforward, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of fresh and simple fruit aromas, jammy flavors and a soft texture.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has jammy ripe fruit flavors and a vanilla accent accompanied by moderate tannins and oaky undertones.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This wine has equally generous doses of ripe fruit and spicy oak in the aroma, and full body incorporating light tannins to provide some good texture.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine shows the softer side of the varietal. It has attractive black-plum and cherry aromas and flavors, a smooth texture and not much tannin.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Light aromas of jammy dark fruit, orange peel and spice lead to medium-bodied, slightly tangy fruit flavors with dry tannins. It doesn't have the structure to stand up on its own.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Dressed up with flashy oak, this medium-bodied wine smells smoky and spicy, tastes oaky, beefy and dark, and has moderate tannins in the texture.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Lightly candied black-cherry aromas meet with a pinch of herbs, new leather and crushed pepper on the nose of this fairly extracted bottling. The palate is framed by chunky tannins and aggressive acidity, presenting tart blackberry and caramel flavors.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An aroma of smoked meat leads to fairly ripe blackberry flavors as this full-bodied wine fills the mouth with firm tannins. It is nicely dry and has a good, appetizing structure.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a good, well-made wine with the firm structure, tight fruit flavors and length for which the varietal is known. It has tasty red and black-cherry notes, subtle hints of oak and full body.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Loads of crushed herbs and pencil shavings meet with dark fruit and charred wood on the nose of this bottling. There is an elegance to the woody character of the palate, which also shows touches of caramelized blackberry.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This attractive spicy wine has rich tannins fully integrated into the blackberry fruits. Acidity pairs with the structure to give a wine that is fruity as well as firm. Drink now.

name: Serafino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: The nose starts with earthy notes of underripe berries, green tobacco leaf and tilled earth, blended with anise seed and cinnamon stick. With time in the glass, ripe berry aromas emerge to balance the earthiness. Fine-grained tannins lend plenty of structure, propping up flavors of cranberry and raspberry and backed by tons of savory black pepper, clove and sawdust. Well balanced acidity keeps it all together through to the spicy finish that's loaded with cracked pepper and blackberry flavors.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Crushed blackberry, wild herbs and burned chocolate aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a bright blackberry-jam flavor on the palate, along with decent herbal spices and medium acidity.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of char, toast and sweet spice, making it hard to get at the fruit. The palate is lighter styled, bringing a sense of elegance.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon has subdued aromas suggesting dark-skinned berry, bell pepper and scorched earth. The simple but savory palate offers black plum, green peppercorn and a dollop of vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

name: Serafino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: Thick, concentrated and highly ripe, this has small amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Compact oak wraps around dark, dense flavors of plum and black currant before a simple finish closes things out.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: The bulk of this wine comes from Discovery, StoneTree, Pepper Bridge and Dineen vineyards. High-toned, not entirely settled aromas of overripe apple, cherry, anise and dried herb are followed by sweet cherry flavors and dry, lightly grainy tannins. Perhaps some time will bring it together.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Black-currant, black-plum, pencil shavings, wet clay and charred cedar aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted berries, rose petal and cedar show on the palate, which remains a little young despite being four years old.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Creamy and fat black-cherry aromas meet with wet clay and oak on the nose of this bottling. There's a pleasing swath of strawberry and candied cherry on the palate, which is kissed by oak and caramel.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Brooding, not entirely settled aromas of dark coffee, herb, spice and dried cherry lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. Firm, slightly dry tannins back it all up.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This aromatic wine shows a floral and cedar perfume followed by rather dense, concentrated cranberry and tart cherry flavors. It is full bodied, has a gripping texture and decent sense of depth.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This sturdy wine is dry and flavorful without overt oak but with a good structure of fine-grained tannin and acidity. Black-cherry and blackberry flavors fill it out nicely.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Dark blackberry, grape seed, singed caramel and gingerbread-cake aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a compelling spice profile on the palate, which lifts up the richer black-plum-paste backdrop.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: A very dry and somewhat dusty take on the grape, this bottling from the family of famed Los Angeles Dodger manager Tommy Lasorda offers aromas of bay leaf, tobacco and blackberry on the nose. The palate combines herb, soy and tea leaf with tart dark fruit.

name: Makana 2014 Cabernet Franc (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice, nougat, coriander, graphite and coconut are followed by a palate where the barrel influence is out front. Vanilla notes linger on the finish. The wood seems to get in the way of the fruit that is in the glass. There are things to enjoy, but not for all tastes.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Very shy aromas of dark-red fruits and wet crushed rocks show on the nose of this bottling. There is a fresh black-plum kick to the palate, which then verges into more dried territory of leather and tobacco leaf.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Deep garnet in the glass, this wine proffers a bouquet of pomegranate, strawberry and violet. Hefty tannins come on strong and then recede, revealing flavors of black raspberry, cassis, vanilla and fennel seed that wind down to a spice-laden finish.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Freshly pressed boysenberry, wet fennel, smoked wood and dried herbs show on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are well polished, allowing the bright red-fruit and cigar-box flavors to shine through.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is earthy but still delivers the fruit flavors. The nose has some new leather, barnyard and new oak tones, while the flavors evoke boysenberries and grape jam.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big, burly and robustly ripe wine, smoky in oak and leathery tannin. Plum, clove and cola mingle on the palate in dense waves of flavor.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Earthy and oaky tones vie for attention in this deep-colored, full-bodied and firmly textured wine. It has deep moody flavors like clove, beef and coffee and good aspects of layering and complexity.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Red violet in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of blackberry, dark plums and anise. It comes on strong at first sip, with flavors of black cherry, blueberry, lavender and licorice. Silky tannins slowly fade towards an orange-zest finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Broad aromas of caramelized red cherry and dried herbs make for a pleasantly savory entry to this bottling from the historic estate. There is a solid amount of herbal expression on the palate, where the dried oregano sets off the tangy black-plum flavors.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: With nuanced oak and 5% Merlot, this is a value-driven wine, overdelivering for the price in its grasp of earthy, herbal character. Medium-bodied and elegant, it shows a simplicity of plum, cherry and clove spice.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of sawdust, vanilla and dark berries come together on the nose. The palate is smooth in feel while the acid keeps it from veering into creamy territory, offering flavors of tart berries, vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon. There is a bitter edge on the finish that's slathered in fine, sandy tannins.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This family-owned estate has produced a ripe, surprisingly soft wine with gentle tannins and rich blackberry fruits. Juicy acidity gives the wine a fresh edge. The wine is ready to drink now.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoke, concentrated blackberry and wet lava rock aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastside of Paso Robles. The palate is tightly wound with dried herb and fennel flavors, offering riper dark cassis on the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: The aromas are locked up out of the gate, displaying notes of gravel, raspberry, graphite, vanilla and blackberry. The palate brings firm, lightly grainy tannins that seem unresolved at first but soften a bit with significant time open. There are good things going on, but they need to make their way to the surface. Give it a very long decant if opening in the near term. It has beyond impressive staying power for a wine at this price.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This dark-garnet-colored wine has aromas of cherry cola and juniper. It is bright on entry with flavors of black plum, raspberry, thyme and smoked meat. Chalky tannins build in intensity and then back off towards a smooth finish that boasts a splash of cranberry.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of black currant and anisette prepare the palate for flavors of cassis, black cherry, licorice and eucalyptus. Gum-drying tannins offer a backdrop for layers of spice and coolness mixed with dark fruit that wind down towards the minty finish.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of black currant, toasted oak and green peppercorn. The chewy palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and clove alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Aromas of sandalwood and nutmeg meld with raspberry and black cherry on the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon blended with 15% Cabernet Franc. Red and black berry flavors are bright and crunchy on the palate, with bitter cocoa powder and tobacco notes chiming in. This is a well-balanced offering with persistent tannins. Cocoa powder lingers through the finish, joined by raw oak and black currant.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Full aromas of black cherry, smoked wood and cola spice show on the nose of this bottling. Polished tannins wrap the palate, which offers juicy flavors of black currant with a finish of vanilla and caramel.

name: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Candied rosewater, minty tarragon, tangy black-plum and black raspberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers similar black-plum tang along with warmer flavors of lilac and pencil shavings.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of cassis and green bell pepper open to flavors of black currant, raspberry, chocolate, thyme and oregano. It is easy on the palate, with surprisingly soft tannins and note of cranberry on the finish.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: While the 2014 vintage is starting to soften and open, this vintage remains tightly wound and hulking. Ripe blackberries and dried green herbs are blanketed by cola, black pepper and dusting polish. Muscular tannins wrestle with the plump black fruit, almost drowning it out. Give this another few years to knit together and then drink through 2034.
