name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Initially a little reductive, this takes some swirling but eventually opens in glass, revealing raspberry, coffee, olive brine, and oak spice characters. The palate is more giving than the nose. It's full-bodied but not overly heavy, with savory tannins, tangy red fruit and a streak of black olive.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Flavorful and harmonious, this full-bodied wine deftly balances rich black-fruit flavors with subtle oak spices on a firm, appetizing frame of light tannins. It brings generosity of flavor along with interesting complexity.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is deep garnet in the glass. Its bouquet of black cherry and green pepper leads to flavors of pomegranate, oregano, thyme, cherry and smoke. It is bright in the mouth, with soft tannins and a savory finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black cherry and graphite are inviting on the nose. It is soft and elegant in texture, with a powerful blackberry flavor that's edged by decent acidity and a touch of violet.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: The Carneros-based producer ventures into heartier red territory with this lovely, plush and broadly expansive red, blended with 5% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Dried cherry, baking spice and plenty of structure define its overall likability and complexity.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Deep red-violet in the glass, this wine has a nose of blackberry and mocha. Strong acidity outweighs bold tannins in a wine with flavors of raspberry, plum, iodine, chocolate and a touch of pomegranate on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Dark ruby to the eye, this wine has aromas of raspberry and violet. Fruit-forward flavors of cherry, Seville orange and black currant are set in a web of grippy tannins that could feel overpowering, but strong acidity saves the day. There is a touch of orange zest on the bright finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This concentrated, layered wine shows ample fruit and tasty spices from the first whiff through the lingering finish. Full body and ripe (but not sweet) black-currant, rosemary and black-cherry notes coat the tongue, while firm but polished tannins give a full and satisfying mouthfeel.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a rich, silky-textured wine that shows bright notes of plum, raspberry, clove, dried herbs and coffee. On the palate, plump red berries are balanced by a line of tightly wound tannins. The oak is a little prominent, particularly on the finish. This should cellar well through 2029.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Phinny Hill (60%) and Bacchus (20%) fruit make up the backbone of this wine. Aromas of plum, black licorice, baking spice and black fruit are followed by a full-bodied, well-balanced, layered palate that shows depth and intensity but with a fine sense of balance. There's no question about the warmth of the year, but it delivers and will have a very long life in front of it. Best after 2022.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Red violet in the glass, this wine offers a bouquet of raspberry and sage. It is easy drinking, despite sturdy tannins, and features flavors of cherry, cranberry and tomato leaf that round off the bright finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This ruby-colored wine offers a bouquet of cherry and sage. A framework of rich tannins supports flavors of black plum, raspberry, cherry preserves, chocolate and anise that round off in a finish that is equal parts spicy and bright.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine has grippy, youthful tannins that wrap around a core of hefty toasted oak. The midpalate is laced in a mix of complementary grilled meat, black pepper and black currant, the texture dense and concentrated. This could stand more time in the bottle; enjoy best from 2025 through 2030.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: The brooding aromas bring notes of pencil lead, scorched earth, dried herb and cherry, indicative of this unique growing region. Medium-bodied, pitch-black plum and cherry fruit flavors follow, backed by firm tannins. A lengthy finish caps it off. It brings a sense of seamlessness and appeal, with its best days in front of it. It captures this vineyard and vintage perfectly.

name: Guarachi Family 2014 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Heritage Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Named for a rare element as this wine is only made in certain vintages, this is a 100% varietal wine in an impressively silver-adorned bottle. Grippy and with a baked fruit quality, it tastes of plum, dried cherry and currant, with a soft rounded midpalate of leather, coffee and cedar. The finish continues to grip.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a big, hearty wine, with dark-fruit flavors, well-integrated oak accents, a full body and firm tannins. Elements of graphite, blackberry and espresso mingle on the palate and linger on the finish.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Wakefield's premium Cab offers a heady combo of rather flashy oak, dried herbs, licorice, red currant and blackberry fruit. It's full-bodied but not overblown, silky-textured and laced with savory, grainy tannins and a streak of graphite. The oak, however, rears its head again quite prominently. Drink now–2027.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Aromas of black cherry and bell pepper pave the way for flavors of blackberry, black currant, pomegranate and leather. A pleasing sense of brightness outweighs deep fruit and spice flavors. Smooth tannins peel back to reveal a cranberry finish, with a hint of baking spice.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This big bold red is given additional power and grace from the addition of 8% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot. Leather, licorice and lavender all play a part within a context of sizable grip and weight, the lingering flavors a mix of grilled meat and blackberry.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From the producer's own vineyards, this is a 100% varietal wine aged 18 months in French oak made by the well-respected winemaking consultant Jeff Ames. It opens in a soft, rounded palate of balanced richness and firm tannin as aspects of cedar, pencil shavings and earthy plum settle in.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is an ambitious full-bodied wine, from the deep dark color to the effusive new oak aromas and dense spicy chocolaty flavors. It is saturated with fine-grained tannins that hold the black-cherry flavors tightly. Harmless tartrate crystals may show up in the bottom of the glass.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine comes from the winery's young estate vineyard in the Upper Mill Creek area of the valley. The aromas intrigue, with notes of dried herb, toast, cranberry, mocha, scorched earth, pencil lead, dark chocolate and cherry. The fruit flavors are plump, lush and full. It provides appeal and has a very long life in front of it.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a ripe, extracted and powerful red wine, starting with aromas of cassis and coffee candies. The palate is lush and rich in flavors of black plum jelly, licorice and toasted oak.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of cassis and violet set the stage for flavors of black currant, dark plum, mountainside herbs and orange zest. There is a nice tension on the palate between strong tannins and bold acidity that come to a head in a bright finish.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Both concentrated and deep, this full-bodied wine has plenty to offer. It starts with a deep dark color, displays rich and focused fruit aromas and brings ripe blackberry and black cherry to the palate. A touch of fine-grained tannins adds a velvety touch to the texture.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a Cabernet with depth and substance, starting with delicious aromas of vanilla, star anise and black cherry. There is a good black-plum-skin tartness to start the sip, and then come the richer roasted berry and plum flavors, finishing with smoke and cocoa powder.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is big but not brash wine, with raisiny plum and cherry fruit, coffee, dark chocolate, black olives and a damp leaf earthiness. The palate is balanced and silky in feel, with juicy, tangy fruit and savory tannins. Drink through 2029.

name: Michael David 2016 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is an excellent example of how a classic style of balanced rather than superripe Cabernet Sauvignon can excel in Santa Barbara County. Aromas of sandalwood, dark-red fruit and dried herbs lead into a medium-weight palate of smashed strawberry and red currant. But it's the layers of oregano, dill and tobacco leaf that set it apart.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This blend is dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Bold black fruit expand on the palate, with a lengthy powder keg of tobacco, gun smoke and cigar box shining through. The tannins are persistent yet soft.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From historic vines biodynamically farmed, this is a broody, big and multifaceted wine. Cassis, black licorice and mocha mingle with a mix of mint, clove and tarragon. There's a warm stoney mineral streak, too. Fine-grained tannins are covered with plush, tangy berry fruit and lead to a long herb-flecked finish. One for the cellar. Drink now–2039.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is an intensely thick, leathery red from a mountain site, with the addition of 14% Merlot and 1% Petit Verdot in the blend. It offers a powerful grip on the palate, and unleashes deep, jammy flavors of black cherry, berry and cocoa powder.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Forty-five-year-old vines at Bacchus Vineyard are at the heart of this wine, making up 66%, with the balance coming from Octave Vineyard in the Walla Walla Valley. The aromas offer subdued notes of black licorice, dark cherry, chocolate, graphite, dried herb and spice, with the warmth of the vintage on display. Concentrated, layered dark fruit flavors follow, with the tannins giving a firm, slightly dry handshake. An extended finish follows. The balance is exquisite. It needs time for the tannins to stretch out. Best after 2023 with a long life beyond that.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's no mistaking the variety, with its aromas of black currant, dried herb, parsley, cedar box, plum, black fruit, coffee and green pepper. Elegant fruit flavors follow on the palate, surrounded by firm, tightly wound tannins. The acidity seems surprisingly bright for such a warm vintage. Best after 2022, with long life beyond that.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of espresso, graphite, smoked wood, black currant and violet show on the nose of this bottling. The palate booms with violet and boysenberry flavors that settle into wood spice and crushed slate, all wrapped in tense tannins.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 10% Malbec in the blend, this bold red is brawny and powerful in concentrated flavors of toasted oak, clove, currant and black cherry. It benefits from bright acidity on the palate that prolongs the fruit flavors well into a lingering finish.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: From a small site where the appellation overlaps with Chalk Hill, Winemaker Patrick Sullivan has crafted an elegant expression of the variety. It displays complex layers of soy, currant, cedar and clove. Earthy and delicate in texture, it finishes with firm tannins and hints of sage and forest.

name: Hess Collection 2016 The Lion Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This is an impressive, bold Cabernet that's blended with 10% Malbec and 8% Petit Verdot, all from the producer's mountain estate. A big, expansive palate makes for a full-bodied, grippy entry that shows flavors of vanilla and dark cherry. Lifted acidity frames it all. This has years to go; best from 2025–2030.

name: Penfolds 2015 Bin 707 Cabernet Sauvignon (Australia)
description: The nose is a heady combo of lifted red currant, red licorice, flowers, mocha and mint. It's also a touch meaty and the oak spice—from 20 months in new American oak barrels—is also apparent. The palate is big but poised and lifted by tangy, curranty fruit and a velvety, almost creamy texture. It is currently tightly wound by fine-grained, herb-tinged tannins and should cellar through 2039.

name: Doubleback 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Plum, clove and tobacco mark this distinct reserve-worthy red, made from the producer's own estate-reserve block. Inviting floral aromatics entice equally, underlining its understated elegance and class. Black licorice lines thick, grippy tannin and oak, suggesting ample time for cellaring. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This seamless estate wine is blended with 10% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot. A thread of acidity brightens the dense, integrated tannins on the midpalate, while flavors of oak and blueberry cobbler lead into intense notes of black pepper and clove on the finish.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Australian winemaker Chris Cameron's veteran experience is starting to shine for this winery, and this is a plush example of Paso Robles ripeness. Plump aromas of black cherry, vanilla and caramel are cut by pepper and herbs. The palate is soft and lush, but offers penetrating acidity that keeps the baking spice and blackberry flavors in balance.

name: Diamond Creek 2016 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From the great site comes this great wine, a study in powerful minerality and underlying freshness. Sanguine in meat with undertones of lavender and black licorice, it offers soft, smooth and rounded tannins that support a core of oak. Black cherry and cassis give it a tartness before the finish becomes seasoned in dried herb.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine made by in-demand consultant Jeff Ames. Demure and floral on the nose, it tastes of black currant and dusty dark chocolate, bark and black cherry, with focused well-delineated flavors that ride along a full-bodied core of powerful grace. The spicy clove finish intensifies the experience.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From the producer's organically farmed estate in Chiles Valley, this is 100% varietal and classic in approach. Baked aromas of plum and blackberry lead to a soft midpalate of plum and cola, with a finish of black pepper and leather. This is a beautiful wine at a fair price.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is an impressive, grippy and full-bodied red, firm in tannin and well-integrated in oak. Caramel toffee flavors complement offerings of lavender and grilled meat, with a dusty, crushed rock flair to the minerality. This has time to go in the bottle. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: An oaky, toasty perfume leads to layered and spicy flavors in this full-bodied wine. It has a generous amount of ripe black-cherry and black-currant flavors. Nutmeg, vanilla and other oak nuances are tasty on the palate and linger on the finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This wine has a nose of black cherry and oregano with a hint of cardamom. Dark-fruit flavors of cherry and black plum are bolstered by notes of juniper berry and tomato leaf which fill the mouth and then make way for smooth tannins punctuated by bright notes of pomegranate.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a fragrant fruit bowl of ripe plums, blueberries and strawberries. On the palate, the fruit ripeness veers in to syrupy territory but is saved by a decent lick of acidity. The tannins are grainy and woody but nicely structured for this to hold up for the next few years.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Smooth and approachable, this wine offers a tangy red-fruit flavor and bright acidity, with integrated oak and tannin. It is delightfully quaffable and finishes in layers of cedar and pencil shavings, remaining varietal and delicious through a steady finish.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this well-made full-bodied red opens slowly to unfurl brawny layers of tannin and smoky oak. The power is met by densely packed flavors of black cherry and currant, with a hint of sage and dried herb.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This 100% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of tilled soil, cedar, underbrush and a whiff of dark berry. The forward palate delivers ripe black currant, star anise and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely with Cabernet Sauvignon, this has delicate aromas of cassis, fragrant purple flower, mint and French oak. The lithe, polished palate offers Marasca cherry, blackberry, cedar and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Made entirely with Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of cassis, cedar, chopped mint and underbrush. The smooth, medium-bodied palate offers black currant, black cherry, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a leathery medium-bodied red of restrained ripeness that offers strong flavors of baking spice, cigar box and tobacco. The fruit leans into black currant and cassis.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: A wine held back in barrel and bottle for some time before release, this beauty still has time to go before relaxing its thick, tannic intensity of Old World leather and cedar elements. A caramel mocha component of opulence is up front and present. Enjoy 2024–2029.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Blended with 15% Merlot, this has a classic character of Old World savoriness, opening in a burst of cassis before becoming more well defined in cedar, clove and crayon wax. The firm tannins never distract, instead supporting a core of full-bodied roundness and plush texture.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Notes of blackberry, cola, chocolate, dried herbs, menthol and toasted wood show both on the nose and the palate. It's full-bodied and silky in texture, with savory, sinewy tannins and a long, toasty, herbal finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This full-bodied wine is packed with aromas of ripe fruit, cedar, cinnamon and flowers on the nose. The juicy palate brings flavors of blackberry and black cherry wrapped in a velvety layer of fine-grained tannins.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Impressively concentrated black-fruit and dark-chocolate flavors fill out the relatively big frame of this full-bodied wine. It smells and tastes generous, ripe, deep and brooding, while well-integrated tannins and a lingering finish add to its appeal.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: The nose opens with ripe blueberry, blackberry and dark cherry aromas sitting beside coffee and wood spice. The palate big, grainy-textured, leathery tannins amidst berry fruit and oak flavors. Despite its bulk, it is relatively approachable now, but ideally it needs more time—up to 15 years—to settle in. Drink through 2034.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Herbal in mountain sage and lavender, this robust red lingers in dusty crushed rock elements and a meaty core of red fruit. Robust and full bodied, it softens on the finish, allowing the oak to show but not distract.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is the second vintage of this wine. The aromas of sweet spice, celery stalk, black cherry and anise are unusual. Full-bodied black fruit flavors follow. Firm tannins back it all up, with amaro-like bitters on the finish. It hasn't fully settled in yet but has good stuffing when it gets where it's going. Best after 2021.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is flavorful and well balanced, deftly blending mild oak and spice elements with warm, ripe plum and red cherry flavors on the soft, velvety texture. All the elements are harmonious and well integrated.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This big, bold wine tastes of blackberry pie dusted in clove and nutmeg, giving it a lush and plush feel. Thick and densely structured, it offers elongated tannins and a memorable, spicy finish.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a delightfully elegant and balanced red that's blended with 5% Cabernet Franc and 2% Petit Verdot. It is subtle and nuanced in aromas of forest, clove and cassis. Layers of flavor develop on the palate, inviting swirls of chocolate and black cherry. There's plenty of structure to age further. Enjoy 2024–2029.

name: Silverado 2016 SOLO Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Thick, rich and densely packed in blackberry and black licorice, this wine finds complementary lightness in a waft of violet. Substantial in weight and grippy tannin, it lingers on a lengthy finish in chocolate mocha and cherry liqueur.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Exotic and elegant aromas of black plum, black-currant jellies and licorice arise on the darkly spiced nose of this bottling by the Daou brothers. The palate combines cassis and blackberry paste with tarragon, soft sage and mint flavors, making for a dynamic, lush and lovely sip.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: Velvety thick and layered in coconut and black licorice, this wine expands on the palate in complex, full-bodied and fleshy waves, remaining fresh and herbal in the glass. Blackberry fruit takes on a baked quality that's sumptuous and grand. Enjoy 2021–2030.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tart, tangy and tense red from the legendary vineyard, soft and velvety lush on the midpalate. Caramelized oak cradles baked cherry and cranberry, the layers complex and lengthy with seasonings of clove and nutmeg. Enjoy 2021–2030.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: Densely textured and robust in black cherry compote and plum, this is a blockbuster, age-worthy red from the Oakville site, its tannins forceful and youthfully grippy. Nutmeg, cedar and clove season the rich fruit and toasted oak. Enjoy 2021–2030.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2016 S.L.V. Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cofermented with 11% Petit Verdot, this is a serious, classically made wine from the generous appellation, Old World in its grippy structure and full embrace of cedar, pencil shavings and dried herb. Clove and peppercorn provide additional spice around a length of firm, integrated tannin and oak, finishing in a sanguine element of meat. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This bottling from a new label by the French-born Fabre brothers is very dark in the glass and shows thick, luscious aromas of black plum, concentrated violets, mocha, minty cola and leather. It's soft and supple on the palate, where chalky tannins presents intense black-currant, black-pepper and elegantly herbal flavors.

name: Grayson 2018 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: With an aroma like cinnamon rolls and similar, pastry-like flavors, this medium-bodied wine is tempting, but not what most people expect to drink with lunch or dinner.

name: Clos du Val 2015 Three Graces Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a rich, luxurious and rounded red, from a site in St. Helena. Sultry, seductive dark cherry, clove, pencil and tobacco complement each other around a velvety smooth texture and tension of tannin that supports an underlying voluptuousness of blueberry pie and chocolate.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are quite light and hard to tease out, showing a bit of herb, cranberry and cherry cola. Broad but still light, slightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors follow. Cranberry notes linger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and effusive in green olive, this blends in 9% Merlot and 1% each of Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot. A thick midpalate of body weight and tannin evolves to a soft approachable finish.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas are light and hard to tease out initially, with faint notes of cherry and spice that open up to reveal plentiful green pepper and garden herb accents. Somewhat lighter-styled fruit flavors follow, with the concentration not all there. Dried tobacco notes linger on the finish.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Deep ruby colored in the glass, this Bulgarian Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of coffee, red berry pie and dried oregano. It has flavors of tart cherry, blackberry and blueberry. It is an easy drinking red with a splash of pleasantly acidic cranberry flavor in the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Plum, herb and spice aromas are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors. It brings appeal, but the fruit concentration is quite light.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Aromas of green and jalapeño pepper are at the fore, with dark fruit following. Plentiful, but lighter-styled black currant flavors follow. It comes off as a bit underripe but still brings easy drinking appeal.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This combines 8% Cabernet Franc, 7% Merlot, 5% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot with the Cab. A leathery, herbal expression of these grapes, it takes on a thick structure and persistence of turned earth, dark chocolate and coffee within a restrained package.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of dried tobacco, herb, cherry cola and spice are followed by full fruit flavors with a soft sense of texture and light structure for the variety.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: There is a strong oaky aroma that coats the red-currant fruit on the nose of this bottling, which is now seven years old. The palate is tangy with plum fruit and a tad simple at this point of its life.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a rich, ripe and seemingly sweet wine that oozes black cherry and milk chocolate aromas and has blackberry-jam flavors wrapped in a soft pillowy texture of light tannins and soft acidity.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This full-bodied wine is theatrically dark and rich, showing a color deeper than wines three times as expensive. It also has late-harvest plum, raisin and chocolate flavors and a soft thick texture.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with Cabernet Franc and Merlot, then given nearly two years in oak, both French and American, this is a moderately ripe red, simple in structure and buoyant in high-strung red fruit and dried herb.

name: Derange 2016 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Intriguing aromas of pencil shavings, olive, violet and dark strawberry are both lushly caramelized and a bit tangy on the nose of this bottling, which gets some Bourbon barrel treatment. The palate's black-plum-skin tang is dusted by a hint of herbs, finishing on candied caramel notes.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The 100% varietal, light herb, cherry and spice aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins bring some dryness and grit that softens a bit with time open.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Woody in cedar, pencil shavings and toasted oak, this is a straightforward, full-bodied red, big in tannin weight and breadth that delivers big bold flavor and integrated oak.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine has an appealing combo of good, ripe fruity aromas and flavors, a mouthfilling texture and soft tannins that make it smooth to sip.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of cherry syrup and pomegranate soda pop make for a sweet smelling entry to this bottling. The palate is tangy with berry and lifted with hints of lavender, fennel and mint, but thin in body.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Extracted aromas of red-cherry and blackberry syrups meet with toasted licorice on the nose of this bottling. It's very thick on the palate with roasted black currant, berry and more licorice spice.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is currently a bit shy on the nose, with dark plum and currant tones as well as some hints of roast beef and sweet curing spice. The medium-weight palate boasts a crushed satin texture and ample acidity to frame the ripe fruit flavors. The finish veers a little toward the sweet end, reminiscent of raspberry sauce and cherry hard candy.

name: Las Positas 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Made entirely with Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with aromas of charred earth, toasted oak and a whiff of dark berry. The tight palate offers blackberry jam, grilled sage and licorice alongside taut tannins that leave an astringent finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Fruity aromas of dark strawberry are enhanced by tobacco and crushed rocks on the nose of this bottling. It's easy on the palate with strawberry sorbet, marjoram, oregano and cracked pepper flavors.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a juicy, simple red that overdelivers on its price point, offering expansive layers of soft rich red- and black-cherry fruit. Friendly and approachable, it's a fantastic value and balanced in style.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a well-made, no-nonsense and full-bodied wine that smells like ripe plums and dried thyme, tastes moderately rich and cherrylike and has a smooth, lightly tannic texture.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Aromas of savory herb, green pepper, game, licorice and dark fruit lead to plump golden raisin and cherry flavors. It's straight down the fairway.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: With up-front oak and firm tannin, this is an easy-pleasing red offered at a remarkably fair price that's effusive in black fruit, clove and cinnamon. The ripeness is expansive and succulent.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of herb, smoke, plum and barrel spice are at the fore, with notes of dried dark cherry emerging over time. Soft, initially lighter-styled fruit flavors follow. It's an elegant expression of the variety with good things going on if they all stitch together and open up.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Both oaky and tannic, this boisterous full-bodied wine has vivid aromas and flavors of sawn oak, dill, red cherry and bay leaf. It is quite tannic in texture, which is not unusual for a Cabernet, but fun to taste.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This complex and savory wine is backed by mild plum and cherry flavors but mineral, earth and herb aspects come to the fore. It shows little new oak, and has a smooth, relaxed texture that makes it easy to sip.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Leathery dark fruit aromas are tight and pinched, but also focused. On the palate, this feels slightly jagged and intense, but not rough or rocky. Slightly blackened and toasty black fruit flavors finish with oak-based smokiness. Drink through 2021.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Part of a range of single varietal wines from this producer, this wine has reminders of the black currant flavors and tannins typical of Cabernet Sauvignon. Its structure and acidity are now just right, and the wine is ready to drink.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Here's a mature Cabernet Sauvignon that has subdued aromas of scorched earth, dried berry and a hint of clove. The dense palate offers black-currant jam, cedar and vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon to capture the remaining freshness.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Dusty berry and spice aromas include notes of iodine and horsey leather. A plump, solid palate holds lightly salty flavors of spiced plum and berry fruits, while this shows kick and liveliness on a finish with medium intensity.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: There's a mentholated herb character on the nose of this wine, expressed in notes of fynbos and fresh mint atop a fruity core of raspberry, ripe red cherry and brambly forest berry, with just a kiss of cocoa character. Medium in weight and satiny in texture, the tannins gain intensity through the lingering finish, where they're partnered with notes of licorice root, earthy herbs and more black fruit-skin flavors.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Cherry, blackberry and raspberry aromas are mildly spicy and include a dark hint of tire rubber. A fresh palate is medium in body and well built; flavors of oak, salt and vanilla lead core berry fruit notes to a gentle finish with mild oak spice.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: This concentrated and full-bodied wine blends smoky, earthy tones with black fig on the nose and palate. It has a lush, broad, mouthcoating texture and moderate tannins for structure.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Though almost seven years old, this bottling still is vivacious with Bing cherry, cola and hickory aromas on the boisterous nose. The palate is also very fruity, with ripe cherries and strawberries that are bolstered by hickory flavors, and the dried herbs slowly show as the wine aerates.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a well made, tempting, commercial style of Cabernet that has abundant ripe fruit, generous oaky, spicy accents, a rich, almost-sweet mouthfeel and lingering finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Fresh blackberry, herbs and a bit of wet slate show on the nose of this bottling. It's very dry on the palate, with savory flavors of roasted beef, cola and berries, framed by ample tannins and decent acid.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is brawny in red and black cherry with a soft midpalate of juicy approachability, moderate oak and tannin. Full bodied, it shows an ease of enjoyability now.

name: Beringer 2016 Chabot Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec, all estate-grown, this is made in a sublime, understated style, with turned earth, soy and stone on the opening nose and palate. Oak and leather mark the midpalate, with a continued emphasis of dried herb.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Reedy, mildly green aromas of candied plum, wood spice and cool earth open this Cabernet Sauvignon that hails 80% from Colchagua and the rest from other Chilean valleys. Olive, herbal berry and minty flavors wrap up with notes of coffee on an oaky finish that's juicy in feel.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Initial aromas of tire rubber and road tar give way to berry and cassis scents. On the palate, this is a medium-to-full CS that's mouthfilling more than elegant. Gamy berry flavors are matched by buttery oak, while vanilla notes vie with residual cherry and plum fruit on a ripe finish.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: There's an upfront green, earthy edge to this wine, with notes of cigar ash and green pepper and hints of coffee and licorice. The medium-weight palate is gripping and full in feel, with structured tannins that lend a lingering astringency to the finish. There's not a lot of acidity, but enough to balance the cherry and plum fruit. Touches of roasted coffee bean and char grace the close.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This smells ripe and concentrated, with lovely black cherry and boysenberry aromas that are hit by notes of cured meat, sweet spice and touches of sweet smoke and pressed purple flowers. The medium-weight palate offers good tannic structure and lively acidity to balance out the ripe fruit flavors. It's a complete and tasty package that's easy to drink now.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Inviting aromas of cocoa, vanilla bean, coffee, flower, herb and graphite lead to a palate that paints around the edges. The tannins bring a firm grip. The wood seems prominent out of the gate. Give it some time to integrate.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Richly extracted aromas of black cherry cream, black-plum sauce and chai spice show on the nose of this bottling. It's very full of flavor on the palate, with caramel and coffee candies, more black cherry and soft lush tannins that are quite creamy.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This compelling wine starts with aromas of red cherry, crushed rock, cigar box and hickory on the nose. The palate combines flavors of smashed blackberry with sage, thyme, pepper, smoke and a loamy minerality.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied red has earthy sage on the nose and palate, an herbal expression within a rich, concentrated grasp of cedar and black licorice. Along the way red currant and cassis come into the picture, adding succulence to the dusty cocoa and mineral.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a thick, chewy and full-bodied red that will appeal to a wide range of palates and budgets. Bright underlying red fruit enlivens the firm tannic structure and integrated oak, finishing soft and smooth on the palate.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine tastes old school in a good way, revealing the traditional black-olive and herb nuances of California Cabernet grown in cool climates. It has good depth, a nicely firm texture and lingering fruit and herb notes on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Dark in color, this bottling shows dark red-cherry and licorice aromas on the nose. The palate is well rounded with firm tannins, solid acidity and flavors of berry, tobacco, fennel and freshly picked herbs.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Made with Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this opens with aromas of cassis, underbrush and cedar. The savory, concentrated palate delivers black-currant jam, mocha and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.

name: Duckhorn 2015 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)
description: Jammy blackberry and dark chocolate mark the midpalate richness of this wine, which is blended with 6% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc, all of the grapes estate-grown. Dusty dried herb makes a statement on the nose as the lean, elegant style comes to the fore.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Locked up on first pour, this wine opens to reveal aromas of the blackest cherries, cedar and spice, with the warmth of the vintage on display. Rich, hedonistic dark fruit flavors follow, surrounded by a lot of structure. It's a power-driven interpretation of this vineyard. Best by 2024.

name: Domus Aurea 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Dark fruit and chocolaty richness are at the heart of this robust wine. Cedar and oak complement the flavors of baked black cherry and blackberry on the palate, giving a rich feel to this enjoyable wine.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is an earthy wine, elegant in structure and style, with moderate ripeness and body weight. Cinnamon, plum and black licorice highlight integrated oak and firm tannin.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Aged entirely in new French and American barrels, this 100% varietal wine is juicy, broad and expansive on the palate, as well as firm and grippy in tannin. Blue fruit and dark cherry meet integrated vanilla and nutmeg seasoning from the oak.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Full bodied and rich, this 100% varietal wine showcases the exciting appellation just outside of Napa in its soft texture and deft embrace of savory characteristics. Cedar, clove and red currant grace a backdrop of integrated oak and lasting taste of graham cracker.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Dense, dark aromas of raisin and blackberry set up a full and chunky palate with a creamy texture. Mildly salty berry flavors include a whack of oak spice, while oak-led flavors settle in on a finish that tastes slightly baked and feels warm.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Meaty and smoky in barbecue char, this wine has a big grip of tension and a robust amount of red jammy fruit. The oak takes on a sweetness of tobacco and vanilla.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Appealing green herb, plum, green pepper, dark fruit, bittersweet chocolate and spice aromas lead to dark fruit flavors that show a sense of balance and restraint. It shows a touch of astringency but also polish, with barrel notes lingering on the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: There is a strong mineral kick to the nose of this bottling, with aromas of wet slate and loam that lead into purple flowers and blackberry juice. The palate is lively with energy, dusted by dried herbs and lifted with fresh blackberries, all clinging to tense tannins and strong acidity.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is thick and rich in chocolate and vanilla notes, with complementary aspects of dark cherry jam. Broadly structured and concentrated, it'll please the palate and wallet in equal measure.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is the winery's first old vine (Vielles Vignes) offering from this esteemed vineyard. The aromas show notes of assorted dried herbs along with black cherry. Dark fruit flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a bit of grip. Best after 2022.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Rich black cherry, vanilla and dark loamy soil make for a very fruity but pleasant entry to the nose of this bottling. There is a streak of candied black cherry on the palate but lots of tannic stiffness as well, with baking spice, pie crust and acidity carrying into the finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a warm and ripe, but well-structured wine that overflows with black cherry and blackberry flavor and has a rich texture of soft tannins and light acidity. The ripeness and intensity of the fruit flavors is practically irresistible.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot, this is a full-bodied concentrated red that's thick in tannin and youthful structure. Black fruit, sage, clove and cinnamon figure into the rich, lushly crafted palate that's integrated in toasted oak.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick in chocolate-covered plum, this is a soft, approachable and fairly priced wine that's broad in appeal and full-bodied style. It has a touch of reduction and oak as it finishes.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Cedar, black currant and fragrant blue-flower aromas take center stage on this polished red. The elegantly structured palate presents dried Marasca cherry and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This stylish, attractively oaky wine tastes warm, spicy and firm in texture. It dresses up ripe cherry flavors with baking spices and fresh cedar accents, for a thoroughly showy and delicious personality.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Broadly integrated in bold flavors of blackberry and black cherry, this is a well-made, 100% varietal wine aged in well-integrated oak. A juicy midpalate informs an overall deliciousness of tamed tannins and elegant finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Extremely well balanced and appetizing, this screw capped wine combines absolutely fresh black-cherry flavors with mild oak accents and energizes them with good fruit acidity and moderate tannins. It is medium to full bodied, and will make a lively pairing with a wide variety of dishes.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Full bodied and firmly tannic, this powerful estate-grown wine wraps flavors of ripe black cherry and blackberry in a velvety, mouthcoating texture. The fruit flavors are concentrated and lingering, while significant and tasty oak accents are woven throughout.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a savory style of Cabernet Sauvignon, with structure that's built to last. Aromas of crushed black rock, dark chocolate, blackberry, charred wood and herb-crusted beef lead into the dry palate, where a sticky structure carries flavors of black currant, violet and cola. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Earthy cherry and cassis aromas are on target. The palate on this Cabernet from the Los Lingues subzone of Colchagua is well put together and in balance. Ripe blackberry and cassis flavors come with a spicy, herbal underbelly, while this is smooth and fairly long on the finish, with mocha and spice notes. Drink through 2024.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: From a site in Rutherford and blended with 6% Petit Verdot, this is a woody, herbal red wine, moderate in structure and robustly ripe in style. Cedar, pencil, char and dried herb contrast against a richness of milk chocolate as firm tannins take hold and grip the long finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Never mind the screw cap, this velvet-textured wine is generous, fruity and deep without overdoing the oak. Its rich and saturated blackberry, black-cherry and fig flavors are warm and mouthfilling while soft tannins bolster the texture and give it a slight sense of restraint on the palate and finish.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This bottling, which includes 1% Cabernet Franc, offers bright and snappy aromas of red currant and black plum along with a bit of mocha cream. There is bright acidity and strong crushed rock minerality on the palate, which surrounds tart red fruit.

name: Caliza 2016 Companion Red (Central Coast)
description: Very strong, fruit-forward aromas of black cherry, blackberry jam, baking spice and toasty oak show on the nose of this bottling by Sabrine Rodems from a vineyard near Mount Madonna. The palate combines rich fruit, wood spice and a butterscotch finish with chalky tannins and strong acidity, a combination that will please many palates.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dried herb, black cherry, dark fruit, coffee and spice aromas are followed by a palate that brings a sense of refinement for such a warm vintage. Best after 2020.

name: Steven Kent 2014 Lineage Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Black and inky, with a touch of reduction, soy and tobacco leaf on the entry, this effuses earthy intensity and soft lushness, combining both within one bottle. Touches of cherry and vanilla nip at the midpalate cradled in toasted oak and firm tannin structure.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Big oak and leathery tannins are hugely present in this thick, richly concentrated wine, that offers fans of a more robust style the jammy blueberry, blackberry and graham cracker layers worth sinking one's teeth into.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: From one of the oldest vineyards in Paso Robles, this bottling starts with subtle hints of oak and toast as well as zesty flashes of lemon and lime. It's fairly broad and creamy on the palate, with full flavors of Meyer lemon and caramel.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This mineral-driven white has a steely frame, punctuated by inviting aromas of white flower and apple blossom. Creamy on the palate, it stays bright and fresh in the glass, with appealing flavors of lemon zest, Gravenstein apple and wet stone.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a full-bodied but balanced wine that starts off with ripe plums and blueberries, with flower, spice and a savory, stalky streak. The palate offers a more savory profile than the nose implies. The plush, tangy fruit is there but is made more interesting by sapid tannins and linear acidity. Drink now–2026.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a muscular wine that announces its presence loudly and assertively, oozing ripe cherry and blackberry notes, along with cola, eucalyptus, and oak. On the palate, there's just enough tangy acidity and plush fruit to balance the huge, chewy tannins and oak. This is structured to go the long haul. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Timark 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a reduced, tight and robustly ripe wine, grippy in structure and a lasting taste of black pepper and gunpowder. Black-licorice, black-cherry and blackberry flavors round out the experience.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This medium-bodied wine from a native American-owned winery has a sweet maple aroma, and flavors that are very fruity as well as quite oaky. It is well-saturated in terms of color and has smooth tannins for a pleasant mouthfeel.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: From the producer's estate site in the heart of the new appellation, this sings in rich, juicy waves of fresh pear and anise. With depths of flavor and body, it retains crushed rock-like minerality and lemony acidity throughout its lush, layered texture.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Brambly but dilute aromas of herbal berry fruits include gritty notes of road tar and asphalt. A lean but grabby palate is angular and wiry, while this tastes of herbal plum and grassy wild berry. Drying tannins harden a minty green finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Generic red fruit aromas lead to a plump, gummy, chewy palate. Like the nose, this tastes highly generic, like a million other everyday red wines. Sticky tannins are notable on the finish of this standard Cabernet.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This wine is plush and soft, giving way to flavors of melted butter and vanilla. The ripe palate is low in acidity and rich in feel.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Balancing fruity and oaky flavors, this medium-bodied Chardonnay shows good crisp apple and ripe pear notes that are coated with butter and vanilla. The texture is on the soft side.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine is smooth and easy to drink. It feels nicely layered and creamy in texture, shows attractive apple and baking-spice aromas and adds vanilla and cream flavors on the palate.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: From one of the best known and finest of the many Puligny-Montrachet premier crus, this wine is structured and potentially very fine. Wood-aging acidity balances the ripe white fruit acidity and strong mineral texture. Rich and concentrated, this wine will be ready from 2022.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: This is clean as a whistle and sharp as a tack, with pinpoint flavors of apple and green papaya. They're followed with a palate-coating wash of buttery oak, and they fade gracefully through a long, lush finish. It's a tour de force from winemaker Rollin Soles.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Lovely fruit flavors combine spiced apple and ripe peach, with a touch of pastry crust. The wine reaches a tension point with a splash of bitter tea ahead of the tannins. It's complex and built for some further aging; in fact, drinking after 2020 is recommended.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: Geodesy is a new project from Sonoma's Judy Jordan, with a crackerjack winemaking team and the broad goal of empowering young women. When this wine is first opened, a burst of buttery oak greets you, suggesting a California spin on these Oregon grapes. With ample aeration, the wine's natural acidity kicks in, bringing flavors of apple and citrus skin, along with extended barrel flavors of toasted cashew.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: With up-front oak and weight, this wine has a juicy midpalate of peach, pear and apple that give the texture a welcome fleshiness and appeal. Full bodied, it retains enough underlying acidity to provide freshness beneath the richer elements.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Lovely and light with strong flavors of Gravenstein apple, pear and melon, this is a floral and well-made wine from the meticulously farmed site that shows a balanced approach to acidity and flavor. The oak is measured and supportive without ever getting in the way.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This fresh wine has a mineral character that provides a strong texture, balanced by perfumed acidity and final citrus lift. Drink now.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: An attractive touch of wood in this wine brings together apple flavors, crisp acidity and some minerality. The wine is harmonious and ready to drink.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Full of fruit and with ripe red-apple flavors, this wine is poised between richness and crisp minerality. Acidity provides essential contrast to the full fruitiness the. Drink from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This lively, crisp wine offers fresh acidity and attractive fruitiness. Apricot flavors dominate, giving the wine a ripe and full-bodied character. Drink now.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This Chard needs plenty of swirling in glass or time in decanter to open up but when it does offers delicate notes of lemon, melon, snow pea, white spice and oyster shell. Medium bodied, the citrusy, zingy acidity and a velvety texture are framed by toasty oak. This classy wine is still in its youth. Drink 2020–2027.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Lightly smoky aromas as well as a crisp texture set this wine on a course with good potential. Its acidity and tangy character are balanced with the minerality and texture. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: For the simple appellation of white Burgundy, this wine is a serious proposition. Its source is partly Puligny-Montrachet and with the wood aging, ripe yellow-fruit and mango flavors and intense acidity, it could even age. Delicious now, the wine will be even better from 2020.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Shy on the nose at first, this bottling offers aromas of lemon preserves on toast, light wood and a touch of nuts against a steely backdrop. It's crisp, clean and easy on the palate, where a sizzle of lime juice cuts through the riper hints of nectarine, riding a taut acidity into the finish.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Good acidity in this wine goes along with the spice to balance the crisp texture and generous tropical fruits. Drink this balanced wine now.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine is balanced and fruity, with a good mix of ripe, tropical flavors and bright apple. The tangy edge of minerality gives it a texture that will allow it to age. Drink from 2021.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This warm premier cru has produced a warm wine. With acidity embedded in ripe peach and melon flavors, the wine is textured enough to bring out a steely edge. It is young and will be better from 2021.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This warm, ripe wine offers hints of tropical fruits as well as minerality. Its full body has a nice line in freshness to keep everything bright and fruity. Drink from 2020.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is textured, ripe with acidity showing strongly through fresh apple and citrus flavors. With its mineral texture and crispness, it needs a few more months. Drink from 2020.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Spice from wood aging gives this wine an almost smoky character that balances with the rich tropical fruits and ripe acidity. The result is a full, generous and opulent wine, ready from 2020.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This village Chassagne-Montrachet is structured as well as fruity. Its mineral edge balances with apple and bright citrus fruits giving the wine freshness and a distinct texture. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This delicious, full wine offers a fine balance between fresh apple fruits and smoother butter and cream textures. The juicy character brings out ripeness as well as the crisp texture. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This wine is fruity and crisp. Attractive acidity and spice are right up front giving a lively edge to this full-bodied wine. With its acidity and texture, the wine will age. Drink from 2021.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine conveys a touch of spice with a hint of toast. The wine's fruitiness is balanced to give an apricot and apple-flavored wine with some attractive complexity. Drink from 2021.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Slightly yeasty aromas lead to a wine that is textured and crisp, with considerable acidity. In this vintage, that's a good thing to counter the natural ripeness of the fruit. The wine needs to integrate, so wait until 2020.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a great appellation for whites, and this fruity and crisp wine shows why. Acidity, lemon flavors and brightness are boosted by the minerality of the wine. Drink now.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: An aromatic wine with subtle scents of fennel, citrus and flint, this brings bright and tangy fruit flavors of Mandarin orange and apple, with a light seam of caramel as it winds down. It's full bodied and flavorful, likely to improve further with another year or two of bottle age.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Quite well made, though not as concentrated as the previous vintage, this is a tangy, tightly wound wine. The fruit mix leans toward white and yellow tree fruits. On the palate the impression is also a bit lean, but balanced. Aged 17 months in one-quarter new French oak (and one concrete egg), it finishes with a lick of butter.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Wood aromas and flavors add complexity to this structured wine, which also features good acidity and a cool citrus edge. The wine needs to develop and will be ready from 2020.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine is fruity, spicy with new-wood flavors as well as fresh acidity. Its ripe character comes through with hints of apricot. The balance is just right in this attractive wine. Drink now.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Two parcels totaling 1.47 acres produced this wine, with an intense floral aroma leading to rich, creamy white fruits. A touch of typical Pouilly minerality adds texture to the wine. Drink from 2020.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This wine comes from a premier cru vineyard that produces a small quantity of white wine as well as red. It is ripe, showing off opulent yellow fruits balanced by plenty of youthful acidity that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2021.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This cool premier cru vineyard, next to the producer's home village of Milly, has made a crisp, steely-textured wine. Acidity and minerality are very present to complement the bright, tangy citrus fruits. Drink the wine from 2021.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine shows medium concentration and excellent focus, with prominent butter and toast flavors. The fruit moves from ripe apples into apple pie—crust and all—but the underlying acidity pulls it all together through the finish.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: From one of the many premier crus in Montagny, this lightly wood-aged wine is ripe with yellow fruits. The acidity cuts through the wine's richness to bring balance as well as a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a ripe, rich wine, full of fruit while also have a strong sense of texture and minerality. Apple and lime flavors give the wine a bite that is enhanced by the tight aftertaste. Drink from 2021.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This premier cru, from the 18th generation of the Lamblin family, has produced a crisp, cool wine with some steely acidity from vines on the left bank of the Serein river. Its fresh mien is underlined by the citrus flavors and green-apple aftertaste. Drink from 2021.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The fruit is sourced from the newly approved Van Duzer Corridor AVA. It brings a distinctive, heady mix of floral scents, a dusting of pollen and a hint of body powder, complementing apple and peach skin flavors more than flesh. Complex and unusual, it's well worth exploring if you are willing to venture outside the standard Chardonnay boundaries.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Bright aromas of apple blossom and pear meet with ripe touches of cantaloupe on the nose of this bottling. There is a great sizzle of acidity on the palate, cutting through the clean, broad flavors of apple butter on toast.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This premier cru produces both white and red wines. Rounded and deliciously ripe, this wine is also textured to give minerality and acidity. It is still young, packed with acidity that will soften. The result will be a rich wine, textured and generous. Drink from 2021.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: New Lazy River winemaker Anthony King debuts with a first-ever Chardonnay from the winery. It's done in a spicy, toasty style, with a firm core of apple pie, both fruit and crust. It continues with a juicy finish and a burst of butter.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This wine has good potential. It already offers plenty of fruitiness, lime and apple flavors structured with minerality and a steely edge. All this will develop further to give an always fresh but also ripe wine from 2021.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This single-vineyard wine from a plot just north of the estate on Keuka Lake offers a pleasing intensity of grilled citrus, limestone and buttered bread. The medium-bodied palate is tense in citrus and mineral flavors, broadened out by accents of peach tart and cream. Lemon curd rings on the lingering finish.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This floral wine is layered with wood, spice and the potential of fine fruitiness. Juicy acidity melds with wood flavors, producing a ripe wine with intense acidity that will soften. Drink from 2022.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This wood-aged wine is well on its way to being drinkable. With spice balancing crisp acidity and citrus flavors, the wine is bright and refreshing.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The Stella Bella range of wines are almost always highly drinkable yet unforced, and offering great value for money and this Chard is no exception. On the nose, this offers delicate aromas of sea breeze, orange peel, lemon and nuts. On the palate there's a refreshing crunch of acidity and shimmering citrusy fruit balanced by a slippery texture and a long, salt-rimmed finish that makes you want to crack this open over a plate of seafood perched beside the sea.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Classic modern Margaret River in style, this starts a touch reductively but those onion-skin notes dissipate quickly in glass, replaced by grapefruit, lemon, melon, flint and oyster-shell aromas. The palate offers bright citrus, saline and toasty oak flavors amidst a creamy texture and a long salty finish.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Aged in wood, this blend of parcels from across Meursault shows the richness for which the appellation is famed. It contrasts that with acidity, freshness and crisp citrus. The combination has produced a wine that can age further. Drink from 2021.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: From the northernmost of the Chablis premier cru vineyards, this wine is crisply fresh, but with a steely edge that gives it aging potential. Green-apple flavors, minerality and final acidity all point to a good development. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Broad aromas of lime spray, tangerine, lemon peel, lychee and white flowers converge on the nose of this bottling. There's compelling cohesion of flavors on the palate, where poached apples and pears meet with a hint of savory sea salt.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Sultry and soft, this white offers a juiciness of pear, anise and salty oak, made in a rich, layered style that nonetheless has complex structure and weight. It finishes with a touch of heat and undeniable power.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This ripe, generous wine is full of the typical tropical fruits of the vintage. The wine sings immediately with yellow fruits and a balance of fresher citrus and acidity. Minerality at the end will allow it to age. Drink from 2021.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This taut, mineral-textured wine is full of crisp fruit and lively acidity. Rich white fruits go along with its texture, balancing the two elements. Drink from 2020.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Wood aging and tropical fruits are matched in this ripe wine. With its tangy structure and acidity all coming together, the wine is balanced, spicy and ready to drink.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This has matured into an attractive wine. Pure green-fruit and citrus flavors have softened to bring in some nutty characteristics, lightly spiced and still tangy. It is ready to drink.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Young and toasty, this barrel-fermented gem is still pulling itself together. The structure is there for aging over the next half-decade or longer, and the lightly tropical melon and papaya flavors are lovely. It just needs to balance out the barrel flavors a bit, but if you love a toasty Chardonnay, there's no need to wait.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This ripe wine with its balanced acidity and fruitiness is moving easily towards drinkability. It has the richness of the vintage plus plenty of crisp balance and a textured backdrop. Drink the wine now.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This ripe wine offers great fruitiness while having a cooler edge with a taut texture. The balance is just right, with fresh acidity integrating into warm, spicy flavors. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine's wood aging is still showing, while freshness has integrated well with the riper fruits. The wine is juicy, crisp and beautifully full in the mouth. Drink now.

name: Gosset 2012 Grand Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: This smoothly textured wine offers ripe white fruits balanced by tangy acidity. It's a full, generous wine lifted by lively acidity. Drink from 2020.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: While this wine has plenty of warm flavors, a strongly mineral texture brings in acidity and citrus fruitiness. That gives the wine texture and freshness for aging. Drink from 2021.

name: A.R. Lenoble  NV Rosé Terroirs Brut  (Champagne)
description: A perfumed wine full of white fruits balanced by acidity, this is already advanced and ready to drink. The wine's texture, however, will also allow it to age. Drink now for its fruitiness or from 2021.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Textured and still young, this tight, mineral wine has a good future. Acidity and strong lime flavors need to soften to give the wine its final, structured but fruity character. Drink from 2021.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Barrel aging has softened the intense acidity of this wine and given it a smooth texture. It has also added to the density and enhanced the ripeness of the white and citrus-flavored fruits. Drink from 2020.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine has good acidity to give texture and minerality to its fruitiness. This freshness contrasts with the ripe fruit of the vintage. It also suggests some aging potential, so drink from 2020.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: From one of the smaller of the Meursault premier crus, this wine is delicately perfumed with white summer flowers. Its flavors are more ostentatious, generous with ripe white fruits and touches of mango to bring a more exotic edge. The wine is still young, so wait to drink until 2022.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Subtle citric freshness on the nose gets its proper due on the palate. Here it is the zesty counterpart to the rounded, smoky, nutty but subtle sweetness. This dances with balance, enabled by that lovely lemon freshness. The finish is medium sweet with a lovely long length.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wood-aged wine is top-of-the-line for the estate. With acidity coming both from the ripe white fruit and the wood, the wine has a good future as the wood integrates. It will take a while to be ready and will be better from 2021.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Tight aromas of lemon peel, lemon pith and a touch of seared almond show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard along Highway 101 just south of Santa Maria. A compelling texture that blends bright acid and grippy tannins present flavors of roasted lemon and hazelnut on the palate.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: From one of the most familiar of the premier crus in Chablis, this wine is fragrant, fruity and still full of apple flavors. Age is just beginning to catch up with it, bringing a toasted-almond character to the fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink, although another few months will make it even better.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: From 21 parcels scattered throughout the village, this wine well represents the area's richness and minerality. Touched by wood and with some buttery character, the wine is laden with yellow fruits and citrus, finished with a hint of honey. Drink from 2020.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is a rich and persistent wine, whose exposure to 20% new French oak pushes tasty toasty flavors right up against the bright fruit. Apple, white melon and a hint of white radish come through in a wine so immediately delicious that there's really no reason to wait on it.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Despite rather low finished alcohol, this is a fully ripened and complete wine. Spicy pineapple, bright citrus and a touch of white radish flavors combine through the midpalate, and aging in 20% new French oak rounds out the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a wonderfully tart, textured and mineral-driven white from multiple sites across the appellation. Crisp apple and pear wrap around a core of lemon, nutmeg and lemongrass, finishing on a bite of wet stone.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This wine is fruity, fresh with a touch of spice that gives a good lift. The bright character is boosted by hints of apricot to balance the citrus. The appellation is known for white wines and this bottling shows why. Drink now.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Situated towards the southern end of the Beaune vineyards, this premier cru produces both red and white wines. This wood-aged wine is rich both from its toastiness and the yellow fruits that add warmth. It is still young and finding full expression. The wine will be better from 2022.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is young but has great potential with its mineral texture and crisp apple fruits. It is complex, showing some wood aging as well as a good texture. All this will soften together. Drink from 2021.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
