description: This is a seductive wine with its balance between smooth, succulent citrus fruitiness and a mineral texture. Acidity and a tight, nervy edge mark it out as a young wine that needs to age further. Drink from 2021.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Toasty and flinty on the nose, this bottling pairs aromas of daffodil, paraffin and lemon cream. Hints of seared oak carry through the palate, where a zippy citrus-zest acidity cuts through the warmer apricot tones.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This bright wine offers numerous subtle pleasures. The flavors mix apple and green melon with spicy white radish. Aged just six months in 17% new French oak, it finishes on a wash of toasted hazelnut.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fermented and aged in wood, this is a rich wine. Its spice, ripe pineapple and mango flavors and dense texture show intense freshness as well as layers of toast, a complex texture and a short aging potential. Drink from 2021.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Wood fermented and aged this is a ripe wine. Stone fruits and and a full-bodied character are balanced by intense citrus flavors giving acidity. The wine is worth aging another few months, so drink from 2020.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is a balanced, wood-aged wine. Toastiness adds richness and softness to the crisp fruits. With a bright touch of acidity and citrus, the wine has a good future. Drink from 2021.

name: André Tixier et Fils 2012 Millésimé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of the most familiar premier cru vineyards in Meursault has produced a rich, wood-aged wine. A dense texture from aging on the lees in barrel brings out spice to balance the ripe apple flavors. The wine needs to age. Drink from 2022.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine begins a bit shy on the nose but soon shows precise aromas of nectarine, chalk, honeysuckle and melon rind. The palate grips with texture, carrying flavors of lemon, white peach and lychee.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is rich with white fruits. Citrus acidity balances the riper, fuller fruitiness. Drink this attractively spicy wine from 2020.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Extremely pure and crisp on the nose, this bottling starts with aromas of pure apple and crushed chalk. There is great zip to the sip and sharp flavors of white peach and lime custard that are vibrant and alive. Drink now–2032.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Estate grown, this expressive, textural wine presents an inviting mix of cucumber, apple and white melon, with some peppery daikon highlights. The lush, mineral-drenched acidity contributes to the overall balance, yielding a wine with both elegance and complexity.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Pristine aromas of lemongrass and white flowers carry the nose of this polished Chardonnay. The palate brings crunchy white-plum and lemon-zest flavors set against delicate warm spices, with bright acidity integrated into a silken backdrop. Powdered lemon candies linger on the close.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From selected parcels, this wood-aged wine is generous while also textured and lined with minerality. Ripe yellow fruits are very present and developing well. However the structure means the wine will need time. Drink from 2022.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: While still young, this wine shows good balance between crisp apple and citrus and some toastiness. The flavors give the wine its richness and ripe character that will age well. Drink from 2021.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The juicy crispness of this wine balances the richness of the vintage with a long-term view. It's textured and poised between apple and apricot flavors, with some final spice. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: A.R. Lenoble  NV Rosé Terroirs Brut  (Champagne)
description: While wood aging shows strongly, this wine also has great fruitiness. It offers potential in its warm, ripe character as well as fresh acidity and spiciness. It should develop well and be ready from 2021.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This vineyard that produces both white and red wines is at the western end of the line of Savigny's premier cru vineyards. The wine is rich and full of spice from wood aging along with opulent yellow fruits. A sense of minerality gives structure. This ripe wine will age, so drink from 2021.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This well-balanced wine connects intense. bright acidity with the pure citrus fruits. The wine is perfumed by accents of flowers, with rich fruit as well as spice. Drink from 2021.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: The touch of spice in this wine adds richness to its white fruits. It gives a wine that is both ripe and textured, with lively acidity at the end. This will be a fine wine from 2021.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fermented in an amphora, this wine has an attractive oxidative edge that has softened the brisk fruit and rounded the corners. It has ripe apple flavors as well as hints of apricots to balance the bright acidity. Drink this bottling now.

name: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Elisabeth Salmon Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This walled vineyard, the clos, has produced a broad, ripe wine, dense with fruitiness and spice from wood aging. The finish is fresh, crisp and textured. This deliciously structured wine will be ready from 2021.

name: Piper-Heidsieck 2006 Rare Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe wine has weight and richness while maintaining balancing freshness. Citrus flavors are already integrated with spice from wood aging to give a full, delicious and ready-to-drink wine.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Mangos and ripe peaches arise from this mature wine. They combine with nuttiness, spice and a full, rounded texture. It provides a great example of how Chablis can change as it ages, gaining richness and complex flavors. Drink the wine now.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This premier cru is on the left bank of the Serein river. Full of ripe while also crisp fruit, this wine is juicy, succulent and freshly fragrant. A backdrop of acidity balances the ripe fruits and edge of minerality. Drink from 2020.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Combining estate grapes from both Roberts Road and Green Acres vineyards, this showcases the coast well in its firmness of structure and high-toned acidity. Starting off somewhat reduced on the nose, it opens slowly to reveal layers of Meyer lemon, melon and green apple, with a richer back note of baked peach.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Subtle aromas of nectarine, lemon and pear flesh are pinpoint in precision and utterly pure on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense in structure yet more generous in flavor that other Chanin bottlings, offering yellow pear, buttered apple, toasted oak and, on the finish, pale-caramel flavors.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Situated close to the range of Grand Cru vineyards, this premier cru is known for its rich wines. Here that generosity is expressed in broad peach and apricot flavors laced with apple acidity. A touch of toastiness adds complexity to this ripe, full-bodied wine. Drink from 2021.

name: Perrier Jouët 2012 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)
description: Petrol and spice aromas lead into a wine that potentially has great richness as well as a beautiful line in crisp freshness. The wine is all about fine fruits, lightly touched by spice and minerality. Drink from 2022.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: The last of the winery's 2016 Chardonnays to be released, it's a stunner. The wine is a limpid gold color, and the aromatics of orange blossom, candlewax and crème caramel set you off on a lush exploration of a vivid, full-throttle explosion of flavor. White peach, crisp apple and green pineapple fruit is nicely matched to toasty oak. The finish extends for a full minute or longer. This may well be the best Chardonnay at this price in the state.

name: Pascal Clément 2016 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: In this beautifully textured wine, acidity and a mineral edge are balanced by spice and fragrant, fresh white and citrus fruits. The structure will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: A blend of several parcels, this bottling provides a snapshot of this famous premier cru. The wine has succulence as well as opulent potential. It is rich but shot through with acidity, minerality and fresh fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2022.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine is open and aromatic, with pretty scents of pastry, butter cookie and apple turnover. The apple and apricot fruit is bright and concentrated. Full malolactic and one-quarter new French oak aging lends a smooth, buttery finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a leesy, creamy wine, with ample flavors of cucumber, melon and wet rock. Dense fruit flavors of grapefruit and lemon rind are in abundance and travel the length of the palate.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This lush and lovely Chardonnay is bursting with apple, peach, tangerine and honeydew. A light dusting of cinnamon spice contributes to a full-throttle, lingering finish. Decant this, and it will open up beautifully.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Sourced from two great sites, Martaella Estate and Zio Tony Ranch, this is an acid-driven wine, demure and elegant in wet stone and a touch of lanolin. The midpalate develops more weight and richness in the form of baked apple and pear, finishing with focus and lasting complexity.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Very light and bright, this bottling from one of the appellation's northernmost and coolest sites shows honeysuckle and more white flowers on the subtle, delicate and yet inviting nose. There's a vibrant tension on the sip, where chalky white-rock flavors dance with lemon zest for a laser-sharp expression.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is ripe, structured with a hint of tannins as well as fresh citrus and green-plum fruits. The vineyard lies just down the slope from the village. Drink from 2022.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This taut, textured wine has a great future. With acidity and crispness underlined by minerality, the wine will be ready from 2022.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Ripe and spicy, this wine also has some of the typical minerality of the appellation. It shows potential for good balance, with bright acidity and a nervy edge. Drink from 2021.

name: Château de Santenay 2017 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: This rich wine is seriously ripe and packed with concentrated yellow fruits and spice from wood aging. Acidity is also a powerful element in a wine that needs more aging. Drink from 2023.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine comes from a tiny premier cru wedged into Volnay but producing white Meursault. Toasty aromas and ripe apple flavors balance richness and a fresher, crisper character. The wine offers intensity, with concentrated minerality and complex textures. Drink from 2022.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of the larger premier crus in Chassagne-Montrachet this is therefore one of the most familiar. This wine's structure comes first, balancing the richness of the vintage while promising considerable aging potential. Acidity and a strongly textured character carry the wine forward for aging. Drink from 2022.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This reserve-level wine honors founder Larry Stone's mother and her sister, whose family farm set him on a winemaking path. Sleek and perfectly honed, it's a mix of green apple, melon and papaya, all lightly ripened but in proportion. It finishes with a burst of buttery toast.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This premier cru has produced a rich, structured wine that is still young. It's currently tight in profile, defined by tangy green fruit and bright acidity. There is density to the fruit, which indicates it will age further and be better from 2021.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Exotic aromas of lemongrass, chive, Vidalia onion skin and toasted nut make for a fascinating entry to this bottling. The palate carries hints of vanilla and light caramel that surround the baked apple flavors, all framed by zippy acidity.

name: Maso Martis 2009 Madame Martis Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This opulent wine comes from one of the best premier cru vineyards in Puligny. That richness is balanced by crisp minerality and acidity, bringing out both the texture and the lemon flavors. The wine is still developing and will be at its best from 2022.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of peach compote on toast, honeysuckle and lemongrass make for a very fresh and floral nose on this bottling from the historic vineyard. A chalky mouthfeel frames flavors of seared lemon and roasted peach.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Juicy in exotic waves of tangerine, grapefruit and Gravenstein apple, this is a textured and complex white, with justified weight and breadth across the palate. Tart acidity lifts the richness and rounded edges from becoming overly lush, bringing it all back to a lasting hit of freshness on the spicy, vanilla-oaked finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromas of yellow peach, roasted pome fruit, light caramel, toast and delicious oak show on the nose of this bottling by Kevin Law. The palate is quite exotic and unique, combining roasted wood, dried peach and mango with hints of saffron, olive oil and aged cheese.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Brioche, pineapple and ripe melon aromas make for a creamy nose on this bottling from the vineyard's historic old vines that were planted in 1971. The palate zips with acidity, carrying flavors of lemon sorbet and sea salt. It's very taut and tense throughout.

name: Château de Santenay 2017 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: A structured and mineral wine with warm apricot flavors, this is dense and complex. Wood aging gives spice that is balanced by the creamy texture and finished with a final burst of acidity. Drink the wine from 2021.

name: Vincent Girardin 2016  Corton-Charlemagne
description: In this ripe white-wine year, Corton-Charlemagne is especially powerful. This wine's considerable concentration unfurls swathes of rich white fruits filled out with minerality and crispened by acidity. The wine's potential is long term and it shouldn't be touched before 2023.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This gorgeous, acid-driven Chardonnay is made from the producer's dry-farmed estate. Stone, apricot, apple, pear and fig ride along a focused, linear palate. Barrel fermentation has lent texture and nuance without distraction. It finishes succulent, soft and inviting.

name: Joseph Drouhin 2017 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)
description: Farmed biodynamically (as are all the vineyards owned by this producer), two parcels within the premier cru provided grapes for this wine. Superbly structured, it combines yellow and white-fruit flavors with generous spice, toast and minerality. The result is a wine that will age extremely well. Drink from 2023.

name: Château de Santenay 2017 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: This wine has great potential. Rich white fruits and generous wood aging form elements of a wine that will take time to mature. To contrast, a strong streak of textured minerality highlights the wine's promise. Drink from 2023.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This gorgeous wine offers aromas of peach, pear and fluffy brioche on the nose, with a rounded, rich and fleshy palate boasting similar flavors. Elegantly structured, it delves deeper into mineral aspects of flint and stone as it opens in the glass, finishing undeniably crisp in tones of apple and Meyer lemon.

name: De Sousa & Fils 2008 Caudalies Grand Cru Millésimé Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: The largest of the premier crus in Chassagne-Montrachet takes its name from the ancient abbey on the site. Rich, structured and blending ripe yellow fruits with intense acidity, the wine is concentrated and ageworthy. Drink from 2022.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Crushed white rocks, Asian pear, a touch of butter and a hint of pineapple converge on the nose of this deliciously complex bottling. There is extreme tension on the palate, where lively lemongrass and taut white-fleshed fruit flavors are expertly subtle and will only improve for decades. Drink now through 2037.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Flinty and light-footed, this méthode Champenoise Chardonnay sparkling wine offers crisp apple and lemon flavors accented by hints of burnt sugar and brioche. It's a piercing, persistent wine juxtaposing rich, mouthfilling pétillance against a bristling acidic backbone.

name: Arnaud Baillot 2017  Corton-Charlemagne
description: This wine has both power and wonderful fruit. The tension between the two will result in a magnificent wine in the future. The wine's acidity and apple and citrus flavors are essential elements in the wine's development. It has a way to go, so drink from 2023.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Owner and winemaker Katy Wilson makes very little of this wine sadly, so stock up if you can. Stony mineral and brine figure prominently on entry as a buildup of Meyer lemon, fig and quince define the juicy midpalate of restrained oak and ripeness. Lingering acidity keeps it fresh through a long, spicy finish.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Despite the struggles of growing grapes on mountaintops in the middle of an island, this Chardonnay impresses with aromas of tight lemon peel, nectarine, pineapple and lime leaf. There is a blast of acid on the sip, where seared white-peach and lemon flavors prove fresh and lovely.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A gorgeous nose reveals subtle notions of candied lemon, musk, fresh and rich yellow apple and an edge of hayflower. The palate is intensely sweet and concentrated but shines with the vivid purity expected of Eiswein. This is a little gem, displaying alluring edges of zesty spice. It is lovely now but certain to last. Drink until 2045.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Very delicate on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of nectarine, white-melon flesh, a hint of melon rind and light lemon spray. The palate is extremely textural, offering subtle flavors of lemon cream, chalk, lemongrass, ash and Brie rind that will live forever. Drink now through 2042.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Clean lines of wet cement, chalk, lime blossom, citrus peel and sandalwood veer into exotic aromatic combinations on the nose of this bottling. There is tremendous tension on the palate, where fine-grained oak tannins uphold the Asian pear, lemon spray and white-rock flavors.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Fruity, straightforward and ripe, this wine is light and refreshing. It will be nice for a picnic or pre-meal cheese tasting.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: An intense smoky aroma and equally dramatic charred oak flavors dress up this rich-textured, full-bodied wine. Butter and vanilla accents emerge and linger on the palate.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: A blend from four parcels in this famed grand cru, this wine offers a panoply of ripe fruit as well as a dense structure. Acidity comes from the wood aging as well as the fruit to balance this intense wine. It will certainly age, so drink from 2023.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: This is an extravagantly buttery Chardonnay, with a soft smooth texture. An aroma of toasted baguette is followed by flavors of vanilla, poached pear and butterscotch while the mouthfeel and body are full.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Bright acidity and touches of spice from wood aging give this wine both ripeness and complexity. With good acidity to guarantee freshness, the wine is balanced and succulently ready to drink.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This crowd-pleasing, medium-bodied wine is flavorful, well balanced and fruity enough, showing spicy oak accents in a supporting role.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is a well-balanced, medium-bodied wine that stays to the middle of the road, offering equal parts ripe fruit and buttery oak. It's a straightforward pour that should please a diverse crowd of drinkers.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Extremely delicate and pure aromas of lemon, nectarine, gardenia and lily are soft and inviting on the nose of this bottling. The palate sizzles with acidity, offering focused but austere flavors of lemon zest and crushed gravel that surround an immensely chalky core. It will mature well through 2042.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine offers ripe fruit aromas, a rich smooth texture and a good touch of crisp acidity for balance. The addition of 2% Gewürztraminer and 2% Viognier help elevate the fruitiness.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This affordable wine offers nicely interwoven oak and ripe fruit flavors. It is smooth and rich in feel, with a lingering baking spice finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aged in wood for 12 months (hence the name of the wine), this is richly textured. Its toastiness is unlikely to disappear, although the fruit is now morphing into nutty flavors and acidity. It is a wine for food rather than an aperitif.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tight aromas of lime pith, lemongrass, lime leaf and wet chalk show on the nose of this bottling. A line of fresh Key lime flavors meet with green pear on the tightly woven palate.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Hints of mango and ripe yellow fruits as well as plenty of acidity and lime flavors give this wine an attractive, open character. The freshness of the fruit at the end gives a final lift. Drink now.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Not too showy at first but quietly rich in flavor, this full-bodied wine drizzles subtle spices of nutmeg and vanilla over a core of baked apple and ripe pear. Toasted oak, butterscotch and pineapple emerge on the lingering finish.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine catches the eye with a deeper than usual gold color before aromas like crisp fruits and flavors like savory herbs and earth unfold. It feels firm and lean on the palate, slowly releasing mineral and toasted almond accents on the finish. From a great Pinot Noir vineyard, this wine should open with time. Best after 2022.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This well-made white offers a balanced mélange of apple, pear and cinnamon. Bright acidity lifts it all and works well with the French oak.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Delicious floral and fruity aromas lead to mouthcoating fruit and honey flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. There is little oakiness to intrude on the gushing, generous apple, pear and peach nuances.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine is a blend of grapes from Sexton Hill and Cider Ridge Vineyards, both estate-farmed and occupying the same hill southwest of Sebastopol, 10 miles from the Pacific Ocean. Apple, lime and a touch of wet stone give it cool-climate appeal while persistent acidity lifts it up.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Delicate scents of dried chamomile, brioche and orchard waft out of the glass. Vibrant and linear, the dry palate offers white-peach, dried pineapple and citrus-zest notes alongside bright acidity.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This exuberant white is lengthy in stony minerality and a touch of sea spray, its closeness to the coast in full display. Integrated and balanced in acidity, it shares juicy layers of apple and lemon with nuanced oak and subtle tannin.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This wine tastes lively, nicely fruity and well concentrated without overt oak or too much body. Delicious, pure apple and pear flavors are supported by good acidity for a slightly reserved character that demands more sipping.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Anise, guava and caramelized oak define this rich, densely layered wine, made from Sangiacomo Vineyard grapes. Concentrated in ripe tropical fruit it finds freshness on the long spice-tinged finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Tight aromas of lime blossom, Key lime sorbet, white melon and a touch of spearmint show on the nose of this bottling by football star Charles Woodson. The palate starts with stony flavors before tropical touches of guava and lychee arise.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Perfumed with floral touches and hints of honey, this wine is lightly structured. The year in wood has added spice to the fruitiness to produced a sophisticated, ripe wine. Drink from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is a substantially fleshy, rounded white wine, offering concentrated flavors of almond paste, white peach and crème brûlée. The oak is integrated and supportive, with nuanced wisps of nutmeg and vanilla.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Lengthy, textured and robustly concentrated, this is beautiful white wine, juicy and floral in equal measure. Flavors lean into apple, pear and peach, with accents of jasmine and nutmeg that spread across a widely impressive palate.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Plush aromas of white peach, pan-seared apple, light caramel and toasted hazelnuts show on the nose of this bottling, which delves into the richer style of Chardonnay. The palate is full and creamy, with flavors of roasted apple, peach and buttery toast, all balanced by zesty acid.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Quite ripe and opulent, this full-bodied wine is mouthfilling, rich in fruit and spices, and shows an attractive, lingering finish. Concentration, layering and a creamy texture all add to its appeal.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Toasted nut, chamomile, coconut and coffee aromas form the subtle nose along with a whiff of citrus. On the palate, a persistent perlage and bright acidity accompany bitter walnut, vanilla, mature yellow apple and candied orange drop.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This balanced wine offers juicy tones of tropical fruit and lemon, with a floral undertone. The palate shows a mild grip, giving it tension and verve.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Steely and seemingly low in oak, this is a softly layered, mineral-driven white, with lithe flavors of apple and pear that mingle well against a fluid texture. The wine appeals in its approachability and quality.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine offers juicy peach, apple and fig, with measured richness and highlights of vanilla and oak. The lush, creamy style is sure to appeal to many.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: In this perfumed wine, spice and a touch of wood aging add richness. Balancing white fruits against acidity, this rounded wine from Lantignié near Morgon is lightly structured and ready to drink.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Lightly wood aged, this ripe, spicy wine has touches of toast overlying yellow-fruit flavors. It is rich and smoothly textured, with a good shot of acidity. Drink from 2020.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This full-bodied wine shows minimal oak flavor, and instead is driven by tasty nervy fruity notes like Bosc pear and Pippin apple. It tastes clean, fresh and tangy for a very appetizing effect that the average California Chardonnay doesn't offer.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Comforting aromas of oven-baked bread and Bartlett pear waft out of the glass. On the polished, refreshing palate, a continuous perlage frames creamy yellow apple, nectarine and citrus zest alongside a hint of baking spice.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Top grower Perroud, based in the Côte de Brouilly, has produced a perfumed Chardonnay. Its acidity and tangy texture are enhanced by the minerality of the chalky soil. Drink the wine now.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Ripe fruit aromas and enticing pastry-shop accents bring a lot of enjoyment to this medium-bodied, fresh and minimally oaky wine. Crisp apple and poached pear mingle with vanilla, nutmeg and ginger on the palate while crisp natural acidity keeps it in balance.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine finds great balance between richness and vibrancy, delivering a broad mouthfeel lifted by brilliant fruit and baking-spice flavors. Lemon, butter and pear aromas lead to Fuji apple and tangy lemon on the palate.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Aged for 15 months in wood and bottled in 2019, this offers a good balance between toast and freshness. Wood flavors fully integrate with citrus flavors to produce a balanced wine that is ready to drink.

name: Robert Perroud 2018 Terres Blanches  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Crushed sea shells, lemon spray, apple flesh and spun-sugar aromas draw the nose into this twist-top bottling. There's a compelling zip of acidity on the palate, where mellow flavors of toast and lemon jelly ride that sizzle into the finish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Silky and vibrant, this delicately scented sparkler offers white stone-fruit, chamomile and brioche aromas. The creamy, weightless palate evokes mature yellow apple, orange drop and a bread-crust note before an almond close.

name: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cola and bark mark a wine of sizable tannins and black-cherry jam in this otherwise mild-mannered red.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This wine is earthy and herbal, with a brushy, dusty grip of tannic power that overwhelms the full-bodied palate.

name: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Black fruit and spice aromas are at the fore of this 100% varietal wine, with the palate showing more of the same. It is straightforward and to the point, with slightly dry tannins backing it all up.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas offer notes of baking spice, tire rubber and cherry. The flavors paint around the edges, with notes of cherry and burnt rubber, with a lick of tart acids finishing it off. It's a strange mix.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Green pepper, jalapeño and herb aromas are out front, with cherry notes lurking in the background. Dark fruit flavors follow, with a strong herbal thread running throughout. It comes off as quite green and light.

name: Bianchi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: With additions of 12% Malbec, 7% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, this red is spicy and full of heat, with an astringent note of dried herb. The tannins are substantial and fruit dull.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Leathery and tobacco dominate in this wine, which is marked by a robust aspect of oak and mild structure.

name: Raymond 2016 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is brawny and shy in fruit, exhibiting a touch of red cherry in the background. Sticky tannins make themselves felt, dotted in leather and clove.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of plum and plum seed along with whiffs of green pepper are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors, focused around the edges. The concentration comes off as quite light, but what's there is pleasant.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Minty aromas of chocolate and oak are a touch hot and burning. In the mouth, this Cabernet feels fairly lean and high in acidity. Red berry and plum flavors come with forceful oak, while this is tangy and fresh on the finish.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A rawness hangs over the nose of this Cabernet, yielding aromas of tomato, red beet, horseradish and leathery plum. A full but somewhat flat palate isn't in the greatest shape, while this tastes of earthy cherry and black plum. With little to the finish, this is a wine to drink now.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Stillwater Creek and Wallula Vineyards. The nose offers aromas of orange peel, green pepper and cherry. On the palate, the concentration comes off as quite light, although what's there is pretty.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine is soft and quietly tannic, with strong flavors of baked plum, tar and black licorice. The texture has a leathery, grainy aspect to it that provides complexity.

name: Croma Vera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of green herb, graphite, underripe cherry and baking spice are followed by ripe, dried-out, seemingly high octane fruit flavors backed by gritty tannins. It's a strange mixture of overripe and underripe.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tart high-strung acidity meets generous tannins in this plummy full-bodied wine, robustly rich in red currant and cherry.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Honey-laced red cherries, spice-cake, molasses and cola aromas show on the nose of this widely available bottling. It's a bit sweet and simple on the palate, with cherry-brioche flavors.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Floral aromas of strawberry and soap open this everyday Cabernet. A full but clumsy and fleshy palate holds minty, herbal flavors of raspberry and plum that lean green the longer you spend with this. Similar flavors fill up the finish.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Interesting aromas of tamarind and cedar get this wine off to a complex start, while spicy savory cooked-fruit flavors give it an unusual but enjoyable character.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Pedras do Monte Cabernet Sauvignon-Tinta Roriz Red (Lisboa)
description: Modest raspberry aromas are shy and the slightest bit stalky. A fresh palate is driven by plumlike acidity, while flavors of plum and mixed berries end with hints of chocolate and caramel.

name: Hook or Crook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas are fresh, mild and clean. Cleanliness is also noted on the palate, which is tight and juicy. Cherry and cassis flavors are touched up by a dash of oaky spice, while this is peppery and tastes mostly of red fruits on the finish.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Moderately ripe aromas of plum and cranberry lead to a rubbery-feeling palate with hard tannins. Earthy berry flavors come with nut-skin bitterness, while this can't shake its aforementioned rubbery character on the finish. The 2016 vintage in Mendoza was tough on red wines, this one included.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This wine is minty and intense in tannin, which contributes to a grippy texture around its full-bodied weight. A brightness of red currant and cranberry give it a lasting tartness on the finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Bright blueberry, plum and cherry aromas open this affordable red, which is soft and supple in approachability. Clove and a touch of mocha round out the light-bodied experience.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Dark red currant and concentrated rose elements meet with crushed slate and a pinch of herbs on the nose in this bottling from the eastern slope of the appellation. Flavors of pencil shavings, tomato leaf and dried oregano are prominent on the palate, where tart berries and persistent acid round out the experience.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Berry and cassis aromas are jammy. This Cabernet from a difficult vintage feels full, chunky and chewy, with tomatoey acidity. Flavors of plum, herbs and tomato leaf finish dry and savory, with just enough fruity ripeness to make this nice.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: There's no mistaking the variety, with its aromas of fresh herb, black cherry, dark fruit and baking spice. Ripe fruit flavors follow, threaded with green herb notes throughout. Firm tannins provide support. The concentration isn't always there but what is is quite nice.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a smoky oaky wine with a touch of reduction that opens into a juicy approachable world of soft rich blueberry and plum. It offers good value with a light-bodied approach to ripeness.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A tarry black color is backed by heavily oaked aromas of asphalt and char. This is full in body, with a denseness driven by severe extraction and equally extreme oak. Woody blackberry flavors are hot on a minty, oaky finish.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: The pine-forest aromas are strong in this bottling, with some blackberry, tobacco and eucalyptus also at play on the nose. Cedary, cigar-box flavors consume the palate, along with touches of blackberry and peppercorn.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: A straightforward and relatively approachable Cab, this offers notes of plums and currants set with a savory, earthy back drop. The palate is full-bodied, with grainy, muscular tannins that coat the tongue and are only just saved by the juicy fruit.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Allomi Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy aromas of gravelly minerality, clay and damp wood meet with tart red currants on the nose of this lightly bodied Cab from a historic vineyard. There is a lot of herbal tension to the palate, which is fairly green and framed by tannins that still need smoothing out.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is a sturdy, full-bodied wine that offers up aromas of ripe plum and cherry laced with dried green herbs and a savory streak of raw meat and mushrooms. The savory, drying tannins pack a punch, but the acidity and fruit weight back it up. It finishes on a note of tangy blueberry. Drink now–2023.

name: Walnut Crest 2003 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley)
description: Aromas of graphite, cherry, medicine cabinet and cedar are followed by black fruit flavors that seem surprisingly light, especially in the middle, for the appellation and listed alcohol. Cranberry notes linger on the finish.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine has a good range of fruit, spice and wood flavors along with appealing balance and a smooth, lightly tannic texture. Hints of cedar, black cherry and raspberry light up the palate.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Full bodied and firm textured, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavor, light oak shadings from the use of 30% new oak barrels and a good grippy mouthfeel.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2016 Dama de Plata Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a chunky, ripe Cab that shows plenty of plum, red and black fruit, violet and cola. The palate is tightly wound, with a chalky mouthfeel and grainy, vice-like tannins that overpower all else. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: From an New York operation located in the Hudson Valley that bills itself as the oldest continuously operating winery in the country, this bottling shows baked cherries, blackberries, molasses and anise on the nose. It's rounded and rich on the palate, where charred red fruits meet with cocoa atop a decently structured texture.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Earthy plum aromas are challenged and wayward, but not off-putting. A tough palate is tannic and lacking in depth of fruit. Dark, peppery berry flavors are a bit oaky, while this is drying and tastes herbal on the finish.

name: Casca Wines 2017 1808 Collection Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Blackberry aromas are friendly and not forced. This is a fresh-styled Cabernet with some smack to a palate with firm acidity and notable tannins. Flavors of berry fruits and plum skins finish tight and mildly tannic.

name: California Roots 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Black raspberry, fresh thyme and white pepper make for an interesting aromatic approach to this bottling. Pencil shavings and bright red fruit prove a tad weak on the palate.

name: Buehler 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a spicy, aromatic Cab dripping in Dr. Pepper, tangy red berries, vanilla, florals, black pepper and soy sauce. The full-bodied palate is a little hot and unbalanced, with chewy, grainy tannins, ripe, concentrated fruit and a fair whack of oak.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: This wine has a strong streak of barnyard notes. Underneath you'll find ripe, plummy fruit, violets, mushrooms, wet earth and hoisin sauce. The palate is clunky and two-dimensional, with grainy-textured, chewy tannins, plush fruit and oak.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2017 Point West Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
description: Brambly berry aromas are minty and a bit stalky. A hard palate features cheek-sucking tannins that create extreme dryness. Gritty, peppery berry flavors are mildly green at their core, while this reverts to rubbing tannins on the finish.

name: Axios 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Big black fruit and cedar wrap around a stock of toasted oak and tannin in this integrated wine that is in decline.

name: Schug 2014 Heritage Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine holds back on its aromatics, but not on its generous grip of oak and tannin. The flavors lean into dried cherry, cassis and mint.

name: Husch 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Sanguine in red currant and tangy acidity, this wine is robust in tannin with a finish of mint.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 100% varietal and was aged in 43% new French oak. Baking spice, graphite, green pepper and black fruit aromas are at the fore. Ripe but light fruit flavors follow on the well-balanced palate.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Crushed rock aromas meet with charred wood, vibrant blackberry and black pepper spice on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are rigid on the palate, where dried herbs, more peppercorn and light black-plum flavors arise.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The aromas offer notes of baking spice, plum and blue fruit. Plump feeling but quite light. Grainy-feeling black currant and plum flavors follow. The concentration seems very light.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Red-berry aromas are a touch green and spicy. A tight, firm, compact palate deals reedy plum and berry flavors along with herbal notes. A dry finish with hard tannins reverts back to lightly herbal red fruit flavors.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: There's an earthy, reductive quality that sets this wine apart. If you're a fan of a little funk, those barnyard notes actually add character to the wine, rather than detract. After all, there are plenty of cherry and chocolate notes to balance them out. Things go up a notch on palate, which is all about power, with muscular, gripping tannins that literally muscle out everything else.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Jammy blueberry and cherry contrast against substantial smoky oak and leather in this medium-bodied smoothly rounded red. The tannin weight makes it seem heavier than it is.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a nervy red wine that packs plenty of ripe fruit onto a taut frame of firm tannins and acidity. It has impressive grip on the palate, good cherry and cranberry flavors and a tannic finish.

name: RedHeads 2015 Esule Cabernet Franc-Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: A soft entry leads a midpalate that's fully ripe and fleshy. Moderate tannins lend support to fruity notes of blueberry and black cherry dipped in dark chocolate.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor, light spicy oak accents and an almost silky texture that makes it easy to sip. It's a good choice to please a crowd.

name: J. Scott Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The aromas show notes of herb, spice, black licorice and cherry. The medium-bodied fruit flavors paint around the edges, with the tannins bringing a lightly chalky feel. It seems a bit overripe, but the concentration is not quite right at the same time.

name: Château Hyot 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: This is a value red made in a big full-bodied style that's thick, rich and chocolatey. Substantial heat and oak push the fruit forward with no hesitation.

name: B Side 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Rubbery berry fruit aromas are a bit pinched and narrow. In the mouth, this is chewy and dense, with tomatoey acidity. Savory, lightly herbal plum, spice and tomato flavors finish with snap.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Berry and plum aromas are a touch jammy and raisiny. A smacking palate with pulp and weight offers plum, currant and herbal flavors. This Cabernet turns over no new stones, but it's savory tasting, fresh and in good shape on the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Boysenberry sorbet, cocoa and sweet dried herbs show on the nose of this complex and layered Cab from the warm reaches of Carmel Valley. The structure is tannic, chalky and firm, though the mouthfeel is lighter than expected, offering flavors of tobacco, berry and light vanilla on the finish.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Earthy, meaty berry aromas are accompanied by notes of iodine and iron. A sturdy palate shows very dry tannins, while this tastes of peppery berry fruits prior to a savory tasting finish with wiry acidity, pushy oak and firm residual tannins.

name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2014 Dancing Flame Llaima Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Very rich and ripe, this lip-smacking wine has abundant grapey jammy blackberry-like aromas and flavors, and a broad, mouthfilling texture. It's well-backed by moderate tannins to balance out all that fruit.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Blackberry, plum and raspberry aromas are full and earthy, but ultimately basic. On the palate, this is high in acidity and a bit lean in body and stuffing. Smacking plum and berry flavors finish fresh, tight and true to the variety.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: The nose of this bottling is very twiggy with aromas of dried herbs, dark cocoa, peppercorn and elderberry. Damp wood and sage sticks show on the palate alongside very dark and dry berry flavors.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Raspberry and plum aromas are fruity, slightly jammy and a touch medicinal. On the palate, this is tight but with fleshy depth. Plum, wild berry and baking spice flavors finish firm and bright, with a healthy kick. Given that 2016 was a difficult vintage for red wines in Mendoza, this qualifies as a success.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Intesa Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a powerfully concentrated wine that's balanced by an underlying brightness. The juicy acidity supports flavors of red cherry and plum, while integrated tannins give it a plush feel that's widely appealing.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is made from two of the producer's properties, Cold Springs and Croquet Estate, both atop the mountain appellation. It shows the power of those sites and a drought-driven vintage. The core is dense and tannic with an intensity of baked plum and dark chocolate.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine comes out of the gate with mint and graphite notes over a core of ripe blackberry, raspberry, dark chocolate and woody, earthy spice. The palate is laced with drying, grainy tannins and a good lick of acidity to balance the ripe fruit. Coonawarra's classic power and richness are tempered by a bouncy, youthful approach in this wine. Drink now–2028.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: Blending in tiny amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec, this robustly concentrated red is given nearly two years in French oak, much of it new. It offers leathery sinew, bombastic tannins that should shake out in time, and classic elements of cedar, pencil shavings and currant. This is for fans of power.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine shows good concentration in color, flavor and texture. It is deep and dark, with ripe, jammy tones of blackberry and black cherry. Significant baking-spice elements add complexity, while fine-grained tannins add a thick texture.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is earthy, dusty and mineral-driven, with a lasting taste of dried herb, cedar and sage. Bright, underlying acidity lifts the midpalate from its full-bodied richness as red currant, cherry and cassis come into the light.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a reduced, thick and richly intense wine from the mountain appellation. It is robust in black fruit and grippy tannin. The fruit takes on a baked quality that works within its context of savory tobacco, clove and black pepper.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is 100% varietal and from the producer's vineyard, planted to two clones of the variety. Clove, caramel and dusty sage flavors guide a powerful, integrated body of full ripeness, soft texture and lasting richness of graham cracker.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 11% Petit Verdot, then aged more than two years in 100% new French oak, this is built for power, exhibiting hugely tannic structure and vanilla oak. Black currant, cedar and dried herb dot the palate before a dense richness of chocolate comes to the fore.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Labelled in velvet, the thick dense texture of this wine is equally soft and richly built, with substantial tannin and oak on display. Bright red cherry and cassis are interwoven between the powerful ripeness.

name: Level 3 2016 Choice & Chance Red (Paso Robles)
description: Earthy cedar gives this wine a savory character that impresses, as well as a well-integrated core of chalky tannin, moderate oak and black-cherry ripeness. It provides substantial mouthfeel and approachability.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: With 5% Merlot blended in, this beastly wine boasts bright tones of cassis and currant, with lingering accents of coconut and vanilla. Big, dense and concentrated, it has a ton of structure, grippy tannin and oak.

name: Adelaida 2017 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: From a Conn Valley vineyard estate and 100% varietal, this wine is tightly wound and full bodied, reflective of the vintage and the warmer climes. It is intensely flavored and dense, grippy in leathery tannin and oak power, with a dusting of dried herb and graphite.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Juicy with just a slight touch of reduction, this wine is thick and well-integrated—a small-production offering that reflects well on the appellation. Plum, black cherry and hints of black licorice toy with the nose and palate, finishing in balance and grace.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is lighthearted and approachable yet structured, with earthy elements of turned earth and dried herb. The palate is grippy in tannin and dark in blackberry and chocolate flavors.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tremendous value for the quality—a youthful tightly wound wine that's still thick and tannic, with a heavy thread of leather, gunpowder and oak. Savory and substantial, it has secondary seasonings of sage and cedar that contrast well against black currant and cherry.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a brawny and broad reserve-level wine that's grippy and dusty in tannins. Powerful red fruit matches the rich concentration, the acidity textured and well-integrated to offer complementary brightness in contrast to the big flavor.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This might be the best value in the appellation: a beautifully structured wine that's brimming in blackberry and plum flavors with a medium-bodied elegant approach. Soft velvety texture gives it additional appeal as it finishes in baking spice and clove.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine opens in cedar and dried herb earthiness and swiftly expands into a world of broad, exuberant red cherry and cassis. It balances its full-bodied power with grace and dusty oak, the tannins relatively tamed.

name: Silverado 2016 Geo Estate Grown Mt George Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a grippy, dense and powerful red, blended with 5% Petit Verdot. Approachable in its youth, it shows strong flavors of red currant, cherry and coconut, with a lushness that lingers on the finish.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Flavorful, well-structured and well-balanced, this is a wine for all seasons. With a medium to full body, generous black cherry and raspberry aromas, and a nicely dry mouthfeel, it is ready to pair with almost any meat, fowl or cheesy dish.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This has lithe bright red fruit with a touch of blueberry—flavors that are integrated and elegantly interwoven. Polished tannins give it grip and weight within this medium-bodied approach. This wine enjoyable and approachable in its understated complexity.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Brawny char and dark chocolate create a stage for jammy black cherry and blackberry to star in this big-boned full-bodied wine. Generous use of oak and substantial tannin give it an oomph of power that persists through a soft rounded finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Plum and cassis aromas are not overwhelming or oaky, and instead are more elegant and fresh. This Cabernet feels firm and pulling, with rubbery tannins. Flavors of berry fruits and chocolaty oak finish dry, with an emphasis on peppery spice.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: A great value from the great producer, this includes 5% Touriga, 4% Petite Sirah and 1% of mixed other grapes. Together, they offer juicy cherry notes and a big imprint of toasted tannin, the backbone of oak substantial yet soft and approachable. The finish is all mocha.

name: Long Meadow Ranch 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smashed blackberry, roasted meats, asphalt and toasty oak aromas show strongly on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard off of Montebello Road. Very earthy flavors of tar and turned soil come through on the palate, framed by very dry tannins and a finishing with a hint of cocoa.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a finely made wine, blended with 10% Merlot and smaller bits of Petit Verdot and Malbec. It offers silky tannins and lovely notes of dried herb, sage, black cherry and blackberry. The finish is dusted in cocoa powder.

name: Bacio Divino 2016 Janzen Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Inviting in rich layers that taste of cinnamon toast, dusty black fruit and clove, this is a powerfully built and nicely layered wine that has tannic structure to spare.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Black cherry, cocoa and turned loam aromas show on the nose. Bright berry and cherry flavors meet with tobacco and ancho chile dust on the palate.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a medium- to full-bodied Cab shows notes of red currants, raspberries and florals, with a distinctive savory core and a mineral, graphite streak. The fruit is concentrated on the palate, laced with structured, sinewy tannins and an earthy, stony finish. Drink now–2023.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: A deep red-berry aroma meets with mocha and toasty oak on the richly layered nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. There is solid complexity to the palate, with chalky tannins sitting beside more cocoa, red fruit and light caramel. This is an affordable wine to lay down. Drink now–2029.

name: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Bright fresh acidity wraps around darker denser flavors of blueberry, black cherry and black currant in this vineyard-designate, which is full bodied in style. It has appealing elements of dried herb and clove.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Brawny layers of blueberry and blackberry show in this broad and textured wine. Supple yet powerful tannins frame flavors of cedar, sage and cinnamon, which it an attractive, appealing vibe.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: From a valley floor vineyard in the warmer northern climes of the valley, this 100% varietal red is broad and generous in black brambly fruit that veers into a rich rounded taste of vanilla. Soft texture makes it approachable and enjoyable in its youth.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the cool mountain appellation, this wine is lightly spiced in clove and nutmeg and has a smooth soft elegance on the palate. Red currant, plum and blackberry give it a fruity underbelly that complements the feral aspects and viscosity.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Snappy blackberry and boysenberry aromas combine with lilac, herbs and olive on a very inviting nose in this second-label bottling by the Talley family. It's a fully flavored experience on the sip, with black plum, savory charred meat and dried herbs, showing great complexity for under $25.

name: MontGras 2016 Intriga Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: This offers a dense, heady mix of grilled plum, dark chocolate, coffee, mint and a slight meaty, charred quality. The palate comes with big, chewy tannins alongside plump fruit, herbs and cola flavors. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Merryvale 2015 Profile Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, rich and rounded red, structured in complex notions of dark cherry and cassis. Billowy tannins give it a lift of texture and lightness despite its overall weight and heft. Let this sit a bit; best 2026–2031.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This is a savory red, adorned in cedar, dried herb and black pepper. The aromatics are nicely defined in violet. Burly grippy tannins complement a wealth of ripe plum and graphite.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a solid bottling from the upper reaches of the Malibu Coast appellation, showing oak smoke, black cherry and a hint of dried mint on the nose. The palate, which is bolstered with 6% Petite Sirah, 4% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc offers flavors of savory meat and roasted cherries, all wrapped in taut tannins that stand firm in the finish.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a firm, full wine that needs some time. It's led by ripe plums, blackberries, mint and baking spices. There's sappy, soapy element to the oak and a savory, soy sauce note. The chalky tannins are big and blocky, driving the wine but nevertheless integrated with the plump black and purple fruit. Drink 2020–2030 and likely beyond.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Strawberry sorbet, light licorice and dried earth show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite mellow at first but becomes incredibly enjoyable with time. Fresh and accessible red-fruit flavors combine with hints of tobacco and tea leaf on the palate, which is delicate but with juicy depth.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Seared citrus, lemon candies and toasty oak aromas converge on the nose of this appellation blend—a more affordable way to taste the handiwork of one of California's best Chardonnay brands. Fresh lemon paste and apple-custard flavors meet with oak and sea salt on the palate.

name: Black Sheep Finds 2017 The Joy Fantastic Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Perfumed in exotic ginger and white flower, this is a creamy and full-bodied white wine from the mountain appellation that is well integrated in oak and tannin. Fig, pear and nutmeg highlight a broad spectrum of appeal and weight across the lengthy palate.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This balanced, bright wine is inviting in aromas of jasmine and apple blossom. Spicy oak complements a core of lemony flavor on the palate that leads to bold apple and accents of ginger and nutmeg.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Intriguing and exotic lime and green-plum aromas meet with white flowers and wet stone on the nose of this countywide blend. There's a bright sizzle of acidity to the sip, where sharp and fresh flavors of citrus pith and river stone converge.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Broadly structured and succulent, this wine offers brawny, well-integrated tannins and juicy undertones of baked plum and black cherry. With 5% Cabernet Franc, it's floral and brimming in dried herb, black pepper and tobacco.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: In a lineup of mostly delicate expressions, this is one of the winery's more oak-forward bottlings, starting with aromas of toasted wood and light caramel. The oak shows on the sip too, but the wine remains clean, pure and soft, with flavors of butterscotch and scorched lemon.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This powerful wine spreads rich butter and vanilla overtones across a foundation of crisp apple and lemon, while riper pear and fig flavors build on the palate and linger on the finish. A complex array of baking spices and a hint of toast add complexity and interest.

name: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This offers classic flavors of crisp, red currant and cassis, with background notes of dried herb and floral rose. The tannins are sturdy and supportive of the fruit. Toasted oak components are emphasized on the lengthy peppery finish.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Aromas of apple butter, lemon candies, daffodil and buttercream show on the lush nose of this bottling. The palate is full flavored and anything but shy, exhibiting lemon cream and juicy melon, all wrapped in penetrating acidity.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Strong aromas of lemon and yellow grapefruit meet with richer touches of toasted Marcona almond, sea salt and toast on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and savory, mixing lemon cream with almond and buttered croissant.

name: Patel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Initially reduced and oaky, this estate wine is intense in tar, black plum and gunpowder tones. The palate is big and ripe, with a generous feel and firm, chalky tannins. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Enticingly fragrant, this lovely sparkler opens with aromas of spring wildflower, citrus and white stone fruit. On the palate, a foaming mousse provides an elegant backdrop for juicy yellow apple, lemon drop and a hint of yellow peach before a white-almond close. Bright acidity gives it a crisp tangy finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted in 2014, this bottling shows lively aromas of lemon balm, mint, earthy nuts and a hint of aged cheese on the nose. The palate is strong with flavors of sour lemon, tangerine peel and ash, riding a laser-edge of acidity while trending pleasantly funky.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tightly wound on the nose, this appellation blend by Raj Parr and Sashi Moorman shows wet stone and lemon peel on the nose but also slightly fatter hints of seared apple, daffodil and light dairy. The sip is also tense and fresh, with lime-pith flavors and the slightest hint of nuts on the finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Immediately appealing aromas of daffodil, honeysuckle, cherimoya and hazelnut paste show on the nose of this bottling. The wine lands smooth and creamy on the palate, mixing plumeria, almond and light caramel flavors.

name: Di Costanzo 2017 Di Co Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This nose on this wine is dense and after some time in glass reveals appealing ripe blackberry and raspberry fruit, drying violets, mint and a savory, earthy mushroom and soy sauce aroma. The palate is big and the tannins have power. They're fine grained and chewy but not chunky. The fruit is sweet but lifted, not jammy. Drink now with time in decanter and proteins or for the next 10 years.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bold, oaky wine is full bodied, very flavorful and nicely rich in texture. Aromas of toasted and buttered baguette lead to ripe pear accented by caramel and vanilla.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Asian pear, Meyer lemon pith, white-melon flesh, sea salt, lime zest and a judicious touch of buttercream all swirl in aromatic harmony on the nose of this bottling. There is a steely grip to the sip, where a chalky structure wraps joyous flavors of lime pith and lemon cream.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Clean and crisp aromas of Asian pear, white melon and underripe pineapple meet with a judicious touch of oak on the nose of this bottling from a ranch that's been under vine since 1849. There is a great grip to the sip, which is pure and crisp, with chalk, flint and pomelo flavors.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Those seeking low-alcohol high-acid extremely taut Chardonnay should look no further than this bottling, which begins with exotic citrus and light daffodil on the nose. The sizzling acidity runs from the front to finish of the sip, where explosive citrus flavors meet with ashy Brie rind and wet gravel flavors.

name: Ackerman 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Leathery, sinewy tobacco adorns firm tannin in this structured, layered and integrated wine, made from a tiny acre block of the producer's hillside property. Elegant in style, it's lovely and light, a perfect companion for the table.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Chamomile, spring-blossom, wild herb, summer orchard-fruit and a whiff of brioche aromas shape the enticing nose on this focused sparkler. Elegantly structured and boasting tension and energy, the dry radiant palate delivers juicy white peach, pineapple, citrus zest and hints of exotic spice set against a silky perlage. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced and precise.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Chalk, ash and brisk lime aromas show on the nose of this bottling by Raj Parr and Sashi Moorman, which wraps a tight mineral-driven frame around explosive energy. The stony aspects dominate the sip as well, from a chalky texture to a flinty flavor, yet there are also touches of lemon zest and lemongrass.

name: Ulysses 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy in forest floor, this mountain wine is grippy and oaky, powerful in its grasp of a drought-affected vintage that offered density and concentration in spades. Stony dusty mineral components override the blue and black fruit that simmers beneath a full-bodied ripeness.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This blends the main variety with 16% Malbec and smaller pinches of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The resulting wine is robust and well built, softly structured and punctuated in flavors of bold red cherry and plum. Rich, it shows some restraint and ultimately balance, the fruit integrated with oak and tannin.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A blend of seven different parcels, this wine is warm and rounded. Its fruitiness offers citrus and crisp pear flavors, enhanced by a texture that adds minerality. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This attractive, balanced wine has a crisp texture as well as a nice touch of spice from wood aging. Its apple flavors are showing well against the texture of the wine. Drink now.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: A smoothly textured, rounded wine, this is ripe and very immediate. The touch of spice from wood aging is balanced by good acidity and crisp, textured apple flavors. Drink the wine now.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Lightly wood aged, this rich wine has ripe fruits and a juicy character. The white fruits are not yet fully integrated into the wood flavors, but it won't be long. This will be a generous wine, ready to drink from 2020.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Smoked nuts and a slight char show initially on the nose, with aromas of lemon and apple eventually pushing through. This is racy and light in profile, with searing acidity that's held in check by flavors of melon, grilled lemon and blanched almond.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This crisp, cool wine comes from the hills above Nuits-St.-Georges. It is bright with apples and acidity, textured and needs a few more months. Drink from 2020.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: From red volcanic clays and decomposing granite in a small, high-altitude region in New South Wales, this pale-gold-hued Chard opens on the reductive and oniony side. There's plenty of ripe melon and tropical fruit too, along with oak-spice and oyster-shell characteristics that eventually beat out the reduction as the wine opens in glass. The palate is ripe and creamy showing some butterscotch oak notes, particularly on the finish. It is a rich, weighty wine particularly considering its cool-climate origins.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: In a lighter, leaner vein than many Chardonnays, this non-oaked wine offers crisp lemon and green-apple notes, light body and a tangy mouthfeel.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is full of red-apple fruits with attractive acidity. It is fresh while also offering ripeness, a generous texture and soft aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a soft, ripe, yellow-fruit-flavored wine. Its gentle structure is filled out with rounded fruits, a touch of acidity and an orange-zest tangy aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine has acidity, a tangy character from citrus and plenty of freshness. Its crisp texture and bright acidity are ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is ripe, with layers of yellow fruits that are lifted by attractive, refreshing acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: This smoothly textured, rather bland wine has acidity and some toast. The fruit is muted and will remain so.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Clean aromas of white peach, sea salt and judicious oak manage to be both bright and creamy on the nose of this bottling from an iconic vineyard in the center of the appellation. It's also clean and crisp on the palate, with flavors of pineapple, mango and lime zest running deep into the finish.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is a tightly wound and intense wine that shows its youth, a study in concentrated Gravenstein apple, salt and stone. A floral underbelly of apple and orange blossom brightens the palate and grippy structure. Let this wine open slowly in the glass.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This wine is a blend of clones 76 and 96 at Roskamp. Appealing aromas of peach, honeycomb, pineapple, lees and lemon curd lead to a creamy, palate-coating mouthfeel, redolent with stone-fruit flavors. A lingering finish caps it off. It's a Chardonnay prototype, made in a fuller style.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: From the new appellation comes this well-made, impressive vineyard-designate, the entry crisp and focused in cool-climate acidity. Stone and white flower accents complement a midpalate of rounded lemon cookie, peach and pear, with just a touch of baking spice on the soft lengthy finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: There's more than enough to like about this highly drinkable Chardonnay. For starters, the nose is pleasantly yeasty, with notes of white flowers, salami and pear. A plump mellow palate deals honey and melon flavors, while this remains yeasty and rounded on the finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a good, reliable, middle-of-the road wine that puts fruit flavors first. It has nice, ripe apple and pear notes, a rather rich texture and softish balance.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This savory Chardonnay offers aromas of hard cheese rind and citrus cream on the nose. There's a pleasing ripeness to the palate in Meyer lemon and melon flavors, with a salty edge extending on the finish.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: The nose on this Hawkes Bay Chard is delicate if a little synthetic, with notes of lime citrus, florals, flecks of honey and white-pepper spice.
