The palate is richer and broader than the nose lets on, the toasty, spicy oak flaring up. It's lacking a little energy and focus, but will appeal to those who like creamy styles of Chardonnay.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Aromas of Fuji apple and toast pave the way for flavors of toasted pineapple, carambola and puff pastry. It is a little stiff at first sip, but opens to reveal velvety tannins that recede into a pineapple-laced finish.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Aromas of candied banana, citrus cream and stone are mild on the nose. There's some roundness to the palate that is fleshed out by citrus and papaya flavors. A stony mineral note rises up on the finish.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Aromas of Creamsicle, straw and lees lead to bountiful stone-fruit and spice flavors, with a creamy feel. The style gets a bit in the way of the substance.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Fresh, lively acidity is up front and persistent in this light steely white unfettered by oak. Fermented and aged instead in stainless steel, it shows bright flavors of mango, peach and green apple.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This Romanian Chardonnay has flavors of vanilla, crème brûlée and apple blossom. On the palate there are flavors of vanilla, apple and peach with balanced acidity. The finish is crisp yet smooth at the same time.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Spicy, savory oak leads the nose on this Chardonnay, which features a bulky palate, with an oily texture. Salty, woody apple flavors extend onto a pulpy finish with heat and briny notes.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This vintage of Chardonnay isn't nearly as confected as the previous one, although it's still a highly fruity drop. It leads with lemon, stone-fruit, seashell and vanilla-pod characters. The mouthfeel is silky and slippery with concentrated fruit flavors. It's framed but not dominated by toasty oak.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Made in a fruity, voluptuous style accented in a heartiness of oak, this is a widely appealing wine at a fair price point, creamy in texture and robust in tropical pineapple, mango and guava.

name: Albatross Ridge 2017 First Flight Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This bold white has a reductive note to the nose, and a meaty intensity throughout. It opens with aromas of jasmine and apple blossom before becoming richer on the palate in pineapple and pear, the oak prominent and complementary.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Clean lines of pear flesh, honeysuckle, lime blossom and mango are rounded and delicate on the nose of this blend from Edna Valley, Monterey and Santa Barbara. There is decent tension to the sip, where white rock and riper pear flesh flavors lead into Gravenstein apple and peach toward the finish.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This amber-colored wine has aromas of pineapples, mangoes and tropical fruits. On the palate it has balanced acidity with flavors of mango and apple.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Tropical in nature with up-front viscosity and richness, this white shows dense flavors of pineapple, mango and vanilla. The oak is integrated yet present, contributing a shock of honey as it finishes.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of bread crust, vanilla and toasted slivered almonds come together with a touch of butter on the nose of this Chardonnay that has seen 10 months in French oak. Bright, sunny acidity shines on the palate delivering flavors of lemon juice, lemon curd, grapefruit zest and a touch of almond cookie.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Partially barrel fermented, the aromas offer notes of melon and herb. Full-bodied flavors follow. It's a very pretty, very pure interpretation of the variety, with the oak seemingly pulled way back.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Cloudy's Bay's Chardonnay is a polished and ripe number that feels a touch sweaty on the nose, with ripe melon and stone fruit, honey, flint, florals and a lick of vanillin oak. The palate is thick and creamy but there's a citrusy lift on the midpalate that brightens things, and a wreath of spicy oak adding sophistication.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of sea spray, citrus and white blossoms meld with a lightly toasted background. There's ample roundness to the palate, with grilled lemon and melon flavors that are propped up by juicy acidity.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: The basic Chardonnay aromas of apple, peach and mild oak are smooth but not overly exciting or vociferous. A plump palate with an oily core texture precedes melon and peach flavors accompanied by integrated oak. A short finish offers barely any flavor but is solid in feel.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Strong oaky aromas meet spicy ginger, vanilla and pineapple flavors in this full-bodied wine. The oak really dominates and the acidity is soft.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This medium-bodied wine has tons of heavy spicy cedar and oak aromas that continue on the palate, coating over the mild apple flavors underneath. It's one for oak lovers only.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This Romanian Chardonnay is light straw in color and has aromas of stone fruits, mango, apple and pear. On the palate it has flavors of lemon curd and white peach. The finish is crisp and refreshing.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Aromas of stone fruits, apple, pear and mango lead you into flavors of lemon curd and ripe peach. It is crisp and clean on the palate with a delightful finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: A rich texture carries buttery, spicy oak flavors almost to the extreme in this full-bodied, soft and pillowy wine.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of walnut and orange peel compete with silicon and rubber on the nose. The palate charges in with a thwack of tangy acidity, then slowly fades to reveal orange peels and shortbread.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Oily citrus and stone fruit aromas smell a bit like household cleanser, while this Chardonnay feels healthy. Melon, apple and vanilla flavors finish with acidic kick, and while this tastes of vanilla and is suggestive of oak, this sees no wood and thus it's the lees that provide said character.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Offering great value, this white contains 2% Pinot Gris. Intense in oak-influenced flavors of caramel and vanilla, it has a simple structure and plenty of richness in the form of baked pineapple and pear.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Quiet aromas of cheese rind, banana candies and tonic carry the nose. The creamy palate shows more fruit in ripe papaya and melon flavors, with bright acidity to prop it up.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Lime and tangerine aromas are zesty and pointy. Matching the nose, this feels citrusy and medium in body. Quick-hitting but clean flavors of citrus fruits and nectarine finish mellow and mild. This may have been fermented in barrel, but there's no oak character to speak of.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Lemony aromas come with a slight shot of ammonia that's offset by yeasty vanilla. This everyday Chardonnay is round and pulpy, but in balance. Melon and yeasty vanilla flavors amount to a creamy whole that's echoed on the finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Waxy apple and nectarine aromas are a bit bland, however this good but basic Chardonnay is punched up by tropical-fruit acidity on the palate. Short-lived flavors of pineapple, kiwi and spring onion go dormant on a low-impact finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This Serbian white has aromas of flint, shale, apple and pear with flavors of wet river rock, lemon-lime, peach, vanilla and apple. It is crisp and fruity with pronounced minerality.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Mild white-fruit aromas are outweighed by resiny oak scents, while this feels full, plump and healthy. A standard mix of melon, pear and wood-spice flavors fade on the finish, leaving mostly spicy residual oak notes.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Tight, crisp apple aromas are lean and limited but fresh and crystal clear. A tight citric palate lacks weight and body, while this delivers short white fruit flavors backed by salty green notes. A mild melony flavor is found on the finish.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Offering initial aromas of rubber and cookie dough, an apricot tone is revealed with vigorous swirling. Lime zest and lemon pith bring tangy acidity to the apricot and white peach on the palate, finally finishing with almond paste and more lemon.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Very fruity and floral on the nose, this bottling is redolent with apple blossoms, cut pear and tropical plumeria aromas. A strong citrusy acidity powers the sip, where ripe pear flavors prove very strong.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Bright aromas of green apple, papaya and pineapple start off this fruity Chardonnay. The palate dazzles in creamy tropical-fruit flavors that are energetic yet brisk.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Lightly seared citrus, lemon preserves, roasted peach slices and an ample amount of oak show on the nose of this bottling. The palate balances rich and ripe flavors with sea salty, lemony acidity and a sandstone-like minerality.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Soft notes of sweet pea and peony dance lightly on the nose of this white, with fruity scents of white peach, melon and strawberry hull at the core. The palate is light-plus in feel, with a slickness to the midpalate. Flavors of guava and lychee unfold on the palate and linger into the medium-length finish.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine comes from a dry-farmed vineyard—an extreme rarity in the state. It shows a lot of toasted grapenut aromas and flavors out of the gate. Notes of green apple and star fruit follow. Mouthwatering acidity ups the interest. Some additional bottle time should serve it well.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is clean and pretty smelling, with fresh aromas of lightly grilled apple, toasted nuts, soft butter and peach pit. The palate is light-plus in weight, with ample acidity to lift the ripe fruit tones of waxy apple, peach pit and soft hazelnut. It's well balanced, easy to drink and like.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A touch of oak starts this off, with a palate built by tight-grained tannins and integrated fruit. Flavors of stone, white flowers and ripe apple combine to create a nuanced yet rich feel.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Fresh aromas of grapefruit, lemon and a hint of pear carry the nose. There is a snappy freshness to the palate, where bright flavors of apple and pear meet with sea salt and sizzling acidity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Made in a bold, full-bodied style, this wine is complex and inviting in aromas of anise, fennel and apple blossom. The palate reveals velvety flavors of pear and peach.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Salty and oaky, this wine was barrel fermented in 26% new French oak, allowing room for an intensity of caramel and baked apple. Lengthy and well made, it has length and breadth within moderate structure and acidity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light brushes of butter, golden pear, almond and lemon balm make for a very inviting nose on this appellation blend. The palate is a tad sweeter than expected, with flavors of apple syrup, pear galette and sea salt.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Very ripe aromas of mango, papaya and candied Key lime show on the fresh and powerful nose of this bottling. The palate is also quite tropical and lush, with more mango, pineapple and tuberose flavors that are cut by a zesty acidity.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Very light in the glass, this is a delicate and floral spin on Chardonnay, starting with aromas of apple blossom, pear flesh and honeysuckle. It's light in body and quite mellow on the palate, offering clean apple pastry and Asian pear flavors.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: An oaky nose of caramel and brioche gives way to a lighter, brighter midpalate of high-toned acidity and fresh flavors of lemon and tangerine. The ripeness is balanced and well integrated with the tannin and oak.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Pale yellow in color, this wine shows notes of flint, salt and seashell along with tangerine, ginger and grapefruit. The palate is texturally rich but is lifted by bright acidity and offers a balanced combo of tangy citrus fruit and toasty oak spice. Drink now.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Golden in color, this is a soft, supple wine that's robustly flavored in pear, mango and vanilla. An earthiness also pervades around a rich grip of oak.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Jasmine and geranium combine for a forceful, floral entry into this white, which is full bodied and fleshy on the palate. Its dense display of pear and apple flavors are succulent and richly lush.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Asian pear and flint aromas show on the toasty nose of this bottling by winemaking legend Lane Tanner. Tight flavors of lemon and lime balm meet with warmer tones of sea salt and white peach on the finish, which is energetic.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Asian pear, lime blossom, light pineapple, wet slate and grapefruit aromas make for a complex nose on this entry-level bottling for the estate winery. Candied pear and ripe apple show on the clean, poppy palate.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Light lemon, wet chalk and smoked white-peach aromas show on the nose of this county-wide bottling, which is all from Clone 4 grapes. It lands on the palate cleanly, with flavors of white peach, lemongrass and a touch of butterscotch toward the finish.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: High toned and full bodied, this is a lengthy, reasonably complex white with a measured approach to oak. It shines in dense green-apple flavor seasoned in baking spice and a subtle suggestion of vanilla.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of butter, apple, toasted oak and hazelnut show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers flavors of ripe lemon, yellow peach and mango sorbet that are quite ripe but dusted with a touch of sea salt.

name: Klepka-Sausse 2012 Mille Or Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Caramel, vanilla and crème brûlée richness rule the day in this lovely wine, which finds balance and grace on the midpalate. Pear, mango and a touch of matchstick and flint complement each other well within a tropical fantasyland of full body and flavor.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a crisp, focused and floral white from a small new producer that shows a backbone of structure and well-integrated oak. From the heart of the Petaluma Gap, it has a length of stone and baking spice within a cradling of Meyer lemon and pear.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Nuanced aromas of Meyer lemon and tangerine rind meet with hazelnut, toast and a hint of ashy Brie cheese on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that only a few producers are able to use. A chalky mouthfeel frames fresh but toasty flavors of lemon peel and oak.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Barrel fermented, this impressively balanced, expressive wine shows lovely flavors of pear compote, ginger snap, lemon meringue and vanilla. Smooth and creamy, it has a lushness to the texture that doesn't overwhelm, offering a bite of welcome acidity as it finishes.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: Ripe white-peach and honeysuckle aromas are leveled by oak, sea salt, toasted almond and seared lemon on the rich nose of this statewide blend. The palate is hefty and rich, with lemon, white peach and roasted nut flavors, balanced by a powerful acid and a lime zest touch that carries through the long finish.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: From the producer's estate site, first planted in 1969, this is an intensely concentrated and powerfully built wine, made by winemaker James MacPhail. Viscous, it has a hearty mouthfeel of lush power dotted in green apple, peach, spicy nutmeg and a hint of toast.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Salty, smooth and exotic in rocky brine, this white has robust power and concentration within intensely flavored richness—a mix of pineapple and pear. Medium bodied, it retains a backbone of acidity that complements the boldness; enjoy best from 2022 through 2027.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is a rich style of Chardonnay, full of buttercream on the nose, but also vibrant, with lime balm aromas. The palate's chalky grip warms up toward toasty, buttery flavors, layered with apple pastry and sea salt elements.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Cohesive aromas of white peach, yellow-nectarine flesh, hazelnut and lemon rind make for a very complex nose on this bottling. The palate is grippy in texture yet full, with flavors of peach, mango and roasted apricot, served atop buttercream and topped with lemon zest.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine sees time in both stainless steel and oak. Flavors of pear, lemon and grapefruit are highlighted by fresh, focused acidity, with a round, smooth midpalate adding layers.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is a substantial, engaging wine that shows focused fruit flavors backed by lively, mouthwatering acidity. Ripe pear, peach and apple notes ride a full body that makes it mouthfilling. Subtle hints of vanilla and ginger add complexity and seem to expand with each sip.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Crisp acidity underscores bright flavors of lemon peel and tangerine in this complex wine. Textured, balanced and deceptively rich in a measured way, it has length and breadth as well as a touch of reduction, making it an irresistible expression of site.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This roughly 50-50 blend of sister vineyards Solomon Hills and Bien Nacido starts with aromas of lemon oil, clean tangerine pith and damp oak. There is great tension on the sip, where bright lemon and dried chamomile flavors meet with sandalwood.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Intensely fruity on the nose in pear and anise, this white is creamy and lush in style, while simultaneously balanced in ripeness. It shows an exotic mineral component of stone and crushed rock before unveiling a smooth, lengthy finish.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Salty, briny and grippy in baked apple, oak and tannin, this wine has lengthy concentration and complexity to offer. Its waves of structure and oak are buoyed by fresh, persistent acidity. The brightness pierces through a lengthy finish of baking spice.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Silky smooth and sculptured in crisp apple, pear and integrated oak, this showcases the famous site in all its complex glory, with accents of baking spice and brine. Medium bodied, it displays richness within a context of balance and grace.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: This wine comes from vines planted in 1977 at 1,350 above sea level—high by the state's standards. Half fermented in concrete with the rest in oak barrel before being aged in puncheons, aromas of toast, pineapple, lanolin, cream and spice lead to a full-bodied palate, with textured tropical-fruit flavors. It's a tasty, full-bodied, rich, very stylistic offering of the variety that need some time in the cellar. Best after 2023.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Golden Delicious apple, buttery shortbread and lemon rind notes combine into an appealing, appetizing nose. The palate reveals chalky depth and lovely autolytic notes recalling oatmeal and rye bread crumbs. A silvery freshness counters the creaminess, and notes of zesty candied lemon peel lend luminosity and fruit. A very classic, elegant, smooth and slender fizz for grown-ups.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Chalk, oatmeal and the flesh of Golden Delicious apple create a nose of richness, freshness and depth. The palate reinforces all of these notions and carries them on a creamy, persistent, foamy mousse. Its generosity counters the inherent freshness and strikes a wonderful balance. An elegant wine with backbone and depth.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This small-production white made by Cabell Coursey comes from Orsi Vineyards grapes and is barrel fermented in French oak, 40% of it new. It impresses in its grasp of green olive, pear and salty brine, a lilt of lemon verbena in the background. The oak is unabashed but doesn't get in the way of the overall complexity and appeal.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Golden Delicious apple, creaminess and freshly baked brioche unite into a nose that promises buffered freshness. The palate is rounded, adds subtle Mirabelle plum to the apple notes and frames them with rounded hints of lemon oil. The mousse is fine and silky; the fruit is rounded, ripe and pure. The freshness is countered with billowy, brioche richness that coalesces into purest creaminess. The finish is long, still fruit-driven and dry.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This wine shows a touch of reduction on the entry, tightly wound as it is in tannin and oak. The midpalate picks up succulence and freshness as well as a flirtation with tropical flavor, its profile robust and rich with plenty of complexity, honey and oak. Let it open slowly or cellar; enjoy best from 2022 through 2027.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Lemon, chalk, Golden Delicious apple and the merest hint of blossom honey combine into an enticing nose that promises both freshness and generosity. Bright, lemony notions emanate with the burst of every single, tiny, creamy bubble to disperse a sense of joy and elegant freshness. This is creamy, smooth, rich and fresh, with a chalky, biscuity depth. Lovely.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: From the vineyard first established by the producers' grandparents in 1927, this white is creamy in feel while also lifted by bright acidity. Apple, lemon zest and tangerine appease the palate, with accents vanilla and nutmeg in the background. The finish is refreshing and vibrant.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Salty oak dots the palate of this lively, vibrant and fresh take on the variety, 100% barrel-fermented and aged in new French oak for 14 months. Brioche richness underlies brighter notions of green apple and pear, with a touch of stone minerality that persists on the savory finish.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Creamy notes of Red Delicious apple with the merest touch of smoke create a most attractive nose. The palate has a streak of vivid, zesty freshness to counter the creamy mousse and presents a harmonious, creamy, elegant whole. A unit of Englishness, if you like, in an elegant, sophisticated, lemony package with a long, lovely apple finish.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: From the oldest vines planted on the estate Quail Hill Vineyard, this wine has been barrel fermented and aged in 50% new French oak for 14 months. High-toned buzzy acidity boosts floral, earthy layers of vibrant, refreshing flavor and nuanced texture, with an undeniable complexity and soul.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Floral, lively and undeniably vibrant in acidity and freshness, this wine dazzles in tones of guava, tangerine and fig. Crisp, balanced and complex, it delivers flavor and texture in waves alongside a stony minerality without ever letting oak get the last say.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This bottling from a coveted vineyard offers a little bit of everything for the Chardonnay lover. The nose begins with aromas of candied lime, tangerine pith, golden butter and cashew cream. The palate continues with toasted hazelnut, fresh lemon and then a crème brûlée finish, yet it's all wrapped in searing acidity and a chalky mouthfeel.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Lemony brightness and silvery lightness are suggested on the nose with its lifted, airy citrus notes. The palate brings substance to the slender but concentrated palate, and the lemony overtones are now enriched with buttery, lemony brioche while the fine mousse underlines the harmonious balance between ripe lemon freshness, slender poise, statuesque backbone and subtle autolysis. This is pure and elegant.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Sharp, focused acidity stars in this barrel-fermented white that dazzles in abundant complexity and structure. Lemon peel, stone and sea air give it an undying freshness in the glass, as lovely flavors of Gravenstein apple, pear and tangerine effortlessly combine.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This producer's blocks were planted in 1991 and 1997 to field selections of both Wente and Robert Young clones. Juicy, tight and tension-filled, it is both complex and high-toned in approach, with looming acidity that freshens in tart lemon-peel, grapefruit and tangerine flavors—a classic and elegant wine.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: A bit more restrained and less fruit forward than its sister wine Field of Fire, this wine is nevertheless a beauty. Citrus zest hides beneath accents of rock and earth. The mineral-laden acidity feels pure as spring water and runs through the waxy texture of the palate. The endlessly long finish is steeped in citrus and minerals.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Lemon zest and wet chalk on the nose are subtle but distinct. The palate comes in with a precise, lemony focus that runs along a fault line of central freshness, buffered by silky, fine and gentle but persistent mousse. The riches of this wine are in its chalky, understated depths, in the fine detail of its mousse and in the inherent, cool, precise freshness. This is a joy that requires stillness. But if subtle elegance is your thing, you are in for a treat. There is something almost timeless about this.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: An impressive white from start to finish, this offers voluptuous fruit on the generous, expansive palate. Salt, stone and sea spray combine effortlessly within integrated tannin and oak. It is a gorgeous reflection on the vintage and the site, which is blessed with old vines.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: From older vines planted in the early 1970s, this is a knockout, standout wine, juicy and exotic in spicy lemongrass, lime and voluptuous intensity. Richly layered, it has a backbone of fresh acidity that keeps it intriguingly fresh and classically structured. In the end, it's supremely delicious.

name: Talley 2017 Rincon Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: There's a generous amount of oak on the nose of this bottling, which also offers creamy yellow lemon and lime on the nose. The palate is tense with citrus-juice acidity, which cuts through the creamy, toasty wood spice flavors.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Complex aromas of flint, toast, seared lime and damp forest wood show on the nose of this bottling by Mike Sinor. There is a compelling chalky tension to the palate, where lemon skin and grapefruit flavors mesh into a tight, flinty minerality.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Tempting butter and butterscotch aromas lead to poached pear and caramel flavors in this full-bodied, full-blown and yet well-balanced wine. Subtle oak spices weave throughout and linger nicely on the finish, in tandem with generous fruitiness.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: This mighty white from the historic producer rarely disappoints—a study in nuanced structure and ageability. Crisp, focused acidity boosts a core of delicious green apple, lemon verbena and wet stone. The wood imprint is subtle and quiet, the wine having aged 10 months in neutral French oak. Allow this to age; enjoy 2024–2028.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Stony, gritty and textured, this is a complex, voluptuously rich wine, with layers of flavor and complexity. Meyer lemon and peach rise to the fore of the palate exposing ripe rounded flavors that veer into an array of tropical nuance.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Pear-flesh and citrus-rind aromas meet with pineapple and slightly tropical fruits on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very tropical and fresh, offering more pineapple but also flavors of grapefruit pith that hold that riper fruits in check.

name: Talley 2017 Rincon Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Hazelnut and roasted apple aromas show on the creamy nose of this single-vineyard expression by the Los Gatos-based winery. The palate is also creamy and generous, with flavors of light butter, marzipan, seared orange and hazelnut paste.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This light-bodied, elegantly crafted white is composed, structured and floral, with an exotic hint of bay leaf on the nose that persists on the palate. Green apple, olive and brine combine effortlessly across the quiet, integrated oak.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Rounded white-peach aromas meet with smoky touches of flint and oak on the nose of this bottling. The toasty flavors continue to the palate, where seared lemon and rounded peach are framed by a bright acidity.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Subtle at first on the nose, this bottling shyly offers white lily and lime rind on the clean and fresh nose. The palate is also light and restrained, moving from chalky structure to richer white peach before a vibrant acidity cleans up the finish.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Meyer lemon and tangerine pith meet with a more reductive touch of Brie cheese rind and ash on the nose of this bottling. That ashy component carries to the sip as well, where pink lemonade flavors play against the yogurt-like components.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: This is a big, full-bodied and fleshy white wine from the Petaluma Gap mountain vineyard, with an intense imprint of vanilla and nutmeg-laced oak. Stone fruit and pineapple are prominently on display, richly dappled in secondary notes of Gravenstein apple and fig.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Tightly wound and a touch reductive at first, this bottling opens up to reveal aromas of sea salt, mango and Meyer lemon rind on the nose. The tight palate also opens with patience into flavors of lime cream, ashy Brie rind and riper pome fruits.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: High toned and well integrated, this is a peaceful, serene wine that lives up to its name. Barrel fermented and given 14 months in French oak, none of it new, it unwinds into layers of lemon pith, orange blossom and silty earth, suggesting crushed rock and stone.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Singed lemon and white-peach aromas are cut by a flinty minerality on the nose of this bottling. Bright, refreshing acidity frames the lemon-candy flavors of the palate, which are enhanced by a pinch of cinnamon.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Smoke, flint and hazelnut combine with lemon into a nose of promising freshness. The concentrated palate is still dominated by oak for now but will mellow into lemon zest brightness with a little more bottle age. There is something brilliant and vivid at the core, and a well of luminous freshness. Smoky overtones stay alluring. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This is a modern, finely structured Chardonnay laced with peach and orange Creamsicle, white spice, floral and reductive notes like nuts and smoke. The palate is creamy in texture and framed by prominent but well-structured oak. Drink now–2027.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Seared marshmallow and butterscotch aromas are cut by sea salt and sour orange peel on the nose of this bottling. There is a caramel tone to the palate but a strong line of lemon-juice acidity cuts through it all, finishing on white-peach flavors.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This is a polished wine of restraint. It's a great effort for a brand new label. A perfumed nose of lemon curd, honeydew melon, blossoms, honeysuckle and oyster shells lead neatly into a palate that is well balanced, slippery in texture and framed by vanillin oak. One for the cellar, this should age with grace until 2029.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Brisk aromas of Asian pear, Meyer lemon pith and Key lime make for a zesty entry to the nose of this bottling from the winery's Jespersen Ranch property. There is a steely tension to the palate, where a stiff structure frames flavors of pear and pineapple that are broad but not too ripe.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Gooseberry yogurt and lemon on the nose signal vivid freshness. The palate counters this with rounded creaminess and a fine, creamy mousse to create a harmonious, rounded palate. Highlights of smoke and hints of shortbread lend lovely depth and seriousness. A great aperitif.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This easygoing Chardonnay offers light flavors of green apple and lemon. There's a good balance of fruit weight against the bright acidity, with a finish that ends brisk on light notes of citrus and plastic.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This Margaret River Chardonnay opens with notes of lemons, green apples, peach pits, nettles and a touch of white spice. The texture is slippery but the acidity is searing, the lemony notes feeling puckering rather than refreshing. There's nothing overtly offensive here, there are just much better examples of this variety from Margaret River.

name: Masia de la Vinya 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a soft wine, gently textured and with ripe fruit. The texture and the character are flat, with fullness but little else. Drink now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Simple and light, this barrel-fermented wine does not quite have the ripeness to offset the time in wood. Thin apple fruit lacks concentration, but there are barrel flavors of toast and caramel in full view.

name: Altvs 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Oaky vanilla, crème brûlée and baked fig flavors make for a rich, unctuous expression of the grape in this vineyard-designate from a warm vintage. The wine is intensely flavored and fleshy on the palate.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This easy-drinking white opens with aromas of white stone fruit and a whiff of spring flowers. It's simple but well-made, offering yellow apple and tangerine alongside fresh acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine has ripe apricot and melon flavors cut with a mineral texture and acidity. With its fresh aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Unlike the previous vintage, this seems thin, lacking the ripeness to bring much flavor to the table beyond what 11 months of barrel aging can provide. It's a generic white wine, with a trace of toast.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Aromas of nuts, citrus and sea spray grace the delicate nose. Medium in weight, the palate shows melon and tart apple flavors against a light cream backdrop.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This ripe wine offers attractive hints of tropical fruits. With its fresh acidity it is balanced and delicious. The forward fruits are refreshing while also full in the mouth. Drink now.

name: Handpicked 2015 Collection Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)
description: Woody aromas are very present on this wine and they also show strongly on the palate. After three years, the wood should have integrated. Although the wine is fruity, it is still unbalanced.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This wine is ripe and full with tropical fruits and rich apple flavors. It has enough acidity to balance. Drink now.

name: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This fruity forward Chardonnay offers bright tropical-fruit tones alongside citrus cream and peach. It is light in profile, with mild sprtizy acidity offering lift.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: A light, simple and fruity wine, this has a fresh citrus edge. Rounded out with warm pear and melon flavors, it is an accessible wine that is ready now.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Slightly sweet aromas of apple flesh, peach and pineapple dominate the nose of this bottling. The flavors are also quite ripe, with more pineapple and tropical elements arising.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Apricot and pineapple flavors deliver a good mix of fruitiness and acidity. This wine is open, with a tangy texture that is already well integrated into the fruitiness. Drink now.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Packaged in a resealable can, this wine offers aromas and flavors of roasted corn on the cob, butter and peach. It's straightfoward yet enjoyable.

name: Perrier Jouët 2012 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)
description: Rounded notes on the nose have the richness of brown butter and toasted hazelnut. The palate confirms this with rich, toasty notes from oak aging, aligned with the Amalfi lemon zest notes that run along a central vein of vibrant freshness. The mousse is superfine and creamy and reveals a chalky depth that is also reminiscent of ripe but tart Cox's Orange Pippin apple. A very fine sparkling wine of exquisite poise with beautiful length and an astonishing umami finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Nutty, creamy, almost buttery richness is apparent with the first whiff of this golden wine. The rounded palate comes in with equal measures of creamy richness and urgent freshness. The mousse is fine and creamy, and toasty oak lends nutty flavors that play against the rich backdrop of buttery short crust flecked with fresh Amalfi lemon zest. A most elegant, rounded and rich sparkling wine with poise and backbone in spades. The finish is dry and long.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: This wine opens with ample expressions of pretzel, lemon candy and stone. It offers complexity and structure in its nuanced use of oak and full-barrel fermentation, finishing on a spritz of sea spray.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is an acid-driven, well-integrated and composed white from a well-farmed site, structured, gritty and complex in nature. Meyer lemon, lime and tangerine provide a crisp fresh backdrop of inviting flavor that meets floral companionship in apple blossom aromas and a hint of lemongrass on the lengthy finish.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine opens in floral, Gewürztraminer-like lychee and mango before becoming quite harsh and astringent on the palate.

name: Cave de Lugny 2017 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)
description: Waxy aromas of apple skins don't qualify as fresh and lively. A full palate offers salty but vague apple and peach flavors that turn distinctly oxidized on the finish.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: The last vintage of the Weersing's gorgeous Chardonnays before the winery changed hands, this slightly cloudy, unfiltered Chardonnay sings of its place. Electric charges of minerals crackle with notes of lemon peel, bay leaf and fistfuls of freshly plucked wild herbs and flowers. The palate is utterly beautiful with its sliced crystalline acidity that lifts flavors of limestone, citrus, salt, herbs and flowers.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Overripe pineapple and sweet apple aromas carry to the rounded, rich palate, with a flabby melon flavor chiming in. The alcohol is quite pronounced and gives a slight sharpness to the overblown fruit flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This softly textured wine is perfumed, fruity with a lightly nutty character. Drink the wine now.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A yellowish color and aromas that lean towards bready and briny open this value-priced sparkler made entirely from Chardonnay. The mouthfeel is O.K., however this tastes bitter and stalky, while nothing changes or improves on a stale finish.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: This wine is now mature although its soft texture and lightly fruity character don't offer much interest. Drink now.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is soft, without much definition. Its fruitiness has gone, some almond flavors have taken its place, but the wine is flat.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Mango aromas and a slight oxidation give this wine a full character. That also means that the wine is ready to drink.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Soft and ripe, this is a full wine, with baked-apple flavors and balanced acidity. It is young, fruity and ready to drink.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Heavy oak on the nose makes this Somontano Chardonnay smell like a sawmill. In the mouth, this is creamy and ultimately rather soft. An oak-dominated flavor profile is low on zest and fruit, while this tastes of burnt popcorn on a resiny finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Buttered corn on the cob aromas lead to pleasant, lighter-seeming fruit flavors. It's a bit innocuous but provides appeal.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Sour apples and dried limes converge on the nose of this bottling, which is almost a slight shade of pink in the glass. Dried apple flavors show on the slightly sour palate.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine opens with ripe, slightly sweaty stone and citrus fruits framed in vanillin oak notes. Acidity on the palate doesn't quite jive with the creamy texture, making the fruit feel a little flat. There's a peachy, soapy finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is still quite tight with minerality as much as fruit. It has the potential to develop and its fruitiness will show better from 2020.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is simple, soft and fruity wine, with attractive acidity and lime and melon flavors. Drink this crisp wine now.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: This wine is soft, open, generously fruity and ready to drink. Acidity is fully integrated into the ripe texture, adding a crisp edge to the warmth of this wine.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This bright wine offers ripe white fruits that balance the spicy texture. The wine's freshness comes from attractive citrus flavors. Drink now.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A simple wine with soft fruits and an equally soft texture, this is made to be drunk young. It has a crisp side, with good acidity and some citrus that gives the wine a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of drawn butter, citrus and brine meld on the nose of this Chardonnay. The light-bodied palate offers flavors of melon and lemon, lifted by accents of sea spray and blanched almond.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: With an oaky, buttery intensity, this wine is tropical in nature and richly lush on the palate—a full-figured expression of the grape sourced from both Beckstoffer and Hudson vineyards, as well as the producer's own Lewis Vineyard within the appellation.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A ripe, full wine, this has a crisp texture and lively, bright fruits. Apple and crisp pear flavors are balanced by a touch of spice and a tangy, lemon-zest aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Crisp and lively, this is a fruity, bright wine. Its acidity and lemon flavors are refreshing and delicious to drink even at this young stage.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: A bright, tangy and fruity wine, this is crisp and full of apple flavors. Freshness contrasts with the warm fruitiness, which means the wine can be drunk now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This juicy wine with peach and pineapple flavors is fresh, crisply textured and tangy. Lemon fruits at the end give the wine a great lift.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of white blossoms, melon and salt carry the well-concentrated nose. The palate is racy in flavors of tart pineapple and underripe melon, with kicks of lime and salt racing towards the finish.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: This wine is lightly structured while preserving plenty of white fruits and acidity. That suggests a potential for short aging, so keep this wine until 2020.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This lightly sparkling wine is bright and fruity in flavors of pineapple, peach and lemon. It is simplistic but easy to like, with a brisk tonic note marking the close.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a smooth, agreeable, full-bodied wine that coats the mouth with rich pear and ripe apple flavors while an almost viscous texture gives nice length on the finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: An aroma of freshly cut pear is clean and crisp on the nose. There is decent tension to the palate, where broad apple and pear flavors are wound rather tight.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This pale-yellow Chard from southern Margaret River is priced as the next tier up from the Shakré bottling, yet it's not quite as cohesive or crowd-pleasing. Aromatics on the nose are dominated by banana, lemon-lime Popsicle, cream and honeysuckle, with some toffee oak notes at the back. The acidity feels a little searing and doesn't sit comfortably in the creamy texture. The tangy fruit continues through to the finish.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This wine has a tight, mineral edge that gives it a strong texture. Under the texture the fruit is crisp, full of acidity as well as lemon flavors. The wine needs a few more months. Drink from 2020.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Tight with minerality as well as lively fruitiness, this wine is crisp and tangy. Citrus flavors dominate, giving a fresh character that needs to soften. Drink from 2020.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This wine is still fresh and young. The mineral edge needs to soften and fill out to give a wine that has weight and the ripe fruit of the vintage.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This is a ripe wine, full of red-apple and pear flavors. It is still textured, with plenty of acidity keeping the freshness. Drink from 2020.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This rounded, ripe wine is all about tropical fruits, which makes it attractive, although also one-dimensional. It certainly makes it ready to drink.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine shows the ripe tropical fruits of the vintage, thriving on its apricot flavors and richness. The acidity is just right, a light touch of freshness and texture to give the wine a lift.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A crisp, mineral-textured wine full of green apples and acidity, this is tangy and already very drinkable. Bright and edged with minerality, it is delicious and refreshing.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This wine is full of crisp white-stone-fruit flavors. With a touch of caramel as well as refreshing, tangy acidity the wine is ready to drink.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: Ripe tropical-fruit flavors from the vintage give this wine richness. Its open, full and soft character makes it ready to drink now.

name: WillaKenzie Estate 2017 Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This austere wine has a severe edge that comes from the acidity and mineral texture. Give it time to soften and drink from 2020.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This rich, spicy wine comes from a small village appellation. Textured with some minerality as well as bright acidity, it is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Now mature, this wine still has plenty of white-fruit flavors. Acidity has softened to disclose a more nutty character that gives the wine roundness and immediate drinkability.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This wine is soft, rounded and full of ripe fruit, with a light texture and a richly fruity character. It doesn't suggest much aging potential for this wine, although it is fine to drink now.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Taut and with a strong mineral texture, this wine is bright with acidity and apple fruitiness. It will develop well over the next few months, so drink from 2020.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is rounded, ripe with the crisp fruits of the vintage. White peach and melon flavors are full in the mouth, nicely lifted by the final lime acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This Chardonnay is like melted butter both in color and in flavor. There's some flinty reduction here too, as well as notes of butterscotch, cooked pineapple and toasted coconut. These flavors flow through to the palate where the ripe tropical fruit sits a little heavily. The texture, however, is less buttery and more chalky. Overall, though, this is a rich toasty style of Chard.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Seared lemon, toast and nutty qualities show on the nose of this Temecula-based bottling, which is already hinting at its age. Lemon peels, crushed almonds and paraffin flavors play on the palate.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of roasted corn on the cob, cinnamon and vanilla with melted butter notes lead to fuller-feeling flavors. Lemony acidity runs throughout. The oak plays a prominent role, with varied results.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Sourced from a vineyard on the west side of Seneca Lake, this wine is initially closed on the nose, eventually revealing quiet tones of citrus cream, white flowers and lime peel. The medium-bodied palate offers fleshy melon and apple flavors, with lively citrus marking the brisk close.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This ripe, open and tropical-flavored wine is opulent and full bodied. Its structure is muted by the generous fruit, giving a soft character to a wine that is ready to drink.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Ripe tropical-fruit aromas show the rich side of this wine. With its apricot and mango flavors, the wine is full, joyous and ready to drink.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: From the Portlandian limestone vineyards on the tops of the Chablis slopes, this wine is fresh, crisp and bright, with steely acidity. Its citrus fruits with hints of peach are already refreshing and the wine is ready to drink.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This soft, rounded wine has warm pear and ripe melon flavors that are lifted by a fresher squeeze of lemon to give the essential acidity. Drink now.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: From vines growing just on the edge of Chablis and sharing the same chalk soil, this wine is softly textured, with hints of yellow fruits and light acidity. It offers an attractive final tang of lemon zest. Drink now.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Toasted oak aromas and slightly sweet apple juice and pear nectar flavors make this full-bodied wine a palate drencher. It's a popular style, soft and ripe.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Vivid, ripe melon and apple flavors carry a touch of sweetness in this medium-bodied wine. It feels soft and round on the palate and has a syrupy finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Interesting aromas of peach, pineapple and herbs lead to thick, viscous-feeling corn on the cob flavors. It gets bogged down.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Pleasing aromas of apple, pear and spice are followed by straight-down-the-fairway, somewhat sleek-feeling flavors. The concentration doesn't seem all there, but what is there is pleasant.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A fresh, open and fruity wine, this is crisp with apple fruits. It is lightly textured but its main thrust is all about fruit, with a fresh, lifted aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This smoothly textured wine brings some of the warmth from the Mâcon region where it was grown. Acidity and citrus flavors shine through the texture of this attractive, ready-to-drink wine.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Produced by Laurent Godard, the first in his family to make his own wines rather than selling grapes, this wine is fresh and lightly citrus flavored, with just a touch of toast from oak aging. It is ready to drink.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Buttery oak aromas ride heavily atop baked apple scents on a fat, lush nose. This barrel-aged Chardonnay from Navarra is plump, round and resiny in feel, with just enough acidity to provide balance. Creamy, buttery white fruit flavors pour on the oak, making this “woody” through and through.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This wine comes from up to 53 parcels across Chablis. Now mature, it has a smooth, nutty texture, keeping the acidity while losing the fruitiness. The wine is on the cusp of being too old, so drink now.

name: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This soft wine is immediately attractive, gentle with generous white-fruit flavors. Its crisp edge is softening to give a full, ripe wine to drink from 2020.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This single-vineyard wine with its fresh apple fruits is crisply textured. Behind this crispness, a warm, riper character will come to dominate as the wine develops. Drink from 2020.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This full, ripe wine is generous, opulent and only lightly textured. It's an attractive wine that is soft and open, with plenty of apricot flavors. It is ready to drink.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This is a buttery wine, ripe and smoothly textured. A touch of toast adds spice. Freshness is a hint in the background among all this richness.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This simple, fruity wine is fresh and cool, with acidity that brings out citrus and kiwi fruits. It is a refreshing wine to drink instantly.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Ample tropical fruits in this wine are luckily balanced by acidity. The bright fruitiness is attractive and the wine is ready to drink.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of French oak and beeswax with a whiff of white stone fruit. Reflecting the nose, the rather lean palate offers yellow apple skin, vanilla and citrus before a bitter walnut close.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This wine is pure tropical fruit. Its ripe character and generous texture are full of creamy butteriness that gives a soft texture and makes the wine very drinkable now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Fruity and ripe, this has a tangy texture, with balanced acidity and yellow-fruit flavors. Freshness gives a great lift at the end.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A fruity, tangy wine with apple and citrus flavors, this is lightly structured. Its fruitiness is still tempered by youthful acidity that needs to soften, so wait until 2020.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This wine is mature, ripe and full of tropical fruits. Its balance and open character make it attractive and ready to drink now.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells buttery, tastes like vanilla and cream and feels soft and generous on the palate. Fans of an unctuous, ripe style will love it.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This very ripe and oaky wine shows abundant pear, butter and baking spices, and has a mouthfilling, soft texture. It's tasty, feels a bit sweet and is easy to sip.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is an aromatic, fruity style of Chard bursting with grapefruit, peach and honeysuckle. The palate is equally fruity with bright, zesty acidity and a talc-like texture. There's a likability to this Chard but it feels somewhat forced into being and over worked.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of flint, citrus and lemongrass shape the nose, with a hint of banana arising after some time in the glass. There's nice roundness to the palate, with light flavors of peach and coconut that evolve to juicy apple. A sizzling tonic accent simmers from start to finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of spring blossoms, ripe pear and sea breeze carry on to the bright, refreshing palate along with hints of citrus zest and beeswax. It's bright and tangy in crisp acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of coconut cream and charred citrus carry the nose of this reserve wine. It is full in feel on the palate, with flavors of coconut and melon. It shows a hint of a mineral edge lending a bit of levity, with a light almond-skin note offering an astringent grip.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This soft wine shows some light, earthy flavors from the filtering. That needs to go before the crisp apple fruits of the wine will show at their best, so wait until 2020.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: From the northernmost of the Côte Châlonnaise villages, this wine is taut and textured. It is crisply fruity, with nervy acidity as well as citrus flavors that need to soften. It always will have an attractive freshness.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: This soft, creamy wine has ripe pear flavors as well as light spice and a tangy aftertaste. It is all fruit without any wood aging, showing ripe Chardonnay and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This under-rated appellation has produced a fresh, creamy-textured wine. A crisp backdrop of citrus is filled out with ripe red apples and a touch of minerality. Drink this attractive wine from 2020.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This perfumed, fresh wine is crisply textured, with attractive acidity and plenty of red-apple fruits. Its bright character is lifted by the zesty, lemon aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This bright, young and fruity wine is full of ripe apple and crisp pear flavors. Acidity comes with citrus and kiwi fruit, tangy and ready to drink.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Properly crisp and with refreshing apple flavors, this is an attractive Chardonnay. Its fruitiness is lifted by a touch of minerality and tang of lemon juice at the end. Drink now.

name: Domaine Ventoura 2018  Chablis
description: This perfumed, fresh wine from a single parcel offers attractive acidity and a bright, mineral texture. White fruits are balanced by fresh citrus flavors. Drink now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This is already a delicious wine with its ripe fruitiness, with hints of tropicality as well as red apples. Rounded and softly textured it has an edge of acidity at the end. Drink now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This rounded, full wine is generous, with broad fruits and attractive, structured minerality. With a final tang of acidity, the wine is still fresh and ready to drink.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Aromas of citrus cream, white flowers and melon grace the straightforward nose. There's a roundness to the palate in ample melon and corn-silk flavors, with integrated acidity offering lift. Lemon curd and blanched almond accents mark the close of this well-balanced Chardonnay.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Sourced from a vineyard on the northwest slope of Canandaigua lake, this ripe Chardonnay displays rich apple and peach tones, with accents of white blossoms on the nose. The creamy palate shows a buttery tone alongside a hint of sour cream, broadened out by rich melon and citrus flavors.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This light, bright and fruity wine offers crisp citrus and green-apple flavors. It comes from an appellation that is unfairly ignored. This is a fruity, fragrant wine that is ready to drink.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Ripe apple and orange aromas meet with a touch of walnut on the nose of this bottling from near the Mexican border. A full palate is flavored with touches of hazelnut, lemon butter and yellow peach, framed by a waxy texture. Drink soon and oxidation seems forthcoming.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This taut, textured wine has acidity and a strong mineral character. White-fruit flavors are still muted behind the texture. Wait until 2020 for this ripe wine.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This low-production wine is smoothly textured, with a hint of toast as well as crisp, juicy acidity. The rounded texture is a sign that it is drinkable now.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Toasted walnut, French oak and butterscotch aromas shape the nose. The aromas carry over to the palate together with mature yellow apple, lemon drop candy and a coffee finish alongside fresh acidity.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This tight and textured wine is full of apple and citrus fruits. Minerality gives the wine a fine edge that also promises a refreshing character as it ages. Drink from 2020.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This rich Chardonnay displays a wealth of butterscotch, lemon and ripe peach on the nose. There's ample fruit to the medium-bodied palate in luscious melon and peach drizzled in caramel. Integrated acidity and light astringency balances it all.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This linear and racy Chardonnay is driven by a tart lime flavor, with white blossoms and white-plum skins filling it out. Tangy peach and white tea linger on the close.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This floral wine is juicy and crisp, with white fruits and good acidity. The wine's texture will allow it to age, so drink from 2020.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This wine has balance, yellow-fruit flavors and delicious acidity. With its crisp edge and light spice, the wine is both refreshing and full bodied. It is ready to drink.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This ripe and fruity wine that has a soft texture and warm white fruit flavors. There is enough acidity in this rich, spicy wine to give a touch of freshness to the warm, nutmeg flavors. Drink the wine now.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This luscious wine offers melon and ripe yellow-fruit flavors. Its generosity is balanced by fresh acidity and a citrus edge. The wine should be ready to drink in early 2020.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a mature wine, with ripe fruits and attractive balanced freshness. Crisp acidity brings out the citrus flavors. Drink now.

name: Pierre Legras NV Coste Beert Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This warm, rounded wine offers plenty of spice, tropical and white-plum flavors. Its balance is just right, acidity giving the essential fresh edge. Drink now.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This full, generous wine is rich in yellow fruits and spice. Still very young, it has a tangy character that will soon soften to bring out fruits and minerality. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This smooth, creamy-textured wine is rounded, the softness backed by acidity. A tangy edge adds a fresher aftertaste that is attractive and means the wine is ready to drink.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This is a medium-bodied, food friendly Chard that opens with notes of ripe fruit: banana, lemon and orange, backed by flinty, toasty oak characters. The mouthfeel is creamy but the citrus fruit is a touch sour, sitting a little heavily. It lifts and brightens on the finish, however, and wants for the right food pairing.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This highly aromatic, crowd-pleasing wine offers boisterous aromas of ripe lemon, red apple and honeysuckle. The mouthfeel is satiny and citrusy in flavors of orange and lemon, with honeycomb, spice and just enough acidity to keep it all afloat.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This vintage of Chardonnay is relatively bright, fruity and toasty: ripe red apples, lemons and melons are tempered by flinty, seashell characters and toasted coconut oak aromas. There's a lovely texture to the palate and the bright fruit continues to shine, even amidst the barrel influence. It feels a little more straightforward than previous vintages but is a solid, regional example nonetheless.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wood-aged wine has a cool edge from the vineyard location in the hills. It is textured with some minerality as well as citrus and white-fruit flavors. Still a little young, the wine will be better from 2020.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Mild aromas of melon and citrus cream start off this unoaked Chardonnay. The medium-bodied palate offers a mix of lively peach and melon flavors, honed by bright lime-laden acidity. A gentle blanched almond note lingers on the finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes ripe but tangy, balancing vibrant tropical-fruit flavors on an appetizing frame. Pineapple, lime and kiwi burst in the mouth and the crisp texture leaves a clean finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Slightly effervescent in the glass, this bottling is loaded with tropical fruit aromas of mango, papaya and tuberose, yet held back by touches of lime pith and chalk. The flavors zip across the palate, from Brie rind and ash to riper streaks of mango and jasmine.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Crisp and taut, this wine is full of apple flavors and spice. It is still young, textured with a steely edge. The wine's maturity is likely to be from 2020.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This soft, smoothly textured wine offers ripe fruits while missing some freshness. Apricot and white peaches make their way through the mineral texture and spiciness to end with a rich, full wine. Drink from 2020.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This family estate, based at a beautiful chateau in a hidden valley, has made a creamy wine. The edge of honey and ripe yellow fruits indicate some malolactic fermentation, giving the wine a round character. Drink now.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This wine has a creamy texture coming from the ripe fruit. With a refreshing edge to balance, the white-fruit and citrus-flavored wine is now ready to drink.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: The tangy aspects on the nose of this bottling are quite prominent, with lemon-bar aromas as well as oak quite apparent. The lemony tang of the palate is refreshing if aggressive, accompanied by toasted wood touches.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: From a small, high-altitude region a five-hour drive southwest of Sydney, this cool-climate wine feels as though there's a fresh breeze blowing through it. Bright pears, melons and pineapples are backed by white spice and just a hint of oak character. The mouthfeel is slippery with bright acidity and more juicy fruit. The oak is there but is very much a supporting character. This straightforward but tasty drop can be drunk until 2025.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This wine opens quite reductively, those flinty aromas making way, as the wine warms and is exposed to air in the glass, towards notes of lemon and orange rind, toasted brioche and burnt sugar—the latter two seemingly from oak influence. The palate is less toasty than the nose implies although it's not entirely absent. Bright acidity and zippy citrus-rind flavors coalesce nicely with the chalky texture, making this a restrained and food friendly drop.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine has an attractive floral character that gives it a ready-to-drink character. With plenty of acidity and citrus flavors it also has freshness. Drink this textured wine now.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Based in the small village of Milly, just west of the town of Chablis, this producer has made an open, ripe wine. With rich yellow fruits and acidity to match, the wine is full bodied, generous and ready to drink.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This refreshing wine offers hints of apricot and melon, with attractive spiciness. The wine's ripeness is pushing it forward to drinkability, so wait until early 2021.

name: Faniel et Fils NV Appogia Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: Apple-cinnamon crisp first comes to mind in this rounded white wine, which is aromatic in white flowers and a touch of butter. Creamy on the palate, it has balance within a lightly oaked arena of crème brûlée richness finished in Asian spice.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of nuts, lemongrass, citrus and flowers are gentle on the nose. The medium-bodied palate shows juicy yellow-apple and peach flavors, with a light creamy coconut accent. The finish is clean and snappy.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Buttery aromas signify the richness and full yellow-fruit ripeness of this wine. With its acidity muted, the wine is full, open, soft and ready to drink.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is ripe and now mature. It has retained some of the sliced-apple freshness of the vintage and the vineyards although everything has now softened comfortably together.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This wine's texture and fruitiness give it ripeness plus plenty of freshness. With the acidity just right to balance the ripe white-fruit flavors, the wine has developed well and is ready to drink.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Earthy with a strong, metallic-like minerality, this is a soft, approachable white, with floral lemon, apple and oak notes. Sourced entirely from the Kuleto Estate Vineyard, it shows lasting flavors of vanilla and crème brûlée.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of peach, cream and citrus carry the nose of this lush Chardonnay that sees time in mostly older French oak. Extended lees contact has imparted a richness on the palate that plays nicely with the luscious melon and stone-fruit flavors, with butter and dark caramel marking the close.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine is structured, mineral with a crisp texture that defines the ripe apple fruits. Its acidity and fresh backdrop give it a real lift and a refreshing character. Drink now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A blend from vineyards in Meursault and Puligny-Montrachet, this wine is the epitome of an open, attractive white Burgundy. Its touch of spice and toast, baked apples and light minerality are well integrated and ready to go. Drink now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: The combination of texture and ripe fruit gives this wine an open character. It comes from a selection of premier cru vineyards across Montagny that have produced lovely ripe apple and spice flavors. The wine is softly textured and is ready to drink.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A vibrant lemon color, this Yarra Valley Chard is a little reductive at first, the sweatiness blowing off fairly quickly in glass. In its place are green-apple, seashell and cashew-nut characters. As the wine warms, toffee and spicy oak notes float to the fore. Fruit on the palate is bright but hemmed in with toasty oak and prickly acidity. Drink now–2027.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Layers of tropical fruits sing well in this wine along with the crisper apple acidity. The wine is ripe, full of tropical fruits and ready to drink.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
