description: Aromas of pineapple and lemongrass carry this fruit-forward Chardonnay. There's a slight char to the fruit on the palate, with juicy tropical and stone-fruit flavors pushing through to the lingering finish.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: The village of Solutré is named after the dramatic rock that dominates the landscape. The wine with its good acidity and riper yellow fruits is open while also deliciously crisp. It is ready to drink.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Ripe peaches and apricots give this wine richness. Balance that with the warm, creamy texture and the wine is very approachable. Drink now.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Smoky aromas and just a hint of remaining freshness give this wine balance and an attractive maturity. The wine has moved on from fruit to secondary flavors of spice and nut, and it is very ready to drink.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Continuing an ongoing exploration of numerous vineyards and fermentation techniques for Chardonnay, this new wine was entirely made in concrete egg. Perhaps it would work better to blend it with some barrel-aged wine, as the effect here is to flatten it out. There's a cement-like minerality, but the apple-flavored fruit is somewhat muted overall. Not a bad wine by any stretch, but it lacks the liveliness of the others in the portfolio.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Wood aging has given this wine its smooth texture, toast flavors and has also brought out ripe apple and honey flavors. A touch of spice highlights the refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Albatross Ridge 2017 First Flight Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This single-vineyard wine combines ripe fruitiness with open toast and spice. The wine is not yet integrated but will offer plenty of acidity and fruitiness from 2021.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Spicy aromas give this wine a contrast between fruit and nutty flavors. The texture is balanced by hints of tropical fruits at the end. Drink from 2020.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Soft and ripe, this is a full wine with baked-apple flavors and balanced acidity. It is young, fruity and ready to drink.

name: Ferrari 2010 Riserva Lunelli Extra Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Baked apple, wood spice and oak-related butter aromas are integrated, while this Chardonnay from the Penedès feels full and chunky but cut by healthy acidity. Melon, peach and apple flavors are oily and mildly oaky, while this abruptly quits on an otherwise clean finish.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This likable straightforward Chard opens with aromas of grapefruit, lemon, red apple and florals which flow into a slippery but crisp palate. The finish is short but bright and juicy fruited.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This gentle, textured wine is soft and open. Its fresh fruitiness as well as a crisp apple edge give the wine ripeness as well as a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: A perfumed, fruity and easy-drinking Chard from Australia's western shores, this opens with aromas of lemons, limes, peaches, white-flower blossoms and a creamy butterscotch character. The tingly acidity on the palate brightens the fruit further and balances the creamy texture. It is a likable and affordable summer sipper.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Fresh lime, savory sea salt and a touch of crushed nuts show on the nose of this estate bottling for this historic winery, which was just purchased by Vintage Wine Estates. It's crisp on the sip, where warmer flavors of roasted lemon and nectarine arise.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Tropical-fruit aromas shows strongly in this ripe wine. With its rich fruits and soft texture, the wine is opulent and very ready to drink.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A ripe, textured wine with acidity and a crisp, mineral edge, this is well balanced. Freshness contrasts with the generous fruitiness of the vintage. Drink now.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This ripe, fruity wine has good acidity plus generous apple and pear flavors. With its succulent mineral texture the wine is rich and beautifully shaped. Drink from 2020.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A blend of vines from two villages, this wine shows the ripeness of the year balanced with crisp acidity. Fermented and aged in tanks, the wine is all about fruit. Drink now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This is a generous, spicy wine, with tropical fruits over acidity. The wine's crisper element takes time to come through and conveys a floral aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A warm and creamy-textured wine, this is rich and full. Acidity adds a juicy element to the citrus flavors. Spice brings out the wood aging. Drink this balanced wine now.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: For white Burgundy, this wine is rich, with a tropical-fruit character. The mango and pineapple flavors are full and opulent, touched with spice from 10 months in wood. Its softness means it will not age and so should be drunk from 2020.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Arcadia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Very tangy aromas of squeezed citrus and preserved lemon show on the nose of this bottling. That tang extends to the palate as well, where lemon peel and tart apple flavors dominate.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is an attractive, ripe and creamy wine, with tropical fruits and balanced acidity. It is developing well and quickly and should be ready from 2020.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is crisp, fresh with bright, young acidity and a lightly mineral texture. Its citrus and perfumed white fruits are still settling down, so the wine needs to age for a few more months. Drink from 2020.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Packed with spicy fruit, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine. It has a tangy character, rich tropical fruits and just enough acidity. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This is an attractively crisp wine, with plenty of red-apple flavors. A pure line of acidity goes with the ripeness and warm texture. Drink the wine now.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A fruity wine with good acidity and crisp apple flavors, this is a bright and lively. Freshness gives a crisp character emphasized by the final lemon flavor. Drink now.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Pear, brioche, ale and whole lemon aromas lead to dry flavors that bring a pleasing sense of acidity.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Despite the open apricot fruits, this wine is still tautly textured, which brings a balance between the richness of the vintage and a potential for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This ripe wine combines typical Chablis steeliness with rich apple flavors and succulent acidity. The young texture promises good things, full of freshness now and likely to develop a riper character as it matures. Drink from 2020.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a smooth, softly textured, with plenty of acidity to balance the ripe white fruits and spice. Drink now.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This is a creamy, ripe wine, It has touches of wood as well as crisp, fresh white fruits. The combination is already delicious, with an attractive fresh aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This crisp wine is full of the ripe fruit of the vintage but also has a cut of acidity and citrus freshness. The two aspects give a balanced wine to drink now.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This textured wine with its strong mineral character is still young. The white fruits are peering through the structure, just about ready to come through and give the wine balance. Wait until 2020.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Almost in the village of Meursault, this walled vineyard produces generous wines. Pineapple and spice flavors give the wine ripeness that contrasts with the textured acidity, which will soften as the wine ages. Drink from 2021.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Aromas of oak and coconut lead the nose along with whiffs of yellow stone fruit. The aromas carry over to the palate along with mature yellow apple skin, dried apricot, roasted coffee bean and a hint of grilled herbs.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: From a blend of different parcels, this wine offers plenty of ripe apple flavors and a steely, crisp texture. The wine's freshness is palpable, lively and ready to drink from 2020.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: This soft, ripe wine shows the richness of the vintage. The acidity is just right to balance the generous mango and pear flavors. It is attractive now and ready to drink.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine is a deliciously structured: light, tangy and with a refreshing, crisp texture. Full of juicy white fruits and citrus, and with lively acidity at the end, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Wholly owned by the producer, this vineyard makes both white and red wines. This bottling shows wood-aging flavors that give spice and concentration to the white fruits and acidity. Still young, the wine will be better from 2022.

name: Trudon NV Magnificence Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a fairly light wine, with crisp apple, a hint of white peach and a lightly buttery finish. The aging for 18 months in 38% new French oak is still integrating, so another year or two of bottle age is recommended.

name: Olivier Leflaive 2017  Meursault
description: Toast and floral aromas mingle easily and lead to this wood-aged wine that wears its toastiness comfortably. Citrus acidity offers freshness among all the ripe pear and green-fruit flavors. The wine should age more, ready to drink from 2020.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine leads with aromas of flint, lemon curd, orange zest and toasty, vanillin oak characters. These notes all flow through to the palate, which is well structured and textural but still quite young, the oak on display. Give this another year in bottle for things to knit together. Drink 2020–2025.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This crisp and fruity wine is full of acidity and a tight, mineral texture. It should develop ripeness and spicy citrus flavors as it matures. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is taut, showing a nervy side of the appellation. Lively, crisp apple and lime flavors burst from the glass. Drink from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This wine is certainly ripe with wood-aging flavors. It also has a mineral texture that gives balance and the chance for further aging. Enjoy the ripe melon and apricot flavors now, or wait until 2020.

name: A.R. Lenoble  NV Rosé Terroirs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine has ripeness as well as poised acidity. It is both generous and freshly fruity. The balance has produced a wine full of white fruits and ready to drink.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Lightly grilled citrus and peach tones show tension on the nose alongside delicate accents of sea spray and almond skin. Medium in weight, that palate is built by taut, tense acidity that highlights racy lemon against a ripe melon backdrop. It is tangy, persistent and fresh, with a light, chalky finish.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Though picked at just 20 brix, this is a leesy and flavorful wine with an interesting component mix. Rather than the anticipated thinness and/or tart acidity, it has almost tropical flavors of bananas and green pineapple, with an impression of whipped cream and caramel once in the mouth. It was aged for 14 months in half new, half once-used French oak.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is fruity, spicy with new wood flavors as well as fresh acidity. Its ripe character comes through with hints of apricot. The balance is just right in this attractive wine. Drink now.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This tiny-production white undergoes no malolactic fermentation and is aged in neutral French oak, the better to capture its crisp, light-bodied acidity. Wet stone, white flower and crisp apple give it definition beyond the austere texture and lasting earthiness.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tight, tart layers of stone fruit and apple highlight an increasingly soft, appealing midpalate. It shows integrated oak, tannin and weight for a highly appealing result.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Toast, pineapple and barrel spice aromas are out front. Full-bodied, palate-coating flavors follow along with a warm finish. It's a no-holds-barred style. For those looking for a big, rich, ripe, toasty Chardonnay, this one's for you.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This fruity wine offers delicious apple and fresh pear flavors. Its lively acidity comes from the cooler situation of the Hautes Côtes, bringing in a breathe of fresh air. Drink the wine now.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Light oak aging has softened the rich yellow-fruit flavors of this wine while keeping a fresh edge in place. It is a floral wine, with hedgerow flavors as well as more tropical aromas giving the wine a ripe feel. Drink from 2020.

name: Château de Santenay 2017  Puligny-Montrachet
description: A good amount of wood aging on this wine hasn't suppressed the ripe fruit but it has certainly left its mark. As it ages, the wood juiciness will be replaced by white-fruit ripeness. Drink from 2021.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Still a bit too young to show its best, this was blended from top vineyard sources and fermented in stainless steel. It's a juicy, fruit-powered wine, mixing apple, pear and melon in equal proportions. Enjoy this lively wine from 2020 to 2025.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This single-vineyard wine with its buttery edge as well as fresh acidity is attractively balanced. Textured minerality and juicy lemon flavors are balanced with a touch of spice from the wood aging. Drink now.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: A small parcel of 40-year-old vines has produced a ripe, wood-aged wine. Yellow fruits combine with the toastiness to give a young wine that needs to age. The aftertaste has both weight and crispness. Drink from 2022.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Well constructed start to finish, this pulls together ripe citrus fruit and rind, with a touch of honey graham cracker. Aged 17 months on the lees, in just 10% new French oak, it's firm and balanced. The native yeast fermentation adds hints of wild clover.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Integrated in oak with a mineral stoniness to the back of the palate, this wine is made in a rich, layered style, showing bold flavors of lemon zest, green apple, pineapple and toasted oak. It packs a punch of ripeness and weight.

name: Faniel et Fils 2011 Les Secrets d'André Millesimé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is as much about fruit and freshness as about structure and potential. In that sense, it is out of character for the appellation. It is attractive, with oak flavors already blended into the apple fruits. Acidity and ripeness are right there. The wine will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2022.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a barrel-fermented, reserve-level wine blending multiple clones and vineyard sources. It plays out broadly across the palate, with crisp apple, ripe lemon and some phenolic citrus rind flavors. It spent 18 months on the lees, in 18% new French oak.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Smooth and forward, this is an appealing style of Chardonnay that shows plenty toast and butter tones. Flavors of apple and brioche come along on the broad palate. This is perfect for near-term drinking.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This vintage is an opulent and toasty number. Straw yellow in color, this wild fermented wine opens with rich but focused aromas of lemon, lime, orange peel and white-flower blossoms, backed by butterscotch oak and salty, seashell reductive qualities. The fruit is concentrated on the palate, slippery in texture and supported by more toasty, polished oak nuances. This wine has a long life ahead of it. Drink now through 2029.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is tight, with a fine texture that needs to soften. With acidity and apple and citrus flavors, it is a ripe wine that has a nervy, steely character. Drink from 2020.

name: Fallet Dart NV Les Hauts des Clos du Mont Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, fleshy wine has plenty of white fruit and peach flavors. These are balanced by acidity and the taut mineral texture that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This bright, crisp wine wine with its acidity and touch of minerality is still a little young, but it will develop well. It needs to open out to reveal the apple fruitiness, so drink from 2020.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a ripe, full wine, with intense white and citrus-fruit flavors. With an open texture and good, fresh acidity, it is balanced but needs another few months. Drink from 2020.

name: Klepka-Sausse 2012 Mille Or Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine shows the taut, nervy side of the appellation. That means it needs to age, softening the acidity and bringing out the wood aging and riper white fruits. Drink from 2020.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a bright, light and high-toned wine from a cool site, densely packed in tart layers of earthy lemon and green apple. It has a floral component of honeysuckle that accents the nose and palate well.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Inviting aromas of lemon custard, vanilla bean and pear meet a robustly lithe concentration on the palate, the power fleshy and richly round. Toasted oak and a tropical bounty of fruit await as the wine builds concentration and flavor seasoned in baking spice.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Spice and light toastiness give this wine a full, ripe character. Allied to the tropical flavors, the wine is fruity and has a good texture. Balance and freshness are its hallmarks. Drink from 2020.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Radiant gold in color, this classy Adelaide Hills Chardonnay is polished, bright and food friendly. It takes a few minutes to open in glass, and shouldn't be sipped too cold, but at its best it offers ripe lemons and oranges, white spice, honeysuckle, some seashell reduction and some vanillin oak notes. The mouthfeel is buttery in texture, supported by spicy oak, buoyed by bright acidity and with a long finish like the salted rim of a citrusy cocktail. Drink with a wide range of dishes until 2027.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of white peach and oak are cut by Meyer lemon pastry on the nose of this bottling from vines planted in 1997. Strong oak and buttercream flavors play on the rich palate, with lemon zest touches providing acidic relief.

name: Malard NV Les Historiques Avize Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: Meyer lemon skins, oak and toast aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high atop the Carmel Valley. Tangy yellow-apple-skin flavors meet with preserved lemon on the palate.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A more approachable, balanced and brighter wine than this producer's upper tier wine, this opens with subtle notes of lime, peach, florals and flint, backed by a creamy toffee oak nuance. There's a lovely balance of bright acidity and a chalky phenolic texture, with a juicy citrus fruit flavors stretching out to the finish. This is a tasty, food-friendly drop for drinking now.

name: Château de Santenay 2017  Puligny-Montrachet
description: This wine is rich and concentrated, full of ripe white fruit and acidity with a judicious touch of wood. Its acidity, mineral texture and toastiness give this blend of parcels across the appellation the essential aging potential. Drink from 2021.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This producer's generic Saint-Véran shows the structure of the appellation along with its fine mineral texture. These partner with crisp lemon fruits and the wine is bright, tangy and ready to drink.

name: Olivier Leflaive 2017  Puligny-Montrachet
description: This wine is poised between a crisp, mineral texture and rounded white-fruit flavors. It is still young, even for a village wine, revealing fresh fruitiness. Give it until 2021 and the wine will be richer and delicious.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This single-vineyard wine is cool, crisp and packed with green fruits and attractive acidity. It conveys a fresh wine that is also ripe, likely to age for a few more months and be better from 2020.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Sourced from a vineyard on the west side of Canandaigua Lake, this wine offers bright, focused aromas of white flowers, lime peel and crushed stone. The light-bodied palate is mildly creamy in lemon curd and white-plum flavors that are shot through with bright, zesty acidity. A stony minerality pervades throughout and the finish carries along a savory blanched almond note.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This unoaked, no-malolactic wine doesn't lack for flavor. It's bright, spicy and nicely textural, with suggestions of citrus zest, green apple, lemongrass and bracing minerality. The grapes are sourced from all over the state—Willamette Valley, Southern Oregon and the Columbia Gorge.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: With a steely nose of crisp acidity and floral honeysuckle, this wine is earthy and robust in caramel apple and pear. Rich and robust, it offers moderate structure and texture from 100% estate-grown fruit.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Whiffs of burnt sugar, smoke and toast mingle into pristine white grapefruit and red apple on the nose of this delightfully easy-drinking Chardonnay. It's light bodied and fresh in composure, with a lingering silky touch. Drink now–2024.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Partly aged in wood, this single-vineyard wine is rich. Touches of pineapple and mango are lightly cut by acidity to give a full-bodied wine that reflects the vintage. Drink the wine now.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A small parcel of a vineyard close to the Villamont winery has produced a luscious wine with ripe apricot and pineapple flavors. The softness is mitigated by a more assertive acidity at the end. Drink from 2020.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine shows delicious richness, poised between fresh apples and yellow fruits and laced with acidity. Its tangy edge and spice from wood aging contribute to its complexity and aging potential. Drink from 2021.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: A walled section within the larger Morgeot premier cru vineyards has produced a ripe, buttery wine. Its wood aging is well balanced between acidity and yellow fruits held by crisp citrus flavors. The wine will age; wait to drink until 2022.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This Moldovan Chardonnay has aromas of lemon, grapefruit and peach. On the palate it has flavors of ripe peach and apricot. It has a clean and refreshing finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Mineral driven, this impressive wine is lively and layered in apple, pear and brioche, its oak integrated and lightly toasted. A touch of richness gives it additional weight and breadth across the memorable texture and lasting baking spice.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Heady aromatics of golden apple, pear and brioche are complemented by stony minerality in this lengthy, layered and oak-integrated white wine from the famous site. Fleshy and balanced, it shares a richness tempered in crisp acidity.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: While wood aging shows on the nose, the palate of this wine is more about generous fruit and intense acidity. Freshness is balanced by the mineral texture and the almost tannic character of the fruits. The wine will need some time, so drink from 2023.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This twist-top county blend is a solid deal, starting with fresh and crisp aromas of lime balm, jasmine and a touch of chalk. Chalky tension grips the palate and then carries through broad gardenia, plump white peach and cherimoya flavors.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Rounded, soft and generous, this wine comes from the small village of Saint-Aubin in the hills behind the Côte de Beaune. It has a rounded, creamy texture with an opulent edge to balance the fresher white and citrus fruits. The wine needs another year, so drink from 2020.

name: California Roots 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: From one of two Lumpp estates in Givry, this wine is soft and open. Its warm, spicy character emphasizes the ripe, floral nature of the grapes in this vintage. It is ready to drink.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Built from estate-grown fruit, this affordable, all-stainless Chardonnay is a pleasant quaff, though it borders on generic white wine flavors. Crisp apple and green melon, accompanied by light citrus, wraps it up.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A full-bodied, ripe wine with a good balance between acidity and rich apple and crisp pear flavors, this is generously proportioned. The freshness and texture are essential elements of the wine that is ready for further aging.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: One of a pair of white wines with the Bourgogne appellation, this comes from old vines. It is ripe, with a hint of honey as well as fresh tangy citrus and fuller pear flavors. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: The scents and flavors of banana dominate this wine, which hits the palate softly, then punches up the impact with herbal highlights. Fermented and aged in a mix of new and neutral French oak, it's sourced from a vineyard in the newly approved Van Duzer Corridor AVA.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This tremendously impressive wine is made from grapes grown at the Martinelli family's Zio Tony Vineyard. It tastes of apple up front, juicy, layered and complex in lush texture and buoyant acidity. Edges of crème brûlée and caramel accent papaya and pineapple, with underlying mineral components that add to the intriguing richness.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This plush medium-bodied wine smells like pear syrup and baking spices, tastes fruity and rich, and feels broad in texture. It shows just enough light acidity to keep it fresh.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fairly light and delicate aromas of lemon peel, lemongrass and the slightest hint of warm buttercream show on the nose of this bottling from the region's most historic vineyard. There is a great sizzle to the palate, with fresh flavors of white flower and lemon zest that lead to an amazingly long and smooth finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the famous site in Carneros, the block sourced by the producer consists of Musque clone Chardonnay, planted in the early 1990s and a portion of it also goes into his Annia white blend. Opening in a whiff of confection, it offers steely acidity and a textured taste of lemon rind, grapefruit and white peach, layered and balanced in every sense of the word.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Tropical, nutty and robust in initial oak, this wine settles into a nice balanced place, slightly reductive and youthful. Apple and pear compote give it a fruity flavor nuanced in lushness.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fruit for this wine comes from the Yakima Valley (50%), Wahluke Slope (26%), Columbia Gorge (21%) and Walla Walla Valley (3%). Aromas of toast, clarified butter, lemon curd, candy corn, summer squash and spice are followed by creamy, well-balanced fruit flavors. A warm finish caps it off. It's a lot of wine for the money.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Lime zest, cream and white flowers show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very crisp with aggressive citrus tones, from grapefruit skins to lime juice, and the tension is noticeable.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Fruit for this wine, aged 16 months in Burgundy barrels, comes from 1981 plantings. The candlewax, vanilla, mineral, pear and spice aromas intrigue. Full-bodied, creamy-feeling stone fruit and barrel flavors follow. A warm finish caps it off.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Aromas of oak, vanilla, lemon jam on brioche and roasted apples show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers flavors of Golden Russet apple, sandalwood and a hint of citrus.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Fresh pear, nectarine, smoke and apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with pear and apple-butter flavors, which are cut by lemon spray and then finish toward marzipan and chalk.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: There's a mix of freshness and savory qualities on the nose of this bottling, with aromas of lemon balm as well as hazelnuts. The palate's toasted almond qualities meet with creamier peach-custard flavors, all lifted by a citrusy tang.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Made with Chardonnay, this has aromas of mature yellow apple, cedar and acacia honey. The savory palate delivers grapefruit, white peach and vanilla alongside bright acidity.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: An aroma of bread dough and subtle floral flavors backed by mineral and peach make this a pleasant and rather subtle wine. Little obvious oakiness comes through and it feels soft in texture.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Aromas of slightly burnt toast, clarified butter, corn silk and spice lead to medium-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. Lemony notes linger on the finish. The style seems to override the fruit at times.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Toasty aromas of oak, butter and lemon spritz make for a familiar nose on this bottling of Central Coast fruit by a South Coast winery. It's fairly rich and oak-driven on the palate, with marzipan and nutty flavors cut by lime zest and lively acid.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a very compelling can of wine, starting with fresh and vibrantly tropical aromas of guava and pineapple chunks. It tightens up a tad on the sip, where lemon-skin flavors take hold. It's great for the beach or lake.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Fruity aromas of papaya, mango and pineapple kick off the nose on this affordable bottling by the Center of Effort team. The tropical tones show on the palate as well, where flavors of Starburst candy dominate, yet there is a tension to hold everything in check.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Light and mellow aromas of lemon blossom and yellow pear show on the nose of this bottling from the Hahn family, which features a new label. The palate is tense and full of citrus flavors, from lime peel to lemon peel, leading into a slightly sour finish.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Light, nuanced and floral, this value-driven wine is also made to benefit environmental causes. Sourced from cool-climate sites, winemaker Matthew Iaconis of Brick & Mortar gives it low oak and moderate acidity, letting it become creamy in crème brûlée and bright in orange and lime.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Creamy aromas of crème brûlée meet with crisp nectarine, citrus and hazelnut on the nose of this rich bottling. The palate shows a lot of oak influence, with more hazelnut and pecan as well as smoky butter flavors.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: A hint of pink shows in the straw color of this bold and dry wine. It offers oaky toasted nut aromas, a broad palate of Bosc pear, walnut and dried fig flavors on a full body and weighty texture. While on the reserved side now, this should be best after 2022.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Very golden in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of ripe apple, white peach and sea salt on the nose. The palate is fat, with apples, pears, buttercream and toasted nuts, plus just enough acid to keep it afloat.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Given no time in oak, this is a surprisingly creamy and lush wine, generous in body weight and lush tropical fruit. Rich and spicy, it finishes in peach and Meyer lemon.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: The Chardonnay is normally one of the strongest offerings from Giesen's range of wines from the organically farmed single vineyard Clayvin, but this vintage is currently in an awkward stage. Closed and fairly reductive, it needs plenty of time in decanter to reveal its tropical and lime fruit, vanilla, and toasty salted-nut characters. The palate is highly textured with a rush of cheek-biting acidity. This rich full-figured Chardonnay is meant for the long haul. Drink 2020–2029.

name: Husch 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: There's an impressive complexity to this affordably priced bottling, starting with aromas of light lemon glaze, nectarine, Asian pear and wet stone on the nose. The palate is taut, bright and fresh with honeysuckle, Meyer lemon pith and wet chalk flavors.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tangy lime-peel, lemongrass and lime-leaf aromas make for a very sharp entry to this bottling. The palate is also very tangy and acid-driven, showing flavors of grapefruit peel, Meyer lemon pith and lime zest.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Initial green and yellow apple notes attain a creamier aspect and lemony zing on the nose. The palate has a lovely, yeasty texture, which rounds out the slender, lemony body. The salty citrus finish is dry and very appetizing.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Nutty and mineral, this is a full-bodied white, with grip and ripeness that isn't overoaked. Citrus and apple flavors give it lift and accentuate underlying acidity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of lees, wet stone, pear, candlewax, candy corn, citrus peel and clove. The palate shows a compelling sense of balance to the deft, light, creamy flavors, with lively acidity brightening the flavors and lengthening the finish. It's an intriguing, lees-driven wine.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A smooth rich texture and ripe luxurious fruit flavors are framed by butter and baking spices in this satisfying full-bodied wine. It goes for ripeness and heft, feeling soft in acidity and long on the finish.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon peel, ripe nectarine, peach and pear flesh show on the nose of this bottling from cattle rancher-turned-vintner Jeffrey Blair. There is a taut texture to the palate, where sea salt, lemon and smoke qualities are mouthwatering.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Appealing aromas of straw, corn silk, candy corn, vanilla and lemon curd lead to full-feeling peach and apricot flavors speckled with spice accents. A pleasing sense of acidity carries the flavors through the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Peregrine's wines always have a certain class and age-worthiness about them and their Chard doesn't disappoint. A nose of quince, peach and tangerine is backed by soft nutty oak aromas, while the creamy-textured palate is lifted by tangy mouthwatering acidity. The oak is present but not overwhelming. A long juicy tangerine finish makes it easy to take another sip. Drink now–2027.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: A fairly tricky vintage, the 2017 Chardonnay is less full throttle and ripe than in previous years, but its restraint offers poise and age-worthiness. Soft pineapple and melon aromas sit alongside vegetal green-pepper ones, along with white spice and toasty vanillin oak. The acidity is what's particularly noticeable on this vintage, but it's balanced by chalky texture and fruit weight. Medium bodied, the oak is somewhat on show but mostly in a supporting rather than leading role. Drink 2021–2029.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of corn silk, spice, almond and stone fruit that lead to beautifully balanced flavors, packed with fruit. A long, lingering finish caps it off. Lively acidity provides the structure. Delicious stuff.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fresh, creamy notes of yeast still play on the nose, mixing with bright notes of green and yellow apple. The palate comes in with the same orchard fruit freshness and is suffused with bright, ripe lemon. The body is light but has a lovely textured midpalate and a dry, appetizing finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Brimming in aromas of peach and vanilla, this wine is complex and layered. Bright acidity boosts the rich elements of fruit and oak on the palate.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Winemaker Pietro Buttita has a sure hand with at least a dozen varietals, and this Chardonnay is no exception. Livened up by good, bracing acidity, this beautifully ripe and smooth wine has great balance and plenty of attractive pear, apple and peach flavors.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Chalk, wet pebble and lemon on the nose bode well for freshness. The palate adds rounded stone fruit notions of Mirabelle plum while yeasty flavors come to the fore. The finish is dry and very fresh, leaving you with lemon zing and chalkiness.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Roasted apple, butterscotch and strong oak aromas show on the nose of this rich bottling, which offers a balanced style of classic California Chardonnay. The palate is creamy in texture with flavors of white peach, grilled lemons and more toasty oak.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Extremely jubilant aromas of Fruit Stripe gum, guava, pineapple and mango make for a fresh and lively nose on this bottling. The palate zips with acidity that cuts through the ripe peach, pear and pineapple-guava flavors, which are powerful yet framed in a tense texture.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Toasty aromas of sourdough with fresh lemon spread meet with white flowers on the layered but restrained nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great tension on the sip, where lively citrus flavors make the mouth pucker before warmer toast tones lead into the chalky finish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Somewhere between honey and lemon in color, this Chardonnay shows off much of what is so good about the North Canterbury region. The nose is sunny and bright with tropical and stone fruit backed by nutty, toasty and floral aromas. The medium-bodied palate is focused with chalky textured but slippery fruit weight. Lifted acidity and bright fruit add tingly tangy character. Drink over the next few years on its own or with food.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Notes of Golden Delicious apple flesh and fresh lemon combine into a very attractive nose. The palate seems buffered, its freshness suspended by lovely texture, yet bright with ripe lemon. This is fresh and harmonious, with lasting brightness that waters the mouth long after the last sip.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Estate-grown, Pastorale is brimming in apple, white flower and toasted oak, with a tease of richness in the form of crème brûlée. Stony mineral persists beneath the surface, boosting a strong, complex structure of fresh, nuanced acidity that finishes in a lingering taste of lemon rind.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Golden Delicious apple notes abound on the nose. They blend in with a lactic notion of yogurt and melted butter. The palate adds a lovely, gentle and creamy texture to the apple freshness and makes this a grown-up, textured and rounded Chardonnay.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Mellow aromas of Asian pear, butter-fried apple and a bit of canned pear show on the nose of this appellation blend. The compelling aspect is the grippy palate, which is taut in a chalky tension that presents flavors of sea salt, Pink Lady apple and red pear.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Year after year, this wine brings consistently high quality, and this vintage does not disappoint. Aromas of pumpkin spice, straw, mineral and a whiff of toast enchant, showing a pleasing sense of subtlety. Full, textured pear, peach, lees and spice flavors follow, intertwining on the lemony finish, with a toasty note that caps it off. It's completely delightful.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: From a vineyard in the Los Alamos Valley, this bottling by Greg Brewer begins with fresh aromas of passion fruit, citron, lime leaf and wet cement. The palate is tightly wound with slightly sour tones of guava peel, presenting a very fresh, no-oak style that still has plenty of character.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This Ritchie white shows robust, fleshy structure and earthy, floral and complex components of fresh tropical fruit and strong tannin. Full bodied and expressive in pineapple, lanolin and mango, it has plenty of backbone and power.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: This bottling is evidence of the strides winemaker David Baird has made in recent years to uplift this new brand. This white is what classic California Chardonnays should taste like when made in a balanced way. Aromas of butter, lemon peels, gardenia and chalk lead into toast, mango, pineapple and peach on the palate that hide behind an earthy, crushed, white-rock structure.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This displays heady aromas of apple, ginger and toasted brioche. Juicy and lengthy, the palate dazzles in underlying mineral aspects of stone and earth.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This appellation blend carries that aromatic hallmark of this winery's Chardonnays, with a streak of walnut oil that decorates the marmalade and toast tones. The palate is bright in acidity, giving energy to the flavors of walnut paste, dried orange peel and sun-dried honeysuckle.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Vineyard-focused aromas of flower, talc, mineral, whole lemon and pear lead to sleek, well-balanced, acid-driven flavors. Lemony acidity brightens the palate and lengthens the finish. There's a compelling sense of purity that completely captivates. It's an exceptional example of this variety, vineyard and vintage.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Toasted almonds, seared lemon peels and toasted brioche show on the inviting and nutty nose of this bottling, one of the winery's first white wines. There is great tension to the sip, where stony qualities lead into nectarine and citrus-spiked lemon-verbena tea flavors, with intriguing herbal tones throughout.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of pineapple, pear and fresh plumeria show on the nose of this bottling by Greg Brewer. The palate zips with acidity, delivering flavors of guava, Pink Lady apple, pineapple and more ripe pear.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Golden stony apple opens this full-bodied wine, robust in structure and tannin. Youthful oak gives it a toasty quality that works with the expressive, expansive fruit, finishing with a lasting succulence and touches of nutmeg and Meyer lemon.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: This bottling's nose is delicate yet focused with aromas of lemon blossoms, lemon candy, lemon balm and lemon verbena, as well as a touch of nectarine. The sip snaps with green-citrus flavors of grapefruit before warming up toward brioche with lemon filling, all surrounding lively acidity and compelling texture. Drink now–2032.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Stone, cream, vanilla and yellow apple combine into a nose that promises body, texture and freshness. The palate majors on the freshness and presents pure lemon that suffuses the creamy texture to great effect. A very elegant, concentrated, taut but also structured Chardonnay that will only improve with age. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Bright and fragrant in aromas of jasmine and lemon rind, this wine impresses in its textured minerality of wet stone and sea spray. Structured and complex, it shines in a light-bodied approach that never holds back in flavors of apple and pear.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Bright aromas of lemon candy, sea spray and lime balm meets with a touch of pastry on the nose. Richer flavors of white peach and sea salt ride a light and bright texture on the palate, which grows more oaky toward the finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean, delicate and yet full aromas of lemon cream, toast, peach blossom and chalk show on the lovely nose of this bottling from a vineyard that sits above Highway 101 in Prunedale. The chalky texture takes hold immediately on the palate, with flavors of white peach and seared nectarine that are chiseled by acidity and finish on an intriguing chive note.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Very buttery in aroma and flavor, this full-bodied wine lavishes almond, cream and vanilla nuances on the palate, supported by a silky and smooth texture leading to a lingering finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a new project run by the owners of the celebrated vineyard in the Corralitos area, and it's a stunning start. Aromas of Asian pear, lime pith, lime blossom and wet clay lead into a zesty and vibrant palate of more lime, chalk and guava peels. The freshness is phenomenal.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: This is a rich yet balanced expression of Chardonnay, starting with aromas of butterscotch, lemon preserves, citrus cream and minty herbs. Ripe and roasted apple flavors show on the palate, as does sea-salt caramel toward the finish, but the lemony acidity drives from start to finish.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Aromas of chamomile, lemon blossom and sweet lime peel meet with an underlying hint of walnut oil and sour cream on the nose of this bottling by Greg Brewer. The palate's compelling texture is simultaneously oily and chalky, with expertly integrated acidity carrying flavors of peach extract and labneh.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Pristine aromas of honeysuckle, white peach, sea salt caramel and sharp citrus make for a delicious entry on the nose of this bottling by Chris Miller. The sip zips with acid and surrounds a chalky texture, delivering flavors of Meyer lemon, grapefruit, pan-seared apple and a touch of mango. Vividly complex and delicious.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Floral, earthy and beautifully textured, this vineyard-designated white is structured and balanced. The components are lovingly etched in wet stone, white flower and lemon verbena, lasting and lengthy with spicy texture and impressive weight.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1997 shows pristine aromas of lime, guava peel, lemon juice and wet chalk. The palate is austere at first, focused on the chalky grip, and then come waves of mellow cherimoya, white peach and other creamy white fruits. A salty element arises on the finish.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Hailing from Josh Jensen's iconic vineyard at 2,200 feet above the Salinas Valley, this is an epic Chardonnay, loaded with clean, lively aromas of cherimoya, honeysuckle, sweet cream, crisp peach, struck flint and chive. The palate is tightly wound, with flavors of lemon spray, seared nectarine, sea salt and toasted oak.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Winemaker: Kevin Grant. This wine is fairly shy and quiet right now, with soft aromas of toasted apple skin, crushed rock, melon rind and a touch of flint. The palate is light and direct in feel, with focused acidity and tart, mouth-puckering flavors of lime, green plum and underripe stone fruit that are supremely mouthwatering and juicy through the close. It shows promise, given some more time to coalesce and fully shine.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Winemaker: Gary Jordan. There's a pronounced wood edge to the nose of this wine right now, which overall smells ripe and fleshy. Aromas of honeydew, yellow apple, buttered apple and orange cream abound in the intense bouquet. The palate is medium-full and flavorful, with more ripe melon and citrus fruits that are framed by sweet spice and toasty accents. A solid seam of acidity lends lift, and lingering honeyed nut and spice accents carry the close.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Winemaker: Andrea Mullineux. An ode to the mature, concentrated white wines of Jura or Rioja, this is, without a doubt, a wine to contemplate. It's a complex, layered, mature and slightly oxidized experience, with pronounced nuttiness and a slight mushroom umami-like tone partnered with beautiful sea spray, citrus pith, white melon rind, apple core, straw and toasted brioche tones. The palate is full and weighty, with ripe melon, apple and orange tones that transition into a supremely sweet-spice and savory impression that carries through to the long, evolving finish.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Winemaker: Gordon Newton Johnson. Aromas of toasted apple, orange rind, lemon oil and apple pie lead the nose of this attractive white. The palate is rich and ripe, but balanced by beautiful, creeping acidity and a pleasant, lightly pithy texture that lends structure to the palate and length through the close. Flavors of toasted apple, melon rind and orange peel abound, with a final lingering impression of cedar-grilled apple and light baking spice. Lovely and well balanced; drink after 2025.

name: Big Churn 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This nonvintage canned Chardonnay doesn't exceed expectations for a quaffer; in fact, it's mostly a dud. Unclean aromas of scrambled eggs and natural gas are not welcoming, while this feels flat and tastes briny and vaguely tropical.

name: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay (Maipú)
description: A noticeably deep-gold color and very strong smoky oaky aromas signal that this is an extremely styled wine. The flavors are raw and woody and somewhat bitter.

name: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay (Maipú)
description: Dusty tropical fruit aromas are watery and briny. This Chardonnay feels tight and lacks body or anything resembling structure. Generic stone-fruit and citrus flavors finish pulpy.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: This wine comes from a parcel situated just below the premier cru of Pucelles. Its candied-fruit flavors don't add up in the context of its origins. It will develop as a wine that is always tight.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A rounded nose of citrus cream, melon and pineapple juice carries the mildly concentrated nose. The palate carries brûléed citrus and melon flavors, with mild acidity backing it up. Toasted almond marks the close.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Pretty scents of apple blossoms open into a strangely piercing palate, with a metallic edge. The fruit flavors revolve around green and yellow apples, and the finish turns bitter.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A light, ripe and smooth Chardonnay with apple and pear flavors, this open wine offers attractive acidity and a fresh aftertaste. It is ready to drink.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Wooly oak and banana aromas set up a creamy, mostly flat palate that's not going to last much longer. Banana-cream pie and vanilla flavors are woody prior to honeydew and vanilla ice cream notes on the finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Medium gold in color, this Chardonnay is, on the nose at least, somewhat of a throwback to the Chards of several decades ago. Unfortunately it lacks the balance to feel retro and instead feels laden with buttery oak-spice aromas, while pineapple and honeysuckle characters are at the rear. The palate is tropical fruited and creamy in texture but is overwhelmed by angular, biting acidity, making the wine feel disjointed.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Light with attractive smooth textures and ripe apple flavors, this easy wine is made to be drunk young. The aftertaste has refreshing acidity.

name: Masia de la Vinya 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Oaky and rough, this estate-grown wine is also low in alcohol and thinly fruited. Light apple and raw lumber notes pretty much sum up the flavors. The wine was aged sur lie for 14 months in 30% new French oak.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of sulfur, herb and peach lead to somewhat lighter styled stone fruit flavors. It's straight down the fairway.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Apple, pear and corn aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. It's a straightforward quaffer.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This simple, friendly wine has plenty of ripe apple flavors that are already well integrated into the light structure and acidity. It is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A yellow color and aromas of apple juice, tropical fruits and mango syrup open this Chardonnay. Apple and vanilla flavors lose some clarity on a full and fleshy finish, with notable acidity.

name: Altvs 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, rich and full bodied, this white is brimming in hazelnut, brioche and caramelized apple flavor. The midpalate is decadently lush.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Spice, clarified butter and peach aromas lead to buttery fruit flavors. It's a straight-forward, stylistic quaffer.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vanilla and clarified butter aromas are out front along with barrel notes of baking spice on this wood-driven wine. The palate shows more of the same, with slightly sweet fruit flavors. It's all about the oak and style.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This softly textured, young wine has an attractive balance between perfumed white fruits and a light texture. The wine will be better from 2020.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Pineapple and vague woody aromas are prime components of a flat nose. This is oaky and struggling to stay vital. Oak-dominated melon and papaya flavors benefit from wood-spice notes, while this soft Chardonnay is mild on the finish.

name: Altvs 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A burnished gold color and strong up-front oak aromas open this woody Chardonnay. On the palate, this is thick and resiny, with citric acidity. Severely woody flavors match the nose, while on the finish this tastes of melon, vanilla and wood spice.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Blended with 3% Viognier, the Snitch is within the Prisoner Wine Company portfolio of illustrative, creative label design. Intensely full-bodied, it tastes of caramel, brioche and baked apple, sure to please fans of a rich, concentrated style.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Lemon balm, herb and flower aromas are followed by sleek, nicely structured fruit flavors. Wilted flower notes linger on the finish.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Apple, pear and a touch of vanilla are standard fare aromas for warm-climate Chardonnay, while this feels plump and just acidic enough. Tropical flavors of pineapple and melon finish with tolerable burn and harshness.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Produced from 25-year-old vines, this wine comes from chalk and clay soil. Its soft texture and fresh acidity emphasize the pure fruitiness of the wine, without any wood. It is ready to drink.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This brightly perfumed wine has attractive apple flavors and a light texture. All about fruit, the wine is fresh, crisp, and ready to drink.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This rounded, fresh wine offers crisp citrus and green-apple flavors. Light, bright and full of tangy fruits, it is ready to drink.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: A soft wine with attractive apple flavors, this is light, although the tight texture gives structure. Crisp at the end, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This soft, fruity wine has attractive apple acidity. Its bright fruitiness offers a touch of minerality to balance the creamy texture. Drink the wine now.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A light, poised and creamy wine, this is full of pear and citrus flavors. The wine is warm and smooth, with an aftertaste of fresh acidity. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine comes from a new, small appellation, with vineyards set at up to a 1,000-foot elevation far to the west of the main Burgundy vineyards. Crisp and light, it offers red apple and spice flavors. Drink now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This well-balanced wine is poised between crisp apple and citrus fruits and a creamy texture that gives it cushioned softness. The wine comes from vines in the hills behind Nuits Saint-Georges. Drink now.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: From the family domaine, this attractive wine offers warm yellow fruits and a touch of spice that are balanced by the mineral texture and youthful acidity. The wine needs another few months, so drink from 2020.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Largely neutral aromas include notes of almond skins and apple. This feels a touch heavy and oily despite not having seen any oak. Tropical and citrus-fruit flavors are pulpy and taste mildly salty on the finish.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Lime pith and sharp white-flower aromas kick off this twist-top bottling. The palate is focused and fresh, with very tropical flavors of passion fruit and Key lime pie.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A pretty strong streak of toasted oak influences the flavors of this medium-bodied wine. Buttery smoky nuances overlay ripe, almost fat, apple and pear flavors on a very soft texture.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Medium gold in color, this Chardonnay may be unoaked but winemaking techniques seem to have been applied to enhance aromatics and mouthfeel. High-toned aromas of lemon peel, peach pit, white blossom and a touch of honey on the nose lead to a full-bodied palate that is highly textural, waxy and slippery, lifted by bright citrusy acidity.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A plump, lightly spicy wine, this brings fresh apple fruit with a touch of gooseberry. Barrel fermented in 20% new French oak, which seems to have rounded it out a bit, this finishes somewhat quickly, with an impression of chicken bouillon.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Firmly anchored in flavors of tart herbs and citrus, this is modest in scale and ripeness, though balanced well throughout. Lime and grapefruit flavors dominate, with no malolactic fermentation or barrel aging to soften things up. Serve it chilled, perhaps with a cold chicken or pasta salad.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: A ripe, easy and generous wine, this has open yellow-fruit flavors. Acidity gives a good lift of freshness, adding a crisp side to the rounded, full textures of the wine. Drink now.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: Fresh but largely neutral white-fruit aromas are slightly briny, while this fruity Chardonnay is light in color. A balanced palate is lively but also pulpy, while this tastes of citrus, pear and melon prior to a lightly briny tasting finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This Beaune negociant, established since the 18th century, has produced a classically simple, fruity wine. With juicy apple flavors and balanced acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Toasty smoky oak leads buttery apple and Bartlett pear aromas towards a round palate with limited malic acidity doing all it can to keep this fresh. Melon, apple and creamy oak flavors soften and fade on the finish before going silent.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: There are some slight reductive notes to this medium-gold-hued Chardonnay, but with time in glass those Band-Aid aromas do blow off somewhat. Underneath can be found lemon, salted nut, toast and white-spice notes. Things improve on the full-bodied palate, which is slippery in texture, with toasty oak influence present but not overwhelming. Fans of full-figured Chardonnays will dig this.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A rounded wine with a hint of crisp apples and plenty of attractive acidity, this comes from a family-owned estate based in the town of Chablis. The wine's lightness and poise are already appealing, so drink now.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: White-flower fragrance and white-stone-fruit flavor characterize this attractive wine that can be drunk young. It is full of fruit, with a hint of butteriness that is balanced by minerality. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Tropical fruit and vanilla characterize this wine—an estate crafting that's soft and fleshy on the palate. The ripeness is in check and balanced, as a touch of richness rounds out on the finish, with a tease of marshmallow oak.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Simple and fruity, this lightly mineral-textured wine has a buttery touch as well as apple flavors. The wine is open and ready to drink.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A bit reductive at the start, with some salty oniony aromas, this Chardonnay needs some swirling in glass before revealing notes of waxy lemon, white pepper and wool. The palate is medium to full bodied, with a slippery texture that doesn't employ the use of oak. Juicy citrusy acidity balances the creaminess nicely, but the fruit feels a little sour.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Aromas of slightly burnt toast, corn on the cob and candlewax are out front. Creamy-feeling fruit flavors follow.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Briny sea shell and citrus aromas come with a hint of lanolin. This feels citric and tangy, with orange and tangerine flavors. A citrus-fruit character dominates this bright, punchy Chardonnay.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: White peach, sea salt, honeysuckle and lemon peel all converge in a classic, oak-driven manner on the nose of this bottling. It's clean on the palate and full of familiar flavors of peach and butterscotch.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a ripe rich style of Margaret River Chardonnay—a veritable peach and melon meringue pie, with some yeasty lees characters in the mix as well. The same intensity of fruit continues on the palate which is creamy but more poised and focused than the nose suggests, with flavors reminiscent of a bar of peach soap. This might last a few more years in bottle but signs points to it being more than ready to drink now.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is ripe and rounded, with generous fruits and a hint of tropical flavors. These elements are balanced by acidity that keeps the opulence in check. Drink the wine now.

name: Ferrari 2010 Riserva Lunelli Extra Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Stone-fruit driven, this white is rich and round, with a noticeable oak imprint of toasted brioche and vanilla. It balances on the finish, showing secondary flavors of apple, pear and baking spice.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: High-toned in citrus and green olive, this white takes on a richer concentration on the midpalate, with a barrel imprint of baking spice and vanilla.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Hints of asparagus aromas lead to a crisp wine with a bit of creaminess and attractive acidity. Its spice shows light wood aging to smooth out the bright character. Drink now.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Much like the previously released Estate bottling, this is a pleasant, light, well-balanced and lightly spicy wine. It's a solid all-purpose white, with clean apple fruit that carries through a crisp finish.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine offers white fruits, lightly spiced and with a dense texture. It comes from the northernmost village of the Côte Chalonnaise. Drink now.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Arcadia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Hints of wood aging bring out the ripe, lightly structured fruit of this balanced wine. A blend across village vineyards, it gives a fresh view of the appellation, bright with acidity and with a taut texture. The wine will be ready from 2020.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Light grapefruit and Pink Lady apple aromas meet with a steely minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very subtle, with mellow hints of lemon blossom, lime juice and white peach in the background.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This bright wine is full of white-fruit flavors textured with minerality and young, intense acidity that will soften. This already-delicious wine will certainly develop. Drink from 2020.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the extended Paquet family, Michel Paquet owns this estate in Mâcon-Prissé. The vineyard is being converted to organic. This wine is ripe, with full white-fruit flavors laced with youthful acidity. It needs aging and should be drunk from 2020.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and bright in apple and stone fruit, with a tease of anise, this wine has a rich midpalate that balances out on the finish, the oak subdued and well tamed.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Bright, creamy fruits give this wine crispness as well as plenty of ripe apple flavors. It is pure fruitiness, juicy and refreshing, finishing with a beautiful lift of acidity. Drink now.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Broad aromas of Asian pear flesh, honeysuckle and guava are soft and pillow-like on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is a tautness to the palate, where honeysuckle, apple blossom and juicy pear flavors linger.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Lush and expansively rich on the palate, this is a creamy wine defined in bold flavors of apple and pear. Weighty, it offers texture and complexity around a core of toasted oak.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine is pure fruit, with crisp acidity and lemon flavors that impart a refreshing character. It is ready to drink.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Produced from the Aegerter family vineyards, this wine is softly textured, open and full of ripe yellow and white fruits. Balanced acidity gives freshness to a wine that is ready to drink.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A boisterous young wine full of fruit, this is setting out to be attractive, crisp and lightly mineral. A hint of structure gives the wine a bite that will soften over the next few months. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Generic white-fruit aromas are clean and welcoming but basic. A full and grabby palate remains fresh courtesy of zesty acidity, while this tastes a touch briny and salty on top of lime, melon and apple flavors. Energy is preserved on the finish by tangy acidity.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Peach and nectarine aromas are fresh and show hints of sea shell and wool. This feels crisp and stony despite being fairly full in body, while apple flavors are lightly spiced and more basic than complex. Acidic zest keeps this lively on the finish.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A generous, ripe wine full of white-fruit flavors, this is bright and young. Its acidity needs to be tamed to bring out the wine's concentration and opulence. The wine will be ready from 2020.

name: Ferrari 2010 Riserva Lunelli Extra Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: The Alder Springs vineyard is known for making wines that are unyielding when young, so this full-bodied Chardonnay is not showing its stuff yet. A muted, slightly spicy and slightly earthy flavor is supported by a big mouthfilling texture. With time in the glass, it shows more baking spices and butter but little fruit focus. Odds are good that it will improve through at least 2024.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: With ripe tropical-fruit flavors, this is a full, opulent wine. A fresher side gives crisper character to the wine but the open, easy fruitiness dominates. Drink now.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: The simplest of this producer's range of single-vineyard Pouilly Fuissé, this wine is all about fruitiness. Citrus and green-apple flavors are pierced with refreshing acidity. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Corn silk, toast and marzipan aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. Straight down the fairway, it offers a lot of appeal.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This no-frills Chardonnay brings tart, clean flavors of lemon curd and green apple, with a finishing hint of pie crust.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Poached pear, strong lily and tangerine peel aromas show on the nose of this bottling, a new project for longtime winemaker Adam LaZarre. The palate offers fat flavors of pineapple, mango and cooked apple, yet with a lemony acidity that cuts through.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Fleshy and rounded in a sweetness of peach and vanilla, this wine is appealing and ultimately bright in underlying acidity, finishing in flavors of green olive and honey.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a high solids, unmistakably Aussie Chardonnay with a full-throttle nose of salted nuts, oyster shell and oak spice. The fruit fills in the aroma gaps with characters like grapefruit, peach and orange zest. The mouthfeel is medium weighted, with lovely texture, ripe (if a little overly plump) stone and citrus fruit and an oak-tinged finish.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Lemon curd, candlewax, clarified butter and roasted corn aromas are out front. The stone fruit flavors are fuller in style but maintain a sense of elegance. It's a wine that doesn't seem quite sure what it wants to be.

name: Ferrari 2010 Riserva Lunelli Extra Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Crisp apple dominates this tight, fruity wine. Acidity is very present, although there are also hints of riper wood and butter flavors. The wine is still young and will be better from 2020.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine seems to be moving past its prime at almost five years of age. It's smooth, but the fruit has a dullness beginning to show. Flavors mix apple pie and peach cobbler, with the pastry notes attributable to barrel fermentation, full malolactic and 18 months sur lie in 80% new French oak. Drink up.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This vintage succeeds better than the previous one. As per the name, there is no oak influence on this Chard, but there is still plenty of spice and nuttiness amidst soft-stone fruits. The palate is medium in weight and chalky in texture, with a purity of fruit (thanks to no oak) and a long juicy finish.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This easygoing, fruity Chardonnay offers notes of stone fruit and lemon, with undertones of wool and ginger. Crisp, crunchy acidity freshens the fruit on the palate, which is chalky in texture and medium in weight. Drink up.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This appealing wine is nicely balanced, fresh and has a flinty mineral character that enhances the crisp apple and white-peach flavors. Bright acidity gives it an appetizing mouthfeel and clean finish.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This is a tropical, fruit-forward style of Chardonnay, with aromas of grapefruit, ripe pear, melon and mango. The latter fruit as well as papaya show on the refreshing palate alongside ripe pineapple.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This is a bright and bouncy Chardonnay bursting with peaches and pineapples along with flecks of honey and just a hint of toast. The medium bodied palate is slippery and fruity, with more toasty spice. It's a likable drop at an affordable price.

name: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2017 Arcadia Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
