description: Based in Solutré-Pouilly, this family firm has produced a ripe and full-bodied wine. It has some of the minerality associated with Pouilly-Fuissé although that is filled out by the tropical flavors. The wine's richness and open fruitiness show that it is now ready to drink.

name: Pierre Legras NV Coste Beert Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Literally meaning “black earth” because of dark clay in the vineyard, this wine is full and softly textured. Its broad character is lightly textured by minerality. The fruits are still developing, so drink from 2020.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This reflects a general Oregon trend toward white wines with moderate to low alcohol and minimal new oak aging. It's been barrel fermented and aged sur lie for just under a year, and offers pleasant flavors of apple and citrus, with a touch of saltine cracker, remaining smooth and consistent all through the finish.

name: Pierre Legras 2012 Monographie Brut Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Soft and rounded, this is quickly developing into a generous, lightly textured wine. Its yellow fruits and warm personality contrast well with the taut acidity as well as the toastiness. Drink from 2021.

name: California Roots 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: While this wine displays the richness of the vintage, it also has minerality that brings structure and a fresh texture with just a hint of wood. The wine will age over a few months before being ready to drink from 2020.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: For its status as a Bourgogne appellation wine, this bottling is beautiful and well-constructed. Its floral aromas and ripe pink-grapefruit flavors are fresh, with an attractive crisp touch. The wine is ready to drink.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Milton Park is Thorn-Clarke's everyday range of wines. This vintage of Chardonnay is a bright and highly likable little number that offers a mélange of aromas like peach, melon, pressed buttercup flowers and honey. The palate is textural and creamy (although doesn't appear to have any oak influence). There's a pithy, waxy quality here that makes this an easy pairing with richer creamier cuisine.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: A shiny yellow tint and aromas of butterscotch, popcorn, pear, melon and tropical fruits announce a round and creamy palate with a note of wood-based resin. Toasty oak, vanilla, spiced pear and apple flavors remain in step on the finish.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This ancient estate in Santenay also has vines further south in Mercurey. Here it has produced a wine that is structured as well as full of ripe white fruits. Acidity and freshness balance the richness of this wine and will allow it to age further. Drink from 2020.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of freshly cut red and yellow apple are out front. Medium-bodied, fresh-fruit flavors follow, with a slightly bitter finish.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A bright, clean, well-defined wine, this mixes zippy citrus with crisp apple fruit. There's a suggestion that at least some of it went through malolactic, as it leads into a buttery finish with a touch of toast.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Done in a solid, dependable style, without frills or fuss, this offers clean apple and melon fruit. It spent 10 months in 28% new French oak, putting a pleasing, toasty frame around the flavors.

name: Fallet Dart NV Les Hauts des Clos du Mont Brut  (Champagne)
description: This house, one of the oldest in Burgundy, is producing some inspired wines. This crisp bottling shows potential balance between the fresh citrus fruit and the wood aging. The result will be a ripe wine hinting at minerality. It likely will be ready from 2021.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: At four years of age, this wine is drinking at or near its peak. It's a toasty, buttery wine, barrel fermented and all Dijon clones. There's a suggestion of slightly burnt apple fruit. Drink up over the next year or two.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This is a pretty, medium-bodied and well-balanced wine that blends crisp fruit flavors, light spices and a touch of butter, all in good harmony. It has vivid green-apple, lemon and floral aromas followed by Anjou pear and lime on the palate.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This tightly wrought, mineral-textured wine has a full-bodied future. It is rich, with touches of apricot as well as apple behind the youthful texture. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The wines from this appellation have a crisp, cool feel from their situation at the entry to a valley. This wine fits that description with its crisp, tight acidity and lively fruitiness. Drink from 2020.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This wine's aromas are pleasing, with notes of apple, cream and spice. Full-feeling yet nuanced fruit flavors follow. Spice notes linger on the finish. It displays a lovely sense of balance that kicks it up a notch.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dry, textured and full bodied, this white is weighty and structured. It offers rich tones of hazelnut, caramel apple and honey brightened by green apple and tangerine.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: The Drouin family's domaine has land in the prestigious Pouilly-Fuissé. From there they produce this taut, citrus-flavored wine with acidity and a steely, mineral structure that will age. It will be ready to drink from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: A steely floral nose contributes a vibrancy to this wine that persists on the palate, as richer notions of stone fruit, pineapple and vanilla weigh in. Creamy and integrated, the midpalate leads to a balanced finish of crisp acidity.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Radiant gold in color, this high solids Chardonnay is spicy, salty, nutty and toasty, with peach pit and melon fruit to boot. Texturally it's creamy with tingly acidity, finely balanced oak and fruit and a long salty finish. There's both opulence and precision in this food-friendly West Aussie drop.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Soft and slightly sour lemon aromas meet with damp wood and forest floor on the nose of this bottling from the team behind Rabble wines in Paso Robles. The palate offers golden-pear, tart lemon and lemongrass flavors.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This balanced wine has a touch of steeliness to contrast with the luscious yellow fruits. Acidity gives the wine a fresh aftertaste and promises further aging, certainly until early 2020.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a soft, smoothly textured wine. Its interest lies in the well-balanced interaction between the white fruit and the wood aging. Still a little young, the wine will be best from 2020.

name: Fallet Dart NV Les Hauts des Clos du Mont Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a succulent wine with ripe apple and citrus flavors. Touches of spice from wood aging are judicious broadening out the freshness of this attractive wine. Drink from 2020.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Bright and sharp, this is the first release from a new estate vineyard planted in 2014. A mix of apple, melon and papaya fruit shows a moderate amount of buttery toast from aging in one-quarter new French oak and (presumably) malolactic fermentation. It's well made, youthful and full of promise for added complexity in subsequent vintages.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Asian and Anjou pear aromas meet with Key lime, citrus and gardenia on the vibrant nose of this bottling. The palate is both tart and lush, with flavors of green guava and white flowers driving it along.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lightly wood aged, this wine from a single parcel is rich with spice as well as buttery white fruits. Ripeness is lifted by acidity that brings freshness to this textured, mineral wine. It is still developing and will be better from 2021.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The winemaking prowess of Steve Webber is on display here in this Chardonnay sourced from three small plots outside the winery's Dixons Creek Estate. Toast and savory notes are on display here in the form of salted nuts, seashells and white spice, along with citrus and stone fruit. Medium bodied, the texture is slippery and sensuous, with plenty more toast, salt and spice flavors. Subtle but rich and well balanced, this is a food-friendly bottling that shows a sense of place along with winemaking style.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fermented and aged in a 600 liter puncheon, this is a leesy, creamy wine with a balanced mix of lemon, lime, apple and peach fruits. It stays light and elegant through the palate, with a bit less concentration than the previous vintage.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This single-vineyard wine is concentrated, with layers of tropical fruits, texture and acidity. These come together in a rich wine full of balanced fruit and intense freshness. The wine should age further, so drink from 2021.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Clean aromas of Asian pear, ripe nectarine and salted butter show on the nose of this bottling. The wine lands on the palate with sea salt, broad peach and ripe orange flavors. The texture is tense and the flavors are lively if a bit riper.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: With some barrel aging, this ripe wine has a soft, lightly spicy texture as well as concentrated apple flavors. The mineral texture will soften over the next few months to bring out the roundness of the generous fruit. Drink from 2020.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The winery is now part of the Jackson Family group. It's 100% barrel fermented and still wound up tight, so decanting will be helpful. Crisp apple fruit, fresh as can be, is wrapped in accents of toasted hazelnut.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Hints of toastiness as well as ripe fruits give this wine both openness and a spicy texture. It is full, with good acidity to balance the rich apple and pear flavors. Drink from 2020.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine opens in hearty aromas of hazelnut, vanilla and oak, the palate defined in fleshy full-figured intensity. A tiny-production offering, it dances around flavors of caramel and Gravenstein apple.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A generous, full-bodied wine, this is full of tropical-fruit flavors. These are balanced by the textured acidity and mineral core that give freshness and a tight aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes (as are all the wines from this domaine), this wine comes from the village that produces quintessential Chardonnay It is crisp with bright apples that have a bright tang. This wine is balanced, fruity with a touch of minerality. Drink now.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wood-aged wine comes from a single vineyard that is wholly owned by the producer (hence Monopole in the name). It is a taut, crisp wine, with lemon acidity that is filled out with green plums and a mineral texture. It is ready to drink.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Leesy and textural, this lightly ripened Chardonnay mixes white radish, green apple and pear fruit flavors, with a peppery burst adding some zip in the mouth. It's proof that Oregon can not only produce outstanding Chardonnays at the higher price points, but also in the affordable, everyday range.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Thick and concentrated in rich flavors of pineapple and pear, this is from a section of the famous vineyard that is low yielding and intense. Sizable oak presents as toasted and supportive, leading to a nutty earthy finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Three wines were produced under the Oregon Solidarity label, using purchased grapes abandoned by a California vintner just as harvest was underway. This wine bursts with fresh apple, pear and peach aromas. Barrel fermentation has smoothed any rough edges and polished the flavors to a bright sheen.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Richly layered in tropical and stone fruit, this wine is fleshy and bright, flush with high-toned acidity and floral aromatics of apple blossom. The fruit-forward appeal of the wine is joined by secondary flavors of melon and peach that pack the finish.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Produced from the Aegerter domaine, this wine is creamy with yellow fruits but offers a crisp, textured edge. It has weight and a feeling of opulence. Drink from 2020.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite inviting, with creamy aromas of butterscotch, caramel, nectarine and golden apple. The palate is lush and broad in flavors of buttered apple, cotton candy and sea-salt caramel, finishing on a touch of buttercream.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Strong aromas of jasmine and honeysuckle meet with creamy white-peach and sweet sandalwood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate is classic California Chardonnay: oak, lemon and pineapple flavors riding solid acidity.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Plumeria and jasmine aromas make for a very floral entry to this bottling, yet there are also bright touches of Key lime pith and richer butterscotch. It's broad and creamy on the palate with poached pear and soft apple flavors.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: From Bien Nacido Vineyard, this bottling begins with aromas of kumquat and sliced lime as well as hints of toast, cashew and tightly grained oak. The palate is taut at first, then opens toward light Meyer lemon and soft butter flavors, with a touch of nuts toward the finish.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: The second vintage for Open Claim brings fresh, bright fruit flavors of apple and pear, with a delicate streak of pea vine. Aging 16 months in one-third new French oak barrels adds a lush, buttery character to the mouthfeel. Veteran Tony Rynders handles the winemaking here.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Salty peach and freshly zested lemon meet with a handful of roasted nuts on the nose of this bottling from Bien Nacido Vineyard. The palate is tightly wound and briskly clean yet also expressive with white-flower flavors of honeysuckle and gardenia.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Sharp aromas of golden pear, white peach, gardenia and toasty butterscotch show on the rich nose of this bottling, which hits the classic notes but in a judicious style. Oak leads the mouthfilling sip into flavors of baked lemon cake and caramel.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This opulent, obviously wood-aged wine is too young. Its juicy acidity and crisp texture are balanced by dense white-fruit flavors and tight mineral texture. This is a wine to age, so drink from 2021

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Ripe Asian pear, honeysuckle, white peach and sea salt aromas all arise on the nose of this bottling from the heart of the region. The palate blends peachy flavors with elegant white-flower touches of gardenia and plumeria.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Yarra Valley Chardonnay at its finest, this bright and balanced wine offers delicate notes of stone fruit, citrus, buttered toast and a touch of smoke. It's really all about the mouthfeel though, which balances creaminess with lifted acidity, juicy fruit and whispers of toasty oak. Power and poise all in one. Drink now through 2026.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: A poised and stylish wine, this has a fine balance between the youthful mineral texture and ripe yellow fruits. Add into the mix the citrus acidity and nervy edge, and the wine has good potential. Drink from 2021.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Apricots and touches of mango come through this ripe, warm wine. It's light on the acidity perhaps, but packed with richness. As it ages, the generous wine will lose some of this exciting fruitiness and gain in maturity. But for now it is delicious and fruity.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Smoked white-peach, singed cherry-wood and seared pear-flesh aromas meet with a pinch of herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly woven, with fresh lime and green-pear flavors riding a chalky texture and finishing with kumquat tang.

name: Black Sheep Finds 2017 The Joy Fantastic Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Matchstick and flinty aromas rise from the glass of this rounded, rich and highly appealing wine. Melon, vanilla bean, hazelnut and a light spice of nutmeg characterize the flavors that highlight a medium-bodied frame of tense structure and grace.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A standout at Torii Mor, this barrel-fermented beauty is bright and toasty, with lush new oak flavors in abundance. Apple and cantaloupe fruit is swathed in buttery toasted cashews. There's a streak of marshmallow and a hint of sea salt. This wine just pounds you with flavor. Drink now into the early 2020s.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This wine is ripe with white fruits, with a touch of minerality. Hints of wood and light spice give both richness and structure, which are cut by citrus flavors that give a final lift. Drink from 2020.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This is a richly fruity wine, with apple, pear and kiwi flavors in abundance. It softens up on the midpalate, with a spicy cinnamon kick through the finish. The length, balance and big fruit flavors are impressive.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a fresh and tropical approach, with sharp mango and tuberose aromas showing strongly on the nose. The palate moves toward a more elegant display, combining that mango with clean and light guava jelly on toast flavors.

name: Bruno Paillard NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This particularly ripe wine has delicious apricot flavors that are balanced by rich acidity. A tangy edge adds an attractive bite of freshness. The wine comes from a single vineyard and is likely to develop further. Wait until 2020 to drink.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This balanced wine is both ripe and crisp. It brings together the richness of the vintage with the mineral texture typical of Pouilly Fuissé. The result is a delicious, full wine that retains a taut aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: The first time the winery has made a Chardonnay, this delivers the goods. Precise, even steely, it's a wine with verve and cut, sporting flavors of lime, gooseberry and green apple, along with highlights of lemon verbena. It's rare to find such complexity in a Chardonnay with limited (or no) new oak. Drink now–2026.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: One of a group of premier crus at the north end of the village, this vineyard is planted in both color grapes. This Chardonnay is full, with some of the fatness of the vintage but more of the tense acidity that comes from a young wine. Wait to drink this wine with baked-apple flavors from 2021.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: From a project by Richard Luzy and François Macarez, this wine is full bodied while preserving a tense texture. The acidity and intense, juicy white-fruit flavors are just melded together, with the promise of further aging. Drink this wine from late 2020.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A good example of how Chardonnay can work in Paso Robles, this bottling from a high-elevation site is fresh, bright and tightly woven on the nose, with aromas of ash, mandarin, lemongrass and spring flowers. The palate is quite racy, with acid-driven flavors of lemon and lime rind as well as fresh grapefruit flesh.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Ripe and opulent but with a crisp edge, this wine is both rich and structured. It comes from a single vineyard, giving a wine that has concentration as well as fresh flavors of citrus and ripe pears. Drink the wine from 2022.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Aromas of cinnamon, cream, lees, clove and spice draw you into the glass. The palate is creamy in feel, with well-balanced fruit flavors that show a deft touch.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Still young, this wood-aged wine is showing toasty flavors while hinting at the fruit potential. The ripe apple and bright acidity will be balanced by the rich texture, the minerality and the tangy aftertaste. Wait until 2022.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Toasty oak, Meyer lemon peel and seared citrus flesh show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is solid tension to the sip, where lemon spray and more oak tones arise atop the fairly strong acid profile.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: A collaboration between two childhood friends, this generous wine is full of ripe flavors, with a soft, open texture. A touch of minerality contrasts with rich yellow fruits. The wine will develop further, so drink from 2020.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Just to be confusing, there is a sector of Saint-Aubin called Gamay. In fact it is planted with Chardonnay and produces accessible wine like this. Dominated by wood aging at this stage, this wine is ripe with yellow fruits that are balanced by the intense acidity. It is still young but will be delicious. Drink from 2022.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Broad aromas of white peach, Meyer lemon preserves, oak and toast arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense with texture and acid, showing flavors of marmalade on toast, lemon zest, oak and peach.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Showing surprising richness for a wine at this low alcohol, it's almost oily (in a good way), with layered flavors. It opens with lime, banana and butter, adding toasted hazelnut and brioche as it weaves down through the palate. Fermented whole cluster with native yeast, it saw 55% new French oak.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: The village of Ladoix, some of the whose vines are in the Grand Cru of Corton, is somewhat unknown and therefore offers good value. This generous, ripe village wine is juicy with white fruits and wood aged.Its structure and balance with acidity are just right and it is ready to drink.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: A blend from over 40 parcels across the estate, this wine is generous and rich. A light touch of wood enhances the fruitiness and fresh acidity. Structured at the end, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The relatively cool Côte de Léchet vineyard has produced a ripe wine in this warm vintage. With apple and citrus flavors competing happily for dominance, this wine's potential is still being realized. Wait to drink until 2021.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A crisp, fruity wine with a strong mineral texture, this is full of creamed-apple and citrus fruits. Its nervy edge is balanced by the full-bodied nature of this ripe wine, steeliness versus ripeness. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A perennial powerhouse white, this delivers gorgeously constructed layers of rich pineapple, guava and mango, complemented by vanilla and baking spice from the oak. A steely midpalate shows bright acidity that lifts the concentration.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This blend of grapes from sites also featured as single-vineyard selections offers a close look at the winery's talent for this grape. Warm, buttery flavors abound, a pleasing sense of baked apple tart with a firm base of citrus. It's well balanced and finishes with a mineral freshness.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This wine has opulence as well as a fresher side. Its fruitiness displays an exotic character as well as fresher, citrus aspects. With its structure and minerality, the wine needs time. Drink from 2022.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: A classic, ripe wood-aged wine, this is balanced between the toastiness and rich yellow fruits. A touch of minerality will enhance the texture as the wine matures. Packed with fruit, it will be ready from 2021.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This little sister to the Mount Eden wines needs a bit of time to breathe through its reductive phase upon opening, allowing the flinty oak-kissed aromas of yogurt and dried lemon peel to emerge. There is tremendous tension to the palate, with lime pith and walnut flavors riding a damp oak element into the finish.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This wine seems to always overdeliver. Here it opens with lovely aromas of white flower, bee pollen and lemon meringue. The plush fruit mingles Key lime and pineapple, showing brisk acidity compiled with refreshing minerality.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Chief winemaker Virginia Willcock and her team once again deliver the goods with this beautifully balanced and multifaceted Chardonnay. More immediately approachable and showing less oak than the Heytesbury, it offers a noseful of lemon balm and orange rind and brioche with salted nuts and a little smokiness at the rear. The palate is creamy yet chalky with the toasty, nutty and citrus characters shining through, finishing long and savory. This could cellar for another five to seven years but good luck waiting that long.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Expansive tones of tangerine and green apple are balanced by bright acidity and stone-like minerality on the palate. The tannins are well integrated and supportive, as is the integrated oak, making this a well-balanced offering.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe wine offers great fruit that mingles with the wood flavors. Acidity and yellow fruits emphasize the spice further. The wine is likely to develop relatively quickly and be ready from 2021.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The touch of wood aging has released the ripe, creamy texture and rich structure of this full-bodied wine. It is intense and mineral, with delicious potential and good acidity at the end. Drink this wine from 2021.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fermentation in new wood has given this small-production, single-vineyard wine extra richness. Lightly smoky, the wine is ripe, with white fruits balanced by juicy acidity. It will be better from 2020.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This vintage of Heytesbury is precise if a little austere. Right now it needs plenty of swirling in glass to open up, but when it does it hints at great things to come. In the shadows lie classic Margaret River Chard notes like melon and stone fruit, oyster shell, salted nuts and plenty of toasty spicy oak. The palate is incredibly focused and beautifully textural, with bright crunchy acidity. Leave this be for another year or so and watch it slowly begin to blossom. Drink 2020–2029.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is supersmooth from start to finish, having been barrel-fermented in one-quarter new French oak. Roughly two-thirds underwent malolactic fermentation, leaving enough acidity to complement the peach and melon flavors with a burst of lime and bright apple. The lingering finish adds toasted hazelnuts and a pat of butter. Drink 2020–2026.

name: Olivier Leflaive 2015 Les Pucelles Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: This ripe, wood-aged wine comes from the largest of the white Grand Cru vineyards. It has the weight and richness typical of this vineyard with its powerful spice, yellow fruits and concentrated young acidity. The wine has great potential and will age well. Drink from 2023.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This barrel-fermented, reserve-barrel selection is annually among Oregon's finest Chardonnays. Richly endowed with ripe fruit, it marries apples and tree fruits to flavors of lightly salted butter, toasted nuts and wet stone.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Headed by Mathieu Paquet, this family firm has holdings in its home village of Solutré-Pouilly. This wine with its full, generous texture and opulent yellow-fruit flavors comes from a single vineyard. It is full, beautifully ripe and now just ready to drink.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A blend from six vineyards located across the appellation, this bottling offers aromas of dried pears, mango and damp oak on the nose. There's a racy line of acidity on the palate, where dollops of creamy oak and baked apple are splashed by tangerine-powered acidity.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Fully ripened, rich and detailed, this silky wine fairly glistens with buttery apple, white peach, melon and kiwi. Further details of lemon and grapefruit bolster the fresh mouthfeel, with a beautifully layered finish that lingers as long as you let it.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The concentration and viscosity are exceptional, lending this young wine a sense of vitality. Fresh flavors of apple and citrus add notes of butter and spice. It was barrel fermented with wild yeasts and finished in stainless tanks.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This indulgent, full-bodied wine goes all out on richness. Aromas of malted milk, vanilla and cream lead to layered hazelnut, crème brûlée and poached pear flavors, while the viscous texture carries through for a lingering finish.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Tight minerality marks out this young wine. Ripe white fruit, crisp acidity and generous texture are all there, developing slowly. The wine's juicy, spicy aftertaste offers great potential. Drink from 2021.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A concentrated wine from a small section of the Pouilly Fuissé appellation, this has beautiful, ripe yellow fruits. With a good balance between these fruits and the typical mineral structure, the wine is still evolving. The juicy fruit and spice from wood aging add complexity. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe wine has a rounded character cut by acidity and a touch of minerality. Its generous character is enhanced by the full yellow fruits and touches of spice. Drink the wine from 2022.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend of Clos Pepe, Bentrock, La Rinconada and Kessler-Haak vineyards begins with aromas of brioche, nectarine-mango jam and toasty oak on the nose. The palate offers an intriguing mix of honeydew, oak, toast and buttered peach flavors, making for a clean and compelling sip.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Structured and tense, this mineral-textured wine needs plenty of time before it is ready. The crisp texture promises perfumed acidity and plenty of freshness that should last for several years. Drink from 2022.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is the first vintage from a vineyard purchased by Louis Jadot. Its structure and touches of wood give it richness while never losing the fresh apple flavors and mineral texture. Drink from 2022.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This softly textured wine has the potential for great richness. Toast from wood aging is still present although apple and citrus flavors come through as well. Reticent now, this wine will age well into a densely textured, ripe wine. Drink from 2021.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of a series of single-vineyard wines from this estate, this comes from a three-acre vineyard with limestone soil. Its mineral edge and white-stone-fruit acidity are bursting with energy and the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2021.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tight aromas of light pineapple, Meyer lemon and waxy paraffin get the slightest hint of smoke on the nose of this blend from four renowned vineyards. The palate is framed by strong acidity and chalky tension that underlies the grapefruit and lemon flavors, which are brushed with a delicate stroke of butter.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Attractive wood aromas give this wine richness as well as a spicy, toasty character. These chime well with the warm baked-apple and citrus flavors of the ripe fruit. The wine is delicious now but will be better from 2020.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This bottling from a property atop the Santa Cruz Mountains shows complex aromas of warmed cream and toasted hazelnuts, with a strong lemon twist. The palate picks up a firm tension and offers flavors of crisp lemon wedge and broader nectarine in the midpalate.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine has swathes of ripe apricots and citrus, giving richness and a fresh edge. Its structure and minerality suggest aging potential. Drink from 2022.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Just up the slope from the village of Chassagne-Montrachet, this vineyard produces cool wines. This bottling offers freshness and crispness. Textured apple and citrus flavors hint at the toast of the wood aging. It needs time so wait until 2023.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This wine offers delicate aromas of roasted pear, oak and butterscotch. The palate is round and plush, with white peach, sea salt and pastry flavors, cut by a stony minerality.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Full aromas of marshmallow, white peach and buttercream are billowing on the nose of this bottling. Creamy, ripe and rich flavors of white peach, cherimoya and oak consume the palate.

name: Bruno Paillard NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This rich wine comes from a three-acre vineyard owned by the Paquet family. It has hints of tropicality as well as fresh green-stone fruits. Minerality and a tight structure suggest this wine is still young, so drink from 2020.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Produced from a small parcel of purchased grapes, this wine is poised between richness and good acidity. Its crisp texture is to the fore, backed up by an opulent layer of pear and apple flavors. At the end, it offers a tang of acidity and zesty lemon. Drink the wine from 2021.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: The vineyard is at the northern end of Santenay next to Chassagne-Montrachet. That perhaps explains the concentrated minerality of this wine with its almost steely texture. Allow time for the spice and apple and crisp lemon flavors to come out. Drink this structured wine from 2022.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Still quite young and tight, there's a well-integrated herbal component suggesting fennel and white pepper, along with more delicate fruit flavors of cucumber, apple and white peach. The elegant complexity and layering reward your attention, and another year or two of bottle age is recommended before drinking.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From one of the cooler premier cru vineyards on the south bank of the Serein river, this wine has a crisp, tight character that is softened by hints of tropical flavors. The fruitiness is perhaps too much up front and needs time to soften and integrate. Drink this full wine from 2021.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This new negociant house run by winemaker Louis Vallet has purchased this small parcel in Meursault. The wine is rich but tightly controlled, with acidity and strong minerality as well as citrus fruits. It needs time and will be best from 2022.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Replacing the much-loved Willamette Valley bottling from years gone by, this is produced, notes the winery, from the same vineyards and barrels, with a price drop as a bonus. Scents and flavors of Meyer lemon, ripe pear and toasted coconut carry through a finish with splendid balance and innate tension.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Luscious is the best word for this gorgeous wine. It's loaded with tart and tangy tree fruits. Silky in the mouth, it brings in highlights of lemon curd and sage, and exits with a kiss of toast.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This wine's texture is what shines at this young stage. Minerality, taut acidity and tight tannins are all there, mingling with the sweep of white fruits. With all these elements, this wine will develop well. Drink from 2023.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This fruity wine also has spice and toastiness from wood aging. It comes from one of the best known of the Chassagne premier crus, one that produces structured as well as fruity wines. With its mineral edge and texture, the wine will likely age well. Drink from 2021.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: In this vintage, the Etoile seems pushed to the limits of ripeness, not that that is a criticism. Exceptionally deep yet still juicy flavors of citrus, peach and melon are framed with toasty new oak. This wine may be best enjoyed over the next few years.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is rich, with white and yellow fruits giving power and density as well as elegance. The wine's normal minerality is muted in this vintage, pushing forward the ripeness and the generous texture. It will age well, ready to drink from 2023.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: From a vineyard high up the slope, this wine has great minerality. Its acidity and crisp texture are delicious, bringing in some apple and citrus flavors. Drink this wine from 2022.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: North Valley is the blended, midpriced tier of the Soter portfolio, and it overdelivers in every way. This is a bright, spicy Chardonnay, with a jumble of pear and melon fruit highlighted with white flower aromas. The wine gains weight through the midpalate, with just a hint of barrel flavor from 6% new French oak.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Textured and full of minerality this tight, nervy wine will need plenty of time. It has great fruitiness but the texture is just as important. Drink this rich, structured wine from 2023.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling blends savory depth with floral lightness, combining sandalwood, seared Meyer lemon peels, butterscotch, hot sandstone and flashes of honeysuckle on the nose. Sea salt and nectarine lead toward marshmallow and wood in the finish, wrapped in a structure that's firm but seamless.

name: Louis Jadot 2012 Les Demoiselles  (Chevalier-Montrachet)
description: Toasty aromas proclaim a young wine. Richness and ripe yellow fruits are balanced by the toast and freshness that shines through this concentrated wine. Its future is assured and it should not be drunk before 2023.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: From a newly purchased vineyard, this wine is taut and textured while also having intense fruits. Acidity and freshness are balanced by hints of apricot and pineapple. The whole is held together by the mineral texture of a wine that needs to age. Drink from 2023.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: From 40-year-old vines of Bien Nacido Vineyard, this bottling offers ashy Brie rind aromas alongside lemon pith and light guava peel. Compelling tension on the palate frames the tangerine pith and Key lime flavors, which warm toward buttermilk and flint toward the finish.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Aged in wood for 16 months, this ripe, lightly spicy wine is now becoming delicious. With its balance, combining creaminess with bright green and white stone fruit, the wine is also finely textured. It has a great future and should be ready from 2022.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This is a tart, tasty, tightly wound wine, with concentrated, long, filigreed flavors of tree fruits, toast and buttered nuts. The balancing acidity brings grapefruit highlights, but the wine has the tension of a steel spring and begs for further cellaring. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This Meursault-based estate also has vines surrounding the old abbey of Chassagne-Montrachet. The wine shows structure and a zesty, mineral texture that dominates at this stage. It needs time to soften and fill out into a wine that has density as well as wonderful fruitiness. Drink from 2023.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: From a site in the heart of the appellation farmed by the Martinelli family, this wine is sparkling in acidity and crisp well-defined flavors of lemon rind and green apple. It explodes in apple blossom and jasmine aromas, with lovely balanced richness and body weight, the oak lending a layering of baking spice.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Pristine and pillowy aromas of white peach, sea salt and creamy white fruits show on the inviting nose of this bottling by Bibiana González Rave. Ripe nectarine and apricot flavors are seasoned with more sea salt on the clean umami-rich palate, which finishes with a hint of ash.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a stand-out single-vineyard Chardonnay from this producer that's packed with tones of spicy tree fruits, almond paste, butter and toasted nuts. The flavors are seamless and lingering, with a lively finish that suggests it will age gracefully for up to a decade. Drink through 2029.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This stunning wine impresses vintage to vintage and 2017 is no exception. Golden apple, pear and honey fig highlight a fleshy, sumptuous and lush texture of nuanced acidity and oak, the fruit estate grown above ocean fog. Spicy nutmeg, cardamon and a hint of ginger round out the complex fruit and structure.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is ripe, full of rich fruit and generous in its texture and fruitiness. White fruits and hints of tropicality go with the wood-aging spiciness. This young wine still has a great textured character that will soften. Drink from 2024.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: This smoky, wood-aged wine comes from a walled vineyard next to the Château de Fuissé. Produced from old vines, it has concentrated apple and pear flavors, a touch of spice as well as bright acidity. The generous, opulent character will allow it to age. Drink from 2022.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: From the producer's estate property for the third vintage release, this wine possesses a beautiful layering of minerality and expressive fruit characteristics of lemon verbena and pear. Complex and elegant, it is powerfully built and silky smooth, with quietly integrated oak and a ginger-like spiciness to the finish.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is opulent while also structured. Rich fruits are balanced by the tight texture and power of the delicious white fruits. The wine offers long-term aging as the fruits and the texture come together. Drink this wine from 2024.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: The second vintage of this vineyard-designate is a standout: beautifully crafted to reflect its meticulously farmed fruit and master winemaking. Brioche, honeyed apple, anise and pear wrap around crisp acidity and integrated oak, the wine's innate power balanced within an elegant framework of structure and graceful texture.

name: Cave de Lugny 2017 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)
description: Buttered popcorn and creamed corn form the nose of this light-gold wine, with touches of waxy melon to support. The palate is flat and round, with no noticeable acidity.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: There is a clean aroma of Asian pear, saline and red apple, and with time in the glass the apple aroma turns baked. Acidity is bright on the palate and starts with flavors of Honeycrisp apple and fresh lemon, however it quickly turns bitter rushing towards a tugging finish and notes of lemon oil and Swiss chard.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: This full-bodied and thick-textured wine comes off as cloying. It has an unusually deep, brassy color. A flood of caramel, vanilla and toast clog the aromas and practically smother the slim fruit flavors underneath.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: An effusive nose reveals ripe satsuma, apricot and peach on a bed of marigolds. The light palate fails to match the intensity of the aroma and is surprisingly feeble in flavors of lemon, grapefruit pith and watercress. The lemon-peel and pepper finish is astringent and spicy.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Light aromas of yellow apple and melon lead to medium-bodied flavors. A bitter note distracts.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Ripe apricot, melon and white grape aromas carry the nose. This is creamy and full in feel, with very ripe fruit on the palate that ends on a savory note.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows an off-beat blend of savory, buttery aromas and buttery but also herbal flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Bread aromas are followed by browned apple flavors and medium body. The wine is sparse on fruit and falls a bit flat.

name: Dark Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Notes of mealy melon, green fig and white peach form the low-intensity nose of this white. The palate is light and slightly sharp, with brisk acidity and flavors of lime and grapefruit. The finish is all tart fruit and lime-like acidity.

name: Dark Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine starts off extremely shy and reserved, with just the faintest hints of white-apple flesh and lemon pith. The palate is zippy and spritzy in prickly acidity and more citrus-dominant flavors that extend to the bright, mouthwatering close.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: This hot-vintage Chardonnay is gold in color and loaded with smoky oak that sits atop an oily nose. On the palate, this is full on first impression but lacking in depth, complexity and secondary notes. Salty, buttery flavors of popcorn, raw oak and baked apple finish with heat and burn.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: Aromas of papaya and passion fruit mingle with wild flowers and lime on the nose. Mellow acidity presents a soft palate feel with flavors of fresh and baked Golden Delicious apples and pears. Some bitter elements and white pepper enter on the tugging finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Mild citrus and tropical aromas are easy but enjoyable. The palate feels full and creamy, but not flabby or soft. Vanilla and melon flavors are lasting and friendly across the finish.

name: Marcel Couturier 2016 Le Clos Reyssié  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
description: This wine from hot vintage smells briny on the nose and quiet on the fruit. The palate is oily in feel, with citric acidity and a slated melon flavor.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Light notes of yellow flower, cantaloupe and red apple form the dainty nose of this white. Somewhat flat on the midpalate, it shows low acidity and round flavors of pear, melon and apple that fade fast on the close.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Straw colored in the glass with aromas of stone fruits, apple and pear, this Chardonnay hails from Romania. It has flavors of lemon and peach and a crisp finish.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Dried pineapple and pear aromas meet with apple juice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit flat with dried mango and more apple-juice flavors.

name: Masia de la Vinya 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aged in French oak for eight months, the nose layers aromas of croissant, creamed butter, cashew, crouton and honey. Sharp tangy lime takes over the palate bullying any other flavors into oblivion, ending on grapefruit pith and peanut skins.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This single-vineyard selection is from a Golden Mile Bench site that purports to have the region's oldest Chardonnay vines, planted in the early 1970s. Some 43% was put through a wild ferment, and all the wine spent 16 months in French oak, half of it new. It's a creamy, lush style, with butter cookie goodness around ripe fruit flavors of melon and pear tart.

name: Gosset 2012 Grand Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: The producer, based in Aÿ, has created a fresh, young and mineral-driven wine. Its crispness and white-apple flavors contrast with the tight acidity that will soften shortly. Drink this balanced bottling from late 2019.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From a vineyard on Westside Road this is a rich and complex white wine meant to highlight a strong, stony element of mineral-laden acidity. Juicy, with length and breadth, it has flavors of baked lemon and hazelnut spiced in nutmeg—a successful contrast between citrus and tropical character.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Fermented in two large casks, one new and the other used once, this aromatic wine intrigues with tones of seashell, flint, grass and citrus. It opens into a textured, complex palate that brings in flavors of Meyer lemon and orange, with hints of jicama and white pepper. Drink now–2028.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From one of the cooler locations on the producer's Green Valley estate planted to three different clones of the variety, this wine opens with aromas of white blossom and hazelnut. The light-bodied, balanced palate contributes focused, lifted acidity around layers of mango, pear and toasted oak flavors.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This is a confectionery white wine that's moderate in acidity and fleshy and full in tropical layers of pineapple and mango. For fans of a bigger richer style with supportive oak, it works.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Full bodied and fleshy in style, this offers soft integrated oak around melded layers of anise, apple and melon. It finishes with a lingering richness of mango and guava.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: Forced oak and nonexpressive fruit aromas set the stage for a soft palate with low acidity. After that, this tastes woody while feeling more flat than lively. Put this on a scale and it will tip straight toward fat.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a remarkably balanced white that is steely in nature, with bright aromas of tangerine, grapefruit and Meyer lemon. These tones follow through on the palate, alongside a fleshy texture and mineral stoniness that refreshes and lingers.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This limited-production wine comes from the Chardonnay heartland of the Côte des Blancs. It is taut and mineral driven, with crisp sliced-apple and intense citrus acidity. Still very textured, this bottling will probably be better from late 2019.

name: Klepka-Sausse 2012 Mille Or Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine full of mineral textures is just coming into its own. It is principally about citrus fruitiness, with a chalk texture and crisp, perfumed aftertaste. Let this wine age a little further and drink from 2020.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Faint notes of lemon peel, bitter melon rind and a touch of straw dance lightly on the nose of this wine. The palate is similarly light and bright, with soft wood spice and toasted-apple flavors, as well as a good dose of orange oil. There's a hint of green apple and plum flavor as well, lending lift and verve to the palate and medium-length finish.

name: Antoine Olivier 2016 Le Bievaux l'Air de Rien  (Santenay)
description: In this wine, a rich confectionery nose is met by a tart, acidic palate of anise, lemon and gritty tannin.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: With this wine, the Dutron family delivered a rich example of ripe yellow fruit flavors, generous tannins and hints of spice from wood aging. Its juicy character and ripeness are full-bodied and still have aging potential. Drink from 2020.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Oak is the main character on this viable Chardonnay, from aromas of almond skin and butter to a resiny palate with shy pineapple flavors coated with hard spice notes.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: There is a compelling and unique freshness to this bottling, one of the first for this new estate. Very light in the glass, this shows aromas of lime blossom, green mango, citrus candy and crushed white rocks on the nose. The palate is very expressive and yet laser sharp, offering flavors of Asian pear and key lime pie.

name: Fallet Dart NV Les Hauts des Clos du Mont Brut  (Champagne)
description: Wood aging gives this wine extra richness and dense texture. It adds spice to the ripe white fruits and acidity to produce a mouthwatering wine that will age further. Drink from 2021.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: As a partner to the winery's Cayuga Lake Chardonnay, this wine is sourced from two vineyards on Seneca Lake: Rock Steam Vineyard on the west side of the lake and Sawmill Creek Vineyard on the east. It sees time in large-format barrels which impart subtle spice tones, with citrus and melon shining through. The palate is rounded yet balanced by well-honed acidity and soft white-tea tannins.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very young and still showing liquorous scents and flavors from eight months in 30% new oak, this offers medium-bodied fruit flavors of apple, peach and pear. There's a palate-pleasing toasty frame that should integrate well once the wine has had a bit more time in bottle. Drink from 2020 on.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Full bodied and fruity, this lemon and pear-flavored wine is ripe and ready to drink. A touch of minerality gives bite and crispness to the texture, balancing the wine's refreshing nature. Drink now.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Smooth and buttery all the way through, this full-bodied wine starts with a butterscotch aroma. Additions of caramel and baked apple flavors contribute to the soft, creamy texture.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Dark in color, this is a full-bodied, firm and deeply flavored white that makes good use of oak, offering a touch of butter and brioche. Apple and peach richness add to the whole.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Aromas of brioche, spring flower and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. Fresh and refined, the palate delivers lemon zest, yellow pear and a hint of acacia honey alongside bright acidity and a soft mousse. It closes on a bitter walnut note.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: This tightly wound wine is reasonably ripe and smooth, light bodied, and gives an uncomplicated serving of apple and lemon flavors on a crisp nervy texture. It shows little oak influence, but subtle fruit, mineral and savory accents should develop nicely with time. Best after 2023.

name: Forget-Brimont NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Premier Cru  (Champagne)
description: This is a single barrel selection, offering bright lemon fruit and a wash of barrel toast. There's ample acidity to complete the overall balance, and it's drinking well at the moment, though not likely to improve further.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: The heady perfume of oak dominates in the nose of this wine, made in a voluptuous, rich and full-bodied style. Apple, pear and melon dance around a core of well-integrated body and texture, which finds balance within the density and concentration.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: All polished and elegant, this medium-bodied barrel-fermented wine offers vanilla and butter aromas, subtle apple and baked apple flavors and a smooth texture. It has an abundance of the baking-spice character that a lot of people love in their Chardonnay.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is a bold and full-bodied wine from the toasted oak aromas to the ripe pear and almond flavors to a rich and mouthcoating texture. Barrel fermented and aged on the lees, it has good depth and concentration, solid structure of acidity and body and a lingering finish.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Aromas of peach oil and honeysuckle extract make for a very sharp and pungent nose on this bottling. There are sandalwood and oak tones to the palate, with a fresh lemony citrus streak throughout.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This bold white delivers a perfumed jasmine tone on the nose and palate. A mix of ginger, nutmeg and apple add to the flavors, lifted by steely, vibrant acidity.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: A quality vineyard and the confident touch of winemaker Terry Brandborg make this unoaked wine substantial enough to stand on its fruit alone. Steely and focused flavors of apple and white peach, with a touch of lemon rind, keep the wine balanced and lingering. Details of sea breeze and oyster shell add a saline note to the finish.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is crisp, mineral and taut. Fresh green fruits and buttery ripeness come together well to produce a balanced, succulent wine that will be ready to drink from late 2019.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Barrel fermented and aged in 15% new French oak for 17 months, this is a fine-tuned wine that deftly balances intense tree fruits with citrusy acids. One-third of the blend was sourced from the first crop of a new estate planting.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Nutty aromas of cashew meet with seared lemon peel and wet chalk on the nose of this bottling. There is good grip to the sip, where sharp flavors of grapefruit peel are set against warmer tones of almond.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This has a floral opening of apple blossom that delves into stone fruit and a touch of tropical flavor on the palate. Lemon, lime and apple mingle along a linear expression of full-bodied intensity that presents as voluptuously lush and fleshy.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This is a relatively large production and a well-priced wine that shows creamy, lush layers of baked apple and pear. Voluptuous in style, it provides a backbone of balanced acidity.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Made by Larry Cherubino, a well-known name in the Western Australian wine circuit, this medium-bodied Chardonnay shows the same restraint and food friendliness of previous vintages. The toasty, vanillin oak is prominent but there are plenty of lemon, melon and orange peel tones to back it up. Crisp acidity lifts the citrus fruit and provides a counterpoint to the creamy texture and toasty oak. Drink now–2026.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Hearty in honey, peach and mango, this white is made in a fuller, more approachable style sure to please, with well-integrated oak and a succulent midpalate. It finishes with as much graceful richness as it starts, ending with a note of crème brûlée and ginger.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This wine is very sharp overall, starting with a tight nose of Gravenstein apple, grapefruit peel, citrus spray and slightly warmer hints of plumeria and toast. The palate rides the citrus-peel line from lemon to grapefruit, proving very racy with acidity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dark in color with an intensity to its use of oak and up-front acidity, this shows a mix of caramel, vanilla and honeycomb, with a lasting note of butter and earth.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is the producer's cooler-climate offering of the variety—a steely, classically structured wine that has crisp well-defined apple, melon and pear.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Light and bright aromas of lemon peel, Anjou pear and damp oak show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is a tangy grip to the sip, where soft wood flavors meet with citrus flavors and are framed by a taut structure.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Dried lemon peels, white peach and crushed hazelnuts make for a pretty ripe nose on this bottling. There is a compelling grip to the sip, which clings to the palate with flavors of ripe lemon, tart apple and a light marzipan touch on the finish.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Earthy, floral and steely in style, this offers plenty of lithe, buoyant acidity and citrus-driven fruit to keep it fresh and nervy in the glass. Smoothly textured and high toned in nature, it shows the diversity of the great vineyard site.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This ripe wine is full of rich, concentrated yellow fruits. It comes from some of the rare parcels of Chardonnay in the Beaune vineyards. A dense wine, it is ready to drink.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: From a Coombsville-area vineyard, this is an elegant, firmly textured and structured white, floral in apple blossom and pear. The flavors follow suit, showing an integrated full-bodied approach that is both balanced and substantial.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Dried lemons, poached apple, buttered toast and sandalwood converge for a classic yet expertly restrained nose on this bottling from a historic vineyard. The palate is crisp, fresh, ripe and savory all at once, presenting flavors of Asian pear, nectarine and Rainier cherry.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is a well-made, well-integrated showcase of the appellation, with crisp flavors of apple, ginger and Asian pear. Hearty in texture and style, it has a lasting bite of anise on the full-bodied finish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Seared nectarine, sea salt and white melon make for a broad, clean and welcoming aromatic entry to this bottling. The sip is very cohesive, showing toast with white-peach jam, lemon rinds and more sea salt, which makes sense given the vineyard's proximity to the coastline.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Anise, earth, white flower and honey combine on the nose and palate of this tightly structured white from a cooler section of the appellation. Gravenstein apple flavors present as lush and plush, cradled in toasted oak, yet there's an acid backbone that's undeniably fresh.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Pleasantly strong aromas of chalk meet with lemon blossom on the impressively delicate nose of this appellation blend from the Pisoni family. There is great tension to the sip, where a chalky grip surrounds flavors of white peach, pineapple and light oak.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: While this vineyard is mainly planted to Pinot Noir, it has a small section of Chardonnay. This wine is crisp, tight and textured, packed with white-fruit flavors and bright acidity that suggest aging potential for a few years. The wine should be best from 2021.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is a nicely made wine, its oak barrel-influence up front yet subdued. Caramel, lemon curd and graham cracker are complemented by mineral components of stone and sea air in addition to an impressive lift of tangerine. The quenching acidity doesn't prevent the texture from feeling lush but all is ultimately balanced and bright.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This full-bodied barrel-fermented wine is bold in flavor, rich in texture and showing a plethora of complex and delicious oak and spice flavors. Nutmeg, toasted almond, baked pears and vanilla coat the palate and linger on the finish, while the luxurious texture is nicely balanced by moderate acidity.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Hazelnut, yeasty dough, lemon juice and honeysuckle aromas make for a very expansive nose on this reserve bottling from the Foley family. There's a hint of butter on the front of the palate, which widens to flavors of citrus, almond, toast and oak.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Honeysuckle and jasmine aromas invite one into this cool coastal wine, light bodied and tightly wound in tannin and well-integrated oak. The flavors assemble into shards of wet stone and oyster shell, with tart chasers of apricot and Meyer lemon.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Sandalwood, sea salt, singed lemon and creamy poached pome fruits show on the nose of this bottling. There is a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, where flavors of lemon juice and kumquat are framed in a chalky tension.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: South-facing toward the ocean and the coast of Marin, this white tastes of the sea, a mix of stone and salt with in a viscous complexion of tightly wound structure and grace. The fruit is subdued and well integrated, with a touch of white peach and lemon lingering on the palate.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: From part of the Gagey family domaine, this wine has a ripe structure that gives it a rich character as well as intense fruit. Its juicy citrus flavors are full of freshness, with a strong textured character that will allow the wine to age further. Drink from 2022.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: An expertly reserved streak of hazelnut and thinly sliced lemon rinds meet with a waft of butter on the delicately delicious nose of this bottling by the Pisoni family. The palate is wrapped in a chalky tension, allowing flavors of clay, Meyer lemon and light buttercream to take hold.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A warm butter aroma meets with lemon spray, citrus pith, wet gravel and crushed limestone on the nose of this bottling from a coveted single block in a historic vineyard. There is lots of tension on the palate, where restrained flavors of lime peel and Asian pear make for a tasty experience.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Buoyant aromas of lime blossom, grapefruit peel, honeydew and green-apple rinds make for a clean and crisp entry to the wine, which comes from a vineyard planted in 1971. The palate is vibrant and fresh, with racy flavors of lime pith and lemon soda.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Salt and oak tones are met by crunchy, creamy flavors of apple and pear in this well-structured, balanced and complex white. The oak and tannin are integrated and supportive, allowing the fruit and floral tones to shine.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: From three separate sites, Winemaker Donald Patz has crafted a wine with an effusive nose of caramel, oak, pear and honey. The full-bodied palate is balanced by firm tannins and heightened acidity. Overall, it's fresh and fleshy in equal measure.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: From one of the best known of the Chablis premier crus, this wine is pure fruit, crispness and structure. These come together in an harmonious whole, with white and citrus fruit flavors giving lift and freshness to the the taut texture. Drink this wine from 2022.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Textured and layered within a medium-bodied frame of elegant ripeness, and balanced in oak, this is a lovely combination of pear, apple and steely mineral components. The aromatics lean into white flower and anise—strong but not distracting.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Reduced in matchstick aromas that compel and blow off, this is a well-integrated white from a great site, the fruit and oak combining to great effect. Big flavors of anise and pear build around a concentration of full-bodied lushness and lasting texture.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Less than 50 cases of this wine were made, but it's worth seeking out. Notes of honey, graham cracker, Gravenstein apple and pear are tossed with anise, while a bright acid-driven backbone delivers structure and freshness.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This new small producer tapped Russell Bevan to make its wines—a wise choice in this bottling, which invites immediately with an unctuous nose of golden oak and brioche. The palate becomes complementarily steely and crisp in apple, wet stone and sea spray, finishing in complex balance and grace.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is classic Margaret River in all the best ways. While it starts off on the fruity, toasty, malolactic side—think ripe tropical fruit, lime and melon, toffee and buttered toast—it's really all about the palate, where there's a gorgeous tension between texture and tingly acidity. The fruit here feels fresher and tangier, and there's a wet stone minerality running throughout, adding complexity and purity. Drink now–2027.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Oregon Chardonnay is attracting global attention thanks to wines such as this. Supple and seductive, it opens with splashy flavors of chamomile, lychee, citrus zest and flesh. There's a whiff of lemongrass and just the right touch (15%) of new French oak.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy lime and grapefruit aromas cut through the prominent sense of oak on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely crisp, framed by laser-sharp acidity and tense tannins, offering flavors of lemon peel, kumquat and more citrus.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Honeysuckle and jasmine combine with fresh Asian pear and a squeeze of grapefruit on the fresh, clean and tight nose of this bottling from a low-yielding, dry-farmed vineyard. It's bright and zesty on the palate with loads of acid and chalky grip, showing flavors of freshly squeezed citrus and riper melon.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: A note of reduction settles into an opening of salt, oak and sea spray in this well-made wine from the famous, windswept site. Crushed rock and white flower present an earthy, mineral component that's nicely balanced against a midpalate of luscious pear and fig.

name: Cocchi 2014 TotoCorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A selection from top Dutron family vineyards in the village of Fuissé goes into this wine. Ripe with apricot and mango flavors that are rounded out with spice from wood aging, the wine is full without losing any crispness or ripe acidity. Drink this concentrated wine now.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: This powerfully concentrated white is engaging in floral and mineral tones, with a robust cradling of oak. There's tension on the palate, which is layered in flavors of tropical guava, mango and pineapple that are dusted with baking spice.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: The wood-aging flavors of this rich wine are prominent, giving extra richness and intensity to the concentration. The vineyard, on the site of an old abbey, has produced a wine that will age. Drink from 2023.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: The chalk soil of this premier cru vineyard gives this wine tight minerality and taut texture. Beneath this, the spicy flavors, rich white fruits and acidity will allow the wine to age many years. Drink from 2023.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This opens with a rich nose of brioche and honeysuckle while remaining simultaneously crisp and fresh on the palate in lemon, grapefruit and apple flavors. Well integrated and balanced within a light-bodied elegance, it shows quiet, nuanced power.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Floral and earthy, this head-turning white is textured, crisp and bright. Complex flavors of lemon pith, peach and anise combine with ease around a midpalate of graceful weight and harmony, while remaining balanced and fresh in the glass.

name: Pascal Clément 2016 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)
description: This tightly textured wine comes from the vineyard at the top of the Puligny-Montrachet slope, which has a stony chalk soil. Wood-aging flavors add richness to this wonderfully full-bodied wine. The final acidity and texture will allow it to age for many years. Drink from 2023.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This dense, wood-aged wine is packed with ripe yellow fruits. The full, rich nature of the wine shows the full-blown intensity of the great exposure of this grand cru vineyard. The wine's instant fruitiness belies its aging potential. Resist drinking now and wait until 2023.

name: Domaine Julie Belland 2014  Criots-Bâtard-Montrachet
