description: From vineyards owned by the inheritors of the Louis Jadot estate, this wine has all the power expected from this vineyard. Its density and richness are palpable, even when crispened by a fresh citrus edge. Wood aging adds spice and enhances the aging potential. Drink from 2024.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The latest vintage of Ryan Walsh's top tier Chardonnay is as joyous to drink as the previous one, although it feels less age-worthy and a little more rustic in style. Lemon hued and slightly cloudy, it offers up heady aromas of bruised apple, nougat, salted nut and oyster shell. The seaside vibes continue on the palate, where the tangy fruit and bright acidity harmonize with a slippery texture and ocean spray saltiness.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2012 Mesnillésime Vielles Vignes Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Rich and luscious while also structured, this wine is packed with ripe fruit and spice from wood aging. It comes from a walled vineyard, part of an estate managed by Louis Jadot. This wine has density along with a strong textured character that will allow it to age. Drink from 2023.

name: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay (Maipú)
description: This sketchy Chard smells more flowery than fruity. A wide palate is mushy, with no focal point. Strange flavors suggestive of lilies are uncommon.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A floral opening of anise and lavender evolves to a buttery middle before the wine becomes disjointed, rough and harsh on the palate.

name: Fork in the Road Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This wine has a sweet confectionery nose and harsh astringent acidity. Marshmallow and baked pineapple flavors become slightly herbal and green.

name: Wakefield 2017 Jaraman Clare Valley & Margaret River Chardonnay (Australia)
description: This estate-grown wine has a sharp nose of oak and petrol. Its palate is a bit harsh and sour.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Briny aromas include lemon and lemongrass. A melony palate is low on acidity, while this tastes vaguely of melon, nectarine and lettuce. A hollow finish hints at bitterness.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Chunky, full and without much spine or structure is how to best describe this wan Chardonnay. Tropical flavors of melon and papaya taste and finish short and warm.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Burly in oak and tannin, this is an approachable white with highlights of anise, lavender and baked pear that finishes with a touch of metal.

name: Ernest & Julio Gallo 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This offers aromas of barrel fermentation, rich and oak-laden in vanilla and spice. In flavor it has elements of graham cracker, honey and crème brûlée but alas, also a harshness to the finish.

name: Frank Family 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Dark gold in color with steely upfront acidity, there are sharp tones of apple and stone here.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Strong aromas of martini olives drip from the glass of this reserve-tier wine, which offers simplicity and approachability in spades. Pineapple and crème brûlée provide a seemingly sweet center.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Dry apple and mild oak aromas are reasonably good and typical of Chardonnay. This has a soft palate with middling acidity. A forced oaky character creates mild bitterness prior to a finish with pear notes and a touch of oxidation.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Inviting in stone fruit and marshmallow, this wine has a robust presence of oak and is creamy and lush in style, with a simplicity that pleases and delivers plenty of flavor.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Strong aromas of wet clay cover the hints of lemon and river water on the nose of this bottling. There is zingy texture to the palate but very weak flavors of squeezed lemon.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Squeezed lime, lemon verbena and exotic lemon peels show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is zesty with more citrus notes as well as a richer honeysuckle-laced sweetness.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: A majority of this wine was barrel-fermented in 40% new French oak and the barrel presence is real. Textured, oaky and subdued in fruit, this shows highlights of anise, lavender and vanilla, finishing in a steely brightness that surprises.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Tropical vanilla and peach rule the day in this high-toned full-bodied white. The oak is pronounced and robust, abiding over a fluffy texture of enduring creaminess and butter.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is fresh and easy, offering aromas of lime peel, gooseberry and grass. Flavors of citrus and grass meet with steely acidity on the palate, leading to a tart lime finish.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This simple white wine has a greenish character, suggesting less than optimal ripeness. Lime skin, grapefruit and bitter apple seed flavors come up, and though it was 100% barrel fermented, the wine lacks body and depth.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Bright gold with tart apple fruit and a touch of barrel toast, this engaging young wine shows its youth with a yeasty, almost beery finish. Give this another year of bottle age and it should begin to even itself out.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Named after the winery's vineyard dog, this oak-aged Chardonnay is rich in aromas of orange blossom, honey, Satsuma and a hint of butterscotch. Tangerine and candied orange-peel flavors meld with vanilla, sugar cookie and a touch of peanut brittle. An orange marmalade flavor adds concentration and structure to the palate.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of vanilla and white pepper lead the nose, with apricot and pear hovering in the wings. Light but creamy in feel, the palate brings mellow acidity and flavors of butter, vanilla, baking spice, and baked pear. Buttery, oaky tones fill out the finish, adding an accent of white pepper.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of peach cobbler, vanilla and crushed walnuts are dotted with an accent of lemon zest on the nose. The light-bodied palate offers bright acidity and flavors of baked pear, buttery pie crust, vanilla and baking spice. The finish lingers on a warm, spicy note layered with lemon curd.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: From two vineyards within the appellation, this is a well-made, well-priced offering of simplicity and nuanced acidity with a few sharp edges of citrus and green apple. The oak is measured and toasted.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This opens in a whiff of matchstick, lemon and pear, as it presents a medium-bodied approachability that will please. Stone fruit and green apple come into the fore as the palate opens, finishing in vanilla oak.

name: WillaKenzie Estate 2017 Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Robust in oak and lush, succulent ripe fruit, this is made in a rich, concentrated style that suggests vanilla cream and baked pineapple.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Aromas of vanilla and spice mingle with orange blossom on the nose of this subdued wine. Sweet baking spice and vanilla bean carry over to the palate, with fruit flavors of baked pear and peach lingering on the finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Out of the gate, the aromas of burnt toast, melted butter and candlewax come off as aggressive, settling a bit with time open. Lees and vanilla flavors follow. It will provide enjoyment for those looking for a rich, buttery style.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of green-apple flesh, key lime and an earthy, somewhat metallic minerality. The palate is crisp with key lime and pear-flesh flavors, dusted with sandy undertones.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Very light aromas of yellow apple, sandstone, honeysuckle and almond show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and grippy with grapefruit flavors that lean into sweeter fruits and also show a metallic edge.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of yellow spring flower, bread crust and yellow stone fruit lead the nose. On the vigorous palate, steely bubbles and bright acidity frame ripe golden apple, grapefruit and a hint of hazelnut.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Lemongrass and sharp citrus notes of lemon, lime and underripe orange power the nose of this bottling from Grava Vineyard. There is a solid sizzle of acidity and a compelling grip on the palate that deliver riper flavors of lemon cream.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Dark gold in color, the wine's flavors delve into rich, honeyed tones of baked apple, fig and mango, the use of oak substantial in style. There's a clean, short finish after plenty of full-bodied concentration and ripeness.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Tangy aromas of lemon juice, kumquat flesh and a slight nutty quality show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines a metallic minerality with hints of caramel, browned butter, lemon balm and a touch of marzipan.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: A darker shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling is very nutty with aromas of Marcona almonds, lemon peels and dried apple flesh. The palate is a more reductive style, with tangy Meyer lemon pith giving depth to the creamy dairy-laced core flavors.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Bright bristling acidity is stone-like in mineral on entry before building steam and power on the midpalate, which shows a richness of vanilla and oak. Pear and lavender flavors complete the light-bodied picture.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: A broad peach aroma is lifted by accents of seared lemon, browned butter and smoke on the nose of this bottling. Oak shows on the palate right away, but is pleasantly integrated into the lemon balm flavor.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Peach, blood orange and nutmeg mingle on the palate of this full-bodied, moderately oaky white, that gets better as it opens in the glass. A touch of nutmeg and ginger linger around a core of fresh acidity before finishing intensely.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: There's a ripe impression on the nose of this wine, with scents of mealy melon, guava, overripe orange rind, struck match, pomelo peel and lightly toasted yellow apple. The palate is medium in weight and slightly round in feel, with some tangy acidity that frames tart flavors of lemon and lime peel. The finish is pithy and citrusy, with a touch of bitter melon on the close as well.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Rich aromas of honey, cream and butter meet with Marcona almonds and chalk on the nose of this bottling. It's a straightforward Chardonnay on the palate, with flavors of toasted oak, roasted apple and lemon cream.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Chardonnay (California)
description: This is remarkably good juice at a ridiculously fair price—a wine that's simple and clean in approach with succulent highlights of peach and fig. The oak is measured, the spice components understated and the whole experience refreshingly quaffable.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Bright notes of tangerine and honeysuckle are sprinkled with white pepper on the nose. Juicy acidity with a little bit of tang carries flavors of ripe honeydew and clementine on the palate. A slightly tugging lemon juice and crushed mineral finish rounds out it this lovely Chardonnay.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dried flower aromas dominate the nose of this Chardonnay with hints of apricot emerging with air. The palate offers more fruit, with bright peach and green-apple acidity, while a touch of biscuit adds depth. Decently structured, the bubbles are a bit frothy. The lemon-juice-laced finish keeps this wine mouthwateringly juicy through to the end, which lingers on a peach note.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Aromas of toasted oak, bread crust and peanut follow over to the palate alongside a hint of candied citrus zest. A foaming perlage softens the bitter almond finish.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This is a solid deal for a wine of this quality, barrel-fermented in a mix of French and American oak. The fermentation doesn't detract from its steely core of integrated acidity and well-honed notions of pear and buttercream. The finish brings tones of nutmeg and vanilla.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Very light in the glass, this stainless steel expression is all about freshness and zip, with a tropical edge. Aromas of ripe red pear, honeydew and guava lead into a zingy palate full of key lime pie and guava peel flavors.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of ginger and Meyer lemon are demure on the nose of this Chardonnay. It has a chalky feel on the palate, with flavors that echo the nose. The acidity is powerful enough to stand up to the body without overpowering it.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Aromas of grapefruit, mature yellow apple and a whiff of spring flower form the nose. The fruity aromas carry over to the palate along with lightly foaming palate and a hint of thyme.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: There is a strong pastry kick to the nose of this bottling, starting with aromas of apple-cinnamon and marzipan. The palate is also plump and almost sweet with rich apple and croissant dough flavors, enhanced with a waft of smoke.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This comes from young, north-slope plantings situated over 1,200 feet in elevation—high by the state's standards. Aged in a mix of new and used oak along with stainless steel, the wine has aromas of clarified butter, wet stone and spice, followed by broad yet still sleek fruit flavors. The future is bright for this variety at this site.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Corn Pops, toasted yellow apple, creamed melon and soft peach form the decadent nose of this white. The well-balanced palate is surprisingly light and vibrant, with ample acidity to counter the ripe fruit tones and lingering notes of spiced orange and lightly toasted apple on the close.

name: Hess Collection 2017 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Aromas of walnut, bread crust, orange peel and honey carry over to the slightly lean palate along with mature apple and bread crust. Bright acidity and a polished perlage provide the backdrop.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aromas of white pepper and peach fuzz can be teased out of the restrained nose of this unoaked Chardonnay. Light bodied and juicy, it has surprisingly concentrated flavors of ripe melon, apple and lime juice. Lingering tones of ripe peach and white pepper mark the finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Chalk and wet stone aromas meet with light flint and citrus pith on the nose of this bottling. It's a very light and crisp style of Chardonnay, almost Chablis-esque, and then a stronger lemon and apple flavor streak arises.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Smoke, dried white peach, orange rind and pear flesh show on the nose of this bottling from one of the Jackson family's more coveted estates. The palate is all about classic California Chardonnay, with butter and fine-grained oak flavors balanced by bright lemon.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This unoaked wine is made entierly from estate-grown fruit. It offers green apple, green melon, kiwi and lime flavors that build to a pleasing midpalate. It hangs there before trailing off into a lightly grassy finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Generous aromas of pear, citrus and lees are followed by sleek but still creamy feeling, well-balanced fruit flavors that finish warm. There's a lot to like.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Toasty aromas of brioche topped with marmalade, white peach and an oaky hint of nuts show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is creamy with warmed butter and poached lemon flavors, and quite rich with oak overtones.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Chamomile, orange rind and toasted bread crust aromas shape the nose. On the elegant palate, a soft perlage accompanies mature yellow apple, white grapefruit and a hint of toasted almond.

name: Fallet Dart NV Les Hauts des Clos du Mont Brut  (Champagne)
description: A tiny-production wine meant to represent the vintage's best barrels, this is robust in body weight and oak, with an expansiveness on the palate that gives it a lush memorability. Green olive, crème brûlée and lemon meringue provide textured, complementary flavor.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: There's much to admire in this budget-priced wine, starting with its straightforward, no-fuss style. Lightly tropical fruit delivers a warm, full mouthfeel, and aging for nine months in 20% new oak puts a touch of toast in the finish. It feels genuine and avoids the usual tricks of the trade that plague many cheap Chardonnays.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Aromas of white spring flower, pastry dough and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. The foaming, polished palate offers creamy yellow apple, grapefruit and a hint of bitter almond alongside bright acidity.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: An early release of this variety aged entirely in stainless steel, this wine offers aromas of melon and baked apple. Well-balanced fruit flavors show on the palate, backed by a tart lick of acidity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a hearty, robustly styled wine, dark in color and profile. It shows flavors of burnt sugar, pineapple and toasted vanilla oak, rounding the concentrated leanings with a persistent thread of acidity that helps to refresh.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Tropical and floral, this wine is dark in color and steely on the palate, with a fleshy middle of ripe fullness and texture. Pineapple, guava and lime contribute robust fruit flavor.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Breezy aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a hint of pie crust shape the nose. On the foaming palate, a silky mousse and bright acidity provide finesse and freshness for creamy yellow apple and lemon zest.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Apple blossom, nectarine and refreshing aromas of lime soda show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard at the northern edge of the appellation. There is strong grip to the sip and lots of racy acidity, offering flavors of lemon peel and light toast.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This wine is nearly two-thirds Evergreen Vineyard fruit, aged in neutral oak. The balance comes from Sundance Vineyard, aged in stainless steel. The aromas offer notes of green apple, lemon, squash and the underside of a pineapple, along with a sense of chalky minerality. The palate is medium-plus bodied with kiwi and pineapple flavors. It's loaded with fruit, but also brings a fine sense of acidity and balance.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Gentle cream with the merest hint of vanilla announces a very subtle Chardonnay. The palate brims with creamy lemon, gentle texture and utter freshness. Lovely now, but it will be even better with a year or two of bottle age. Drink now through 2025.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Toasted brioche, orange cream, lemon cream and caramel converge on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tangy with lemon peels and grapefruit rinds, proving incredibly acid driven and zesty.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dark in color and thick and rich on the palate, this is a well-made, robustly concentrated wine that doesn't shirk in intensity. Coconut, vanilla and baked apple and pear highlight a palate of creamy texture.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Pineapple, apple and caramel mingle harmoniously in this nicely integrated white from this new producer. The oak is well behaved and supportive, allowing the fruit and subtle spice notes of nutmeg to shine through a long, soft finish.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Enticing scents of spring wildflower, white orchard fruit and pastry dough are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant sparkler. On the savory, elegant palate, a soft mousse and fresh acidity accompany ripe yellow apple, white grapefruit and a bread crust note. A hint of saline marks the close.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lush and rounded, this vineyard-designate tastes of crème brûlée and pineapple—bold flavors that hold up against supportively refreshing acidity. The oak is well integrated and helps to underline the wine's concentrated nature.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Bolstered by barrel scents and buttery malolactic flavors, this tasty wine artfully blends lime and peach fruit with a kiss of caramel. It was aged in 40% new oak, the rest a mix of once-used and neutral barrels.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Coming from a block planted in 1991, this wine was fermented and aged in stainless steel. The aromas offer notes of pear, cantaloupe and whole lemon, along with a chalky sense of minerality. The palate is full and textured, with a lovely mouthfeel and layering. It delivers.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Aromas of browned butter, poached apple, lemongrass and a pleasant metallic edge show on the nose of this bottling by one of the region's largest growers. The palate is clean and light in feel, with flavors of Asian pear, lemon zest and apple butter.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: From the producer's own estate in the now-designated Petaluma Gap appellation, this wine opens in a sweet floral nose and develops in the glass to show apple, vanilla and pear. Rounded and rich, it possesses a backbone of acidity that matches the medium-bodied grip.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tart pineapple and robust oak combine with ease in this medium-bodied, richly tropical and creamy wine. Teases of vanilla season the robust flavors, finishing in a balance of fresh acidity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A crisp, mineral-led wine, this is tight and tense. Apple fruits are cut with a squeeze of lemon, balancing the crispness and tautly structured aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Honeysuckle and lime-blossom aromas meet with honeydew melon rinds on the fresh nose of this twist-top bottling. There's a chalky frame to the sip, where tangerine and lemon-cake flavors dominate.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine has a buttery entry dipped in hazelnut and quince which evolves to show hight-toned acidity and steely style. Elegant in restrained ripeness, it delivers nuanced secondary flavors of apple and fig.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aromas of lemon peel, lime juice and white flowers meet with a touch of chalk on the nose of this bottling. It's grippy on the palate, with flavors of lemon blossom and ripe yellow apple.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine comes from young plantings at a vineyard that has made its mark with Rhône varieties. The aromas pop, drawing you into the glass with notes of candlewax, whole pineapple and spice. Ripe, full-bodied tropical fruit flavors follow. A fine sense of acidity frames it all perfectly.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: A broad, creamy expression of Chardonnay, this bottling shows lemon blossom, meringue and crème fraiche on the fresh nose. Toasty oak, lemon preserves on brioche and creamy white-peach flavors show on the rich yet balanced palate.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine succeeds in its bright aromas of flowers and vanilla. Full bodied, fleshy and complete, it offers layers of pineapple and guava flavors that will please a wide range of palates.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This might be enjoyed as a tribute to a new and important style of Oregon Chardonnay—leesy, textured, low in alcohol and rich in flavor. It was barrel fermented and aged 10 months in oak, none new, but presumably some once-used as there is a pleasant trailing note of caramel.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Fresh, creamy and full of white fruits, this wine is crisp and well balanced. The texture shows attractive tautness, with great swathes of acidity giving the wine a delicate, perfumed character. Drink this bottling now.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this elegant sparkler offers delicate but enticing scents of white spring flowers, orchard fruits, pie crust and a whiff of wild herbs. On the softly foaming palate, fresh acidity brightens creamy yellow apple, white peach and citrus notes before finishing on a thyme note.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Sourced from all estate-grown, low-yielding vines, this layered wine melds Meyer lemon, green apple and a touch of green melon fruit with light spices and ample acidity. Precision and power are in play here, the tension enhanced by aging in a mix of 55% concrete eggs, 25% stainless steel and 20% French oak barrels.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Made without oak, this wine has a steely midpalate etched in stone fruit and mango that offers plenty of mouthfeel and intensity from the fruit alone. It has length and balance and is immensely enjoyable.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Toasted brioche and lemon-apple foam aromas make for a very voluptuous yet restrained nose on this bottling. Seared lemon peel, oak smoke and roasted apple flavors complete the experience on the palate.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is a pretty, barrel-influenced white of memorable aromatics—a mix of orange and apple blossom that linger gingerly on the nose. Rich, with interwoven acidity, the wine is balanced in fruit flavors of honey-dipped apple and pear.

name: Gosset NV Brut Grand Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Beautifully mature while still tangy and mineral textured, this wine is taut and very textured. The white fruits are still there, balanced with the more toasty character that shows the wine's age. This is a real food wine, ready to drink now.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: The blend, from Estate, Freedom Hill and Durant grapes, is deeply fruited with a tart, tangy kick. Think apple fruit with a spine of steel, dense and sappy, and lingering on the palate. In common with all of Lange's Chardonnays, this actually seems to improve after being open for a full day.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Dark gold in color, this wine has a robust mouthfeel and a powerful, rich body complemented by sharp acidity. Green apple, honey and Asian pear meet layers of tropical fruit and white flowers dipped in a mineral tone.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Classically balanced Chardonnay aromas of toast with orange marmalade, poached white peach, warm butter and oak show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The fully flavored palate combines honeysuckle and plumeria with creamy peach, butter and oak, proving more soft and lush than crisp.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Poached nectarine, lime juice and lime zest make for an intriguing nose on this bottling, which combines core richness with edgy citrus tones. The palate is crisp and chalky in structure, with lime-laced cream flavors again lending to that rich and zesty balance.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This cuvée is sourced from the Dundee Hills estate vineyard. It's a pretty wine with pleasing flavors of apple, spice, toast and sandalwood. All Dijon clones, it's not quite as ripe as recent vintages, but nicely focused and balanced through the long finish.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: A toasted apple character leads the nose of this wine, with additional glimmers of orange peel, pie crust, peach pit and some stony minerality. The palate is medium in weight and well balanced, with ripe cedar-grilled apple, grilled pineapple and buttered popcorn flavors that mingle with subtle accents of beeswax and orange pith. It is ripe and lush yet well balanced, with ample acidity to keep the richness in check.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: The wines from Drouhin's Roserock vineyard, in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA, offer a nice counterpoint to the more familiar Dundee Hills bottlings. This young wine is smooth and supple, with medium ripeness. Lemon, peach and pear fruit flavors combine gracefully, with a toasty wrap pulling the wine into focus.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This is a full-bodied and richly layered white that dazzles in aromas of apple blossom and matchstick. The midpalate is creamy in feel, with strong flavors of pear and fig.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Toasted oak, white peach, fresh lilies, salted nuts and butterscotch aromas make for a very lush creamy nose on this bottling. The nutty buttery richness of the palate is sliced by vibrant citrus flavors, finishing on caramel candy.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: From vines planted in 1990 about 1,000 feet above the ocean, this is a complex Chardonnay, starting with aromas of grapefruit skin, peach blossom and a hint of hazelnut oil. Oak tones meet with creamy lemon and snappy citrus skins on the palate, finishing on candied lemon peels.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: A mix of tree fruits laced with an impression of pea vine, this lovely, textural wine shows impeccable balance throughout a long finish. Hints of fresh herb combine with a deeply fruity palate in keeping with the house style and the vineyard's characteristic stamp.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Toasted almonds, orange rinds, pan-seared pear and a bit of oak smoke show on the nose of this bottling from a property that's been family-owned since 1945. Green apples, lemon rinds and lemongrass freshness are enhanced by savory sea salt and judicious oak flavors on the palate.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From older plantings on the extreme Sonoma Coast, this is a high-toned, linear and freshly focused wine with an Old World sensibility, light in ripeness and delicate in texture. Floral aromatics lead to a palate of Meyer lemon, sea spray and white flowers, finishing in a twist of grapefruit.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aged in a concrete egg, this bright bottling offers aromas of kumquat, lemongrass and light almond on the nose. There is tremendous grip to the sip, where bright and brilliant flavors of crisp lime and fresh lemon blossom extract meet with grapefruit zest. Very lively and tactile.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This beautiful mineral-textured wine is 100% Chardonnay. Its taut texture, crisp acidity and citrus fruits contribute to a wine that, while now 17 years old, is still young and vibrant. Drink this bottling now.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Golden pear, browned butter and white-peach aromas are kissed by oak on the nose of this rich but balanced bottling. The creamy mouthfeel and poached apple flavors are leveled by lemon zest and a fresh tension, making the wine simultaneously lush and taut.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: From a winery focused primarily on sparkling wine comes this compelling Chardonnay, which offers aromas of Meyer lemon pith, fresh lime balm, white flowers and a touch of almond. The palate is tense and fresh, somehow both full and crisp, delivering flavors of plumeria, lily and citrus.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: There is a sharply mineral focus to the nose of this bottling, which shows aromas of wet gravel alongside lemon peel, lemon blossoms and a touch of ripe nectarine. It's very grippy on the palate, where chalky texture and flavors unveil lemon pith, river water and kumquat flavors.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: A big-shouldered, bold-flavored, impactfully dense style mixes ripe apple, Meyer lemon and a taste of pineapple in a wine with exceptional concentration. Aged in neutral wood, it picks up just a gentle lick of vanilla winding through the finish. Decant this wine, as it has the depth to reward extra-long aeration.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: A limited-production wine from the from the Côte des Blancs. It is tightly textured, very crisp, mineral and fresh. Bright citrus and green-apple flavors will soften as the wine matures. It should not be drunk before 2021.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: The winery's reserve-level cuvée is sourced from the estate vineyard, same as the Arthur, but here the presence of new oak is more forceful, the fruit a bit richer, and the impact of phenolic overtones more noticeable. It's a young, pungent wine that should benefit from additional bottle age. Drink 2021–2028.

name: Château de Santenay 2017 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
description: From estate-grown grapes, this is a creamy, robust and intensely flavored white made by sought-after winemaker Martha McClellan. Vanilla, peach, fig and key lime provide weight and breadth on an expansive palate of nuanced tannin and oak, buoyed by refreshing acidity, with stony mineral elements that imprint on the mind.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: The fascinating nose of this bottling is driven by wet stone, yet it also touches on orange rinds, fresh chives, lemongrass balm and a nearly basil-like aromatic without the green spice. It's lively on the palate with flint and crushed stone, showing very fresh and acid-driven flavors of lemon and ash, riding a firm tension through the sip.

name: Piper-Heidsieck 2006 Rare Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a beautiful wine with minerality, toast and tight acidity mingling with the citrus flavors that are still very present. The balance of the wine is impeccable, on the cusp between youth and maturity at the point when it has just become truly ready to drink.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a great appellation wine, overdelivering on price with an opening touch of matchstick that evolves into a stony, high-toned expression of tangerine and blood orange. Within the fruit are savory notes of nutmeg, hazelnut and ginger that linger leisurely on the lengthy finish.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Nutty hazelnut and stony minerality combine seamlessly in this impressive white from the coastal appellation. Full bodied, concentrated and structured, it imparts steely, lively flavors of lemon peel and tangerine, finishing with a soft silkiness to the texture and overall balance of weight.

name: Olivier Leflaive 2014  Corton-Charlemagne
description: Always one of the great Champagnes, this comes from a year that is generally regarded as good but not great. And yet, with this Champagne is magnificent. The wine has some good bottle age, hinting at toast while also keeping the tight, mineral edge of a great wine from the Côte des Blancs. Drink from 2020.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Colorless, fresh and zesty is how to describe phase one of this lighthearted Chardonnay. A tangy palate is lean and direct, while this tastes of green fruits and pickle brine. A lean, salty finish won't make you dance.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: The aromas are subdued, with notes of tin and herb. The lightly spritzy palate falls flat, with the variety hard to find.

name: Dark Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Flat aromas are an accurate indicator of what's to come with this unoaked Chardonnay. A creamy palate is low on acidity, while flavors of ham and vanilla barely suggest fruit. This is probably what one should expect from a 14.5% Argentine Chardonnay with no barrel aging.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Aromas of burnt toast, almond skin and char lead to ripe, full-bodied peach and char flavors. A warm, somewhat bitter finish caps it off.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Ripe upfront fruit—peach, pineapple, guava—leads on this wine, along with a little white pepper and toasty oak spice. The light-to-medium-weight palate, however, takes a somewhat sour turn. While there's chalky texture and lifted acidity, the sourness is a little off-putting and throws the wine out of balance.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This is a fruity, steely and approachable white wine, light in body style and weight. It offers simplicity and soft fleshy flavors of apricot and pear.

name: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This wine starts out delicate and pretty, with fragrances of flower blossoms, pears and apples gently wafting from the glass. It takes a much sharper turn on the palate, though, where angular acidity bites and tingles, slicing like a razor through the chalky texture and lean fruit and throwing the wine off balance. Acid hounds might dig it, but others will find the acidity alarming.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Wood resin, honey and modest white fruit aromas don't match how citric this is on the palate. Orange flavors are cascaded with oak, while this turns even more woody on a pulpy finish with tropical fruit notes.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Reductive and brimming in toasted oak, this white has a creamy, robust mouthfeel of marshmallow and banana, the tannin profile substantial and lengthy.

name: Torres 2016 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: Anise, fennel and butter combine in this medium-bodied, estate wine, which offers oaky intensity and fruit-forward ripeness. The fruit embraces a tropical profile of guava, mango and pineapple, with a steely backbone of acid.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This is a light-bodied, mildly fruity wine that accents apple and pear flavors with a sprinkling of dried herbs. It's soft and dilute in terms of mouthfeel but works well as a basic white wine.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Medium-gold in color, this subtle Chardonnay offers notes of stone fruit, melon and oak spice. It's got a lovely slippery texture but feels a little hot and lacks some vibrancy. A woody character creeps in on the finish.

name: Handpicked 2015 Collection Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)
description: A barrel-fermented and aged white from the sprawling site, this wine offers heady and floral aromatics and a fuzzy apricot flavor. Earthy and robust in toasted wood characteristics, it finishes with a salty minerality of stone and fog.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Sour lime, crushed concrete and flinty smoke aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's a tad reductive on the palate, with lime pith and riper apple aromas stating to emerge with patience.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Dark in color this white offers baked flavors of pear with accents of lavender and licorice. Rounded and polished, it has a supple texture that wears its oak well.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This medium-bodied wine offers smoky aromas and fennel and oak flavors accented by butter and vanilla. The mouthfeel is rich and soft.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Barrel fermented and put through full malolactic fermentation, this comes out simple and straightforward, with the rather generic character often found in Chardonnay. The fruit touches lightly on lemon, apple and pear, and with no new oak exposure, the wine stops there.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a medium-bodied wine with light buttery, apple-like varietal aromas, straightforward fruit flavors and a smooth texture.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This starts off a little reductive and oniony. With some swirling in the glass it starts to open up and eventually subtle stone fruit, citrus and salty aromas are revealed. The palate is slippery textured with an appealing burst of stone fruit rimmed by that slight salty character and a short finish. A solid if not overly exciting Chard.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This starts off a little reductive and oniony. Underneath can be found salt and nut aromas with flickers of citrus and melon fruit. Toasty oak is quite present, too, particularly on the palate, which is medium in weight with tangy fruit and refreshing acidity.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Flavorful, well balanced and medium bodied, this wine is easy to sip and enjoy for its ripe peach and apple flavors and mild acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Ripe aromas of pan-seared apples, buttercream and smoky planks of oak show on the nose of this bottling. It is very smoked with oak on the palate, along with seared citrus, lemon jam and sweeter toast flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A tasty array of baking spices, pear and honey give this full-bodied wine plenty to like. From nutmeg and vanilla aromas to pear, peach and marzipan it tastes rich and somewhat sweet. The texture is soft and thick.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Full bodied, lush and round, this is an approachable white that is robust in apple, pear and melon flavors. The richness takes on elements of baked pineapple and caramel as it opens in the glass.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A touch cloudy in the glass, this bottling shows very tangy aromas of lemon peel, orange rind and lemon juice on the nose. There is a lot of acid and intriguing texture to the palate, but the tangy orange-peel and lemon-zest flavors are quite aggressive.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Nutty and richly layered, this wine offers integrated oak within a light-bodied style of ripeness and weight. Apple and fig contribute the majority of the flavor, as a touch of vanilla plays on the finish.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Aromas of lemon balm, baking spice and yellow apple are followed by medium-bodied, textured fruit flavors that dip in the middle.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Subdued aromas of yellow apple, vanilla and spice lead to medium-bodied custard flavors. It doesn't all seem in harmony.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: Fig, guava and melon flavors are fleshy and rich in style in this full-bodied wine. The oak is subtle, with a lasting note of flint on the finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of petroleum jelly, herb and red apple skin lead to plentiful stone fruit flavors. It's straight down the fairway.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This light-bodied wine was aged in 25% new French oak barrels and 75% neutral barrels. It offers savory and mineral aromas, delicate flavors of green apple and fennel and a rather lean mouthfeel.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This showy, oaky wine aims to please. It bursts with buttered popcorn and caramel aromas, rich and buttery pear and apple flavors and a soft creamy texture that is low in acidity.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine comes from a vineyard that has established itself as a top site for this variety. Aromas of custard, barrel spice and freshly cut apple are followed by full-bodied flower and stone fruit flavors. It comes off as a bit ponderous and weighty, with the oak out front.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This wine is serious, full bodied and marked by oaky, buttery, ripe apple aromas that lead to similar flavors. The butteriness gives a light sense of sweetness and a rich texture adds to the effect.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: There's a somewhat metallic undercurrent on the nose of this bottling, which is sharp and sour with green-pear rinds on the nose. The palate is clean and crisp but also rides on the more sour edge of the spectrum, with green-apple-skin flavors.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Bright citrus, guava and pineapple rind lead on the nose here, although a green leafy character and subtle nutty, toasty notes add character to the ripe fruit. The palate is nicely balanced and textured, creamy and skinsy, with juicy fruit and the gentle support of oak. A solid if not overly complicated weeknight white.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of ripe apples, pomelo skins, wet slate and cement show on the nose of this bottling from one of the vineyards to survive the recent wildfire. Dried apples and wet wool flavors arise on the palate, which carries an earthy quality throughout the sip.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Generic white fruit and mild oak aromas are easy to like but just as easy to overlook. A pulpy palate is oily and fairly full, with intermixed flavors of melon, orange and nectarine. A steady finish confirms that this is a Chardonnay with potential popular appeal.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Well balanced, fresh and appetizing, this medium-bodied wine is animated by lively apple and peach flavors that are lightly accented by hints of vanilla and cream. Good acidity makes if refreshing and palate cleansing.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Steely in apple and lemon, this appellation wine offers a solid backbone of acidity that keeps it fresh and lively in the glass. Integrated oak supports the moderate structure and effusive fruit.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This Chardonnay is pale gold in color with a slight green tinge. There's a green leafy note on the nose, too, along with lemon peel, pineapple rind, white pepper and touch of something sweet like nougat. The palate is medium weighted, clean, crisp and simultaneously slippery and chalky in texture. There's a tangy, lemony finish, but it's fairly short.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This wine sees a lift in quality from the previous vintage. Medium-gold in color, it offers high solids goodness in the form of salted nuts, ginger, vanilla, brioche and ripe stone and citrus fruit. It's full bodied, offering salty, toasty characters with a slippery texture and bright acidity. The oak sticks out a little on the finish.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Plush, smooth and soft, this medium-bodied wine shows plenty of vanilla, butter and pear aromas, ripe pear and apple flavors and a rich but light texture.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This is an easy-drinking, lightweight Chardonnay exhibiting fragrant peach, pineapple and guava notes, with a touch of spice. It's powdery in texture, with tingly acidity and a stone fruit finish.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Very clean and subdued on the nose, this bottling offers hints of pear flesh, peach blossom and damp chalk aromas. The palate packs together lemon rinds with apple flesh, making for a very familiar and pleasant experience.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A straightforward, medium-bodied wine, this punches up its clean apple fruit with a whiff and taste of clove. It spent nine months in 35% new French oak, and finishes with a lick of butter.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Layered and creamy, this full-bodied wine spreads butter, baking spices and poached pear flavors across the palate. Its smooth and plush texture is mouthfilling and soft.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Heady in confectionery aromas, this is from an estate vineyard. Full-bodied flavors of green olive, dried herb, apple and pear are intertwined between layers of integrated lifts of acidity and a lasting taste of kiwi.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Crushed stone, prominent oak and a twist of lemon show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is strong energy to the sip, with flavors of honeysuckle and lime rind, wrapped up in a taut texture.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: A sappy wine with a nice mix of crisp apple and tangy tangerine fruit, this opens into a broad streak of toast and almond paste. The interesting mix of fermentation vessels—barrels, puncheons and a concrete egg—gives the wine both texture and flesh.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: Solid fruit flavors of white peach and other assorted tree fruits are given a rich finish in toasty wood. The gold color, streak of vanilla and rich aromatics make this rather blocky wine smooth and comforting, and it should have broad appeal to lovers of old school Chardonnay.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: A light and bright Chardonnay offering up notes of waxy lemon, melon, dried herbs and touch of florals. It's chalky in texture, with a juicy burst of acidity. A solid expression of the Adelaide Hills.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is a relatively light-bodied Chardonnay, but the textural palate adds weight. It's initially quiet, with subtle notes of peach, nectarine, blossoms, honey and a touch of salt. A slippery texture is well balanced by lifted acidity and delicate fruit, while some toasty oak flares up on the finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Dried apple peels, light guava and apple blossoms show on the nose of this always popular bottling that helped start the stainless trend many years ago. The palate grabs hold with tension right away and then spreads into tropical flavors of mango and papaya, with a touch of grapefruit pith.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of vanilla, pear, wood spice and yellow apple lead to rich, full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors that bring a sense of balance. The oak plays a prominent part, but if you are looking for a rich, oak-driven style, look no further.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Oak smoke, lemon blossoms and a touch of steel show on the nose of this bottling. There are tangy citrus elements of lime skin and grapefruit that penetrate from the tip of the sip toward the warmer toast qualities on the finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of vanilla bean and lemon balm. There's a lovely sense of balance and texture to the palate. It provides a lot of quality and value.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Easy, ripe and luxurious, this full-bodied but silky-textured wine offers plenty of poached pear and spiced-apple flavors wrapped in butter and vanilla.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This is a very fruity, full-bodied wine that feels and tastes rich, verging on sweet. Peachy aromas lead to vanilla and pear nectar flavors that have good depth and linger on the finish.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a bright, tart and tasty wine, with a refreshing mix of apple, pineapple and peach fruit, amped with a bit of peppery daikon radish. The flavors are balanced and harmonious, and a light touch with new French oak (11% for 11 months) adds a hint of toast to the finish.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Toasty aromas of brioche and slightly sour lemon preserves show on the nose of this bottling from a Big Sur vineyard. There is warm butter and tangy lemon on the palate but also savory touches of sea salt.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A creamy texture carries tasty butter, vanilla and ripe peach flavors in this full bodied, soft and smooth wine. Hints of apple, pear and buttery croissants add to its appeal.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Butter, hazelnut and baking spices provide heady aromas and rich flavors in this full-bodied, oaky and soft-textured wine. Vanilla and pear join in on a smooth, almost thick mouthfeel that keeps the flavors echoing on the finish.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Smooth and fruity, this is a buttery style of Chardonnay, with immediate appeal. Flavors of ripe apple and mixed tree fruits come with a touch of toasted hazelnuts. Medium in body and length, it finishes with a pleasing vein of caramel, from 11 months in roughly one-quarter new French oak.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This gold-hued Chardonnay comes from an international couple based in Rochester, N.Y., who make wines from both the Finger Lakes and South Australia. It is a little closed and reductive at first, but those oniony aromas blow off after some swirling in glass, and aromas like cashew, sea spray, toast and subtle citrus and orchard fruit come whirling to the fore. The palate is more generous, powdery in texture and balanced by mouthwatering acidity, orchard fruit and salty nuances. This is all framed by toasty oak, but it's supporting rather than overpowering. Plunk this beside a cheese board.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Rich and salty in oak and mineral, this medium-bodied wine holds its ripeness and underlying concentration well, contrasting it with bright acidity that refreshes the pear and fig components. Vanilla and a lilt of lemon meringue play on the back of the palate.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Sharp acidity boosts a lengthy, complex midpalate of green apple and Meyer lemon in this well-made wine, which shows a lasting lushness of crème brûlée and toasted oak on the finish.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Broad and creamy aromas are cut by lemon juice and crushed chalk on the approachable nose of this bottling. The smoky quality extends to the palate, where toasted almond, ripe peach and salted lemons make for a mouthwatering experience.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Heady in pear and melon, this is a full-bodied, lushly rich white that offers a complete embrace of oak. The wine was aged in 100% new French wood for 10 months. Flavors of crème brûlée, vanilla and gingerbread underscore the warmth and concentration on the palate.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Finished at an unusually low alcohol level, this is steely, spicy and rather thinly fruited, with flavors of Satsuma orange and mixed citrus. Aging in one-quarter new French oak for about a year adds a seam of caramel as it winds through the finish.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fermented in new French oak; the wood shows here but subtly, and mostly to add textural character rather than flavor. Aromatically it's an attractive combo of melon, orange peel and other citrus, backed by toast and flint notes. The palate is creamy, but the fruit remains bright and balanced, marked by subtle toast notes.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Plump aromas of pineapple jam, plumeria and toast show on the ripe nose of this bottling. The palate, crisp at first, is broadened out by a pineapple cream flavor. A chalky grip leads to a toasty finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Red pear, nectarine and a hint of pineapple make for a broad, aromatic entry to this bottling. There are clean lines of sharp, steely structure to the palate, which gives way to fleshy flavors of apple, pear and white peach.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Floral and youthful in lively acidity, this is a nicely made, balanced and moderately weighty white. Stone, mineral and a thread of apple skin provide a measured level of fruity fleshy flavor that holds onto some nuance and complexity.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light guava-skin aromas meet with pineapple, while a restraining sense of citrus pith and rind show on the nose of this bottling. There is a compelling toasty quality to the palate, cut by lemon juice acidity that leads into a slightly buttery finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Savory aromas of sandalwood and toasted hazelnuts combine with seared oak and preserved lemon aromas on the nose of this bottling from a newer estate. Lemon rinds show strongly on the palate as do Asian pear flesh and green-pear peels. It's tightly woven and sharp in texture.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This has undeniably inviting aromatics of ginger and apple blossom that puncture the nose before unleashing a fleshy full-bodied blend of citrus and tropical flavor on the palate. It's rich and lush with enough acidity to keep it fresh and lively in the glass.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is a bright, aromatic Chardonnay from Padthaway, a small region three hours southeast of Adelaide. Fragrances of peach, pineapple, lemon-lime and ginger are backed by toasty, white spice and seashell nuances. The palate offers opulence with restraint. It's chalky and a little skinsy with a long, gingery finish. A versatile food wine.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: A deep gold hue, this is already in a good drinking window, with deep, ripe fruit flavors of apple and pear, annotated with sweet pineapple. It's a bright, tangy wine, fermented in a mix of concrete egg and oak barrels, and framed with citrusy acids.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fresh and floral, this bold, layered wine tastes of green apple, lemon and lime, with a pleasing bite of tartness on the midpalate. The acidity is persistent and supportive of the fleshy full-bodied nature of the tropical richness the wine otherwise presents.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: A sure-fire crowd-pleaser, this fresh and textured wine fairly zings with bright flavors. Apples and white peaches are in the mix, and 10 months on the lees has given it a lively mouthfeel. Just 10% new French oak barrels were used, enough to begin to round it out. Drink now through the early 2020s.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Toasty aromas or brioche and hazelnuts meet with chalk and crème fraiche on the nose of this county-wide blend. The palate tangs with lime and grapefruit zest before a softer almond cream aspect rises in the midpalate and extends toward the finish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine offers flavors of lemon curd, vanilla and hazelnut supported by juicy acidity. It is full in weight and richly textured, providing a palate of pure enjoyment.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Rounded aromas of roasted pear, white flowers and a hint of buttercream show on the nose of this bottling by Ryan Deovlet. The palate is both tautly wound and slightly buttery, with flavors of preserved lemon cream on hot toast.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Toasted oak frames the ripe pear and apple flavors in this full-bodied wine. It has very good depth, concentration and flavor complexity, with bright acidity and flavors of spice and fruit that flood the palate.

name: Black Sheep Finds 2017 The Joy Fantastic Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: In true Henschke style, this Adelaide Hills Chardonnay is a sleek and polished wine with plenty of character. Stone fruits, cream, flint, nuts, white pepper and a copper penny tang make up the nose, while the palate tingles with lifted acidity and a slippery finish. Bright peachy fruit and oak spice linger long after the first sip has been swallowed. Drink now–2027.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Ushering in a new era and new ownership at Adelsheim is this first-ever vineyard designated Chardonnay, sporting a colorful new label. It's a fresh, refined style, tight and almost steely, with firm tree fruits at the core. The palate broadens out with smooth, toasty barrel flavors, from a year in one-quarter new French oak.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Bright and billowy aromas of gardenia and plumeria meet with a touch of peach on the tactfully precise nose of this wine. The palate sizzles with acidic energy that cuts through the ripe flavors of apple blossom, white peach and Key lime pie.

name: Pierre Legras NV Dea Matra Grand Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Bright and fresh aromas of white peach, lightly tropical mango and a kiss of oak make for a compelling entry to this bottling. There is fresh zest to the palate, which offers ripe flavors of pear and apple flesh on a lighter frame.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: White flowers meet with wet wool on the fresh nose of this bottling from an own-rooted vineyard planted to the Clone 3 of Chardonnay. The flavors are exotic and taut, with guava skin, citron and lemongrass proving unique and attention-grabbing.

name: Black Sheep Finds 2017 The Joy Fantastic Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Nutty, reductive oak leads the way to a thickly textured well-made wine that's full bodied and fleshy in style. Melon, pear and tropical mango wrap around cinnamon toast and graham cracker richness, finding a balance in a lingering hint of flint.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Fresh aromas of lemongrass, lime zest, jasmine and guava lean toward tropical on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp with honeysuckle, jasmine and plumeria flavors, bound by a sharper lemon-rind component that hold the floral touches in check.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Balanced and tart, this exceptional wine is firmly anchored in ripe apple, with palate-tickling suggestions of oranges and pineapple, bolstered by lemony acids. Barrel aged for 14 months, it welcomes a bit of breathing time, expanding generously while adding a burst of butterscotch to the lingering finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Aromas of sea salt and toast meet with crushed rocks and salty nuts on the savory yet fresh nose of this bottling. That salty quality shows strongly on the palate as well before tangy lime adds to the underlying cashew and toast flavors.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Lemon rind and lemon balm meet with green pears and a hint of chalk on the brightly citrusy nose of this bottling. The palate is very fresh with flavors of apple blossom, lime peel and a grippy structure.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Meyer lemon pith, Brie rind, ash, butter and chalk converge for an intriguing nose on this appellation blend. There is a very strong chalky grip to the sip, with flavors of lemon zest and crème fraiche. It is refreshing and very Chablis-like.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Light and bright aromas of lemon peel, yellow apple, orange peels and red-pear flesh arise on the nose of this bottling by Eric Johnson. There's a great grip to the sip, where lemon and nectarine flavors show in the midpalate that leads into a more creamy yet still chalky finish.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Buttercream, honeysuckle, pear flesh and a hint of toast show on the cohesive nose of this bottling. It's a down-the-middle and familiar Chardonnay on the palate, with flavors of lemon, lime, roasted apple and nut butter, finishing on a touch of butterscotch.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is the second vintage for this Chardonnay from Chris Figgins, which marries bright apple and citrus to delicious French oak, 38% new. It has a fine, focused through line, while opening up with grapefruit, Meyer lemon and tangerine, along with that lovely toasty character. New World fruit to be sure, but Burgundian in its elegance and power.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This creamy wine offers vanilla-inflected pear, apple and butter cream cookie flavors. It's all Dijon 76 clone, roughly two-thirds wild yeast fermented and aged in just over half new French oak barrels. The palate-pleasing creaminess persists through a long, satisfying finish.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Hazelnut, preserved lemon, warm toast and a touch of daffodil show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling by Eric Johnson. There is a toasty quality to the tip of the sip before the fresh waves of lemon and creamy cherimoya set in, leading into a lush, rounded finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine is fleshy on the palate and bright in aromas of citrus and stone. Notes of pear, flint and lime provide an unctuous nature on the palate, with refreshing acidity making for a nicely balanced and memorable experience.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Green pear skins and flesh lead toward aromas of nectarine and lime preserves on brioche on the nose of this wine from a historic vineyard. There is a zesty brightness to the sip as well as riper flavors of roasted apple, yellow peach and pineapple, framed by a chalky structure.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Aromas of chalk and oak meet with lime pith and a hint of cinnamon on the dynamic nose of this bottling from a vineyard that sits 1,100 feet in elevation. Baking spices show on the palate, alongside flavors of preserved lemon, sandalwood and vanilla.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This wine is big and buttery but also well balanced. It is layered and creamy in flavors of vanilla, pear tart and almond. An especially smooth and clinging mouthfeel helps the intricate fruit and spice notes linger on the finish.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tropically rich and weighty, this is well-made wine in a bold style, that's fresh, textured and integrated with toasted oak. Bright acidity gives it a foundation of lifted vibrancy that helps to tame the richer rounder fruit that finishes in orange peel.

name: Pierre Legras 2008 Route Impériale Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Done in a toasty, buttery style, this is sourced from a Golden Mile Bench vineyard planted in the late 1970s. Aged 16 months in roughly half new French oak, it's toasty and fresh, with buttery apple, pear and peach fruit and defining acidity. It needs a couple of hours to open up, showing exceptional texture and length when it does.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Aromas of Meyer lemon, wet gravel and buttercream hit all the touch points for an excellent Chardonnay. There is great tension on the palate, where a rounded Key lime flavor meets lemongrass and a touch of crème fraîche toward the finish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A strongly mineral kick of wet slate meets with apple peels, marmalade, toast and wool on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tense and taut with flavors of lime peel and kiwi, framed by a chalky minerality.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: The Chardonnays from CheckMate's second vintage are again subtly differentiated in interesting ways. This one is built with Dijon clones 76 and 95. Half was fermented with wild yeasts and all was aged 17 months in 50% new French oak. It's layered with flavors of apple, lemon and pineapple, and finishes with hints of butter cookie and bracing wintergreen.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This is made from the first vineyard farmed organically by the producer and sitting at 1,400-feet in a cool pocket in the appellation. Citrus-driven brightness rules the palate, following by a creamy pear flavor. The oak and tannins are powerful yet integrated.

name: Rizzi 2014 Pas Dosé Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Nutty, buttery and bright, this is an impressive, memorable and complex wine from the great Petaluma Gap site (situated between 300 and 800 feet in elevation)and one of the coolest-climate of all the producer's wines. Fresh layers of apple, pear, melon and lime meld with ease, supple in tannin and beautifully wrapped in nuanced oak.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine offers a potent, ripe mix of pineapple, butter, baked apple and toasted nuts. Aged a full year in 50% new French oak, it has powerful enough fruit concentration to completely balance out the barrel flavors. The finish brings a kiss of caramel and buoyant acidity.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is vibrant and layered with accents of spicy oak. Salt, wet stone and pretzel flavors are complemented by more traditional notions of green apple and pear, with flourishes of hazelnut and vanilla on the close.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This impressive white is sourced from grapes grown at the coveted Red Hen Vineyard. Full bodied and well balanced, it integrates its oak and power well, allowing room for vibrant acidity to boost the fleshy layers of red apple, Meyer lemon and toasted vanilla.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This is great Ritchie Vineyard wine, gorgeously profiled in caramelized oak and a nutty lushness that's hard to resist. Full bodied with waves of fresh acidity, it delivers nuance amidst a fleshy, tropical power of fruit and layering.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Winemakers Braiden Albrecht and Andy Erickson crafted magic out of a difficult vintage, picking the grapes for this beautiful white well before the October 2017 fires. It's gorgeously racy and light, bright and effusive, offering fleshy flavors of peach and lemon. Licorice and fennel finish out the expressive wine, which persists in wet stone.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is aged in a majority of concrete egg (71%), as well as stainless steel. Bright and floral in lemony texture, it has great wraparound acidity that gives it a persistence of freshness and a bite of stony mineral that lingers for considerable length on the impressive palate. This vintage marks the 20th year of owning the Durell Vineyard for Three Sticks owner Bill Price.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine offers a lovely use of oak, which contributes to its salty, stony mineral profile that pleases from the start. Lemon, apple and ginger notes combine around nice, lifted acidity and a textured, layered and complex midpalate that lasts on the finish, balanced in weight and breadth.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Roasted corn on the cob aromas are at the fore. The palate brings ale and some off notes. Toast, char and coffee flavors linger on the finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of burnt toast and peach lead to toasty, sweet flavors. The wood influence completely takes over.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Paxis White (Lisboa)
description: The aromas are hard to tease out, with light notes of peach, spice and cinnamon. A broad but not entirely cohesive-feeling palate follows.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Vanilla bean, caramel, melted butter and toast aromas are out front. Lighter-styled barrel and fruit flavors follow. The oak and malolactic influences take over.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows an unusual pink tinge in the color, aromas that are lightly floral, and flavors that blend fruit salad with heavier butter and toasted oak nuances.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Dusty aromas of wool mix with a harder note of peach pit on this crisp and pointy coastal Chardonnay. Briny tropical fruit flavors finish lemony, tangy and angular, with acidity leading the way.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Aromas of cinnamon and spice lead to slightly sweet, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It's straight down the fairway.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of lanolin, unbuttered popcorn and generic white fruits amount to an amorphous nose. Same can be said for the palate of this Itata Chardonnay, which is mild and flat. Vague flavors of melon and nectarine include a note of dried cheese, while there's not much to say about a quiet finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: The nose on this popular bottling is a bit muted, with hints of yellow apples, green-apple skins and chilled steel. The palate starts with tighter apple flavors before opening toward very ripe pineapple and pear flesh that grow somewhat sweet into the finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Aromas of apple blossom, oak, smoke and cream show on the nose of this bottling. There is a lightly taut texture on the front of the palate before waves of ripe pear and applesauce grow slightly sweet on the finish.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: Medium straw in color, this wine has aromas of pear and toast. It is bright on entry, with flavors of pineapple, lemon and brioche and a lemon zest finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This wine offers a bouquet of lemon sorbet and rose petal. There are touches of salinity across the palate amid flavors of pineapple and passion fruit with a trace of iodine.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Oily aromas of popcorn and yellow apple feed into a standard, medium-bodied palate with notable acidity. Flavors of apple, oak grain and vanilla are steady on a finish that doesn't veer off course.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: With a soft nose of white flowers and citrus, this wine has flavors of lemon, grapefruit, and river rock. It is a touch stiff at first, but retains its brightness through a lemon curd finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
