description: Strong buttercream, apple custard and oak smoke aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The smoky oak tones carry into the sip, where pear and green-apple-skin flavors are slightly bitter and a honey-butter character goes into the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a lively light-bodied wine with very fresh and straightforward fruit flavors, and a texture that balances crisp acidity with a touch of perceived sweetness.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Aromas of toasted pineapple and green apple peel set the stage for flavors of grapefruit, lime and freesia. This wine is full in the mouth, with a strong sense of acidity that lingers through the animated finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Sweet-leaning aromas of apple, pear, orange skin and concentrated honeysuckle show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers light apple and green-pear-skin flavors.

name: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Aromas of toast, reduction, banana and peach lead to light, sweet fruit flavors. It finishes warm.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Peach and melon aromas are supported by heavy but well-applied oak. A lightly resiny palate is full and a touch flat, while this tastes oaky, melony and generic, with a mellow finish that suggests popcorn.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Toast and clarified butter aromas lead to flavors that show more of the same. The style rides over the variety.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of lemon zest and butterscotch lead the way to flavors of toasted pineapple, passion fruit and vanilla. It is well-balanced on the palate and has a smooth finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Strong aromas of vanilla and caramel meet with buttercream and lemon on the nose of this very classic style of California chardonnay. There is a lemony tension and freshness to the sip, where the oak flavors grow strong and nearly sweet in the finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A bouquet of white peach and rose petal prepares the palate for flavors of nectarine, honeydew and white flowers. A harmonious mix of fruit and floral flavors meld into a soft, perfumed finish.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Flinty aromas of struck match meet with light lemon peel, pith and blossom on the nose of this bottling. The lemon-juice-laced palate is tangy, fresh and very sharp with nearly singeing acidity.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Made with Chardonnay, this has subdued aromas evoking ripe yellow peach and white flower. The forward, rounded palate offers ripe Bartlett pear and a hint of pineapple.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: The aromas are subdued at present, with light notes of apple, pear and cinnamon. Full-bodied stone fruit flavors follow, showing an appealing sense of texture. A warm finish caps it off. It's a lovely example of the style.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Light plumeria and jasmine aromas meet with candied lime peel and brioche on the nose of this wine, which is billed on the label as gluten-free and vegan-friendly. The palate starts with a snappy taut texture and delivers flavors of candied lime, grapefruit and honeysuckle.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-boded wine shows a nice blend of ripe pear and apple aromas, with buttery baking-spice flavors. A rich texture and subdued acidity make it soft on the palate.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This deep straw-colored wine has a nose of apple and crème brûlée. It is creamy on the palate, with flavors of pear, lemon curd and butterscotch that wind down to a soft toffee finish.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Ripe pear and chalk aromas meet with playful scents of bubblegum on the nose of this unoaked Chardonnay. The sip zips with acidity before the ripe flavors of pineapple, pear and Pink Lady apple take over.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Aromas of citrus blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of cedar shape the nose on this Chardonnay. The juicy, tangy palate offers tangerine zest and Golden Delicious apple alongside bright acidity.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Buttery croissant aromas and indulgent vanilla and butter-laden flavors make this wine virtually rich enough for dessert. It shows plenty of oak baking spices, a fat texture and lingering buttery finish.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: The aromas are subdued, with notes of spice, toast, clarified butter and peach. Broad feeling but still elegant fruit flavors follow, dipping in the middle. Toasty notes linger on the finish. The oak is front and center, but for those looking for this style, it delivers.

name: Sonoma-Loeb 2017 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Clean aromas of lime and lemon meet with chalk, dried apple and pear on the nose of this bottling. The palate is pleasant is slightly simple, showing cooked apple and tangy lime-zest flavors.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: This lemon-scented wine is bright, textured and fruity. It has a mineral texture that is tautly stretched and packed with green fruits, a touch of spice and nuttiness. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is both steely and spritzy, with an earthy mushroom component that persists and detracts from the fruit. There's a metallic edge to the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A mostly neutral aroma is followed by generic, semisweet fruit flavors in this soft low-alcohol wine. It has little varietal character and tastes clean and syrupy.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows good restraint and balance, as subtle baking-spice aromas meet Bosc pear and lemon meringue flavors. It has great balance and is a good candidate to hold for further development. Best after 2022.

name: Eden Rift 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: A light gold color in the glass, this is toasty upfront, with oodles of sweet spice, cedar and brown piecrust characteristics, but with interesting additions of singed cinnamon stick and fresh crushed herbs, like mint and mâche. The palate is full and round in feel, with a lush, creamy body and more toasty, ripe fruit flavors of wood-grilled apple and clove-spiked orange that finish long on the rich and enduring close.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This is a lovely full-bodied white, with 1% Sauvignon Blanc in the mix. It is native-yeast barrel-fermented and aged further in French oak, 70% of it new. Lively, fresh and citrus-driven, its bolder style and use of oak doesn't detract from a high-toned personality and firm structure.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Lots of butter, toast and fresh fruit make this medium-bodied wine taste rich, oaky and a bit heavy. The wine feels soft, round and low in acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of onion mask prettier nuances of citrus, grapefruit and toast on the nose. It's slippery with tingly acidity on the palate, but the fruit seems somewhat sour and the toasty oak flavors at the finish throw off the wine's balance a little.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This wine has ample bright and fruity aromas that meet good, focused apple and pear flavors. Medium body and a light smooth texture make it easy to enjoy.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of spring flowers and green apple form the nose along with a whiff of Mediterranean herbs. On the tangy palate, bright acidity lifts ripe pear and white peach before a citrus finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Broadly fruity, earthy aromas and reasonably ripe fruit flavors make this medium-bodied wine a respectable choice.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Ripe pear, pressed yellow flowers and a yeasty whiff of bread dough lead the way. It's racy and linear, offering mature yellow apple and hazelnut alongside fresh acidity.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: The nose is rather subdued but the ripe, full-bodied palate offers mature pear, apple and peach. Oak-driven spice, including vanilla and butterscotch provide backup before a bitter almond close.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: White stone fruits, spring wildflowers and a whiff of wild herbs shape the nose. The rounded, medium-bodied palate offers ripe green apple, honeydew and a hint of lemon zest alongside fresh acidity.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Fragrantly fruity in peach, apricot and a sweetness of vanilla, this is a cheery, approachable and richly styled white, which refreshes within a full-bodied middle.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Enticing aromas of spring flower, white stone fruit and alpine herb shape the nose. The rounded medium-bodied palate delivers creamy Bartlett pear, apple, juicy citrus and a smoky mineral note alongside tangy acidity.

name: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)
description: Aromas of Granny Smith apple follow over to the extremely simple, rather diluted palate. Juicy acidity keeps it on its feet.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of green apple and citrus carry on to the fresh, light-bodied palate along with a hint of green melon. It's simple but well-made.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This tangy white offers aromas and flavors of green apple, citrus and honeydew. It's simple but well-made.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Fruity aromas of green apple and honeydew follow over to the tangy palate along with a hint of almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish.

name: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)
description: Aromas of white stone fruits and yellow spring flowers shape the nose. On the light-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies yellow pear, lemon zest and a hint of beeswax.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This has subtle aromas evoking lemon and green apple. The aromas follow through to the straightforward palate along with Bartlett pear, while tangy acidity gives it a bright close.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of white stone fruit and spring blossom waft out of the glass. On the rounded palate, tangy acidity brightens creamy pear and Granny Smith apple.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of orchard fruits and yellow spring flowers mingle with a whiff of nut. The rounded palate shows yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of white almond before a juicy close.

name: Alexana 2018 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Aromas suggesting chamomile, pressed Spanish broom and mature pear form the nose along with a whiff of citrus. The rounded yet light-bodied palate suggests lemon drop, butterscotch and mature apricot before a bitter almond close.

name: California Roots 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and butterscotch lead the nose along with a whiff of mature yellow apple. The palate is full bodied but lean in terms of fruit richness, offering oak-driven spice, nut and a hint of lemon drop; you'll also detect the warmth of alcohol.

name: Terlato 2018 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Graphite, grilled herb and mature yellow pear aromas come together in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the rounded, medium-bodied palate offers ripe golden apple, white peach and a tangy saline note. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of white stone fruits and white spring flowers lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the juicy, tangy palate doles out yellow pear, Rennet apple and a mineral note evoking crushed oyster shell.

name: Terlato 2018 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of mature pear, citrus zest and a whiff of spice lead the nose. The ripe, rounded palate offers ripe yellow apple, citrus rind and a hint of vanilla before a bitter almond finish.

name: Terlato 2018 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Made with grapes grown according to the principles of organic and biodynamic agriculture, this opens with subtle aromas suggesting mature white stone fruit, dried herb and crushed stone. Mirroring the nose, the lean, linear palate presents unsweetened lemon drop, dried yellow apple slice and a hint of graphite.

name: Bandit NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of mature yellow stone fruit, cedar and Alpine herbs lift out of the glass. The aromas follow over to the taut, full-bodied palate along with oak-driven spice, coconut and citrus rind before a butterscotch close.

name: Lange 2018 Classique Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Brancott advertises this low-alcohol wine as 20% lower in calories. While the marketing feels gimmicky, their Pinot Grigio succeeds far better than the previous vintage's Sauvignon Blanc. It should really be termed Pinot Gris, for this pink-tinged bottling offers heady aromatics closer to Alsace than Italy in style. A perfume of lychees, lime leaf, Asian pear, peach and honeysuckle make up the nose, while the palate finds a balance between creamy texture and lifted acidity. This crowd-pleasing white would be happy beside spicy cuisine.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: White stone fruit, almond and a whiff of pressed Spanish broom shape the delicate nose. The fresh, rounded palate doles out ripe apple, white peach and a hint of citrus before a juicy close.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Granny Smith apple, lemon drop and crushed stone aromas appear in the glass along with a whiff of Alpine herbs. On the full-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies mature yellow pear, lemon drop and a hint of graphite. A smoky note signals the close.

name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: Very pale in the glass, this is a sprightly, zesty spin on the often tepid grape, offering loads of lily, lemon-lime soda and peach aromas on the nose. The sip is very zippy with acidity and near effervescence, showing peach and fresh lime-juice flavors.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Here's a fantastic expression of Pinot Grigio that opens with enticing scents of spring wildflowers, white stone fruit and an inviting whiff of freshly baked bread. Savory and medium bodied, the rounded palate offers ripe green apple, yellow pear and lemon zest alongside a tangy mineral note.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: The aromas show a bit of reduction out of the gate along with a light dusty note. Full-feeling kiwi, pineapple and apple flavors follow.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: In the first canned offering from the winery, aromas of apple, melon and Vaseline offer full-feeling flavors that persist through the lightly smoky finish. It's a sure crowd-pleaser, and the price is right.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Structured and elegant, this Pinot Grigio shows enviable class and pedigree. It opens with delicate scents of white spring flowers, ripe pears and a whiff of dried Alpine herbs while the round, polished palate delivers creamy apple, honeydew and white almond. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors, while a tangy mineral note suggesting saline lingers on the close.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of pressed field flowers, white stone fruit and bread dough lead the way. On the concentrated palate, bitter almond backs up mature yellow apple and ripe Bartlett pear alongside a hint of saline.

name: A to Z 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: There's a lot of reduction showing out of the gate. Banana, apple and Vaseline aromas follow. The palate is a cornucopia of tropical fruit flavors, with papaya in the lead. It has an almost oily consistency. The flavors are delicious when the reduction clears.

name: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This Romanian Pinot Grigio has aromas of lemon blossom and crème brûlée. On the palate there are flavors of flan, peach and apple with a clean finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: A delicate nose of lemon verbena and stone starts off this light-bodied white. It is simplistic and straightforward on the palate, driven by a crisp lemon flavor and broadened out by a slight creaminess to the feel.

name: Wilridge 2017 Acadia Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: A very green nose doles out fresh cut grass, celery and carrot top aromas. The palate shows yellow apple, underripe orange and snow peas, with a bitter green edge. The finish is hot, loaded with lime pith and white pepper.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Delicate lemon and orange blossom carry the nose, with melon and more citrus arising on the light-bodied palate. There's a pleasing softness to the palate with plenty of acidity to match.

name: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This Romanian Pinot Grigio has aromas of lemon blossom, peach and stone fruits. It has flavors of apricot and yellow peach with crisp acidity on the finish.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: This informal white has a shy nose that eventually gives up aromas of bitter almond. The simple, rather diluted palate evokes hints of white stone fruit alongside bright acidity.

name: Holm Oak 2017 Pinot Gris (Tasmania)
description: A neutral nose suggests white-peach fuzz and chalkboard eraser, with time in the glass peach flesh and white pepper emerge. A very mellow palate is soft, but not unbalanced, offering flavors of papaya, squash blossom and a squeeze of lime juice that quietly fades away.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of toast, yeast and citrus define the nose of this wine. The light-bodied palate shows a slight impression of ripe melon, with a sharp orange-laden finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of underripe banana and lemon cream lead to a bright, zesty palate. Crisp lemon defines the flavor, with a savory, yeasty note marking the close.

name: Laurelwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Earthy in pea shoots and freshly cut grass, this is a thick, viscous and lemony white wine, restrained in ripeness and a lasting flavor of peach.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Straw in color and smelling like freshly sliced pears and pineapples and white-flower blossoms, this straightforward Pinot Grigio offers bright acidity, a slippery texture and a juicy finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This wine is light, fruity and soft in texture, offering honeydew melon aromas and golden apple flavors. It's mild in terms of acidity and short on the finish.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This fruity and very affordable wine has an appealing, smooth texture and attractive, light peach and apple flavors. Medium body and a touch of crispness make it appetizing.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a light, lean wine that emphasizes simple refreshment and will be easy to sip. Delicate green-apple aromas and a touch of butter in the flavor give it just enough substance to savor.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of Granny Smith apple and citrus zest lead the nose. The aromas carry on to the simple but well-made palate along with crisp acidity and a hint of pear.

name: Casa Liliana 2018 Good Pinot Grigio (Venezia)
description: Very basic in flavor, this canned wine is acceptable as a generic accompaniment to food. It's light bodied and soft in texture.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: This light-bodied wine has a touch of wood smoke in the aroma and vague, modestly fruity flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This Pinot Grigio is straw colored with aromas of lemongrass, jasmine and lime rind. On the palate it is balanced with flavors of crème brûlée, vanilla and peach. The finish is crisp with a nice level of acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Spring flower and orchard fruit aromas take center stage on this straightforward white. The bright palate shows apple, pear and citrus zest alongside crisp acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Citrus blossom and white stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the easygoing palate, a hint of white almond accents green apple and Meyer lemon before a tangy finish.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Light and crisp, this wine offers peach, melon and stone. It remains bright and approachable from start to finish.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Tangy and crisp in character, this light-bodied wine shows touches of mineral and white pepper in the aromas, and lean citrus and green-apple flavors on the palate. It's refreshing and reserved.

name: A to Z 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Big on fruit and floral flavors, this medium-bodied wine exudes crisp apple and Anjou pear aromas that lead to ripe fruit on the palate and a touch of tanginess on the finish.

name: A to Z 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Broad aromas of Meyer lemon, lime balm and citrus blossoms show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound, with fresh flashes of tangy apple.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This wine smells gorgeously fruity, tastes ripe and pure like freshly cut apples and Bosc pears, and has a good crisp texture balanced by medium body. A touch of sweetness emerges on the finish.

name: Folie à Deux 2018 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fresh lemon-lime aromas and tangy, green-apple flavors give this light-bodied wine an appealing fruity character. The smooth texture has a touch of crisp acidity for balance.

name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: Aromas of spring blossom and mature yellow apple waft out of the glass along with an inviting whiff of sun-warmed hay. On the rounded palate, a toasted almond note accents ripe Bartlett pear, honeydew melon and a tangy citrus note.

name: Terlato 2018 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Hawthorn and ripe green-apple aromas mingle together on this medium-bodied white. On the round savory palate, tangy acidity lifts honeydew melon and ripe Bartlett pear before a fennel finish.

name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Aromas of white stone fruit, honeysuckle and a whiff of nut shape the nose. On the tangy medium-bodied palate, a saline note lifts peach, yellow pear and bitter almond.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a truly lovely and lush white wine, barrel-aged 10 months in new French oak and made in an elegant style. A creamy golden nose of nutmeg, vanilla and crème brûlée follows a voluptuous thread of hazelnut and anise, finishing gracefully with structure and textured acidity.

name: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay (Maipú)
description: Flat aromas of caramel and a hot radiator carry the nose. A palate without much clarity or structure fails to help this along, while briny flavors of citrus turn mushy like yellow squash on a short finish.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This is a seamless, Old World and classic white, integrated in salty oak with a beautiful opening nose of lemon rind. Lifted, persistent acidity gives it focus and freshness, as a taste of briny oyster shell, lemongrass and Asian spice mingle around well-integrated thoughtful oak. This is a beautiful wine.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This standout wine is bursting with a rich mix of tropical fruits. Ripe and fleshy, it's got banana, papaya and mango, along with peaches and apricots. The acidity brings lemon pith and rind, and the time in one-third new oak adds a streak of caramel. Drink now through the mid-2020s.

name: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay (Maipú)
description: Sharp feline and pineapple aromas are inexact and are not typical of the variety. A full palate is propped up by tangy acidity, while this tastes of celery, green herb and apple cider.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is an intensely reductive wine with strong whiffs of rubber and onion. Citrus fruit lurks well below. The acidity is crisp but somewhat unripe, and the creamy texture doesn't help balance it.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Oak-forward and wearing the wood with abandon, this white has baked tropical flavors and a lingering harshness to its tannins. The grapes originate from both Sonoma Mountain and the Russian River Valley.

name: Pascual Toso NV Brut Chardonnay (Maipú)
description: A heavy yellow color signals a chunky, flat nose. This organic-grape Chardonnay is soft on the palate, with short apple-based flavors that are slightly oxidized. A bready, wheaty finish is plump but heavy and bland.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This screw cap white is perfumed and floral, aged in both oak barrel and stainless steel. The midpalate and finish take on an astringent tinge before delving into vanilla and butter.

name: Dark Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A light color and equally light aromas of lime and little more introduce a linear palate that's oily feeling and acidic and pulls inward. Briny, tart nectarine flavors do a quick fade on a finish that rings with acidity.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: This popular white is rich and concentrated in tropical fruit and sweet oak with a lasting taste of honey and vanilla.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This Chardonnay doesn't succeed as well as the previous one. Like others in this vintage, this is a very fruity expression of a variety that is generally more understated and texturally focused. Ripe peach, melon and honeyed notes, along with a fair whack of toasty oak all feel a little sweaty and synthetic. The fruit on the palate is a touch sour and the acidity is biting, making this wine feel unbalanced.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: Fruit for this wine comes from the Melody Lynne Vineyard. Aromas of vanilla and crayon lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors. The oak completely overrides the fruit.

name: Frank Family 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is tart and cloudy, with strong flavors of baked pineapple and anise. The acidity takes on a persistent sour character that won't appeal to all.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Melon, grapefruit and vanillin oak notes show on the nose. The acidity is fairly searing, but the oak and slippery texture do help support it to some extent. A sour citrus note creeps in on the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Lemon curd, lees and spice aromas are followed by sleek stone fruit flavors. It seems a bit light, and the lees influence gets in the way at times.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: With a candied quality to its fruit, this tart, lemony wine is uneventful in terms of structure and complexity, offering a straightforward simple expression of the grape.

name: Georges Duboeuf 2017  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This ripe wine traffics in butterscotch, brioche and baked pineapple, the texture viscous and overtly lush. It finishes with a lingering hint of sweetness.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Very light and nearly effervescent in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of grapefruit peel, baking soda and damp campfire wood. Lemon pith and sour apple flavors arise on the sip.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: Honey graham cracker and vanilla flavors help declare this wine big, ripe and lush in style, the body robust and the acidity moderate. Baked peach, caramel and toasted oak round things out.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Soft, supple and moderate in oak, this medium-bodied white delivers layers of texture and vanilla with apple and pear fruit melded well within.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Vivid gold in color, this medium- to full-bodied wine boasts ripe, almost syrupy, fruit aromas and flavors, and has a mouthcoating soft texture. It tastes clean and rich, verging on sweet.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This is an ultrareductive Chardonnay, and it takes lots of vigorous swirling and time in glass for citrus, salted nut and toasty oak notes to start floating to the surface. Things improve on the palate, which is slippery textured, with plenty of fruit weight and toasty oak that are balanced by a focused line of acidity. The citrus fruit and salted nut creep back in the on the finish. Drink 2020–2025.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: An ultrafruity, borderline confected Chardonnay that oozes peach and melon juice, ripe banana and a lick of oyster shell and floral aromas at the back. The palate is equally fruity, although the slippery texture nicely balances the acidity. The toasty oak finish is short and a touch synthetic.

name: Xavier Monnot 2017 Chardonnay Les Grandes Coutures  (Bourgogne)
description: This wine is meaty and full bodied in style, with pretty aromatics up front—a mix of jasmine and apple blossom. The palate takes on bountiful oak elements of vanilla and honey, with a lush texture front and center.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Aromas of lemon, white peach and spice are followed by sleek but slightly viscous fruit flavors. It's a straight down the fairway offering of the variety.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a widely appealing white with a crisp entry that veers into vibrant nervy energy and freshness. With a buoyant undercurrent to its defined flavors of golden apple and pear, it finishes with just a hint of lemony richness.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: The latest vintage of this wine is ultra aromatic. It's a fruit bowl of heady aromas: baked apples, melons, tropical and stone fruits, laced with wet stones and toasty oak influence. The palate is plush but not overly creamy or heavy, and with more plump, ripe fruit. The oak rears its head at the finish. Drink now and for the next few years.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Floral, earthy and intensely full bodied, this is a robust white brimming in apple, guava and fig flavors, in addition to oak.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: A new offering from the producer, this is a classically tropical, honeyed white wine, viscous, thick and oaky, with a touch of butter teasing the palate as it opens in the glass. For fans of full-bodied flavor, this is creamy and buttery in spades.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This light-bodied wine is lean and restrained in style, from its very pale-yellow color to green-apple and cucumber aromas to subtle, crisp flavors like jicama and white peach. It was aged in neutral oak barrels, so no obvious oak flavors come through, just steely refreshment.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Can't-miss oak drives the nose on this high-elevation Chardonnay. In the mouth, oak-based weight is cut by hard-driving acidity. Smoky, woody notes push generic white fruit flavors to the fringes, while primed acidity pushes a low-fruit finish to its limits.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A refreshing, restrained Chardonnay boasting Sauvignon-like characters of grapefruit, grass and canned green bean, backed by lifted lemony notes and just a touch of flint and toasty oak. The palate shows, once again, SB levels of acidity, but the slippery texture, mineral notes and toasty French oak nuances place it firmly in Chardonnay territory. Drink now.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of lemon curd, almond skin, apple and toast are followed by medium-plus-bodied fruit flavors that bring a sense of weight. Bright acidity backs it up.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Tightly wound aromas of key lime spray and lychee make for a fresh entry on the nose of this bottling, which was aged in Slovakian oak. Lemon and tangerine flavors arise on the palate as does a spun-sugar element, proving quite pleasant if the slightest bit sweet.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This single-vineyard wine is—unexpectedly considering its cool climate—a richer, creamier style than its counterpoint, the Keltern, located in the warmer Hawkes Bay. Aromas of ripe melon, yeasty apple, grapefruit, honeyed nut and toast lead into a weighty, luscious palate that displays a good deal of oak influence but also a bright line of citrusy fruit that runs through to the finish. For those who enjoy opulent Chardonnay, drink now or cellar until 2027.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Butter, butterscotch, vanilla and pear-nectar flavors give a big luxurious personality to this soft full-bodied wine. The texture is equally rich, almost sweet, coating the sides of the mouth and propelling the buttery nuances through a lingering finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: A pale yellow color, this wine smells fresh, vibrant and inviting, with lively aromas of citrus, lemon-lime, yellow apple, green melon and a touch of mineral dust. Lightweight and well balanced, it has a bright acidic seam and fresh, zippy citrus and green apple tones, with hints of sea breeze and limestone minerality. Bright and sassy, this is well balanced and oh-so-easy to like and drink.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Touches of nutmeg and vanilla fill the nose of this full-bodied and full-flavored wine. The texture is smooth and creamy, while a touch of acidity helps balance all that richness.

name: Apollonis 2010 Inspiration de Saison Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Full and rich, this has a sizable concentration of guava, pineapple and lime, the latter offering a hint of underlying freshness. The finish is big, yet tangled in acidity.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: What a treat to find an unassuming but satisfying, estate-bottled wine in this price range. This medium-bodied, well-balanced wine offers mild pear, butter and vanilla aromas, lively fruit flavors backed by good acidity, and a silky mouthfeel that's not too fat and not too lean.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Oaky vanilla, caramel and lemon curd highlight the full-bodied concentration of rich flavor in this wine, aged in both new and neutral oak. Well made, integrated and structured, it shows grace within a powerful package of intensity.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This widely available, well-priced bottling is worth stocking up on. Creamy aromas of yellow peach, oak, butter and lemon are classic Chardonnay markers. The palate offers ripe peach, pear and apple flavors, cut by lime peel and decent tension. It's rich yet clean and balanced.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fleshy, focused and bright, this wine also offers plenty of full-bodied richness and full flavor—a meaty take on baked apple, pear and a savory twist of olive.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: This is a new, high-end project from winemaker Sebastian Donoso at Fetzer, sourcing from several spectacular vineyard sites, including Heintz and Morelli. Tart, structured and nervy, it offers integrated flavors of tangerine, guava and apple laced in nutmeg.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Richness, almost unctuousness, is the hallmark of this full-bodied, creamy textured and complex wine. Subtle baking spices, butter and ginger fill the aroma, while perfectly ripe, abundant flavors of pear tart and toasted almond flood the palate. It's balanced on the plump side.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Soft and creamy aromas of poached pear and buttered toast are cut by the slightest edge of lemon peel on the voluptuous yet not overdone nose of this bottling. More lemon and baked nectarine show on the palate, which is plush and creamy, with flavors of marshmallow and meringue.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Lightly toasted coconut and lemon peel make for a soft, delicate nose on this bottling. There is plenty of ripe fruit on the palate, from pear and apple cream to exotic citrus with just enough oak background, proving to be a very flavorful wine.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: There's a faint straw and toasted challah character in the background of this light and bright wine, with additional notes of dried apple skin, orange and lime zest, white carnation and chalky limestone. The palate is bright and nervy, with a great line of acidity that keeps the palate fresh and lifted through the mouthwatering finish. It's well balanced and delicious, with a lingering lime zest flourish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Clean aromas of Gravenstein apple, dried lime peel and a kiss of oak show on the nose of this blend of the Bien Nacido and Sierra Madre vineyards. There is a great tension to the sip, where strong citrus-peel and green-apple flavors make for a zingy experience.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This opulent Chardonnay charges out of the gate with ripe stone and tropical fruit, brioche, honey and toasty oak notes. The palate is less full throttle than the nose suggests. It certainly has richness and body, but it's tempered by a clean line of acidity and more tangy fruit. The oak is jutting out a little, but it should settle with time. Drink now with food or cellar until 2026.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Rich aromas of brioche and sweet butter are cut by chalky lemon pith and candied citrus rind on the nose of this blend of fruit from John Sebastiano and Sierra Madre vineyards. The chalky mouthfeel presents flavors of grapefruit, toasted croissant and a drawn-butter element toward the finish.

name: Forget-Brimont 2008 Millésime Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Villa Maria's single vineyard Hawkes Bay Chardonnay is still a baby. It's a little closed and reductive at first, but with time in glass it starts to open somewhat, revealing a mélange of aromas: citrus, mint, salted nuts, warm stones and some buttery, woody notes. Medium to full bodied, the palate is taut and focused, a high solids style with a creamy texture and more toasty oak influence. A long lemon curd and nut finish hints at great things to come. Drink now with time in a decanter and food or until 2027.

name: Cocchi 2014 Bianc d'Bianc Brut Chardonnay (Alta Langa)
description: Sandalwood, struck match, poached pear and smoked apple show on the savory nose of this bottling. There is a smoky quality to the sip as well, with flavors of roasted chicken in lemon sauce, nectarine and poached citrus leading into a caramel-laced finish.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Vivid oaky, earthy aromas lead to ripe firm flavors of apple and citrus in this assertive and well-structured wine. The char and wood-smoke nuances carry over to the palate, along with a nice nip of tannin and firm acidity that help to offset the richness.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Generous aromas of oak and pecan meet with seared lemon peel, caramelized white peach and sea salt on the lavish and delicious nose of this bottling. The palate is oaky and toasty yet made dynamic by ripe lemon, pan-seared apple and clove-dust flavors, all cut by strong acidity.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Broad and clean aromas of honeysuckle and squeezed citrus show on the crisp and lively nose of this bottling. It lands with richer buttercream and pan-seared apple flavors, which are cleaned up by decent acidity.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This heady, fleshy white from a well-farmed site is creamy and lush in mouthfeel, with a supportive backbone of acidity. The fruit is a mix of crisp green apple and more robust fig, with touches of vanilla and brioche emanating from the integrated oak.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: There's an intriguing combination of hazelnut, pecan and tangerine on the nose of this racy bottling, which offers tangy and pithy aromas. The palate is very taut and zesty with yellow-grapefruit and sour acid flavors.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Fresh aromas of citrus spray, orange cream, lime peel and buttered toast converge on the nose of this bottling. It's fairly plump on the palate with ripe apples and poached pear, but the salty caramelized lemon-peel edge enhances the sip.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Lightly sweet apple tones meet with tangerine pith and lemon balm on the clean, easy and familiar nose of this bottling by the family of former Los Angeles Dodgers manager Tommy Lasorda. There is decent tension to the palate, which is bright, fresh and crisp with pome fruit and citrus flavors.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Generously oaked but up to the challenge, this substantive and full-bodied wine matches lavish butter, toast and vanilla flavors with concentrated and ripe peach, pear and honey flavors. It has a rich, nicely viscous texture but good acidity underneath it for balance.

name: Talley 2017 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Very floral aromas of honeysuckle and gardenia meet with flint, sweet wood and butter on the nose of this bottling. Ripe flavors of white flower, applesauce and cinnamon show on the rich palate, which finishes ever so sweetly.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Broad aromas of pear, lime skin, apple blossom and hazelnut show on the nose of this bottling. The nutty aspect extends to the palate and settles into tangy marmalade and buttered toast toward the finish.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: There's a strong sense of wood, matchstick and smoky flint on the nose of this bottling. Those woody elements carry to the palate as well, where sandalwood and oak elements mesh into dried lemon peels and savory sea salt, bolstered by sizzling acidity.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Delicate on the nose, this bottling starts with light aromas of honey, tangerine, crushed chalk and the slightest bit of pineapple. The palate is very tangy, high-toned and a tad sour, showing green grapefruit and citrus pith flavors.

name: Altemasi 2015 Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Overt oak aromas outweigh generic white fruit notes prior to a plump and creamy palate that's fairly resiny. Wood-based flavors of vanilla and spice work well with salt and melony fruit notes, while this Chardonnay performs a slow fade on a salty tasting but balanced finish.

name: Adelaida 2018 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: This white from the great vineyard site is intense in approach and full-bodied richness. Thick, concentrated layers of tropical and stone fruit effuse from the palate adorned in toasted oak and lasting lushness.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Aromas of green apple, white flowers and white peach excite your palate for bright fruit flavors of Granny Smith apple and yellow peach. This wine is well balanced, with a crisp and clean finish.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Aromas of citrus blossom and white stone fruit lead the nose along with a whiff of crushed herb. On the creamy palate, fresh acidity brightens mature yellow apple, white peach and a hint of lemon zest. It closes on a savory, almost salty note.

name: Boekenoogen 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Intensely steely, this wine offers a length and breadth of full-bodied ripeness that takes form in broad layers of honey, pear and lemon chiffon. Structured, it's richly concentrated with a lingering hit of toasted oak.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This wine interlaces a light buttery-oak nuance with vibrant, appealing fruit flavors. It's medium weight yet fresh, with a smooth, well-balanced palate that displays a harmonized mix of savory oak and citrus nuances.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This wine starts off a bit reductive and oniony, but it mostly blows off with time in the glass. In its place, subtle aromas of grapefruit, lemon rind, oyster shell, and a briny, smoky nuance emerge. The palate is chalky textured and focused with a clean line of acidity and a citrusy tang. This is a lean, almost austere style of Chardonnay that would appeal to those who normally steer clear of rounder, more opulent expressions.

name: Talley 2017 Oliver's Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is a smooth, floral white crisp in white flowers and a bite of grapefruit. The midpalate settles into more substantial elements of fresh pear and nutmeg, finishing in a hint of reduction.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This whimsically labeled wine by Brian Loring offers great quality at a more affordable price. Aromas of hazelnut, cashew, seared marshmallow and light flint lead into a bold palate of poached apple, lemon curd and sweet oak.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Rounded aromas of baked apples, cinnamon, French toast and singed sandalwood show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a strongly aggressive sizzle of acidity on the sip, followed by squeezed lemon and grapefruit-peel flavors.

name: Poseidon 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Made entirely with Chardonnay and aged in barriques, this medium-bodied white offers delicate aromas of yellow stone fruit, crushed herb and a whiff of toast. The polished linear palate demonstrates restraint and finesse, delivering mature yellow apple, peach, a sprinkling of ginger and coffee notes. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2021.

name: Talley 2017 Rosemary's Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Aged in new French oak for 12 months, this leads with a pronounced toasty oak character expressed in layers of baking spice, cedar plank-grilled apple, ripe yellow melon, clove-spiked orange and toasted brioche. It's round and plush in the mouth, with rich flavors of grilled apple, cantaloupe and peach pit that are balanced by ample acidity. It's a well-balanced and decadent wine for those that like a richer Chardonnay experience.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Brut Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: Creamy aromas of lemon meringue, butterscotch and toasted marshmallow are cut by zesty lemon peels and flesh on the nose of this bottling. It's a very full expression of Chardonnay on the palate, where toast and almond tones are leveled by lemon-lime acidity and white-flower flavors, all finishing on a caramel candy tone.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: A subtle flintiness graces the nose of this bright and lively wine, with supporting tones of lightly grilled apple, peach pit, lemon verbena and a touch of freshly dried hay. The barely medium-weight palate shows good fruit intensity, with ample apple and underripe peach tones, and a lingering sweet spice accent that adds depth and interest. There's great cut, thanks to the superbly focused natural acidity, and a clean, mineral freshness that lifts the finish.

name: Ruby Hill Winery 2017 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Clean and crisp aromas of Asian pear, toast with lemony butter, white flowers and white rocks show on the nose of this bottling from a coveted vineyard in the Corralitos area. There is great tension on the sip, where pear, lime peel and lychee flavors grip the palate and don't let go.

name: Sandhi 2017 Bentrock Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: One of New Zealand's most inimitable leading lights delivers the goods in this elegant Chardonnay. The nose is nutty, salty and buttery, balanced by bright stone fruit, orange peel, honeysuckle and a beach shell mineral nuance. The textural palate rushes over the tongue like water over river stones. The toasty oak is present but is well integrated, providing structure and balance amid crystalline acidity and a long, salty, citrusy finish. This is a beautiful food wine right now, but could withstand some time in the cellar until around 2026.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Tones of wet chalk, lime blossom and citrus pith make for an aromatic entry to this bottling. The palate shows orange skin, light oak and an intensely chalky minerality, clinging to the mouth with tang and structure. It is texturally complex but it goes down easy as well.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This is a fresh, vibrant and all-around high-toned white from the heart of the Olivet Lane District. It is full in weight and concentrated in welcoming teases of citrus pith, lemongrass and ginger.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: This is a juicy full-bodied white that is well balanced by crisp apple and orange flavors. Integrated tones of nutmeg and ginger offer support, while a lasting note of wet stone underlines a mineral component.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Fermented in new oak but aged in neutral, this single-vineyard expression from Dusty Road Vineyard offers aromas of honeysuckle, chalk and squeezed tangerine on the delicate and fresh nose. There is tons of grip to the sip, where exuberant citrus and stone-fruit flavors are bright and carried by racy acidity.

name: Enrico Serafino 2015 Oudeis Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: The winery's stainless-fermented white is so good and such a value for the quality that it cannot be recommended highly enough. Licorice, anise and green apple combine around a steely core of crisp acidity and lengthy balance that impresses from start to finish.

name: Vantz Clippert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This divine and complex white delivers tones of almond paste, sea salt, lime and tangerine that are balanced by fresh, vibrant acidity. This is a well-balanced, food-friendly wine that impresses from start to long finish.

name: Guy Charlemagne 2013 Cuvée Les Coulmets Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Champagne)
description: This impressive white delivers a core of quince, lemon rind and apple that blends with accents of white flower and lemongrass. Crisp acidity drives the freshness on the textured palate, offering elegance and plenty of layers of intrigue. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2021–2026.

name: Cave de Lugny 2017 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)
description: Milky, earthy flavors put a funky spin on this medium-bodied soft-textured wine. Its aromas of chicken stock and turned earth are unusual for the varietal.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: Made from organic grapes, this wine is ultimately bland and uneventful, with a slight taste of hazelnut.

name: Maso Martis 2015 Dosaggio Zero Riserva Sparkling (Trento)
description: High-toned floral aromas and flavors mark this memorable, elegant and delicately textured wine, buoyant in acidity and fresh hits of tangerine, lime and a tease of caramel. The structure is impressive, suggesting potential aging, and the wine has an undeniable hint of wet stone-like mineral that lingers.

name: Stolo 2017 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This wine shines in fresh flavors of tangerine and grapefruit. Bright acidity lends structure to the light-bodied palate, giving it an elegant and lasting impression.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2018 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: Quiet notes of melon and apple show on the nose. The palate is oily and heavy, with little acidity to prop it up, finishing on a synthetic banana and Band-Aid note.

name: Torres 2016 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: Heady in oak and a forceful taste of caramel, this continues in bold baked flavors of pineapple, vanilla and matchstick. It is intensely flavorful and ripe.

name: Torres 2016 Milmanda Chardonnay (Conca de Barberà)
description: Caramelized oak and concentrated, tropically sweet fruit dominate in this full-bodied, lushly crafted wine, textured and layered in bold flavors of baked pear and pineapple.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This is a simple, no frills Chardonnay that offers up ripe aromas of melon, citrus and honeysuckle. The palate is buttery though not heavy, thanks to a good lick of acidity that keeps things lifted.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This lightly herbal wine offers a apple skin flavor. It is easygoing in feel, with a brisk finish.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Plenty of butter and butterscotch aromas start this wine off with a bang, while equally effusive pear and ripe apple flavors join in on the palate. There's a touch of earthiness, but the pastry character really carries this medium-bodied wine.

name: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: A quiet nose of citrus, stone and apple peel offers a fresh, zesty start. The palate is crisp and tart in lemon rind and green-apple flavors, with a delicate bitter note on the finish. Enjoy with food to help cut through the acidity.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: This white has a hot spicy opening from the oak that tastes of peppercorn. The palate is moderate in ripeness with drying tannins and a shortness of fruit.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Welcoming aromas of melon, apple and buttercup get this blend of 80% Chardonnay along with Riesling and Moscato off to a solid start. A round, melony palate is just fresh enough, but also creamy. Flavors of apple, papaya and green banana finish plump and healthy, with a hint of bitter citrus pith. For a three-year-old Brazilian white blend, this is quite good.

name: Handpicked 2015 Collection Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)
description: This simple, fruity wine has an attractive touch of minerality as well as fresh acidity. It is soft, juicy and ready to drink.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: A waxy, petrol-like character initially wafts from the glass of this wine, followed by notes of bitter melon, spiced orange and mealy apple flesh. The palate is medium in weight, but shows good acidity and a lightly toasty note that works in harmony. There's a subtle texture too, with notes of wood-grilled apple and peach pit lingering on the close.

name: Château du Châtelard 2018 Secret de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: Guava, yellow gooseberry and pineapple core form a fruity mélange at the heart of this wine. The palate is light and zippy, with a prickly sensation and ample acidity to lift the fruit tones and carry freshness through to the mouthwatering finish. It's direct, clean and easy to like.

name: Twisted Cedar 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is a soft, open wine, just hinting at texture but more focused on accessible white fruits and light, succulent acidity. Its easy character means the wine is ready to drink now.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Thyme, bread crust, walnut and citrus aromas lift out of the glass. On the sharp palate, you'll find medicinal herb, orange peel and bitter walnut alongside steely bubbles.

name: Handpicked 2015 Collection Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)
description: This wine layered with wood and crisp green and white fruits comes from vineyards close to Savigny-lès-Beaune. A yeasty edge gives a rustic character to the otherwise fresh fruitiness. Drink now.

name: Handpicked 2015 Collection Chardonnay (Yarra Valley)
description: Pineapple, orange zest and other tropical-fruit aromas carry on the lean palate along with bitter walnut and a hint of medicinal herb. Sharp bubbles and racy acidity provide the lively background.

name: Altvs 2017 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This simple sparkler has delicate aromas and flavors suggesting mature yellow-apple skin, chamomile and citrus peel alongside bright acidity. It closes on a bitter note.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This fresh-tasting wine from one of Mendocino's most reliable wineries has vivid apple and pear aromas, ripe and fruity flavors and very little oakiness to get in the way. A bit on the soft side in texture, it's easy to sip.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: This has unusually low alcohol for a Chardonnay, which may indicate some residual sugar has been left in the finished wine. Light in weight and texture, it hints at apple and banana, with a touch of toast from 15 months in barrel.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Brioche, baked fig and crème brûlée mark this bold full-figured wine, which traffics in additional rich tones of marshmallow and vanilla. It's made in a hearty style and will appeal to fans of voluptuousness.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: An attractive, warm, yellow-fruit character gives this wine roundness to go with the ripe acidity and fruitiness. Made to enjoy young, it is ready now.

name: Dark Horse 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: So rich that it tastes sugary, this wine smells and tastes like lemon meringue pie. The texture is smooth and syrupy, the flavors are mostly sweet and the acidity is very soft.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Smoke and maple-syrup elements give a flamboyant edge to this rich-tasting oaky wine. It's candied in flavor and almost cloying in mouthfeel.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Marshmallow aromas and butter flavors give this wine a candied, confectionery character. It shows very obvious oak influences and has a soft, almost cloying texture.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Briny, yeasty haystack aromas lack fruit. This Peruvian sparkler is made of Chardonnay, and it feels all right. A mix of tropical fruit and bitter citrus flavors don't change much on the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A nose of banana and powdered candies carries to the light-bodied palate. There is slight roundness to the feel, with spritzy acidity maintaining freshness.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This seems to be the current release, though it's well past its prime. It's short, simple and generic, with a bitter finish. Drink up.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Paxis White (Lisboa)
description: There's a funky, mealy edge to the nose of this wine, with hints of yellow flower, orange peel and apple flesh. The palate is light and thin, with a watery midpalate and a searing zip of acidity that rises on the finish.

name: Otazu 2016 Pago de Otazu Chardonnay con Crianza Chardonnay (Pago de Otazu)
description: Dark in color, this wine offers a sharp taste of apple and lemon, remaining high toned within a generous ripeness. There's a metallic twinge to the finish.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: This straightforward wine is medium bodied, medium flavored and rather simple in structure. Bolstered with 2% of Moscato, it has light fruit-cocktail aromas and mild hints of vanilla.

name: Frank Family 2017 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Dark in color and possessed of prominent oak, this is a hearty white with bold layers of vanilla and melon.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: An initial aroma of buttered popcorn leads into additional scents of peach pit and lightly toasted apple skin. The medium-weight mouthfeel offers more of the same, with medium acidity to balance the richness and lend brightness as well as a mouthwatering sensation to the close.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Very fruity, soft and on the sweet side, this thick and medium-bodied wine tastes simple and straightforward. It shows ripe, lush Bartlett pear and Fuji apple aromas and flavors, and very low acidity.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: Light gold in color, this leads with aromas of orange peel, mealy melon and overripe pineapple. The medium-weight palate offers more ripe fruit tones that are juxtaposed by an odd and assertive bitterness and melon-rind flavor. The slightly nutty finish has a toasted-apple character.

name: DFJ Vinhos 2018 Point West Alvarinho-Chardonnay (Lisboa)
description: From a majority of Monterey-grown grapes, this showcases floral honeysuckle and a sweetness of vanilla oak within light-bodied ripeness and approachability.

name: Bota Box 2018 Nighthawk Gold Chardonnay (California)
description: With a perfume of fresh melon and baked pear, this full-bodied, concentrated wine has a metallic edge that distracts.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of pureed corn, citrus cream and melon carry the nose of this unoaked wine. It's broad and silken in feel on the palate, with soft fruit flavors and a lactic undercurrent.

name: Georges Duboeuf 2017  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine opens in a strong grasp of honey, apple and stone fruit, with a mix of high acidity and viscosity. Approachable, the oak is buttery but thick and out of tune with the high-toned fruit.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas like butterscotch and salted peanuts join candied-fruit and apple-juice flavors in this full-bodied, fat and sassy wine. It has an apparent touch of sweetness to accompany all those rich and indulgent characteristics.

name: Manuel Olivier 2017 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)
description: A partnership between Brett Zimmerman and winemaker Ed Killian, this shows thick, concentrated flavors of sweetly baked tropical fruit and crème brûlée. The oak is prominent and adds touches of vanilla along the way.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is fresh, fruity and uncomplicated, showing apple-skin aromas, ripe pear and apple flavors and touches of brown sugar on the finish. It is generous in flavor and soft in balance.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Waxy melon and apple aromas are holding their own and not fading. A firm, fleshy palate is braced by vital acidity, while this Chardonnay tastes of apple, green melon and nectarine. Modest heat on the finish is more than tolerable; drink now.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: Big tropical-fruit flavors meet salty oak in this voluptuous, lush wine, that displays a full-bodied style of optimum ripeness. An earthy underbelly of white flowers and apple blossom provide contrast.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Citrus-driven with strong floral aromatics and high-toned acidity, this is a full-bodied and fleshy white that is ample in ripeness. Green apple shines and provides a lasting note of tartness on the finish.

name: Côtière 2017 Talley Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Textured and approachable in style, this is medium bodied and holds its oak well, showing a melding together of strong green-apple flavor twisted in lemon.

name: Manuel Olivier 2018 Chardonnay  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: Partial wood aging has given a wine that is just touched by spice. The fruit is much more important: cool, fragrant and with acidity and green-fruit flavors. Drink this wine now.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: This softly textured and fruity wine shows the possibilities of Chardonnay within Beaujolais. The wine has minerality, good acidity, crisp apple flavors and is ready to drink.

name: Skyside 2017 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Consistent as the day is long, this southern Oregon pioneer brings a fresh, lively style to this tasty summer sipper. Fermented in French oak, it's aged on the lees but not put through malolactic, leaving snappy acidity firmly in place. A little bit of a chill won't hurt it a bit on a warm spring or summer afternoon.

name: McWilliam's 2017 McW Reserve 660 Chardonnay (Tumbarumba)
description: One of the first 2017 Chardonnays out of the gate, this was fermented in a mix of stainless steel and neutral oak. This puts the pressure on the fruit, never an easy task with inexpensive Chardonnay. Here, it's sharp and a bit thin, suggesting neutral apple flavors. It broadens out a bit in the mouth and brings a light hint of toast, neutral barrels notwithstanding.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Initially funky aromas of lees and yellow apple lead to light, bright flavors. It doesn't all come together but there are interesting things going on.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This apple and citrus-flavored wine is crisp while also having a sense of the sun on this southern Burgundy vineyard owned by the Dutron family. The wine is perfumed with ripe acidity, with a textured aftertaste. Drink from late 2019.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: A softly textured, ripe wine, this is immediately attractive. Full of bright acidity as well as richness, the wine has a slight yeasty character as well as great, open fruitiness. Drink now.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This has inviting wafts of spicy ginger, nutmeg and clove from the beginning, and then notes of oak that follow through with flavors of Asian pear and lemon. The acidity is moderate and the body full and concentrated, with a lasting note of butter.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: White wildflower and white stone fruit aromas waft out of the glass. On the palate, fresh acidity brightens mature yellow apple, toasted nut and a coffee note while a foaming mousse lends softness.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Light aging in old wood has opened up this ripe and fruity wine. Apple and melon flavors are enhanced by spice as well as the mineral-textured acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: At the moment this wine is reductive, and far less exciting than this normally first-rate producer's upper tier wine, Luminosa. Those oniony, Band-Aid notes do blow off with time in the glass, and underneath are notes of waxy lemon, salted nut and toast oak. The palate is also somewhat closed in on itself, but the crunchy acidity, citrus fruit and chalky texture all show promise. Give this another six months to a year in bottle for things to knit together.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Moderate in apple, peach and oak, this is a medium-bodied well-made wine at a fair price point that delivers approachable flavors, texture and balanced acidity.

name: Cascadian Outfitters NV Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals field flower and white stone-fruit aromas. On the racy, linear palate, fresh acidity and a foamy perlage accompany Golden Delicious apple, crushed herb and lemon zest. It closes on a nutty note.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Sourced from vineyards in the vast expanse of South Eastern Australia, this is an aromatic and opulent Chardonnay. It charges out of the gate with aromas of grapefruit rind, anise, white flowers and vanilla. It's creamy but not overtly so, and is supported by toasty oak.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Aromas and flavors of vanilla, candlewax, custard and clarified butter are out front. Abundant peach notes follow. It seems a bit stylized but still has balance and appeal.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: While rather light in flavor, this medium-bodied wine is well balanced, dry and appetizing. Crisp apple and white peach notes round out the brisk texture.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Aged in stainless steel to preserve the fresh fruit, this wine has a light, poised touch. Crisp sliced apples and lime acidity are given a textured touch that adds to the refreshing character of the wine. Drink from 2020.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: This is lighter than the previous vintage, almost to the point of being steely, but it's cloaked in a bit of toast from barrel fermentation and brief aging. Not a rich wine, but well-structured with clean tree fruit flavors, it's what used to be called a classic food wine.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Golden in color, this is a creamy, likable white with some age on it that shows bold layers of Gravenstein apple and pear. There's a steely backbone of acidity that complements well.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: From the Aegerter family estate, this wine is soft, ripe and warm while keeping a light touch of acidity. The yellow fruits with balanced acidity are delicious and the wine is ready to drink.

name: Husch 2017 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This is a solidly medium-bodied wine that offers a balanced combo of bright fruit, oak and minerals. Citrus, pineapple, toast and seashell aromas lead to a palate that's creamy but buoyed by zippy acidity. The toasty oak creeps back on the midpalate, and the finish is on the short side.

name: Chateau Souverain 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a nicely balanced, well-modulated wine that combines ample fruit notes with a honey and almond overlay and a very smooth mouthcoating texture. It is medium bodied and subtle in its richness.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Hazelnut and browned butter mesh with lemon cream on the nose of this full-flavored and bold Chardonnay from the Foley family. The flavors are rounded and rich, with butter-poached apples and creamy lemon, proving very powerful.

name: Ferrari NV Brut Chardonnay (Trento)
description: Aromas of marzipan, white-peach cream and a hint of marshmallow are cut by a streak of sour citrus on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers sour lemon, toasted nuts and, in the midpalate, a fleshy nectarine flavor.

name: Peirano 2017 The Heritage Collection Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This wine's aromas of peach, lemon, honeysuckle and seashell are followed by a clean, refreshing, bright-fruited palate that shows texture without weight or clunky oak. A simple but likable drop.

name: Domaine du Granit 2018 Chardonnay  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)
description: Harvested from vines around the chateau, this wine is attractively balanced, full of fruit and crisp with acidity. Its bright character is enhanced by the mineral texture and lively aftertaste. It will be ready to drink from late 2019.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Bread crust, mature yellow stone fruit and dried herb aromas lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the lively linear palate offers mature Golden Delicious apple, citrus zest and a toasted walnut note alongside a continuous perlage.

name: Flambeaux 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Aromas of bitter walnut, orange rind, chamomile and toasted bread crust propel out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the racy palate along with yellow-apple skin while continuous bubbles and vibrant acidity provide the backdrop. It finishes on a bitter note.

name: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Almost a tad pink in the glass, this stainless steel expression is very exuberant on the nose, showing bubblegum, wet slate, mango and pineapple aromas. The palate is also ripe and refreshing, with tropical flavors of coconut and papaya.

name: Pierre Legras 2012 Monographie Brut Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: A blend of old vines from across the appellation, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. Touches of yellow fruits contrast with the crisper acidity and citrus edge. This wood-aged wine has good aging potential. Drink from 2021.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This generous and full-flavored wine layers pear syrup and vanilla over spiced apple notes. A soft mouthfeel makes the fruit seem even riper, and extends the finish. While not overtly oaky, the wine teases out both nutmeg and vanilla notes that add complexity.

name: MooBuzz 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Bright citrus and green-apple notes liven up this fresh, crisply textured wine. It has vibrant acidity, light and fruity flavors and a great sense of vitality.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This informal white has subdued aromas evoking yellow apple and green melon. The aromas carry on to the extremely simple light-bodied palate.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of ripe stone fruit, citrus and spring blossom form the nose. On the rounded medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies green melon and Bartlett pear.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Peach-pit, apricot, lemon-peel and blossom aromas suffer from a sharp undercurrent of pepper. Ripe apples and fresh lemons settle on a dry round palate, with mellow acidity. There is a little white pepper and crushed mineral combo on the lightly tugging finish, with notes of ripe pear.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Here's a big, full-bodied Pinot Grigio that offers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, yellow pear and flinty minerals alongside just enough fresh acidity. It closes on a note of candied tangerine slice.

name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: After a few swirls of the glass, you'll find whiffs of dried wild flower, baked apple and toasted almond, while the round full-bodied palate offers mature yellow apple, white peach and candied lemon slice. A vanilla note lingers on the close while just enough fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Round and creamy, this has enticing scents of ripe apple, white peach and citrus zest that follow over to the savory palate along with a hint of vanilla. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.

name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: Round and full bodied, this savory white boasts pear, baked apple and orange-zest aromas and flavors. It closes on a note of toasted hazelnut and a hint of flinty mineral.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This fragrant copper-colored wine boasts enticing scents of acacia, Spanish broom, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of wet stone. The elegantly structured savory palate evokes ripe Rennet apple, white peach and orange drop alongside tangy acidity.

name: Borsao 2016 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: This wine was cofermented with Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling and Muscat. The aromas are compelling, with notes of freshly cut apple, petroleum jelly, honeysuckle, peach and pear. There's a beautiful sense of lightness, texture and freshness to the fruit flavors that linger on the finish. The balance is exquisite.

name: Dark Horse NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a drinkable but very bland wine showing almost neutral flavors, low alcohol and a soft texture.

name: I Am 2018 Pinot Grigio (Romania)
description: Straightforward notes of citrus and apple have a light cabbage tinge on the nose. The palate is light and relatively neutral in flavor, ending on a crisp citrus note.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: A muddled aroma of lemon and gardenia carries to the light-bodied palate. This is simple and straightforward in its appeal.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light and very lean wine smells like fresh thyme and pine needles, tastes very crisp and delicate, has low alcohol and good refreshment qualities.

name: Stemmari 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: Fresh in feel and a touch sweet, this fruity wine is light bodied and shows flavors of flowers and apples, supported by a soft texture.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
