description: Full bodied and fragrant, this has varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine, hay, tropical fruit and honeysuckle. The juicy structured palate doles out yellow peach, green melon, grilled herb and a citrus drop note. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Tropical-fruit, tomato-vine and elder-flower aromas lead the nose. On the round ripe palate, notes of white pepper and nutmeg accent ripe honeydew melon, white peach, pineapple and lemon drop.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Tropical fruit, white spring flower and a whiff of tomato leaf form the expressive nose. Reflecting the aromas, the savory medium-bodied palate doles out honeydew melon, white peach and pineapple before a tangy, almost saline finish. Crisp acidity keeps it fresh.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: With a tiny amount of Sémillon and Muscat, this is stony, floral and herbal, with a flinty hint of oak. Full bodied, it has hearty flavors of lemon candy and meringue that underline its essential richness.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Textured, round and yet steely, this wine offers a straightforward approach and subdued ripeness. A touch of peach sparks the midpalate with lovely flavor.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of white grapefruit, hay, elderflower and a whiff of crushed tomato leaf shape the nose. The aromas follow over to the linear elegant palate, along with white peach and a hint of dried pineapple alongside tangy acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: In spite of the difficult vintage in Marlborough, this is a strong offering from Jules Taylor. There's a little reduction at first, but the flinty, salty nuances actually add character to the already appealing lemon, stone fruit, red apple skin, grass and green bean notes. The palate balances a creamy texture with crunchy acidity and a salty, citrusy finish.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Honeysuckle, tomato-leaf and honeydew-melon aromas shape the nose. Bright, linear and savory, the palate doles out Meyer lemon, nectarine and pear while a mineral note of saline accents the finish.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Given time in both neutral French oak and stainless steel, with 23% Sauvignon Musque clone in the mix, this white is creamy in peach, pear and apple skin flavors. Complex, layered and textured, it weaves jolts of acidity and spicy pepper along the way.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Very light aromas of yellow rose, wet gravel, honeysuckle and tart green apple show on the nose of this bottling. The sip is tense and zippy, combining rounded nectarine and chilled apple flavors with intriguing touches of lemongrass and chive.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit, elder flower and citrus almost leap out of the glass on this expressive but elegant wine. Elegantly structured, the savory palate delivers juicy white grapefruit, pineapple and mature apricot alongside tangy acidity.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Racy and fragrant, this vibrant white is loaded with finesse and tension, opening with aromas of citrus, wild herb and a whiff of honeysuckle. On the elegant, tangy palate, crisp acidity accompanies juicy pineapple, white grapefruit and succulent white peach alongside an energizing saline note.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Blended with 5% Sémillon, this wine is lushly aromatic in jasmine, flint and dried herb. A tiny hint of fresh-cut grass nips at the edge of the light-bodied palate, with fresh apricot and peach at the core.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: From the producer's Hardie Ranch, this is a 100%-varietal white fermented and aged in both stainless steel and oak foudre. The creamy palate brings elements of peach, dried herb and freshly cut grass, with a lengthy finish of stone.

name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: This offers classic if delicate varietal scents of white flower, Bartlett pear and a citrus note. The vibrant, linear palate shows crisp green apple and tangerine zest alongside racy acidity that gives it a tangy finish.

name: Chaddsford 2016 CFW Pinot Grigio (Pennsylvania)
description: Unusually dry and tangy, this light-bodied wine smells like celery and herbs, and tastes very lean and straightforward.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Soft and fresh, this medium-bodied wine has clean, neutral flavors and is easy to sip. Aromas are a little peachy while flavors suggest pears. The texture is mild.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Light mineral and lemon-rind aromas are followed by dry, tart flavors. It should shine on the dinner table.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: An eye-catching, conversation-starting color of faded orange-pink, this wine shows bright peach, watermelon and red apple on the nose. The palate is full and fruity, yet cut with citrus acidity, offering orange, underripe cantaloupe and lime-rind flavors.

name: Tamarack Cellars 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A light rosé color and assertive fruit flavors help this full-bodied wine stand out. It lights up with watermelon and peach notes and has a crisp balance and firm texture from being fermented with the skins, in the same way that red wines are made.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Refreshing and charming, this light-bodied wine has aromas like apple skin and lemongrass, with a sweet-tart flavor and good acidity. It's all clean and crisp.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This simple white offers delicate hints of pear and citrus while vibrant acidity gives it a crisp, short finish. It's a quaffing wine to pour at picnics and other informal get-togethers.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Peach and honeysuckle aromas lead the way on this lively wine and carry over to the straightforward palate along with citrusy notes. It's simple but well made.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit, yellow flower and a hint of nut lead the nose. On the informal palate, brisk acidity brightens banana, white peach and pear.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This opens with delicate aromas of white spring blossom and orchard fruit. The bright, straightforward palate offers Kaiser pear, juicy yellow peach and a lemon zest note alongside vibrant acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Gold, with delicate copper highlights—the natural color of Pinot Grigio juice when it has contact with the grape skins—this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and fragrant wild flower. The bright palate offers yellow peach, apple and a note of candied lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.

name: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)
description: White spring flower, Bosc pear and wet stone aromas lift out of the glass. The bright, straightforward palate offers apple, tangerine and a hint of almond alongside bright acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose on this lively white. The fresh, easy-drinking palate offers ripe green apple, peach and a juicy citrus note alongside tangy acidity.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of green apple and white peach lead the nose on this refreshing white while the medium-bodied palate offers ripe pear and juicy nectarine zest. Bright acidity gives it focus and a clean finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Enticing aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and flint waft out of the glass. The fresh, refined palate doles out ripe Bosc pear, nectarine peel and a mineral note alongside bright acidity.

name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Aromas of white peach, flint and hint of banana carry over to the round, ripe palate along with green apple and a note of juicy tangerine. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors and leads to a bright, clean finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Elegantly structured and savory, this offers aromas of white field flower, orchard fruit and chopped herb. Boasting depth and finesse, the bright, juicy palate delivers mature pear, tangerine zest and flinty mineral alongside fresh acidity that lifts the creamy flavors.

name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: Delicate aromas that recall spring wild flower, orchard fruit, herb and crushed rock lead the nose on this structured white. Aged partly in large casks, the round, full-bodied palate offers ripe pear, nectarine and a flinty mineral note while fresh acidity provides balance.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Structured and elegant, this lovely Pinot Grigio opens with delicate scents of white Alpine flower, citrus and a whiff of herb. The bright palate offers creamy white peach, crisp green apple and juicy nectarine while a mineral note backs up the finish. Bright acidity provides lift and balance.

name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Gold with copper highlights, this elegantly structured wine offers heady scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit. On the juicy, savory palate, nutmeg and mineral notes back up ripe apple, mature pear and apricot that lead to a fresh finish.

name: Lange 2018 Classique Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Made in a frankly commercial, off-dry style, this is dangerously quaffable. Pronounced apple, pear and melon flavors are balanced by moderate acidity and a hint of ginger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Windchaser 2017 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: White spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of Alpine herb come together on this delicious, structured white. The juicy, full-bodied palate offers white peach, mature pear and tangerine alongside bright acidity that lifts the creamy flavors. A precise mineral note closes the lingering finish and lends finesse.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Full-bodied and elegant, this opens with aromas of mature orchard fruit, crushed stone and nut. The linear, structured palate boasts more complexity than most Pinot Grigios, offering ripe pear, toasted almond, mineral and dollop of acacia honey. Drink through 2020.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Round and juicy, this opens with aromas of stone fruit, dried herb and a whiff of pear. The ripe, enveloping palate doles out white peach, mature apple, juicy nectarine and a hint of bitter almond. A mineral note closes the lingering finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light-bodied, dry wine smells fresh and fruity, tastes like crisp apples and honeydew melon, and has a soft texture that makes it easy to sip.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Aromas of white flowers and ripe banana lead the way to flavors of tart green apple and melon. The finish is pleasant but slightly acidic.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Pineapple, citrus blossom, and white peach aromas prepare your palate for tastes of green apple, lemon zest and apricots. The finish is crisp and acidic.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: One of the few bubbling Pinot Grigios available in California, there's enough promise here to wonder why not more. Pink grapefruit, ripe peach, kiwi and Gravenstein apple aromas show on the nose, while the palate picks up light apple cider, lime juice and jasmine flavors.

name: Fox Meadow 2018 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)
description: The aromas of apple and pear are light, seeming to show some lees influence. Flavors are dry and straight down the fairway on this innocuous easy drinker.

name: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Light aromas like canned fruit cocktail and almost sweet flavors like banana and marshmallow characterize this medium-bodied wine.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: There's an intriguing touch of grassiness on the nose of this bottling that also shows restrained yet tropical aromas of mango and green papaya. The palate is less interesting, with light melon flavors and a lack of bright acidity.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: This wine tastes very tangy and crisp. Medium bodied, with lemon and green-apple flavors, it's refreshing and mouth-cleansing.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: White blossoms and fresh green herbs perfume this full-bodied wine. Dry in style and refreshingly tart, it finishes briskly with a bit of floral flair.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Ripe honeydew melon and grapefruit flavors are edged with lime acidity in this sunny, dry wine. It's refreshing and crisp, with a hint of dusty mineral on the finish.

name: La Bellanotte 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Waxy lemon and pear aromas are muddled by bee pollen aromas. The palate is light and watery, driven by a plastic citrus flavor.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Steve Clifton takes this common grape on an uncommonly tasty spin, starting with taut and fresh aromas of green-apple flesh, grapefruit pith and light white flowers. The earthy palate shows river-stone and wet-cement minerality but also Key lime and Gravenstein apple warmth, all wrapped up in a compelling texture.

name: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This light-bodied wine smells like honeydew melon and canteloupe and tastes almost sweet. The texture falls between bright and rich.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This ripe yet varietally true style features scents of baked pear, ripe melon, cinnamon and allspice. This is plump but lacking true depth, finishing short.

name: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)
description: This medium-bodied wine doesn't show much of the variety's mouthfeel, but does show clean, dry flavors of melon and citrus. Enjoy it now through the end of 2016.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This bottling's extreme grapefruit pithiness meets with rainy cement and a touch of rubber on the nose. The flavors are quite reductive, with tar and sour crab apple touches.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: Melon and citrus aromas and flavors mingle easily in this cleanly made quaffer. It's a bit plump on the palate, yet refreshing on the lemon-lime finish.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: Nicely rendered, with varietally correct aromas of pear, citrus and almond skin. There's a bit of texture to this wine's medium-bodied palate before it eases into a clean, mouthwatering finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Fresh Anjou pear mixes with candied banana on the nose of this straight-forward Pinot Grigio. Light and zippy, the palate is green-apple focused, finishing on a creamy lemon note.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: The wine smells and tastes like fresh, crisp pippin apples, has a lively, refreshing texture and soothing fruity aftertaste.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Light floral aromas and more rich and savory flavors make this wine satisfying to drink. It's light-bodied, fairly soft in texture and has a light sugary finish.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a good, medium-bodied wine with light aromas, fairly neutral flavors and a very clean, straightforward personality. It will suit a crowd.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Loaded with ripe pear, muskmelon and tropical fruit, this is a medium-bodied, plump white with crowd appeal. It seems a bit off dry, but closes on a citrusy note.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is plump and custardy in feel, but still refreshing thanks to bright apple and lime aromas and flavors. It's more citrus than apple on the crisp finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This wine's pinkish-coppery hue suggests a bit of skin contact, as does the silky texture on the palate. Hints of gingery spice accent flavors of poached pear, finishing on a dry, dusty note.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: An admirable effort, combining lemony citrus notes with hints of pear and quince. It's medium in body, with a long, crisp finish.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: Sweet and bubbly, this light-bodied wine tastes fruity and floral, with a frothy, mouthfilling texture.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: This medium-bodied, substantive wine is complex and appealing, with aromas like canteloupe and prosciutto and dry, tangy flavors like peach skin. It's not outright fruity but very appetizing.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Lime and grapefruit aromas lead to crisp, dry and fresh citrus flavors in this medium-bodied and tautly balanced wine with a lively personality.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This bold, full-bodied white is a nifty showcase of Pinot Gris's unique duality. On the nose, it seems quite spry and cutting, wafting of crushed minerals, crisp green-apple skins and blossoms. The palate, however, is weighty and mouth filling, a testament to 30 days of maturation on its lees. It maintains its fresh, fruity flair and pleasantly sunny citrus acidity.

name: A to Z 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: The aromas bring fresh notes of pear, melon, star fruit and flowers. The palate is clean and broad in feel, lingering on the finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Fresh and bright, this bottling shows aromas of sliced pear, lemongrass, hay and honeydew, with a creamy character on the nose. A great line of acidity cuts across the sip, where tart lime and lemon-pith flavors reign.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Slightly briny aromas akin to orange peel open this citric PG. Dry orange flavors are more or less it, while this holds steady and stays fresh across a standard finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells sweet but tastes dry. Vivid fruit aromas and flavors, and a lively, tangy mouthfeel add lots of personality. It smells like apples and honey and tastes like crisp apples and citrus.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: What an interesting, unique and minerally wine. Aromas evoke both melon and prosciutto. The texture is dry, even slightly astringent, supporting the subtle but complex flavors like Badoit water, cucumber and lemon.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Light aromas of pear, white flowers and melon lead to dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It doesn't bring much complexity but still offers plenty of appeal.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This bottling is easy, light and crisp, starting with squeezed orange and ripe yellow apples on the nose. It's delicate on the palate, with citrus and stone-fruit flavors, just right for an afternoon sip in the sun.

name: Carlton Cellars 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Pale straw in the glass, this wine has aromas of lemon grass and grapefruit pith that pave the way for delightful flavors of Honey Crisp apples and red grapefruit juice.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Aromas of apple and pear are followed by dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors, dipping a bit in the middle before coming back together.

name: A to Z 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Underlying notes of vanilla soften the aromas of pineapple, grapefruit and lemon zest. Medium bodied with crisp acidity in the mouth, there are flavors of apple and lemon curd in the long finish.

name: Colutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Apple peels, squeezed lime, rain on cement, jicama and Asian-pear aromas show on the crisp yet rounded nose of this bottling by actress Drew Barrymore. The palate is quite inviting with broad apple flavors, offering just enough texture and acidity to keep all sorts of wine lovers interested.

name: Fox Meadow 2018 Pinot Grigio (Virginia)
description: Earthy aromas and savory, herbal flavors make this light-bodied wine taste a little funky. It has good acidity and a fresh texture, however.

name: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Most of the action is on the outside of this gaudy bottle. However, this light and slightly sweet wine has appley, floral flavors and a soft, easy texture.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Melon and citrus aromas are clean and easy, not pungent. This feels good, with limited but solid white-grapefruit and orange flavors. A dry juicy finish tastes mildly bitter but isn't too severe.

name: Feudo Arancio 2018 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)
description: Almost neutral in flavor, this light and smooth wine is innocuous, crisp and refreshing.

name: Three Thieves 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This wine has more body and a richer mouthfeel than many of its peers, with mild floral and almond flavors and a touch of butterscotch.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Light aromas of apple, pear and petroleum jelly are followed by crisp acid-driven flavors. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Fresh green-apple aromas and crisp, lemony flavors make this light-bodied wine appetizing and fresh.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Light aromas like canteloupe and flavors like honeydew melon make this wine fruity and easy to enjoy. It's medium bodied, fruity and smooth.

name: SeaGlass 2018 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: A mix of floral, tropical and citrus aromas is more than fine. A snappy citric palate is racy and high in cleansing acidity. Citrus flavors are plain and simple, while this is entirely clean and fresh on the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: The nose on this bottling is bright, fresh and clean, with lots of apple, Key lime and squeezed-citrus touches. Snappy pear flavors show first on the sip, then come riper yellow peach and cantaloupe, all framed by jubilant acidity. There's nothing too complex, but it's a refreshing sipper.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and rich in peach and nectarine, this well-made white shows light-bodied ripeness and buzzy acidity. The midpalate has a pleasing lushness and hint of grit.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Tight and fresh aromas of Key lime and grass make for a subtle entry to this zesty bottling. There is great tension on the very stony sip, where rainy cement, lime skin and white-fruit flavors make for a satisfyingly complete package.

name: Brancott 2015 Chosen Rows Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This barrel-fermented wine is less overtly rich than you'd expect given the treatment, although it still puts texture front and center. Notes of citrus, tropical fruit, bell pepper, flint, salt and toast carry the nose. The mouthfeel is slick in a lemon pith flavor, with lean acidity lending support and a savory, toasty, vanillin character on the finish. Drink now–2027.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is pleasantly and lightly fruity, offers a touch of mineral complexity and has good balance and medium body. It shows a bit of restraint that's appealing in a varietal category crammed with extroverted wines.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine has aromas of pineapple and juniper berry. It feels good on the palate, offering flavors of grapefruit, pineapple, lemon sorbet and chopped parsley and a bright finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Green pyrazine aromas are offset by milder and fruitier notes of green apple and citrus. This SB feels plump and lower than usual in acidity. Ripe flavors of nectarine, green plum and green herbs remain mildly green on a finish, with just enough acidic support.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is stainless-steel fermented, opening with a fresh lively nose of legume and pea shoot. Robust in mouthfeel, it has additional flavors of anise, apple and pear, finishing bright and earthy.

name: Giesen 2014 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This young wine shows structure and a strong steely character that is masking the fruit. All will improve as the wine matures, with ripe herbal and citrus flavors shining through the texture. Drink from 2021.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This fragrant, ripe wine offers easy apple and spice flavors. Its herbal edge adds zestiness that goes with the minerality to give it texture and aging potential. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This may not be the world's most complex wine, but it is bright and textural and just plain delicious. Bright lemon-lime and pineapple-rind aromas fill the nostrils, while quieter grass and nettle characters come slowly and softly. The mouthfeel is slippery, with bright, crunchy acidity and plenty of fruity goodness.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The name of the wine says it all, this comes from a vineyard with stony, flinty soil. That's ideal for the mineral texture of this wine with its green fruits, acidity and fresh aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This perfumed wine shines with fruitiness, offering attractive swathes of ripe apple and gooseberry flavors. Lightly textured, the mineral edge gives the wine shape and complexity. Drink from late 2019.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Grassy and richly rounded in pea shoot and fig, this wine is mild in acidity with an intense, steely finish.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: This soft wine has green and citrus flavors that are gentle and fresh. A mineral touch accompanies the bright fruitiness. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This full-bodied wine is bigger than usual for the varietal, offering very ripe melon aromas, rich flavors and a mouthfilling texture.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of cantaloupe, kiwi and peach lead to a broad mouthful of tropical fruit flavors that include pineapple, kiwi and papaya. A slightly warm but still mouthwatering finish caps it off.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This medium-bodied wine combines zesty, grassy aromas with rich fruit flavors for a well-balanced and appetizing character. It shows plenty of citrus, green apple and gooseberry tones.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Light to medium bodied, this wine offers delicate fruit and herb aromas, followed by crisp and lightly fruity flavors that hit the target.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This has a subdued nose that eventually reveals whiffs of exotic fruit and dried aromatic herbs along with a hint of elderberry. Grapefruit and mature apple lead the rounded palate, while a hint of fennel provides backup.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: From Nelson, a wine region just west of Marlborough at the top of the South Island, this is textbook New Zealand Sauvignon, in all its refreshment and fruitiness. It bursts with citrus, pineapple, grass, florals and a touch of salt. The palate is slippery, dry, crisp and fruity. Knock it back on a warm summer's day.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This clean fruity Sauvignon is a classic combo of tropical and citrus fruits and grass characters, buoyed by crisp acidity and a creamy texture. Uncomplicated but refreshing.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Flinty figgy aromas and reserved fig and apple flavors give this full-bodied wine an appealing, rich quality. The wine's initial subtlety is a good thing as it develops slowly in the glass.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and lush, this is a rich, satisfying white for fans of a more voluptuous style. Flavors lean on peach cobbler, vanilla and brioche.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of celery, dried apricot and a whiff of tomato leaf lead the way. The aromas carry over to the lean palate along with grapefruit, graphite and a hint of grilled sage.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Ripe pear and lemon-skin flavors show on the simple nose of this bottling. Clean flavors of crisp apple and pear flesh meet with wet stone on the palate, which is pleasant and familiar.

name: La Tunella 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Fruity aromas of white spring flower, citrus and white stone fruit shape the nose. On the linear palate, crisp acidity accompanies grapefruit, green melon and pineapple along with a hint of dried Alpine herbs.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh and accessible aromas of passion fruit, ripe melon, sweetgrass and wet cement make for a very complete nose on this bottling. The palate is classically crisp, with flavors of gooseberry, lime peels and cut grass, as well as a slightly metallic minerality.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This wine's perfumed yet delicate nose of lime, stone fruit, florals and tomato leaf leads into a palate that is chalky yet slippery, with what feels like a slight bit of residual sugar balanced by zingy acidity and more citrus and floral flavors.

name: Colutta 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This has aromas of grapefruit and a whiff of tomato leaf. On the racy, somewhat lean palate, crisp acidity accompanies pineapple and a hint of green melon.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Opening in jalapeño, dried herb and grass, this light-bodied white comes together in the glass to refresh in crisp acidity and lasting steely texture. It was fermented in both concrete and neutral oak.

name: La Tunella 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This opens with unusual aromas of brimstone, crushed stone and a whiff of bread dough that burn off to reveal white stone fruit and citrus. On the crisp, linear palate, racy acidity frames grapefruit and kiwi before a tangy saline close.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Framingham's whites always have a strong textural element to them, thanks in part to the use of a little skin maceration and barrel aging in oak and acacia. Straightforward but likable, their latest Sauvignon is a medley of bright grapefruit, pineapple, and grass, and snow pea characters, ensconced in a creamy texture and lifted by crunchy acidity and a long, fruit-filled finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Aromas of cut grass, kelp and lemon rinds show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with sour citrus flavors, and slightly more complex hints of oregano and nori wrap.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tropical fruit bomb, with aromas of banana, melon, herbs and kiwi. The lightly styled palate brings more of the same, drawing out on the finish. It has a distinctive style.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a traditional style of Sauvignon made from the Musque clone and emphasizing unabashed grassy, herbaceous aromas and crisp citrus-like flavors on a nicely acidic texture. It tastes refreshing and food friendly.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Both passion fruit and notes of freshly cut grass are subtle on the nose, and there also is an edge of nettle. The palate could do with more focus but catches itself on the fresh, vivid finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Appealing aromas of lemon oil, freshly rubbed herb and fig lead to medium-plus bodied fruit flavors that persist on the finish. The palate brings a sense of heft. A warm finish caps it off.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Elegant and balanced, this lovely white opens with aromas of gooseberry, elderflower, citrus and a whiff of crushed tomato leaf. On the savory palate, crisp acidity supports juicy white grapefruit, green melon and creamy white peach before a tangy close.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Dried botanical herb, citrus, tomato vine and dried spring flower aromas form the nose on this alluring white. Savory and elegant, the linear palate delivers grapefruit, ripe honeydew, creamy white peach and a hint of graphite and oyster shell before a tangy finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Spicy notes from this wine's wood aging balance against rich apricot and nutmeg flavors and a general ripeness. The wine's weight counterpoints the fresh, tangy aftertaste of the Sauvignon Blanc. Drink from late 2019.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: The aromas are subdued, with notes of lemon zest, sweet herbs, fig and tropical fruit. Juicy, sweet, full-feeling tropical fruit flavors follow. It's a somewhat riper style of the variety that delivers.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: In line with this biodynamic winery's attempts to reflect site and vintage as truly as possible, the 2017 Sauvignon is clearly from a cool year. Medium-gold in hue, the restrained nose is a quiet medley of citrus, tomato leaf, flint, salted nuts and toast, thanks to barrel maturation for a portion of the fruit. The palate is highly textural. There's very little fruit here (for a brighter, more approachable SB this vintage, try this producer's Petit Clos wine), and the finish feels like biting into a grape seed. But balance and complexity promises more interest in the coming years. Drink 2020–2025.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Alluring aromas of grilled herbs, dried pineapple slices, tomato leaves and graphite form the nose. On the linear, savory palate, tangy acidity balances grapefruit, green melon and dried apricot before a saline finish.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Steely and floral on the nose, this wine opens into a lush, textured palate driven by fruit. Lemon and peach flavors are complemented by flecks of wet stone and flint, finishing dry and delicious.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This crisp white is steely and bright in acidity. A core of pear, fig and mint shows a creaminess on the midpalate that remains balanced and fruit forward through the finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Grassy fresh and bubbling in acidity, this light-bodied, lightly ripe white is dazzling in lime and grapefruit, with a tease of peach skin. It's an enjoyable varietal wine that shows restraint and grace.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Crisp aromas of honeysuckle, lemon, peach and fresh lime are clean and inviting on the nose of this bottling. The sip combines a tense texture with ripe peach flavors that are held back by lemongrass and sour lime-skin touches.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Passion fruit and freshly cut grass on the nose suggest dewy, greenish freshness. The palate projects these fruity and tart notions on a very slender, juicy, easy and bright palate, full of citrus zing. The finish is dry and appetizing.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Medium-gold in color, this North Canterbury Sauvignon leads with a heady nose of guava, lychee, and pineapple, with soft aromas of grass and tomato leaf. There's a nice play on the palate between texture and prickly acidity, with plenty of tropical fruit and a long finish. It makes for an apt pairing with summery cuisine.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With the goal of making wines for environmental change, owners Matthew and Alexis Iaconis donate $1 of every bottle of Delta sold to environmental groups that reduce carbon emissions and protect the ocean. This white is crisp and fresh—a delicious quaff of fig, peach and lemon rind, with a compelling, stony mineral edge, fermented entirely in stainless steel.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Pale-gold in color, this Sauvignon is less brightly fruited and more vegetal than in previous years, but still offers an attractive nose of gooseberries, lime leaf, tangerine, grass and florals. The palate is well balanced, with a viscous texture that's cut through by pristine acidity and tangy fruit—a refreshing and textural drop at an affordable price.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh and fruity, this is a light-bodied white that displays a lasting sense of crisp acidity. Flavors of ripe fig, pear and melon meld with a lasting tease of freshly squeezed lemon.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Strong grassy aromas meet with a softer hint of white flowers on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate's strong grip delivers Sancerre-like flavors of crisp lime, lime leaf and more cut grass.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This needs a few swirls of the glass before releasing aromas of white spring blossom and citrus. The linear, focused palate shows grapefruit, peach and crushed tomato vine framed in crisp acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Vivid grassy minerally aromas and nicely concentrated flavors give this medium-bodied wine a lot of depth and it shows a great, tangy balance to go with it. Crisp apple, dried thyme and lemon zest wake up the palate, backed by nervy acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Intriguing aromas of grapefruit, graphite and botanical herbs follow over to the savory, vibrant palate along with apricot, tropical fruit and a hint of lemon drop. Bright acidity follows through to the dry, tangy finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A generous fruitiness is wound up tightly in this tangy, concentrated and well-balanced wine. It leads with vibrant citrus and gooseberry aromas, followed by tight fruit flavors that expand on the palate and linger nicely on the finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dried hay, bags of lawn clippings, green mango, white pepper and green bell pepper show on the very complex nose of this bottling. The bell pepper flavors are prominent on the sip, where pasilla chile elements meet with warm peaches.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of lime skin and chilled green-apple flesh are quite sharp on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Sémillon. There is great snap to the sip, where fresh acidity and a compelling texture deliver flavors of apple peel, lime juice and white pepper.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Fresh and clear in focused acidity, this vineyard-designated white is a bouquet of lovely fruit and flowers, from peach and squeezed Meyer lemon to jasmine. Stony texture adds a mineral component that's irresistible in appeal.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Spring flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of crushed Alpine herbs shape the delicate nose. Racy and linear, the vibrant palate delivers grapefruit, apricot and thyme, while crisp acidity keeps it balanced.

name: Level 3 2016 Driven Red (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed tomato vine, tropical fruit and toasted nut aromas lead the nose. The linear palate is a bit more subdued, offering mature grapefruit, dried apricot, grilled herbs and tangy minerality before a hazelnut finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Mirabelle plum on the nose has an edge of flinty smoke and green fern. The concentrated palate is an interplay of the rounded ripeness of the stone fruit and the stony, fresh tartness of citrus. The result is full-flavored, animated juiciness on a light but expressive body. Lovely now but will evolve. Drink 2020–2025.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Subtle notes of both pale and very ripe lemon zest on the nose have the slightest edge of cut grass. The palate is equally subtle and adds complex yeasty notes to the slender midpalate, providing depth and nuance. There is also a creaminess to counteract the varietal tartness. Lovely counter poles. The finish is long and aromatic with citrus and grass.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The first vintage of Sauvignon Blanc from this producer is a complex and lively white wine to balance their rich red portfolio. Aromas of jalapeño, green herbs and wet cement meet with nectarine on the nose, while the zesty palate combines bell pepper, lime peel, peach and tropical fruit.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of exotic fruit, citrus and crushed tomato vine take center stage. It's crisp and savory, offering grapefruit, green melon, dried herbs and a savory saline note before a dry finish. Crisp acidity keeps it balanced.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Aromas of pressed spring flower and exotic fruit are front and center. On the full-bodied palate, you'll find grapefruit, dried pineapple, mature green melon and graphite alongside a hint of fennel and the warmth of evident alcohol.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is 100% stainless-steel fermented, which shows in the fresh, lively acidity that's front and center. Flinty wet-stone accents give it a bit of texture as bold flavors of lemon and mango linger on the medium-bodied palate.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Soft and subtle tones of green apple and passion fruit are enhanced by a hint of jalapeño spice on the nose of this bottling. There is a fascinating stony quality to the sip, where wet cement flavors combine with passion fruit and lime-laced tonic water.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A small-production white out of Alexander Valley, this was tank-fermented and made to capture lovely aromatics of jasmine and stone. Peach and melon flavors accent a juicy core of succulence on the midpalate, which is creamy in texture. It lingers in mineral.

name: Kenzo Estate 2018 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Flinty reduction on the nose suffuses grassy freshness with passion fruit's tart ripeness. The palate majors on that passion fruit on the still smoky but light, slender, expressive palate. The mix of grass, fruit, smoke, stone and zest is wonderfully moreish. Lovely now but will evolve. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: The nose is rather subtle and gives just a little grass with a flinty, smoky smudge of reduction. The palate is light and carries hints of lime, cut grass and more of that smoke before passion fruit adds a little roundness. A slender, refreshing and full-flavored wine.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: For his own label, Larkmead winemaker Dan Petroski looks to northern Italy for inspiration, sourcing from Napa Valley vineyards he admires (ones with the warmest days and coolest nights) to produce this 100% varietal beauty. Robustly fruity and flinty, it shows apricot, lemongrass, wet stone and wraparound acidity that buzzes in freshness.

name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Jadis  (Sancerre)
description: Subtle aromatics evoke stone and lime at first but then fill with more tropical notions of ripe passion fruit. The palate beds this aromatic passion fruit on cushions of soft, yeasty, creamy texture that is spiked with lime freshness. An exciting prospect. The finish is dry, long, textured and totally aromatic. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Château de Tracy 2008 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This is a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc from a property owned by Rupert Murdoch in the hills of Bel Air. Golden in the glass, it begins with lush aromas of white peach, mango, toasted almond, white flowers and toasted marshmallow. The palate opens with a flash of acidity followed by smooth waves of honey-dusted nectarine and seared stone fruit, finishing with hazelnut cream.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Winemaker: Bartho Eksteen. Green plum, fynbos, bell pepper and onion grass form the nose of this vegetal, green-leaning white. The palate is light and bright, with tart lime and gooseberry flavors that are partnered with vibrant, searing acidity and additional glimmers of mach, green-plum skin and bitter melon rind. The finish is crisp and mouthwatering, with a lot of verve throughout.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: This variety's reductive side shows strongly here, taking over on the aromas. Medium-bodied fruit flavors follow, with strong vanilla accents. The flavors seem washed out and the oak prominent.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Winemaker: Charles Hopkins. There's a pronounced green, herbal note right upfront on the nose of this wine, offering some serious pyrazine character. Green plum and lime leaf lead the aromas and carry through to the medium-weight palate. There's nice body to the mouthfeel, with a subtle creaminess to the midpalate that's then refreshed by bright acidity and a pithy, green-plum skin and lime pith character that floods the finish. Fresh fynbos and herbs, like celery root, parsley and mache, linger long on the close.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Subtle elderflower, fern and grass on the nose attain an incredibly rounded richness on the palate. The green tartness is plumped out with Mirabelle plum ripeness and buffered by a rich, creamy texture while a sparky streak of lemon zest keeps everything focused. Texture, fruit and freshness combine in a most winning fashion. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Duckhorn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a grassy and intensely herbal white wine, with an imprint of reductive oak and quite ripe personality.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a soft wine, its acidity and herbal elements muted and indistinct. It is pleasant, but without much character.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and intense, this wine is crisp, full of gooseberry fruits and tightly textured. Drink now.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This crisp, herbal wine offers light, perfumed fruit and lively acidity. It is a simple, accessible wine that is ready to drink.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Softly textured, this fruity wine comes from vineyards in the eastern Loire Valley. Its tangy green-fruit character is enhanced by the bright acidity and rounded aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This crisp, herbal wine is classic Loire. Touches of minerality and bright green-fruit flavors make for a fresh, ready-to-drink wine.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This grassy, herbal wine is all about crisp green fruits. Its acidity and zesty character balance with the ripe fruit and bright aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Bright white currants and crisp acidity are star attributes of this simple, fruity wine. Its herbal texture is light and easy to drink. The wine is ready now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: An herbal, intense wine, this is tightly textured, with grapefruit flavors that show through strongly. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: A really catty Sauvignon Blanc, herbal and crisp, this is intense while also ready to drink. An edge of steeliness gives shape and adds texture to the fruity wine. Drink now.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There is nothing complex about this fruity, crisp wine with its lemon tang and fruitiness. It's made to be drunk instantly.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Herbal and gooseberry flavors are part of this classic, light Sauvignon Blanc. Crisp acidity and lemon flavors give a wine that is fresh at the end.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a soft and fruity Sauvignon, with straightforward notes of ripe lemon, lime and stone fruit, with a hint of green bell pepper. The palate is fruity, seemingly with a touch of residual sugar and crisp acidity. It closes on a synthetic note, though, which makes taking another sip a challenge.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A soft wine with ripe acidity and apple and lemon flavors, this is lightly crisp. With its fresh fruits and perfumed aftertaste, it is ready to drink.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Grassy and herbal, this classic Sauvignon Blanc is also fruity and fresh with lime-juice flavors. It is tangy, bright and ready to drink.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This open, fruity wine has an herbal, tangy character that contrasts with the light orange peel and riper fruit flavors. It is a fresh, balanced wine that is ready to drink.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: A full, ripe wine, this has a rich, soft texture. Its acidity and bright, tangy fruit are refreshing and generous. Drink this wine now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A ripe wine with hints of tropical fruits as well as lemon and pink grapefruit, this is fruity and lightly textured. Its freshness and lightness are already attractive. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a ripe and creamy-textured wine. Herbal flavors are shot through with lemon zest and crisp apple on the full-bodied palate. Drink now.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Crisp and zesty, this is a light and fruity wine. Still young with its mineral edge prominent, the wine with its citrus flavors should be ready to drink from 2020.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This soft, ripe wine offers attractive acidity and green-fruit flavors. A bright tang brings zestiness and juicy fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Ripe and fruity, this wine conveys the proper tang of Sancerre, with crisp acidity to temper the richness. It is correct but without much character. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2019.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This wine has extremely aromatic gooseberry and pine needle aromas along with crisp and fruity flavors that are fresh and straightforward. It's light in body and simply refreshing.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A refreshingly aromatic wine, this is ripe with white fruits and a squeeze of lemon. Freshness and a crisp texture are right up front in this attractive wine. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The small appellation of Coteaux du Giennois north of Sancerre produces ripe wines, particularly in 2018. The acidity is softened by rich apple flavors that contrast with the tangy, herbal core of the wine. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Creamy and lush on the palate, this white has a rounded richness sure to please, with lasting flavors of lemon verbena and peach.

name: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this soft wine has ripe apple as well as citrus flavors. The creamy texture gives it a rich feel, contrasting well with crispness at the end. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: In the soft style typical of this small region west of Sancerre, this wine is fruity, with apple and lime flavors and a mineral texture. Freshness makes the wine bright and refreshing. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This wine's ripe fruits are young, with the potential to soften and fill out. Crisp apples, citrus and bright acidity complete this attractive wine. Drink from 2020.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: A soft, creamy wine, this is full of crisp apple fruit that is lightly touched by a squeeze of lemon. Acidity is muted by the ripe fruits to give a rounded wine that is ready to drink.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is ripe, softly textured with gentle acidity that gives a rounded character. The citrus edge adds a touch of freshness to a wine that is ready to drink.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is a soft wine, with white-fruit flavors and gentle acidity. Its light, bright fruitiness has a tang of lemon zest and a juicy, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A crisp, lightly herbal wine, this is packed with green-apple fruits laced with grapefruit acidity. The wine is perfumed, gently textured and ready to drink.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine goes for smoothness and richness rather than the typical varietal character, yet it has snappy underlying acidity. It feels and tastes ripe and generous, has mostly pear and apple flavors and good balance.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a crisply textured wine, with attractive acidity and a strong mineral edge. Fresh citrus flavors and acidity are comfortably balanced by the taut steely edge. Drink now.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Lemony and fleshy, this is a steely white wine, with ample body weight and moderate acidity.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This wine is tense, mineral and concentrated. The white-fruit, gooseberry and spice flavors have a juicy character, refreshingly crisp and with plenty of final acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This softly textured wine offers a pure line of sliced-apple flavors and crispness on the side. It comes from an estate owned by the Mellot family. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine comes from a vineyard that is wholly owned by the producer, hence the word monopole in its name. Youth gives it a yeasty character at this stage, one that will fade as the crisp herbal flavors open up. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This tangy, fragrant wine offers a taut, mineral edge as well as ripe melon and grapefruit flavors. The wine was fermented in tanks to keep its freshness, crisp texture and fruitiness. Drink now.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This wine comes from a small appellation dedicated entirely to Sauvignon Blanc. The wine's bright, fresh character is softened by the gentle acidity and textured with minerality. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral components of grass and hay are complemented by light crisp flavors of grapefruit in this white, that is fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral oak. It's a delightfully enjoyable wine.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: From a particularly stony vineyard, this wine shows a strong mineral character. The tense texture along with green-fruit acidity suggest a wine that needs to age further. Drink from 2020.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A hugely rich wine, full of ripe pear, melon and spice flavors, this is densely textured. The alcohol gives a touch of pepper that happily contrasts with fresher acidity at the end. Drink from 2020.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This open, attractive wine with fresh apple and citrus flavors and light texture has a refreshing character. Tangy minerality adds interest. Drink the wine now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With its soft texture, this wine is immediately attractive and drinkable. A light herbal edge adds to the wine's mineral texture, emphasizing white and citrus fruits. Drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This estate white is fermented and aged entirely in stainless steel and shows a bright crisp personality as a result. Lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors are boldly formed, building to a vanilla richness on the finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This wine is crisply textured, full of citrus fruit with a herbal, mineral edge. Along with its freshness and lively acidity, the wine shows a sense of structure. Drink now.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Crisp but with a creamy texture, this ripe wine is full of green-apple flavors. Acidity and freshness are lifted by the edge of minerality to give a well-balanced wine that is ready to drink.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This attractive wine offers textured fruitiness and a fresh line of perfumed acidity. With its brightness and crispness, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A taut, crisp wine with intense acidity and citrus flavors, this is still full of its mineral texture and tangy character. The wine's fresh, bone-dry character needs to soften and it will be worth waiting until 2020.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: This ripe wine is full of apple flavors and clean lines of acidity. Its full-bodied character gives it intensity and allows plenty of room for the wine's tangy fruitiness at the end. Drink the wine now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: From the Les Faitaux vineyard, this wine is smoothly textured, with ripe grapefruit and melon flavors. Perfumed and with a touch of pepper, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This strongly herbal wine is full of green fruits with tangy acidity. A light structure brings out the freshness of the green fruit and citrus flavors. Drink the wine now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This softly textured wine comes from a vineyard full of small stones. Open and generously textured, the wine has a strong, classic herbal character that contrasts with the creamed-apple flavors. It is ready to drink.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: From three different vineyard sites, this wine is crisp, textured and full of bright apple and citrus flavors. The texture gives a tangy character to a wine that is still young. Drink from 2020.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Tangy and fresh, this nicely crisp wine offers plenty of lime and honeydew melon flavors on a light to medium body. It's smooth, well balanced and easy to enjoy.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: King Estate is jumping further into Sauvignon Blanc with this affordable complement to the single-vineyard Croft cuvée. At first taste you might say this is all peaches all the time, as that fruit flavor totally dominates the palate. But let it breathe, and a mix of tropical and citrus fruits come together in a luscious array. A portion was fermented in concrete (the rest in stainless), which adds some welcome texture to the body of the wine.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This richly textured wine is full of apple and grapefruit flavors. Fruitiness is balanced by the strong mineral texture, taut acidity and tangy aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This ripe wine offers great fruitiness and young acidity. It has a yeasty character at this stage that will soften over the next few months, resulting in a wine with texture, minerality and some aging potential. Drink from 2020.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine comes from a 10-generation family producer. Fresh and fruity, it offers bright acidity and citrus flavors with a tight texture and lightly herbal aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: One in a range called Les Parcellaires, this wine is ripe, round and textured while still young. Fruitiness dominates, boasting ripe lemons and apples that come with a vibrant tang of acidity. The wine will be ready from 2020.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Anjou pear, squeezed lime and riper guava aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate combines apple flesh with lime juice, proving pleasantly mellow and refreshing.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: In true Margaret River style, this is an extroverted vegetal Sauvignon Blanc and it may not be to everyone's taste, but does reflect the coolness of Stella Bella's site in southern MR. It leads with aromas of snow peas, green bell pepper and tomato leaf, along with soft stone and citrus fruit. The palate is texturally lovely and slippery, with crunchy acidity and all the same flavors as the nose and a long mouthwatering finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aged for a few months on its lees, this wine is ripe and full of young fruitiness. Acidity and apple and crisp pear fruits are balanced by the mineral texture and spice at the end. Drink from 2020.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This renowned biodynamic producer's ventures into orange-wine territory have been interesting if a little hit and miss. This vintage lies somewhere in between. Fermented on skins in stainless steel and amphorae and then matured in part new, part used oak for three months, the result is a wine the color of lemon drops, with a nose like the Cullens' herb garden in summer: wild mint, tarragon, green bell pepper, wild honey and something more heady and floral like ladies' perfume. The palate is less extroverted, focused instead on creamy texture, lifted acidity, spicy oak and some phenolic bitterness. This won't be for everyone, but there's a certain joy in the weird and the wild and this wine has both.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Intense and spicy, this ripe wine is packed with tropical fruits, acidity and lemon juice. It is perfumed and concentrated, while preserving a juicy, fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: High toned in grapefruit and lime, this 100% varietal white is textured on the midpalate and shows just a hint of oak. Persistent freshness keeps it lively and vibrant on the palate.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Aging on its lees has given this wine from a 39-acre family estate extra richness. A strong texture and lemon-zest flavors contrast with ripe green-plum fruits. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine shows a lot of reduction out of the gate but is worth waiting for. Once it blows off, it reveals aromas of gun smoke, pink grapefruit, mineral, talc and herb. Sleek white and pink grapefruit flavors follow on this acid-driven offering. Pair it with a cold seafood salad with a lime-and-garlic dressing. Give it time in the cellar or an extended decant.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Made from a vineyard planted with vines selected from the estate rather than bought in a nursery, this wine is soft, ripe with a dense texture as well as crisp citrus fruits. Minerality adds extra complexity. Drink now.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This vivid wine feels light in weight but is substantial in terms of flavor concentration. It shows crisp apple and lemon aromas on the nose, with layers of citrus, melon and apple on the palate. There's a pleasing balance between fresh acidity and ripeness.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of lime, grapefruit and cut grass meet with a wet-stone minerality on the nose of this fresh and lively bottling. The palate is taut in feel, displaying flavors of lemon and Granny Smith apple.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Tight aromas of lime skin and faint white flowers are framed by a steely line of minerality on the nose of this bottling. There is pithy tension to the sip, where broad quince and apple flavors are sprayed by Meyer lemon.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: This rich Sancerre is full of white fruits as well as the more familiar herbal characteristics. It is taut, with a sculptured texture. The wine is not quite ready and will be better from early 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Tight and bright aromas of grapefruit pith are subtle and refreshing on the nose of this bottling. The palate is all about stony flavors of gravel and river stone, yet there are also more broad touches of pear skins and apple flesh.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Tight rounded richness meets moderate acidity and biting layers of crisp green apple and fig in this well-made, expressive white. It shows a deft hand of balance and weight.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Produced from grapes growing on flinty soil, this wine is packed with apple and lemon fruits that are textured with minerality and light spice. The wine is already well balanced between fruitiness and the steely edge. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Named after the Roman who built a villa where Pouilly now is, this is a ripe, smoothly textured and ageworthy wine. Ripe apples and apricots are cut with lemon acidity, balancing the wine and giving it a full, rich aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: The chalk soil of this vineyard has produced a textured wine that is balanced by generous white fruits that are beginning to come through. Made from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine is structured and needs a little more time. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Typical of the Quincy appellation, this wine has Sauvignon Blanc flavors that have been tamed and softened. The result is a beautiful, apple and pear-flavored wine with ripe acidity and a gentle texture. Drink now.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: The bottle, almost impossible to hold in one hand, signifies an important wine. With three years aging, this wine has developed a ripe, nutty character that has not left behind its herbal roots. It is touched by spice, layered with intense acidity and is ready to drink.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This fragrant, softly herbal wine has a creamy texture. Its orange-zest tang is balanced by ripe apple fruits and lifted by acidity. The balance between richness and freshness is just right. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This soft Sauvignon Blanc comes from a small appellation southwest of Sancerre. Its crispness is filled out by the fragrant tropical fruits and ripe texture. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A slightly reserved character helps this light-bodied, mineral-driven wine stand out from the pack. Aromas of flint, dried thyme and a wisp of lemon lead to ripe pear and Pippin apple flavors.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This ripe wine is still young, with layers of crisp herbal fruits and intense acidity. It is strongly textured, tangy as well as mineral. The combination with the green fruits makes for a full-bodied wine that needs to age. Drink from 2021.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Very light aromas of lemon peel, pear flesh and apple syrup seem a touch sweet at first but remain refreshing. There is buoyant acidity on the palate, where green-apple and lime peel flavors ride a grainy chalky texture.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: From a vineyard named after the chalk-white stones, this wine has plenty of minerality. It also has a ripe, full character that gives richness and a texture that is moving towards softness. Likely to age well, the wine will be better from late 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is Sauv Blanc vinified more like Chardonnay, It was barrel fermented in neutral French oak and put through partial malolactic. Apple, melon and tangerine fruit is displayed in a smooth, mellow style, with some residual sweetness to further round out the finish.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Crisp, textured and full of fruit, this rich wine has good acidity as well as a strong mineral texture. Freshness gives it a lively character while the ripe white and citrus fruits are delicious. Drink the wine now.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Tight, flinty and steely, this is full of crisp green fruits and herbal flavors shot through with minerality. The texture and acidity give an immediate freshness that will soften as the wine ages. Drink from 2020.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This ripe, full wine is well balanced between crisp gooseberry and citrus flavors, with a mineral character that gives texture. Its juicy acidity is delicious, properly mature and the wine is ready to drink.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a single parcel of vines owned by this Pouilly-based producer, this wine is taut, tight and still young. Great acidity, layers of minerality and steeliness combine with green-fruit and apple flavors in a wine that needs more time. Drink from 2020.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Clean and taut on the nose, this bottling shows a blend of passion fruit, lime skin and rainy cement on the pristine and delicate nose. There is a great snap to the palate, where rounded flavors of red pear and passion fruit are quite forward, yet also tightly woven.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: With skin fermentation and lees aging, this ripe wine enhances the natural freshness of the grape with rich spice and baked-apple flavors. Densely textured it is just ready to drink.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Oak aging has softened this ripe wine and given it richness. Acidity and a mineral texture are coming together with ripe white fruits to offer a concentrated wine with a tangy aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wine opens in a nutty flourish of earthiness and floral apple blossom before exposing complex waves of Meyer lemon, green apple and fig. Intensely high toned, it is crisp and dry, with plenty of bite and texture.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Light and mellow on the nose at first, this bottling opens toward Asian pear flesh, warm nectarine and clean melon aromas. It lands on the palate with bright flavors of guava, passion fruit and lime, cut by mineral-laden touches of wet cement.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Pale gold in color, this Sauvignon Blanc from the recently relocated Henry's Drive team, is a shining example of the Adelaide Hills' ability to make world class Sauvignon Blanc. The nose is a perfumed fruit bowl of pineapples, apples, limes and orange peel with touches of honeysuckle. It's medium in weight, with slippery texture and fantastically crunchy acidity with a copper-penny-like tang. Food-friendly, this would make an excellent bottle to bring to a summertime dinner party.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a stunning estate that was planted biodynamically, this bottling, which is the first for this project by newly hired winemaker Ernst Storm, offers aromas of cut grass, dried grapefruit rinds and lime zest on the nose. Stony flavors of wet cement make for a fresh and compelling palate, with flavors of green-pear skin, lime rind and dried hay all apparent.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This crisp, steely-textured wine is still young. Its taut texture is balanced with green apples and ripe pears. The acidity is still bright, forward and needs time to soften. Drink from 2020.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With a third of the wine aged in barrel, this is a broad, spicy Sauvignon Blanc. The acidity has been muted by the wine's extra richness. Melon and creamed-apple flavors balance the spiciness and final structure. Drink now.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: A light touch of spice from partial wood fermentation has added to the richness of this wine. That is balanced against the steely edge of acidity and minerality. This wine is almost ready but will be better from early 2020.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Clean aromas of rainy cement, sharp cut grass and lime blossom show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and lively, with grapefruit juice, grass and passion fruit flavors leading toward a taut finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This vineyard-designate wine is beautifully defined and proportioned. It deftly mixes the grape's grassy and citrusy side with a ripe stone-fruit flavor that yields a full-bodied, almost fleshy mouthfeel. The finish is textural and dotted with cinnamon spice.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine is named for an old morello cherry orchard that stood where the vineyard is now. The 25-year-old vines produced a ripe, generously textured and perfumed wine. It is young, needing some months for the fruit to settle in. Drink from early 2020.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This strongly textured wine comes from a vineyard with chalk soil. With taut, crisp acidity and bright citrus highlights, the wine is steely and needs a few months to calm down. Drink from 2020.
