name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A turnabout in style from the previous vintage, this is a rich, dense wine, with a mix of Meyer lemon, apricot and mango fruit. This sees time in 40% neutral oak and 60% stainless steel, the former of which has aided in rounding out the palate.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine is all about fruit. Its bright texture and acidity are part of the crisp lemon, green-plum and apple flavors that overflow from the glass. To support this, the wine has a mineral edge that will allow it to age longer. Drink from 2020.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Part of the range called Les Parcellaires, this wine celebrates the flint soil often found in the central Loire vineyards. It gives a mineral character to the wine that balances with the ripe apple and spice flavors to give a juicy, lightly structured aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Fermented and aged in wood for 10 months, this ripe, spicy wine delivers an impressive blending of mineral fruit and a rich texture. The intensity and concentration give both great fruitiness and great structure. Drink the wine now.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A vineyard once owned by monks (who chose their sites well) has produced a beautifully ripe wine. Its green fruitiness is still young, offering richness and density as well as a concentrated texture. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2021.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This bottling from a newer biodynamic property, now made by winemaker Ernst Storm, combines racy and riper tones on the dynamic nose, offering aromas of dried lemon, red pear, wet stone and parsley. The palate is stony and tingling with acidity, delivering ripe pear and nectarine flavors.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Fermented and aged in wood, this wine has a different character from most Sancerre. It has toastiness but the main effect of the wood has been to fill the wine and soften the acidity while keeping a fresh edge. Drink this ripe, full-bodied wine now.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: The slightest bit cloudy in the glass, this bottling shows a wondrous combination of grassy aromas and fruity tones of passion fruit and guava on the full nose. The palate is flavorful in ripe tropical fruits as well as strong grass and wet stone accents.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Old vines are the heart of this wine from a single parcel of less than two acres. They give a structured wine, very mineral and concentrated, bringing out great acidity as well as green fruits. The wine is only just ready and will be better from 2020.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This mature wine is ripe with white fruits and acidity. Its initial freshness has softened with some aging to give a nutty character that balances the fruitiness. Drink now.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Lychee, peach and inviting opening aromatics make for a heady entry into this light, bright and crisply high-toned white. Lemon peel and a bite of orange add to the texture and overall complexity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Naturally fermented in a mix of stainless and neutral barrels, this is a tart and juicy wine with classic varietal flavors. Sappy and stylish, it's loaded with citrus fruits hovering close to New Zealand in style, though the Loire is the inspiration. Kudos to winemaker Thomas Monroe for upping the Sauv Blanc game in Oregon.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: This rich, powerful wine in its equally powerful bottle is ripe and full of yellow fruits. Fermented and aged in wood, the wine conveys a slight hint of spicy flavor, but has benefited in its great ripeness and density. Drink the wine from 2021.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This white represents 100% organically grown estate grapes, blending in 11% Sauvignon Gris and 8% Sémillon. Lively in lemon rind, melon, peach and grapefruit, it has a stony minerality that gives it an edge of complexity and intrigue, with a lush body weight and texture.

name: Joseph Phelps 2018 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: This wine is powerful in its intensity and ripe fruitiness. Fermented in large casks and then aged in wood, it offers toastiness as well as pineapple and apricot flavors. A tang of acidity and lemon zest marks the finish. Drink from 2020.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Crisp pear flesh, lemon rind and white-flowers show on the nose of this always zesty, refreshing bottling by Doug Margerum. There's a stony grip to the sip, where citrus and Asian pear flavors compete for attention against the tremendously chalky texture.

name: Kenzo Estate 2018 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A wine made to celebrate 500 years of the Mellot family in Sancerre, this will likely mature further. Smoothly rich, the wine offers great spiciness as well as ripe white and citrus fruits. Now after three years, the wine is softening and showing how well Sancerre can age. Wait until at least 2020.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This small-production wine was selected from a parcel of old vines. The natural richness is tempered by acidity and the freshest white-fruit flavors. It has concentration in its perfumed character and bright fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Quince, lime and fig jump from the glass in this floral and earthy white wine, fermented and aged both in stainless steel and neutral oak. Stony mineral aspects complement the fruit amidst a textured palate.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Grassy and flinty in stone and gunpowder, this is a bright, lemony and very light white wine made from organically farmed grapes.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Soft aromas of pineapple core and white peach dance on the nose of this delicate, easygoing white. There's a slightly spritzy sensation on the palate, with more waves of underripe tropical and stone-fruit flavors. The finish is brisk and refreshing.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Biodynamically grown grapes from a small walled vineyard produce this beautifully balanced wine. Its clean lines and crisp acidity contrast with hints of tropical fruit and are all part of a wine that has a strong future. The wine's structure and flinty texture should soften over the years. Drink from 2021.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Right now, this wine feels underripe and very reductive. Those sweet onion aromas are tough to get past. Canned green beans, and a feline note are prominent too, and citrus rind and pineapple fruit sneak in underneath it all. Acidity on the palate is rather searing, slicing through a weighty mouthfeel, but the two don't seem to gel. This may need a few years to settle into itself more but the jury's still out.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is low in intensity, with supersoft notes of just-dried straw, lemon peel and white-melon rind. The palate shows roundness at first that's then lifted on the close by a pithy, bitter sensation. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Touches of yellow apple, pear and melon rind unfold on the nose of this direct white. The palate is light and easygoing, with ample acidity to lift the orchard-fruit flavors and lend nice refreshment to the close.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This lively, light-textured wine has a touch of minerality to go with the attractive white and citrus fruits. It is crisp, bright and ready to drink.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Light aromas of pink grapefruit and herb lead to light, puckering citrus and papaya flavors. One wants more aromatically but the acidity is lovely. If it opens, it moves up.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Grapefruit and passion fruit aromas are not too aggressive. This feels full but kind of soft. Stone-fruit flavors of peach and nectarine are offset by mild green notes, while on the finish this is mellow and not showing much sizzle. Drink now.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: This smells clean and fresh, with medium aromas of fresh apple, Anjou pear and a kiss of orange blossom. The medium-weight palate shows good concentration that's balanced by orangey acidity and a clean, easygoing finish. It's straightforward but well balanced.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A vaguely peachy nose is limited in fruit and crispness. On the palate, this is a bit wan and indirect. A mix of bell pepper and lime flavors quietly settle on a round finish with salad-like green notes and some bitterness.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This grassy, herbal Sauvignon Blanc conveys touches of white grapefruit and gooseberry. Light and crisply textured, it finishes with a squeeze of lemon. Drink now.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Although labeled as a Vin de France, this wine comes from Gascony. With its lightness, crisp herbal and currant flavors, the wine is lively, fruity and ready to drink.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This well-poised wine moves comfortably between strong herbal flavors and a creamier apple character. Packed with fruit lifted by a tangy edge, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a perfumed and regionally typical Sauvignon that charges out of the gates, with aromas of flowers, snow peas, citrus and tropical fruit, jalapeño peppers and grass. Tingly, piercing acidity is the most noticeable aspect of the palate, and there's perhaps a touch of residual sugar there too, to balance all that acidity and give a sensation of fruit weight.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Notes of lime, white grapefruit, gooseberry, grass, bell pepper and tomato leaf are woven into a chalky texture. Lifted citrusy acidity frames it all.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: It is unusual to see a Sauvignon Blanc made in the Minho region when there are so many great local grapes. The wine itself is pleasant, with a poise between herbal and more tropical flavors, light and ready to drink.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Aromas of thistle and pyrazines are greater than anything fruity. A texturally full palate isn't that punchy or acidic, while this SB offers salad-like flavors complete with citrus vinaigrette. A simple, short finish wraps this up. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine offers loads of ripe pineapple, guava, tomato leaf and white pepper aromas. Zippy, bright acidity lifts the fruit on the palate although it's a little sour on the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A mix of green fruit and green-bean aromas are crisp and punchy, not blowsy. A zesty, angular palate is lean and slightly sharp, while this racy SB tastes of tart lime and green apple. A raw and stripped palate is fittingly trim.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Made in honor of the man who founded the Mellot dynasty in 1513, this is a rich wine. Light oak-barrel flavors mingle with a strong mineral texture that gives the wine a tight edge. Now mature, the fruit is well integrated with the structure of the wine. It is ready to drink.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Pretty scents of just-ripe peach and melon lead the bouquet of this light and attractive wine, with supporting notes of lemon verbena and sweet clementine essence. It's light in weight, clean and brisk in feel, with subtle lemon-peel and orange flavors that continue through to the finish. Drink now.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This top wine in the Bourgeois range is made for aging. Its perfumed apple and citrus fruit and concentrated texture have now blended well together to give a balanced, mature wine. Impressive in its density and richness, it is ready to drink now.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Produced on the Bourgeois family vineyards at Maimbray, this wine was partially fermented in wood. The resulting wine moves easily between freshness and spice, with apple and pink-grapefruit flavors balanced by the mineral, textured edge. The wine is only just ready to drink and will be better from 2020.

name: Crane Lake 2005 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Gritty, sulfuric aromas of matchstick are less than clean and inviting. On the palate, this is surprisingly flat and low on acidity. Green herbal flavors hint at melon while this offers no kick, acidity or fruit on a green finish.

name: Producta Vignobles 2018 Mission Saint Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Aromas of banana, pineapple and ripe guava unfold on the nose of this white. The palate is flat and soft, with a pronounced weight that lacks structure and acidic support.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Soft scents of yellow melon and apple flesh unfold on the nose of this straightforward white, with just a hint of white florals. The palate is soft and flat, with low acidity and round flavors of pink apple and pear that finish clean but short.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Tangy and fruity, this wine is full of herbal flavors. Green with a spicy character, it is ready to drink.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Soft scents of sweet grass, underripe mango, pineapple core and lime rind form the nose of this light white. The palate is round and a little heavy in feel at first, with low acidity, though a hint of citrus-pith bitterness lends some textural lift to the back.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: A light color and vegetal aromas akin to canned peas open this lean SB. Saucy, savory flavors of lime and white-wine vinegar finish short and hollow.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There's very little coming from the nose on this wine. After some swirling, faint wisps of lemon, lime and peach emerge along with hints of soft dried green herbs. The palate doesn't offer much either, other than somewhat underripe, laser-like acidity and a chalky texture. It is very, very young.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Made in a creamy, softly fruity style, this wine is fresh with citrus and green asparagus while keeping its acidity and tangy character controlled. It is ready to drink.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Vegetal aromas suggest canned peas, while this feels tight and drawing, without much body. Salty briny flavors of green fruits and green veggies finish with pyrazinic flavors backed by firm acidity.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: It's always surreal to taste 2019 wines from the southern hemisphere before the northern hemisphere has even begun harvest (at the time of writing). Their youth can sometimes be hard to take, particularly the eye-watering, mouthpuckering acidity. This SB is a veritable fruit bomb on the nose, oozing tropical fruit, lime Popsicle, grass and wisps of dried herbal characters. And then the acidity wrestles it all into submission on the palate, making it hard, for now anyway, to take another sip.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Pungent aromas of green herbs and pyrazines control the nose on this fuller-bodied SB that's soft to the point of being prematurely flabby. Green grassy flavors of lime and asparagus finish with a lasting green-tobacco note.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Straw colored with aromas of citrus, apple, orange and vanilla, this Sauvignon Blanc has flavors of peach, apple and passion fruit and a soft, easy finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Pale straw colored in the glass, this Romanian Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of orange, vanilla and lemon peel. It is well balanced with flavors of peach, tropical fruit and apple. The finish is soft and silky.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This Romanian Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of lemon, orange and vanilla. On the palate there are flavors of passion fruit, peach, apple and apple cobbler. It has good balance and a soft finish.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Medium-intense aromas of green plum, lime peel and gooseberry form the nose of this breezy, easygoing wine. The palate is light and fresh, with high acidity and tart green-fruit flavors that yield a prickly impression on the palate and carry through to the mouthwatering finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Softly textured and fruity, this wine has creamed-apple and pink-grapefruit flavors, giving a good balance between the round texture and crisp acidity. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Hailing from Transylvania, this straw-colored Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of lemon zest, vanilla and orange peel. There are flavors of peach, apple and passion fruit before the soft finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A wine that leans towards the tropical-fruit style of Sauvignon Blanc, this is softly textured and ripe. Acidity gives freshness to the rounded character of the wine. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is an aromatic and fruity summer sipper bursting with passion fruit and guava and backed by tomato leaf and bell pepper notes. The palate is crisp but not searing, with perhaps a touch of residual sugar balancing out the acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a soft, open style of Sauvignon Blanc, bringing out touches of tropical fruits while leaving the more herbal character in the background. Its fruitiness is tempered by a tangy mouthfeel. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Creamy and lushly rich, this has strong flavors of peach and vanilla. Made in an appealing style, it finishes in a sneaky twist of jalapeño that gives it a touch of earthiness and heat.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Herbal with asparagus and gooseberry flavors, this crisp wine is concentrated. A mineral edge takes away from the fruitiness while adding texture. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This herbal and perfumed wine is attractive with light, bright acidity. Its easy texture and fresh orange-zest flavors are already refreshing. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Cool coastal aromas of canned veggies, particularly beans and peas, drive the nose on this SB that's braced by preserving acidity. Green flavors are light on fruit, while it's acidity and not flavors that steer the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Golden pear, ripe peach and light cement aromas show on the nose. There is a kiss of sweet oak on the palate, where roasted apple and yellow-peach flavors also arise.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: From a vineyard on Oak Knoll and made from 65% Sauvignon Blanc and 35% Sauvignon Musque, this is an earthy, robust and exotic white with a taste of pea shoots, citrus and tangerine. Medium bodied, it has grip on the palate.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Rounded aromas of wet hay, grass clippings, struck stone, apple and pear make for a wide entry to this bottling. There is a good zip to the sip, where flavors of damp pine and crisp green apple arise.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Broad aromas of poached pear, wet stone, grass and guava make for a well-rounded nose on this bottling. There is compellingly chalky grip to the sip, and then the flavors show riper tones of guava cream and tropical fruit.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A delicate and straightforward wine, this opens with wisps of lime blossom, grapefruit, tomato leaf and green herbal notes. Zippy acidity on the palate buoys the juicy, limey fruit and floral flavors. It's clean, refreshing and balanced.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: The Côtes de Gascogne's reputation lies with bright, light white wines such as this. Full of white fruits and with a touch of acidity, the wine is crisply textured and ready to drink.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Light amber colored in the glass, this Romanian Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of vanilla, pear and apple. On the palate there are flavors of stone fruits, especially yellow cling peach, and lovely soft and smooth finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Grassy and herbal, this is also a lively, fresh and floral white wine. The fruit component is a delightful mélange of pineapple, lime and melon.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine comes from the small Gascon estate owned by François Lurton. It is a ripe and full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc, with hints of tropical fruits as well as a more herbal character. The tangy lemon-zest aftertaste is attractively refreshing. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With an earthy nose, this canned white tastes slightly reduced at first, but opens slowly to reveal nutty undertones beneath a fruity core of melon and fig. The mouthfeel is crisp and steely with a lasting lushness of richness.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Tangy and well balanced, this light and refreshing wine offers lemon-lime aromas, grapefruit flavors and a lean appetizing texture.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Oily and viscous in mouthfeel, this complex white offers a touch of oak and floral, herbal components. It is complemented by rich rewarding flavors of vanilla and fig.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine shows resemblance to a New Zealand style, with strong aromas of citrus, green pepper, gooseberry and kiwi along with papaya, guava and fresh asparagus. Broad kiwi and citrus flavors follow. A warm, slightly bitter finish caps it off.

name: Patel 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This premium Sauvignon is barrel fermented and aged, and underwent partial malolactic fermentation. It's medium-gold hued and a little reductive at first, although not unpleasant. Bruised red apple, pineapple, nectarine, tomato leaf and white spice characters all take a back seat to the butter and toast aromas. The palate is creamy, but also taut and focused, sliced with bright acidity.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fairly ripe style of Sauvignon Blanc coming from a coastal area, starting with big aromas of peach, nectarine, orange sorbet and lemon cream. The palate goes more sour with lime skins and bitter orange, and then come waves of dried mango.

name: Giesen 2014 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A premium, gold-hued Sauvignon from this mammoth-sized producer, this wine is intensely rich on the nose, oozing honey, fennel, green pepper, mushroom, butter and wood spice. Underneath this thick cloak lie more typical SB notes: stone and passion fruit and fresh green grass. The palate is full bodied but less overtly rich than nose suggests. Copper penny-like in texture, it has bright acidity and a soft frame of oak. Drink this with food on the table.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Fruit, spices, stone and vivid herbaceousness come together nicely in this well-balanced and satisfying wine. It shows wonderful varietal character in citrus and lemongrass notes.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a perfumed Sauvignon that bursts with attractive notes of lime leaf and peach blossom. The slippery mouthfeel is sliced by bright rapier-like acidity and oodles of juicy citrus fruit.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a fairly rich, concentrated Sauvignon, with ripe notes of peach, pineapple and lime alongside accents of flowers, brioche and white pepper. The palate is creamy in feel, with biting acidity lifting the juicy fruit.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a balanced, food-friendly example of Marlborough Sauvignon succeeding despite a tough vintage. The nose is all about the citrus fruit: lemon-lime and grapefruit, with some soft grass and green herbal notes in the background. The mouthfeel is creamy but buoyed by bright, crisp acidity. Tangy citrus fruit lingers on the long finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is reserved in style, offering mineral, chalk and light milky aromas, followed by dry and tangy mineral and white-pepper flavors. These add up to an interesting, complex and different wine.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Pleasing fruit-forward aromas of kiwi, herb, melon, citrus and wet stone lead to a mouthwatering palate that is simultaneously sleek and rounded in feel. Pink-grapefruit flavors linger on the finish. It has a lively, thirst-quenching aspect that heightens the appeal.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: While not a common grape for the region, Sauvignon Blanc seems to have found a home in the winery's limestone-based vineyards that sit at over 1,000 feet in elevation. Crisp aromas of gooseberry, lime and passion fruit meld with a grassy tomato vine tone. There's a juicy, fresh feel to the palate that melds all of these notes together to yield a well-balanced wine that shows good tension and grip.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is an attractive, perfumed Sauvignon with heaps of lime popsicle, peach blossoms and dried green herbs. The palate is both chalky and slippery in texture, nicely balanced by crunchy acidity, bright fruit and dried herbs.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Crisp and tangy, this light- to medium-bodied wine offers tones of citrus, green apple and a touch of tropical fruit. It is smooth and easy to enjoy.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fruit for this wine comes from Sagemoor Vineyard, with a dash of 4% Sémillon from Gamache. Light aromas of citrus peel and fig lead to textured honeycomb and citrus flavors, with the Sémillon seeming to contribute a stronger part than its percentage might suggest.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This vintage of Urlar's Sauvignon is still young and quite reductive. But this does blow off fairly quickly with some swirling in glass and then it offers notes of guava, pineapple and citrus and a touch of grass. The palate is nicely balanced with zippy acidity and juicy, fruity charm. This is an easygoing sipper for summery cuisine.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Meyer lemon peel and spring blossom aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There's a sizzle of white pepper to the bright palate, where a solid texture upholds the green-fruit flavors.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This light, refreshing and herbaceous wine has a streak of lemon that supports mineral, white pepper and sliced fennel bulb flavors. It is definitely crisp and tangy, refreshing on the palate.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: In the first release of this wine, cantaloupe, honeydew melon and pineapple aromas are out front. Full-feeling, almost sweet-drinking mango and pineapple flavors follow, with a warm finish capping it off. It shows the variety's richer side.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of grass, grapefruit and herb lead to a crisp citrus flavor on the full-bodied palate. These tones carry on the finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Crisp aromas of juniper, pine sap, citrus and pyrazines are pure Leyda, while this SB from a hot year still feels zesty and punchy. Lime, tarragon and lemongrass flavors wrap up on a minerally finish that carries a tangerine note and a hint of bitterness.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is vivid and dramatic, emphasizing fresh herb and gooseberry aromas. The medium-bodied palate is mouthwatering in grapefruit and lemon flavors.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Made from the Sauvignon Musque clone, this is an intensely viscous, floral and earthy white wine with lasting intensity. Its flavors build around lemon candy, apple and wet stone, finishing crisp and fresh.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is fresh and focused, with mineral-laden stoniness and sumptuous stone fruit at its core. Lemon and lemongrass vie for attention on the light-bodied palate.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Lushly textured, this is a layered, likable and well-balanced white, with well-constructed flavors of pear, fig, green apple and melon. Moderate acidity lifts the fruit and complex texture while preserving its soft supple nature.

name: François Lurton 2018 Domaine Les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This wine was given no time in oak and made entirely from grapes grown in Dry Creek and Russian River Valleys. It is lively, tart and fresh. Balanced flavors of lemon peel, lime and peach mingle around an earthy tease of fresh-cut grass.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Breadth and depth are the hallmarks of this full-bodied mouthfilling wine. It offers ripe citrus, dried fig and mineral aromas followed by rich and palate-coating flavors that combine subtle spices and ripe melon flavors.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a delightfully bright, light and refreshing wine, grassy and herbal within a context of textured grapefruit and lime. It's lovely and complex with a persistence of acidity.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Creamy on the palate, with a balanced approach to acidity, this wine offers breadth and length, nicely combining a small amount of Sémillon within. Pear, peach and Key lime make for an expressive midpalate of fruit seasoned in a touch of lemongrass.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This delicious take on the grape is ripe yet bright. Exotic flavors of peach, pineapple and lemon zest lead to a creamy midpalate, with just a hint of oak shining through.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of Granny Smith apple, cut grass and damp pine needles show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong sizzle of acidity on the palate, where the green apple flavor plays with a richer nectarine tone.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This stainless-steel white offers tones of jasmine and peach, with lingering flecks of lime and grapefruit. The acidity is fresh, lively and well balanced.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Light in color this is an effervescent expression of peach, apricot and pear, delicate flavors that are balanced and lovely on the palate. A finishing touch of lime keeps it bright.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Tropical with secondary notes of peach, green apple and Meyer lemon, this is a robust, concentrated and fleshy white wine, bright in underlying acidity and thus ultimately well balanced.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This crisply fruity wine shows a fine touch of maturity. Its spice and herbal character has softened into more tropical flavors while keeping ample acidity. Drink now.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Concentrated and rather full in body, this wine has ripe fig and complex mineral flavors that coat the palate and linger on the finish. Richness and depth are its hallmarks, and it's weighty enough to serve alongside big proteins.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A perennial, small-production wine to watch, this comes from cool-climate vines and offers a supple texture and mid-weight ripeness. Balanced in acidity, its flavors lean into delicious apricot and peach.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Despite a tough vintage, this wine is showing all of the hallmarks of classic Marlborough Sauvignon. Aromas and flavors of snow peas, tropical and citrus fruits and touches of salty oyster shell are ensconced in a creamy texture and deftly balanced by citrusy acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the newly launched Cru label, this classy, varietally expressive Marlborough SB opens with bright lemon, lime, passion fruit, tomato leaf and dried herbs. Those passion fruit and leafy, dried herbal characters continue on the palate, which finishes long and salty. This should age gracefully. Drink now–2027.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This old-vine Sauvignon Blanc is polished and restrained, tightly wound with subtle citrus, tropical fruit, snow pea and grass. Extended time on lees results in a beautifully textured palate, chalky and silky all at once, with a long, salty finish. Drink now–2027.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: The fruit for this wine comes from the well-regarded, biodynamic Churton Vineyard in Marlborough. The nose offers a well of flavor in ripe pears, lemons, honeyed figs, flint, tarragon and other fresh green herbs. The palate is texturally taut and talc-like, sliced by crunchy acidity and backed by citrus and honey flavors. It has an endlessly long, lemony finish.

name: Kestrel 2018 Falcon Series Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)
description: The nose of this wine smells of canned fruit and soap, while the palate is dilute, with watered down flavors of apple and pear.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A crisply herbal wine with simple acidity and a grassy character, this is light, bright and ready to drink.

name: Duckhorn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is made partially from the Musque clone, the wine fermented in half neutral oak and half stainless-steel. Herbal and tart, it has an intensity of flavor and ripeness.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: With grapes coming from Four Lakes Vineyard, the aromas aren't entirely settled. Despite the listed alcohol, the fruit concentration and palate feel are quite light.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Very tart aromas of green apple and sour grapefruit meet with grassy, green-pepper aromas on the nose of this bottling. Flavors of rainy cement and dusty, dried apples show on the sip.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Blended with 15% Sémillon, this is a large-production white that is earthy and sharply high-toned in grapefruit, guava and flint. Plenty of acidity boosts the midpalate of concentration and richness, finding balance in the end.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Freshly cut grass, pea shoots and gooseberry etch themselves along a thick, concentrated palate of weight and richness in this vineyard-designated white.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Perfumed in jasmine, this is a richly woven white tasting boldly of fig and kiwi that finishes in a touch of metal.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This perfumed wine comes from a limestone-rich region on the southeastern edge of South Australia. It sees partial fermentation in large oak barrels and time on lees aging in stainless steel and oak. The result is pretty floral aromas along with orange peel, grapefruit, figs and white spice. The mouthfeel is slightly chalky and textural, lifted by zingy acidity and lots more citrusy fruit. It's a clean and likable drop.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Aromas of sliced green apple, lime and citrus blossom show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines lime, grass and apple, with a hint of honeysuckle.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Sharp in flinty, stainless-steel appeal, this is a bright, light-bodied white, with forceful layers of apricot, green apple and lime.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Wet gravel, damp grass and danky herbs show on the nose of this appellation blend. Dried green-apple flavors dominate the palate alongside hints of lime spray.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A one-off in Burgundy, this Sauvignon Blanc comes from a small appellation west of Chablis. It is slightly earthy and otherwise fresh, grassy and crisp with acidity. Green-fruit flavors are right up front, ready to be drunk now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a rounded wine, with hints of yellow fruits as well as citrus. Its crisp edge contrasts with the earthy warmth of tangy fruitiness. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From a trio of vineyards, this white is grassy and fruity in equal measure, with flavors of pineapple, maraschino cherry and kiwi. Lively acidity keeps it fresh in the glass, leading to a mineral-laden finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Aromas of wet gravel, lemon peel, citrus pith and green pear show on the nose of this bottling. There is a pleasant stony quality to the sip, where red-apple, light nectarine and peach-blossom flavors converge.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Strong in dried herb, lemongrass and pea shoots, this is a robust, rounded and richly composed white from the estate vineyard, showy in oak, peach and green apple.

name: Cloudy Bay 2015 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)
description: Herbal and earthy, this white tastes of pea shoots, peach and flowers. It's textured and showing just a hint of oak. Rounded in richness, it finishes lush and tropical.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Mineral-laced aromas of flint, gravel and slate play loudly on the nose of this bottling. There is intense tension on the sip, which is also stony but layered with grapefruit pith and lemon spray. Slight effervescence remains in bottle.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: An intensely herbal wine, this is crispness in a glass. Its tight acidity, zesty texture and great fruitiness are ready to drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Spicy green-fruit aromas are followed by a slightly oily-feeling palate braced by green-apple acidity. Stone fruit and passion fruit flavors are true to Sauvignon Blanc, while this is quick and spicy on the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This soft, fruity wine is an attractive interpretation of Sauvignon Blanc, displaying ripe white fruits and a touch of citrus. The wine is attractive to drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Sauvingon Blanc is the second grape in Rueda to Verdejo, but here's a good one for casual situations. A no-nonsense nose with white fruit scents and cactus notes leads to crispness on the tongue and flavors of stone fruits and passion fruit. A note of scallion spices up a citrusy finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This structured and demure white is juicy in pear and apple, with notes of vanilla and honey that add understated richness. With just a bite of weight, it refreshes in lengthy acidity.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The winery's Sauvignon Blancs don't shy away from an emphasis on the grape's grassy character. This is a penetrating, focused wine, with lemongrass and green pineapple flavors again pushing the herbal, pungent notes forward. It's sourced from a single acre planted in 2008.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Invigorating notes of gooseberry and lime accent this zesty, pleasantly herbal Sauvignon Blanc. Dry and revitalizing in style, it offers pristine grapefruit and lime flavors and a fresh, grassy finish. Drink now–2021.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This white offers sharp, tangy flavors of grapefruit, green apple and lemon. Lively acidity keeps it fresh through the midpalate and long, lingering finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Grassy in gooseberry, lychee and fig, this is an appealingly herbal wine that shows great structure and complexity. The fruit is abundant in peach fuzz, melon and apricot laced in buzzy acidity.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Floral, flinty and well balanced, with nice structure, this is a well-made white brimming in apricot and lime whose label states stainless-steel fermentation was used. It shows classic flavor and fleshy texture with length and decent depth.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: The Origines range from the Tutiac cooperative comes from the best parcels. This intense Sauvignon Blanc is richly textured but also fruity, with great swathes of lemon and green-apple flavors. Drink from 2020.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Bright in lemon and wet stone, this white offers an impressive breadth of flavor and texture. The oak is well integrated, yielding a wine that is open to lasting refreshment.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A standout at Melrose, this is bursting with ripe grapefruit and a pungent, penetrating grassiness, often noted with this grape. It's much closer to New Zealand than to a Loire Valley style, with notes of lemongrass adding some spice. The length and overall power are impressive.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A sensational take on an emerging Oregon style for Sauvignon Blanc, this rich, vibrant and deep wine rocks the palate with citrus, white peach and pear skin flavors. It's clearly varietal without being grassy or overly herbaceous, and the acids have been rounded off with just enough fruit sweetness to cut out any bitter edges.

name: J. Bookwalter 2017 1st Edition Conner Lee Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is outstanding white wine, entirely varietal and estate, aged in both new and old puncheons. Matchstick, flint and rounded acidity boost a midpalate of structure and complexity highlighted in white flower, lemon zest and Asian pear.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: A perfumed nose of lime, tropical fruit, white blossoms and hints of grass and snow peas leads on this Sauvignon. A creamy texture adds interest on the palate but it's not enough to make up for the lack of flavor and short finish, leaving this wine feeling a little flat and characterless.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A straightforward drop from a tough vintage in Marlborough, this opens with oniony aromas that give way to more vegetal ones like grass and bell pepper. Lemon-lime and tropical fruit are in the mix too. Crisp acidity balances a chalky texture and citrus and dried herbal flavors on the palate.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: The tangy fruitiness of this wine is lively and full bodied. Citrus flavors are balanced by ripe apples and contrast with an herbal edge. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: There's a slightly sour and tangy note on the nose of this wine, which offers aromas of lemon oil, cooked green apples and a slight nuttiness. There's a hint of wood on the palate, where dried lemon-peel flavors are tangy yet the overall impression is rich.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: In this wine, sharp edges of citrus and white flowers are met by grassy herbal tones that ride along a light-bodied frame highlighted in apple, lemon and melon.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Kiwi, peach and apricot flavors offer fruity intensity in this stainless steel white, which has stony mineral components that add to a complex texture. It is medium in weight and has a metallic tinge on the finish.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Cream, yeast and a touch of yogurt on the nose suggest richness. The palate follows suit but counters all the lactic flavors with lovely lemon brightness. This is a wine that lives off its rich texture and fine streamlined freshness, while peachy juiciness peeps like a promise from underneath. Keep this for best effect, let it become its full, creamy, complex self. Drink 2022–2032.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: There's some oniony reductiveness at the start of this wine, but it sits beside, rather than over, the lime, guava, pineapple-rind and dried green-herbal notes. On the palate there's seemingly a little residual sugar. It won't be noticeable in the form of sweetness necessarily, but as texture: a feeling of fruitiness and a slight creaminess. A tropical-fruit note rounds out the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: One of New Zealand's best known labels delivers a fruit bowl of a wine, bursting with peach, pineapple and guava, with a flicker of nondescript green-vegetal notes at the rear—a crisp slippery light weight summer sipper.

name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Quintessenz Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This barrel-fermented wine shows dried lemon peels and a funky herbal kick on the nose. The palate is packed with dried grass and sour apple flavors.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This crisp and light wine has grapefruit and crisp lemon flavors. They form a contrast to the tangy apple-skin texture that comes through the acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Crisp aromas of yellow bell pepper and citrus go mild on the pyrazines. A juicy but basic palate plays up the peppery side of this grape, while fresh lettuce and arugula notes play out on a thin finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a straightforward combo of citrus, stone and tropical fruits, with tomato leaf and just a touch of green vegetal character. There's a little residual sugar on the palate, which is noticeable mostly in the form of fruit weight, a creamy texture and as a counterbalance to the prickly acidity. The citrusy lift at the close is a refreshing way to finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a delicate but fragrant Sauvignon offering aromas of apple, pear, lime blossom, white spice and freshly cut grass. The same flavors follow through to the palate, which is chalky textured with a wet stone mineral nuance.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Tropical fruit aromas are accented by green notes and a hint of peppery spice. Tart citrus flavors reflect mostly orange and grapefruit, while there is little change on a finish that turns slightly salty.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Winemaker Vailia Esh's commitment to “give new verve to old songs” shines on this bottling from a cool-climate vineyard, which shows aromas of flint, grapefruit pith and wet stone on the nose. The tightly wound palate starts with flavors of fresh rubber and grapefruit peel before opening toward lime zest and wet concrete.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: 92–94. Barrel Sample. Pure notes of crisp, lemon and herbs give this wine freshness, intensity and layers of acidity and minerality. The wine will age relatively quickly.

name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2018 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Sweaty, briny aromas are packed to the hilt with pyrazines and oily citrus scents. A flat, oily palate is oddly flabby, while this tastes of bitter greens, tart grape skins, pineapple and alfalfa.

name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2018 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Bland, dusty aromas hint at green melon, and from there things don't improve. A lemony palate is linear and lean, while this tastes odd, sour and vegetal. Unfocused flavors fail to impress.

name: Producta Vignobles 2018 Mission Saint Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Stalky aromas lack fruit and freshness, while this feels flat and lacking in zest and cut. Bitter flavors don't suggest much, if any, fruit, while this fading SB is stale on the finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Gentle, almost emollient notes of passion fruit hover on the nose. The palate comes in with richer juiciness, adding hints of baked apricot and lovely lemon freshness. This is pure and serene and will be ready with a little bottle age. Drink 2020–2028.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is a barrel-fermented white that impresses from start to finish, with 4% Sémillon added to the mix. A sublime white-peach flavor is layered and well-integrated within a stony texture. Offering length and breadth, this is defined by an exotic spice note that lingers.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: On the nose the merest whiff of lemon suggests the fruit that broods underneath. The palate has a plump, limpid, glowing ripeness at its core, framed by leafy, crushed grassiness and vivid, pure lemon. There is something soft and creamy around the edges, too. This needs time to reveal its undoubted splendor. Drink 2022–2032.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: This light-straw-colored wine has a bouquet of clementine and spearmint. It lacks complexity, with flavors of quince and green apple that wind down to a eucalyptus finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Prickly aromas of pine, green herbs and seashell are low on fruit. This Sauvignon Blanc is plump and basic in feel, with apricot and peach flavors that turn peppery and bitter on a simple finish.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Deep gold to the eye, this wine has a nose of citrus, baking bread and vanilla. It is astringent on the palate, with flavors of tart apple, lemon and toast with a slightly sour finish.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: The nose is almost closed but here and there a flicker of passion fruit appears tantalizingly. The palate is just as tight and taut, but the gloriously aromatic passion fruit shines and shimmers. Purest lemon sets a silvery, zesty accent, but all about this bids you to be patient. This will blossom in all its freshness with a little bottle age. It holds all of Styria's dewy freshness. Drink 2022–2032

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Ripe tropical and citrus fruit sit heavily on the dry palate. It's sliced through with biting acidity and a lemony finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Onion and garlic aromas mostly blow off after a few minutes and let this medium-bodied wine turn more fruity and concentrated on the palate.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine emphasizes earthy and lightly herbal flavors and has a moderately rich mouthfeel to go with them. Subtle flint and mineral notes outweigh any fruitiness.

name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2017 Quintessenz Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Sour lime and sour guava aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent grip to the palate, although the flavors are a bit muddled, with apple and lemon most prominent.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine shows subtle notes of stone fruit and lemon, along with some herbal tones. There's crisp acidity on the palate but the fruit is a little sour, particularly on the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This wine features aromas of pear and vanilla. It is light in the mouth, with flavors of Gala apple, pineapple and mint that lead to a cooling finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lemon, stone fruit, florals and a grassy note in this wine lead to a palate that is textured and a bit weighty from partial fermentation in aged French oak for a few weeks. The acidity, however, is searing and all that texture isn't enough to balance it.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A simple nose of lemon sets the scene for flavors of grapefruit, lemon and white flowers. This wine offers a pleasant mouthfeel and a soft floral finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This creamy and fruity wine has a light herbal touch and citrus acidity. The elements give a ripe, crisp wine that is ready to drink.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is an easy-going sipper that's lemony, floral and a touch herbal, with prickly acidity and a chalky texture. It's light in body and finishes with a citrusy zing.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This bright, tangy and fruity wine comes from the Entre-deux-Mers region of Bordeaux. With crisp acidity, an herbal touch and plenty of citrus fruits, this fresh wine is ready to drink.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Pure herbal Sauvignon Blanc, this is a crisp wine. Full of citrus and with touches of spice, the wine has plenty of attractive acidity and a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a light, crisp wine offering up subtle tones of citrus, apple and stone fruit. It's juicy and bright, making it a refreshing choice for a hot day.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a slightly earthy reductive aroma followed by green-apple and white-pepper flavors. Good acidity gives it a sense of vibrancy.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: There's an intriguing and atypical streak of sour grass and earthy herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate displays a compelling grip, carrying flavors of chive, kaffir lime, lemongrass and fresh spring herbs.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of citrus tang, dried mango and cooked nuts. It's broad and ripe on the palate with apple-juice and lime-zest flavors.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Full bodied in thickness and concentration, this is a heavy grippy white. Floral on the nose, it offers well-defined flavors of lemon and melon that linger on the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Bright and lively, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavors and refreshing acidity. It has citrus and green-apple flavors, a crisp mouthfeel and clean finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This crisp white is grassy and herbal in pea shoots, with fresh fleshy layers of lemon peel that refresh the palate. Light in style and approach, it's well made and good value.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Pale straw in the glass, this wine has a nose of pink grapefruit and just-cut grass. Flavors of soft peach, green apple and white peppercorn wash across the palate before heading into a light pear-scented finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Appealing and refreshing, this medium-bodied wine combines bright and fresh citrus and apple aromas with crisp, fairly ripe fruit flavors and lively acidity for good balance.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: It's not flashy or superfruity, but this light-bodied wine has good, clean citrus flavors, crisp balance and a nicely brisk texture. It is nicely dry, appetizing and straightforward.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lime blossom and chalk lead into ripe pear flesh on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Texas. There is good zip to the sip and a compelling texture, delivering flavors of Gravenstein apple and pear

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine has a compact texture of firm acidity and tone. Subtle aromatics lead the way to defined flavors of melon and peach that have a density that persists on the long finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A classic Sauvignon Blanc at a fair price, this bottling starts with fresh and inviting aromas of apple blossom and red apple on the nose. Crisp and clean on the palate, it's tightly woven structure reveals lemon wedge and sliced Granny Smith apple flavors.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: From a new producer in the appellation, this is a refreshing, light-bodied wine that displays flavors of peach and Meyer lemon. The bright acidity quenches from start to finish.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Floral on the nose, this white is lively in acidity and stony in texture—a nice combination that gives it breadth and depth. Peach, apricot and Key lime flavors define the palate, with a lingering taste of melon. There is 5% Gewürztraminer blended in.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Very light on the nose at first, the refreshing bottling offers subtle aromas of springtime flowers and delicate grass, proving quite appealing and even sexy. The subtleties continue on the palate, where rounded Asian pear flesh meets with a honeysuckle sweetness.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This vibrant, sappy and delicious wine is another example of why Sauvignon Blanc seems to be a missed opportunity in Oregon. It offers flavors of lime, grapefruit, apple and melon, with a lightly buttery mouthfeel that's buttressed by juicy acidity.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Straightforward Sauvignon Blanc aromas of apple skins, pear rinds, grass and wet stone show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate starts tart with lime and then evolves into a creamier midpalate, offering flavors of lemon wedge and guava skin.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: With a persistence of lively acidity, this crisp white is fresh and floral, with textured waves of integrated flavor. The fruit consists of green apple, grapefruit and lime, a memorable medley of refreshment.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Sharp aromas of lime and underripe orange meet guava and wet concrete on the nose of this bottling, which was fermented in large barrels. There is great tension on the palate, where lime peel, lemon juice and chalky flavors reign.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: A richer style of Sauvignon Blanc, this bottling is a darker yellow in the glass and offers honeyed aromas of almond, orange, dried apple and pineapple brioche. It's soft, supple and slightly oily on the unctuous palate, where salted apple, petrol and light vanilla flavors converge into a white wine with power.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Briny white-fruit aromas are loaded with pyrazines and matchstick notes. Sharp malic acid makes for a zesty citric palate, while this tastes of sour green apple and gooseberry, with orange peel in the background.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Green aromas and minimal fruit on the nose are telling. This feels bland on the palate, while citrusy flavors are briny and slightly bitter prior to a short, salty finish.

name: Astrolabe 2016 Taihoa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A yellow color and barrel-based aromas with oily tropical backing introduce this oak-aged SB. A chunky palate with pineapple juice weight tastes of woody melon, mango and citrus. Overt oak comes back on a resiny finish with vanilla notes.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Peppery aromas suggest green bell pepper and not much more. A lean, acidic palate offers vague citrus flavors offset by a hint of canned peas, while this is crisp but hollow on the finish. Prior vintages of this vineyard-designated SB have been better.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Medium straw colored in the glass, this zesty Sauvignon Blanc from Bulgaria has aromas of lemon, salty sea air and grapefruit pith. It is bright upon entry into the mouth with flavors of lemon curd and pineapple before the zesty finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Briny citrus aromas are frankly a bit sweaty. A blazing palate is based on citric acidity, while this tastes of sour orange and lemon-lime. A crisp, cleansing finish is tight and juicy.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This seems to be sitting under a blanket of sulfur that is somewhat masking the lemon-lime, grapefruit, pineapple, nettle and vegetal aromas. It's oily in texture on the palate, with more flavors of citrus and tropical fruit cut by sharp acidity. The finish feels a touch sour.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is initally reserved on the nose, but with time in the glass, aromas of citrus, nettles, herbs and snow peas begin to show. Things improve some on the palate, which shows lifted citrus fruit flavors and clean, crisp acidity amid a slippery texture and a short but pleasing lemon-lime and herbal finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Saline, generic white-fruit aromas and a touch of spice make up the nose on this sharp, tight SB. Tart citrus flavors are backed by smacking acidity that keeps a punchy finish going for a long while.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Muted seemingly by a fairly thick blanket of sulfur, this wine squeaks out citrus and tropical fruit and snow pea aromas. The palate is equally shy and a little watery, showing only hints of tropical fruit and a short finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lacking the ripe fruit flavors of the previous year, this wine is on the lean and mean side. It starts with onion and plastic aromas. Underneath lurks lemon rind, grapefruit and dried herbs. The palate shows brighter citrus flavors, but the acidity feels a little underripe.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Basic Sauvignon Blanc aromas of mixed citrus fruits are a touch flat and starting to show some age. A tangy palate with citric acidity tastes of lime, passion fruit and grapefruit, all backed by slight bitterness. Drink as soon as possible.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This a lush fruity wine that is easy on the taste buds. Pineapple and citrus aromas lead to ripe, lightly sweet pineapple and banana flavors and a soft low-acid texture.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: This may be Te Mata's upper tier wine, but, for this vintage anyway, the barrel ferment, which includes 11% Sémillon and 3% Sauvignon Gris feels soapy and overworked. Aromas of ripe lemon, watermelon, bubblegum, banana, honey and fresh tarragon feel as much oak as fruit derived. The oak and lees work is even more evident on the palate, but it's cut through by lifted acidity and fresher, tangier fruit. This seems to be going through an awkward phase. Give it a few more years in the bottle and things may very well improve.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Dominant aromas of celery, bell pepper and canned peas play up the green side of Chilean SB. A plump and round mouthfeel is held together by moderate acidity, while this tastes of pyrazines, meaning canned beans and peas. A plump and peppery finish is full of cool-climate greenness.

name: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a wine that has been worked. A lot. It was whole bunch pressed, barrel fermented wild on solids and with lees stirring. And while walking the less trodden path is always admirable, in this instance it delivers an odd, mealy wine that's honeyed and heavy with notes of waxy lemons and limes, pineapples, guavas and green peppers. Things pick up more on the palate. It's tangy, and textural with zingy acidity and bright fruit, although that mealiness is present here, too.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine carries light aromas of apple skin and herb. The medium-bodied palate is viscous in feel, with creamy fruit flavors to help round out the experience.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Unmistakably Marlborough Sauvignon, this wine is a heady combo of peach and floral soaps, lychees, snow peas and grass. On the palate, the bright fruit and chalky texture are sliced through the middle with searing acidity. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Rounded tropical fruits go with intense acidity in a wine that is bright and rich. A smoky character brings out white-currant flavors to freshen up the mango aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Apple and punchy citrus aromas share space on the nose, while this feels round and solid. Briny flavors of green melon and passion fruit lose intensity in fast order on a finish that shouts green and herbal.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Punchy aromas of green citrus, bell pepper and sea foam come with top-heavy pyrazinic notes. A strong coastal green character drives this Leyda SB, which tastes of celery, bell pepper and briny citrus fruits.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: The cooler, more difficult vintage of 2017 shows less upfront fruitiness than the previous vintage. Nevertheless, this wine achieves a balance of citrus, peach, dried herb, nettle and jalapeño notes, along with a textured mouthfeel that's lifted with zingy acidity. Things finish bright and lemony.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Briny apple aromas are clean and lively. A citric palate has the feel of grapefruit juice squeezed straight from the fruit itself. Grapefruit is also the key flavor, with a light note of green herbs carrying over to the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This lively, fresh, light-bodied wine offers citrus and mint aromas followed by richer apple and peach flavors on a smooth, rounded texture with just a hint of acidity underneath.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Generous fruity aromas and flavors give this medium-bodied wine a fresh straightforward appeal. It is packed with apple, banana, peach and melon notes carried on a relatively soft texture.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Dry and tangy in style, this light-bodied wine offers good refreshment qualities due to bright citrus and green-apple flavors. Good acidity keeps the texture lively so it will make a good lunch or apéritif wine.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Spunky aromas of grapefruit and lime are typical for Leyda SB. A fairly full palate feels a bit oily, while this is briny and mildly salty tasting, with lime as the core flavor. A steady finish with moderate fullness and bright acidity is solid.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine deftly balances fruit, vegetal and herb characters in the form of papaya, guava, peach pit, snow pea and tomato leaf. It's textural but not overtly creamy, with crunchy acidity and an herbal finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The entry-level wine from this magnificent estate, this reveals considerable intensity as well as rich tropical fruits. It is a full-bodied wine, juicy and full of acidity, offering ripe oranges with a strong, tangy aftertaste. Drink from late 2019.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine blends generous apple flavors with touches of mineral and fig for a fruity but substantial style. Good acidity balances an impression of slight sweetness.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an aromatic and fruity wine offering up bright pineapple and pear aromas but also a good dose of tomato leaf and dried herbs. The palate is slippery yet chalky, with crisp acidity and a tangy, fruity finish that makes it easy to reach for another sip.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Green aromas of lime, canned peas and beans feed into a palate that's minerally and moderate in body, with pulsating acidity. Flavors of lean, green citrus fruits are herbal and grassy, while this is tight as a drum on the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh, fruity and tangy, this wine is a good thirst quencher and will be versatile in food pairings. It has a sunny, ripe flavor profile and enough crisp acidity for good balance.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Less brash than many in this category, this wine's aromas range from tropical and stone fruits (guava, pineapple and peach) to wet stones, grass and flower blossoms. Still young, the fairly searing acidity is somewhat balanced by a slippery texture and bright fruit.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A soft note of Cream of Wheat accents more concentrated fresh fynbos, grass and lemon pith tones. Lightweight, it offers a slight prickle on the palate, with good cut to the green gooseberry and pear flavors. The finish is mouthwatering and brisk.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: For starters, this cool-climate SB is almost colorless and smells tight, lean and stony, with lime as the main fruit aroma. A crisp palate is home to briny citrus flavors, while a zesty, cleansing finish confirms all that came before it.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Very perfumed, this attractive wine has ripe tropical and lychee flavors cut with acidity and a touch of herb that add the necessary freshness. The wine comes from a four-acre parcel known as Les Bas Quartauts. Drink now.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of snow pea, tomato leaf and jalapeño lead the charge, but they're balanced by ripe tropical and stone fruit that temper the greenness. On the palate things feel riper, offering a viscous texture that's balanced by cheek-biting acidity. The finish is tangy and satisfying.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Soft hints of white flowers, like honeysuckle and orange blossom, lead the nose of this pretty wine, with supporting scents of orange pith, honeydew rind and beeswax. The palate is light in weight and focused, with bright acidity that complements the white peach and lemongrass flavors. There's a light structure on the finish, with a final kiss of nuttiness on the back.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: There's a soft, pleasant flintiness upfront on the nose of this wine, with more pronounced notes of orange peel, fresh grass and green melon rind. It's just more than lightweight on the palate, offering ample acidity to complement flavors of green plum, lime pith and more green melon that linger on the close. A slight pithiness lends some texture to the finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine offers a heady mélange of lychee, peach, pineapple and rose water, with just a touch of tomato leaf. Tangy fruit follows onto the palate, which has a lovely, viscous texture and tingly acidity. It's a highly likable, mouthwatering drop.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Dusty lime and ocean breeze aromas are fresh and chiseled. There's more to the palate of this coastal SB than many of its kin, with pushy acidity and volume. Green apple, citrus and salty flavors conclude on a round finish with ample body.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Ex-Cloudy Bay winemaker Kevin Judd's wines are never shy and never boring. This wine is an opulent Sauvignon, quite the opposite of the Marlborough style most are familiar with. Wild fermented in oak barrels, it's a heady combo of lemon, toast, salted cashew and wild herb. The full-bodied palate is highly textural but not heavy thanks to a good lick of acidity. Herbs, lemon rind and toasty oak ripple right through the finish.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A cool vintage in Martinborough has yielded an austere and vegetal wine. Tones of green bean, tomato stem, pressed yellow flower, grapefruit and stone lead to a grainy-textured palate. Laser-focused acidity highlights accents of dried herbs. Those who normally steer away from ultrafruity Sauvignon will find this a refreshing and compelling drop.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: The small hamlet of Saint-Andelain is the source of this wine. Planted on flinty soil, the grapes give out a strongly mineral character, tightly textured at this young stage. The wine is full, ripe with herbal and yellow-fruit flavors comfortably combined. Drink from 2020.

name: Cloudy Bay 2015 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)
description: An all-around solid example of Marlborough Sauvignon, this wine is carried by lifted aromas of fresh lime, guava and passion fruit, with a lick of dried green herb and salty oyster shell. The palate takes a more austere turn. It's nicely balanced, chalky in texture and bone dry, with crunchy acidity and bright fruit. Again, an herbal and saline character runs along its spine.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
