description: The bouquet of this fresh and lively wine offers up ripe orange, green melon, sweet grass and lightly caramelized pineapple. Medium acidity lends vibrancy to the solid ripe gooseberry and pineapple core flavors on the lightweight palate, with great cut through the mouthwatering close.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine is a good choice in the savory style. Vivid cut-grass and shallot aromas lead to a lively palate impression and citrus flavors tinged with mineral. It has great acidity, is not overripe and nicely shows the character of the grape variety.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Despite battling an unusually warm and wet vintage, this producer once again delivers the goods. This wine balances tropical and stone fruit flavors with green notes of tomato leaf and nettles, alongside a saline, sea swept quality. Texturally, it's like wet stones, with crystalline acidity that buoys the bright fruit and seashell saltiness.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine bursts with aromas of lime, pineapple, peach and apple, followed by the variety's characteristic green bell pepper and nettle aromas. The palate is viscous but balanced by focused acidity. Less fruity than the nose, the herbal, vegetal nuances get the chance to shine here. It is a classy, even elegant Sauvignon from the bottom of New Zealand's North Island.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine is ripe, full in the mouth and packed with white fruits. Underneath all this richness, a crisp, mineral character gives a great lift of herbal acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a multifaceted and tasty drop from two organic vineyards in the Bendigo and Pisa subregions of Central Otago. Fragrant, fruit aromas of grapefruit, lemon, pineapple and lychee are laced with streaks of honey, flint and minerals, showing just a little green veg and herbal nuances. The palate offers zippy acidity, bright fruit, dried herb and chalky minerality, leading to a lemony zing on the finish.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of green bell pepper are largely devoid of fruit. This feels wet but shows no grip or tension. Peppery green flavors sputter out on the finish.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This may be 9.5% alcohol, but the payoff is a wine that's mean and green. It starts oniony and reductive and is followed by green notes of nettle, jalapeño pepper and tomato leaf with just a hint of fruit in the form of passion fruit and lime. On the palate, the acidity is underripe and searing. There's a touch of juicy, limey fruit but it's beat into submission by the acidity.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: A soft, dull nose has little to offer, while this tired SB feels flabby. Oxidized white fruit flavors finish with low acidity and almost no edge.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Floral overdrive on the nose suggests intense honeysuckle. The palate lacks definition and a little balance, but has vivid acidity and juiciness. Drink while flavors are fresh.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Waxy apple and petrol aromas are akin to some Rieslings but uncommon to Sauvignon Blanc. Mildly oxidized citrus flavors end with tired lemon and orange notes marred by oxidation.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is an oaky expression of Sauvignon Blanc where the vanilla custard, nutmeg and spicy, woody aromas all but overpower stone fruit characters. Things improve on the palate, which is restrained and manages to avoid overt malolactic creaminess. It's lifted by crunchy acidity, but it's not enough to handle all that vanillin oak, which lingers in the mouth long after swallowing.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This doesn't succeed as well as the previous year, and that could be down to the difficult vintage. It feels overworked and like there's a fair whack of SO2. It's a combo of lemon-lime, peach, tropical fruit and dried green-herb nuances, amidst a slippery texture and lean, almost searing acidity. A slightly bitter herbal note makes up the finish.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This is a fairly worked, commercial style of Sauvignon that hasn't fared well in the difficult vintage that was 2018. Sure, it's got the citrus, stone-fruit, green-bell pepper and tomato leaf characters this style is known for, but the acidity is searing and hard to take, bowling the fruit right over.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From two vineyards on Marlborough's southern coast, this is a vegetal dominated wine showing notes of asparagus and canned peas. Tropical fruit is there too in the background, along with flecks of honey. The medium weight palate is grainy textured. There's less veg here but there's also less fruit. The region's hallmark acidity feels a touch underripe and the flavors end abruptly—a slightly odd, disjointed expression.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Briny peach and melon aromas feed into a palate dictated by grabby grape-skin extraction. Slightly bitter pear and green apple flavors finish flat and with a mild grassy taste.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a very pale-hued wine that could, on quick glance, be mistaken for a glass of water! The flavors are relatively watery as well: delicate if not overly interesting notes of ripe lime, pineapple and green bell pepper. The acidity is a little tart and a touch of residual sugar left in the wine offers some fruit weight to counteract it. The finish is short and simple.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is a little closed in on itself and even with vigorous swirling in glass only squeaks out hints of citrus, stone fruit, dried herbs and grass. Acidity on the palate is mouth watering, balancing the ripe fruit and herbs, but it takes awhile in glass before these characters are revealed.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Initially, reductive oniony notes dominate the nose here. But they mostly blow off after awhile and then the fruit-bowl aromas are given the chance to shine through: peach, passion fruit, grapefruit and touches of vegetal greenness. Things get a bit harsh on the palate again, where sharp acidity bites at the heels of the plump, juicy fruit.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine offers a quiet line of peach, passion fruit and lime aromas, with just the suggestion of green pepper. The fruit on the palate is ripe and textured but the acidity feels a little searing and disjointed.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A bit oniony at first, aromas of nectarine, lime, grapefruit and bell pepper soon appear. Crisp tingly acidity cuts through the fruitiness but it feels disjointed and a little underripe and overworked.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Pale, almost watery in color, this wine shows its cooler, seaside Awatere locale by offering a salty character to accompany notes of passion fruit, guava, snow peas and nettles. The palate feels less cohesive with the plush ripe fruit sliced through by racy searing acidity and only just saved by the textural weight of the fruit.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: There are lots of reductive aromas going on here—onions and some feline notes—followed by rather brash, underripe tones of canned green beans and peas and then, eventually, lime and passion fruit. The reduction does dissipate in the glass, but give it a little while. Things improve on the palate where the fruit is tangy, the acidity zippy and the mouthfeel chalky. A refreshing limey note takes thing out at the close.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Buttery, woody aromas are out front and dominate the nose on this barrel-heavy SB. A grabby palate is made stickier by cloying wood tannins, while this tastes mostly of wood grain, with distant hints of spiced apple and citrus.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Leading with aromas of cut grass, pressed yellow flower, lemon zest and stone fruit, a sharp acidity punches on the palate, but is balanced—just barely—by a slippery texture and fruit sweetness.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Lime peels, red apple and hints of kelp show on the nose of this bottling. It's grippy on the palate with aggressive acidity, offering intense flavors of Granny Smith apple, lime and green herbs.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The grassy herbal nose shows notes of white pepper and grapefruit. The bright zesty palate offers ripe lemon and white peach following with ripe apple and an herbal tinge on the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Steely mineral character makes for an easy approachable entry into this crisp refreshing white, which is light in style with a lush middle. Pear and apricot flavors complement the mouthfeel.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Lively lemon and green-apple aromas make this light-bodied wine attractive from the first whiff. It brings more crisp fruit to the flavors, and maintains a tangy balance that's quite appetizing.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fresh aromas of pear, rainy cement and the slightest hint of grass are evident on the nose of this bottling. There is a compellingly tangy grip to the crisp sip, which also shows ripe red apple and other pome fruits, making for a complex, pleasing sip.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an easy-drinking but punchy Sauvignon Blanc boasting zesty lemon and lime flavors marked by hints of freshly cut grass and herbs. It's dry, medium-bodied style and margarita-like salted finish lend refreshment. Enjoy now–2021.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Light aromas of mineral, herb and citrus are followed by bright, fuller-styled, well-balanced fruit flavors that carry on the finish. Pair it with food to see it at its best.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Made in a richer style than most, this wine has its share of attractive baking-spice aromas, ripe apple and peach flavors and full body. It's unoaked but offers nice complexity and maturity anyway.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Generous aromas of citrus, herb and tropical fruit are followed by lean, puckering, white grapefruit flavors. It brings a captivating sense of acidity along with a lengthy finish.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Crisp aromas of lemon wedge, chilled green apples, river stones and white flowers make for an alluring start to this bottling. There is a strong sizzle to the sip, which presents flavors of honeysuckle, grapefruit and crisp apple slices.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Inviting in floral and peach aromatics, this well-made medium-bodied white has high-toned citrus flavors at its core. Grapefruit and lemon juice and zest mingle effortlessly buoyed by bright acidity and persistent freshness.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A portion of this wine was fermented in French oak, while the other half in stainless-steel drums. It is grassy and herbal at first, settling into flavors of lemon rind, melon and pea shoot. The palate is rich and rounded, with buzzy acidity brightening the background.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a nicely tart, palate-cleansing wine with plenty of fruit acidity, rather light body and vivid lemon, grapefruit and fresh herb flavors. It tastes bracing and crisp, making it a great choice with appetizers and on hot summer days.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is fermented and aged in barrel for six months, and it shows a moderate midpalate of structure of supportive oak. In taste, it's a tart tangy expression of green apple, lemon and grapefruit pith, the acidity up front and persistently fresh and forgiving.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is an easygoing, lovable and classically made white from one vineyard site in Carneros planted to the Musqué clone of the variety. It shares effusive layers of peach and vanilla within a viscous mouthfeel of elegant power and grace.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine is not too full bodied, but is big in terms of zesty, vivid flavors of grapefruit, lemon peel and green apple. It has mouthwatering acidity and great palate-cleansing characteristics. Bring on the oysters or cold cracked crab.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This has 10% Sauvignon Musqué, 3% Sémillon and 1% Muscat Canelli. Together, the grapes provide an experience of floral melon, stone fruit and white flower, a pungent nuttiness contributing additional complexity. The midpalate is steely and high toned in citrus.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of lemon peel and pomelo wedge meet with gravelly, grassy undertones on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is richness to the palate, and the faint hint of oak, with flavors of baked apple that are cut by grass and squeezed lime.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: From McGinley Vineyard, this bottling is extremely fresh and vibrant, starting with aromas of spring flowers, alpine water, white lily and delicate pear peels. There is extreme tension to the palate, where rounded apple, pear and nectarine flavors are wrapped in fresh acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This beautifully crafted wine has sizzling acidity and resulting freshness, with a bite of texture and grit. Peach, fig and melon flavors ride alongside crisper elements of lemon pith and grapefruit, finding a cohesive whole that is balanced and forever bright.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This white is the result of concrete egg experimentation and it succeeds wildly in its lovely capture of acid-driven stone fruit enveloped in a persistence of minerality. Peach and lemon flavors round out a medium-bodied texture of impressive lushness and enduring beauty. The wine was aged 12 months in concrete.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wild- and barrel-fermented Sauvignon is fragrant and fruity but not overtly so, with aromas of fresh lime juice, white flower blossoms, honeysuckle, orange zest and freshly cut grass. It's textural and chalky on the palate, with mouthwatering acidity, bright fruit and an orange peel finish. The oak supports but barely shows in flavor.

name: Pascal Jolivet 2010 Exception  (Sancerre)
description: The top wine from this grand estate is made from selected rows of old vines. It has both deep flavor and intense concentration, offering ripe white fruits that are now mature as well as a nutty character that balances the rich texture. The wine is sure to age well. Drink from 2021.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: The vineyard of the fortress of Château de Tracy, owned by the d'Assay family for 600 years, has produced a rich, well-balanced wine with a strong herbal element as well as apple, citrus and spice. Still a young wine bursting with fruit, it will be better when it softens. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine really wraps up New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc in one brilliantly balanced package: Nettles nestle next to grapefruit; tomato leaf lingers beside guava; lime and pineapple perch alongside dried green herbs. Crisp, prickly acidity slices through a chalky texture that feels like stones baking in the sun.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: This wine is somewhat spritzy and thick, with a drying taste of lemon candy and strong vegetative essence. Pea shoot and gooseberry figure into the mix.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Veggie aromas and oily, doughy flavors make this wine a bit extreme but it does have a smooth texture and some nice baking-spice elements that develop on the palate.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Oily white fruit aromas are fleshy but inexact, with a note of lanolin. A full, plump palate delivers wayward citrus flavors along with a dash of sea brine. Salt and pyrazines rise up on a finish that holds its own.

name: Undurraga 2018 U By Undurraga Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Bright and fruity, this light wine is full of herbal flavors. Lemon touches and fresh acidity are refreshing, crisp and the wine is ready to drink.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Oily citrus aromas carry a sulfuric matchstick scent. This is tight and sharp on a palate driven by malic acidity. Briny citrus flavors show a hint of green herbs, while a chalky finish confirms the wine's lean, tart profile.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc mainly from the Côtes de Gascogne region is light, fruity and fresh. It has an herbal edge but is as much about refreshing green fruits, lime and sliced apple flavors. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Thick, herbal and buttery, the midpalate of this white is grassy and awash in pea shoot. Medium bodied, it has a simplicity of approach.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: This is a stainless-steel fermented and aged white that takes some time to reveal its aromatics—a subtle combination of peach and wet stone that follows through on the lean up-front acidity. Touches of jalapeño add spice as a contrasting hit of vanilla takes hold on the finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A pale straw color and prickly, grassy aromas that lean toward green citrus open this lees-aged SB. Much like the nose suggests, this tastes of green citrus fruits and grass, while a short finish is fresh and snappy.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Wet earth, dried yellow-apple peels and damp herbs show on the nose of this bottling. There is a petrol character to the sip as well as flavors of sour apple and dried grass.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Blended with 5% Gewürztraminer, this is a light herbaceous offering of bright stone fruit that's fresh, viscous and well made. Vibrant acidity permeates a fruit-forward style tinged in contrasting notes of freshly cut grass and lemon meringue.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This medium-bodied, value-priced wine from a Sierra Foothills winery offers an interesting mix of melon, herb and pistachio aromas and flavors along with a smooth and rather rich texture.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Produced from grapes in the same Sauternes vineyard as the first-growth sweet wine, this fragrant dry (sec) wine has touches of honey as well as crisply herbal fruit. It is taut, with an earthy hint that should blow away over the next few months. Drink from 2020.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Whiffs of ripe pink grapefruit and caramelized sugar on the nose contrast zesty white grapefruit and green herbs on the palate of this dry, refreshing Sauvignon Blanc. It's easy drinking but boasts an elegant mineral finish. Enjoy now–2021.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Sour limes and cut lawn clippings show on the nose of this bottling from the heart of Ballard Canyon. There is good grip to the sip, where sour Granny Smith apple flavors meet with damp gravel minerality.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Sour limes and green-apple peels make for a tangy aromatic entry to this bottling. There are plenty of rainy cement flavors on the palate, which is lifted by lime peel.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a bone-dry Sauvignon that offers up stone and tropical fruit, floral, snow pea, and green-bean flavors amidst a searing line of acidity that very nearly overpowers the fruit.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Reductive and oniony at first, this aroma spends at least the first five minutes in glass overpowering the other aromas, but it does eventually blow off. In its wake lie notes of nettles, grass, bell pepper, lemon and grapefruit. On the palate, the reductive and vegetal characters slip away, making room for the fruit, which is bright and crunchy, nestled into a slippery texture and crisp acidity.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Crisp but tangy lime and poached pear flavors show on the nose of this bottling. There are a lot of tangy grassy flavors to the palate, from lime peels to lemongrass.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Passion fruit and crushed mineral aromas lead to a citrusy palate with weight and balance. Lime and green herb flavors are standard for Leyda, while this shows a hint of early oxidation on a short finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe, almost confected, pineapple leads the way here but it's not over the top. Grapefruit zest, snow peas and tomato-leaf characters are also in the mix. The palate is waxy in texture with fleshy tropical and citrus fruit balanced by salt and green-vegetable flavors. The acidity is on the mean and green side but the ripe fruit creeps back in on the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This small family-owned estate has produced a solid wine from a difficult vintage. Intensely fruity aromas of ripe pineapple, melon and lime Popsicle mingle with snow pea and dried green herbs. The palate is less extroverted, thanks to cheek-sucking acidity. Things finish with a herbal touch.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This ripe, almost honeyed wine is swirling with pineapple, guava and black currant, and has a tomato leaf character in the wings. The juicy fruit is accompanied by crisp acidity and there's a long pineappley finish. It is a refreshing poolside sipper.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a slippery textured wine with a citrusy bite that offers up-front characters of lemon-lime, passion fruit, nettles, tomato leaf and a streak of sea salt. It is a zingy and refreshing drop.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a ripe wine, particularly considering its home in the cool, sea swept Awatere Valley. Aromas like candied peaches and pineapples combine with flowers and soft, grassy undertones to make up the nose. The palate is creamy with bright acidity and plush fruit. It makes for refreshing easy sipping.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Mandarin and guava are backed by a firm grassy note and crowned by a daisy chain on the nose. Spry acidity tickles the palate, which is full of lime and wheatgrass, with some apple notes as well. The dry, crushed mineral finish is extended by mouthwatering acidity, lemon juice and Golden Delicious apple.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a ripe fruity wine that leads with heady aromas of candied pineapple, lemon-lime, green pepper and grass. It's clean and crisp with bright if slightly searing acidity and a chalky texture. Drink up.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a juicy citrusy wine that offers up flavors of lime, grapefruit, guava, jalapeño peppers and a touch of oyster-shell saltiness, wrapped up in a chalky texture and zippy acidity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Although this Sauvignon is from a region 180 miles south of Marlborough, it exhibits similar characters to its more famous neighbor. Heady aromas of grapefruit, lime, jalapeño pepper and nettles lead to a bright and citrusy palate. A touch of residual sugar helps balance the zingy acidity and adds texture and fruit weight to this simple but gluggable wine.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A rather odd but not unattractive combo of onion, struck match, salt and buttery nuances lead on this wine. They're followed by notes of dried herbs, red apples, lime and pineapple. Flinty acidity cuts through the creamy texture on this almost medium-bodied Sauvignon. A mouthwatering limey zing closes things out.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: The aromas are a bit hard to tease out, opening to show notes of melon and fig. Sleek flavors follow that flatten out on the finish. The variety seems hard to place.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine leads with a heady nose of lime, green apple, pineapple rind, and just a suggestion of grass and green veg. Drink up, though, because the fruit quickly starts to feel less fresh and more confected while sitting in glass. On the palate, a slippery texture is cut through with crisp citrusy acidity. The finish is limey and grassy.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Grassy and herbaceous aromas meet with lime rinds on the nose of this bottling. The palate is broadly intriguing with mango and lemongrass flavors, framed in buoyant acidity and finishing more toward earthy dried grass.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine walks a reductive line at first. It's oniony and a little closed in on itself. But things open with time in glass, and soon aromas of waxy lemon, lime, peach, dried green herbs and canned beans waft to the fore. The palate is crisp and citrusy, balanced nicely by silky texture and tingly fruitiness.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Briny Pacific Coast aromas include notes of green citrus. A lean, tangy palate has lime juice kick and acidity. Grapefruit and lime flavors precede a juicy finish that makes you salivate. This was made to go with ceviche, crudo and shrimp salad.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A Sauvignon Blanc that brings out the more tropical flavors of the grape, this is ripe and lightly textured. Its acidity gives a tangy contrast, heightening the fruitiness of the wine. Drink the wine now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A ripe fruity nose displays orange, Asian pear, quince and Meyer lemon. Rambunctious, tangy acidity on the plate delivers flavors of grapefruit, wet stone, peach pit, and apple. A chalky lime-laced finish is tart with green apple and a touch of pithiness.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Grapefruit, passion fruit, tomato leaf and jalapeño peppers take the lead in this Sauvignon from Martinborough, at the bottom of the North Island. Really, it's all about the palate, which is powdery in texture with a focused line of crisp acidity and a green-tomato-leaf character running through to the finish. It's both classic and classy.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: In the Waipara Valley, north of Christchurch, this Sauvignon Blanc ticks many of the country's typical style boxes. It's fragrant and zippy, with heady fruit-bowl aromas of lemon rind, peach, guava and pineapple along with a touch of green bell pepper—a refreshing summer sipper.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: White pepper, lemon and green-apple aromas introduce a tart palate that echoes the nose, with the addition of honeydew melon with a grassy note. This is bright and juicy with tart sunny acidity, the finish brings a squeeze of lime juice while apple flavor lingers long.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Pale lemon in color, the nose delivers freshly cut grass, ripe gooseberry and lime zest. The juicy palate is with vibrant acidity in tones of ripe apple and lemon that extend to the clementine finish in a final bright juicy push.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Green veggy and herbal notes take the lead in this wine in the form of jalapeño peppers and nettles. They're followed closely by notes of lemon rind, peach and white pepper spice. The waxy stony texture on the palate is cut through by tingly acidity. Sea salt and lemon zip through to the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This vintage sees a big improvement on the last. There's slight reduction on the nose at first, but it's not enough to bury the black currant, pineapple-rind, peach, freshly cut grass and herbal fragrances. The fruit takes a tangy lead on the palate, where it sits amidst a slippery texture and racy acidity. This is a simple but likable drop.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This vintage of The Ned is once again a fruity easygoing number that checks many of the New Zealand Sav Blanc boxes. Peppy peach, guava and citrus nuances are backed by greener ones: nettles, jalapeño peppers and dried herbs. Powdery textured and buoyed by bright fruit and crunchy acidity, this is a refreshing and balanced drop.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a balanced and refreshing drop. It boasts ripe pineapple, melon, guava and fresh green-leaf flavors accompanied by flinty acidity, a slightly creamy texture and long, tingly finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a delicate and quite pretty wine wafting lime-blossom and grapefruit aromas with quiet green-bell-pepper nuances. It's slippery and mouthwatering with tingly acidity and a lime and green herbal character on the finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: The most well known wine from the brand that arguably put New Zealand wine on the map has gotten more restrained and austere over the years. The latest iteration leads with green grass and tomato-leaf characters. The guava and pineapple fruit is less fleshy and more pithy. Waxy and chalky in texture, it is tight and focused, if a little harshly so. There's focused crunchy acidity and a sea-salt character that lingers on the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Pale gold in color, this is a tasty, textural Sauvignon offering up a heady mix of fresh green herbs, lime leaf, green-apple and stone-fruit notes, all balanced by a mouthfeel that is both chalky and creamy. It punches above its weight.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: The quality of this vintage is back up to where it was in 2016, and the fruit less confected than it's been previous years. Delicate attractive notes of lime blossom and stone fruit along with a hint of snow pea and sea salt nestle within a silky texture, buoyed by a line of stony crunchy acidity. Sip with Southeast Asian cuisine.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a relatively restrained wine that's a little reductive to start. But there's plenty of lemon-lime green-apple, pineapple, nettle and snow-pea aromas too. Things brighten up quite a lot on the palate. The fruit is juicy and tart, like biting into a green apple, and a slippery texture balances crisp acidity.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Oddly, this wine starts out with kerosene aromas reminiscent of a New World Riesling. There's also plenty of more varietally typically characters like lemon, grilled pineapple, passion fruit, grass and honey. This wine, however, is really all about the palate, which is creamy textured and bursting with ripe fruit-bowl flavors, sliced through with zingy lemony acidity. Drink with a wide array of seafood dishes.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas bring appealing notes of fig, herb and whole lemon. Sleek, tart, citrus and tropical fruit flavors follow. It's tasty.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This vintage of Giesen's Sauvignon is a traditional balanced expression, but it does lack some of the interest of the previous year, perhaps thanks to the challenging 2018 vintage. Nevertheless, it delivers plenty of passion fruit, lime, black currant and grass characters, is slippery in texture and buoyed by crisp citrusy acidity. It is great plonked on the table at a fresh veg-filled summer meal.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A touch of reduction gives a smoky, flinty edge to the vivid citrus and gentle passion fruit on the nose. The palate is pristine with lemon sharpness and juicy fruit. The body is light, dry and totally refreshing with a totally lip-smacking finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This well-balanced wine bursts with fruit-bowl characteristics of grapefruit, lime and passion fruit with black-currant leaf, grass and jalapeño pepper to boot. It's slippery in texture, tangy fruited and buoyed by crisp acidity. A long passion fruit note lingers on the finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The Southern Valleys subregion of Marlborough tends to house heavier, more clay dominant soils suited to Pinot Noir. This Sauvignon, however, is clearly a happy resident, showcasing a nose full of fruit—pineapple, green apple, melon and lychee—with a soft streak of green in the form of tomato leaf and nettle. It's the palate that sets this wine apart, though, balancing chalky texture with a mouthwatering acidity that glides rather than cuts like a knife on the tongue, make another sip an easy endeavor.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Darker in color than many of its counterparts (more straw than pale yellow) this wine is offers up aromas of grilled nectarine, pineapple, lime, apple blossoms and copper-penny tone. The palate is textural with a slight saltiness on the fish. A rather surprising and singular Sauvignon that could work with a variety of dishes.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Lemon zest notes and a hint of passion fruit rise from the glass. The palate is fresh, easy and broadens to accommodate all of that citrus freshness.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is once again a solid wine, despite the difficult vintage. The classic fruit and veg combo reigns supreme on the nose, with passion fruit, pineapple and black currant swirling with tomato leaf and snow pea aromas. The palate is taut and focused, with flinty acidity, zippy, limey acidity and a long fruity finish. Its a happy match with all manner of shellfish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a restrained mineral expression of the variety that leads with notes of grass, jalapeño peppers, guava and lemon-lime with a slightly smoky undertone. The acidity is tight, tingly and laser sharp. Texturally it's both chalky and slippery and finishes on a long citrus and mineral note.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is a highly fragrant wine bursting with aromas of lime juice, pineapple rind and honeysuckle, and just a hint of snow pea greenness. It's both chalky and slippery in texture, with a grass and nettle note creeping in on the palate and a long pineapple-rind finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine, from one of Marlborough's oldest winemaking families, is a solid, well-balanced drop, which is particularly impressive considering the difficult 2018 vintage. The nose leads with an attractive combo of ripe fruit bowl aromas (think peach, passion fruit, pineapple and guava) along with flower blossoms and a vegetal and dried herb nuance. Tangy acidity balances fruit weight, a chalky texture and a herbal finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From some of the oldest vines in the Waipara Valley, this is a refreshing wine that conjures images of summer even on the darkest of winter days. Leading with lime, fresh pineapple wedges and guava, the vegetal aromas take a backseat, just hinting at green-bell-pepper notes. The palate is like biting into a pineapple and sucking out the juices. Keep a bottle in the fridge all summer.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Clean aromas of lemon, guava and papaya are ripe but balanced on the nose of this bottling. There is a cement-like grip to the palate, where broad pear, apple and peach flavors are cut by crisp lime and a gravelly minerality.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: The aromas pop, with notes of banana, pear, lemon zest and pineapple. The palate is chock-full of full-bodied, textured pineapple, cantaloupe and kiwi flavors that linger on the finish. Delicious stuff. Give it some additional time in the bottle to settle in.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Notes of gooseberry, citrus and green leaves make for an intense but ripe nose. The palate almost bursts with vivid, bright and full-flavored juiciness, presenting passion fruit, gooseberry, peach and citrus. All the varietal freshness is here but it is cushioned with creamy ripeness. This is a lovely and moreish combination.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Notes of both creaminess and passion fruit are foremost on the nose, and enticingly so. There is immense moreish juiciness on a palate that combines soft but fresh texture with vividly expressed fruit. This very elegant Sauvignon Blanc, is fresh, zesty and full fruited, but gently creamy, too. It's quite the package.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This vintage delivers appealing aromas of stone fruit, honeysuckle and wet stone, with only the slightest vegetal tone. There's a lovely play between the creamy texture and crunchy acidity on the palate, highlighting flavors of orchard fruit, salt and snow pea. It finishes long, with stony minerality.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Vivid notes of passion fruit and peach are creamy and juicy at once on the inviting nose. The palate cuts this with precise lime zest freshness that highlights the rich intense fruit even more. This very concentrated and you wonder how so much intensity can be crammed into such a slender wine. Whoa.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Zesty citrus on the nose has a tiny edge of reductive smoke. The palate brims with the vigorous and vibrant varietal freshness but this is set against a cloud-like impression of peach, grape and passion fruit juiciness. Despite the slenderness, this is a huge mouthful of flavor, zestiness and utter freshness. Lovely now, and it is certain to evolve. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A stellar example of the variety, this is sourced from 1990 plantings at the estate (note that there is also a less expensive Willamette Valley bottling). Sleek and richly flavored, there's a saline accent under deep citrus and stone fruit, flesh and rind. The depth and penetration compare favorably with top-tier Sancerre.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: A funky, yeasty touch dominates the nose at first, some air then presents ripe juicy stone fruit. The palate is highly concentrated and unusually textured. Yeast, balm, zest and juiciness present a picture of unusual balance, intensity and depth. This is Sauvignon Blanc, but not as you know it—creamy, taut, bright and juicy, all at the same time. While this is lovely now, this is made for maturity. Drink now through 2030.

name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2018 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Herbaceous lime aromas devolve to smell like Mr. Clean cleanser. A wide body with nothing in the center and green flavors of banana and bell pepper fail to click at a level above acceptable.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Spicy white-fruit and citrus aromas are pointy and lightly green, as are the flavors on this jumpy Sauvignon Blanc that rises to the level of easily drinkable.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Distinctly smoky and buttery, this wine has a charred peppery quality in the aroma that brings a dryness to the palate. It's full bodied and heavy in texture.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This basic, rather rustic wine smells minerally, tastes buttery and a bit earthy, and feels broad and big on the palate.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Citrus and celery aromas precede a plump, citrusy palate. Limited flavors of citrus, green herbs and grass finish similarly. Overall, this is a highly standard and generic Sauvignon Blanc.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Steely at first, with a hint of matchstick, this is a fleshy viscous white with rich flavors of crème brûlée, fig and vanilla. It finishes in a density of baked pineapple.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Simple aromas of grapefruit, lemon, dried apple, chalk and grass show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's broad on the palate with apple flesh and nectarine flavors, yet there is also a tangy citrus spray toward the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Prickly pyrazine aromas come with notes of pineapple and banana. This is medium in body, with a beam of ringing acidity that forms the baseline of this La Mancha SB. Flavors of grapefruit and green herbs are steady on a dry citric finish.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This was fermented and aged in stainless-steel tanks and includes 8% Sauvignon Musque. Floral and lithe, it has a thickness on the midpalate of viscous apple and quince, with a light finish of cut grass.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lean, grassy aromas of citrus fruits are basic. In the mouth, this feels tight and chiseled. Modest citrus flavors include a grassy note or two, while this is light and fresh on the finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Light bodied and fruity, this wine blends citrus and herbal flavors with mild acidity for a good, low-key character. It's fresh, clean and palate cleansing.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A dusty, chalky, herbaceous aroma leads to unusual herb-butter flavors in this full-bodied wine. The texture is very smooth and rich, and the balance is soft, slowly revealing lime notes on the palate.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A pale and slightly green-tinged Sauvignon that feels very young and a little reductive. Those oniony notes do blow off with time in glass, and quiet aromas of lime and stone fruit with hints of honey and white flower blossoms take their place. On the palate the tongue is hit with biting, almost underripe acidity. There's some texture and weight but barely any detectable fruit at the moment.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Grassy, stony and brimming in ripe peach, this is a steely, firm and fleshy white wine with a full-bodied style of weight and viscosity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Earthy aromas of damp soil, dried limes and a hint of white flowers show on the somewhat reductive nose of this bottling. Wet lanolin flavors arise on the sip along with slightly sour touches of lemon rind.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Tropical fruit aromas like banana and mango join brisk acidity and medium body in this aromatic but lean wine. The flavors are more lemony and tight than the aromas, finishing with a steely edge.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a crisp and mild-mannered wine with subtle aromas and flavors. Medium body and lively acidity make it a good palate cleanser.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Done in a sleek, grassy style, this marries tart citrus fruits to hints of green beans and freshly shelled peas. Ultimately, tart citrus flavors dominate, with plenty of acidity to complement fresh white fish or shellfish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This light-bodied wine keeps the fruit flavors subdued and emphasizes appetizing mineral and wet stone flavors. A smooth mouthfeels gives way to zingy acidity on the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Unabashed herbal aromas and veggie flavors define this medium- to full-bodied, smooth and slightly crisp wine.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Lively lemon and grapefruit aromas lead to moderate fruit and herb flavors on the palate. This medium-bodied wine shows good acidity and a fresh clean character.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This maverick wine tastes dry, fresh and full of minerality. Chalky, smoky, spicy aromas and tangy lemon and white-peach flavors make a good combination.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh apple blossoms and apple rinds meet with pomelo skin on the bright citrusy nose of this bottling. There is a pleasantly refreshing lemon tang to the sip, which is straightforward and not overly complex.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a very young wine but with several more months in bottle it should bring forth more of the now-quiet melon, tropical fruit and honeyed aromas. The palate is slippery and slightly chalky with crisp acidity and very little fruit.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a light and delicate Sauvignon that could be mistaken for a contemporary Pinot Grigio. Pale, almost watery in color, quiet notes of melon, green apple, flowers and white spice are backed by a buttery, honeyed character. The acidity is tingly and crunchy, the texture chalky, and there's a spicy note sitting beside green apple flavors.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh herb aromas of basil and parsley meet lemon-lime flavors as this full-bodied and mouthfilling wine wakes up the taste buds.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Nutty, earthy and intensely built, this is a ripe and full-bodied wine that is boldly layered in flavors of caramel, green apple and vanilla oak.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This classic-style wine offers light citrus and herb aromas, moderate fruitiness, good richness and fullness in texture, and more savory herbs in the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling, which is mostly Central Coast with a touch of Sonoma, shows cut pear, light guava and grassy aromas on the nose. The palate grips at first and then opens toward red apple and tangy lime juice, with a slightly sweet-seeming finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy and grassy in pea shoots with nice fruit companions of apricot and peach, this white is equally robust in citrus-laden acidity. Solid and simple, it finishes with a touch of spritz.

name: Fallon Place 2015 Nacimento Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Made partially in barriques and casks, this offers aromas of oak, tropical fruit and citrus blossom. The lean linear palate shows oak-driven spice that overrides grapefruit and dried pineapple.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Sweet peach, Key lime and anise mark this medium-bodied white, comprised of 8% Sémillon. Moderate in acidity and structure, it has a length of full flavor.

name: Giesen 2014 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of pink grapefruit, lemon-lime soda, kiwi and candied mango. Full-bodied, broad, textured kiwi and pineapple flavors follow, leading to a warm finish.

name: Kunde 2016 Drummond Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Aromas of French oak, dried fennel and coconut mingle with whiffs of tropical fruit and celery. It's lean, linear and racy, showing cedar and dried herb alongside a hint of grapefruit.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Barrel fermented and aged for just seven months, this spicy and attractive wine offers compelling aromatics with mint, fresh herbs and lime. The flavors follow along a path of herbal citrus fruits, including a touch of grapefruit. It's a zesty, crisp and refreshing style that will accompany a wide variety of shellfish, river fish and poultry.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Heavy, sweaty aromas of pyrazines dominate a feline nose with grit. An oily palate shows citric acidity but little else, while this tastes of salty, briny grapefruit and sea water.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Flabby, vegetal aromas are pyrazinic and oily. This feels chunky and tastes of vinaigrette and briny green fruits, while an oily feeling finish remains briny.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The new releases of Aussie Sauvignon Blanc are still piercingly young but show plenty of promise. This wine's nose is a fragrant mélange of lemon-lime popsicle, ripe stone fruit, white flower blossoms and gingery spice. A jolt of acidity wakes up the mouth. It's somewhat balanced by a chalky texture and fruit weight, but it needs more time to settle into the wine. Give this another six months in bottle.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: A punchy aromatic mix of terpenes, pyrazines, passion fruit and tangerine includes notes of canned peas and bell pepper. A plump palate with medium acidity offers green-leaning lime and grapefruit flavors that finish with notes of cactus pad and tarragon.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: There's almost no notable fruit to the nose, while this feels lean, tangy and acidic. Bell pepper, green bean and lemon flavors tap out on a short finish that tastes mostly of pyrazines and sour citrus.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Mild citrus and green herb aromas set up a plump palate. Melon and pyrazinic bell pepper flavors die off quickly on a green finish. Call this basic and decent and that's that.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of toasted Grape-Nuts, herbs, citrus and wet metal lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. The palate is pleasant, but the aromas don't match up.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Potent reductive notes dominate on the nose of the wine. Beneath the associated sulfuric onion and Band-Aid characters can be found tropical-fruit characters. Things are equally unbalanced on the palate where the acidity feels sharp and underripe and the reductiveness shuts down the fruit flavors.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lime and tropical fruit aromas lead to a fleshy palate with adequate pop. Salad-like flavors of lettuce dressed with citrus notes finish green and spicy, with some length.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Apple and pear flavors give this wine freshness and spice. It is bright, fruity and ready to drink.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This vegetal and pungent wine shows slightly sweaty aromas of onion, grass and tomato leaf, with some citrus and tropical fruit. The palate presents similar sweaty, vegetal flavors, with slightly sour fruit amidst a slippery texture and prickly acidity.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This Sauvignon is a little reductive and oniony at first but it's also highly perfumed and floral, with lime leaf and blossoms alongside peach and lychee fruit. The palate, however, doesn't hold together as well; 2018 made for an even trickier vintage than 2017, thanks mainly to the presence of two ex-tropical cyclones right at harvest. It's slightly spritzy with bracing acidity and fruit that veers on the sour side, feeling a little overworked and underripe.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine offers a nose of pear and citrus zest. It is smooth in the mouth, with flavors of lemon-lime, passion fruit and bitter almond and a slightly salty finish.

name: François Lurton 2018 Les Fumées Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)
description: Pale straw in the glass, this wine has aromas of lime and green pepper. It is savory at first sip, with strong chopped green herb notes, but then fruit flavors fills the palate, notably mango and guava that lead into a bold grapefruit finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This wine is showing a lot of reduction at the moment, blanketed in yeasty, sweaty onion and salt notes. Beneath this lies vegetal notes like green bell pepper and snow pea, along with citrusy touches like lemon, lime and grapefruit. The palate is slippery, sliced through with searing acidity and crisp citrus flavors. The finish is slightly bitter.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of lemon and chopped parsley are the precursor to flavors of pink grapefruit, Seville orange and hazelnut. This wine is bright in the mouth, offering a zesty, citrus-laced finish.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Unfortunately, this wine does not seem to have weathered the tough 2018 vintage well. It's highly aromatic, even by Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc standards, but it feels synthetic and reductive, with associated onion, rubber and salt aromas sitting over ripe pineapple, tomato leaf and green bell pepper notes. On the slippery palate, sharp-edged acidity feels a bit underripe and green-pepper notes dominate, the fruit barely detectable.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: The aromas seem completely shut down at present. Tart, sleekly styled flavors bring a pleasing zip of acidity. If the aromas open, it could move up.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Stone-fruit, citrus, snow pea and a white-flower-blossom aromas are somewhat covered in a veil of reductive, oniony scents, but this does blow off with time in glass. The palate is also affected by reduction, causing it to feel both heavy in weight yet impaled with a sharp knife of acidity. Then, on the finish, a feeling of sweetness creeps in.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Citrus, tropical fruit and sea brine aromas open this lively SB from Chile's coast. A mix of green herbs, lychee and melon flavors stays fresh on a liquid-salad type of finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Tasting fresh and vivid, this light-bodied wine exudes grassy citrusy aromas, followed by grapefruit, celery and scallion flavors that are assertive and refreshing. Good acidity keeps it lively.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Vivid citrus and snap-pea aromas lead to vibrant fruit flavors and a lively texture in this medium-bodied wine. It has great acidity to refresh the palate, and nicely concentrated lemon, grapefruit and thyme flavors.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This fragrant white opens with aromas of citrus, wild herb and a whiff of flint. The racy palate offers grapefruit, pineapple and a smoky hint of mineral accompanied by firm acidity.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit, dried alpine herb and a whiff of cedar mingle with a hint of tomato vine. The vibrant linear palate evokes yellow apple, pineapple and grapefruit alongside firm acidity.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Very pale in the glass, this bottling starts with very stony aromas of cement and grapefruit rind before riper pear and apple-flesh scents arise. It's very dry, crisp and stony on the palate, like licking cement, but then a riper green-pear element comes out toward the finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This vibrant wine blends oak and mineral notes with tangy citrus and green apple, giving it depth and complexity. It is medium bodied, well balanced and worthy of a special occasion.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Grassy and grapefruity in aroma and tangy in flavor, this jazzy medium-bodied wine is refreshing and crisp. It has lemon and lime flavors, great acidity and a clean finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: From grapes grown on Atlas Peak, this shows moderate structure and medium-bodied ripeness. The flavors are etched in stony, steely melon, apricot and a punch of jasmine.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Exotic fruit, citrus zest and crushed tomato vine aromas combine with whiffs oak. It's structured and linear, offering ripe pineapple, grapefruit, coconut and a hint of butterscotch alongside bright acidity.

name: Earthquake 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit, bread dough and a whiff of dried wild herb float above the glass. On the restrained full-bodied palate, you'll find juicy grapefruit, dried yellow peach and a saline-like mineral note.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Honeysuckle and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose. On the savory light-bodied palate, fresh acidity brightens honeydew melon, grapefruit and a hint of saline.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: From organic and biodynamic- certified grapes grown on the producer's estate, this is grassy, herbal and lemon-sharp in acidity—an exotic, dry and smooth white wine. With a tease of white flowers and white pepper, it has charm and intrigue to spare.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Crisp, tangy and well balanced, this wine is energized by vivid citrus and herb flavors. A medium body and nicely concentrated lemon and lime notes make it extra appealing on the palate.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Tropical fruit, crushed tomato vine and honeydew melon aromas follow over to the generous juicy palate. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while a lemon-drop note rounds off the finish.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Fresh crisp apples and sliced fresh herbs make a tantalizing aroma in this medium-bodied, crisp and well-balanced wine. Apple and lemon light up the palate while good acidity adds a lip-smacking aspect of refreshment.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This attractive wine is one of the richer, broader-textured examples of its type, adding good melon and tropical fruits to a base of crisp lemon. The mouthfeel is smooth and soothing but it also has a good undercurrent of citrus acidity for great balance.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is the inaugural vintage of this new project from Wes Steffens and Martha McClellan of Vineyard 7 & 8 on Spring Mountain. Here, they employ 100% varietal grapes (Musque clone) from a site on Atlas Peak to produce a barrel-fermented expression of bright fresh acidity wrapped around spicy grapefruit, jasmine and papaya.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is 100% barrel-fermented and includes 10% Pinot Gris, in addition to the Musque clone of the main grape. Floral and earthy with a barrel imprint of vanilla and oak, it has flavors of pea shoots, lemon and grapefruit wrapped within a cocoon of sharp acidity.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is an appealing white wine that's high toned from start to finish in complex yet refreshing layers of peach, melon and lime. The light-bodied approach keeps it energetic and lively, with a finish of dried herb and cut grass.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Bubbly in acidity, this white sees no time in oak remaining crisp, clean and dry in the glass. Flavors of peach and vanilla provide a richness that contrasts well against the steely frame.

name: Southern Roots Wines 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Aromas of cedar, toasted hazelnut, tropical fruit and hay slowly take shape in the glass along with hints of tomato vine and grilled herb. The rounded enveloping palate offers grapefruit, mature apple, fennel and saline while tangy acidity refresh the rich flavors. It's complex and intriguing but also mature so drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This crisp, bracing wine blends modest fruit flavors with appealing savory, mineral notes that are subtle and fascinating. Its complexity, medium body and great acidity make a winning combination.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Full of lemon and crisp apple flavors, this medium-bodied wine builds good richness on the palate to beautifully balance all that tanginess. It tastes lively, fresh and appetizing.

name: Mettler Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit, gooseberry and crushed tomato vine mingle with a note of grilled herb. On the savory enveloping palate, tangy acidity lifts creamy white peach, honeydew melon and grapefruit while bitter almond and saline notes grace the finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Deftly made, this vibrant wine brings out the grape variety's citrus and herbal side but also complements it with subtle oaky hints of vanilla, white pepper and mineral. This is a serious wine to pair with a great meal.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Varietal aromas of honeydew melon, crushed tomato vine and exotic fruit carry over to the savory palate along with grapefruit, white peach and pineapple. Tangy acidity accompanies the rich flavors right through to the lemon-drop finish.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Made from an organically grown field blend, which includes 17% Sémillon, this is a steely white wine that offers effusive tones of quince and lemon on the nose. Light and crisp ion the palate, it brings flavors of green apple, melon and lemongrass.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This taut, balanced wine emphasizes mineral, earthy aromas and crisp, bone-dry fruit flavors on a medium-bodied frame. It is appetizing and palate-cleansing.

name: Saget la Perrière 2018 L'Origine Sauvignon Blanc (Blanc Fumé de Pouilly)
description: This outstanding wine has deeper and riper fruit components than many of its type, ranging from kiwi to lime to green apple in the aromas and richer tropical fruits on the palate, where subtle oak and white-pepper nuances emerge.

name: Giesen 2014 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is an estate-grown project with winemaker Jesse Katz at the helm, who works with 100% varietal grapes to make this impressive white. Aged less than a year in French oak with toasted acacia barrel heads, it opens thick and heady, with a viscous nature to the wood. Stone, pineapple and wisps of fig combine seamlessly, boosted by fresh acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fermented and aged in both stainless steel and neutral French oak barrels, this is a delightful white, lively in acidity and freshness. A balanced sweetness of peach presents around accents of jasmine on the nose and vanilla, ginger, wet stone and lemongrass on the lengthy palate.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Intense aromas of grapefruit, tomato vine and pineapple follow over the savory focused palate along with honeydew melon. Fresh acidity and a mineral vein evoking crushed rock energize the finish.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wild Sauvignon from vineyards in the Upper Yarra Valley. Cloudy lemon in color, the intriguing nose is a heady mix of honey, lemon verbena, wild thyme and other scrubby herbs and spices, warm stones and grass. The palate is slippery, spicy and honeyed with lemon zest, crunchy acidity and a mineral streak. This is a rustic and just plain yummy wine that feels like an herb garden in the height of summer.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Intense aromas of tropical fruit, crushed tomato vine, graphite and alpine herb virtually leap from the glass. The vibrant full-bodied palate is delicious and elegant, doling out juicy grapefruit, cantaloupe and a mineral note of granite. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Buttery at first sniff and rich in mouthfeel, this full-bodied wine is smooth textured and gradually reveals layers of ripe fruit and mild spices on the palate that include vanilla, mango and mineral.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fragrant and delicious, this stunning wine opens with classic varietal aromas of tropical fruit, elderberry, honeysuckle, hay and crushed tomato vine. The savory elegantly structured palate doles out honeydew melon, grapefruit, ripe white peach and tangy mineral notes. Fresh acidity accompanies the juicy flavors.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Floral and perfumed in rose petal, jasmine and wet stone, this wine offers plenty of tart acidity beneath a wealth of layered lemon and lime. It finishes deliciously in fresh pear and peach.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Focused, fragrant and loaded with finesse, this offers classic varietal aromas of grapefruit, elderberry, crushed tomato vine and a whiff of freshly mowed grass. Reflecting the nose, the savory vibrant palate delivers tangerine, wild mint and pineapple alongside racy acidity.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: A candied nose with aromas of lemon-lime soda and kids' vitamins is unconvincing and uninviting. A bland palate holds sugary flavors of melon and lychee that aren't common to the variety.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This reductive Sauvignon is sweaty and feline, with buttery, vegetal, grassy and citrusy aromas. The palate is oddly spritzy, with sharp acidity, a creamy texture and a sour finish.

name: Washington Hills 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Washington)
description: Gritty, sweaty aromas of haystack and citrus are not appealing. In the mouth, this is both chunky and acidic. Salty green fruit flavors include a hint of tropicality prior to an empty finish that barely lingers.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A straightforward Sauvignon from a difficult vintage in Marlborough, this offers aromas of melon, guava, peach and jalapeño peppers. On the palate, crunchy acidity lifts what feels like a touch of residual sugar and slippery fruit weight.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine starts with the classic Marlborough SB combo of ripe fruit and veg in the form of melons, peaches, snow peas and bell peppers, but things fall apart on the palate where the texture is watery and a touch spritzy. The acidity feels on the underripe side and the fruit a touch sour, compensated in part by what feels like just a bit of residual sugar.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine's fragrant nose of lychees, pineapple rind and lemon leads to a palate that is textured with a citrusy zip and a slightly bitter finish. It feels a little overworked and underwhelming.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lemon, guava and pineapple rind lead the way here, along with some grassy pungency. The palate comes with citrusy zingy acidity and a slightly creamy texture, with a lemony finish. This is a simple but fairly well-balanced drop.

name: Grassini 2016 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Exotic fruit, crushed tomato vine and grapefruit aromas leap out of the glass. The mature, full-bodied palate isn't very expressive, offering dried yellow apple slice and fennel notes.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This flavorful wine exudes bright peach aromas, and turns riper and softer on the palate, where peach and apricot flavors and low acidity make it soothing and mouthfilling.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: There's a bit of salt-tinged reduction to start, but there's also a fair lick of waxy lime, grapefruit and green bell pepper aromas. The palate also combines the effects of reduction (which makes the wine feel somewhat closed in on itself) with citrusy pithy white-spice flavors, a creamy texture and lifted acidity—a straightforward drop.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: The nose wants to give nothing away and remains neutral but fresh. The palate is a little dilute when it comes to flavor, but the body is slender and fresh with citrus hints and has a dry finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A fruity nose of peaches, tropical fruit and lychees on this Hawke's Bay wine leaves a little space for white-pepper-spice notes but none for the green-vegetal characters more typically found in South Island Sauvignons. The palate balances the fruitiness with crisp acidity. Stone-fruit flavors close things out. This is a straightforward but balanced drop.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This dry, refreshing and affordable Sauvignon starts out a tad reductive with oniony aromas. Lemon, lime, stone fruit and a touch of salt follow. The palate is chalky in texture and citrus right to the end.

name: Flat Top Hills 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Aromas of citrus, crushed tomato leaf and a whiff of wet stone lift out of the glass along with a white spring flower note. Racy and light on its feet, the palate offers grapefruit and green melon along with the merest hint of saline.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Very fruity and rather rich in texture, this wine is one of the riper, softer versions of the varietal. It shows appealing apple, vanilla and honeydew melon flavors.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Aromas of grapefruit and pineapple follow over to the tangy, light-bodied palate along with a hint of green melon. It's crisp, with racy acidity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A classic combo of pink grapefruit, lime and fresh green grass makes up the nose of this wine, while the palate is chalky textured, with prickly acidity. Crunchy tart citrus fruit ends pithy and a touch bitter.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A hint of lemon and a touch of lychee play on the nose. The palate is easy, juicy, fresh and citrusy. The body is light and finishes dry with a lemony, bright echo.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Lightly styled aromas of herbs, kiwi, lemon zest, papaya and mineral lead to broad-feeling but focused citrus and herb flavors. Vibrant, edgy acidity heightens the appeal. Pair it with blackened rockfish with a pineapple-kiwi salsa.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of fresh sweet grass, green melon rind, lime peel, underripe mango and fig form the nose of this fresh and tart wine. It's lightweight and easy to drink, with subtle fruit flavors and medium acidity. It's not an overly complex pour, but it's tasty enough, with a touch of earthy, herbal bitterness on the end.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Mike Landt makes an amazingly deep, ripe Sauvignon Blanc, especially given his cool-climate location. It is rich and textural, with dense fruit flavors of melon, grapefruit and kiwi and a lush and creamy mouthfeel.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Boushey Vineyard makes up the 70% majority of this wine, with the rest coming from Red Willow. Barrel fermented with native yeast, the aromas are light on first pour, with notes of lemon verbena, lemon oil and herb. The flavors are tart, racy and acid driven, with a long, drawn out finish. It's elegant and subtle, with pleasing complexities to be had. Give it some additional time in bottle to see it at its best.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is a fruity white that is balanced by buoyant acidity. Fermented mostly in stainless steel, it offers defined flavors of lemon, melon and lime.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a delicate, dainty Sauvignon that glides onto the scene with lime, red apple peel and blossoms. Texturally, it's a little chalky, with an apple-focused tang, balanced acidity and a mouthwatering finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Heady aromas of peach, pineapple, white pepper and jalapeño pepper lead the way in this wine. It leads into a slippy-textured palate that displays lots of fruit concentration and a long, pineapple finish.

name: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and herbal, this wine offers bright, persistent acidity around a full-bodied embrace of ripe peach and pineapple.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of lemon oil and citrus blossom are wrapped in an herbal haze on the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc that's blended with 23% Chenin Blanc and 1% each of Marsanne and Viognier. The palate is dry and astringent, with spry lemon-lime acidity and flavors of ripe apple, blossoms and a whisper of salinity.

name: Domaine de Chevalier 2016  Pessac-Léognan
description: The allure of caramel and smoke hits first, after which a cloud of the purest apricot essence reaches the senses. The viscous palate tingles with disarmingly sharp acidity, balanced by incredibly luscious sweetness. Layer upon layer of apricot, passion fruit and candied lemon unleashes itself in this clean, precise TBA. It offers marvel concentration and purity. Drink until 2040.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Even after two years, this wine is still young, serving as a reminder that great Sancerre needs time. For now, the tight apple and citrus fruits are intense and need to soften. Drink this wine from 2019 and the richness and beautiful fruit will be shining.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: A ripe wine, full of apple and tropical fruit, this is a rich style of Sancerre. Still young with its mineral texture intact, it has delicious fruit, finely balanced acidity and an opulent character. Drink from 2019.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Named after the chapel once part of an Augustinian monastery, this single-vineyard wine is rich with intense green gooseberries and minerality from the flinty soil. The wine is still young, rich but and needing to develop. Drink from 2020.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
