description: This soft, smooth wine offers ripe fruit and an attractive edge of spice as well as freshness. White stone fruits are cut with tight minerality, leaving a beautiful wine that needs to age. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine comes from a four-acre parcel of stony soil. Closed and tight as is typical of young Pouilly Fumé, it promises rich white fruits for the future. Ripe and well structured, it will be ready to drink from 2020.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Named after the cherry trees that once grew where the vineyard is now, this wine is textured, crisp and full of layered citrus fruit and acidity. Still young, it will be better from 2019.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This has all the classic Sauvignon Blanc characteristics—fresh-cut grass, green gooseberry, lime leaf and peppery fynbos—in an effervescent, lean and bright package, with high acidity and lively carbonation. Drink now.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This aromatic, fruity wine offers good acidity with a lightly herbal touch. Fresh apple and pear flavors are cut with tangy acidity. Drink this crisp, clean wine now.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This white has a creamy, lush texture that is complemented by a bright enduring freshness of grapefruit and lime. The full-bodied midpalate fruit profile is defined in tropical guava, apricot and almond paste.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine is exceptionally smooth and polished, showing a gentle but not too-soft texture that carries fresh apple and lime flavors and subtle oak accents like nutmeg and vanilla. With medium to full body, it feels like a barrel-fermented wine but without obvious oakiness, and shows good layering and concentration.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is bright in acidity and nicely textured, with an underlying lushness to the weight of the body. Peach and dried herb show most prominently on the palate, with a smoothness of stony mineral and lentil.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This vineyard-designated white is impressively layered and complex, with integrated acidity and texture to its light-bodied character. Lime, cantaloupe and wet stone give it a fruity complexion met by a note of salty brine.

name: J. Bookwalter 2017 1st Edition Conner Lee Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Fresh spring grass, lemongrass, grapefruit, pear blossom and a hint of flint show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is framed by a compelling texture that's both fleshy with stone fruit and racy with sharper lime rinds, providing great depth.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A whole-cluster pressed white aged in both French oak and stainless steel, this wine is richly woven in lemon verbena, pineapple, quince and grapefruit, its structure complex, lengthy and moderate in acidity.

name: Duckhorn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fat wine, missing out on the crispness that should come out of Sauvignon Blanc. It is as heavy as the bottle in which it comes.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a taut and bracing wine, with aromas of grapefruit and lime and flavors of lemon and jicama. It's rather light in bodied, but has such a refreshing, almost electric character that it still makes a big impression.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Tangy, herbal and crisp, this textured wine is very intense and still young. It has plenty of acidity along with gooseberry and underripe lemon flavors. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The aromas don't seem entirely settled at present, showing some reductive notes. The palate is light, tart and tangy. It doesn't stand up on its own but might have a place at the dinner table, though the listed alcohol seems a bit high for that as well.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Savory elements of canned white beans ride over a fresher core of citrus and lemongrass. While there is some weight and breadth to the palate, it's carried by an astringent lemon peel flavor and a lightly grainy texture.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Simple citrus fruits and a strong herbal character are the main elements of this wine that is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc from across the Loire Valley. Light and crisp, it is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This soft wine is rather indistinct. Its fruit is lightly crisp but out of focus, giving a gentle wine that is ready to drink.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A grassy wine with green fruits and gooseberry flavors, this is light and bright. It has instant freshness and is ready to drink.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: For a Touraine Sauvignon, this is rich and ripe with tropical fruits as well as the necessary acidity. It is fruity, with a lightly zesty texture and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This light, fruity and herbal wine shows a good balance between citrus and gooseberry fruits and a bright, fresh character. Drink this simple wine now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Aromas of milky white flowers and savory white beans carry to the light-bodied palate and join broader flavors of melon and lemon. There's a pleasing roundness to the midpalate, yet disjointed acidity takes hold on the finish.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Very herbal and crisp, this currant-flavored wine is all fruit and acidity. It has hints of more tropical flavors as well as an attractive perfume. Drink the wine now.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: This soft, ripe wine is made to be instantly drinkable. The texture hints at minerality while it is also full of rich white fruits, a rounded texture and balanced acidity. Drink now.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Vineyards close to the Atlantic Ocean are the source of this bright, herbal wine. It has hints of tropical fruit although the main fruitiness comes from lime and pink-grapefruit flavors. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This fresh, light and creamy wine is bright with citrus flavors. Its herbal nature is still young but is attractive for its upfront, fruity character. Drink this wine now.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This softly textured, fruity wine has crisp apple flavors and an herbal edge. Citrus zestiness combines with tense acidity and a clean, deliciously fruity character. Drink the wine now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A sharp nose of crushed limestone, tomato leaf and citrus zest makes for a bracing start. The palate is equally stony and tense in feel, with a plethora of tart citrus flavors.

name: Domaine Fouassier 2017 Sur le Fort  (Sancerre)
description: A skin-fermented, 100% Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is dark and brooding with a slightly oxidative character that won't appeal to everybody. Concentrated and oaky, it tastes of honey and baked apple with a viscosity that lingers.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is herbal and crisp, with a tight edge of minerality. Juicy currants and freshly sliced green fruits dominate this lightly textured wine. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Fruit for this wine comes mainly from Touraine. In the hands of a master from Sancerre, the naturally herbal character of Touraine Sauvignon is tamed and given richness. Fruit and minerality come through strongly. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: With a light touch, bright acidity and layers of mineral acidity, this wine is packed with fruitiness that contrasts with the tight texture. Drink this pure, crisp wine now.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: A blend of wines from across Sancerre, this wine is soft, with rich yellow fruits as well as citrus. It offers warm fruitiness, fully integrated acidity and texture that is lightly mineral at the end. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling offers light citrus, burned toast and wet cement aromas. Sour Granny Smith apple flavors show on the palate, which offers a touch of tension.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This rich wine is smoothly textured. After an extra year, the wine has lost its brightness and has spread out into mature fruits, almonds and a touch of yeast. Drink now.

name: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The style of Sancerre's smaller neighbor is less intense when young and, like this wine, readily drinkable in the year after harvest. A crisp texture is nicely integrated into ripe apple and yellow-fruit flavors. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Les Loges is one of the focal points of fine Pouilly Fumé. This wine has some of the richness associated with the area while at the same time being easy and accessible. White fruits dominate and the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This open, ripe wine conveys a warm, rich character. Tropical fruits dominate, with just a touch of spice and minerality, plus acidity in the background. The wine is young, but is ready to drink although it will be even better from 2019.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: A soft wine with quince and ripe red-apple flavors, this is open and packed with fruit. The acidity is there, adding freshness and finishing this rounded wine with a crisp lift. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Crisp, clear and moderate in structure, this wine offers a medium-bodied take on ripeness and body structure, allowing for fleshy flavors of guava and fig to present themselves with ease.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Fleshy and full-bodied, this 100% varietal white offers notions of sweet peach, baked pineapple, biscuit and honeycomb. The texture is thick and viscous.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A wholly owned Mellot walled vineyard in this small region west of Sancerre is the source of this crisp wine. It is light and bright with mineral texture while not losing fruitiness. Drink this refreshing wine now.

name: Brancott 2015 Chosen Rows Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine has layers of citrus and crisp fruits under ripe apricot and sweet apple flavors. A tangy texture gives shape to this attractive wine, although it is really all about fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is definitely on the tropical-fruit spectrum of Sauvignon Blanc flavors. So apricot and white-nectarine flavors are right up front in this ripe wine. It's all fruit, with a tangy edge of citrus to give freshness. Drink now.

name: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This bright, fruity wine offers lively acidity and an almost chalky texture. It is taut and crisp, a classic Sauvignon Blanc from the village of Verdigny. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Open, ripe and soft, this lightly yeasty wine is developing quickly. Tangy citrus and apple flavors are balanced by a touch of spice as well as a zesty aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This easygoing, fruity wine has a soft texture and plenty of acidity. It is balanced between the crisp citrus fruit and ripe apples while the mineral texture shows in the background. Drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This ripe and fruity wine is softly textured, with only a hint of minerality. Broad white fruits are freshly cut by citrus to give a lifted character to the fullness of the wine. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Crisp, fruity and with a strongly herbal character, this wine has a rich texture from the lees aging before bottling. Hints of riper white fruits will develop as it ages for another few months. Drink from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: A pure, crisp texture and herbal flavors shine from this wine. Its acidity and still-young citrus flavors are right up front and need a few months to soften. It will be a delicious wine from 2019.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This crisp and fruity wine is lightly herbal. It also offers lemon and gooseberry flavors along with considerable acidity. The aftertaste reveals a richer side that shows concentration. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Lively acidity and crisp fruits mark out this attractive wine. It conveys citrus and bright lemon fruitiness, with a fresh aftertaste. Drink this lightly textured wine now.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Young and alive with herbal as well as fruit textures, this wine from one of the top Sancerre vineyards is right up front. The citrus fruits, mineral texture and considerable acidity will come together to give the wine good potential. Drink from 2020.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Based in the small village of Les Berthiers, this wine family has produced a classic wine. It has acidity, with a tense and mineral texture that's balanced with bright white fruits and citrus. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This fruity wine is packed with tangy orange and grapefruit. Its acidity is emphasized by the youth of the wine, which will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2019.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Musqué (Oak Knoll District)
description: This young wine is already attractive with its fruitiness and ripe acidity. A touch of tangy acidity as well as the taut texture suggests it will age for another few months. The name of the wine refers to the number of people needed each day to work the parcel of vines. Drink from 2019.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Toasty aromas of lemon rind, white flowers and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite broad, ranging from nectarine to citrus, which will please a wide variety of tastes.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This well-balanced wine has both structure and freshness. It has a crisp edge to the ripe white fruits and zesty aftertaste. This wine is ready to drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: The flint soil of this wine's vineyard has given it a tight minerality. It also offers plenty of crisp citrus and apple fruits, with a herbal hint. The wine is made to drink young and is ready now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Ripe tones of banana and melon meld with an underscore of chalk dust on the nose. This shows some textural weight on the palate, broadened out by juicy tropical fruit on the midpalate and elongated by a zesty line of acidity.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: There are plenty of cailloux (stones) in Pouilly Fumé and this wine shows the steel and minerality that results from this soil. Very crisp while also with a richer element, this wine needs to age further. Drink from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This bottling shows a full, fat style of Sauvignon Blanc, although the wine hasn't lost all its freshness and has kept some citrus flavors. Its richness reflects the warm vintage, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink from 2019.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A smoothly textured wine, this is soft and full of ripe white fruits. Its acidity and grassy character are controlled by the wine's richness. Balanced and finishing with crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This soft, ripe wine has attractive layers of apricot fruitiness as well as crisper citrus acidity. Together these two flavors give the wine delicious freshiness and zesty acidity at the end. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a crisp, clear and freshly focused wine, direct in its lemon freshness and strong flavors of grapefruit, green apple and tenacious acidity.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Produced by the Millet family, this ripe wine with touches of minerality is about rich fruits and balanced acidity. Hints of apricots and pineapple balance the citrus thread that goes through the wine. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This fruity wine is attractively textured and crisp, with a strong mineral edge that gives a bit of bite. Full of red-currant flavors and with final acidity, it will be better from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This white has a Muscat-like quality, a sweetness of peach, fig and apricot that's exotic and pronounced. Jasmine plays expertly on the nose.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh lime and wet stone meet with reductive grassy aromas and a touch of pear on the nose of this bottling. It's very tangy on the palate, showing citrus and apple cider elements.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: From a densely planted vineyard, this soft wine has ripe pink-grapefruit and taut lime flavors, with a strongly mineral texture. It is very much up front, and needs time to settle. Drink from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: A blend from three vineyards, this rounded wine is rich in apple and green-plum flavors, with an edge of spiciness. It is rich enough to be ready to drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This small vineyard region on the banks of the Cher river is devoted exclusively to Sauvignon Blanc. The producer, one of the top names in the area, has made a ripe, juicy and fruity wine. Richness balances the crisp citrus flavors and delicious tight acidity at the end. Drink now.

name: Dry Creek Vineyard 2018 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This remains one of the best wine values on the planet: a Loire-style, stainless-steel fermented beauty that the winery has been making for 46 years. Guava, peach and apricot surround buzzy acidity in a crowd-pleasing quaff of undeniable quality and freshness.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: All about ripe, tropical fruits and freshness, this is an immediately attractive wine. It is open, easy and developing quickly. Already the bright fruits and tangy acidity are forward and refreshing. Drink this wine from 2019.

name: Giesen 2014 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Light, bright and still fresh, this is a fruity wine. Its acidity, green fruits and light texture push it forward and lead to a refreshing, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Tinel-Blondelet, this estate has made a crisply textured wine, intense with acidity and still very young. Its freshness and brightness need to soften, so drink from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Malmbray is the home village of the Roblin winery. The Kimmeridgian chalk soil gives intensely crisp wines, like this, that are full of taut citrus and herbal flavors. Drink from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: From a vineyard that has a mix of chalk and stones, this wine is rounded, smoothly textured with ripe white fruits. This gentle character is cut by more tangy acidity to give a textured, tight finish. Drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: From an estate vineyard and aged in both stainless steel and foudre, this wine has strong elements of peach and lychee, with underlying floral components of white flower and jasmine. Medium bodied and balanced, it's fresh and fruity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This soft, full wine has ripe apple flavors. Acidity and rich fruitiness give an intense wine that is both refreshing and steely textured. Drink from early 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This producer's entry-level Sancerre offers a fresh balance of apple and citrus flavors, with hints of almonds and lively acidity. An immediately attractive wine, it is ready to drink.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A perfumed, herbal aroma leads to a crisply textured, tangy wine. With a strongly grassy character, this wine is taut and and right up front. It needs a few months to calm down; drink from 2019.

name: Patel 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine comes from a plateau of chalk exposed south. That location gives the wine its soft texture and creamed-apple and lime flavors. It has a light feel, with poise and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Pascal Gibault has a great ability to produce ripe Sauvignon Blanc, profiting from south-facing slope vines. This wine, still young, is rich, perfumed and full bodied. Drink from 2019.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Named after the small limestone pebbles widely found in Sancerre, this wine has a young, mineral texture and is full of green fruits. It is crisp and herbal, with bright acidity that gives a delicious final zing. Drink now.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Ripe apple and pear fruit are comfortably blended with more citric flavors in this structured wine. It has good fruitiness, a tight mineral structure and the potential for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, like all the wines from this producer, this open wine provides a good introduction to the company's impressive range. Citrus fruits are laced with ripe apples and crisp pears cut with minerality. Drink now.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This small appellation west of Sancerre produces a style of wine that is softer and cooler than its big-name neighbor. That makes for a wine, like this, that is charming and smooth when young, with its attractive citrus character rounded out. Drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This wine needs aging. Its tight texture, although rich, is also taut and mineral. With herbal acidity and a tangy aftertaste, it shows excellent potential. Drink from 2019.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The Favray estate is one parcel of 39 acres, producing a taut, mineral and citrus-fruit-driven wine. Still young, his potentially rich wine has intense acidity that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Vibrant aromas of grapefruit spray, papaya and tomato leaf carry to the textured, light-bodied palate. This is immensely crisp and refreshing in feel, with crunchy green pear and citrus ringing on the finish.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This wine is rich and full of apple flavors along with warm acidity. Like many wines from this appellation, it is still young after a year and needs to open up its ripe fruits. Drink from 2019.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A ripe wine, full of delicious fruit flavors and acidity, this has a chalky texture as well as rich white fruits tightly cut with acidity. It is ready to drink.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: One of a series of wines that the producers calls Les Parcellaires, single-vineyard wines, this is an impressively perfumed wine, exotic in character. It is rich with just the lightest hints of purer acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This wine comes from a parcel of vines planted on flint soil close to the Loire river. It is tense and mineral, with swathes of rich citrus, lively acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Named after the Roman villa that once existed in Pouilly-sur-Loire (and which gave its name to Pouilly), this wine comes from old vines giving concentrated citrus and green-fruit flavors. Bright, crisp and tangy, the wine could do with some aging. Drink from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Crisp, herbal and apple flavored, this perfumed wine is ripe, full in the mouth and still young. It has great acidity and a tight mineral texture. The wine comes from 25-year-old vines that add concentration to the fruits. Drink from 2019.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: This half-stainless- and half-neutral-oak-fermented wine takes a gentle approach to this variety. The natural acidity and herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc is softened here with 10 g/L of residual sugar. The wine is round and fruity, with a mix of preserved lemon, white peach and pineapple. Drink slightly chilled.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This tense, dense wine is still young. Its pure line in acidity is emphasized by the concentration and strong minerality. Drink this wine from 2019.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This wine comes from old vines planted on flinty soil. The terroir gives a strongly mineral edge to the crisp, ripe white fruits. It has a rich character, the creamed-apple flavors edged with a touch of apricot. The wine is ready to drink.

name: J. Bookwalter 2017 1st Edition Conner Lee Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Named after a legendary oak tree, this wine is full of ripe tropical and spice flavors. Its rich character is balanced with sophisticated acidity. Densely textured, the wine could do with a few more months, so drink from 2019.

name: Patel 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Well integrated with a subtle fist of power, this wine is fleshy and fruit forward in apple and lime with a stony mineral edge. A twinge of fresh grapefruit flavor brightens the glass and adds to the overall complexity.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is the home domaine of what has become a large negociant house. The wine is all about fruit, crisp and full of citrus and white stone-fruit flavors, with intense acidity. Drink now.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This young wine is still full of crisp fresh fruits. The texture is tight, mineral from the flint soil and nervy. Drink from 2020.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Fresh yellow peach and apple flavors are accented with cashew, green plum and lime zest in this dry but intensely fruity Sauvignon Blanc. It's a full-bodied yet zesty wine marked by a fresh, lingering finish.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Big in luscious flavor and ample body and ripeness, this white shines in pear, honeysuckle and vanilla cream, fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels. It is fleshy and well integrated, with a moderate streak of supportive acidity.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Made with the addition of 9% Viognier grown in Bennett Valley, this is a pleasing white layered in lushness and strong flavors of pineapple and mango. The tropical nature doesn't preclude brightness and balance, ending in a flourish of white flowers.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is an extra-rich wine, concentrated with ripe fruits. It is still young with no holds barred in its power and intensity. With its dense texture and upfront fruit, it needs to age. Drink from 2020.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This 37-acre estate managed by Annick Tinel-Blondelet has produced a juicy wine with open white fruits and good acidity. Called after the original name for the Sauvignon Blanc grape, it has great fruitiness, a taut texture and is ready to drink.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: From old vines, this rich wine is beautifully concentrated and fruity. Apples and crisp green plums go with citrus to give a wine that has delicious potential. Drink from 2019.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Very easy-to-like aromas of lemon rind, lime pith and light apple blossom make for a refreshing and pleasurable entry to this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where wet cement minerality meets with grapefruit-juice flavors.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine with an attractive bite is still young, with a tight texture and plenty of ripe fruit. Lemon and spice flavors are shot through with acidity and a strongly zesty character. Drink the wine from 2019.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: From a small parcel of vines next to the producer's cellar, this ripe wine is full of rich white fruits that are cut with acidity. It is well balanced and really crisp. Drink now.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This medium-bodied white brings a stony mineral texture, with fleshy flavors of guava and mango. It offers complexity and nuance against a full embrace of ripeness.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine may still be young, but it already offers rich fruits, creamed pear and hints of peach. These are cut by acidity and the a flinty texture typical of Pouilly Fumé. Drink this wine from 2019.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine has the weight to be expected in a Pouily Fumé as well as the flinty texture that comes with the terroir. Just ready, this wine will be even better from 2019.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This ripe wine full of white fruits as well as citrus comes from silex flint soil, which gives minerality to the fruit. The wine is tense and edgy, lined with final acidity. It will be ready to drink from 2019.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Now aged three years, this wine is ripe and generous. It has lost its initial taut character and filled out with tropical fruits over rich acidity and just the lightest mineral texture. Drink now.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Packed with ripe white and yellow fruits, this entry-level wine in the Vacheron range is impressive in its own right. Its richness comes from the intense fruit that contrasts with the final mineral texture. Drink from 2019.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This smooth, ripe wine is full of creamed apple and spicy pear flavors. It comes from an organic vineyard on chalky, stony soil. Apart from its generous character, the wine also has a young, mineral texture that will soften soon. Drink from 2019.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: A warm wine rich in white fruits and with open acidity, this instantly attractive wine will also age. Like all wines from this producer, it is made with natural yeasts, while the old vines add natural concentration. Drink from 2019.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine is a selection from vines grown on limestone. After a year in bottle, it has developed stature and richness, offering ripe white fruit as well as delicious final acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A rounded wine, this offers a good balance between acidity and ripe white fruits. A nervy edge adds a youthful texture that gives shape to the wine. Drink now.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: From one of the top vineyards in Bué, this wine has pure, rounded and rich apple and green-plum flavors. It is a powerful concentrated wine from a vineyard that produces ripe fruit. Drink from 2019.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: As its name indicates, this wine comes from chalk soil. Crisp minerality is the order of the day, with intense acidity, layers of citrus and a zesty, bright texture. There is a herbal element that will soften. Drink from 2019.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: The heavier, clay soil that is found in parts of Sancerre is the origin of this rich wine. It is one of a pair of wines (the other highlighting chalk soil) and shows how terroir-driven Sancerre's Sauvignon Blanc wines can be. Ripe white fruits are cut with acidity, still youthful and needing to soften. Drink from 2019.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Clean, crisp and reminiscent of springtime on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of lime blossom, wet cement, scratched pomelo skin and cut grass. The palate is extremely energetic and makes the mouth tingle while delivering flavors of lemongrass and lime.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: With an edge of tangy fruit, this wine is ripe, concentrated and intensely textured. Its strong citrus fruits, great acidity, concentrated minerality and zesty freshness are still developing. It needs time to round out and become even richer. Drink from 2020.

name: Cloudy Bay 2015 Te Koko Sauvignon Blanc (New Zealand)
description: This rich wine has not lost its acidity or mineral-driven white fruits. With a touch of pepper on the palate from the alcohol, the wine is full, dense and will be better from 2019.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: An intensely aromatic, invigorating wine with notes of freshly cut grass, lime zest and smoke. The palate is fresh and pristine, offering loads of cutting gooseberry and lime flavors. Offers all the vibrant fruit of New World Sauvignon Blanc but is more sprightly and mineral in character.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This bottling from the extremely coastal Jespersen Ranch shows what a truly cool climate can do for Sauvignon Blanc. It's tightly woven but approachable on the nose, with aromas of honeydew, kiwi and wet stone. The palate is incredibly zippy, offering chalky flavors of apple and pear. A lime rind tartness holds the finish.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a well-integrated white wine, made in an unabashedly full-bodied manner that displays ample fruit. Fig, vanilla and a thread of lemon zest give it plenty of flavor and crowd-pleasing personality.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This rich, tropical-fruit-flavored wine is generous and full of delicious apricot, mango and pineapple flavors. As a contrast, a strong mineral edge comes from the limestone soil. This is still a young, deliciously fruity wine, but it will be better from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine is all about fresh, tangy and grassy fruit. With a distinct texture and strong minerality, it is tight and needs to age. It comes from one of the top vineyards in Sancerre. Drink from 2020.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: A grip of reduction on the nose in tones of flint and matchstick is consistent for the producer's style. On the palate are light-bodied layers of green olive, pineapple, peach and lemon, a contrasting set of fruit and savory elements that work seamlessly together.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Based in Les Loges, one of the small settlements around Pouilly-sur-Loire, this father-and-son team has made a rich, intense wine that shows the aging potential of Pouilly Fumé. It has power, ripe white fruits and concentrated acidity. Drink from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Intense, fruity and now ready to drink, this wine comes from some of the old parcels of the Bourgeois estate. It is rich while remaining crisp, with a flinty edge that gives it a good texture.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine has a good balance between rich apple flavors and tight acidity and minerality, reveling in the warm 2017 vintage. The texture is taut, but the young wine will soften in a few months to offer smoothness and roundness. Drink from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: The extra richness of a Pouilly Fumé is very apparent in this wine. Its ripe white fruits are tense, tangy while also full bodied and, even after three years, still very young. That bold fruitiness needs to soften further, so drink from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is called “premier” because the grapes in this wine were the first to ripen in 2016. It has a perfumed character with good acidity to balance the tangy, herbal fruits. The texture and the fruit are now fully integrated and this wine is ready to drink.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Named after the Pierre Etienne Mellot, founder of the dynasty in 1513, this wine comes from flinty soil. Its strongly mineral character has been tamed by wood aging. The result is a rich, peppery, balanced wine that is intense, generous and ready to drink now and until 2022.

name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Jadis  (Sancerre)
description: This producer, now in its 10th generation, sources the grapes for this wine from a seven-acre vineyard on clay and chalk soils. Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this rich wine is full of generous apple and apricot flavors that are now mature enough to drink. The wine could also age, so drink now or until 2022.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Harvested from a small parcel, less than four acres, this wine is in perfect condition. It is balanced, with white fruit and citrus coming together, led by the acidity. It is developing into a full, ripe wine. Wait until 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine comes from possibly the most famous vineyard in Sancerre with an impossibly steep slope. Tight, textured and rich, it is still young and firm, with a strong mineral character. It needs to age, so wait for this rich, spicy wine until 2020.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Densely textured, this ripe wine still has plenty of freshness. Although it rich and packed with citrus and white fruits, it also has a strong mineral character that needs to soften. Age this wine until 2019.

name: Château de Tracy 2016 101 Rangs  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: One of a series of single-vineyard wines from this producer, this wine's name is a reminder that the Romans were here. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine offers pure, strong acidity as well as intense white fruits. It is ready to drink.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Based in Pouilly-sur-Loire, this producer has crafted a full, rich wine. With its touch of toastiness and a smoky edge, the wine is full of ripe citrus fruit that is cut with zesty acidity. Drink from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine, produced like all Laporte wines from organically grown grapes, is impressive in its ripe fruit and minerality from the flinty soil. Still young, it has a tight texture but its style and balance already shine. With powerful citrus, orange zest and lime juice flavors, the wine needs to age and fully integrate. Drink from 2020.

name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Jadis  (Sancerre)
description: Set on one of the majestic, steep slopes in Sancerre, this vineyard produces strongly mineral wines. This bottling is maturing well, softening the intense texture while leaving a tangy character. Rich white fruits are fully integrated with the acidity to give an ample wine that is ready to drink.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This wine has great richness. It is produced using natural yeasts from selected parcels. Ripe and full of concentrated white fruits and tense acidity, it needs aging to soften the intensity. Drink from 2020.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: From the oldest vines in the estate, this is an intense, rich and still-young wine. Its currant and citrus acidity are concentrated and show great depth. Juicy acidity blends into the mineral character of the wine. Let it mature and drink from 2020.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Like all Alphonse Mellot wines, this is produced from biodynamically grown grapes. That enhances the pure and dense fruit texture, the minerality and extreme richness. It needs to age, and will be best from 2020.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: From a southern-exposure, 3.7-acre vineyard, this presents a rich style of Sauvignon Blanc. It has all the minerality the chalk soil can give, at the same time offering ripe citrus and zesty acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Based in the notable wine village of Bué, this producer has made a rich wine, partially aged in wood. Intensely juicy with tropical fruits cut with citrus and hints of toast, the wine is full, ripe and already delicious. Drink now.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This steep slope of vines dominates the village of Chavignol, home to the Bourgeois family. An aromatic wine, it is crisp, textured and full of citrus and gooseberry flavors. This beautiful wine is still young, so wait to drink until 2019.

name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Jadis  (Sancerre)
description: Named after grandmother Léontine, this wine is made to be aged. It is still maturing, hinting at fullness to come. Spice and generous apple flavors are cut with acidity and a rich texture. As the develops further, it will fill out and become more powerful. Drink from 2019.

name: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: This wine comes from Mellot's home domaine of La Moussière, It is young and intense, with a mix of spice, concentrated citrus and crisp acidity. The depth of flavor in this wine is extraordinary and merits aging. Drink from 2020.

name: Blanco Nieva 2018 Martúe Sauvignon Blanc (Rueda)
description: This wine is offers pungent aromas of banana, gooseberry and gummy bears. The palate brings more of that intense banana along with Macintosh apple and pineapple. Zippy lime acidity flows through out ending on a grapefruit pith and green banana note.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: A yeasty nose is less than fresh and indicates a wine in decline. A grabby palate with the feel of grape skins tastes wheaty, grassy and fruitless. Low acidity on the finish confirms that this is fading.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Light aromas of tropical fruit and herb carry a slight metallic note. The flavor concentration is quite light, making this simple and straightforward.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: There's bit of a rubbery cabbage quality to this wine that's overwhelming the fruit characters. When you do find the lemon and pineapple notes, they're lacking some freshness and come with a lot of acidity on the palate. Overall, the disjointed nature of this wine is hard to shake.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A fat style of Sauvignon Blanc, this offers rounded yellow and white fruits cut with just enough acidity. A rich wine, it is ready to drink.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A pinched, briny nose is punchy and includes aromas of citrus peel. A narrow palate is tight but low on depth, while this tastes peppery and green, with little fruit character. On the finish, bitter green flavors are once again lacking in fruit.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: This is a fairly typical Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc nose, veering more down the citrus and green vegetal lane than the tropical one. Notes of grapefruit, nettles, lime, green bell pepper and ground white pepper are slightly overpowered on the palate by searing acidity that's only barely balanced by some textural roundness.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Unmistakably Marlborough, this wine is an extroverted mélange of guava, pineapple and peach, with some characteristic grassiness in the background. Overall there's plenty of refreshment to be had here.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A softly herbal wine, this offers crisp citrus flavors as well as riper white fruits. Plenty of acidity maintains freshness. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Prickly lime and pine needle aromas set up a lean palate with sharp acidity. Tart, punchy citrus and passion fruit flavors finish with lasting tang and grip from green tannins.

name: Duckhorn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is viscous and sweetly ripe in baked apple and honey flavors, with a thickness that persists.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This needs time in glass to aerate and to show its passionfruit, pineapple, grapefruit and green herbed characters. Even then, the acidity is a little searing, just barely kept in check by some fruit weight.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of bell pepper and asparagus would rate as lightly vegetal in most books. A chunky, full palate is low on acidic verve, while a highly pyrazinic flavor profile means this tastes of green citrus and veggies. Mild bitterness and a note of citrus skins lead a plump, chunky finish.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Light in color and flavor, this wine smells tangy and citrus-like, and tastes lean and low in fruit and acidity. It's clean and simple in character.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A reductive onion note initially masks this wine. Eventually, as the wine aerates it shows citrus fruit, dried green herbs and tomato leaf. Things improve a bit on the palate where a citrus tone plays alongside juicy acidity, but overall this is an austere and simple style.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A slightly darker shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling shows dried apple, wet hay and orange touches on the nose. The palate offers apple, pear and lime flavors, but without much texture or energy.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: As the name suggests, this wine is made using natural yeasts. It comes from a parcel in the small village of Tracy, close to the Loire river. The wine is ripe and full of fruit, with a tangy, orange-zest aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Piquant aromas of green fruits are feline in nature. This SB from Rueda feels chunky, with soft edges to the palate. Briny, lightly vegetal flavors of citrus fruit and bell pepper finish with just enough acid to make this worthwhile.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There seems to a rubbery onion character here that's somewhat masking the guava, passionfruit and pineapple characters. The palate is rich but crisp at the same time, with tongue-tingling acidity.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This light-bodied wine is grassy in aroma, has lean veggie and lemon flavors and a fairly crisp mouthfeel.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Lightly and judiciously wood aged, this wine is smooth, rounded with a poised balance between its acidity and generous yellow fruits. The period of wood and then bottle aging has softened and filled out the fruit, giving the wine a ripe character. Drink now.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Named after the shells that are the basis of the chalk soil of Sancerre, this wine is ripe and full. The aging in large wooden barrels has softened the shock of Sauvignon Blanc, resulting in a citrus and apple-flavored wine that is now ready to drink.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Opulent and rich, this wine offers intense, ripe yellow-fruit flavors and crisp citrus acidity that are enhanced by the concentrated texture. It is just now ready to drink but will age further, at least until 2022. Its name refers to the Romans who came to Sancerre.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine comes from a small walled vineyard next to a townhouse with little towers, called locally in jest Château Paladi. Ripe with apple and lime fruits, the wine is crisply textured and balanced, with a flinty character. It is ready to drink.

name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Jadis  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from a steep, southeast-facing vineyard close to the castle of Beaujeu. Particularly rich, it offers tropical fruits that show strongly through the acidity. There is an urgency to the texture, taut and still young. The wine proves the aging ability of fine Sancerre. Drink from 2020.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This is an exotic, 100% varietal wine given impressive time to mature before release. It's worth the wait. Flinty, it offers plenty of body around a wealth of well-developed pineapple, grapefruit and lemon-squeeze flavors, finishing in balance and with lingering complexity.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: Using wild yeasts and biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is intense and impressive. The richness is restrained by taut minerality and acidity, cutting through the ripe white and citrus fruits to give balance and the potential for further aging. Drink from 2019.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Etienne Henri Bourgeois pioneered oak aging in Sancerre. Made in exceptional years, this wine is aged in oak, giving it a smooth texture and an attractive touch of spice. It is just reaching maturity, with the white fruits and toast beautifully integrated. Drink now.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling, which includes 12% Sémillion, starts with fresh and snappy aromas of wet grass, ripe passion fruit and cold rain—a stunning aromatic combo. The palate is extremely zippy, with powerful acid slicing through flavors of lemongrass, lime and wet stone.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This wine celebrates the 19 generations (mostly called Alphonse) that have run this top Sancerre estate since the 17th century. The wine offers ripe fruit, bold quince and spice flavors, with hints of apricot. Structured and concentrated, it is a wine to savor, but not before 2019.

name: Joseph Phelps 2018 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: This wine comes from vines on the edge of the village of Chavignol, one of the top sites in Sancerre. Balanced and mineral driven, it is structured with acidity and tangy, tight texture. The wine also offers apricot and white stone-fruit flavors finishing with concentrated acidity. Drink from 2019.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This is a new cuvée from Alphonse Mellot, derived from old vines in Chavignol. Like with all the Mellot wines, the fruit is ripe, organically grown and very pure. The structure and concentration will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This wine is richly endowed with ripe yellow and quince flavors, tightly textured and concentrated. The fruit dominates although there is also room for the tight texture that will soften. Drink this rich wine from 2019.

name: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Jadis  (Sancerre)
description: A single-vineyard wine from one of the highest points in Sancerre, this is concentrated and dense, full of taut fruit and rich acidity. Apple flavors are cut with tangy, spicy citrus lifted by the taut aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

name: Domaine Fouassier 2017 Le Clos de Bannon  (Sancerre)
description: Almost tropical in its fruitiness, this wine, with one year in bottle, is generous, rich and open. Yes, it still shows a hint of minerality and herbal tanginess. But it is now a full wine packed with citrus and apricot flavors. Drink now.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Serge Dagueneau works with his three daughters at this family property, celebrating their heritage in this wine. Made from late-harvest grapes with some noble rot, it is extra rich while remaining completely dry. Flavors of yellow fruits and peppered apples show strongly against the powerful acidity and final touch of honey. Drink this delicious wine from 2019.

name: Kenzo Estate 2018 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Named after Alphonse Edmond, the father of present owner of Alphonse Mellot, this is the top wine from an always-impressive estate. Richness and concentration almost overwhelm the wine at this young stage, showing that it is set for aging. The acidity and biodynamically grown fruit of this powerful wine need to open up. Drink from 2020.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This wine comes from a densely planted vineyard, with nearly 7,000 vines per acre. Low yields and superripe fruit have yielded a concentrated wine, intense with white fruits and acidity. Age this wine until 2019, to let its richness mature.

name: Massican 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Luminous lemon freshness dominates the nose of passion fruit on this tropical Auslese. Sauvignon Blanc's varietal greenness—think tomato leaf and grass—edge and shape the wonderfully luscious midpalate, while spiky, sharp freshness delivers satisfying thrill. What lovely, flavor-bursting passion fruit tension. This crackles with life.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Neutral aromas are largely clean and barely suggest white peach. This boxed SB is plump and citrusy on the palate, with citric flavors that turn a bit green and grassy on the back side.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Passionfruit, pineapple and mango rind dominate this wine from the bottom of New Zealand's north island. There's a touch of residual sugar on the palate, yet bright acidity balances all the ripe fruit.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Cut grass and pungent green-apple slices make for a familiar entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with Granny Smith apple and nectarine flavors, but they are short-lived and the texture is flat.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A bit more subtle than some of its more bombastic counterparts, this wine shows notes of grapefruit, guava and citrus. It's crisp in feel, but balanced by plenty of ripe fruit flavors on the palate. A zippy grapefruity note rings on the finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: From the relatively cooler maritime climes of the Awatere Valley in Marlborough, this Sauvignon leads with green vegetal notes of snow pea and green bell pepper, backed up by lemon-lime and grapefruit. The palate slippery with some fruit sweetness and rather searing acid. Stylistically it feels a little forced.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A multi-national collaboration between Winemaker James Foster and Pat Monahan, lead singer of the band Train, the duo's Sauvignon Blanc is a straightforward expression of the variety. The typical grapefruit, guava, pineapple and tomato leaf notes are all there. The palate is crisp and zippy, with a touch of creaminess due to time on lees.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine balances loads of peach and pineapple tones with a touch of green bell pepper. The palate is a bit disjointed, with the ripe fruit and bright acidity not quite gelling.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Fruity but not bombastically so, notes of apple, guava and peach lead into a palate that is creamy-textured thanks to some time spent on lees. The palate is back by enough acidity to remain refreshing yet the finish is abrupt.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is initially a bit reductive. It veers towards the green spectrum, showing notes of bell pepper, tomato leaf and grapefruit. There's a biting, slightly underripe quality to the acidity and that is ultimately balanced out by a slightly rounded texture. It finishes on a citrusy tang.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Honey-dipped pineapple and guava, with a touch of fig give this wine a fruity midpalate. This has a moderate structure and a lingering note of anise.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This soft wine conveys pineapple and ripe white-currant fruitiness along with citrus acidity. Warm, open and rounded, it is ready to be drunk now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a vegetal style from the bottom of New Zealand's South Island. Snow pea and bell pepper notes lead the way, with passionfruit in the background. The palate is creamy in feel, but it's balanced by lifted acidity and more fruit-driven flavors.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Medium gold in color, this wine is a luscious wine that offers aromas of lemon balm, guava, nettle and bruised apple. It's creamy and slippery in texture, but a good lick of acidity to holds things in place.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This small enclave of Sauvignon Blanc in the north of Burgundy has much, tastewise, to do with Sancerre. This wine offers crisp acidity and white-currant flavors cut with lemon juice and filled out with hints of white fruits. Drink the wine now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Pineapple, guava and grapefruit lead the way in this refreshing wine. There's a good lick of acidity that's balanced by ripe fruit flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Refreshing aromas of fresh grapefruit and lemon are tempered by lime pith and wet stone. The palate echoes the nose, showing more bright citrus fruit and river rock tones alongside tangy lime-juice acidity. The finish brings fresh squeezed lemon juice laced with white pepper.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: In the warmer climes of Hawke's Bay on the North Island, much of New Zealand's (a k a Marlborough's) classic green vegetal notes are gone. The wines exhibits more tropical fruit characters, displaying ripe mango, peach, and lychee notes that are balanced by lifted acidity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A perfumed wine from the small region west of Chablis, this is a tropical-fruit-flavored wine. Its light texture and freshness give it a lively, crisp character. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Aromas of vanilla bean, lemon custard and green apple are found in this Czech Sauvignon Blanc. In the mouth there are flavors of apple pie, flan and caramelized orange peel. The finish is crisp and clean.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A charred onion and nuts offer a reductive quality that presides at first sniff. Underneath it are more typical characters: grapefruit, lime and pineapple. The texture is slippery, finishing on a salty note.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: The aromas of this wine are delicate and pleasing, giving way to apple, passionfruit, guava and flowers. There's a satiny texture and a good lick of acidity on the palate. It's nothing too complicated but is nevertheless thirst quenching

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Attractive aromas of lemon verbena, white pepper, tomato leaf and grapefruit are followed by a tangy, citrusy palate. This is an easy-going, refreshing wine that won't dent the wallet.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This zingy wine starts off with lime, grapefruit, tomato leaf and white pepper. There's a slight chalkiness and slipperiness to the texture, with bright acidity and a lifted, mouthwatering finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a well-integrated and smoothly soft white, balanced and light bodied with a lasting imprint of peach, apricot and green apple.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Prickly citrus and grassy scents are pungent. A plump, slightly heavy palate is only modest in acidity, while this tastes of bell pepper, white pepper and passion fruit. A mellow finish is just fresh enough, with lasting green notes.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: There's a juicy lemon-lime popsicle quality to this wine that's hard not to like. The slight floral character helps, too. It's crisp yet slightly viscous in texture, with lemon and lime notes on the finish that make it a fruity and fun little number.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Meyer lemon pith and orange flesh show on the very light and easy nose of this bottling from the region's pioneer winery. The palate is much more intriguing, with a chalky, tense frame delivering lemon-lime flavors.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an aromatic wine with ripe pineapple, peach and ginger spice notes. The palate also has a richness about it, in the form of a creamy texture and plenty of fruit concentration, but there's a good lick of all-important acidity to freshen things up and make the fruit seem tangy rather than sweet.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Grassy aromas met with cut limes on the easy nose of this bottling from the historic winery on Alamo Pintado Road. Granny Smith apple flavors consumer the sip, which is smooth and refreshing.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Combining light herb and mineral aromas with somewhat richer pear and fig flavors, this medium-bodied wine is fruity, smooth and shows some savory complexity too.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Perfumed in jasmine, this is a fleshy expression of the variety that's ripe, resolved and moderately structured. The fruit is a mix of fresh peach and green apple.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine balances a tangy citrus side against a rich texture and riper flavors of pear and apple that come out on the palate and linger on the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Remarkably fragrant in jasmine, this wine is light, balanced and well-integrated—a larger production offering that doesn't shirk on flavor or style, offering plenty of pretty bang for the buck.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Strong aromas of dewy springtime grass, lime zest, pomelo rind and wet cement make for a pungent entry to this bottling. The palate is stony in flavor, with touches of pink lemonade, cut grass and lime rind.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is bright and aromatic, with notes of guava, pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of grass. The palate is slippery in feel, with crunchy acidity and a long guava finish. Lovers of this style will find this a solid choice.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of snow pea, tomato leaf, passionfruit and lemon rind are followed by a crisp, citrusy palate of mouthwatering acidity and a slippery texture.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is all about subtle stone fruit, white spice and floral characters. The acidity is a little on the harsh side, but it's just barely kept in check by a chalky yet mouthwatering palate.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A lightly vegetal nose with fruitier bolts of mango and melon leads to a juicy palate with bright, banging acidity. This outdoes many Rueda Sauvignon Blancs via spicy green fruit and melon flavors and clean and proper balance. Drink now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This canned wine offers a convenient means of enjoying crisp white wine, starting with aromas of dried hay, steel and lime leaf. The palate offers sour apple, tart limes and very strong cut-grass flavors.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Attractive, lifted notes of lemon, lime, nettle and green herbs follow from the nose to the palate. A touch of ripeness balances the zingy acidity, providing a slippery texture and feeling of ripe, juicy fruit. The finish is long and lemony.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Buttery, nutty notes are the fore of this oak-aged wine, along with grilled peaches, orange peels and ginger. It's creamy and slippery in texture, but the laser-sharp acidity brings it into focus. While the style is a little flashy and the oak a little too in the fore, it's nevertheless fun to see a different expression outside the well-worn model.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is shy at first, whispering notes of lemon, grapefruit, tomato leaf and jalapeño. It is chalky in texture, with those grapefruit and green notes running through to a finish that shows a bit of bitterness.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A salty character leads the nose and palate, followed closely by notes of peach, pineapple and orange. Creamy textured, with mouthwatering acidity, those tangy fruit flavors follow all the way through to the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Showing the restraint of the vintage, this wine offers notes of guava, lemon verbena and white spice. Prickly acidity weaves into a chalky wet-stone note on the palate, finishing long, citrusy and mouthwatering.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine shows a strong line of green herb, tomato leaf and nettle characters, with tropical fruit in the background. Some oak fermentation, lees work and partial skin contact make for a more textural style, with lifted acidity and a slight flinty quality neatly round things out.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Chalky aromas and flavors distinguish this bone-dry, refreshing and different wine. It's light in body, light on ripe fruit flavors but brings out the mineral, saline and citrus flavors that many wine drinkers love.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of orange, lemon peel, fresh greens and the ocean are clear, clean and in harmony. A tangy, crisp palate is braced by a shot of blazing acidity, while this tastes mostly of lime and salt from the nearby Pacific Ocean. A steady finish is showing the slightest bit of yeasty breakdown, so drink as soon as possible.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Light aromas of wet cement, grapefruit rind, grass and smoke show on the nose of this bottling from the Jack McGinley Vineyard. There is compelling grip to the palate, where lemongrass, lime leaf and rounded apple flavors make for a mellow sipping experience.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fermented and aged in neutral oak, this wine offers pretty aromas of lemon and apple blossom. The firm palate brings peach and apple flavors that are balanced by tense acidity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Light aromas of lime and apple lead into a more supple tone of honeydew on the nose of this widely available wine. There is a compelling grip to the palate, where a chalky texture carries flavors of Anjou pear and lime pith.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This late-release wine has an attractive buttery aroma, baked apple flavors and a nicely rich texture. It expands into canteloupe and light fig on the midpalate and those flavors linger on the finish.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is a 100% stainless-steel white that offers spritzy acidity and grainy texture around a midweight body as peach and vanilla flavors wrap around that light refreshing core of pure fruit. This is a new wine from one of the oldest wineries in the state, brought back to life by the great-great-grandson of original founder Charles Kohler.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Fleshy, full-bodied and floral, this wine is generously proportioned in stone fruit and Meyer lemon tones. These tones complement the palate well, giving a sense of substance and style.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Brisk and tangy all the way through, this light and refreshing wine was fermented in large oak vats and aged on the lees for four months. It features citrus aromas, lively citrus and crisp apple flavors and a nicely tart texture that livens the palate.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a fruity sparkler made in the Charmat method. The nose is a mix of honeyed nuts, yeasty apples, green tea and orange zest while the palate shows a touch of sweetness, which enhances the tangy fruit and honey flavors without completely taking over.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Guava, pineapple rind, red apple skins and green herbs lead the nose. The grapefruit-tinged palate is threaded together with prickly, mouthwatering acidity, chalky wet-stone minerality and a long, juicy and spicy finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine gushes in tones of lime popsicle and guava flecked with honey. The juicy fruit continues on the palate, where tangy, bouncy acidity sits easily alongside a creamy texture. There's a long peach and lime finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this is a floral and balanced wine that displays great tension and texture. Fleshy in flavors of peach, lime zest and wet stone, it delivers a rounded feel that lingers on the palate.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This enticing wine is savory on the nose, displaying light herb, fig and mineral aromas. Rich melon and crushed rock flavors yield a creamy texture.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: It's not usual to age Sauvignon Blanc, but this late release and the companion Mariah Vineyard bottling are nicely concentrated wines. In the buttery oaky spectrum, this medium-bodied and nuanced wine smells lightly buttery, tastes rich, feels mouth-filling and lasts long on the finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine erupts with ripe mango, pineapple and grapefruit, backed by some grass and nettle notes. There's fruit weight on the palate, threaded with wet stone and bright acidity, with a long, slightly savory, green-herbed finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aromatic but not bombastic, this shows grapefruit, apple and lemon aromas on the nose that are followed by herbal notes of tomato leaf, mint and grass. There's a focused line of acidity on the palate that cuts through the fruit and rounded texture but doesn't jut out. Drink now–2023.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This blend of fruit from the McGinley and Grassini vineyards is fermented in cigar barrels, and shows rounded aromas of passion fruit and nectarine on the nose alongside lime, grass and chalk. There is a smoky quality to the smoke, with red pear, chalk and grass flavors wrapped in a creamy texture.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This extremely energetic and zippy bottling offers grassy elements on the nose that are balanced by hints of passion fruit, wet stone and lime rind. The palate is extremely textural and grippy, delivering pear and apple flavors along with pink-grapefruit pith and a chalky finish.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is a lovely, barrel-fermented white that sources widely from Stagecoach Vineyard, a mountainous site that provides structure and balanced power in this case. Strong varietal aromas of pineapple, peach and anise ride a fleshy midpalate that refreshes in complex layers of lasting flavor.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: Soft and soapy, suggesting high pH, this wine is light in style, with easygoing citrus flavors. The palate is soft and lacking in an acidic lift.

name: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: This wine offers the classic Marlborough combo of ripe tropical fruit flavors and subtle touches of snow pea and nettle leaf. It's the palate that really brings things up a notch with its chalky texture, stony minerality, mouthwatering acidity and long, juicy finish.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Aromas of orange, mango and citrus blossom lead to flavors of tangerine, passion fruit and mango. The finish is crisp and clean.

name: Clif Family 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Beautifully interwoven acidity gives this wine a lift of freshness and viscosity in this lovely, 100% varietal white, sourced from several sites, including Stagecoach on Atlas Peak, Hyde Vineyards in Carneros and the Spottswoode Estate. Fresh peach, apricot and wild vanilla are met by textured richness that's balanced and measured in approach.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This light and crisp wine has a snap-pea aroma, tangy herb and citrus flavors and a touch of veggies on the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This perfumed wine is crisp with citrus while also ripe with yellow fruits and a touch of honey. It is already attractive, ripe and refreshing. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This defiantly herbal wine has grassy aromas and gooseberry flavors. Its tangy character and taut texture are those of a young, fruity wine. It is ready to drink.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This straw-colored Sauvignon Blanc has aromas of orange blossom, guava and lemon zest. In the mouth there are flavors of lemon, mandarin orange and mango. The finish is crisp.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Thickly built, spritzy in acidity and brightly citrus-driven in lemon zest, grapefruit and apricot, this is the fourth vintage of this wine from the longtime Napa Valley producer. It delivers flavor and texture within integrated oak, within which just a portion is fermented.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows the rather pungent, herbaceous aspect of the grape variety from the first whiff of wet earth and chives to flavors that are tart and lean.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
