description: This full-bodied wine is delicious, layered, complex and well balanced. It is compelling from the first whiff of melon and fig to the rich, concentrated palate.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Elderflower, tomato leaf and citrus aromas delicately float out of the glass on this fragrant white. On the elegant linear palate, bright acidity accompanies juicy grapefruit, white peach and honeydew melon alongside a hint of wild herb. A tangy mineral note signals the close.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This wine's green pear scent has an earthy tang. The palate has gentle grass- and lemon-scented freshness. It's light in body and unobtrusive, with a dry, subtly aromatic finish.

name: Di Costanzo 2016 Farella Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Aromas evoking grapefruit, tropical fruit and tomato leaf flow over to the full-bodied enveloping palate along with green melon and steely mineral. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.

name: Saget la Perrière 2018 L'Origine Sauvignon Blanc (Blanc Fumé de Pouilly)
description: Loads of yellow peach, lemon pith and a kiss of wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe yet restrained enough, offering nectarine and lemon flavors, set against a tight structure and zesty acid.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Floral and brimming in citrus-laden acidity, this is a creamy, lush example of the variety, with a strong peachy flavor and aromas of apple blossom.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This is an intensely perfumed wine, full with apricot, kiwi and tight apple flavors. Still young, this rich, full-bodied wine is concentrated and ripe, demanding time to mature. Drink from 2019.

name: Sketchbook 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Intense varietal aromas of tropical fruit, tomato vine, aromatic herb and citrus jump out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the expressive, mouthwatering palate doles out juicy grapefruit, honeydew melon and grilled sage alongside tangy acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Lime, kiwi and grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is tremendous zip and a stony, chalky texture to the medium-bodied palate, which is full of grass and lime peel flavors.

name: Level 3 2016 Driven Red (Paso Robles)
description: Tropical fruit, tomato vine, grilled herb and toasted aromas lead the nose. Tangy and savory, the medium-bodied palate offers pink grapefruit, kiwi and a note of bitter almond. A mineral note wraps up the salty finish.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Named after this producer's home winery, this wine is ripe and full of crystal-clear fruit. Zesty acidity is comfortably surrounded by full-flavored fruitiness. It could do with some aging, so drink this rich wine from 2019.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, crushed thyme and a whiff of tomato leaf take shape on this medium-bodied structured white. The elegant palate doles out dried apricot, mature yellow peach, crushed oyster shell and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity. A hint of toasted hazelnut lingers on the close.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: Winemaker: Bartho Eksteen. This screams Sauvy from start to finish, with pronounced aromas of fresh grass, grapefruit peel, lime pith and tart gooseberry on the nose and mouth. The lightweight palate is fresh and zippy, with more vibrant green-fruit flavors that show good cut and precision. Hints of citrus and singed straw grace the finish, the only hints at the wooded element of this harmonious and well-integrated wine.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Subtle in stone fruit aromas and a waxy apple tease, this vineyard-specific white is bright, fresh and layered with texture. Light in ripeness, it'll do well as an aperitif or companion to the table and a wide variety of fare.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Aromas of citrus, wild herb, crushed tomato leaf and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose. On the medium-bodied savory palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe grapefruit, juicy lemon drop and white peach, while a flinty mineral note backs up the finish.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine's green apple, dewy grass and bright lemon notes create an appetizingly fresh nose. The palate brims with ease and lightness and that pervasive, lemony freshness. This is harmonious, aromatic and wonderfully fluid.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: This wine's fresh nettle and bergamot aromas create a subtle, fresh nose. The light palate surprises with its concentration and verve. Citrusy freshness runs through this like a faultline—it lifts and illuminates everything. This is light but expressive, subtle but completely convincing.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Concentration and depth are the hallmarks of this fresh, flavorful, bracing wine made from organic grapes. It matches bright citrus and grassy aromas with deep, layered melon, fig and prosciutto flavors that seem to expand on the palate.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: The wet nettle, green grass and lemon notes on the nose of this wine are utterly appetizing. The palate reprises these aromas in a precise, enticing and clean fashion. Expressive, fresh, light and dry, it gives the impression of deliciously understated confidence.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A touch of creaminess lends fluidity and ease to the nose of this wine. It also accentuates the sunny stone fruit notes that pervade the dry, concentrated but light palate. Varietal expression is true but subtle here; it promises to be even better with some bottle age. Drink now–2025.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Restrained and refined, this wine offers delicate aromas of grapefruit, white spring flower and crushed herb. The enticing scents carry over to elegantly structured palate along with apple, exotic fruit and tangerine zest. Fresh acidity provides balance while a flinty mineral note lingers on the finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from certified organic grapes, this wine offers a strong uplift of acidity and refreshing layers of tangerine, white peach and Meyer lemon. With just enough grip and body it has complexity amid the freshness.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crushed tomato vine, bell pepper and grapefruit aromas follow through to the full-bodied savory palate along with tropical-fruit notes. Fresh acidity gives it balance while hints of tangerine zest and white pepper mark the close.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of bell pepper, tomato leaf and citrus jump out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the linear full-bodied palate doles out juicy grapefruit, white peach and dried sage alongside crisp acidity. A saline note gives it a savory finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Grassy and herbal, this white is tart and tight in acidity, with a low level of ripeness that keeps it crisp and clean. Lemongrass and lime round out the finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This lovely white has a bright, floral nose and is fresh in flavor. Well-textured, it offers a wealth of delicious peach skin, Meyer lemon and grapefruit pith, the tang and juiciness of the fruit flavors melded together in impressive harmony.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Gritty citrus aromas are equally vegetal. This wine is lean and a bit watery in feel. Briny flavors retain a strong sense of greenness on a tangy, citrusy finish that runs heavy on phenolics.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Chunky tropical and vegetal aromas are just fruity enough. This wine feels plump and solid, with good acidity. Like the nose, this tastes of mango and melon but also canned veggies, while a briny finish strongly suggests bell pepper.

name: St. Supéry 2018 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Rounded in nondescript aspects of apple and crushed stone, this lightly ripe white is floral in jasmine and honeysuckle and is easily quaffable.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Starting out reduced, light aromas of herb, citrus zest, kiwi and other tropical fruits lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors. There are good things going on but the concentration seems light.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A herbal wine, crisp and green, is laden with acidity as well as gooseberry fruits. It has a cool character while also having some density and ripeness. Drink the wine now.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Though pungent with crisp varietal grassy notes, this does not push that herbaceous character too far over the edge, as one-quarter was fermented and left on the lees in French oak barrels. The fruit flavors run to bruised apple and melon, which contrast with the herbal side.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Briny melon and mild mineral carry this straightforward wine. A zesty, acidic palate holds flavors of lime, lettuce and generic bitterness. The finish is bright.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Aromas of green-melon rind, crushed stone and white blossoms carry the nose. The palate is light in feel, with flavors of tart kiwi and spicy greens ending on a powdered chalk note.

name: Longboard 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 18% Sémillon, this is a lush wine richly discreet in guava, melon and fig, with moderate acidity holding it together with grace and concentration. A note of oak boosts the tropical profile.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Grassy in pea shoots, this is an easygoing, quaffable white with buzzy acidity and a lasting taste of fig and melon.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Fleshy and gravelly, this white is blended with 14% Sémillon. It leans into a sweetness of stone fruit and vanilla, with a lasting lushness on the finish.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: With 5% Sémillon and 1% Muscat, this is no shy white, offering instead full-bodied, lush and fleshy flavors of peach, mango and vanilla. It lingers in a finish of freshly cut grass.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Bright aromas of honeydew melon, Asian pear and herb lead to tart, spritzy, lighter-styled fruit flavors. The concentration seems light, but what's there is good.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The wine is called a curiosity because it comes from the only Sauvignon Blanc appellation in Burgundy. Saint-Bris in the Yonne valley produces ripe Sauvignon, creamy and gently textured with attractive acidity and ripe apple flavors. The wine is young, intense and will be calmer from 2019.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Lighter-styled aromas of herb, lemon zest and fig are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors. A melon note lingers on the finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Aromas of citrus fruits and canned vegetables carry this wine. It's round and plump in feel, with balancing acidity, while lime and herbaceous green flavors flatten out on the finish.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: From the coastal Colchagua subzone of Paredones, this SB opens with a mix of tropical-fruit aromas and cool-climate green bean. A tangy, zesty palate is fueled by citric acid, while flavors of tangerine, lemon and green herbs finish with smacking acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Pressed wild flower, ripe orchard fruit and citrus aromas mingle with a whiff of crushed stone on this savory white. Full bodied but linear, the elegant structured palate delivers red grapefruit, tangerine zest, white peach and crushed herb alongside vibrant acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Radiant and savory, this compelling white boasts enticing scents of elderflower, ripe citrus, crushed Alpine herb, tomato leaf and a whiff of tropical fruit. The delicious elegantly structured palate delivers juicy grapefruit, mature white peach, honeydew melon and mineral accompanied by bright acidity.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Elegantly structured and savory, this estate's Sauvignon is always one of the best in the denomination. Restrained and loaded with finesse, it opens with enticing, delicate aromas of dried herbs, mature yellow stone fruit and a whiff of grapefruit. Reflecting the nose, the delicious, balanced palate offers apricot, crushed sage and citrus alongside fresh acidity. A delicate mineral note lifts the finish.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: A touch of flinty reduction still clings to the nose of this wine. On the palate, zesty, lemon-scented drive and concentration belys the fluid expressiveness and light body. This is lovely now but will come into its own with a little more bottle age. Drink 2019–2022.

name: Arietta 2017 On the White Keys White (Sonoma-Napa)
description: All of the aromatic expression here is still shrouded by reductive notes of flint and struck match. Underneath, it's a wonderfully fresh, vivid and creamy wine with grass, lemon and summer blossom notions. The palate shows concentration and depth despite its dry lightness. Elegance and harmony are apparent from the first sip. This deserves some bottle age. Drink 2020–2030.

name: Bota Box 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Chile)
description: Barrel-fermented in acacia wood, this wine is reduced and quite harsh. It lacks in fruit tones.

name: Producta Vignobles 2018 Mission Saint Vincent  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Heavily vegetal aromas are stale and offputting. This wine is holding onto its acidity, but underripe flavors of green vegetables outweigh a lemony character. It ends bitter and pyrazinic.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: Tropical and overripe on the nose with aromas of papaya, honeydew and geranium, this Sauvignon Blanc is equally tropical on the palate. Full in body and warm, this feels thick and coating and has a finish lingers on an overripe papaya note.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: This wine has a harsh fuzziness to the texture and a strong aroma of grass and canned pea.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Vegetal aromas suggest canned beans and peas. A round, pulpy palate delivers mostly pyrazine-driven flavors of bell pepper and string beans. On the finish, this tastes of veggies and grape skins.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Aromas of apple juice and melon are light on the nose. A texture of grape skins and citrus peel drives the palate, while a stone-fruit flavor dominates.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: Very faint aromas of lime zest show a bit more definition on the palate. The acidity is abrasive and high, leading to a long, tart finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Mild aromas of citrus appear on the nose. The palate is soft in feel, with slightly mealy tropical-fruit flavors. A quiet vegetal tone marks the finish.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a slight metallic edge to it, a twist that muddles the heartiness of its tropical fruit and creamy texture.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of haystack and grass lead to a prickly palate with tangy acidity but not much body. Slightly bitter flavors of green herbs and grass lack fruitiness. The finish is chunky.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Apple flesh and watery lemon aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's flat on the palate, offering lime zest and more sliced-apple flavors.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a jalapeño spiciness on the nose that intensifies into the lush, round palate of buttery cream that accentuates the unctuous ripeness overall.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Pea shoots, lemon and wet stone contribute graceful flavors to this wine, which has a metallic edge to its medium-bodied texture.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This wine has juicy apple, lemon and lime flavors with a touch of tangerine-laden acidity that helps keep the balance in check. Moderately structured, it's an enjoyable wine with texture and length.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Strong flavors and aromas of pea shoots, peach and sweet vanilla give this wine a richness and full-bodied, fleshy personality.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Starting out a bit reduced, the aromas open to reveal notes of citrus zest and herb. The palate is quite light in style, not holding together on the finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp, bright and balanced, this white is floral in jasmine with a persistence of peach and pear flavor. Given time in neutral oak, it offers body and richness without heaviness, remaining fresh on the finish.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Shy at first on the nose, this wine develops to reveal a voluptuous style of fleshy, rounded grapefruit, pineapple, cantaloupe and Meyer lemon. It remains complex and exotic through a lengthy midpalate and textured finish, with persistent acidity.

name: Joseph Phelps 2018 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: The aromas here are vivid, with notes of pear, pineapple, citrus, melon and herb. The palate explodes with kiwi, papaya and passion fruit flavors that carry on the finish. It's flat-out delicious, showing a captivating sense of richness and texture as well as a lingering finish.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Barrel-fermented with 19% Sémillon, this white impresses in light flavors of peach, apricot and lime. Citrus-driven acidity and a tease of wet stone creates a buoyant feel to the fleshy palate. It's complex and undeniably delicious.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: This blends three different cuvées—one in stainless steel, one in acacia barrel, and one in concrete egg. It's a deft bit of finessing the grape, adding layers of texture and minerality without diluting the varietal character. Herb and citrus components are perfectly balanced, and the wine has exceptional length.

name: Jermann 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Floral and stony, this impressively complex and memorable white has a thirst-quenching grasp of gravelly minerality, a core element built around bold, beautiful flavors of fig, Meyer lemon and tangerine.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: These vines, planted in 1990, are the oldest for this variety in the Willamette Valley. At first the wine shows a textbook style, with vivid acidity and a luxurious mix of citrus fruits, with an emphasis on Key lime and grapefruit. But it continues to expand with hours of breathing time, adding flesh and detail, until finally it most resembles a dry Sauternes, complete with a lovely streak of honeysuckle.

name: Skagit 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake Chelan)
description: Extreme aromas of garlic and onions lead to crisp lemon and garlic flavors that push the envelope of acceptability, but may suit some people's taste buds.

name: Esser 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Tart gooseberry and grapefruit aromas are soft and reserved on the nose of this wine, though they carry through to the palate with a but more intensity. There's a thinness to the midpalate, while just enough lemon-lime acidity graces the finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Floral tones of verbena and jasmine are oddly pronounced on the nose of this wine, dominating the green apple and melon rind fruit. The round mouthfeel shows a bit of flatness on the midpalate, echoed by a final note of citrus oil that lacks some needed verve.

name: Duckhorn 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From a single vineyard, this white is given six months to chill in stainless steel. It tastes concentrated and full, with an overt tartness to the underlying acidity.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Peach candies and pineapple slices form the nose of this ripe wine, though with only moderate intensity. The lean palate shows more restraint, with tart plum and lime flavors that finish zippy and mouth-puckering.

name: Domaine Fouassier 2018  Sancerre
description: This is a thickly constructed white that tastes sweet in vanilla and mango, a big expression of the variety that opts for richness over freshness.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: Tart plum and green gooseberry immediately greet the nose on this bottling. Nervy and taut, it's light and zippy on the palate, with an abundant lime flavor and mouth-puckering lift on the close.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: It seems odd to make a Sauvignon Blanc in the same region as Vinho Verde's great whites, but this fat wine is the result. It has richness and touches of tropical fruit, but lacks acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lime leaf, green gooseberry and plum lead the nose of this fresh and easy white, with a soft flintiness in the background. It's prickly and vibrant on the palate, with a final bitter-melon flavor.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There's a pleasant grassy overlay to the lime leaf, citrus peel and melon rind aromas and flavors in this zippy wine. Mouthwatering and puckering, it's quite zippy and zesty in feel, with a fresh finish of lime and green apple flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is very green, offering up eucalyptus, fresh garden herbs and lemon peel. The palate is astringent in feel, leaning on lemon and lime pith with lots of grassiness straight through the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Intense aromas of freshly scooped honeydew melon, flowers and herbs. The rounded palate brings plenty of appeal with its tropical fruit flavor. Enjoy now for its straightforward nature.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are quite light, with notes of melon, lees, lemon, vanilla, herb and pear, with the palate bringing more of the same. There are good things going on but the concentration seems a bit light.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Subtle hints of sweet grass and lemon verbena mingle with the green melon, lime and underripe mango core of this wine. It's medium in weight, with a flatness to the midpalate that countered by a bitter pithiness on the finish.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Bright and focused, this wine is full of gravelly minerality and wet stone grit, with vibrant shakes of lemon peel and grapefruit. The freshness hides a robust weight and full-figured ripeness.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This barrel-fermented wine is toasty and ready to drink. The wood has suppressed the more herbal flavors of the Sauvignon Blanc, instead introducing more spice and apricot fruit along with intense acidity. Drink this rich wine now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine starts citrus-driven and bright in acidity before evolving in the glass to take on more power and richness, a mix of stone fruit and melon.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This oak-aged wine is rich, ripe with bold tropical fruits and a lightly mineral texture. Spice and toastiness balance with the up-front fruitiness and the crisp acidity at the end. Drink this wine from 2019.

name: Monochrome 2018 Sense Out of Place White (California)
description: Made with 12% Sémillon, this wine is a blend of fruit from Summit View, Seven Hills and Les Collines vineyards. The aromas start out subdued, opening to reveal notes of tropical fruit, citrus peel and herb. In contrast, the palate is sleek but flavorful, loaded with papaya and kiwi flavors, with a citrus and tropical-fruit-filled finish.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fresh, clean and crisp aromas of Granny Smith apple peels, cut grass and lime rinds show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and tangy with grapefruit pith and more cut-grass flavors, proving almost puckering and proving very tightly woven.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Crisp aromas of honeysuckle, Anjou pear and green apple lead into more layers of grass, nectarine and wet stone on this bottling, which evolves quickly in the glass. There is strong tension to the palate, where floral flavors meet with honeydew and lemon zest.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Very mineral-driven on the nose, with aromas of chalk and wet gravel, this bottling also shows scents of lime and pear rind. The palate is very tangy, with pomelo-pith flavors, but there is also a more rounded touch of cut pear and orange rind.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The winery makes a pair of Sauv Blancs, and this one is high in acidity with fruit flavors of green apples and pink grapefruit. It finishes clean, with an interesting herbal note.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Grassy with lengthy acidity, this is a robustly fresh, focused and fruity white, with highlights of kumquat, fig and apricot. The midpalate and finish veer into creamier, buttery flavors that provide a welcome lushness of mouthfeel.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This wine offers lively acidity broadened by flavors of fig, peach and green apple. Stainless-steel fermented, it remains crisp and focused in the glass, finishing in lemongrass, Meyer lemon and a hint of ginger.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Fragrant in white flowers, this wine offers sizzling freshness and stony backbone. Melon, lemon, lime and tangerine all play a part in contribution to its fruit-forward complexity and long-lasting appeal. Small amounts of Sémillon and Viognier are added.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Pear, grass, fig, toast and lemon-peel aromas are followed by medium-bodied, textured fig, melon and barrel-spice flavors that persist on the finish. The Sémillon blended in (22%) gives the palate extra weight and depth.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Pretty in peach skin, jasmine and vanilla bean, this robust white is rich and layered, with supportive acidity that makes it seem fresh and lively.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: The inaugural release of this wine was fermented and aged sur lie for 18 months in a concrete egg. Aromas of pineapple, kiwi, citrus, lees, straw and herb are followed by lighter-styled but still creamy-feeling fruit flavors that lead to a warm fruit-filled finish.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Made from Oak Knoll District grapes, including 20% Sauvignon Musqué, this wine spends time in both stainless steel and French oak. Fleshy in white peach, apricot and melon, it offers balanced acidity and layers of texture.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Partial oak aging has resulted in a soft style of Sauvignon Blanc. The intense herbal character has been filled out with spice and a judicious touch of toastiness. It is an elegant wine, ready to drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Lightly tropical as well as herbal, this wine is crisp and bright. Its acidity and fresh kiwi and gooseberry flavors are balanced by a touch of pineapple and topped with intense, young acidity. Drink the wine now.

name: Mauritson 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Grassy aromas of cut lawn and green apple meet with wet sidewalk and dried lime rinds on the crisp, almost austere, nose of this bottling. There is extreme zip to the sip, with more grass and lime-rind flavors, proving quite bright.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: This attractively soft and creamy wine has lively fruits and plenty of acidity. Green-plum and lemon-juice flavors are right up front, giving a bright wine that is ready to drink.

name: Peju 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A rather round nose offers heady aromas of honey, dried apricot and hazelnut. The palate has some weight, but is well balanced by acidity and shows notes of apple juice, baking spice and more hazelnuts.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A flinty aroma and smoky, white-peppery flavors give this medium-bodied wine a savory rather than fruity profile. Hints of earthiness join subtle lemon flavors on the palate.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This medium-bodied wine has an earthy, smoky aroma followed by tangy lemon flavors and figgy, earthy accents. It has a crisp mouth-cleansing texture.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Floral and characterized by bold stone-fruit flavors, this wine is spritzy in acidity, with a nutty herbal imprint of anise.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: There's a roundness to the nose and mouth of this wine, formed through abundant waves of ripe green melon, peach flesh and white cherry. Ample acidity keeps the medium-weight mouthfeel in check, with final flavors of green banana, citrus oil and melon rind.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: All herbs, citrus and crisp white-peach flavors, this wine bursts with cool fruitiness. Its acidity, light texture and touch of minerality are bright and juicy. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Crisp and grassy although with some hints of tropical fruit, this wine is all about fruitiness. Acidity, citrus and a refreshing character are all part of this attractive wine. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Dried herb aromas and lemon-lime flavors highlight this medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has considerable richness in the mouthfeel and tastes soft in terms of acidity.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Rather tropical on the nose, this bottling shows pear, plumeria and ripe apple aromas on the nose. It's a bit viscous on the palate but with some energy, carrying flavors of apple soda, honeydew and candied pears.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The nose seems a bit disconnected from the palate, showing aromas of overripe lemons and stinky steamed vegetables. While the palate shocks with searing acidity, fresh squeezed lemon and lime and a pervasive grassy note, ending on a tangy lemon note.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A ripe, tropical-fruit style of Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is perfumed with pineapple balancing the pink-grapefruit flavors. A crisp, zingy texture makes the wine refreshing and deliciously fruity. Drink now.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine is light bodied, very fresh in aroma and reasonably crisp in texture, showing green-apple flavors and subtle herb and citrus notes. It is very clean, well balanced and should be perfect for a crowd.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Thick, concentrated and rich, this is a 100% stainless-steel fermented white that tangles in tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Underripe banana, green plum and lime set the stage of this fresh and inviting Sauvy. The palate offers more of the same, with ample acidity and additional hints of tart lychee and green apple that hang around on the medium-length finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine presents vibrant citrus-zest aromas and clean, fruity, almost-sweet flavors on a rich texture. It has more thickness and mouthfeel than many renditions of the grape, and feels low in acidity.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a fruity and fresh-tasting wine that's light to medium in body, very aromatic and has flavors like a fruit salad of apples, melons and peaches with a dash of lemon juice. All that fruitiness verges on sweetness, so dry-wine stalwarts beware.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Fresh-cut sweet grass, lime peel, green mango and underripe banana unfold on the nose of this solidly vibrant wine. The lightweight palate offers more of the same, with pleasant freshness and citrusy lift through the fresh finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: The nose displays a some what odd combination of candied orange, pineapple, asparagus and white flower. The palate is on the softer side, showing mildly concentrated flavors of peach, grapefruit, sweet grass and juicy lemon-lime acidity. The finish is astringent and lemony, leaving a fairly dull impression.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A solid sense of concentration and fresh floral and citrus flavors make this wine attractive. It has a lively but smooth texture, with good acidity backed by a soft, ripe and fruity core.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Shy aromas of cut grass and yellow-apple rinds show on the nose of this bottling. There is a sweet flash of ripe apple on the palate, but it's cut with a fresh lime juice kick.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: The aromas leap up, with notes of pink grapefruit, herb and kiwi. The flavors are full in feel, providing enjoyment.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A blend from grapes mainly across the Loire regions, this fruit, crisp and herbal wine is a pleasing homage to Sauvignon Blanc. It has all the citrus and gooseberry flavors as well as hints of tropical fruits. Drink this easy-going wine now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Rich and creamy in texture, this wine offers lasting freshness from start to finish. The palate is dotted in bold flavors of fig and green apple.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an especially aromatic wine in a particularly aromatic varietal category. Aromas like cut grass, grapefruit and snap peas rush out of the glass, leading to equally vivid veggie flavors and a nice, crisp texture.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: One of a range of white varietal wines from this large estate, this is rich, intense with spice and honey as well as the more classic Sauvignon Blanc herbal character. Its tangy texture and good acidity are already balanced. Drink from late 2018.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Blended with 13% Sémillon, the aromas are quite light, with notes of herb and citrus. The palate is medium bodied with a lingering finish. It's pleasant but comes off as quite lightly flavored.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A fresh scent of peony lies atop fruity notes of peach, pineapple and mango on the nose and mouth of this refreshing bottling. It's lightweight, smooth and easy to drink, with a touch of herbal, grassy interest on the back of the close.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: There is an abundance of tropical fruit, sweet pear and orange Popsicle aromas on the nose of this bottling. It dries up considerably on the sip, where bright and tight flavors of apple flesh are framed by fairly ripping acidity.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Tart, thick and woody, this white presents as full bodied and richly thick on the palate, before slowly unfurling brighter, crisper notes of lemon verbena.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A bright gold color and assertive oak aromas and flavors make this an unusual example of the variety, but it is appealing nonetheless. The aroma is quite buttery and the flavors resemble toasted almonds and grilled pears while the body is full and viscous.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Wet cement and cut grass make for a very fresh nose on this bottling. The palate is quite grippy in texture, offering lime pith, red pear and more damp sidewalk flavors.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Charming aromas of white peach nectar and Mandarin orange mingle with honeysuckle and honeydew. The slick palate feels fresh in zippy flavors of pink grapefruit and lime.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This Trinchero-made bottling shows lemon sorbet and Pink Lady apple on the clean and easy nose. It's easy and likable on the palate, offering lime sorbet with tangy lemon-rind flavors.

name: Giesen 2014 The August 1888 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine was vinified in a mixture of new 300-liter French oak barrels (50%) and stainless steel, with all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Appealing aromas of kiwi, whole pineapple and spice are followed by full-bodied, textured tropical-fruit flavors that lead to a warm finish. The concentration doesn't seem all there, but it is still quite enjoyable.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Time in barrel has softened this wine's intensity and broadened the feel. It boasts flavors of tropical fruit, spice and toast. This wine is well balanced between fruit and oak aging. Drink from 2019.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Flinty wet-stone aromas and subtle mineral and fig flavors mark this wine. It tastes clean and crisp, boasting a well-balanced, medium body.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Well-concentrated but still lively and fresh, this medium-bodied wine is just what many people look for. It smells grassy and grapefruity, tastes more ripe and full like honeydew melon, and has a pleasant richness on the palate.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Inviting in floral and lemon peel, this large-production white is textured and balanced in acidity, with a depth of tangerine and apple blossom.

name: Le Vigne di Zamò 2018 Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Apple blossoms, zesty lime sorbet and a flash of honey show on the nose of this bottling. There is just enough grip to the sip, where honey, lemon rind and yellow-apple flavors arise.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This is a nicely concentrated dry wine that blends fruity and savory aspects and has a good framework of crisp acidity and medium body. Aromas of apple skin and flavors of apple and cucumber are accented by light earthy touches.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Grassy, herbaceous aromas and tangy citrus flavors give a lively, extroverted personality to this medium-bodied wine. It has good crisp acidity that will make it refreshing on a warm day and especially good with simply prepared seafood and fresh-style cheeses.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This is a light-bodied, refreshing white, succulent and fruity in pear, apple and fuzzy peach. A thread of minerality plays out as wet stone and lemon peel.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Hailing from Boushey Vineyard, this wine was aged in a combination of large format oak and concrete. Aromas of gooseberry, kiwi, pink grapefruit, lemon rind, tropical fruit and herb lead to creamy-feeling fruit flavors supported by well-balanced acidity. A lingering finish caps it off. It's a richer styled interpretation of the variety.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Thick and relatively rich, with a nutty underbelly, this white offers peach and pineapple flavors up front before making room for brighter aspects of lemon peel and grapefruit.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: With 10% Sémillon, the white aged in neutral barrels, this is a rich, interwoven wine with spicy acidity and bold tropical flavors at its core. A dash or two of ginger and white pepper memorably finishes things out.

name: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Freshly cut lawn, wet cement, sour lime rinds, jalapeno and kelp combine for a very unique and compelling nose on this bottling. The roasted jalapeño note extends to the palate, where white pepper and crushed white-rock flavors make for a memorable sip.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Savory aromas and flavors like fennel bulb, snap pea and cucumber make this medium-bodied wine stand out. It has a good, crisp dash of acidity for balance and excellent fruit concentration that unfolds on the palate.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Very grassy aromas of lawn cuttings, juniper and pine oil show on the pungent nose of this zesty bottling. It's intriguing and lively on the sip, with green-fruit skins and more pine-needle tea flavors that keep one coming back for more on a hot day.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aged in French puncheons and concrete, this is an herbal, bright and buzzy white that's medium bodied and complex. Apricot dominates alongside hints of ginger and lemongrass.

name: Jermann 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Venezia Giulia)
description: From the producer's grand estate atop Spring Mountain, this is a memorable white, exuberant in apple, stone fruit and lemon peel, with a tease of guava. The acidity is integrated well and complementary to its contoured texture and hint of minerality.

name: Silverado 2018 Miller Ranch Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Fermented in an egg-shaped clay amphora, this ripe, full wine is a fascinating exercise in bringing old and modern together. Now mature, with a toasty character as well as opulent, ripe tropical fruit, the wine is rich and intense. Drink now.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine comes from Lonesome Springs Ranch Vineyard and was fermented and aged in stainless steel, with rocks from the vineyard included in the tanks. After starting out just a touch reduced, it opens to reveal aromas of kiwi, white grapefruit, mineral and herb. The palate is sleek in style with electric acidity. It's a racy acid white at a terrific price. Pair it with ceviche.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Broad aromas of pear, Pink Lady and Granny Smith apples show on the fresh nose of this wine. The flavors are fresh and vibrant, offering hints of crisp Anjou pear and wild lime.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Pale gold in color, ripe tropical and stone fruits, along with bruised apple and guava, white pepper and a smattering of snow peas can be coaxed from the glass after some swirling. The palate is medium bodied and oily in texture, but there is enough acid—along with lemon and herbal flavors—to keep things bright.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: There's a spicy, toasty quality to this wine, amidst waxy lemon, apple blossoms and the classic tomato leaf and grass characters. There's nice textural weight on the palate, with balanced acidity, shy fruit tones and a grassy finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Soft scents of baby's breath, lemongrass and minty herbs dance on the nose of this delicate white, with hints of lemon-lime citrus at the core. It's lightweight and direct in feel, with clean acidity and a slightly pithy citrus character on the close. Enjoy this dainty gem now.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe, almost confected, peach and tropical fruit notes lead the way in this wine, where grassy green characters take a big back seat. Nevertheless, it's bright and cheerful, with zippy acidity and an easygoing nature.

name: Kiaora 2019 Estate Grown Signature Series Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe tropical fruits, bruised apples and blossoms are encased in a distinctive canned green-bean aroma. The apple-tinged palate shows some textural weight, but it's not quite enough to balance the acidity which feels a tad lean and forced.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is light and easy to like, with soft notes of sweet grass, lemon peel and white melon rind on the nose and mouth. It shows light acidity on the palate, though the pithy finish is clean and bright. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The nose on this bottling is very light with subtle apple and pear aromas. The palate is somewhat flat, with touches of apple, grass and wet stones.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This young release wine offers aromas of char, roasted coffee bean, dried herbs and cherry. The palate is full-bodied around the edges, lighter in the middle, with firm tannins and coffee notes on the warm finish. The oak is very expressive at present, taking over the show. Additional time in the bottle is needed. Best after 2024.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: With a soft, moderate structure and light style, this is a well-integrated red that has balanced oak and tannin. Clove, cedar and forest notes season a core of plum and dark cherry, finished by a pleasing jolt of vanilla.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This robust and flavorful wine is scented with cigar box and dark chocolate. The palate adds in a black cherry flavor for a big and complex array of facets to savor. A full body and firm tannins give it good structure and its concentration is intense enough to deliver a lingering finish.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Gritty aromas of stalky red fruits are a touch horsey. A smacking hard palate with racy acidity is home to saucy flavors of plum and tomato. A flush and full finish maintains the same saucy flavor as before.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: A hint of mint adds interest to the fresh, ripe red-cherry and raspberry flavors of this medium-bodied wine. It has a touch of tannin to add grip to the texture and good acidity underneath.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Plum flavors take on a rich, soft and moderately structured core of full-bodied character in this vineyard-designate, the fruit baked and dotted in cinnamon. Earthy and herbal components complete the fleshy picture.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of red cherry, raspberry, mint and spice are followed by plentiful fruit flavors, with light vanilla accents. It's a pretty interpretation of the variety.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Spice, dark coffee grounds, dried flower, black licorice and candied cherry aromas lead to ripe, dense, full-bodied black fruit flavors backed by burly tannins. A warm finish caps it off. It comes off as quite ripe.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dark garnet to the eye, this wine has a nose of cherry and green bell pepper. Although tannins come on a bit strong, bright acidity offers balance. Flavors of black plum, cherry, pomegranate, coffee and chocolate wind down to a soft cranberry finish.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Candied black cherry, hickory smoke, vanilla and dried herbs show on the complex nose of this bottling. It's very plush, rounded and likable on the palate, where flavors of red cherry and caramel prove quite lengthy and medium weight.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of vanilla, graphite and wood spice are followed by black fruit flavors that bring a sense of fullness. The tannins bring some grip and dryness.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: Aromas of black plum, scorched earth and vanilla guide the nose on this Merlot. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, cedar and licorice alongside polished tannins.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of black cherry and apple peel lead to flavors of fruits of the wood, cassis, cranberry and vanilla bean. This wine is full on the palate, with a firm network of tannins and a surprisingly bright finish.

name: Roots Run Deep Winery 2014 The Scholar Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This Merlot has subdued aromas of toasted oak, mocha and ripe dark fruit. The dense palate offers roasted coffee bean, ripe black plum and caramel alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Initially on the shy side, this Merlot eventually offers subdued aromas of dark fruit, tobacco and cedar. The medium-bodied palate is a bit more expressive, evoking dried black cherry, graphite and licorice alongside smooth tannins.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Strong juniper and cedar aromas start off this full-bodied wine, with vivid flavors of cola, cherry juice and mint on the smooth palate. It's an unorthodox style, but lots of fun to taste and drink.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This Merlot has aromas of cedar, vanilla and black fruit. The round palate evokes blackberry jam, mocha and clove alongside polished tannins.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely with organically farmed Merlot, this shows aromas of ripe plum, cedar and a whiff of vanilla. The robust palate doles out blackberry jam, tobacco and clove while round tannins provide soft support.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This medium-bodied wine tastes ultrafresh and fruity, feels rich and lightly tannic and has enough underlying concentration to add depth. Perfect for casual occasions.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This ruby-red colored wine offers a bouquet of blueberry and clove. Flavors of black currant, dark plums, chocolate and orange zest are set in a web of tannins that might feel overpowering were it not for the wine's bold acidity. There is a touch of mint on the fruit-filled finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This easygoing honest-tasting dry wine has simple straightforward fruit flavors, a good restrained texture and relatively light body so it's tempting to pour another glass. Expect ripe but not sweet plum and grape flavors.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This full-bodied Merlot is blended with 7% Petit Verdot and 6% Teroldego. It tastes ripe and generous, but also grippy on the palate. Moderate tannins and good acidity give it some heft, while a deep black-cherry flavor and mild oak spice add interest.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This Merlot offers aromas of dark berry, espresso, toasted oak and a whiff of bell pepper. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, vanilla and coconut alongside assertive tannins.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Most of the fruit for this wine comes from Pepper Bridge, Sheridan and StoneTree vineyards, along with a pinch from Kiona. Aromas of exotic spice, cedar box, licorice and jammy red fruit are followed by ripe, rich fruit flavors. It's high on the hedonism scale, with the warmth of the vintage on full display.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This organically farmed Merlot offers aromas of toasted oak, espresso and dried black fruit. The concentrated palate offers blackberry extract, mocha and star anise alongside firm tannins.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: A fine Merlot from a state rarely recognized for its versions of the grape, this ripe and rich wine was sourced from a vineyard in the northeast corner. Aged 22 months in 50% new oak barrels, it's awash in flavors of mocha and cherry, with tongue-scraping astringency as the tannins fade away. Drink 2020–2026.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This wine has aromas of blackberry and thyme. Flavors of black cherry, raspberry, vanilla and aniseed are supported by a backdrop of smooth tannins that dry the palate ever so slightly, culminating in a smooth, lengthy finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This wine brings out the wonderful natural herb, olive and tobacco side of Merlot, along with plenty of deep black fruits, too. It has a mouthfilling texture supported by moderate tannins, a touch of new oak that's not overwhelming and a lingering fruit and spice finish.

name: Pine & Post 2004 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This Merlot has aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and vanilla. The concentrated palate presents blackberry jam, star anise and a hint of mocha alongside chewy tannins.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling is shy at first, offering focused aromas of toasted wood, dark blackberry and caramel. A firm structure frames the palate, where juicy blackberry fruit is lifted by thyme and dried purple-flower flavors.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Big and bold, this wine has heady aromas of cedar, toasted oak and cinnamon, followed by ripe and focused black-cherry flavors that have good depth. It is firmly tannic in a good way, has a velvety mouthfeel and sense of density and structure that will help it age. Best through 2023.

name: Continuum 2014 Sage Mountain Vineyard Proprietary Red (Oakville)
description: Cedar, clove, black currant, leather and Mediterranean herb aromas form the nose on this 100% Merlot. Smooth and enveloping, the full-bodied palate doles out mature black cherry, licorice, espresso and grilled herb framed in polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2027.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Herbal and brimming in cedar, this is a light-bodied, lightly textured wine with 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in. Simple red fruit and coffee combine to offer flavor.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Aromas of plum, baking spice and sugared currant are followed by quite lightly styled fruit flavors. The concentration isn't all there.

name: Château les Aubastons 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Smoky oak and dull tannins support baked black fruit and tobacco in this soft, approachable and straightforward red wine.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Light in color and showing some bricking, with aromas offering notes of candied cherry and cola. Medium-bodied but elegant fruit flavors follow. Drink now.

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Well-balanced and nicely concentrated, this full-bodied wine fills its firm frame with a core of rich black cherry and shades of roast beef and pepper. It shows firm tannins and good acidity to counter the deep fruit notes.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: A tough, gritty nose runs high with pyrazines and stalky berry aromas. Following the nose, this is tight and tough, with cool-climate acidity and raw tannins. Spicy, fiery berry and green-herb flavors finish dry and peppery, with scraping residual tannins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a soft, simple red wine, trafficking in rich layers of chocolate and coffee. The tannins are persistent and firm.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Intriguing aromas of plum, high-toned herb and baking spice are followed by soft, generous fruit flavors. The concentration at times seems a little light, especially through the middle, but what's there is nice.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This wine is 100% varietal, with all of the fruit coming from Burgess Vineyard. The aromas bring unusual, not entirely harmonious notes of green pepper, savory herb, dark cherry and Robitussin. Soft fruit flavors follow, needing more structure to stand them up. It doesn't all mesh.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Carneros)
description: Aromas of coconut and mature black plum lead the nose on this Merlot. The evolved palate offers prune, cocoa and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Rich and fruity, this wine is generous and dark. Bold tannins and rich concentration are all part of a dense, superripe wine that just misses being over the top.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Made entirely with organically farmed Merlot, this offers subdued aromas of espresso and vanilla. The dense palate shows prune, clove and coconut alongside assertive tannins.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This Merlot opens has subdued aromas of cedar, tobacco and a whiff of black-skinned fruit. The dense palate evokes prune, toasted oak and dried sage alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins.

name: Monteverro 2013 Red (Toscana)
description: Here's a Merlot that opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, bay leaf and baking spice. The chewy, medium-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and mocha alongside velvety tannins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Wood smoke and cooked berry aromas yield to bold charred blackberry flavors encased in nicely grippy tannins and lifted by acidity. The wine is medium to full bodied, and quite bold in style.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: All the fruit for this wine comes from Gamache Vineyard. Soil, ground cherry, tangerine and herb aromas intrigue. The cranberry flavors are backed by tannins that give a light squeeze.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: Bright ruby red in the glass, this Romanian Merlot has aromas of pomegranate, roasted fennel bulb, blackberry and black cherry. In the mouth there are flavors of cherry, raspberry, cranberry, orange zest and white chocolate. The tannins are silky, and the finish is soft with just the right touch of spice.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: High-toned aromas of spiced currant and red plum are underpinned by baking spice and sawdust on the nose. This is taut and drawing in the palate, with a sauced red-berry flavor pervading throughout. A slick of acidity gives levity on the midpalate, while the close brings a firm tannic bite.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Oaky swaths of cocoa and coffee cover a core of dark plum sauce and cherry on the nose. There's a firm feel to the structured palate, with a dense mix of dark fruit lightened by shots of tart cranberry, and a firm hug of tannins keeping everything in check.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Coming from the Entre-deux-Mers region, this wine has a light touch as well as attractive ripe berry fruits. It is lightly spicy, underlining the ripe fruitiness while also leaving room for acidity. The wine will age well and be ready from 2021.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Attractive flavor complexity ups the interest level in this medium-bodied, smooth and supple wine. Plum and blackberry blend with black olive and tobacco on the palate while melted tannins coat the tongue.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Smooth and easy to sip, this full-bodied wine has a silky mouthfeel that coddles bright raspberry and plump blackberry flavors in soft and supple tannins and resolved acidity. It's big but well mannered.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This intense, rich Merlot-based wine is full of ripe tannins, with layers of black fruits balanced by acidity. The tannins show that the wine is still young and needs to round out. Drink from 2022.

name: Tapiz 2013 Las Notas de Jean Claude Red (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of spiced currant and plum blend with a hint of herbs on the nose. There's a silken feel to the palate, with red-plum and cherry flavors bolstered by a firm grip of tannins.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This wine has impressive black-cherry, cocoa-powder and leather aromas, a concentrated palate of blackberries and charcuterie steeped in supple tannins for a grippy but yielding texture. It's well balanced, food friendly and offers great value.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This five-acre vineyard has produced a perfumed wine with mint aromas as well as big, black-fruit flavors. It is dense, jammy and full, with spice and intense richness. Drink this wine from 2023.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The finest Merlot yet from Del Rio, this is a solid effort that takes a balanced and detailed approach to the oft-maligned grape. Tobacco, vanilla and licorice streaks are subtle enough not to overmatch the cherry and red plum fruit. It finished dark and a bit grainy, with strong flavors of espresso.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Owned by the Dignac family, this estate is capable of producing dense and solidly rich wines. This pure Merlot bottling has the power and ripeness of the vintage, giving a dynamic character to the black fruits and acidity. Drink this wine from 2022.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Gamy aromas of wild berry and animal are funky and never really settle. Generally speaking, this feels balanced, with green herb, savory oak and cured meat flavors that finish with forced oak and related clove notes.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Cheesy oak aromas combined with herbal, minty berry scents lead to a grabby palate with drying tannins. Flavors of red plum, rhubarb and barbecue sauce finish with notes of red currant and chalk.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Medicinal plum aromas are fiery at first, then more suggestive of latex and Band-Aid. This average Merlot feels full and grainy, with a resiny texture. Plum and berry flavors come with chocolaty notes prior to a nonspecific finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Value shoppers should consider this competent Merlot with cassis, plum and vanilla aromas. On the palate, this is screechy and tight, with hard acidity and firm tannins. Short plum and berry flavors finish with a light dose of spice and burn.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of cocoa powder, charred meat and smoke meld with black currant, blackberry and black cherry, all wrapped in ground pepper on the nose. Tangy high-toned acid and stiff tannins carry sharp red-cherry and pomegranate flavors, with fallen leaves and wood-smoke tones. The finish is spicy ending on black cherry.

name: Paraduxx 2016 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of char, vanilla, dried raspberry, dried red apple and fruit leather are followed by somewhat lighter styled fruit and earth flavors, with the tannins showing a bit of grit. Cranberry notes linger on the finish. It seems quite dried out.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This Merlot opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, caramel and green peppercorn. The concentrated palate delivers dried black cherry, mocha and clove alongside chewy tannins.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: The aromas offer notes of cedar, spice box and barrel toast, with the oak out front. Lighter styled raspberry flavors follow, with toasty barrel notes on the finish. The oak seems intrusive.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Sanguine in red and black currant, this is an expansive, succulent and broadly fleshy red wine, full bodied but still elegant. Grippy tannins provide additional power as elements of cedar and clove season the fruit and oak.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft, juicy and layered wine that offers approachability in its integration of oak and tannin. Cherry, plum and cassis flavors give it a brightness that persists long on the finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A powerful, juicy red-fruit-flavored wine, this is dense and concentrated. The tannins are still young and right up front, competing with the black-currant fruits. Wait to drink this rich wine until 2021.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Fermented and aged in wood, this wine is full of spiciness as well as solid, dark fruits. At this stage, the tannins are dominant with a sense of power. However, the wine is also rich with dark plums and blackberries, cut with acidity. It needs to age further, so drink from 2022.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is well-made varietal wine, blended with 24% Cabernet Sauvignon. Chocolate, blackberry and plum highlight a soft, approachable palate of fruit dusted in lasting hints of clove and cinnamon.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of raspberry, cocoa and spice. Ripe, well-balanced fruit flavors follow. It's a spot-on example of the variety that impresses start to finish.

name: Darioush 2012 Darius II Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cedar, black-skinned berry, leather and peppercorn aromas form the nose. The brawny palate offers prune, dried black cherry and licorice alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Fine-grained tannins provide polished support.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Lush and expansive on the palate, this is a lovely version of the variety, full bodied yet classic in style. Coffee, plum and baking spice combine for a complex and layered experience of seamless acidity and tension on the palate.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Enticing aromas of underbrush, spiced plum, fragrant blue flower, cedar and a whiff of incense come to the forefront on this fragrant Merlot. It's taut, elegant and structured, delivering dried black cherry, clove, licorice and a hint of sandalwood framed in fine-grained tannins. It has surprising freshness for the hot dry vintage. Drink 2020–2027.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The top wine from this estate, this is pure Merlot, a ripe wine with juicy black fruits and smoky spice from the wood aging. Age the wine to let the rich tannins calm down and integrate into the broad fruitiness. Drink from 2022.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: This is the top wine from this Fronsac estate. Aged in wood, it shows both fruit and wood tannins that give spice and structure to the flavors. Generous, juicy Merlot is lifted by the fresh acidity at the end. Drink from 2022.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Merlot opens with aromas of black plum, roasted coffee bean, cedar and spice. The firm palate delivers flavors of blackberry jam, licorice, clove and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2025.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This wine offers intensity and concentration. If it is one-dimensional it also has layers of acidity, tannins and juicy freshness that are immediately delectable. Drink this wine from 2023.

name: AVA Grace 2016 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)
description: Murky, mulchy aromas are leafy and damp, with an odd peanut-like note. A linear palate is low on body and high on acidity, while this Merlot tastes stalky and less than ripe, with a green note to the finish.

name: AVA Grace 2016 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)
description: Roasted, earthy berry aromas come with notes of latex and Band-Aid. This Merlot feels saucy and soupy, without much structure. Herbal plum and raspberry flavors finish with lighter but similar flavors.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: A Merlot from grapes grown across the Atlantic coast vineyards, this wine is soft, lightly textured and made to be drunk young. Juicy black fruits and spice make it easy and approachable.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of gun smoke, pencil eraser, vanilla, plum and wood spice lead to plump fruit and barrel flavors with a lightly gritty feel.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: A savory nose of herbs and muted spice starts off this lithe Merlot. The palate is pert and persistent in tart plum and cherry flavors, with a sheen of grainy tannins giving support and pushing through the finish.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Carneros)
description: This wine is 100% varietal, coming from Phinny Hill and Red Willow vineyards. Reticent red apple skin, cherry and strawberry aromas are followed by a palate that paints around the edges. Coffee notes linger on the finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Cedar and sawdust aromas lead to earthy, meaty, oaky flavors in this moderately built, well-aged and woody wine. It's a good choice when you're on a budget and enjoy wines that aren't overly fruity.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Fresh herb and green pepper aromas are at the fore, along with orange twist, raspberry and a tree bark note. Green pepper and blue and black fruit flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a slightly tacky feel. It doesn't seem to have fully ripened, with the variety hard to find.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Plum, cranberry and cherry pie aromas are followed by a woody-seeming palate that finishes short. The oak influence is intense.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of spice, cherry and smoke are followed by ripe black fruit flavors. It's straight down the fairway.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Dark cranberry, dank herbs and a touch of game show on the nose of this bottling. The palate leads into dark boysenberry with leathery aspects throughout.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of chocolate, dried cherry and spice are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors. Dry, slightly scratchy seeming tannins back it up. The fruit seems a bit fatigued.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Pitted dark cherry and vanilla aromas lead to light but creamy feeling fruit and barrel flavors. The oak plays a large part in the show, but it largely works.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of red apple skin, baking chocolate, spice, vanilla and cherry are followed by a fresh-seeming palate that brings cranberry-like acidity. The tannins show grip.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Toasty aromas of roasted coffee bean, blackberry and asphalt show on the nose of this bottling. There is a tangy Old World character to the palate, which is more leathery than fruit-driven.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Lighter in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of cranberry and strawberry with a slight herbal tinge. Oregano and garden herbs show alongside easy-to-like raspberry fruit on the palate.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Restrained aromas of boysenberry and Concord grape are dusted with roasting herbs and seasoning salts on the nose of this reserve bottling. The palate is loaded with fresh fruit that is young and tannic and still needs a bit of time, and finishes on a caramel kick.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Vibrant cherry candy defines the almost sweet smelling nose, with additional notes of fresh strawberry, fresh cherry, white pepper and saline. Delightful and concentrated, flavors of bright strawberry, red cherry and gala apple meld with dried herbs and pink peppercorns. Juicy acidity is balanced by firm crushed velvet tannin on the palate. The fruit remains energetic through the finish slowly extinguished by the tannic structure.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Faint aromas of dried herb, cigar leaf, mocha and raspberry are followed by light, tart cranberry flavors backed by firm, dry, somewhat gritty tannins framed by a blast of impressive acidity. It's very tannic on its own but should fit in well at the dinner table. Pair it with pork chops with a cherry compote. It has an extremely long life in front of it. Give it a multiday extended decant if drinking before 2025.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Mellow on the nose at first, this bottling eventually opens to show strong cherry fruits along with a background of oak. Black-cherry flavors show on the sip, which is very elegant in a silky structure although without many prominent aspects, all very integrated.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Lighter in the glass, this extended maceration bottling by Scott Sampler shows bright red cherries and notes of chipped cedar on the nose. The woody aspect continues to the palate, where cigar-box flavors mix with exotic berries, a gravelly texture and herbal touches.

name: AVA Grace 2016 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)
description: Barrel spice, sawdust, green pepper and game aromas are followed by sweet, dried out seeming fruit flavors.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Red-cherry compote and crumbled sage aromas show on the nose of this reserve bottling. There are strong herbal touches to the palate, from bay leaf to woody aspects of cedar and pine, set against a sour cherry and pomegranate backdrop, with acidity that sings into the finish.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: This is blended with 19% Cabernet Sauvignon and made in large numbers, aged in both French and American oak. Sinewy and sanguine, it has crisp red fruit and is lightly herbal, with tightly focused tannins and an approachable balance of acidity.

name: St. Francis 2016 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: This is a bitter wine, with harsh and stiff green flavors. The tannins override the black fruits.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of cranberry, raspberry jam and red currant are followed by ripe fruit flavors surrounded by slightly dry tannins. There's no doubt it's a (very) warm vintage wine.

name: Trujillo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are brooding, with notes of dark raspberry, medicine, coffee, graphite, cola, herb and cocoa powder. Ripe, dense, slightly dried out seeming fruit flavors follow. Firm tannins back it all up. It all seems a bit desiccated

name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Viognier (Virginia)
description: Plush red fruit, herb and eucalyptus aromas lead to scrumptious fruit flavors. It possesses a compelling sense of balance—a superb value that brings a sense of purity not always seen at this price.
