name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is 100% varietal and quite good—a balanced take that's softly approachable and well priced. Pencil shavings, chocolate, cedar and bright cherry, cranberry and currant combine with ease, cradled in supportive American oak.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are pleasing, with notes of plum, baking spice, vanilla and herb. Soft, plump but light fruit flavors follow, displaying a sense of elegance and appeal. The barrel influence plays a big part in the show but plays it well.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Thick and leathery in black fruit, this perennial classic from the region has a depth of flavor and texture that is structured and full of grace. Blended with 9% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Malbec, it shows toasty oak, clove and integrated tannins that soften in the glass.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Packaged with a velvety suede label, the wine is equally smooth, rich and rounded, with thick baked plum and cherry flavors. Secondary highlights include clove, cedar and pencil, seasonings that help to temper and moderate the fruit.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Blended with Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, this Merlot is a tannic and powerful wine. It offers earthy flavors of leather and oak around a rich and decadent core of dark plum.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a single vineyard in Carneros, this is tart and tangy, with a tightness of structured tannins and considerable oak. The fruit is black and seasoned in leather, tobacco and black pepper.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This tastes of black cherry fruit wrapped in dried leaves, tobacco and a sprinkling of Italian herbs. The tannins are chewy and substantial, but ripe and rich, in keeping with the overall flavor profile. The length and detail through the finish are impressive, as are all of the winery's 2014 Merlots.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Significantly riper than the 2013, this is dense with flavors of black olive, black fruits, dark chocolate and cherry tobacco. The tannins seem huge for Merlot, as is the case with all of the winery's 2014s, but given the region's standard flavor profile, these tannins are fully ripened and well matched to the 100% new French oak, contributing to lingering, trailing accents of espresso and smoke. Only wild yeasts were used.

name: Kenzo Estate 2016 Rindo Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine, earthy and meaty, this wine shows hints of dried herb, petrol and ash between dark brooding hits of plum and black cherry. Made mostly from Merlot, it has 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc blended in, adding to its soft, layered finish hinting of mocha and sage.

name: Gainey 2016 Patrick's Vineyard Selection Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sourced from the Black Sage Bench, this is an aromatic, sexy mix of dried roses, anise, brambly berries, savory herbs and cassis. A heady wine with immense power, it was 100% fermented with wild yeasts. Smoky and smooth, the tannins have a pleasantly charred character and tongue-drying flavors of espresso grounds.

name: Denner 2016 Mother Of Exiles Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This cuvée is a blend of sites from Osoyoos East and the Black Sage Benches. It's strikingly rich, deeply fruited, dark and toasty. Notes of cherry, cassis, smoke and roasted coffee remain in excellent balance, as the ripe, dense and grainy tannins carry the finish.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Stalky base aromas are topped with creamy oak and vanilla. A sticky, grabby palate doesn't flow with ease, while this seems to have been force-fed some sketchy oak that has left the wine tasting candied.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Aromas of anise, cherry liquor, red apple and pencil eraser lead to light fruit flavors. Slightly gritty tannins back it up.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Vibrant aromas of green herbs, orange oil, plum, smoke and Vicks VapoRub lead to lightly styled fruit flavors. It's an unusual offering of the variety.

name: Director's Cut 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a thick tannic red, with huge concentration and coating tannins. It tastes leathery and earthy without much to offer in the way of fruit.

name: Château les Aubastons 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: This has burly amounts of oak and dry tannins, the ripeness generous in blackberry jam with herbal touches that don't fully integrate.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Saucy aromas of tomato, green herbs, plum and asphalt form a rough opening, while this Merlot feels dense and chewy. Earthy, herbal plum and coffee flavors finish full, with oak and lasting herbal notes.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Mesquite smoke, tire rubber, plum and currant aromas lead to off-dry fruit flavors that go down easy.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Oakiness pervades this medium-bodied one-note wine from the spice-rack aromas to oaky mapley flavors and slightly drying tannins.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Aromas of blackberry, cherry, cotton candy and vanilla are common and don't offend. A screechy, high-acid palate yields tart black plum and cranberry flavors, while this is sappy and edgy on an herbal tasting finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Aromas of raspberry, blue fruit, green pepper, orange peel and a whiff of smoke lead to confectionary fruit flavors. Grippy tannins back it up. It doesn't all seem to have fully ripened.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a slightly sweet, smoky and seemingly manipulated wine, with a pronounced woodiness to the oak and an herbal quality that gives it limited dimension.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This is thick meaty red wine that takes on a baked plum character accented in big tannin and oak.

name: Watermill 2017 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This wine is concentrated and viscous, with an herbal imprint and strong notes of oak and cedar. The fruit is tangy and sour in red currant, cherry and a hint of cinnamon.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Toasty oak gives this a minty, chocolaty nose. Concentrated and a bit sappy in feel, this Merlot tastes of black plum and chocolate along with creamy oak. Juicy acidity on the finish helps cut through the oak and sappiness.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Wood spice, tire rubber, green wood and cherry aromas stand out on the nose. Rich fruit and plentiful barrel flavors intertwine on the palate, with the latter taking over. Coffee notes linger on the finish. The style gets in front of the fruit.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Cabernet Franc, this is an earthy red. Tart acidity and thick tannins provide the frame for full-bodied flavors of baked cherry and plum.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This wine is soft, fruity and easy to sip. Grapey aromas and ripe straightforward blackberry flavors fill in the middle, and there is little noticeable tannin or acidity.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: This is a thick, concentrated and robustly tannic red wine, with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Lagrein. It's juicy in black cherry and dark chocolate, with savory additions of cedar, pencil shavings and tobacco.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of cassis and raisin bread prepare the palate for flavors of raspberry, strawberry, pomegranate and rose petal. This wine is bright in the mouth, with soft tannins and a touch of orange zest on the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a well-behaved, extremely affordable, firm-textured wine that has moderate oak and fruit flavors in good balance and a nip of tannin to help give it some grip.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of blackberry, clove and espresso prepare the palate for flavors of cherry, pomegranate, dark chocolate and lemon zest. This wine is surprisingly bright on entry. After a few seconds, engaging tannins fill the mouth and power through the long-lasting finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of barrel spice, vanilla, black cherry, dried tobacco and savory herbs are followed by light, elegant, well-balanced fruit flavors. The concentration seems light, but what's there is spot-on, though the variety is a bit hard to find.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This dark ruby-colored wine offers aromas of cassis, blackberry and brambles. There is a nice balance of slightly gritty tannins and bold fruit, with flavors of raspberry, cherry, anise and orange zest. The finish is noted for a lingering sense of brightness on the palate.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: With a spicy entry of clove and cinnamon, this wine is soft and supple on the palate—a light-bodied burst of cherry and blueberry that overdelivers on its price point.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Fresh and savory herbs, roasted coffee bean, bittersweet chocolate, cherry licorice and dark fruit aromas are out front. The plush palate is packed in the middle, lighter along the edges.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of orange peel, dried tobacco, vanilla, toast and dark fruit. Broad, creamy-feeling fruit and barrel flavors follow. Coffee and plum notes linger on the finish. It's an unusual interpretation of the variety.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Blended with 5% Petite Sirah, this is a thick and meaty red wine, sanguine in iron and red currant. It has a robust ripeness and concentration with pleasing accents of dried herb and cedar.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine has a savory side to complement its good blackberry flavors. The aromas of black olive and bell pepper are typical for the grape variety when grown in cooler areas and they don't overwhelm the nice fruit impressions on the palate.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is an intensely powerful, ripe and robust wine, richly layered in black-cherry and chocolate flavors. Secondary characteristics of clove, tobacco and dried herb nip at the full-bodied middle as toasted oak takes the final bow.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has aromas of dark-skinned fruit, toasted oak and vanilla. The round, ripe palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and star anise alongside smooth tannins.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: Aromas of cedar, vanilla and black-skinned fruit come together on this 100% Merlot. The forward palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and clove alongside pliant tannins.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas are high register, with notes of dried herbs, coffee and black cherry. Luscious fruit and barrel flavors follow, with the tannins giving a squeeze that only Washington Merlot could. The barrel influence gets a bit in the way, but there are still good things going on.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine has aromas of black cherry and roasted red pepper. There is a nice interplay of subtle tannins and fruit brightness, with flavors of cherry pie, black currant, butterscotch and sage. There is a soft hint of smoke on the finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: From several sites within the appellation, the wine includes 6% Cabernet Sauvignon from the producer's Oak Knoll District estate. This is a well-made red, soft in plum and integrated in oak. It expands on the midpalate to add a richness of black cherry and vanilla that's lush and lengthy.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Blended with 12% Cabernet Franc, this is a nicely made wine, soft and silky with a lasting thread of spicy clove and cinnamon. Forest-floor earthiness complements dark fruit and supple tannins, with a supportive embrace of moderate oak.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: The ripe raspberry, plum, spice and herb aromas show nuance. Plump, well-balanced, slightly candied fruit flavors follow. It's a pleasing warm vintage, warm appellation example of the variety.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: There is 10% Malbec, 8% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot in this wine, which represents a refined and complex expression of the grape from a mountain site. Smoky oak meets black cherry, leather, dark chocolate and a touch of dried herb—flavors that accent a balance of tannin and structure.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Deep garnet in the glass, this wine features aromas of blackberry, cassis and oregano. It fills the mouth with flavors of raspberry, Delicious apple, strawberry and cocoa that are set into a web of firm tannins. The finish has a pleasing burst of espresso bean flavor.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas bring appeal, with notes of roasted coffee bean, dark chocolate, toast, herbs, cassis, vanilla and flower, showing pleasing nuance. The palate brings a sense of elegance to the fruit and barrel flavors, along with a zing of acidity. Considerably more restrained and elegant than recent warm vintages, it shows lovely balance to the fruit and barrel flavors.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Subtle wood spices and ripe luscious fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine a stand out. It's packed with opulent black-cherry notes that follow baking-spice aromas, and feels smooth in texture, wrapping soft tannins around all the generous flavors.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: High-register aromas of baking spices, dried herbs, dried leaf and toast lead to deft, plump dark fruit flavors with ample barrel notes to go along with them. It shows a sense of refinement and elegance that heightens the appeal. There's plenty of richness as well, with fruit and barrel playing equal parts.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This is 100% varietal and a good showcase for the grape. Thick rounded richness and dense flavors of cherry and vanilla are complemented by sage, cedar and dried herb.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine has a nose of dark plums with a touch of green pepper. A network of velvety tannins provides a background for flavors of black cherry, blackberry, toffee, smoked meat and green pepper. The finish is slightly spicy.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: From the Jaeger Ranch in the heart of the appellation, this is a spicy, lengthy and complex red, entirely varietal and made in small amounts. Coconut, vanilla and clove accent soft plum and blackberry, with the tannins well integrated and the wine full of tension and structure.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Inky garnet in the glass, this wine features a bouquet of pomegranate, violet and smoke. It offers a palate-pleasing mix of fruit, savory and spice flavors, in particular cassis, dark plums, clove, anise, sage and smoked meat. Prominent tannins slowly dissolve into a clove-tinged finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Frankly oaky, this swaggering wine shows alluring cedar, nutmeg and vanilla aromas followed by good ripe fruit flavors and more baking-spice nuances. The mouthfeel is broad and rich due to a full body and lots of fine-grained tannins.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This savory Merlot opens with aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, nutmeg and a whiff of green peppercorn. The concentrated, full-bodied palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2020.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Brawny and brooding in black and red berry, this is a well-integrated, cohesive and harmonious wine, aged 18 months in French oak. The tannins are soft and supple and the acidity high toned, allowing room for herbal elements to shine within the fruit.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This is a great varietal wine, with excellent quality particularly for the price. The red is well integrated, with underlying power and overall grace. Smoky black cherry, cassis and currant are accented by orange peel and high-toned acidity, finishing soft and supple in tannin.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Violet perfume opens this memorable wine that is sourced from the Jaeger Ranch. Soft, supple, fleshy and lush, it's a seamless and full-bodied offering. Flavors of leather, vanilla and black cherry complement each other, with a hint of toasted oak that lingers on the finish.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: This Merlot feels a little synthetic and bitter. Though it leads with primary red fruits like cherries and strawberries, along with potpourri and chocolatey oak-derived notes, the palate is flabby and on the sour side. Spiced wood nuances add structure and the finish is herbal.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: This Clare Valley Merlot starts somewhat reductively, the red and black berries and vanillin oak notes all a little masked. The palate feels a bit watery but is sweet fruited with gentle granular tannins. A synthetic quality creeps in, lingering to the finish, which feels a little bitter.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a sweet nose of chocolate and vanilla oak and this richness continues on the palate. Basically built and structured, it has a simple approachability.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: A light nose of baked cherry and earthy flowers carries to the rounded, soft palate. A solid framing of bright acidity and polished tannins offer support.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This straightforward but balanced wine offers primary fruit aromas like plums and red berries, with a touch of peppery spice. Soft tannins on the palate support the plummy herb-flecked fruit.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Very extracted and rich on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of cherry syrup and mint. The palate is also somewhat syrup-like with dusty red-cherry, fennel-bulb and tarragon flavors.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Soft, velvety and lush, this full-bodied wine offers high-toned red fruit, dusty spice and robust oak. Sourced from both the Hudson and Hyde vineyards, it has vibrancy through the finish.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Candied Bing cherry syrup and other focused red fruits meet with a touch of mint on the nose of this bottling from south of Paso Robles. That cherry concentration meets with menthol and cough-drop flavors on the palate, which is framed by just enough tannins.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: Aromas of cherry, soil, dried herbs, dried tobacco, dark raspberry and earth are followed by full-feeling fruit flavors surrounded by enough tannic structure to lay down well in the cellar. Best after 2024.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is 100% varietal and offers classic varietal elements of cedar, sage and dried herb. The quiet fruit is a mix of red currant and plum, with a cool-climate elegance of integrated tannin.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: The aromas offer notes of reduction, asphalt, black fruit and spice. Intensely rich, ripe, focused fruit flavors follow, backed by burly tannins. A high octane finish caps it off. It's a full throttle offering of the variety that needs some time in the cellar to stretch its legs. If the reduction clears it might move up.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Black cherry, roasted red berry, light soil and judicious oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Firm tannins and decent acidity frame the palate's familiar roasted cherry and cedar flavors.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Tones of chalk and chocolate-covered cherry carry this wine, which has 22% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in. Sultry and soft, it flirts with flavors of earthy clove and tobacco on the palate, finishing full yet balanced.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Reductive in tar, oak and thick concentrated flavor, this estate wine is spicy and darkly brooding in black cherry and plum. Sage and cedar nip around the edges of fruit and powerful ripeness.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas are subdued, with notes of baking spice, currant, smoke and graphite. Ripe, full-bodied fruit flavors follow, painting around the edges, with firm tannins providing the scaffolding.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This blends in 8% Syrah, which adds a brooding element of additional power and color to the wine. Cinnamon, black cherry and currant play around integrated oak, tannin and substantial ripeness, finishing in tobacco, black pepper and meat.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sinewy in leather and dusty tannin, this is a well-integrated, full-bodied and earthy wine with forceful flavors of baked plum and dark cherry. It broods with secondary elements of sage, clove and tobacco.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Blended with 16% Cabernet Sauvignon, the estate steep and low yielding, this wine offers sinewy leather, tobacco and dried herb, its texture soft and supple. The fruit is elusive, a mix of plum and blueberry with balanced richness.

name: Ashbrook Estate 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Much of this wine is sourced from Stagecoach Vineyard and is 100% varietal. Thick and oaky in sage and dusty, concentrated brush, it is full bodied and classically styled. Featuring cocoa powder, cedar, pencil and red currant, it has power and grace in equal measure.

name: Byron Blatty 2016 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Black raspberry, dried and fresh herb and black currant aromas are at the fore. Ripe, lush fruit flavors follow, supported by firm, lightly grainy tannins. It has a nice yum factor. Best after 2023.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Older vine fruit from Conner Lee and Dionysus vineyards make up the heart of this wine, blended with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Malbec, which express themselves. Lively aromas of green pepper, dark raspberry, herb, black currant, spice and plum lead to supremely rich, ripe, full-bodied, creamy-feeling dark fruit flavors.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Pleasing aromas of dried herbs, bittersweet chocolate, dark coffee, fresh herbs and cherry lead to lush, full-bodied red fruit and green herb flavors, accented by barrel notes and backed by velvety tannins. Though it drinks green for a varietal Merlot, it brings undeniable appeal.

name: Tapiz 2013 Las Notas de Jean Claude Red (Mendoza)
description: Estate-grown and blended with 4% Cabernet Sauvignon from a site near Yountville, this wine offers a mix of velvety, plush texture, toasted oak and bold blueberry and strawberry flavor. Full bodied and richly round, it has powerful tannin and a lasting taste of coffee that gives it a savory finish.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A lively, cranberry-colored wine, this is scented with spice and filled with bright blue fruit flavors. There's a pleasing dusty character around the ripe tannins, which add highlights of lead pencil, dark chocolate and cinnamon.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: One of several single-parcel wines from this producer, this 100% old-vine Merlot is dense and ripe. Red-berry flavors are warm, on the verge of becoming smooth while still having structure. Good acidity at the end will allow it to age further, even though it is ready to drink now.

name: Cricket Hill 2014 Midnight Diamond Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: A pronounced pencil-shaving aroma is accompanied by cedar and cocoa powder. Bitter cocoa powder and oak lead milder hints of plum and vanilla to the bitter, charred finish.

name: Skagit 2015 Four Lakes Vineyard Merlot (Lake Chelan)
description: An unusual nose combines black raspberry, cabbage, barnyard and vanilla with a hint of licorice. The palate is a bit diluted at first with bright crunchy cranberry and pomegranate popping toward the end before quickly evaporating leaving behind the memory of a tang, while tannins are dusty but disconnected. This is a bizarre wine that has a slow start and a quick finish that is abrupt and vanishing.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Vibrant aromas of braised green pepper, plum, ashtray and red cherry are followed by off-dry-drinking fruit flavors. It would be green for a Cabernet Franc, but the sugar helps it out.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Muted aromas of cranberry and barnyard are joined by milk chocolate candy bar. Tannins are flat on the palate, with bland acidity doing nothing to support flavors of cranberry, plum and black currant. A surprising lick of tartness introduces the finish and then falls away leaving bell pepper and flat, dull oak flavors.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Hailing from Transylvania, this Romanian Merlot is garnet colored in the glass with aromas of cherry and plum and flavors of red raspberry and red currant. It has a juicy, ripe red fruit finish.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Sanguine with fruity flavors of currant and cassis, this is a hearty, full-bodied and substantially ripe red, lush on the palate with a succulent texture. It has aspects of forest sage, dusty rock, cocoa powder that highlight mountain tannin structure and bold oak.

name: Cricket Hill 2014 Midnight Diamond Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: This wine is tart, green and astringent. It is driven by racy red fruit and carries a bitter finish.

name: Château Plaizirs 2016 Cuvée Prestige  (Côtes de Bourg)
description: The aromas pop, with notes of mesquite smoke, red cherry, tire rubber and herbs. Quite smoky tasting flavors follow, along with a dry squeeze of tannins. The smoke influence is prominent.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine is soft and fruity, almost syrupy in texture, and has simple cherry and berry flavors.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Oaky in a green lumber sort of way, this shows little varietal specificity. It's a thin red wine with aggressive tannins.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: An aroma of cherry syrup meets fresh and seemingly sweet cherry and strawberry flavors in this light- to medium-bodied wine. It is smooth and easy in texture, and soft in balance.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Easy to sip and rather light in body, this wine tastes fruity, pleasant and straightforward. It offers a soft texture and a touch of jam on the finish.

name: Kuleto Estate 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Mild in structure and approach, this is a straightforward offering of the variety, herbal and earthy with a full-bodied ripeness at its core. Spicy clove and leather highlight a robust finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Fruity and fresh, this light, cheery wine gushes strawberry-jam and cherry-candy flavors. It's soft in texture and semisweet in balance.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This southern Oregon Merlot has ripened enough to pack black cherry fruit flavors into its core. It's quite astringent, and there's a suggestion of concrete, though no such fermenters are indicated. Finished and aged in French oak, the wine has a light streak of maple syrup that rounds it out.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This wine comes from a parcel of old Merlot that has produced a richly dense while also balanced wine. Its acidity and spicy character are layered with the dense black fruits and firm, dry tannins that will soften. Drink the wine from 2022.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: Herbal and savory in pencil shavings, cedar and crayon wax, this is a powerfully built and quite tannic rendition of the variety, blended with 6% Petite Sirah. The fruit is jammy and densely packed.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine is dry, well-balanced and offers a good, velvety texture to support generous cherry and raspberry flavors. It's difficult to find this kind of drinkability at this low price.

name: Château de Monteberiot 2015  Côtes de Bourg
description: This is a solid choice for midweek enjoyment. Generous aromas of ripe fresh red fruits meet with crushed slate, gravel and a kiss of sweet oak on the nose. It's lively on the palate, where juicy red cherry and oak framed by a spicy acidity.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is an appealing red wine, juicy and soft in layers of baked plum with an oaky backbone. Accents of cedar and dried herb round out its full-figured profile of concentrated density.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Mellow on the nose, this bottling offers layered dried cherry, red flowers, damp wood and a hint of soy aromas. The palate is quite dry, combining marjoram and cedar with tea leaf and light-red-fruit flavors.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This fruit-forward Merlot kicks off with a blueberry pie aroma. The palate is light and lithe, displaying a pleasing grip of juicy dark plum and cranberry flavors that are lifted up by persistent acidity. Lightly grainy tannins frame it all.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Perfumed aromas of blue fruit, pipe tobacco, orange peel, flower and fresh herbs are followed by soft, velvety, fruit and barrel flavors. At times it doesn't quite seem to have fully ripened.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This bottling, which is bolstered by 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, starts with ripe cherry, dried sagebrush and pencil shavings on the nose. The structure is grippy on the sip, with dried plum, cherry and woody flavors, plus a lingering hint of green herbs carrying into the finish.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: There's a sweet overlay to the nose of this wine, showcased through scents of ripe plum and cherry flesh hit by a solid dose of vanilla. The palate is smooth and approachable, with fine tannins and solid red-fruit flavors that are juicy and fresh through the finish. It's not overly complex or involved, but tasty and easy to like.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A earthy nose combines graphite, cherry, freshly milled pine, cedar and geraniums. The round and ripe palate is only mildly concentrated in flavors of red cherry and raspberry. Tannins are soft textured and velvety, but abundant. the acidity is also mellow with the lightest ring of tang towards the finish flavored by a mild note of vanilla and berry fruit, with brighter peppercorns.

name: Sevtap 2016 Sunday Kind of Love Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very floral aromas of rose and strawberry framboise show on the excited nose of this bottling. The palate offers simple and somewhat sweet flavors of fruit punch.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Forward scents of pressed carnation and baked plum lead the nose of this wine, with hints of vanilla and incense in the background. The palate is smooth and supple, with juicy flavors of raspberry sauce and macerated cherries that leave a sweet impression through the close.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This garnet-colored wine has aromas of bright cherry, cranberry and red plum. On the palate it is slightly acidic and tart with flavors of pomegranate, tart cherry and cranberry.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas are reticent, with notes of raspberry and cherry. The palate seems to break apart a bit in the middle.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Nearly black in the glass with a vibrant magenta rim, this has a distinctly funky nose. The palate is mild in flavors of plum and red apple, with vanilla, tilled earth and cocoa powder. The tannina are powdery and stick to the teeth through to the muddled blackberry finish where light peppery spice quietly falls away.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Very extracted aromas of black cherry, stewed plum, vanilla and caramel show on the nose of this bottling. The very rich and ripe palate packs more caramel with fudge and tangy black plum.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling packs together bright red-cranberry fruit with strong and dark herbs of oregano and marjoram. It's a bit sweet with red currant and raspberry on the palate, all set against that herbaceous backdrop.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Strong aromas of potpourri, wood spice, clove and cedar make for a very strong aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate reflects the wood spice but adds tangy red- and black-plum flavors.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This red opens with scents of green pepper, blackcurrant leaf and licorice. The medium-full palate is well structured by velvety tannins that lend lingering texture through the close. Black fruit flavors are at the core, though they're not overly pronounced or forward throughout the experience.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This garnet-colored Bulgarian Merlot has aromas of cranberry, dark plum, red raspberry and violet. There is a nice level of acidity in the midpalate with flavors of cherry preserves and ripe black raspberry. The finish is fruit filled and juicy, with a touch of light powdered chocolate on the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: From a vineyard in the Fronsac region west of Saint-Emilion, this wine is packed with ripe black-currant fruits sustained by spicy tannins. The dense Merlot gives structure and some aging potential. Drink from 2021.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Dried herb, cherry, dark chocolate, raspberry, plum and anise aromas are out front. Plump, tart fruit flavors follow. There's a strange mixture of tartness and ripeness.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Surprisingly rich for a red wine from the Côtes de Gascogne, this wine has ripe red-berry fruits and stalky tannins. They go with the acidity that is still young and vibrant. Drink the wine from 2020.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Perfumed in gardenia and lavender, this is from a site hovering at 1,300-feet-elevation. Red cherry, plum, dark chocolate and graphite play around dense, concentrated layers of soft, integrated smoothness and a hit of fresh acidity.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Coming from a vineyard on the Wahluke Slope, this wine offers appealing aromas of baking spice, dark cherry, bittersweet chocolate and plum. The palate is well balanced in cherry and chocolate flavors.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Toast, freshly brewed coffee, chocolate and spice aromas are at the fore, with barrel notes playing a strong influence. Full-bodied raspberry and cherry flavors follow, shortening on the finish. It hits a high mark for the price.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Thick, rich and spicy, this wine is robust in tannin structure and powerfully dense black fruit. For fans of a fuller style, it delivers plenty of concentration around accents of leather, clove and cigar.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This generous, structured 100% Merlot wine is ripe and jammy, with a solid, still-youthful structure. Red fruits burst with energy and freshness. It will develop well and will be best drunk from 2021.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of dried herb, dark chocolate, cherry and cedar. Well-proportioned, slightly jammy red- and black-fruit flavors follow, supported by a lovely sense of structure and accented by plentiful barrel spices. It hits a lot of high notes.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: This delightful Merlot from a heralded vintage on Long Island shows a wealth of crushed herb, moss and small dark berries on the nose. The palate is grippy in thick-skinned dark-berry flavors that are supported by a tangy slick of minerals. Herbs and tart fruit linger on the finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is an explosive offering of succulent black cherry and cola that finds balance and backbone on the structured midpalate. It finishes with hints of clove, cedar and toasted oak that linger.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: From the mountain appellation neighboring Mount Veeder, this is an impressive, hearty and earthy red wine. Sanguine with meaty elements of flavor accented by leather and black currant, it is soft, integrated and well structured, with length and grace.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: With 13% Malbec in the mix, this is a densely packed and robust red wine, herbal and earthy in cedar and anise. Dark cherry and smoky oak round out a fleshy midpalate that finishes in a lengthy swirl of dark chocolate.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: An edge of rhubarb plays most subtly on a rounded nose that suggests apple compote. The palate comes in with subtle freshness and a zesty-citrus edged fruitfulness. At first, there is a touch of grapefruit, then the full force of strawberry compote unfolds—unusual but very attractive, with a nice, fresh, balanced sweet finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine is soft, rounded and succulent in waves of plum and dark cherry. Moderate in weight and ripeness, it is solidly backed by integrated oak, baking spice and a lasting hint of dried herb.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Tightly wound and youthful, this is a cellar-worthy wine, perfumed in black fruit, dried herb and oak, with a thick concentration of richness and structure. Enjoy 2020–2026.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Spicy and smoky, this wine moves easily between bright berry fruits and a structure made for aging. With a fresh edge of black currants and a firm core of tannins, the wine will age well. Drink from 2021.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: The second wine from this leading estate in Francs, this is big, bold and very ripe. Its tannins and integrated black fruits are warm and rounded, with a core of dryness that will allow the rich wine to age more. Drink from 2020.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This wine delivers pleasing aromas of blackberry jam, smoke and turned soil, leading to a palate loaded with black cherry, cocoa spice and light mint flavors. Solid tannins and fresh acidity complete the picture.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Produced by a pioneer of Merlot in Portugal, this is a rich, softly textured wine. Touches of the wood aging remain, giving the wine weight and spice. They support the blackberry fruits and rich tannins. Drink from 2021.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Juicy, savory, spicy and well integrated, this bold beauty offers so much of what the variety is while combining 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. With a backbone of tannin and oak, it shines in lasting accents of clove, chocolate and red and black currant, rich and smooth.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Thick and herbal, this wine has an earthy entry of tight-grained tannin and black olive. Blended with tiny amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, it was barrel-aged for nearly two years in French and Hungarian oak and is robustly ripe and concentrated in lush red fruit.

name: Beringer 2016 Bancroft Ranch Merlot (Howell Mountain)
description: Embracing the variety completely, this wine is fermented in stainless steel and aged in French oak. Thick, brawny red fruit is lush in tannin and texture, with accents of baking spice and dark chocolate rounding out the palate.

name: Denner 2016 Mother Of Exiles Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: From the great vineyard site in Carneros, this 100% varietal wine from the site's oldest vines is earthy, rugged and generous in flavor, oak and heat, with a persistence of structure and tannin. It unfurls itself slowly to show succulent cassis, nutmeg, graphite and blueberry compote, layers of complexity that lead to a soft, graceful finish.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 22% Cabernet Sauvignon and tiny percentages of Malbec and Petit Verdot, this is a hearty take on the variety. Full-bodied flavors of black currant and dried herb meld with firm tannins and oak. Textured, richly layered and appealing, it finishes on acents of tobacco and clove.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Ripe, softly textured and generous, this is wine that shows the opulent side of Merlot. Its tannins and blackberry fruits are finely integrated into a texture that is rounded and rich. Drink now.

name: Cullen 2016 Diana Madeline Wilyabrup Red (Margaret River)
description: Blended with 6% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Malbec, this vintage is superb and exuberant in flavors of chocolate-covered plum, baking spice and dried herb. Structured, robust and mineral-driven, it is powerful yet balanced. Enjoy 2026–2036.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Made from 100% Merlot from the producer's historic site, this wine saw time in French and Hungarian oak. Flavors of currant, orange and dried herb provide a complex landscape, held together by sinewy tannins.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This has subtle aromas suggesting white spring flowers and citrus zest. The bright, simple palate evokes grapefruit, sage and a hint of beeswax.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine starts off a little shy and rubbery, but it blows off some with time in glass, revealing guava, passionfruit and grass. There's a good lick of acidity on the palate, that's kept relatively in check by the ripe fruit flavors. While its sharp edges lack some finesse, the citrus and guava element is enough to please many a Sauvignon Blanc lover.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit and dried herbs meet flavors that are earthy and herbal in this medium-bodied lively assertive wine.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Aromas of tart candies, grapefruits and soapy florals make for a heady nose. This is light in feel, with a palate that transitions from lemon to red apple and finally grapefruit pith on the finish.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: This wine shows grass, melon rind, citrus, guava, and green bell pepper. The palate puts forth just a smidgeon of citrus fruit, but mostly it's green and lean, with a whisper of textural weight that increase its interest slightly.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: The nose on this Sauvignon Blanc is oddly overripe. Most of the aromas of canteloupe, mango, lychee and geranium are pleasing, but they are overpowered by a waft of ginko nut. All of these flavors carry to the palate, where bright acidity doesn't quite stand up to the full body.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Medium-intense aromas of freshly dried grass, orange peel and tart melon rind dance on the nose of this attractive white. The palate shows a bit of roundness that's kept in check by ample acidity and a slightly astringent citrus-pith character. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this white is fruity and fresh, with a nutty character that rides alongside ripe apricot and melon. There's a robust intensity to the finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This is a simple expression, showing some of the typicity of the cooler Awatere Valley as well as the cooler, wetter vintage. Citrus, tomato leaf and jalapeño pepper tones shine on a palate full of zesty but in-check acidity. There is a slightly slippery texture with a leafy, grassy finish.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Aromas of passionfruit, lime, grapefruit and peach notes are backed by tomato leaves and stones. The palate is taut and focused, with zingy, lime acidity and a green leafy finish.

name: Te Pa 2019 Pa Road Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe citrus and melon along with a touch of lychee and tomato leaf aromas are a bit dull but can be coaxed from the glass. The palate offers a grapefruit and citrus tang with balanced acidity. Simple yet enjoyable. Drink now.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Stone-fruit flavors and jasmine aromatics define the core of this light-bodied wine, which is stony in mineral texture with an intense lemony aspect that meets crisp green apple.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: While this delivers in many regards, the style seems more muted and angular than in vintages past. After vigorous swirling in glass it finally displays guava, grapefruit, lime and snow pea characters. It's a crisp style with mouthpuckering acidity and a no-frills disposition.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: While this wine starts with an oniony aroma, it blows off fairly quickly, displaying aromas of honey, peach, guava, lemon and dried herbs taking its place. The palate shows a whisper of sweetness, balanced by tropical fruit flavors and a herbal finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Pleasantly tropical in tones of pineapple rind, citrus and banana, this is a well-balanced offering that begs to be enjoyed seaside. There's a pleasing roundness to the light-bodied palate, with a refreshing sweet-tart finish.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This reserve Sauvignon Blanc is teeming with scents of candied peach and lemon, with geranium and honeydew. Full in body, this is a white that could stand up to a heartier meal. The creaminess and roundness stick around on the long finish.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This wine is lively in tropical and floral aromas. Lychee, passion fruit and geranium are concentrated on the nose, as well as prevalent on the palate. There is a striking salinity that gives this wine a savory line. There's a lot of power in the wine.

name: Danza del Sol 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Showing a brilliant light-gold color and mineral and citrus aromas, this light-bodied wine reveals flavors of apple and pear accented by vanilla. It's quite smooth and polished in texture and leans toward the soft side in terms of balance.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Notes of pollen, lemon and fresh flowers carry the quiet nose. Light in body and brisk in feel, green melon and grapefruit flavors drift to an astringent, salty finish.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Flint and savory herbs are the stars of this wine, with citrus playing a supporting role. In both aroma and flavor, fennel and bell pepper stand out with grapefruit and a smoky, stoniness on the midpalate. The finish is long and zippy in herbacious tones.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Grapefruit, white peach, cantaloupe and pilsner aromas follow through to the palate. Bright acidity is matched with a textural creaminess. The finish is demure, with a zip of acidity straight down the middle of the tongue.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A veritable tropical fruit bowl of aromas—with just the slightest whisper of grass—slides smoothly into a light- to medium-bodied palate of zingy acidity, slippery texture and plenty more ripe pineapple and guava fruit.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: There's an attractive floral element upfront on the nose of this wine, supported by ripe notes of guava, pineapple and mango. The medium-weight palate offers enough cut to counter the fruity richness, while brisk, refreshing citrus flavors carry the close. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is fairly typical in style, focused more on passionfruit and citrus flavors than on the herbal and grassy flavors. Along with all the lemon, passionfruit and stone fruit characters, there's a lick of zingy acidity and a slightly creamy texture, making for an easy-drinking summer sipper.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A floral character that leads the way on the nose of this lively wine, expressed in notes of lemon verbena, clover and baby's breath. Behind are fruity tones of white melon, peach and lime that provide a solid core to the lightweight mouthfeel. The lime pith-flavored finish is tart and refreshing. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This wine is concentrated on the nose with canteloupe, mango, flint and yeast. Equally tropical and intese on the palate, there are playful bursts of necterine and marzipan. It feels creamy and smooth despite its lively acidity. The finish is long and flavorful.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a solidly made, wallet-friendly Sauvignon Blanc that offers heady, fresh aromas and flavors of lemon zest, oregano and snow pea, with a slightly creamy texture to balance all that zingy acidity. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This could be a poster child for Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc, offering all the hallmarks of the style: white grapefruit, pineapple, passionfruit and peach skins with, of course, a lick of grassiness. Its racy acidity and slightly chalky texture make for an easygoing summer sipper.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine has all the extroverted qualities of New Zealand's most famous wine style—brash aromas of guava, grapefruit, passionfruit, grass, tomato leaf and fresh green beans. It has zippy acidity and just a hint of creamy texture, with tons of citrusy zing.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: Soft aromas of grapefruit, lemon, wet stone and moss set the tone for this Sauvignon Blanc. Not in your face in any way, the aromas and flavors are classic yet demure. This is light and bright, with zippy acidity that leaves a tingle on the long finish.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This wine has enticing aromas of lemon, white peach and aloe which translate onto the palate. The acidity is crisp but could stand a little more to hold up to the body. The lovely flavors hang on until the very end of a long finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Light aromas of dried grass, savory herbs and lime leaf mingle with fruity notes of green melon and white peach on the nose of this wine. The palate follows suit with more lime and tart melon tones, lifted by ample acidity and finishing slightly bitter and tangy. Drink now–2019.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Dried grass, lemon peel and tart gooseberry set the stage on the nose of this bright wine and carry through to the tart-flavored palate. The mouthfeel is surprisingly rounded in texture, though it's lifted by ample acidity that helps to enliven the finish. Drink now.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Notes of stone fruit, watermelon and passionfruit carry a slightly green tinge. There's a ripeness to the feel, but a nice line of acidity helps maintain balance. Overall, a solid and straightforward buy.

name: Wine Cube 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine's honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the fresh, linear palate, a mineral hint accompanies grapefruit, pineapple and tomato leaf notes.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: For pure, young Sauvignon Blanc, this is a soft, rounded wine. It is attractive to drink immediately, with quince, apple and lemon flavors. The final taste is packed with fruit.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Aromas of ripe stone fruit, lemon curd and green beans are backed by appealing secondary characters of melon rind and dried herbs. The palate feels a little more forced and lacks the pretty fruit found on the nose, but there's pleasing textural weight, crisp acidity, and an interesting salty, melon rind finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: A yeasty aroma is at the forefront on this wine, although there's also plenty of this style's characteristic citrus, pineapple, snow pea and green bell pepper as well. The palate is extra fruity, bright, zippy and crisp, making for an easygoing porch pounder.

name: Serafino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)
description: This offers grilled herb, citrus rind and exotic fruit scents. The ripe, forward palate shows grapefruit, baked apple and mature peach flavors.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Notes of pollen, lemon and plastic carry the nose, with a bit of melon showing on the light-bodied palate. There's mild concentration to the flavors and a pleasing roundness to the feel, balanced by a gentle vein of acidity.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This ticks all the Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc boxes with bold aromas of lemon, grapefruit, snow peas and grass on the nose. The zingy, citrusy palate is complete, with a long, lemony finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This starts shy, but after a good amount of swirling in glass it reveals a medley of ripe tropical and citrus fruits with white pepper and a green herbal tinge. There's a flintiness on the palate, wrapped in a smooth, chalky mouthfeel and a long, tangy finish.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: There's a clean, refreshing tropical-fruit character to this zippy wine, showcased in waves of pineapple, peach and underripe mango that combine with notes of sweet grass, lime peel and green plum. Ample acidity keeps the palate fresh and zippy, while a pithy character lends astringent grip to the close. Drink now.

name: Wine Cube 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Typical aromas of grapefruit, passionfruit, lemon and snow peas are layered with some salty and herbal notes. There's a touch of residual sugar on the palate balancing a lot of crisp acidity in this clean example of a classic style.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: There's a chalky, carnation-like character upfront on the bouquet of this wine, countered by ripe yellow melon and peach tones that lend an interesting juxtaposition. The palate boasts a slightly rounded feel, with a soft creaminess thanks to the ripe melon and stone-fruit flavors. Just enough acidity manages to lend balance to the fruity weight and keeps the finish in check.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Small amounts of Sauvignon Musque and Sauvignon Gris are blended within this substantive, lushly built wine, which is thick and rich in flavors of peach and vanilla. The finish brightens with aromas of jasmine.

name: Carlton Cellars 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells at first like toasted garlic and dried herbs, but it develops complexity and good fruit flavors after airing in the glass and then it deepens with each sip. It's supported by a very lively crisp texture.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This light-colored and medium-bodied wine has fresh citrus aromas, lemon, apple and vanilla flavors and a rounded texture that give it a full mouthfeel. It's well made and well-balanced.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of papaya, lemongrass and tart candies are brimming with vibrancy on the nose. There's a solid fruit presence on the rounded palate, with a line of crisp acidity providing adequate tension.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This offers classic, intense aromas of guava, fig, lychee, grass and jalapeño, plus a hint of white pepper. There's a welcome textural weight on the palate, balancing crisp acidity and more green vegetal and grass flavors, wrapping up with a long, melon rind finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas pop, with notes of green flower, bountiful citrus peel, fresh herb, kiwi and scooped honeydew melon. The broad feeling but lighter styled kiwi flavors bring appeal, with a pink-grapefruit snap on the finish.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: The bouquet of this wine is enticing in tones of grapefruit, flint, Pink Lady apples and pilsner. It manifests on the palate in such a way that is buoyant and lush, with texture from the lees. It feels silky and alive at the same time and finishes long and full of complexity.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Ripe tropical and passion fruit along with wild mint, butter and a flinty minerality are slightly hidden in this gold-hued wine. The full-bodied palate is round and rich, with just enough acidity to keep things refreshing. A salty herbaceousness is present right through to the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: It introduces itself with a hint of passion fruit, a touch of grass. While the nose just teases, the palate gives bright lemon freshness and juicy yellow plum. This is bright, light, dry, fruit-driven and refreshing.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc offers up peach and pear juice, tropical fruit, tomato leaf and green bell pepper on the nose. It's silky and slippery, with an approachable, easygoing vibe about it.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Earthy and floral, this is not your average Sauvignon Blanc. This displays lots of floral, lemon balm, melon and warm spice notes on the palate. A delicate line of tannins from 18 hours of whole-cluster skin contact offers balance to the weighty juicy fruit.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet grass, peony, sweet pea and fynbos aromas lead the nose of this floral white. They're grounded by tones of white peach, Meyer lemon and white melon rind, though the fruity core seems secondary to the abundant herbal tones. Medium acidity lends enough cut to keep the mouthfeel vibrant and the finish fresh. Drink now.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine opens in a wave of bright fresh flavor that evolves to present more creamy and substantive body and richness. The highlights are dipped in peach, apricot and melon, with a pronounced finish of vanilla and cinnamon.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This Yarra Valley based Australian brand delivers a solid and unmistakably Marlborough Sauvignon Blanc. It's a heady blend of stone and tropical fruits, blossoms, snow peas and jalapeño pepper. There's some fruit weight on the palate and a touch of oiliness, but the sunny acidity keeps everything bright and bouncy.

name: In Situ 2008 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Aconcagua Valley)
description: This reserve Sauvignon Blanc is fresh in profile, with tropical fruit tones and lively acidity alongside secondary components of marzipan, marmalade and wild ginger that have evoloved with age. The texture is both energetic and creamy, with a long, leesy finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers lemon, grapefruit, chamomile and a soft, green mossiness on the nose. Pea shoots, citrus and crushed minerals dance on the tongue with vibrant acidity. It finishes zippy and crisp, and would be perfect with oysters.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a pretty, delicate wine with notes of honey, blossoms, peaches and lychees and tomato leaf. There's a lovely chalky texture, with mouthwatering acidity and a ripe fruit character adding to the wine's charm.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This fresh and well-balanced white opens with notes of sweet pea, fresh grass, orange blossom and lemon leaf. It's a refined and delicate pour, with refreshing acidity and clean flavors of white melon rind and citrus rind that lend a pleasant pithiness to the fresh finish. Drink now–2019.

name: Volpe Pasini 2017 Zuc di Volpe Sauvignon (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Using slightly less new oak than the Reserve, this Sauvignon Blanc is bright and energetic. Aromas and flavors of passionfruit, grapefruit, honeysuckle and grass carry this wine. The acidity is racy and works well to combat the full, creamy weight. It finishes long and smooth. Pair with rich, creamy cheese.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A heady mélange of peach, melon, citrus, apple blossoms and snow pea lead into a sea-salt palate with more stone and citrus fruit flavors, focused acidity and just the slightest textural weight.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Subdued aromas of grapefruit, banana and papaya carry to the juicy, medium-bodied palate. This offers a round, textural mouthfeel, with a brisk, chalky finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Slender and taut, the nose is pretty and perfumed with bright passionfruit, pineapple, nettles, grass and tomato leaf, with a touch of honey. There's tongue-tingling acidity on the palate to go with a slippery smooth texture and a good lick of citrus and tropical fruit.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Bright, light and easygoing, with aromas of lemon, pear juice, melon, peach and a touch of green beans. The texture is slippery but nicely balanced by refreshing acidity, finishing on a herbal note. Drink now.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Punchy, vibrant aromas  of grapefruit and pineapple juice meet a mild, floral hop note on the nose. There's a round feel to the  palate which displays lots of tropical fruit rinds and floral, grapefruit flavors. Perfect for a hot summer's day.

name: Borsao 2016 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: A pretty Sauvignon Blanc that's easy to like, this shows a bright nose of limes, blossoms, stone fruit and a hint of jalapeño pepper. Drink this crisp, zippy sipper on a hot summer's day.

name: Highway 12 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Grapefruit, guava, lemon, green bell pepper and pea shoot aromas emerge with time in the glass. The chalky textured palate is what brings things up a notch—it's tightly wound and focused, with mouthwatering acidity. This is a tidy wine that manages a great balance of fruit and herbal tones.

name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Flinty with an aroma of matchstick, this wine is ultimately fresh and fruity in honeydew melon and peach, with an ebullience on the palate. Lightweight, it adds highlights of grapefruit and lemon on the finish.

name: Pope Valley Winery 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This Sauvy offers a nicely balanced experience, starting with fresh scents of lime leaf, thyme, citrus peel and pineapple core. The citrusy tones carry through to the refreshing palate alongside medium acidity. The lime-pith-flavored finish boasts a subtle astringent texture that lends some length to the close.

name: Byron Blatty 2016 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Rich, tannic and woody, this wine is robust in big black fruit, espresso and toasted oak. It is youthful in dense concentration and structure, a worthy showcase of the variety grown in a wild cool-climate appellation that appears to love it with abandon. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Baking spice, black fruit and medicinal aromas are followed by somewhat lighter-styled fruit flavors. Grainy tannins provide support. The concentration seems a bit light.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Ripe and jammy, this wine has tannins as well as red-berry flavors. It is unbalanced and seems old-fashioned and hot.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Garnet in the glass, this Romanian Merlot has aromas of dark fruits and dark plums and flavors of blackberry, red plum and black raspberry. The finish is soft and simple.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: This juicy wine from 100% Merlot suggests overripe fruit. Hints of beets and red berries are shot through with acidity. Drink this jammy wine soon.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sourced from the Black Sage Bench, this spent more than 50 days on the skins and was fermented with wild yeasts. It's smoky in the nose and smooth in the mouth, with wild strawberry fruit. The tannins have a pleasantly charred character, with streaks of licorice and dark chocolate.

name: Paraduxx 2016 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Green herb, cherry, soil, coffee, cedar and flower aromas lead to sweet, somewhat lighter-styled green-tea and cherry flavors that paint around the edges. There are good things going on, but it comes off as quite green for the variety.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Cherry and spice aromas lead to graceful fruit flavors, with plentiful vanilla accents. Herb notes linger on the finish. The concentration seems light and the vanilla notes a bit heavy.

name: Pine & Post 2004 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Winemaker: Miles Mossop. From the Bottelary section of Stellenbosch, this Merlot opens with vanilla-infused raspberry, strawberry and cherry pie filling, all hit by ample baking spice tones. It's quite soft on the midpalate, with lush and rich fruit flavors that echo the bouquet. A pleasant spiced black tea and chocolate tone unfold on the finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Light aromas of carnation and snappy black raspberry meet with the elegant touch of bay leaf on the nose of this cool-climate Merlot. Its grapes grow on a southwest-facing orientation, which is the only reason they get ripe at all. The palate's red-currant and cherry tones are overcome by herbal touches of bay, juniper and mint, wrapped in zesty acidity.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is somewhat nondescript in thick layers of baked fruit and oaky tar.

name: St. Francis 2016 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is thick, dull and overtly earthy in compostable earth and green herb.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: From a section of the producer's vineyard, this wine is juicy and herbal, with a full-bodied robustness of ripe red currant and cherry. The fleshy fruity character is buoyed by a richness of blueberry and vanilla biscuit, as the finish offers black pepper and clove.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Lighter in color, the aromas bring unusual notes of seaweed, cherry, wet penny and exotic spice. The palate is full of ripe raspberry and red-cherry flavors with a short finish. If the aromas and flavors sync up, it might move up a notch or two.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Spicy aromas and jammy flavors make this medium-bodied wine exuberant and rich, turning off dry on the palate where the texture is velvety.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This wine smells sweet and spicy like ginger cookies and tastes relatively light, fruity and off dry. It's medium bodied, has a touch of good tannin and a lot of oak influence.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Not entirely appealing aromas of green wood, macerated cranberry and cherry lead to wood-dominated fruit flavors (60% new French). The oak takes over the show, completely overwhelming the variety.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Very tangy and youthful blackberry fruit meets with licorice and roasted plum on the nose of this bottling from south of Paso Robles. The palate is very zesty and fresh, with bright raspberry, blackberry, vanilla and brown spice atop squeaky tannins and strong acidity.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Aromas of dried herb, dark cherry, black raspberry and barrel spice are at the fore on this 100% varietal wine. They lead to sleek cherry and cranberry flavors that provide intrigue.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine features a bouquet of raspberry, black cherry and violet. It is smooth on the palate, with flavors of blackberry, cherry, pomegranate, vanilla and almond blossom. Cool minty notes come into play towards the finish, followed by lingering brightness.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Thick, firm tannin is pronounced in this reserve-level wine. Coconut and vanilla-seasoned oak rides along a roadway of dried herb, clove and blackberry as the texture softens and teases in complexity.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From the winery's Mountain Terrace Vineyard 1,700-feet up, this is a floral, subdued and brightly woven red wine. Vanilla and milk chocolate flavors provide a richness and likability, with a pronounced bite of oak and tannin on the finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Deep garnet to the eye, this wine has a nose of lingonberry, raspberry and a touch of rosemary. Soft tannins provide a framework for flavors of tart cherry, strawberry, clove and chocolate, with a touch of smoked meat. The pleasing finish provides a lingering sense of brightness on the palate.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Three Palms Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a smoky and herbaceous version of the variety, with big, bold flavors of black cherry, blackberry and cured meat. Powerfully built in brawny tannin, it finishes soft and seductively.

name: Château Campillot 2015  Médoc
description: This is the luxury cuvée from vineyards in the Seze family since 1918. With its perfumed fruits and firm tannins it is serious as well as sumptuous. It has weight and a dry texture that will soften into the blackberry fruits and generous structure. This wine, with its still-firm texture, needs to age, so drink from 2022.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: A touch of residual sweetness can't mask the thinness of the fruit—this simply hasn't ripened sufficiently in this location. Flavors revolve around stem, thin berry, vanilla and green tannins.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Called authentic because there is no added sulphur, this wine is all fruit, without any wood aging. On the palate, it is juicy, packed with acidity and red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out a metallic, tight edge to the wine.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This estate, in the center of the Entre-deux-Mers region, has produced a successful wine in this warm vintage. The 100% Merlot delivers great fruit while allowing a place for dry tannins. The wine has a lightness to it and is ready to drink.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Fruit forward aromas of raspberry jam, baking spice and oak lead to lightly styled red fruit flavors. This lacks in concentration but what's there is an enjoyable, straightforward expression.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a simple yet approachable Merlot offering notes of ripe dark-berry fruit, chocolate and vanillin oak. The palate is full bodied and plush but the oak is on the clunky side, particularly on the finish.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Coffee bean, red apple and spice aromas are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors. There's interest to be had but it doesn't all quite come together by the finish.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Les Collines, McKinley Springs and Elephant Mountain vineyards. Expressive aromas of raspberry jam, red currant and exotic spice are followed by plentiful red fruit flavors and backed by firm tannins.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Aromas of plum, boysenberry, vanilla and spice carry the nose of this wine. The flavors are surprisingly elegant in style considering the warmth of the vintage and it shows a sense of sleekness that provides appeal.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Baked earth, crushed slate, dried sage and dried red fruits show on the dusty nose of this bottling. The palate is driven by tobacco flavors and dried garden herbs, proving rather Old World in style albeit a bit single-noted.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of baking spice, red apple and raspberry are followed by plump cherry flavors. It provides appeal if not a lot of complexity.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is fruity in notes of raspberry and plum, with plenty of mocha accents. The flavors are soft and supple, intermingling fruit and barrel tones, with the latter stealing the show on the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Close to the Fronsac vineyards, the estate has produced a ripe, structured 2015. A light touch of acidity and poised black-currant fruit makes it both accessible and refreshing. Drink this attractive wine from 2020.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is an easy drinking red perfect for a weeknight bowl of spaghetti bolognese or a pizza. It's medium to full bodied, with soft tannins and flavors of juicy berries, cherry cola, chocolate and some savory herbal notes. Drink now.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has subtle aromas of black plum, scorched earth and toast. On the concentrated palate, firm but polished tannins support black cherry jam, cedar and licorice.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This Merlot offers aromas of black-skinned berry, roasted coffee bean, cedar and bell pepper. On the dense palate, close-grained tannins grip black currant jam, vanilla and a hint of mocha. Drink through 2022.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Garnet in the glass, this Merlot has aromas of cherry cola, saddle leather, black plums and a whiff of tobacco leaf. The palate offers flavors of black plum and sour cherry, while the tannins are a bit grippy, but pleasant.
