name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Pure Merlot, this wine comes from a property that borders on Pomerol proper. Its juicy red-berry flavors are classics for the vintage. Ripe while crisp and with acidity balancing the tannins, the wine is developing well. It should be ready to drink from 2021.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Spicy and toasty from the wood aging, this wine is ripe and dense. It has enough juicy black fruits to balance the serious amount of wood, at least in the future. Wait for this concentrated wine with its good potential to develop over the next few years. Drink from 2021.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas of cedar, red berry, pipe tobacco and a whiff of toasted oak lift out of the glass. The elegant but restrained palate delivers red cherry, cassis, licorice and exotic spice alongside bright acidity and fine-grained polished tannins. It's an admirable effort for the cool wet vintage.

name: St. Francis 2016 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: Aromas of violet and baked biscuit invite one in before this earthy herbal wine imparts harsh tannins that give it a tart sour taste.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Merlot (California)
description: This Merlot has unripe, rubbery berry aromas that bring road tar to mind. It's highly acidic and light bodied, with tart tomato, red plum and red currant flavors and a rough, peppery finish.

name: AVA Grace 2016 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)
description: This wine dramatically brings out the veggie side of Merlot. It smells like beets and herbs and tastes like plums with a side of greens.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: This wine is thick, heavy and tannic, with an herbaceous quality of cedar and pencil. Flavors of dark cherry and chocolate highlight the full-bodied concentration.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This is a light oaky off-dry wine with a soda-pop freshness and flavors like strawberries and cherry candy.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Spicy oaky accents give a little momentum to this mostly light and appealing wine. It has cinnamon, ginger and vanilla flavors blended with cherry notes.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This involves 25% Cabernet Sauvignon—the two varieties combining for a muted dusty texture of broad-shouldered richness and brawn. Plum, tobacco and chocolate all play a part.

name: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: The 100% new wood shows in this wine's polished character, hints of mint and dark chocolate. It will develop into a superripe and powerful, yet balanced wine. It's bold and full of fruit at this young stage, wait until 2022 before drinking.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Juicy red fruits are supported by soft tannins in this broad, ripe wine. It has acidity, berry flavors and a succulent aftertaste. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: This light-bodied wine smells like candied fruit, and tastes fresh of raspberries and strawberries that meet a soft texture.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied value-priced wine has relatively light herb and veggie accents as well as modest raspberry and plum flavors. It is quite smooth and soft in texture.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells like brown sugar and carries lots of jammy fruit flavors. Moderate tannins give it some structure.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Spicy aromas, good concentration and an off-dry flavor make this wine robust while staying rather soft and friendly for people who don't love aggressive tannins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This medium-boded oaky style of wine has baking-spice aromas and sweet-seeming flavors like blackberry jam along with moderate tannins.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a dusty grip of clove and tobacco, savory elements that play well against a backdrop of soft expansive dark cherry and cassis.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Exotic spice, dark raspberry and barrel spice aromas lead to restrained fruit flavors in this wine, with cocoa notes on the finish. Despite the warmth of the vintage, it seems underripe.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Smooth and easy to drink, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor, with shades of vanilla and nutmeg. The texture is silky, showing a hint of tannin but overall is ripe and juicy.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: A distinct green tinge colors the aromas in this blend from Olsen (60%) and Boushey vineyards, with herb and green tea notes more characteristic of Cabernet Franc. The palate brings soft-feeling orange peel and raspberry flavors

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this delivers plum, red fruit, mocha, green herb, barrel spice and dark raspberry aromas. It's light in style on the palate, with fruit-forward flavors and dried tobacco-inflected finish. The tannins are surprisingly dialed back for Washington Merlot.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Good and grapy, this wine has lots of dark-fruit flavors and enough body and tannin for a grippy texture. It is very clean and well made and will be a good go-to wine for casual occasions.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: From one of the state's finest vineyards, this offers high-toned raspberry, blueberry and spice aromas and a well balanced, fruitful palate.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: An early red release from the vintage, this is light in color and notably blue fruited for a Merlot, with spice and orange peel accents. The flavors bring more of the same, adding boysenberry and plum notes that coat the palate before tapering on the finish. You'd never have it pegged as Merlot, but it's tasty all the same.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine offers ground cranberry, red currant, dried herb and golden raisin aromas. The flavors are surprisingly elegant, considering the warmth of the vintage and region; they taper toward the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This wine's blueberry, herb and barrel spice aromas are appealing. Its fruit flavors are light in style and glide toward the finish. It's an enjoyable, straightfoward Merlot.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Good depth and concentration help this full-bodied wine stand out, and the chocolaty flavors are hard to resist. It feels rich and smooth in texture, spreads nicely across the palate and is backed by moderate tannins.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Raspberry, black licorice and wood spice aromas lead to smooth cherry flavors in this wine. It pulls up short on the finish.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine was given 20 months in oak and another two or so years in bottle before release. It has a soft texture and lengthy tannins accented in earthy compost, graphite, red cherry and dark chocolate.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: There's a lot of stony earth and deep red-cherry fruit to the nose of this soft and rich bottling, with a pinch of dust as well. The palate is framed with decent tannins, showing dried berry, leather and herb flavors. Very down-the-middle wine, great for midweek dinners.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Big and beefy, this wine has huge aromas of wood smoke, beef jus and cedar followed by generous blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a firm tannic texture. Earthy roasted elements indicate it's fully mature now.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a handsome full-bodied wine that's full of flavor and has the kind of bold, moderately tannic texture that goes great with big proteins. It shows lots of ripe blackberry and cherry aromas that continue on the palate.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: This full-bodied Merlot has jammy, raisiny dark berry aromas. It's round on the palate, with nice acidity balancing its blackberry and baked black plum flavors. It finishes short but spicy, with drying tannins. A classic meat-friendly Uruguayan red.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Dark ruby in color, this wine features aromas of cassis, coffee and green pepper. It offers a nice mix of fruit and savory flavors, notably cassis, stewed plums, smoke and espresso. Mellow tannins continue into a coffee-bean finish.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: A very down-the-middle red wine, sure to please most, this bottling starts with dark blackberry, elderflower, char and vanilla aromas. The palate offers dried blueberry and hints of thyme, riding fine-grained tannins and strong acidity into the finish. Still a tad sticky, so it could use more time.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Deep ruby in the glass, this wine has a bouquet of black plum and anisette. Supportive tannins provide a background for flavors of cassis, black cherry, vanilla, licorice and a touch of smoke that lingers into the smooth finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Sanguine and herbal, this wine is hugely concentrated in extracted and intense flavors of blackberry, red currant and cedar. It showcases meaty tannins and rich oak.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This soft, round Merlot blends in small amounts of Malbec and Syrah to offer a powerful, full-bodied frame. It's lengthy on the palate in tart red fruit, integrated oak and fresh acidity.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a fruity entry of dark cherry and plum: flavors that are dusted in a lightness of cinnamon spice. Well put together, it's soft and round on the palate with a full-bodied ripeness that minds its manners and plays well with its more elegant intentions.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Extra richness and depth lift this wine to a high level of quality and deliciousness. Its ripe blueberry, blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors seem layered and generous, and it fills the palate with fine-grained tannins and a full body.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This elegant medium-bodied wine has everything in place, from fresh plummy aromas to warm layered flavors to an appetizing and moderately tannic texture. It has excellent balance, with a sense of freshness and depth that is compelling.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine brings richness and ripe opulent flavors to the fore. Tobacco, cedar and black-plum aromas come before blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors while firm tannins and good acidity wrap around the palate for support.

name: Gainey 2016 Patrick's Vineyard Selection Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is spicy and succulent, with expert touches of clove and cinnamon. Roundly rich, it delivers a complexity of long-lasting red plum and cherry flavor accented in dark chocolate and lightly toasted oak.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a tremendous value for the quality— an earthy, sanguine and dried herbal wine that's tightly wound in structure and composure. Accents of pencil lead and cocoa powder add complexity and savory components to the full-bodied whole.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of baking spice, red currant, herb and tire rubber that seem a little unsettled. The plum flavors are light and fall a bit flat.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: This widely available bottling is very fruity on the nose with boysenberry aromas alongside hints of clay and mud. Dark spice and pungent red fruit show on the sip alongside those earthy tones.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Racy red plum and blackberry tones meet leafy tobacco on the nose and palate. This is plush in feel, with soft tannins and racing acidity that cuts the flavors short.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Candied red fruit, turned earth, crushed rocks and purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling. There's a cherry-cough-syrup touch to the sip alongside brown spice, but it's fumbling a bit over flavor and texture.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This Merlot has aromas of black cherry, juniper, and white pepper. The palate is spicy in tones of clove and cinnamon, with an undercurrent of black plum and cherry. Ample acidity, a full body and generous tannic structure lead to a long, spicy finish.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Aromas of currant, dark plum, herb and spice are followed by light elegant fruit flavors, with the extraction pulled back. It finishes with strangely tart cranberry flavors that distract.

name: Paumanok 2015 Estate Bottled Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Leaning on the herbal side, this Merlot shows fresh fennel and tobacco on the nose, with a core of red plum. There's some green bitterness on the palate yet a darker plum note offers some counterbalance.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This is a thick, dense and oaky red wine, with a generosity of tannin and slight whiff of reduction. Reserved in fruit, it traffics more substantially in leathery tobacco and cigar box.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: This Merlot is superfloral and bright, with aromas and flavors of kirsch, red cherry, violet, lavender and cinnamon that carry to the palate. The finish is long and flavorful.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: There's a mix of fresh- and stewed-fruit tones in this wine, with baked red currant and fresher cranberry notes. The palate is round and juicy in feel, with grainy tannins and a mild oak flavor.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: This blends in 7% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is pungent and earthy in forest and tobacco, with smooth thick full-bodied waves of green tannin and light accents of clove spice.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Red currant, rose petals and crushed slate show on the nose of this bottling. It's fairly rigid on the palate at first, slowly unveiling black raspberry and loamy soils. The structure is firm and the acidity quite zippy.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This is a smooth and supple Merlot that offers a mix of red plum, blackberry and a mild leafy, herbal twang. Its mildly grippy tannins and soft acidity lend to its easy-drinking appeal.

name: Paraduxx 2016 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Dark-purple fruits meet with deep-violet aromas and loamy soil on the nose of this bottling. There's a powerful and earthy richness on the sip, showing flavors of boysenberry, cut by an acidity that's almost overpowering.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Tart red fruit tones are peppered with a leafy, green tobacco note on the nose. The medium-bodied palate is round and soft, with no hard edges, letting the fleshy red plum and cranberry-skin flavors do all the talking.

name: Krupp Brothers 2016 Water Witch Stagecoach Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a new offering from the winery. Almost all varietal with just a splash of Cabernet Franc (3%) coming from Quintessence and Red Willow vineyards, the aromas of toast, spice, cedar, black raspberry and dried herb aren't entirely revealing. The palate seems a bit linear and wound up. Perhaps some time will flesh it out?

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: A very rocky expression of the grape, this bottling shows mud, clay and just a hint of dark red fruit on the nose. Dark cherry starts the sip alongside cola spice, but it's the texture and structure that take center stage, with thick tannins and strong grip. A smoky meat character shows on the finish.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Cedar, oak, leather and vanilla dominate the nose and carry over to the palate, where vibrant cranberry and pomegranate flavors pop with a wash of fresh acidity over attractive peppery notes and grippy tannins. Tangy fruit lingers on the finish with a pinch of pepper.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This big wine is hugely fragrant in strawberry, cherry and a slightly reduced hint of oaky tar. Dense rich layers of flavor etch themselves against a backdrop of tobacco, cedar and ripe black cherry.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The smoky nose shows aromas of black pepper, tobacco and leather. Ample acidity on the palate is highlighted by juicy blue fruit flavors, alongside green tobacco leaf, black pepper and wood smoke with spicy, gritty tannins. This finishes on strong notes of leather over cranberry and smoked pepper.

name: Trujillo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers a substantial nose of bay leaf and eucalyptus—pleasant and defiant. Huge sweet tannins wrap around sizable power and ripeness, a mix of black cherry and cinnamon-dusted plum.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a true pan-Washington Merlot, with fruit coming from nine vineyards across the state. Blended with a good whack of Cabernet Franc (13%) which reveals itself, baking-spice, plum, raspberry and herb aromas are followed by soft ripe fruit flavors, with the tannins pulled back. Herb and raspberry notes linger on the tart finish.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: Blackberry, tobacco and dusty tannins define this blockbuster. It is a full-bodied red that is varietal in its underlying softness and approachability. There's an intensity and heat to the lingering finish.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a full-bodied, structured and youthful wine, varietal in its softness and approachability. Cassis and cherry exude forcefully around a core of thick tannin and oak, with an undertone of dried herb.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Aged in just 30% new oak, the aromas offer appealing notes of vanilla, red raspberry, cedar and cocoa. The flavors are plump, soft and pure, pulling up ever so slightly on the vanilla-filled finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Rounded red-berry fruit meets with vanilla, caramel, smoke and wet soil on the nose of this bottling from a winery near Morgan Hill. Hickory smoke and rich red-fruit flavors start the palate, where grippy tannins lead into a cocoa-laced finish. It needs some time to smooth out.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This wine is oaky first and fruity second, showing smoky spicy aromas and equally spicy, lightly charred flavors. Medium body and moderate tannins give it heft on the palate and there's just enough blackberry flavor underneath to counterbalance the oakiness.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Anise, cherry, green herb, orange peel and spice aromas carry the nose. These tones carry to the full, fleshy fruit flavors on the palate.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: This wine's dark berry aromas recall cassis and raisin. Citrusy acidity and hard tannins make for a lively mouthfeel, framing roasted plum and currant flavors. Mint and herbal notes linger on the finish, which is bold with acidity.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a ripe and fruit-forward wine, with intense notes of jammy plum, cherry and blueberry on the nose and mouth. A slight creaminess and plush flavors create a broad, tasty mouthfeel that finishes with a hint of milk chocolate.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Cherry, dried herbs and baked earth show on the nose of this bottling from a new producer based in Monterey County. It's a clean, down-the-middle expression of the grape, with dark red cherry, cocoa spice and herb flavors framed by medium tannins and acidity.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: A play on the famous line from the film Sideways, this bottling attempts to resurrect Merlot's image, starting with rich fresh aromas of blackberry sorbet, tangy black-plum skins and crushed gravel. It's a very young wine throughout, as the lighter bodied palate offers candied black-raspberry and plum flavors. Good with a chill.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine was aged in 20% new French oak. Its raspberry, green herb and spice aromas lead to ripe fruit flavors that coat the palate. It's lovely and exquisitely made but seems a bit green for the variety.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This ruby colored wine has aromas of cherry cola and red raspberry. On the palate, there are flavors of red raspberry, blackberry and red plum before the fruit-filled finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Hints of mint and cedar make the aroma of this full-bodied wine tempting, and the flavors deliver lots of plump berries and light, spicy accents. It's well-balanced and easy to appreciate.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine's bittersweet chocolate, currant and baking spice aromas are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors, with cocoa notes on the finish. Though sophisticated, it seems dominated by oak.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This rich and slightly earthy wine has an aroma of dried figs and ripe black plums plus a slight funky note that blows off. That's followed by juicy and friendly cherry and berry flavors and a smooth sleek texture. It's medium bodied, not overtly oaky and light on tannin.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine's pretty strawberry and spicy/tart cherry fruit shines, with medium concentration and length. Its light tannins and supportive acids are in fine balance, making it a nice alternative to more elegant Pinot Noir-based Oregon rosés.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine's baking spice, cherry, vanilla, coconut and anise aromas are followed by soft, saturated red and black fruit flavors. It shows polish, but the oak juts out.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This wine's aromas pop, with blueberry, cherry and woodspice notes and a kiss of dried herb. The flavors are ripe and juicy, with a soft texture.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Blended with 14% Cabernet Sauvignon, this enjoyable wine brings raspberry and red currant aromas that feel pure, with no obvious new oak influence. The flavors are sleek and juicy.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Black plum, cocoa, coffee spice and raisin syrup show on the fairly ripe yet not overdone nose of this bottling. The palate is well integrated with flavors of red cherry, baking spice and a vanilla finish, all presented with fresh acidity.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of saddle leather, black cherry and tobacco carry the nose of this complex wine. The palate is well balanced in flavors of dried plum and blackberry that lead to a smoky finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Full bodied and firmly structured, this wine is concentrated and ripe in flavor, coating the palate in richness. It has deep, ripe black-cherry aromas, cherry and milk chocolate flavors, firm tannins and a lingering finish.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine brings graphite, cherry, cassis, vanilla and spice aromas. The palate shows depth and concentration, with rich yet restrained flavors backed by velvety tannins. Give it time to open up.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: Dark, inky and earthy, this is a powerfully dense and rich expression of the variety, that is varietal in its mix of fruit, spice and herb. Black-cherry and mocha flavors dance around spicy toasted oak and polished, billowy tannin. Enjoy best 2022–2025.

name: Borsao 2016 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Smooth and medium in body, this supple wine has fresh and engaging cherry and berry flavors, with subtle oak spices, mild tannins and soft acidity. It's well balanced, polished and pleasing.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This wine explodes with aromas of cinnamon stick and oak. The entry is thick and dense on impact, with powerful, polished tannins. Dark cherry, raspberry and dusty clove combine with ease around a palate of structure and grace.

name: AVA Grace 2016 Fruity Silky Soft Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells and tastes overtly oaky, as notes of maple syrup, brown sugar and cinnamon blanket the mild fruit flavors underneath.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Aromas of blackberry leaf, plum and balsamic reduction lead the nose of this direct wine. It's medium in weight, with surprisingly gripping tannins and abundant black-fruit flavors.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This wine's jammy raspberry and plum aromas are stretched thin. The palate is soft, lacking acidity. Strawberry and cassis flavors lead to an herb-laced finish.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This Merlot's herbal berry aromas are tinged with brett and vinegar. It's tannic on the palate, without the body to support that kind of edginess. Its plum and currant flavors are grassy and green, and its tannins are scratchy.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Stewed plum aromas lead the nose of this wine, losing clarity with airing. It smacks of superficial acidity and tastes of plums and berries, with a touch of chocolate in the backdrop. The finish is creamy and artificial-seeming in both flavor and texture.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Light and easy, this offers softly spiced plum and cherry tones throughout the nose and mouth. The palate is clean and direct, with fleeting tannins and a light, tart-fruit accent on the close.

name: Kuleto Estate 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This brilliant garnet colored wine has aromas of black cherry and raspberry that translate to the palate. The finish is bright and crisp.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Garnet in the glass, this wine has aromas of red cherry, vanilla and black raspberry. On the palate, there are flavors of cherry vanilla and cocoa powder that are bolstered by chewy tannins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Vivid cherry and strawberry flavors give a cheery personality to this generous wine. It smells bright and fruity, and tastes more ripe, showing light spicy accents and a good focus on fruit.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This wine's generic berry aromas are earthy and a touch baked, with clove and chocolate notes. The palate is dense and blocky, with leafy berry and chocolate flavors that finish with a residual minty note.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Sweet spice and potpourri grace the black plum core of this accessible wine. It's medium in acidity and soft in tannin, with a clean, fruit-forward finish. Drink now.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe plum, chocolate-covered cherry and boysenberry flood the nose and palate of this straightforward but easy-drinking wine. It's rich in sweet-fruit flavors, but not overdone, with soft tannins that lend a touch of texture.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of underripe elderberry, black currant, sweet smoke and chocolate cake make for an intriguing (if unfamiliar) nose on this bottling from a new producer in Atascadero. Ripe flavors of prune ice cream, figs and raisins show on the sip, which shows decent acid and texture.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Ruby in the glass, this wine has aromas of freshly baked cherry pie and red plum. On the palate, there are flavors of cherry preserves and black plum.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Conner Lee (42%), Dionysus (33%), Bacchus (21%) and Stillwater Creek vineyards. Its medicine cabinet, dried cherry, pencil lead and woodspice aromas lead to fruit leather flavors. It seems dried out.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of cherry, vanilla and freshly baked brioche carry the nose. The palate is smooth in feel, with soft tannins supported by flavors of tart cherry and plum.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This wine is very flavorful and unapologetically oaky, from the smoky aromas to the almost-sweet maple and brown-sugar flavors that blend with a jammy fruit character. It is quite deep in color, saturated in flavor but not overly full bodied.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: This wine's light aromas suggest woodspice and cherry. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors, showing pleasing texture and a tart finish. There's a barbeque note that seems out of place.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Red plum, baking spice, dewy herbs, tobacco and a sour licorice aroma show on the nose of this well-known wine. The palate is more flat but clean, with simple tart pomegranate flavors.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine's subdued aromas of sticks, spices, blackberries and coffee are followed by a smoky, gritty palate with blackberry flavors. The tannins seem quite dry and scratchy.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: This wine's aromas are light, with herb, raspberry and spice notes. The palate offers grainy, astringent tannins. It doesn't all come together.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Wet cedar, dark cherry and pine smoke show on the nose of this well-distributed bottling. Dark red fruits and wood spice come through on the palate, which is framed by a sticky texture and lingering acidity.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Fans of The Prisoner will like this broadly juicy blend of 81% Merlot with Syrah, Petite Sirah and Malbec, the body full and fleshy. Ripe in baked plum and chocolate, it's robust and smooth.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Cool-climate aromatics open this wine, which drinks heavier in dark plum, dark chocolate and an earthy compost note. The acidity is uplifting, if not somewhat disjointed, and quiet on the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is an herbal offering of the variety, correct in some of its cedar and dried herb components. Dusty oak and tannin define a moderate structure of warm, supple plum and baked cherry steeped in cinnamon.

name: Imagery 2016 Pallas Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a thick, full-bodied and herbal reserve wine, light in fruit while robust in oak, the elements integrated and textured. Cedar and dried herb coat the finish, with a lasting taste of graphite.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Ripe while still firmly tannic, this wine is still very young. It has a tough character from the dry extraction and new-wood aging, leaving a bitter edge that needs to soften. Made from organically grown grapes, the wine will likely be ready to drink from 2022.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This 100% varietal wine comes mainly from the Wahluke Slope. Its bittersweet chocolate, blue fruit, peanut shell, cherry, herb and anise aromas are followed by plush fruit and barrel flavors. It's a lot of wine for the price.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this widely available, decent everyday red shows black cherry, charcoal and a strong rocky element on the nose. The juicy red fruits show strongly on the sip at first, and then comes more herbaceous oregano, marjoram and pepper. Acidity and structure rise into the finish.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend from Seven Hills, Pepper Bridge and Octave vineyards brings distinctive raspberry, cedar, orange zest, black cherry, plum, flower and spice notes. This is supported by firm tannins that need time to soften.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Strong aromas of cedar and pipe tobacco meet with dried cherry on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard south of San Jose. That pipe tobacco element is also heavy on the palate, along with wood spice and dark intense red fruit.

name: St. Francis 2016 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine's plum, black raspberry and spice aromas are followed by light fruit flavors speckled with vanilla accents. The tannins bring a light grip, with lingering barrel notes.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine comes primarily from Stonemarker Vineyard. Its aromas intrigue, recalling black cherry candy, dark flowers, sage, mint, anise and barrel spices. The palate is smooth and polished but trails on the finish. It's a unique offering of the variety.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Herbal and perfumed, this is a tannic, grippy and complex red, sourced from throughout the county. Peppercorn, cedar and chocolate-covered berries define the pleasant array of flavors.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This old-vine bottling is soft and ripe on the nose with blueberry and black-currant aromas proving delicate but inviting. The palate deftly balances acid and tannins, with more currant flavors as well as turned earth and dried herbs.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Plush aromas of dark strawberry, blueberry and lilacs make for a very full nose on this extremely well-priced bottling, which is available across the country. The blueberry flavor extends to the palate, yet the smoked meat, char and pepper-spice flavors give savory depth to the wine.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is impressive in spicy clove, powerful plum and supple lengthy layers of flavor surround in polished tannin. It finishes with a silky smoothness that's not easy to forget.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Fairly light and restrained on the nose, this bottling from a winery founded in 1987 offers pleasant tones of vanilla, red cherry and baked cranberry on the nose. The palate is fresh, with tight red-currant and baking spice flavors that are framed by grippy tannins.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Black olive marks the opening of this soft, spicy and ripe wine, well integrated in its marriage of fruit, acidity and oak. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, showing a lasting balance of clove and dark chocolate on the finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Blended with 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot, this is a thick and concentrated showing of the variety, plush and lushly spicy in clove and cinnamon. The fruit is plummy and rich in dark cherry, toasted oak and vanilla tea.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Burly yet structured, this robust varietal wine, blended with 3% Cabernet Franc, is supple with underlying grip. Big boned in style, it offers a wealth of bold cassis, dark cherry and sage.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Most of the fruit for this wine comes from a block of Conner-Lee Vineyard planted in 1992. Somewhat light in color, it offers appealing raspberry, chocolate, dried herb and spice aromas and soft, supple fruit flavors, with light savory herb accents from the addition of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Juicy fruit flavors linger on the finish. It shows lovely balance and texture.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: This inky violet wine has blackberry, espresso and smoke aromas. It feels good on the palate, with soft tannins and cassis, cherry preserves, pomegranate and baking spice flavors. It offers a bright splash on the finish.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Blackberry and juniper aromas set the scene for cherry, black plum, white chocolate, orange zest and eucalyptus flavors in this wine. Smooth tannins provide the backdrop for its nice mix of fruit and savory characteristics, while the long-lasting finish is marked by a chocolate note.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Dark red-violet in the glass, this wine has cherry and orange rind aromas. It fills the palate with flavors of black cherry, pomegranate, orange and aniseed, offering velvety tannins and a smooth finish.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Soft, supple and dusty, this 100% varietal wine is subtle in plum, cedar and graphite, showing a nice complexity on the midpalate of textured full-bodied ripeness. The tannins are present and polished.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Hailing from Seven Hills, Loess, Leonetti Old Block and Mill Creek Upland vineyards, this is a standout offering of this variety. Its anise, dark fruit, mocha, spice, flower, earth and green pepper aromas lead to focused fruit flavors, with a firm spine of tannin, bright acidity and finish that carries. The structure augurs well for its longevity. Best 2021–2026.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a ripe, sophisticated wine. Its structure and tannins give it weight, concentration and richness. Berry fruits, spice from wood aging and a generous texture all contribute to this fine wine. Drink from 2023.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Dark raspberry, milk chocolate and coffee aromas lead to lightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. Smoky notes linger on the finish. It doesn't seem to have fully settled in, and the concentration seems a bit light.

name: Paumanok 2015 Estate Bottled Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Aromas of Band-Aid, dried cherry and dried orange peel are followed by Fruit Roll-Ups flavors. It all seems dried out.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of barrel spice, red apple and cherry are followed by nicely textured fruit flavors. The tannins bring a lot of grit and grip.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Graphite, high-toned cherry, vanilla and herb aromas lead to somewhat elegantly styled fruit flavors. The tannins bring a bit of grip.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is half from Ferguson Vineyard with the other half from Seven Hills. The aromas are light and high toned, with notes of red cherry, mocha, dark chocolate and spice. The flavors are medium bodied, with tart acidity and quite firm tannins that need some time to soften.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Cocoa, vanilla and red-fruit aromas are followed by supple, rich fruit and barrel flavors. The barrel influence seems primary but there are good things going on.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: The aromas offer notes of raspberry, spice, red apple and herb, not seeming entirely settled. The flavors are lighter in style, with a slightly stewed feel.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Somewhat lighter in color for the variety, aromas of fresh herb, flower, tire rubber, mocha and cherry are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. The tannins bring a slightly gritty feel.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This generous wine is rich in black fruits and has a soft texture. The producer is a Merlot specialist and it shows in the deft handling of this grape in the coastal setting of Bairrada. The wine is full while also having a core of acidity and light wood-toast flavors at the end. Drink this wine now.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine starts out ever so slightly reduced, opening to reveal aromas of raspberry, berry, vanilla and spice. The palate mixes fruit and barrel, showing a pretty sense of texture. Vanilla notes linger on the finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: The aromas are high register, with notes of flower, bittersweet chocolate, slightly dried-out cherry and black licorice. The palate has a firm sense of structure, with well-integrated tannins and abundant cherry flavors.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas are not yet ready to reveal their charms, with notes of barrel spice, dried dill and red fruit. The cranberry, raspberry and barrel flavors, meanwhile, show generosity and plushness. The barrel influence seems a bit heavy.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Aromas of dark raspberry, pencil lead and baking spice are followed by focused well-balanced red-fruit flavors that persist on the finish. It's an impressive offering of the variety.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Baking-spice, dried dill, cedar box, vanilla and red-fruit aromas lead to soft textured rich raspberry flavors backed by grainy tannins. It's a no-holds- barred interpretation of the variety.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: The aromas and flavors show notes of baking spice, vanilla, coconut, cherry and anise, mixing fruit and barrel. The tannins are lightly grainy in feel, with coconut flavors on the warm finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This is a true unicorn wine—an almost never seen variety from this vineyard where the vines were subsequently removed after this vintage. Starting out slightly reduced, it opens to reveal aromas of macerated cranberry, black raspberry and red currant. The flavors are concentrated and rich, showing a sense of layering. It's quite ripe for the winery's style but delicious all the same, showing a sense of purity given to the neutral oak aging.

name: St. Francis 2016 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is unduly green and chalky on the palate, with a disjointed approach to acidity. Full bodied and robust, it struggles to maintain structure.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Strong aromas of green pepper, herb and currant lead to quite lightly styled fruit flavors. It all seems quite underripe.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Muddled boysenberry and plum sauce aromas unfold on the nose of this smooth, ripe wine, followed by flavors of black cherry and plum that finish with a sweet edge. A hint of warmth appears on the close, alongside a touch of milk chocolate.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are quite reticent and hard to get at. The palate brings plentiful red-fruit flavors and grippy tannins, with a tire rubber note that distracts.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Light aromas of soil, dried herb, dried cranberry, licorice, barrel and cherry are followed by anise and cranberry-filled flavors that trail on the finish. It doesn't all seem to come together, with the structure seeming lacking.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: A subtle warmth graces the nose of this bottling, lifting the rich black-raspberry and boysenberry characteristics. Earthy scents of peat and pepper unfold in the back, while the medium-weight, satiny palate returns to rich, plush black-fruit flavors dusted in clove.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: The aromas pop, with notes of raspberry jam, cherry and spice. The cocoa and jammy red-fruit flavors are light and appealing, tapering toward the finish. It's a straight down the fairway offering of the variety.

name: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: High-toned exotic spice, dark raspberry and barrel aromas are followed by focused, supremely rich fruit flavors that lead to a warm finish. Firm tannins provide support. For those who question if Merlot can be a serious wine, this is your answer.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of braised green pepper, blueberry, coffee and herb are followed by lightly sweet, medium-bodied fruit flavors. It provides a lot of easy-drinking appeal, though the variety seems a bit hard to find.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Spicy plum and berry aromas are green and grassy. A basic palate with adequate structure is drawing. Plum and berry flavors are generic, while this value-priced Merlot tastes herbal and saucy on the finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Spicy berry aromas are oaky and deliver an odd citrusy scent. A chunky palate offers just enough structure and balance to be taken seriously. Plum and berry flavors are a touch green and grassy, while this holds on to its minty green essence on the finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Spicy, herbal dark plum aromas are peppery, soupy and a touch green. This Merlot feels hard and pinched, with chewy but rough tannins. Highly herbal flavors of juniper and green herb lend a saucy character to dark berry fruit flavors, while this is lightly green and tannic on the finish.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Light-red fruit, crushed gravel and a hint of gunmetal aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied on the palate with lots of turned soil flavors and just a touch of red fruit.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Berry and black plum aromas are herbaceous and suggest eucalyptus and hot pavement. A forward palate is edgy and grabby in feel, while highly herbal plum and berry flavors lean toward green. Saucy, herbal, soupy flavors dominate a thick finish.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Overextracted aromas of tangy black plum and blackberry jam show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe flavors of black-plum juice prove too tangy and nearly vinegar-like.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Generic black fruit aromas are earthy and oaky. A crisp, smacking palate is short on body and stuffing, while this tastes tart and snappy, with tomato and herbal red plum flavors. A short, scouring finish is indicative of moderately ripe Merlot.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Toast, plum, herb and cherry aromas are followed by light, slightly sweet seeming fruit flavors. The tannins seem quite bunched up, not appearing to have fully ripened, and the fruit concentration a bit light.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Red cherry and turned earth show on the simple but clean nose of this bottling. Tart red fruit and more dusty qualities show on the sip, with a hint of vanilla on the finish.

name: Watermill 2017 Estate Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This wine possesses a hearty helping of tannin and herbal elements that won't appeal to all. Full bodied and concentrated in ripeness, the dried herbs and cedar dominate on the nose and palate. Small amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec are blended in.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of ripe blueberry and blackberry mingle with vanilla and pumpkin spice on the nose. The fruit forward palate shows plum and cranberry backed by dried leaves, nutmeg and vanilla. The tannins are dusty yet structured, while the acidity is tied to the berry flavors and weaves in and out. It finishes with a tart berry flavor loaded with cracked pepper and earthy.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This single-vineyard Bulgarian Merlot has aromas of cotton candy, ripe cherry and fruits of the woods. In the mouth, there are flavors of ripe cherry, black berry and cassis.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Baked red-cherry, vanilla, baking-spice and turned earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Strong herbs, from oregano to thyme, show on the sip, alongside tangy red fruit flavors.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: A savory nose offers violets and herbes de Provence mingled with vanilla, black currant and wild blackberry. The palate is smooth in feel, with sandy tannins and bright acidity housing flavors of tart cranberry and raspberry alongside vanilla, tobacco leaf and cinnamon. Black plum and leather tones linger on the grippy, tannic finish.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: The nose of this bottling is quite shy, offering hints of black cherry, dark berry and loam with patience. The palate shows simple berry and earth flavors, with a touch of tannic tension.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Licorice dominates the nose of this Texas Merlot, with additional notes of plum, rhubarb and black pepper. On the palate, black raspberry and cherry flavors give way to a licorice tone, bolstered by gravelly tannins. The finish is spicy and tannic.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: Tight aromas of dark berry, cedar and wet lumber show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the southern reaches of Paso Robles. Twiggy, herbaceous flavors meet with red fruit on the palate, which is framed by chunky tannins.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Blended with just over 9% Syrah and a touch of Zinfandel, this is a thick, densely structured red, offering flavors of mocha, cherry and plum. The secondary aspects dive into herbal territory, a mix of dried herb, cedar and pencil shavings.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: From the Texas expansion of this Colorado-based winery, this Merlot displays a distinctly spicy aroma of cinnamon, licorice and cracked black pepper backed by blackberry and dark cherry. The medium-bodied palate is generous in feel, with flavors of pomegranate, black currant and charred wood that are balanced by steady acidity and gripping tannins. Cinnamon, black pepper and raspberry emerge on the finish.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This expressive wine offers floral and fruit aromas, with touches of volatility and bold oak spice. It has a firm structure, mouthwatering acidity and a considerable layer of well-integrated tannins that easily support all the black cherry and violet flavors.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: High toned, unsettled aromas of dried Rainier cherry, spice and a medicinal note are followed by tightly wound fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.

name: Four Lanterns 2016 Sardius Merlot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Light in color, aromas of graphite, herb, cherry and raspberry are followed by light fruit flavors. It's a pleasant example of the variety, coming from a somewhat difficult vintage for Merlot, particularly from this appellation.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Crushed red flowers, thyme, wet rocks and rusty earth make for a compelling nose on this bottling. The palate proves extremely tangy, with strawberry balsamic sauce flavors and white pepper on the finish.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Herbal in dried herb and sage, this is a rich and softly pleasing wine, with moderate structure and a chalky aspect tot he texture. The core flavors dip into chocolate mocha and baked cherry.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: All varietal, barrel aromas are out front, with notes of vanilla and exotic spice. The red-fruit flavors are lighter styled and seem ever so slightly dried out. The variety is a bit hard to find.

name: Paraduxx 2016 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Toast, coffee, berry and herb aromas are followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. It all seems a bit dialed back.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This blends in handfuls of Petite Sirah, Malbec and Petit Verdot, adding to the wine's thick concentration and full-bodied density. Reduced on the nose, it unfurls layers of leather, tobacco and plum within a larger context of chocolate and tobacco.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Though this red bubbly wine may explode all over the kitchen, the hassle is worth the effort. Aromas of black cherry, tart boysenberry and clove lead into full-flavored palate of blackberry and baking spice. The mouthfeel is quite lavish and there's the slightest sense of sweetness.

name: St. Francis 2016 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is 100% Merlot. High-toned aromas of coffee, graphite, licorice, black raspberry and spice lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that paint around the edges, missing in the middle. There are good things going on if the midpalate fleshes out.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Red-cherry, wood-smoke and crushed graphite aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft and luxurious on the palate at first but then come more rigid, chalky tannins, carrying flavors of black cherry and oak.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose and aromatic in balsamic, this wine features tight-grained oak and a sizable grip of tannin, with dense, layered flavors of blackberry, dark cherry and leather.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of char and toasty oak in front of red fruit. The fruit and barrel flavors are lithe, with the tannins bringing a slightly grainy feel. The oak shows prominently at present.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Chalky tannins wrap around sizable oak, sage, tobacco and cedar in this full-bodied 100% varietal wine. An herbaceous component dominates on the back of the palate.

name: Borsao 2016 Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Medium-intense and slightly creamy in feel, this plush, ripe wine boasts upfront notes of blackberry, boysenberry and raspberry on the nose and mouth. The fruity core is partnered with a backdrop of vanilla and sweet spice, all framed by dusty tannins that lend a satiny texture. Final hints of bramble and cocoa grace the finish.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Green herbs and wild berries typify this wine from the western benches of the Okanagan. There are ample streaks of smoke and char around tart berry fruit, and 21 months spent resting in new French oak adds dark chocolate and amplifies astringent tannins.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Dense tannins and ripe, juicy black fruits give this wine concentration and richness. The 100% Merlot from a fine year is structured and powered by wood and spice flavors, delivering a persistent aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2021.

name: Tapiz 2013 Las Notas de Jean Claude Red (Mendoza)
description: Penetrating and inviting aromas of candied cherries and sweet cedar show on the nose of this estate bottling. The palate combines both ripe red cherries with slightly underripe fruit flavors alongside pencil shavings, dried herbs and chalky tannins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Black-cherry and caramel aromas show on the familiar, straightforward nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. It's very cleanly made, with crushed blackberry, crushed slate and smoked wood flavors on the palate.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Herbal and grippy, this medium-bodied wine offers tones of red plum, dried herb and a touch of graphite. It has a lasting streak of freshness that supports the fruit.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This wine blends in 15% Petite Sirah, adding to its dense, rich and rounded character. Aromatic in clove and black pepper, it tastes of blackberry cobbler and vanilla oak.

name: Imagery 2016 Pallas Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Made with 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc, this is juicy in cherry and berry, a fruit-forward and roundly soft wine that's pleasantly structured, full bodied and fresh.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Deep aromas of boysenberry, slate and pine show on the nose of this bottling from an appellation in San Benito County. Turned loam flavors arise on the earthy palate, which also offers dark cherry, strong acidity and firm structure that still needs some time to smooth out.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Juicy, rich and with layers of wood and tannins, this is a concentrated wine. The toasty wood-aging flavors are still prominent, giving the wine a bitter edge at this stage. That will blow off as the wine matures and black-currant flavors takes center stage. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and smaller amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this wine is thick, dense and dusty in tannin. Flavors of mocha, cherry and clove dominate on the well-integrated, full-bodied palate, finishing in dried herb and coffee bean.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a fine wine, blended with 12% Petit Verdot and 9% Cabernet Sauvignon. Perfumed in violet and sage, it has grip and expansive weight flavored in red currant and plum. The finish is soft, lush and dusted in cocoa powder.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine that celebrates its strength and softness in equal measure, this wine delights in crayon wax, dried herb and red currant, the initial elements complemented in black plum, clove and cedar. Savory and tannic, it shows a balanced approach to its full-bodied ripeness on the lasting finish.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Grown at high elevation, this is 100% varietal. Thick in mocha, oak and dusty sage, it speaks to strong tannin and oak, providing a punch of full-bodied ripeness and chocolate-covered plum.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Without added sulfur, this ripe, berry-flavored wine has intense fruitiness and acidity. It comes from two parcels of Merlot producing ripe, jammy fruit as well as good acidity. The tannins are fully integrated, giving a wine that is solid, dense and juicy. Drink from 2021.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal expression of this fine grape, in this case from a relatively cool climate, this sings in brambly black-cherry, mocha and graham cracker richness, its texture soft and supple on the midpalate. Tremendous aromatics give it a memorable lift and length, elegant to the end.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Great concentration and good balance make this medium- to full-bodied wine enjoyable. It has an intense dark color and plenty of ripe red- and black-cherry aromas and flavors that flood the layered, saturated mouthfeel.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Under the same ownership as the Rothschild property Château Clarke in Moulis, this estate predominately grows Merlot. This wine comes from a selected parcel that gives rich, intense and concentrated fruitiness and dense tannins. It shows a lightly burnt character from the wood aging but the blackberry fruits are dominant and ripe. Drink from 2021.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Powerful ripe fruits and rich tannins come together in this jammy Merlot with a dark texture. Packed with spice, berry flavors and toasty wood aging accents, the wine is still young. It needs time for the impressive fruit to come through, so drink from 2022.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Cinnamon-covered cherry and black currant highlight this beautifully layered, spicy and complex example of the variety—a well-made, full-bodied effort that finishes in a dusting of cocoa powder and coconut.

name: Byron Blatty 2016 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Hugely concentrated and a touch reduced, this is a lovely, generously full-bodied wine, rich as a dark-cherry cobbler in flavor. The barrel oak is pronounced and supportive of the wine's seasonings of black pepper, violet and plum. The ripeness and richness are profound, met by a structure that suggest further cellaring; enjoy best 2025–2030.

name: Cricket Hill 2014 Midnight Diamond Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Here, harsh acidity underscores a disjointed experience of high-toned red currant with coconut and leathery tannin.

name: St. Francis 2016 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: Overripe fruit from a small experimental vineyard is the hallmark of this wine. The awkwardness is not helped by the extracted tannins.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: The aromas are light and hard to tease out, with notes of herb, coffee and bittersweet chocolate emerging over time. On the palate, the concentration is quite faint and the tannins gritty.

name: Ata Rangi 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)
description: Reduced and brimming in barrel oak, this is a full-bodied, concentrated and ageworthy wine, flavored in strong layers of baked plum, cinnamon and soy. As it opens, generous helpings of blueberry and fig figure into the mix, adding to the complexity. Enjoy 2025–2030.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is smoky and aromatic, showing whiffs of tobacco and the dark highlights that typify the winery's four Merlots. The palate brings roasted cherry fruit, and finishing streaks of coffee, licorice and dark chocolate.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is sourced from the Osoyoos East Bench and the Black Sage Bench. It's concentrated and dark, with savory herbs and lush flavors of roasted black fruit, smoke, char, licorice and espresso. Impressively, the tannins remain polished and proportionate.

name: Cricket Hill 2014 Midnight Diamond Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Extremely extracted and concentrated aromas of cherry syrup and grenadine show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is sweet and syrupy with cherry-balsamic flavors.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Braised green pepper, herb and tar aromas are followed by lightly sweet plum flavors. It's extremely green for the variety.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Quite shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and sandalwood with patience. The palate is a bit flat, with basic red-fruit and wild herb flavors.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Sweet oak aromas and candied fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine a pop personality. It has a soft texture, light tannins and quite a bit of vanilla and oak spices.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: A charred wood aroma and toasted bread flavors stand out in this medium-bodied oaky-flavored wine, masking much of the fruit flavor that might lie beneath.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This fresh, twist-top bottling makes for a great weekday table win, starting with aromas of light red fruit, oregano and damp wood. There's a strong herbal kick to the palate, which gives depth to the tangy cranberry fruit and lighter texture.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: The aromas are light and difficult to get at, while the palate brings dark fruit flavors that are reserved in style, tapering on the finish. It doesn't all seem to come together.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Red cherry aromas and a creamy texture highlight this medium-bodied, well-priced and certified sustainable wine. It has good concentration to keep your interest and very smooth tannins for easy drinking.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: One of the inaugural releases from this winery, it is a blend of fruit from Seven Hills and Summit View vineyards. The aromas are fruit forward and fascinate, with notes of plum, raspberry and Twizzlers. The palate is soft, showing an almost Pinot-esque feel. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery, a unique offering of the variety.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Ripe, rich and full bodied, this opulent wine from a San Luis Obispo producer has plenty of fruit aromas and flavors shaded by chocolate and baking-spice nuances. It's all at a reasonable price for the level of quality.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Well rounded aromas of red cherry, wood smoke, cowboy leather and earth make for a very accessible entry to the nose of this affordably priced wine. There is a strong snap to the palate and an impressively chalky grip, offering flavors of dark cherry, cranberry and, on the finish, some vanilla.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This is a sturdy, well-balanced wine, with supportive tannins and refreshing acidity that carries ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry. It will be just the thing for a steak, roast or stew.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Excellent fruit concentration and very good balance make this full-bodied wine a winner. Minty cedary aromas accent the vivid black-cherry and pomegranate flavors as moderate tannins and fresh acidity add appetizing structure.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This medium-bodied wine matches ripe black-plum and -cherry flavors with light yet firm tannins. A sense of concentration and density comes through on the palate and encourages the lingering finish.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has inviting aromas of black plum, cedar and bay leaf. The concentrated, savory palate doles out black currant jam, clove, vanilla and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a big, structured, full-bodied Merlot that feels moderately tannic in texture and gushes with ripe plum and black-cherry flavors. A light minty aroma and attractive oak spices work well to add complexity.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Touches of dried herbs and black olives in the aromas and flavors give an authentic appeal to this full-flavored and full-bodied wine. A hint of spicy oak enhances the experience but doesn't overwhelm the fruity, savory aspects that are so enjoyable.

name: Sevtap 2016 Sunday Kind of Love Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The aromas seem overripe and slightly volatile, along with notes of baking spice, cherry and licorice. Rich, extracted fruit flavors follow but without the structure to hold them up.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: The aromas bring notes of braised green pepper and cherry. The palate comes off as quite light, with the concentration lacking.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Juicy fruits and soft tannins give a light wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2020.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Blackberry, black cherry, herb and volatile aromas are at the fore. The flavors come off as light for the listed alcohol level, trailing toward the warm finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Saucy aromas of tomato soup, plum, berry and green herb come up a bit short of ripe and tantalizing. This feels solid but scratchy and tannic. Flavors of plum and green bell pepper are even more herbal and green-leaning on the finish.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: Ripe strawberry and red cherry fruits abound in this wine, along with some floral and vanilla notes. The medium-bodied palate offers juicy fruit with chewy, grainy tannins. The alcohol feels a little hot. Drink up.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Resting solidly in the medium-bodied spectrum, this wine offers primary red berry and cassis fruit geling with the vanillin oak aromas and flavors, offering a touch of mint and dried herbs for interest. Softly textured with plump fruit and enough acidity to make another sip an easy endeavor, this is a simple drop with an short finish but an attractive price point.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: A broad, concentrated and 100% varietal wine, this is smoky in meat and blackberry jam, its tannic weight substantial and grippy.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: The aromas are reticent, with notes of graphite, vanilla, raspberry jam and cherry, with the oak out front. Dark fruit flavors follow, with the oak taking over the show.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: A tad unbalanced and hot, this is nevertheless an easy-going sipper full of plump red fruits and touches of soy sauce, mushroom and eucalyptus. The tannins are chewy and leathery and don't knit together as well as you'd hope but they get the job done.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: A blend of fruit from Olsen (60%) and Boushey vineyards. Spice, dark plum and cherry aromas are followed by ripe, saturated fruit flavors, with the oak (all second fill) pulled back. A cranberry-filled finish follows. It shows a pleasing sense of purity, though the concentration is light.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 14% Cabernet Franc, this succeeds in its light-bodied palate of red currant, cranberry and plum, with secondary characteristics of pencil shavings and graphite. The midpalate is thick and concentrated, finishing with elegance.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: While this wine has a dry core, berry flavors accompany the dry tannins. From a 45-acre estate, this ripe, juicy wine shows the structure of the vintage and the rich fruits. Drink from 2021.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: The aromas are light and hard to tease out, with whiffs of herb and spice. The flavors are light but juicy and ripe, painting around the edges with firm tannins in the middle. Give it time to open.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas come out of the gate lightly reduced, followed by notes of graphite, blackberry jam, plum and spice. The palate brings a pretty sense of styling, with the concentration light in the middle, but otherwise delivering a sense of appeal.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: There's a very strong woody element to the nose of this bottling, starting with cedar and grainy oak, as well as blackberry. The wood spice shows strong on the palate too, along with berry and caramel flavors.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Saucy aromas of black plum, stewed herbs and tomato precede a beefy palate cut by ringing acidity. Saucy berry, bell pepper and tomato sauce flavors fade out on a finish that's chunky, full and sound.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: High-toned acidity lifts a delicate offering of cinnamon, plum and blueberry in this soft, round and approachable red.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Flower, soil, herb, spice and black cherry aromas lead to ripe dark fruit flavors that taper ever so slightly toward the cocoa-filled finish. There is a lot to like.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Merlot may be a much maligned variety in the States, but particularly at this price point, it offers a drinkability that's hard. Yalumba's version has plenty of red and black fruit but it also shows anise, wet earth, mocha and mint amidst a medium-body, stony texture and lean, tongue-gripping tannins.

name: Barton & Guestier 2018 Réserve Sauvignon Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This simple but thoroughly drinkable wine offers upfront raspberry, pepper, violet and eucalyptus notes. The fruit is a little sweet, but there's enough acidity to prop it up, as well as chalky tannins and a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a jammy wine, produced in a clay amphora. It is full of the extra-ripe fruit typical of the vintage. However the wine works because the tannins are not excessive, giving space to the red-berry flavors and just enough acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers cool-climate characteristics of spice, turned earth and pencil. Its plummy fruit is largely structured around a robust body of power and weight. Aged in both French and American oak, it persists on the finish in a mix of black pepper and sage.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Black cherry, wet loam, damp cedar and a pinch of cocoa show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tense with tannins and searing acid, though intense boysenberry flavors do peek through.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Ripe, fruity and spicy, this is already an attractive wine. Bright red fruits are neatly supported by the tannins and smoky, new-wood flavors. This structured wine from the Noël family, growers since 1800, will be ready from 2021.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Made entierly from Merlot, this wine is smoothly textured, with tannins cushioned by the ample black fruits. With its blackberry flavors and dense texture, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Dried herbs, dark red cherry, crushed slate and smashed twigs show on the nose of this bottling from the southern Paso Robles region. The herbaceous character is deftly integrated into the palate's black-cherry fruits, all framed by tight tannins.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Sanguine in red currant and cherry, this full-bodied wine is juicy, soft and round, with polished tannins and integrated oak. It impresses with its ability to offer varietal character and overall approachability.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Dark-chocolate flavors are happily balanced by ripe black fruits that give this wine weight. It has a good long-term future, with plenty of wood aging playing with the rich fruitiness. The wine is produced by Bordeaux-born Jean Lissague. Drink from 2022.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Hearty red-fruit and graham cracker richness mark this well-made wine, blended with 8% Cabernet Sauvignon. A generous tannin structure provides a framework for the ripe weight as the finish explores aspects of sweet tobacco.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine notes of red currant and plum meet a light dusting of baking spice and clove in this well-made, well-integrated wine. It shows a heartiness of full-bodied richness and toasted oak.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Reduced at first, this wine comes around to reveal soft layers of baked plum, graham cracker and coffee. Full bodied and ripe, it offers a balanced oak nuance and a soft texture that speaks to the varietal character.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Spicy and structured, this wine has layers of firm tannins as well as plenty of ripe blackberry fruits. Oak aged for 12 months, it is already balanced, packed with fruitiness with the firm core giving a fine backup. Drink from 2020.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
