name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: With vines close to the Garonne river south of Bordeaux, this small vineyard has produced a light and fruity wine with red berry flavors. It's soft, just lightly tannic and ready to drink now.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Nelson Neves has made a rich wine, recognizably Portuguese in its tannic structure while also having a jammy, juicy red-fruit character that comes from the Merlot. This ripe wine is ready to drink.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon and aged for 28 months in French oak, this broad-shouldered red is powerfully concentrated and tightly wound. Raisin cake, cigar box and baked plum play nicely together within an intense texture of leathery spice.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This spicy wine, with its strongly minty flavors and touch of pepper, is also rich with fine black fruits. It shows its wood aging strongly, contrasting with berry flavors and acidity. The wine is still young and will be better from 2019.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a forceful, simple wine, with a slight herbaceous quality that keeps it varietal and cooler-climate in style and weight. Bright red fruit shines in a light-bodied frame.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and soft, this is an enjoyable well-crafted varietal wine, spicy in plum and cherry. Full bodied, the midpalate is relaxed and integrated in nuanced oak.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This soft wine is full of red fruit. It has a fine balance of acidity and gentle tannins. From the fruity 2012 vintage, it's now ready to drink.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Thick and chocolatey, this brawny wine is full bodied and richly concentrated. It is a mighty force of blackberry, blueberry and toasted oak.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Very pleasing aromas of red berries, wet slate and red flowers make for a very floral and fruity entry to this bottling from a single vineyard. The palate is very easy to enjoy as well, with fat red-cherry fruit, decently chalky tannins and hints of licorice and caramel toward the finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Aromas of mint, talcum powder and dried cherry lead you to a delightful palate of red and black plums and black raspberries. Soft tannins and a persistent finish make this a notable Bulgarian Merlot.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This 100% varietal wine, a steal of a deal, works in its offering of juicy plum, just enough grip and pleasant structure. Integrated oak helps it maintain a lightly firm texture on the palate, piquing in cranberry and red currant flavors on the finish.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Given additional structure from the addition of 21% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot, this well-made wine shows a wealth of plum and raspberry that's succulent on the palate. Soft supple tannin provides support and a touch of heat, the finish is awash in cinnamon and vanilla.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is brawny and blustery in style: big boned with a lot of heat. Sturdy tannins surround extracted black fruit and shards of cinnamon, with fresh tobacco taking root on the finish.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: This is a powerfully structured wine from one of the pioneers of Merlot in Bairrada. It is dark with tannins while also brimming with great black-fruit flavors. Rounded, balancing fruit and acidity, the wine is smooth, rich and now ready to drink.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Made in a balanced and graceful style, this light-bodied red comes from vineyards in both Oak Knoll and Oakville. Tart cherry, plum and coconut shavings are supported by light oak and firm tannins. The finish is complex and spicy.

name: Joullian 2015 Hammler The Chief Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: Soft and layered, this perennially impressive vineyard-designate speaks highly of the variety, showing balanced offerings of plum, dark cherry, leather and spice. A smoky oak  character lies beneath the fruit, complementing it well, while an expansive tannic presence supports the wine's overall breadth and depth. Big boned, this is built to age yet entirely enjoyable now.

name: Director's Cut 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine offers an herbaceous nose of dusty gravel, bell pepper and thick black cherry, the body somewhat thin and simple in structure. The tannins pierce through on the finish.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Really flat on the nose, this shows aromas of black cherry and cedar. The palate offers bland cherry and blackberry fruit with a hint of pepper and leather.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Plum, baking spice and licorice aromas lead to lightly styled fruit flavors in this wine. The wood influence seems quite intense, distracting from the fruit.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Subtle dark-berry aromas meet with hearty spices, including pepper dust, cigar box and wood varnish. The oak is prominent throughout, with flavors of pine, bay leaf, eucalyptus oil and dried cherries on the sip.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Wood, sweet spice and plum aromas are out front in this wine. The palate is broad, with abundant plum flavors and astringent tannins. Baking spice notes linger on the finish. It's not obviously Merlot, but there's enjoyment to be had.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: With small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this is a reduced and juicy wine, showy in notes of oak and cinnamon. Juicy plum and black cherry provide concentrated fruit flavors alongside a richness of milk chocolate.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: A simple but appealing Merlot. Ripe red and black fruit, chocolate and some herbal oak notes are followed by a plush, fruity palate. The alcohol is a little hot but this is nevertheless an easygoing weeknight red.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Despite being a full four years old, this wine's aromas aren't yet fully revealing their charms, with high-toned vanilla, spice, cedar and cherry notes. The flavors are tightly wound as well, with a light gamy streak throughout. It's not clear if it will open with additional time or if what you see is what you get.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Barrel aromas are at the fore in this wine, with vanilla and baking spice notes in front of plum. The palate mixes fruit and barrel flavors, and drying tannins provide the frame.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This Moldovan Merlot carries aromas of black raspberry, vanilla and fresh red cherries. The smooth palate is balanced, with flavors of black raspberry and black cherry.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Pretty red fruit and herbs are backed by a little earthy, stalky notes. The palate is a little on the tart side, but it's also juicy and easygoing, with soft tannins and a light to medium body.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This is a dark fruited, dense Merlot, with notes of cola, cabbage leaf, fig and raisiny dark fruit. The palate has richness but it's balanced by lifted acidity, keeping it firmly in a medium-bodied bracket.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Hailing from Istria, this Croatian Merlot has aromas of blackberry, raspberry and red plum. In the mouth there are flavors of red plum and black cherry with a persistent finish.

name: Pride Mountain 2016 Vintner Select Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This is a sanguine Old World-style wine, rounded in tannin and generously soft. Coconut, bay leaf, cherry and vanilla give it a yin and yang quality that flirts with both savory and rich flavors, finding balance despite its full-bodied concentration.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a highly impressive wine that's 100% varietal and blissfully well-priced. Dusty blackberry cobbler comes first to mind, held in check by robust tannin and powerful structure. A wine that will appeal to Cabernet Sauvignon fans, it balances that power with a soft side embedded in peppery clove.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Hugely concentrated, this wine has power to spare, within its full-bodied richness and fruity succulence. Blackberry, black cherry and milk chocolate combine effortlessly to provide a pleasurable experience of complexity met by supportive acidity and exotic spice.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of black cherry, earthy rust, cedar and warm vanilla make for a very pleasing and standard nose on this bottling. There is a lot of baking spice on the palate as well as plums, black cherries, sandalwood and a hint of cocoa, making for a complex sip.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Red fruit aromas are at the fore in this wine, with pleasing raspberry and Red Vines notes, along with spice accents. The palate shows remarkable restraint, refinement and balance considering the warmth of the vintage, and its firm tannic core should allow it to evolve nicely for a few years in the cellar.

name: Domaine d'Arton 2017 La Croix d'Arton Red (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: All the secondary characters that come into play as a wine matures are really working for this Merlot. The fruit is heading into raisin territory; there're earthy, vineyard floor and horse saddle notes. The palate is silky and savory, although the oak is still a little obvious. Drink now with autumnal cuisine.

name: Cycles Gladiator 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Rustic gamy aromas of burnt leaves and stewed fruit are sketchy. A raw edgy palate feels tannic and resiny. Stalky berry flavors topped with forced oak end with a mix of wood resin and chocolate notes.

name: Midnight 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Huge oak and an intensity of ripe flavor give this wine a harsh edginess that's hard to dispel. Compost, coconut and a green hint of bay leaf or cedar mix in a disjointed way.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Built to be simple and cheery, at a solid price point, this wine is indeed simple and soft, with flavors of charred oak, soy, black cherry and an intensely herbaceous character.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: This value wine has an astringency that adds to an overall puckering notion of ripeness and oak. Earthy mushroom and compost underlie red fruit, yeast and cedar.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Aromas of licorice, prune and leather try hard to hold up but fade to herbal and soupy. High tartaric acidity throws the palate out of balance, while this tastes of generic plum and prune. A short chewy finish closes this out.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Very shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and baking spice aromas with patience. The palate is flat and dull yet inoffensive, with flavors of sweet red fruit, herbs and char on the finish.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Wood-heavy aromas of bacon and clove don't allow for much fruit expression. This is tannic and weighty on the palate, with flavors of baked berry fruits, clove and burnt wood. Bacon and clove notes remain out front on a finish that's all about oak.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This straightforward and fruity wine is relatively light bodied, offering juicy black cherry and strawberry flavors and a hint of sweetness. It's soft and easy to sip.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This deep ruby wine has a nose of blackberry, strawberry, sage and thyme. It is soft on entry, with a nice balance of fruit and spice flavors, in particular black cherry, dark plum, fennel, sage and mocha. The tannins start off very mild and gradually increase in intensity, lingering through a licorice and cherry finish.

name: Sevtap 2016 Sunday Kind of Love Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Barnyard aromas and massive, drying tannins really stand out in this unusually raw-boned wine. It smells earthy and smoky, tastes meaty and herbaceous, while the texture is full of potent, gripping astringency on first sip that eventually moderates with subsequent tastes.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Sweet-seeming oak aromas and flavors grab the attention in this medium-bodied wine, while moderate tannins and rather soft acidity make it easy to sip.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: While oak-driven on the nose, boasting swathes of espresso bean and cocoa nibs, there's a core of ripe cherry and plum that carries the palate. A judicious balance of acid keeps this wine in check, while mild-grained tannins offer further support. A slight note of green stems arises on the midpalate through the astringent finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Dark plum, mulberry, wet river stones and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this bottling. Candied pomegranate and baked red plum arise on the sip, with strong vanilla and baking spice flavors. The tannins are oddly both thin and chalky.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed asphalt and wet gravel meet with baked black cherry and a slight hint of herbs on the nose of this bottling. Though the acidity is balanced, the tannins are a bit clunky on the palate, where boysenberry, tar, cocoa and coffee flavors arise.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: Coming from one of the state's top vineyards and 100% varietal, this has aromas of cherry, cranberry, vanilla and freshly chopped wood which lead to tart cherry flavors that display a bitter note that distracts. Barrel aged for 20 months in 60% new French oak, the wood influence seems heavy, getting in the way of the finish.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: A rich, slight boozy, nose of brandied cherry, cinnamon and bubble gum spice leads to a primary, ripe palate. Medium in weight, with soft tannins, its showy fruit lingers on the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Oaky and extroverted, this full-bodied wine smells lightly smoky and full of baking spices. The flavors resemble sweet cherries, strawberry jam and a touch of maple.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Attractive dark-fruit flavors and a smooth texture lend a lot of appeal to this medium-bodied wine despite a reduced, earthy character in the aroma at first, which is not uncommon in screw-capped wines.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: The aromas seem unsettled, with notes of vanilla, baking spice and dark fruit that don't seem entirely in harmony. The palate is chock-full of raspberry and barrel-spice flavors, with loads of coconut on the finish. The aromas and flavors seem out of sync.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Dried blueberries, thick blackberry jam and gingerbread aromas show on the nose of this older bottling from the Agua Dulce region. The palate is thick and tarry with flavors of charred beef and more blueberries. It's still alive, at least.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of wood spice, dried herb and tire rubber, not seeming very varietal. The palate is ripe with plum and barrel flavors that paint around the edges. Mocha notes linger on the finish.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: A pleasant intensity of bramble-berry and red-currant aromas blend with a crushed black pepper tone on the nose. The palate is light and lithe, focused on tart red fruit, flecked with peppery tones. Mild, sandy tannins keep the feel smooth and linger on the cranberry-skin finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Very ripe and saturated with dark fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine combines a jammy character with wisps of smoke and grilled herbs. It gets points for good fruit concentration and feels smooth and full on the palate.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a well-behaved, nicely balanced wine with good cherry and sage flavors, an appetizing texture livened by light tannins and a touch of acidity. It should be versatile with food and easy to pour for a crowd.

name: H.L.R. Cellars 2016 Estate Merlot (Fountaingrove District)
description: This is a broad, deeply flavored wine, highlighted in dark plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors. Big boned, it offers a softness of texture accounted in clove and toasted oak.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Soft and varietal in nature, this wine offers dusty plum, leather and black currant and cherry, its structure simple and richly round. There's a hint of black licorice on the lengthy finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Showing the green, earthy side of the variety, this Merlot opens on aromas of fresh-cut herbs and eucalyptus, with dark cherry, plum, vanilla and cedar providing a dense core. Soft in feel, balanced acidity and building tannins provide a solid structure for the red plum and cranberry spice flavors to run rampant.

name: St. Francis 2016 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: The aromas of licorice, black fruit and dried herb bring a slightly baked quality. The flavors are full and up front, showing pleasing concentration while retaining elegance. There are a lot of good things going on here but I can't see them evolving much. Drink it in the near term.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of cherry, plum, herb, raspberry and wood spice. The flavors are rich, sappy and full, backed by soft tannins. Barrel notes linger on the finish.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Bright, fruity tones of red cherry resound on the nose, leading to a softly structured palate that carries more bright red fruit alongside shots of granite and vanilla. Aged 10 months in Hungarian oak, this is a straightforward, pleasing Merlot.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Coming from one of the state's coolest vintages, this comes in at an alcohol level rarely seen in modern day reds in the state. The aromas are a bit unusual for this variety, with notes of herb, blue fruit and wood, along with a light floral note. The palate brings sleekly styled fruit flavors backed by tart acidity, tapering toward the finish. Light medicinal notes linger.

name: St. Francis 2016 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine offers a wealth of structured tannins that integrate well with its fresh tart red fruit. Soy, baked bread and cedar add nuance and additional flavor.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: High-toned aromas of cherry and red plum mix with cinnamon and clove on the nose. Soft on the palate, with plenty of grip from building tannins, juicy red fruit carries to soft vanilla and earthy moss notes.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Seductive cinnamon aromas lead to ripe red-cherry flavors in this attractively oaky wine. It adds nutmeg and clove to a pleasant and almost sweet fruitiness, while the texture is smooth and just lightly tannic.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of char, plum, butterscotch, vanilla and spice, needing some coaxing to get at them initially. The palate mixes cherry and cranberry flavors that show intensity and length. There are good things going on but they don't all seem to come together at present.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: The aromas are light on first pour, opening up over time with notes of herb, cherry, wood spice and black licorice. The ripe currant flavors are a bit linear in style, but show polish and appeal, seeming ever so slightly dried out.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: A deep color and potent aromas of blackberry and black currant are the first impressions from this full-bodied, firmly structured and well concentrated wine. They lead to a palate full of deep blackberry flavors, a nicely dry balance and mouth-filling texture.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Soft and elegant on the nose, this bottling presents rounded violets, plump blackberries, broken asphalt and dried dill on the nose. The palate is plush with blueberry and lilac flavors that ride chiseled tannins and benefit from peppercorn and marjoram spices. It is complex and flavorful.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Striking tones of roasted coffee, cocoa and toasty oak ride over a dense core of ripe dark cherry and plum. The palate is silken in feel, with a plush, round texture supported by grainy tannins and bright acidity. More oak shows in the flavors, yet it's integrated among bright cherry, dark currant and granite tones which lead to a lingering dark cocoa finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Franc and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon from Riverbend, this wine principally comes from Red Mountain Vineyard. The aromas are all high toned at present, with notes of vanilla, herb and exotic spice, not quite ready to reveal their charms. The red-fruit flavors are plump in feel, lingering on the finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: A dark color and concentrated aromas of black cherry, cassis, licorice and even some charcoal are good indicators of what's coming—namely a dense palate with tartaric bite and ripe plum and blackberry flavors. A full finish with scratchy tannins tastes of chocolate and oak.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A slight reduction on the nose gives way to a brawny full-bodied expression of leather, black pepper and meat—the fruit elusive at first. Soft and sinewy, it shines on the finish in more discreet elements of cassis and red currant.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Fruit for this wine all comes from Riverbend Vineyard and saw just 10% new French oak. Blended with 17% Cabernet Sauvignon, a medley of fresh herbs pop on the aromas, which also show notes of cigar box and whiffs of pencil lead. The palate brings cranberry-tart fruit flavors that offer pleasing depth and stretch out on the finish. It provides a lot of quality and value.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Concentrated black cherry and black olive aromas have an earthy edge in this full-bodied wine, while the flavors are dry and potent black fruits with touches of dark chocolate. It's a well-structured wine that will improve through at least 2021.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Spicy bramble berry aromas take on a slight brandied character, bathed in anise and savory dried meat tones. The plush, silken palate boasts some additional savory streaks, with shots of cranberry acidity keeping the weight in check. Soft tannins offer just enough support to carry this wine to the lingering rich, cherry finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Immediately appealing on the nose, this reserve offers a wealth of aromas in brandied cherry, anise, clove and savory dried meat tones. The palate works to further integrate these notes into flavors of juicy cherry, rich plum and shots of cranberry. Sultry in feel, with integrated, bolstering tannins, drink this wine through 2020 to enjoy its luscious primary flavors and developing sanguine tones.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Mint and violet notes accent a dense black-cherry core in this full-bodied, juicy wine. Light touches of baking spices and dried herbs add complexity and play into a layering effect on the palate.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: The aromas show nuance, with notes of toast, assorted dried herb, cherry and plum. The fruit flavors are seamless in feel, showing concentration and depth. It's thoroughly enchanting.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is deep in fruit flavors, and has impressive structure in terms of extraction, body and an abundance of fine-grained tannin. It brings soft black cherry and cedar to the aroma, dark chocolate and blueberry to the palate and coats the mouth with a firm but velvety texture. Best after 2020.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Largely structured and weighty, this well-made wine is youthful in its grippy tannins and full embrace of huckleberry and black-cherry fruit, the exuberance tempered by complements of black licorice and toasted oak. This will be happy in the cellar; enjoy best 2024–2029.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: From a single site in Carneros, the Stewart Vineyard, this wine is exuberant in red fruit, with a sly hint of tobacco and tomato leaf. Big ripe tannins wrap around a meaty side show of garrigue and black pepper, finishing in elegant ripeness.

name: Denner 2016 Mother Of Exiles Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Blended with 10% Petit Verdot, this age-worthy beauty is impressively oaked and tannic in its youth, with a concentration of densely packed red and black currants. Coconut shavings and vanilla appear from the background alongside black pepper and cinnamon. This should drink best from 2024–2034.

name: Kuleto Estate 2015 Frog Prince Red (Napa County)
description: This wine is extreme in bay leaf and green, herbal flavors, with a touch of oxidation.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: This Merlot shows aromas and flavors of bright cherry, red plum and baking spices. The fruit comes off as tart on the palate but the oak spices are appealing. Not much tannic expression but a nice acidic lift keeps the finish going strong.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Merlot seems to struggle a bit in Oregon, lacking the volume of other West Coast versions. Quite tart with simple berry flavors, this wine shows no real flesh, but goes directly from a sappy start into a tangy finish.

name: Imagery 2016 Pallas Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: A hearty 12% Cabernet Sauvignon is added to this wine, which is aged in 100% French oak. Reduced, with sizable oak influence, it shows dried herb components wrapped in bittersweet black pepper and leather.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Dull aromatics open the way to thick dense red fruit, oak and a thickness of tannin in this estate-driven red which drinks heavy on the palate. Cedar and pencil shavings accent it well.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of red currant are bright and fresh, with little apparent new-oak influence. Raspberry and currant flavors bring more of the same. It's a straightforward, easy drinker.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Sourced from both Volcano Ridge and The Pines vineyards, this is a smooth, supple wine, 100% varietal, with a mix of plum and blueberry fruit. Somewhat high toned and bright, it is ready to drink over the next couple of years.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: All the winery's wines are 100% varietal, and this is a solid effort with substantial flavors of mulberry and blackberry fruit. There's a streak of cola and lightly earthy tannins. Flavors are broad and accessible, and the wine finishes with a streak of vanilla.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas of mint, woodspice, raspberry and coffee are followed by ripe red-currant flavors. Soft, lightly grainy tannins provide support. It has good things going on and is varietally correct but seems a bit woody.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in black cherry and smoky oak, this is a robust, richly ripe red, meaty and brawny in leather and blackberry jam.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This Merlot brings a lot of aromas and flavors to the table, with tones of baked red and black fruits, nutmeg, clove and balsamic. The tannins are silky and the acidity gives a fresh lift to the feel.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of black currant, vanilla and violet pave the way for flavors of tart cherry, strawberry, lavender and vanilla. Soft tannins lay a groundwork for bright fruit flavors that work their way across the entire palate, leading into a zippy cranberry finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Deep red-violet to the eye, this wine has aromas of dark plum, cherry and juniper. It might be a little too restrained for some, with flavors of black cherry and Red Delicious apple, joined by strong notes of eucalyptus, spearmint and anise. Smooth tannins fill the palate right into a cool mint finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Inviting aromas of cherry cordial, dried herb and chalk lead to generous, well-fashioned fruit flavors. Light tannins provide support.

name: Darioush 2015 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Aromas seem unsettled, with notes of dust, herb and cherry. The flavors are plush and ripe, delivering plenty of enjoyment.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a well-made approachable wine, aromatic in black cherry, cola and plum. Thick ripe flavors are highlighted in brick, black pepper and toasted oak.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A lieu-dit in French is a place historically recognized for what was there, a hazelnut (coudrat) tree. This wine comes from a single vineyard named after the trees grew there. It is a rich wine, packed with the bright fruit of the vintage as well as some firm tannins. Aged in wood, it has spice and toast as well as the black-currant fruits. Drink this wine from 2021.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: From one of the properties owned by the Ducourt family, this wine is structured and firm. It also has juicy fruit, rich tannins and plenty of crisp acidity, with a touch of spice from wood aging. With its firm tannins, it needs to age, so drink from 2021.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a hearty version of the variety, blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petite Sirah. Black licorice, Dr. Pepper and densely rich, extracted black cherry and blueberry accent a full-bodied softly textured palate of approachability.

name: Tapiz 2013 Las Notas de Jean Claude Red (Mendoza)
description: A bouquet of black plum, cassis and licorice leads into flavors of black cherry, raspberry, anise, white chocolate and violet. It is rich on the palate, with velvety tannins and touches of floral and spice notes on the finish.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: This soft, approachable red impresses in a mix of earthy mushroom, soy and cedar, its body thickly constructed around a core of ripe tannin and charred oak. Well structured, it finishes in bursts of black pepper and leather.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Deep violet in the glass, this wine offers aromas of black cherry, strawberry and black pepper. It is bright on the palate, with soft tannins and flavors of tart cherry, cranberry, juniper berry and black pepper that round off in a zippy finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: A bouquet of raspberry, strawberry and Mediterranean herbs preps the palate for flavors of blackberry, cassis, vanilla, lavender and black pepper. It is well integrated, with velvety tannins and spicy finish.

name: Château Valandraud 2002 Kosher Mevushal  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has aromas of roasted coffee bean, coconut and black-skinned berry. The concentrated palate offers black-currant jam, mocha and bay leaf alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Merlot gives this wine its richness and density. Partial oak aging adds to the ripe, smooth texture. Tannins, layers of spice and bold red fruits add concentration as well as juicy acidity. Drink from 2019.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Inky red-violet in the glass, this wine has aromas of black cherry and chocolate. It is pleasing on the palate, with fruit-dominated flavors of cherry, raspberry, pomegranate, vanilla and espresso. Smooth soft tannins linger a moment past a finish marked by a splash of cranberry with a touch of freshly ground coffee.

name: Corley 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Fruit and barrel aromas intermingle, with notes of vanilla, coconut, wood spice, clove and red berries. The red fruit flavors are fresh and focused, with lightly grainy tannins providing the frame.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: This polished, vibrant red opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, mocha, French oak, exotic spice and a whiff of coconut. The elegantly structured palate offers black raspberry, pomegranate, oak-driven spice and espresso alongside bright acidity and tightly knit, close-grained tannins that leave a firm finish. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2019–2033.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: Herb, baking spice and exotic spice aromas are followed by tart luscious cranberry and cherry flavors. It comes off as a bit oaky but it still brings a lot of appeal.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This is a thick, rich and chocolate-laden wine, soft and generously ladened with tannin. Cigar, cedar and dried sage remind one of its varietal intent, while its medium-bodied size allows for plushness on the palate.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this opens with subdued aromas of ripe plum and vanilla. The aromas carry through to the robust palate, together with tobacco and clove. Round tannins provide soft support. Drink through 2019.

name: Byron Blatty 2016 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)
description: This is a micro-sized nine-acre estate, with vines that are 50 years old. Complex and rich, it is a generous burst of ripe full Merlot that is developing well. Black fruits, spice and juicy acidity all contribute to a wine that will ready to drink from 2017.

name: Arietta 2016 Hudson Vineyards Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine confirms the producer's prowess with the variety, coaxing a soft, integrated expression that's full bodied in a generosity of plum, black pepper and cinnamon. Structured, it shows aging potential and an earned place at the table.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This is an expressive wine, with notes of toast, vanilla, baking spices and dark fruit. The palate is full bodied but well balanced, showing a pleasing interplay of fruit and barrel flavors that continues through the finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Raspberry, oak, wood spice, vanilla and herb aromas are followed by plump, jammy red-fruit flavors that provide appeal.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Strong cedar notes greet the nose alongside charred red bell pepper, crushed gravel and elderberry fruit. Pencil shavings are prominent on the very full and complex palate, giving nuance to black plums, roasted beef, charcoal and dark chocolate.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Dusty tannins make for a soft texture in this wine that's subtle in dried fruit, Christmas spice, chocolate and clove. It delivers flavor and complexity without attitude, a savory expression of the grape from a relatively cool climate.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Fleshy and unctuous in flavor yet tautly structured, this neatly balanced Merlot offers loads of bright cherry and raspberry flavors layered into wisps of toast, spice and cedar. Its brisk puckery style makes it an ideal dinner wine. Fine-grained but persistent tannins on the finish suggest ageability well into the 2020s.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Syrah, this medium-bodied, soft and juicy red offers notions of berry pie and dusty leather, as backbeats of chocolate and blackberry play on the palate. With an intensely lengthy finish marked by clove this wine is memorably inviting.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: An attractive oaky theme runs through this medium-bodied and appropriately tannic wine. It smells like toasted bread, cinnamon and vanilla, and tastes both fruity and full of oak spices.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: Cocoa, toast and char aromas are out in front of red-fruit notes. The flavors are generous and full, with fruit and barrel flavors intertwining on the finish. The tannins bring some grip.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Barrel aromas of vanilla and coconut are followed by fruit-forward cranberry and raspberry flavors and a vanilla-filled finish. The oak plays prominently.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: A strong element of minty eucalyptus shows in this wine that is full bodied on the palate and integrated in oak, with an accent of clove. Fruity berry pie and mocha round out a softened, approachable texture that'll pair well at the table.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Coffee, smoke, herb, blue-fruit and barrel-spice aromas are at the fore. The palate provides soft, easy-drinking fruit and barrel flavors that linger.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Light aromas of baking spice, vanilla and red fruit lead to well-balanced red-fruit and barrel flavors that taper toward the finish, with coffee flavors lingering.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Brisk and bright, this bottling showcases a more cutting expression of Merlot. Crisp black cherry and plum flavors are accented by bramble and a touch of sage. The finish lingers long, fringed by fine, firm tannins.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Hints of sweet pastry introduce this bright, summery Merlot sparkling. Fun and fizzy, it fills the palate with rich, creamy mousse and sweet-tart strawberry-yogurt flavor.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Whiffs of barnyard and bramble lend rusticity to this wine, contrasted by fresher, prettier notes of rose petal and blackberry jam. It's a charming Merlot marked by crisp black-fruit flavor, sprightly acidity and dusty, lingering tannins.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Hints of milk chocolate and spice accent this sumptuously rich, silky wine. Ripe black cherry and berry flavors are approachably juicy and fruity, fringed by soft, feathery tannins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Exuberant aromas of cocoa and raspberry with light herb accents are followed by fresh, forward fruit flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins that bring some astringency.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Layers of coffee, vanilla and spice lend an oaky undertone to this plump, easygoing red. The palate is approachably fruity, offering a generous dose of fleshy plum and cherry flavors. Feathery fine tannins and a kiss of vanilla mark the finish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Red currant and dried-herb aromas lead into sweet cranberry and cherry flavors. It goes down easy.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas show notes of chocolate and raspberries, sprinkled with violets and fresh herbs, not seeming to have fully blossomed. The palate is elegant and refined, displaying a lovely sense of restraint. Smoked-meat flavors linger on the finish. It doesn't always come off as entirely varietal but brings a lot of enjoyment.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Brimming with ripe black plum and cherry flavors, this densely concentrated wine is unabashedly fruity and forward. It's well balanced though, showcasing crisp acidity and nuanced hints of rose petal and granite. Fine-grained but penetrating tannins persist on the finish.

name: Falkner 2016 Amante Special Selection Super Tuscan Style Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Decadent chocolate and coconut macaroon accent sweet tannin and generous oak in this softly textured wine, made in small amounts. The finish is powerful and ripe.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas offer light notes of vanilla, plum and clove. The palate is full and generously flavored, with the tannins bringing some grit.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Rich black cherry, cola, turned earth and smoked meats show strongly in the inviting nose of this bottling from the San Luis Obispo County appellation's namesake winery. A fine-grained tannic structure kicks off the palate, where smoked blueberry and elderberry meet with leather flavors, all carrying a decent weight for such an affordable wine.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Savory bramble and crushed-mineral tones lend complexity to ripe flavors of blueberry and plum on the palate of this wine. Medium bodied in style, it's balanced by a streak of cranberry acidity on the midpalate and rigid, fine-grained tannins.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Whiffs of lavender and violet lend a perfumed, floral edge to this stylishly composed wine. Full bodied and supple on the palate, it's moderately concentrated with crisp blackberry and cherry flavors. Penetrating but fine-grained tannins bristle on the finish.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: All varietal, this wine is a blend of fruit from top sites Ciel du Cheval, Conner Lee, Obelisco and Stonetree. The aromas are quite reserved, with notes of barrel spice that are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors with a spicy finish. It drinks well but the variety seems lost.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: A bit firmer and more powerful than the producer's regular bottling, the Vintner's Select boasts a core of black cherry and cassis accented by shades of bramble and forest floor. Rich, rounded and full bodied, it's balanced by a streak of cranberry acidity and lingering notes of anise.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Fresh, fruity flavors of sun-ripened blackberries contrast with savory notes of smoked nut and granite in this elegant wine. Nervy acidity and a clean, mineral edge makes it refreshing and quaffable through the summer, but it's also substantial enough to enjoy with food well into autumn.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Chocolate and blackberry form an impressively generous and full-bodied personality in this 100% varietal wine aged 22 months in a hearty percentage of new oak. Big tannin and traces of cigar and espresso continue on the brawny theme.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine combines deep, ripe fruit flavors, light spicy accents and a very firm mouthfeel that begs for a bite of a grilled rosemary lamb chop. The wine pushes the stereotype of wimpy Merlot out of the way and does it with fruit concentration rather than obvious oak. Drink through 2020.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Merlot is on the comeback trail and this is a very fun style made by respected vineyard manager Erik Mallea. Woody red and black cherry meet with cola on the nose, while the palate remains bright, fruity, refreshing and easy to quaff. Flavors of black cherry soda meet with a milk chocolate character, yet without any overdone richness.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Very heady and earthy aromas of cedar, tobacco leaf, smoked cigar and the hint of ancho chile show on the nose this unique, cool-climate take on Merlot. The palate is quite woodsy with cedar and pine but also jammy with red fruit, bolstered by bitter dark chocolate and dried chile pepper.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Voluptuously full-bodied and smoky, this 100% varietal wine imparts characteristics of cedar, herb and cigar on its grippy and generous palate. This is a reserve-level wine that delivers on that promise, it finishes awash in fists of black pepper.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine has classy, complex aromas that combine sophisticated oak and spice notes with very generous, deep fruit flavors. The way it all comes together seamlessly on a posh but firm texture shows the winemaker's skill as well as some great grapes to start with.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: There's a dullness to this wine, which flirts with the idea of plum and cherry flavor yet gets somewhat bogged down in marshmallow. Light bodied, it presents with more ripe sweetness than it may actually have.

name: Sterling 2017 Vintner's Collection Merlot (California)
description: This wine comes off as quite green especially considering the variety, vintage and appellation. Aromas of bell pepper and green herbs lead to cherry and savory flavors, with the tannins bringing some heft.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Intensely ripe cherry and berry flavors mark this plush, softly structured rosé. It's easygoing, fruity style is approachable.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Plump blueberry and blackberry fruit meet with crushed slate and root-beer notes on the nose of this widely available bottling. It's a bit thin in body and a tad sweet-leaning, but shows caramelized black fruit and rocky earth on the palate.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: While initially quite smoky and nutty on the nose, this light-bodied wine does release prettier notes of cherry and raspberry with some aeration. Soft acidity lends heaviness to the plate. The finish is brisk and clean.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Off dry and a bit sugary in style, this easygoing rosé offers intensely ripe, slightly ruddy strawberry and cherry flavors. The finish is brisk and clean.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Ripe blackberry and plum flavors resonate at the core of this big, full-bodied wine. It's a bit jagged in nature though, juggling contrasts of ripe fruit with sharp acidity. Soft, chalky tannins frame the finish.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: The volatiles are high while the flavors offer notes of cranberry and cherry that provide enjoyment.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of cranberries, raspberries and herbs lead to broad rich flavors. The tannins bring a little astringency but it offers enjoyment.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Tire rubber, currant and spice aromas are followed by pleasing, plentiful dark-fruit flavors. The tannins bring some grit.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Baking spice and dried cherry and cranberry aromas lead to lighter-styled fruit flavors with a gentle grip of tannins. It trails on the finish.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Vineyard designated Merlot is a rarity in the state, though this is one of the three the winery made in this vintage. Amped volatile aromas and generous barrel spices are followed by light, slightly dried-out cranberry and cherry flavors.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Candied cherry and berry aromas abound on the nose of this dry rosé, but the palate is surprisingly elegant. Pristine red cherry and raspberry flavors are fresh and bright, accented by savory, slightly bitter hints that lend nuance to the finish.

name: Château Eyquem 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Despite the warmth of the vintage and the growing region, this wine comes off as green aromatically. The flavors show ripeness but there seems to be a disconnect.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Pleasing aromas of cocoa, dried herb and red fruit lead to a full-bodied palate with a tight core of grippy tannins. Vanilla and spice notes run throughout.

name: Casca Wines 2016 Cabo da Roca Baga Reserva Merlot (Lisboa)
description: While demure on the nose, this revitalizing, citrusy rosé offers a firm punch of raspberry and pink-grapefruit flavors. Dry and guzzably thirst-quenching, it's an ideal summer apéritif.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Spicy, minty aromas and rich flavors like dark chocolate and black cherries add up to a bold, full-bodied wine from the Lange Twins. It has a deep color, moderate tannins to add grip to the texture and a lingering finish.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is a lushly concentrated, likable wine, soft in tannin and subtle in oak, with strong layers of black plum, berry and espresso.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Subdued herb, red fruit and spice aromas are followed by quite reserved cherry and berry flavors. It displays a lot of restraint.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: An aroma like black pepper and turned earth leads to flavors that are more savory and smoky than fruity. This is a sturdy, fairly tannic and full-bodied wine that wants to pair with rich proteins.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Subtle whiffs of raspberry and watermelon entice on the nose of this dry Merlot rosé. Elegantly concentrated and pleasantly puckering, it's a thirst-quenching quaffer to enjoy well into the fall season.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Cocoa, plum and spice aromas are followed by lush blue-fruit flavors. Vanilla notes are speckled throughout.

name: Calla Lily 2013 Audax Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This squat bottle comes, indeed, straight from the barrel with no filtering, and works quite well. Bright and plump purple fruits mix with vanilla and a tickling acidity on the nose. The palate shows juicy cherry fruit as well as blackberry and blueberry, with richness from vanilla and caramel. The tannins are a bit tough, but rugged in the right ways.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: There is an elegant integration of aromas on the nose of this bottling, with black cherry, smoked beef and a touch of tobacco. The mouthfeel is very soft and full, presenting flavors of blueberry, crushed asphalt and tart black plum skin. A solid sipper now, it's likely to improve with some aging.

name: Pine & Post 2004 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Char, toast, herb and red-fruit aromas are followed by plump red and blue-fruit flavors, speckled with coffee accents. It shows a pleasing sense of balance.

name: Château Bourseau 2016  Lalande de Pomerol
description: This opens with a touch of reduced oak, never letting go of its sizable full-bodied cradling of wood and tannin. In the glass it begins to unfold and reveal juicy, rich red currant, cassis and berry seasoned in clove.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: With an addition of 3% Petit Verdot, this wine sources from Andy Beckstoffer's Missouri Hopper Vineyard in Oakville and Benessere in St. Helena. It impresses in brown sugar and berry pie, the underlying foundation succulently fruity as savory touches of clove and pencil shavings begin to show amidst the firm tannin.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Wild red berries, crushed pepper, lilacs and a frame of asphalt show on the exuberant nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with meat, smoke, cedar, charcoal and easy boysenberry flavors, the perfect pairing for a hamburger. It is a tad light in body, especially since it hasaged for so many years.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: More Bordeaux-style blend than varietal wine, this is a combination of Merlot (75%) from Conner Lee, Dionysus, and the Benches along with Red Mountain Cabernet and Wahluke Cab Franc. Aromas of ripe red currant, blackberry and violets are followed by full-bodied fruit flavors that pack a wallop. It shows the warmth of the vintage but still brings finesse.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Despite the trend for dry rosé, there's something to be said for a bright, berried sip accentuated by balanced sweetness. This wine hits just that spot of pristine, delicately sweet cherry flavor juxtaposed with zesty acidity and a spry, mineral feel.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Lavish aromas of deep purple violets and blackberry jam are spiced with touches of licorice on this rich, nuanced and tasty bottling. Blueberries and elderberries shine through on the palate, with lavender, black tea and cedar flavors.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Ripe, rich blackberry and plum notes abound from nose to finish in this bold, deeply concentrated wine. The palate is velvety in texture, edged by a fine, chalky frame of tannins and lively cranberry acidity. Hints of pepper, dried herb and lavender lend nuance to a long finish.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: Good fruit concentration and a velvety texture make this deeply colored, dry wine substantial enough for a special occasion. It smells like spicy oak and tastes like ripe black cherries and blackberries, with a smooth mouthfeel.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The aromas are light, with notes of barrel spice, mocha, herb and red fruit. The palate is very pretty, almost delicate, with the tannins showing some grip.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Ripe yet deftly balanced, this full-bodied wine offers an abundance of blackberry fruitiness balanced by tones of granite and dried herb. It's sumptuous and expansive on the palate, finishing long with fine, sharply edged tannins.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: There's tremendous value in this well-made wine. It's savory in its mix of dried herb and plum notes, with smooth, softened tannins and judicious use of oak that lends richness to the palate. It'll appeal broadly.

name: Duckhorn 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 8% Cabernet Sauvignon, this mountain-grown wine offers bold black plum and berry around a compacted, extracted fullness of tannin and French oak. Dried herb, clove and vanilla accent the fruit, while the finish lingers gingerly.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The aromas of cocoa, raspberry, black tea, vanilla and cranberry are in full bloom. The cranberry and cherry flavors are ripe and full, backed by firm tannins. This wine is in a sweet spot. Drink now.

name: Silverado 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from 100% of the variety, organically farmed. It offers a soft approachability that will appeal in its plum and black cherry, the acidity lifted and well integrated with the oak.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Aromas of spice, red fruit and milk chocolate are followed by an opulent palate of fruit and barrel flavors. It appeals on every level.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Wisps of cocoa powder and cinnamon lend a warm, spicy tone to this rich, berry-toned wine. Ripe black plum and blackberry flavors are lipsmackingly fruity but calibrated neatly by crisp acidity and fine, chalky tannins. The finish is long and lingering.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This 100% Merlot could be mistaken at first for Cabernet, so structured and bold it initially appears. Cassis, blackberry, spicy clove and pepper combine effortlessly against a layered concentration of body and weight, finding structure along the way. Drink now through 2021.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This is an impressive undertaking, made from estate vineyards across the region, all certified sustainable. Medium in build and intensity, it allows acidity to balance out the strong, interwoven tannin and power to remain buoyant in high-toned cherry and currant. It finishes with a flourish of cinnamon spice.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This wine impresses in its succulence of black cherry and plum, the oak and tannin tamed and integrated to allow for a sensuality of texture along with such a boldness of flavor. Despite the concentration and ripeness, the wine is relatively light and easy to enjoy at the table.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: One of the producer's signature wines, in a region becoming well-known for the variety, this elegant, herbal-tinged wine does not part with the Napa Valley's imprint of boldness in its length and breadth of rich red fruit, clove, vanilla and toasted oak.

name: Arietta 2016 Quartet Red (Napa Valley)
description: The winery's first varietal Merlot is a blend of fruit from the Canoe Ridge, Stone Tree and Cold Creek vineyards. The aromas are locked up at present with notes of dark fruit, crushed flowers and spice that lead to ripe, plush fruit flavors backed by a firm spine of tannins that need time to unwind. It's the most unabashedly forward wine this winery has made to date. Give it plenty of time to open up; it delivers.

name: Byron Blatty 2016 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)
description: From a vineyard 1,500 feet above the valley floor in Soda Canyon, blended with 4% Cabernet Sauvignon from Morisoli Vineyard, this is a beautiful beast of a wine, concentrated in red cherry and plum as well as mocha. Nicely weighted with soft tannin and length, it's well made and should age. Drink now through 2020.

name: Experience 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The nose of this wine is all about oak, with toast and char leading the way. The palate follows suit yet shows a bit more fruit, with grilled red-berry flavors washing over a lithe, crisp palate.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe and soft, this is a smooth wine. With its attractive black fruits and the lightest touch of tannin, it is fruity with a hint of toast. Drink this wine now.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: Underripe red plum and currant aromas are flecked with prickly fern notes on the nose. The light-bodied palate is marked by tart red berries and bitter green stems.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: A blend of fruit from DuBrul and Meek vineyards, this wine brings light aromas of herb, vanilla, raspberry, orange peel and black licorice. The palate offers a mouthful of tart fruit flavors that are simultaneously sleek and generous.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Medium ruby along the rim, with purple in the core, this Merlot starts off with ripe red cherry and plum on the nose, with fern and warm spice adding nuance. The palate is soft and plush, with grippy black-tea tannins supporting juicy red-fruit flavors.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Offering aromas of blackberry, strawberry and green bell pepper, this wine has flavors of raspberry, strawberry, black cherry and leather. The fruit flavors are jammy on the palate and strong tannins and equally strong acidity make for a pleasing wine.

name: Nelson Neves 2015 Superior Merlot (Bairrada)
description: This rich, wood-aged wine is impressive and well aged. It may be made from Merlot but it tastes thoroughly Portuguese with its dry tannins, mint flavors and intense ripe fruit. The tannins are cushioned by this juicy, rich fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Jackalope 2017 Merlot (Applegate Valley)
description: This rusty-colored Merlot opens with roasted, herbal, burnt aromas of plum and currant. Light, fresh and saucy on the palate, this tastes of tomato sauce, pepper and barely ripe plum. Herbal, savory and green on the finish.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This is an easy-drinking, crowd-pleaser of a wine. Light to medium bodied, it has fresh strawberry and cherry flavors and a soft, smooth texture.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Smooth and soft, this easygoing wine has mild fruit and oak-spice flavors, low acidity and a touch of sweetness to round off any edges.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Gritty and earthy up front, with generic plum scents, this feels hard, tannic and in need of more body. Roasted, oaky flavors of hickory and saucy plum finish dry, woody and hollow.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Raw, earthy plum aromas are spicy and lightly herbal. This feels saucy yet monotone. Tomato, red-plum and herbal flavors end with a hint of brown sugar and a continuation of the wine's herbal plum character.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This easy-to-drink wine combines a lightly oaky aroma with good but light fruit flavors and savory accents. It's dry and well balanced, with a smooth mouthfeel.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of tire rubber, plum and red currant are followed by sweet plump fruit flavors. Chalky tannins provide the frame.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Light but relatively interesting aromas of black cherry, oregano, dill, pipe tobacco and cedar show shyly on the nose of this bottling. The shaved cedar is strong on the palate that is light in mouthfeel, and shows the same notes as the nose.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh and fruity aromas and flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It has an earthy smell at first, but that blows off quickly. The mouthfeel is smooth, almost sweet. .

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: The aromas are shy on this bottling, but with patience show gravel and blackberry juice. The mouthfeel is also a bit light, offering dark red and purple fruit alongside asphalt and espresso bean.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: There's menthol on the nose of this light-bodied, unfussy red, memorable for its big, drying tannin and oak. Savory fruit is accompanied by a taste of soy.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This wine has a good, deep color, lots of fruity aromas and flavors, and a smooth mouthfeel. It tastes grapy and jammy but dry, with light spicy accents to add interest.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Dry peppery currant and red-plum aromas are light and nothing you haven't come across before. Plum flavors are a touch baked, with a chocolaty backdrop. A solid finish with savory, spicy plum notes is satisfying.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Tire rubber, smoke, cranberry and red-currant aromas lead to quite-sweet plum flavors. The palate provides appeal but the aromas are difficult to get around.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: The aromas offer notes of pickling spices, cranberry and raspberry, with green herbs lurking in the background. The palate is fruit filled and quite flavorful for the vintage, showing finesse and polish.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This wine and the entire brand often punch above their weight, in this case showing black cherry, cedar, dried dill, crushed graphite and peppercorns on the nose. The palate offers oregano and dill at first, but proves silky with dried cherry and cranberry fruit.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Dry, spicy berry aromas are pedestrian but fine. This is tight, fresh and a touch scraping on the palate, with plum, currant and roasted flavors. Spicy, minty and solid on the finish, this is a perfectly good Merlot with limitations.

name: Sunstone 2017 Villa Sole Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This wine is all varietal. It brings aromas of toast, barrel spice, licorice and jammy red fruit that are followed by full-bodied red-fruit flavors. The tannins provide a firm grip.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This is a generously full-bodied wine, explosive in dark, brooding black fruit, coffee and bittersweet chocolate that offers firm, integrated tannin and lively acidity in equal measure. It shows varietal character, with an additional 1% Malbec swimming within.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: This wine is a blend of equal parts Seven Hills and Ferguson fruit. Aromas of raspberry, plum, tobacco and dark fruit lead to flavorful, polished tart fruit flavors. It's undeniable in its appeal.

name: Silverado 2015 Mt George Vineyard Estate Grown Merlot (Coombsville)
description: Coffee, spice, vanilla and pencil lead aromas are followed by rich, luscious, full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors. It's hedonistic and pulls no punches but shows balance: an equal mix of fruit and barrel.

name: Château Moulin de la Bridane 2016 Cuvée Héritage  (Saint-Julien)
description: From a vineyard situated in a forested area of northern Tejo comes this is a structured version of Merlot. It is ripe and rich with black fruits, as well as dark tannins and firm concentration. It could benefit from further aging, so drink from 2018.

name: Otazu 2018 Merlot Rosado (Navarra)
description: Vague black-pepper aromas and almost neutral flavors combine for a simple, muted wine. It is medium bodied and innocuous.

name: San Pedro 2017 GatoNegro Cabernet-Merlot (Central Valley)
description: This is a ripe wine with some of the rich red fruit of Merlot. It does, however, have too much ripeness and bitter chocolate flavors. The wine is ready to drink.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Grapes come from Alexander, Dry Creek and Russian River valleys to make this wine, first released in 1997. Oaky and mild-mannered on the palate, it shows touches of clove, black pepper and dried herb, while robust tannins play a supporting role.

name: Château les Aubastons 2016  Côtes de Bourg
description: Blended with 15% Petit Verdot, this wine is big and brooding in tannin and charred oak, with a sizable presence on the palate. It dabbles in ripe, full-bodied black cherry, plum and tar.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This firmly structured wine has a good, gripping texture and lots of black cherry and black-plum flavors. Backed by bracing acidity and a modest layer of tannin, it's a versatile wine for lunch or dinner.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Aromas of this medium-bodied wine are smoky and herbal. The flavors combine black pepper, spicy oak notes and and almost-sweet fruits like plum and watermelon.

name: Snake and Herring 2017 Cannonball Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Petit Verdot Red (Margaret River)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells sugary and floral, but tastes quite dry. Flavors are fruity but spare and the mouthfeel is taut.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Fine fruits, red-berry flavors and crisp acidity give this wine a fine balance and immediate attraction. It is lively with its bright texture and finishing acidity. Drink from 2017.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Lots of sweet-smelling new-oak flavor permeates this dry, medium-bodied and moderately tannic wine. Aromas suggest toasted French bread and the flavors blend chocolate and cherries.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Aromas like cedar and marascino cherries are followed by good red and black cherry flavors. A firm and tannic texture gives this medium-bodied wine a rustic touch.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Lean and tannic, this wine has a firm structure that makes it mouthwatering. It will pair well with creamy pasta, Korean barbecue and other rich dishes.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a vivid smoky aroma that gives way to fresh strawberry and raspberry notes on the palate. It feels juicy, slightly tart and light.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A finely perfumed wine from a mere 2.5-acre vineyard, this is ripe and with great balance between the tannins and the warm berry fruits. It has a generous, while structured, character that will develop well. Owners Viviane and André Vossen's consultant is Michel Rolland whose family owned this castle for 200 years. Drink starting from 2019.

name: Château la Bastidette 2016  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: Straightforward plum, cherry and tomato aromas lead to a juicy palate that's lacking in structure. Simple slightly sweet plum and black-currant flavors finish with a note of peppery spice. At only 11.5% ABV, this is Merlot is an easy sipper.

name: Tortoise Creek 2017 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This ruby-garnet wine has a touch of oxidation on the nose with flavors of blackberry, black plum and black cherry in the mouth. It's not perfectly harmonious in the midpalate but there's a fair bit of acidity in the finish that makes it refreshing.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: A bit thin on the nose, this shows dried oregano, baked red plum and touches of vanilla and caramel on the herbally forward nose. Black tea, cranberry, pomegranate, oregano and marjoram come through on the palate.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: Juicy red cherry meets with wet stone, smoldering oak and dried oregano, marjoram and basil on the nose of this retro-styled bottling. A touch of ancho and pasilla chile to the palate gives peppery, herbal depth to the red-fruit base.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: The aromas of blueberry, sugared plum and herb are bright and fresh. The flavors are sweet and full and go down easily.

name: Pegasus Estate 2016 Quadrille Vogelzang Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: With a tiny bit of breathing room, this wine opens up magically into dark earth, crushed asphalt, blackberry jam, cappuccino and mocha on the nose, which predict a tarry texture. Indeed, the structure is firm and fine-tuned, yet vibrant with boisterous acidity, showing layered flavors of dark fruit enhance by cedar, sandalwood and incense notes. Drink 2017–2033.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Coffee, raspberry, green herb, dill and vanilla aromas are followed by light but plump fruit flavors. It goes down easy.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This Brazilian Merlot smells rubbery and gaseous, with saucy berry notes. In the mouth, this is severely tannic and drying. Toasty, blackened and bitter in flavor, this ends with peppery notes and hard-pounding tannins.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Plusher and rounder than the Special Reserve bottling, Millbrook's standard label Merlot suggests soft red-cherry flavor accented with cocoa powder, savory mushroom and beetroot. Gentle acidity and fine-grained tannins accentuate its plump juicy feel. Drink now through 2019.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Dried plum, dried strawberry and dried raspberry meet with cola spice on the fresh if thin nose of this bottling. The palate offers sour plums, peppercorns, damp compost and smoke flavors.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling is a tad fruit-punchy at first, with light red cherry and candied pomegranate aromas, but then picks up complexity with a leather note. The palate also offers that leather alongside tobacco and light elderberry fruit.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Scents of perfumed lilac talc, vanilla and smoked meats frame the red and black fruit core of this wine. The medium-length finish has lingering flavors of ripe black cherries.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This Moldovan Merlot has aromas of eucalyptus, dark chocolate and raspberry with flavors of cherry, black plum and a touch of baking spices. There's a nice minty lift in the midpalate, with a bright fruit finish and persistent tannins.

name: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Merlot (California)
description: This garnet-colored Merlot has aromas of black plum, cherry and saddle leather which pave the way for soft flavors of raspberry, red plum and a smooth tannic finish.

name: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Paicines)
description: From a warmer region about 27 miles inland from Monterey Bay, this bottling shows crushed black rocks, black cherry, light vanilla and the slightest bit of char on the nose. It's relatively demure on the palate, with touches of milk chocolate, red cherry, gravel and graphite.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Milk chocolate, toast and raspberry aromas are followed by quite sweet fruit flavors. It's unabashed in its easy-drinking appeal.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Pronounced aromas of char, smoke and bramble lift with time and aeration, revealing prettier notes of fresh herb and red cherry. Plump cherry and berry flavors are supple and concentrated, but have a distinctly green, herbal tone on the midpalate. The finish is marked by a bite of fine-grained but delicately bitter tannins.

name: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Prominent aromas of toast and char lead to a supple, elegant palate with red fruit speckled with barrel spices. It's a very pretty wine, though the barrel influence gets out front.

name: Earth's Harvest 2013 Merlot (California)
description: This is a perfumed wine. Although the tannins are still firm from 14 months in new oak, it does have fine, fragrant red-fruit and acidity. The texture is dense, still young, and will be fine from 2019.

name: Château Lafleur du Roy 2016 Cuvée Excellence  (Pomerol)
description: Intense in mulled spices and juicy blue and black berry, this is a smooth, approachable and likable wine. Medium bodied, it will play well at the table, providing a chocolaty note at its end.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Bold oak aromas like wood smoke and toasted baguette meet almost-sweet flavors like cherries, plums and a bit of maple syrup in this medium-bodied wine.

name: Imagery 2016 Pallas Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Smooth and accented by dried herb, this wine is tart in currant and lush in chocolate, offering a wide spectrum of aroma and flavor. Medium bodied, it picks up power and concentration on the finish, allowing for a ripeness to strike last.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: The producer sources fruit among several appellations for this varietal wine, coaxing a wealth of full-bodied flavor and succulence into its mix of cedar, sage, black cherry and oak. The firm tannin profile provides a structured foundation.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Tasty and true to type, this wine smells like ripe plums and cherries accented by dried thyme, and tastes slightly meaty on top of all that fruitiness. It's a smooth-textured wine in which moderate tannins add a good bite to the mouthfeel.

name: J. Lohr 2017 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This 100% Merlot produced by the Glemet family has spice and layers of wood-aging flavors that are still dominating the fruit. That fruit is there, waiting, with hints of red berry and black-currant flavors. Drink from 2019.

name: Cousiño-Macul 2014 Finis Terrae Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Jean Lissague, one of Bordeaux wine's “new generation,” produced the 100% Merlot with spice and firm tannins. It also has weight and richness from the generous fruitiness. Drink this structured wine starting from 2019.

name: Trentadue La Storia 2016 Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a flavorful, smooth-textured wine drenched with grapy, jammy flavors. Ripe and concentrated, it has a lively mouthfeel due to welcome tannins and acidity. It offers a lot to like.
